reviews.review: Good view from Buda to Pest. The Fisherman's Bastion has a pretty good view, and the steps leading up to it are lovely. You get a great spectator's spot to see Pest across the Danube River, and the architecture is pretty. Definitely try to go on a sunny day, though; even slightly rainy, the scenery can look a bit drab.
Amazing views. Part of the bastion was being renovated at the time of the visit, however this didn't take away from the beautiful views, definitely worth a visit :)
Beautiful . Beautiful building, gorgeous views of the city, especially at night. Go in for an (expensive) drink & for the best views of Pest.

Real-life Disney castle. Situated near to the Funicular, Fisherman's Bastion offers scenic views of the city. Built to commemorate the millennium celebrations, the Bastion appears to spring from a Disney film or a fairy tale. The Bastion itself is a very peaceful and idyllic setting. The only things that visitors need to beware of is the obvious tourist traps such as paying to climb up to the higher parts of the Bastion when the same views can be seen from below. Fisherman's Bastion is a fantastic viewpoint and photographic opportunity for visitors to Budapest.
Great view!!. This is a must for Budapest visitors! The view and pictures that you can take are memorable!This is a must ! You must climb to the fence and admire the whole view!
Best views over Pest. When visiting the Old Town in Buda, the Fisherman's Bastion offers splendid views over the Danube and Pest. There is a modest entrance charge, but it is worth it.

Impressive and breathtaking views of the Pest city of Budapest. While we were in Budapest we crossed over the Chain Bridge from Pest City to Buda city. We were stunned looking amazingly at the great architecture which seemed very similar to fairy tale buildings. Prepare your camera for the most beautiful shots you can take from the top of the Fisherman's Bastions. Breath taking views of the Pest city-House of Parliament, the Chain Bridge,etc... These bastions are a wonderful gem and not to be missed while in Buda city. A nice walk takes you to the unforgettable and well decorated Matthias Church, the Holy Trinity column and St. Stephen's large statue. Besides these if you continue walking you will admire all the surroundings with nice buildings, restaurants, cafe and souvenir shops. You can reach Buda by public transport and using the Buda Hill funicular (to avoid walking uphill) A MUST-SEE!!!
Must do in Budapest!. Beautiful cathedral, buildings, views. Go late afternoon when the setting sun shines on Parliament. Wander the grounds of the castle too!

Interesting place with its specific atmosphere. Interesting architecture, nice view of Budapest. Certainly nice (and very expensive) place to live. Unfortunately, the best vie is paid. Still you can find good view point without necessity to spend a Forint ;-)
Wonderful View. Our tour guide, Thanks to our tour guide Adam Botta, we could even identify the landmarks below, He even pointed out a church with my family name!
Lovely area. Beautiful. Other reviews suggested to not pay to go in, so I didn't. But lovely view, close to St. Steven statue, St. Matyas Templom, beautiful views.

What a view. Great day spent wondering around Budapest with a local friend of mine, this and the castle are definitely a must see and their hot wine is a great plus after walking around in the chilly October weather

Great Views. We walked up, but you can get the railway up. When you get to the top yo have a magnificent view of Pest. The only thing I would say was that some of the modern build up there resembled something out of Disney Land.
Very busy, but worth the effort to see Buda, and the other "attractions" up there
Wonderful architecture. Despite scaffolding at the moment, this architecture was interesting. Worth visiting fishermans bastion and viewing parliament from here!

Just as good views nearby without having to pay. We visited the Bastion on a joint entry ticket with the church opposite. Only a small part of the Bastion was visitable and there was nothing extra within it. There are equally good views of Budapest from other vantage points round about.

Unique Memorial. Every time I go to Budapest, I go to Fisherman's Bastion. Here's a little history. It was built in neo-romanesque style by Frigyes Schulek as a monument to the Guild of Fishermen in 1895. The views of the Parliament bldg across the Danube alone, is worth the trip up there. I enjoy just walking a round "people watching" & taking pictures of the beautiful bldgs.

Nice views, great piece of architectre. It's a unique part of architecture, worth seeing both during the day and in the evening. The views are also really nice, except the fact that the place is really crowdy all the time and it's hard to find a moment to take a photo. Higher level is paid during the day, which I think is not worth its price at all - better go to the lower level instead. The staircase below is a nice photo spot itself as well.
Must see. Fisherman's Bastion is a place that should be in the top-list of places-to-visit in Budapest. Very convenient to rich it by funicular
Great Views. It is really worth coming to this part of Buda. The views are stunning and it is a great area to walk around.

A building straight out of a fairy tale. Beautifull area with architectural elements that looks like it comes straight out of a fairy tale. Nice view over the city. When walking there, a classical music event was going on. The combination of the music, the atmosphere and the view made the experience magical.
Must do!. Fantastic views of Budapest and the Danube - a must do during your time in Budapest. Easy to reach by foot or public transport.
Beautiful place!!!! . Great view!!! Highly recommended. Budapest at ita best. Take a walk and take pictures of the incredible views.
Great view . Great view on Pest from this bastion. Place is free to visit. On top is coffee shop with mulled wine.

Gorgeous voews. Fishermans Bastion provides gorgeous views of the Budapest skyline. We visited at sunset and then later during the day. Both are times you should visit as your pictures will be gorgeous. They views of Budapest are incredible, especially of the parliament building.

Good views, but only partly open.. Great views, but only partly open because of renovations. We purchased a joint ticket for the church and bastion, and were informed of the restriction, but that it was still the same price. Worth it for the view, but they could have given a bit of discount!
Great views. After the castle go here really nice great architecture and you get great views of the city from here

Beautiful Views from Fisherman's Bastion. As part of our riverboat tour / excursion, our city tour took us up the Buda side of the city to walk around the area known as Fisherman's Bastion. Lots of Hungarian history on this side of the river that was interesting with our tour guide. You can see the Pest side from there over the Danube, great views of the Parliament building and the river front. A nice stop on our tour.

what will you do here?. It is definately a place to visit, once visiting this fantastic capital city! Beyond the fact that it is one of the landmarks of Budapest, it is fairly central, AND have a perfect view to the heart of the city (from above). The bastion is in the castle, so you are actualy visitng the castle, which is good news, as this is what you want to do. Plus taking photoes, seeing a little history, etc.. All at one location. Do not miss it out! ...whether it is night or day...

Amazing views. This place is very beautiful with scenic views of Budapest. Probably the best viewpoint in Budapest. Although it's not worth to pay for going on the walls of the bastion, as some parts are open anyway and others, which you have to pay for are no different.

Fisherman's Bastion. To visit Budapest and not visit Fishermans Bastion would be a shame. This area has much to offer. Beautiful views, shopping, and the best coffee house with authentic pastries. Love it all!
Great views. Excellent view, worth a visit. Very scenic and great view of the city and the river Danube. Nice place to take photos.
Special view on Pest's panorama. It's in the Buda castle, and absolutely unmissable. From there is one of the most beautiful view on Budapest's Pest side.

beautiful views. this is a fantastic place for pictures and for picturesque views - not to be missed
walking around this area is very pleasant
Very beautiful! The kids love it. The fisherman bastion area is very beautiful ! The kids love it and one can get there with the funicular train
Wear comfy shoes!. Beautiful elaborate walls and walkways, wind around and above the river below. Gorgeous in winter - but windy and cold, and lots of cobbled streets. Wear warm boots in December!

You can't beat the views of the Danube and Pest!. Keep in mind that you do NOT need to pay to get these views. I did not and managed to see everything that I wanted to see. IMHO...it's about the view and I do not feel I missed anything by not paying. But who knows? ;)
Beautiful structures and amazing views. The fisherman's bastion is really unique - combining beautiful architecture and amazing views. I am definitely we made it!

Go after dark!. This was a really cool place, especially after dark when most of the tourists have gone for the day - beautiful views over the city, great for night time photography if you're into that. The climb up there really isn't too steep...well worth it!
looks great on 0:00 am. Great place for romantic night walking, nice illumination, nice view on city especially on clear night. free for visitors

Beautiful site, interesting place to visit.. Fisherman bastion gives a panoramic view of the Danube and the Parliament on the opposite bank. It is beautifully lit-up at night. There is a small restaurant and a coffee shop on top.

Busy but beautiful. As previously stated very busy area but well worth a visit. There were renovations being carried out but the views are breath taking. In fact the whole area is so interesting with some wonderful buildings and we enjoyed a stroll around on a sunny September morning.

What a view!. The atmosphere walking around on this square makes you feel comfy, relaxed , happy. Either you walk away from the view over the river or towards the wall overlooking the great and beautiful river. Take it easy, be happy, enjoy!
SUNRISE. I was here around 6.30AM. I caught the sunrise and enjoyed beautiful view of the city on the tower. Not much tourist at that moment.

Magnificient. This monument is a well-known landmark of Buda castle. It is a great place not only for an ordinary sightseeing but some romantic meetup as well. There are lot of historical landmarks and restaurants nearby.

Must see. You should see this fairy-tale like castle. It was built in this style for no other reason than the architect liked is. Most of the view is obscured by restaurants, but if you're hungry you can have both.
This was a cool place. . This was a cool place to go and added a more "fortress" feel to visiting Buda Castle. We had fun here and you could see some great views of the city.

Photo time! . Fight through the crowd to get a spot for that amazing profile pic selfie!
Joke aside, there's a ticketing booth at the stairs, but for the two times I went there was no one....

Beautiful place, excellent view of the city, very crowded. This is a very popular tourist site, and for good reason. Amazing architecture, fascinating history and a breath taking view of Pest. I highly recommend taking the free tour (with Key to the City card, I purchased mine at the airport).

Overrated by many?. As Budapest rookies we took the advice of Tripadvisor reviewers and visited the impressively-titled Fisherman's Bastion - love the name: #2 attraction in Budapest, can't go wrong we thought. The FB is accesible by a cute-looking funincular railway. This had a large queue and so we decided to walk. The route was not signposted until the first direction indicators appeared at the top of the hill. The walking surfaces were steep and uneven. We went on an afternoon where sun gave way to rain that came in quickly over the Buda hills. Paths turned to mush. The FB is a viewpoint with an 800 HUF entry fee. You walk up a flight of stairs, round a corner, and find a construction site. Rain gutters finish over paths thus depositing water over passers by. The place is heaving with large groups of people scrambling for the best photopoints of Parliament, etc. The problem is that the best photos of Parliament are to be taken from the river, not from FB. Views from the castle are comparable and are free. We simply didn't get the attraction of this place and it seemed like a waste of time that could have been better spent in a city with many wonderful features.

Misnomer Alert: This has almost nothing to do with fishing. Because the Danube River was the pathway of invaders for many centuries, settlers on the River's banks built fortifications to defend themselves. After thousands of years, the resulting emplacements had become the prominent feature of the Buda portion of the city. They overlook the Pest side, with panoramic and historic views, food and shopping venues, and a fascinating history. No trip to Budapest would be complete without a visit.

Magnificent view on Pest side. Great place to fill the culture of the city and also to check the magnificent views of the Pest side. We used the fisherman's Bastion as one of the locations for photoshooting! In clear sunny day this will give some classy pics!
The best view of the Parliament building. Just one great tip, its free on the evenings (you'll save 5 Euros or so) and the view is even better at night (with lights of the Parliament)
Well worth the climb up the steps for the view. Well worth the climb up the steps for the view. Be prepared for the wind to be bitter up there though.

Romantic place . My fav landmark of Budapest where you can visit the Matthias church and the lovely castle. As the bastion is on top of the hill, you can enjoy the fascinating night view of the pest side, the Danube and the shining parliament. Sometimes there might be musician playing music at the castle.

Nice walk. We went around with kids, they didn't care about the beautiful wiev to the Danube & Pest, but really enjoyed climbing up on the acient rocks of the ruin church nearby and walk up and down on the stairs of the Bastion, also running around in the castle yard.
Nice view. A very nice view over Pest from this a bit Disney-like building. Very many tourists though and restaurants and bars where you would not expect them.

Wonderful view. This is one of the most visited parts of Budapest. Its architecture is very unique, and a view you can experience from Fisherman's Bastion is amazing.
If you'd like take some nice pictures, panoramas, this is the perfect place to do that.
You can avoid to pay visitor's fee if you access it from the other (the Northern) side.
Fantastic view. A fantastic view of Budapest. You can see from here the Danube and Pest side of the one of the most beautiful town Budapest.
Excellent. So many tourists from all over the world. Make sure not to miss this fortress while in Budapest. Church, bastion, library everything is more than beautifull.
White Lady of Danube :). Gentle and rustic, full of inspaering corners, for takeing a pictures or kissing ... Enjoy majic moments :)
Beautiful place to visit!. It's a beautiful place to visit where u are on top of the hill. However, it's ovecrowed so u it's better to visit it early in the morning or before sunset!

Go for the views and architecture!. This is a must-see building when in Budapest. The city has so many beautiful building and this is one of my favorites in the entire city. It's a place that is lively and full of people. Enjoy a panoramic view of the city and Danube River.

Great place for pics. This is a great location to get pics of Parliament and the Danube. The down side is hoardes of tourists in your way. Unfortunately the weather was terrible when we were there so I think we missed out on some of the sightseeing.
Great outlook. Architecturally interesting, good view of the city and the Danube. In close proximity to quaint shops and St Matthias church which you should tour while there..
Great view . A rather easy walk up a few stairs for great view of the river and city. The history and culture of this city requires several days to absorb.
wonderful views. get up the hill on the Buda side to see this outlook. The views are spectacular. There is a fee to see it.

Stunning Views!. Some of the most stunning views of the city are from here. Well worth it. Highly recommend walking back to Pest across the bridges. It's quite remarkable to see Pest from the Buda side of the river. Those images will be the ones that stay with me.
A must see site. Great for a coffee with a view. You will pay more for this coffee than elsewhere, but it will be worth it:)
Stunning. This is situated a short distance from the castle and it a beautiful place to visit....the views are fantastic from the tower ....you won't be disappointed

Beautiful sight!. In my opinion definitely the most beautiful place in Budapest! From this viewloint you will have a view on the Parliament, the beautiful Danube River and Chain Bridge ofcourse. View worth every step you have to climb to reach it! Try and you won't regret!

Outstanding views. This is next to St Stevens Church on castle hill on the Buda side of the Danube. There is a fee to go up the flight of stairs to see a panoramic view of Budapest. I don't think it is one of the "don't miss" attractions but if you are visiting the castle and St Stevens it will provide a great view of the city.
great view. this is an excellent place from where you can admire the city of Budapest in all her extension, strongly reccomended
Amazing view!. Very interesting construction of the bastion. You can also enjoy perfect view form the top. Some exercise for your feet.
Nice walk. Interesting walk on a pleasant day. Lots of beautiful architecture to marvel at but marred by a section concealed by scaffolding.

Did I miss something?. This attraction requires an extra entry fee, in addition to the Buda castle attractions. Basically, it is a walkway high above the Danube, between the cathedral and the cliff.Granted, some (half?) of the Bastion was under construction and blocked off during our visit, but I wasn't terribly impressed. Yes, you can take some great photos from the walkway with the Parliament and the Pest side in the background down below. But, it's difficult to get good pictures because of the mass of people, and the 'attraction' itself doesn't really offer anything to see in and of itself. The concrete conical lookout points are sort of neat to look at, but of course you can see those without paying to 'enter' the attraction.Overall, I'd say if you're at the castle, you might as well check this part of it out as well.

Fisherman's Bastion. Awesome views from the top, make sure you are wearing comfortable shoes if you plan on walking from Halasz Utca (the nearest tram stop). Only downside is there is a lot of work happening around the area so the scaffolding can ruin a good photo!

Very unusual and quirky arhcitecture with great views. This is on the Buda side, atop the hill which also has the castle, a great cathedral and more. This is a good side-step across a small square and has the most unusual little towers you can walk though semi-alfresco, all in white. I haven't seen anything quite like this elsewhere. The best part is the awesome view over all of central Budapest!!

Pretty - Simple. Pretty to visit, the cafe within the Bastion is worth having a hot chocolate at (it's basically just bars of chocolate melted..mmm) Cool view, but you do have to pay to actually walk over the Bastion. Alright for a quick look, wouldn't spend too much time on this activity.
Wonderful views across the river. We visited on a tour and would have liked more time to go to the lower levels. You have to pay to enter but there are wonderful views of the city. Very clean.
Amazing Views. Amazing Views of the city, pretty place, nice architecture and pretty Buda all around. Take in consideration that there are steps to climb.
Amazing view of the city. We went there & we were amazed with the wonderful view of the city of Budapest, it's a breath taking especially at night, we loved it.
Excellent to visit. If you want to see a splendid view of the city, this is one of the places you don't want to miss. You can easily get to this place by bus.

Need to see--but no need to pay. The Fisherman's Bastion is a beautiful set of stairs and battlements and turrets on Castle Hill in Buda, overlooking the Danube. Gleaming white, it looks like straight out of a fairy tale. In my opinion, it's the best place to take pictures of the whole city from above and of the Parliament building across the river. During the day, part of the bastion is blocked off and only accessible after paying a small fee. However, if you keep walking past the fee area, you can access another part of the bastion and the stairs for free. Also, if you return in the evening, the whole bastion is accessible to the public for free. We came twice, once in the morning, once at night. There were plenty of tourists both times but the views were even more spectacular at night. There were a few street musicians also. You can sit on any part of the bastion, enjoy the views and just take soak up the atmosphere.

Great view of the city. A gentle walk to fisherman's bastion will provide you the most amazing views of the city. Join Matt on the free Conquer Budapest walking tour and get a run down on the history of the site at the same time.

Beautiful views! . A lovely site to sit and look out over Budapest. We took many photos and sipped very rich hot chocolate to keep warm. We chose not to pay to actually climb a few steps to get up to the top level, which was only a few meters higher than the free level. The view is perfect on the free level enough to miss paying 800f. Even though not a lot seems silly to pay for it.

Great Views. Just off the square surrounding Matyas Church, this promenade provides spectacular views of the Danube, Parliament and all of the Pest side of town. Bring your camera and spend 1/2 hour strolling along the parapet.
The Best Views Over Budapest. This was a great place to visit providing the best views over the Danube and Budapest. There is a little cafe at the top and had the best vistas.....do it.

It's wonderful. It's so pretty here. There's so many nooks and crevices to explore. It makes you feel like you know what life was like back then during the time the castle lived. There are some great views and some great places to take pictures. The drive up is quite incredible too. I would definitely stop here to enjoy the castle and the views!

Amazing architecture. I booked a private tour to get to see Budapest highlights in couple of hours. This place was an amazing spot. It used to be a place for fishing and fishers would take the fish into the top roof. The architecture is very authentic.
Stil Giorgious. You have to view this when you visit Hungary. It is one of the brilliant sights of Budapest along the Danube.
I love this place, the view. The one of the nicest place of Budapest with nice view to the Danube... the architacture, the cathedrale.... you will love Budapest for this...
Really nice place. Fisherman's Bastion is the place in Buda with beautiful towers, where you can have great panoramic view over Pesta. Must see in Budapest.
Part of Grand Views. If you are in Budapest you will not miss this - a nice walking tour is wonderful in the day or night.

Incredible views of the city. Visited the Fishermans bastion on a sunny day at the end of September with a group of friends. Beautiful views over the city, and a lovely space to spend the afternoon. There is a fee (somewhere between £5-10) to walk along the bastion, but you can get just as lovely a view & photos without paying. Plenty of shops, restaurants and markets are dotted around the vicinity but if you move off the beaten tourist track, there are some lovely (cheaper) places to eat out.

great view. There is a fantastic view of the city from this location. We walked up a few years ago, and taken the bus up this year. Either way it is worth the trip. Be sure to take in the church while you are there, it is steeped in history.

Great restaurant with a view!!. Eventhough we came some 15 minutes earlier than open, the waiterd jnvited us to come in. we had a great table outside and the even had a daymenu for a good price. Because it was our lunch we took this. The wine wasxalso very good and nicely priced. to our surprise there were also musicians so we really enjoyed the music, view snd food very much. Also the waiters were very excellent in their work! a big 10!

Oh God what a view !!. We went there after reading a lot of recommendations that you must visit it when you're in Buda. There are a LOT of tourists which confirms the fact that the place is amazing. The view to the Pest side with the river is absolutely beautiful!!! Definitely took a lot of photos there. You gotta see it!!

The Fishing Bastion is something to see. The Fishing Bastion is something to see. Almost like the castle in Disneyland or Disney World. The square by it is beautiful. The view across the Danube River onto Budapest is spectacular. You can see the magnificent Parliament building and the Bridge of Chains. If you go up the right hand side tower, you will need to pay but if you walk to the left side tower, it's free. It can get crowded but worth taking the time. Took some good photos from here. There is a café where you can get something to drink and see the view.
best in the night. Romantic place especially in the night. Grete view over the Pest part of the city. Inside of the restaurant is also beautifule but the food was not good enough,,,
Budapest photo gallery. Here you can find all angles to take a panoramic picture of Budapest below..the Bastion is nice place to stroll along, take a pic and go eat desert at coffee house near by..
Great view!!. a must seen sight! great view from the top. Near the temple (charges the entrance) but worthy to see

Budapest. Famos and great arhitectural building with a nice view of this great city.
Part of Buda from this part everybody can see Pest from this part of city. Try in the evning as well.

Lovely lovely site!. The Fisherman's Bastion is atop the Castle Hill and can be accessed by the funicular (very reasonable and saves time). Great views across the Danube of Parliament. Definitely a site you don't want to miss. St. Mathias Cathedral is located here.
Word Heritage Site. Marvelous church. Exceptional building.ust see. Worth the small entrance fee. But who on earth allowed the Hilton hotel carbuncle to be built on the side!
Interesting. There is not a lot to say about this. The main attraction about it is that it gives great opportunities for views of the city.
Beautiful views . We went up to the bastion at night time. Gorgeous views of Budapest all lit up at night. Very romantic place

Worth the climb. Very pretty view from the top although a slightly touristy area - but what do you expect when you can see the whole city across the river? If you don't want to climb you can also get the bus of course.

Lovely views and a very pretty part of Budapest. Really nice some great views and quite quirky, albeit very busy and touristy.Had a coffee in the cafe overlooking the Danube, had no toilet and was told to go to the public toilet where you had to pay.Get nothing for nothing in Budapest!
Nice view. The view and the atmosphere were amazing! Only the places around to grab a drink were a bit pricey, but definitely worth to visit.
Fairytale & romantic. Beautiful architecture and amazing views over the River Danube and Pest. No one could be disappointed with a visit especially at night when it is lit up
My visit to fishermen bastion . It was a lovely experience at fishermen bastion the view was amazing you can see Budapest from the tower and all I can say it was breathtaking.

Great views. The architecture and views within and from the Bastion are amazing - with the high vantage point providing a great view across all of the Pest side of the city.The prices for the various options were very reasonable, but each section were individually priced and it wasn't always clear exactly what you got for your payment. There was however a large volume of free activities too.The Bastion is also a very short and easy walk to/from the palace.

View of Budapest Abound. Had a lovely walking tour of this site. Got a feel for how it was in the past as well as could view repairs from damage of WWII. Our guide provided lots of information about what it was like to live in the country during Communism which was eye opening.

Beautiful! . The bastion itself is a marvellous piece of architecture! It is located next to a beautiful square and really is a sight to behold. However, the views you can experience on it are even better. You get an amazing outlook onto the Danube river and the Pest side of the city. This provides an excellent view of famous landmarks such as the Parliament building and the bridge of chains. Parking up on the peak is expensive so try to walk to take transit here!

Amazing views but don't pay!!! . Best views of the city and Danube on a clear day! The buildings look like something out of a Disney fairytale - so pretty!! But beware, you can pay a few euros to go up the right hand side tower but if you walk to the left side it's free! There's a little cafe where you can drink and enjoy the view so better off spending your money there!! It's a crowded area but worth the wait to get a good photo.

Worth a visit, but not worth the ticket. Really lovely views and worth a visit but you don't have to buy a ticket - if you walk just next door and all around the area you'll see exactly the same view! Try and pick a sunny day to get the best views and would recommend walking up the hill rather than taking the train as along the way there are some really good views.
Beautiful and a great view across the river. We hiked up the stairs to the top of Buda and visited the Bastion after lunch by an outdoor cafe next to the cathedral. It is crowded, but well worth it

So pretty! Do not miss! . This building is beautiful! It felt like Hogwarts, we were asked to buy a ticket to go up onto a particular part of the building (800ft each) but we found if you walked down a bit further you can go to the top of the spire and see the magnificent parliament building from there. Glad we didn't waste our money.There was a fantastic pianist who was playing near an outdoor bar with fairy lights ,beer and food. Make sure you take cash as you have to pay for the toilets and you may want a cheeky Beer too!
Well worth a visit!. Got some beautiful pictures here, as well as seeing some amazing views of the city. Would definitely make the trip here again!

Disappointed. The views are great, but it was very "tourist" - especially compared with nearby Castle Hill.Skip fisherman's Bastion and the overpriced restaurants. Go to Castle Hill or Gellert Hill for the views.

great way to view Budapest!. The bastion is on the lovelier side (for me!) of Budapest (the Buda side). It provides a great panoramic view of the Pest side of the city. The only downside is that you have to pay to get up to see the view.
Mr . Some of the buildings are amazing that goes for this one outstanding easy to get to by foot plenty to look at on the way

Well worth a visit. Great views - Its an enclosed walled town old world - get the lift up to visit Buda castle and walk over to see this walled town ( They are next to each other on the hill over looking the river.

Overrated - do it for free. Don't get me wrong, the views from up here over Pest are stunning and the 7 towers of the Magyar tribes are very attractive. It's just not worth paying to go up the steps for the view. Although much of it is blocked off by restaurants or bits you have to pay to access there are a couple of places where you can enjoy the view for nothing - so do that instead.

Nice view. We walked from the Chain Bridge up to the Fisherman`s Bastion (via Buda castle) and it was a lovely walk. When we arrived, I was surprised to find such a nice open space. The light of the afternoon was lovely, the views of the Parliament and the Danube were incredible.

Vantage viewpoint from Buda side. This should be one of the "must-see" tourist spot as you could take beautiful pictures of Budapest from here. You could take the funicular up and down Buda side and the Bastion was just about ten minutes walking distance from the castle. There were lots of visitors around and many vantage points to take pictures around. We considered there was no need to pay extra fee to enter the Bastion for the sake of having better views. Highly recommend this site to others.
Best view . This is like the best view you can get of budapest. We went at 10.30pm was very safe. We got bus no 16 and took us to the top .

Good viewing area. Go to the free area instead of paying to climb a few stairs to see the exact same view. You can get your picture taken with a man in old Hungarian attire with a live hawk resting on your arm. Hurdy Gurdy music in a gazebo park, Take the funicular up and down and spend some time admiring the spectacular architecture of the castle area.

Great views. The fisherman so bastion offers som of the best views of the main city centre.Getting there is as easy as strolling across the chain bridge and catch the funicular to the top.Apart from the view the are some nice cute shops and of course good food. Jamie Oliver has just opened a new restaurant in this area

Astoniishing views of the city. One of the most beautiful (and very recently restored - looks like brand new!) castle corners I have been to. Plenty of cafes near by and amazing views of the city from the height. Superb sunrise - in case you can be there early enough!

Great View. Stunning view. The cafe menu and standard of service was only OK. Perhaps this is a strategy so that guests don't outstay their welcome and others can fill their place and also enjoy he view???
Great photo spot. Beautiful views and a wonderful place to photograph the city. The best part of Budapest is looking back over the Danube!

Beautiful piece of architecture and amazing sight views . Must see. The sight views and the neighborhoods are amazing. Definitely worth visiting. There are lot of beautiful tourist attractions around in a walking distance. So you just need a good weather and mood to start enjoying the city.

Views (of people posing for photographs). Perhaps because we'd walked up the hill next to Buda Castle and had enjoyed the view of the city from the bridges, but Fisherman's Bastion seems rather underwhelming. Perhaps the biggest problem was that rather than being able to actually look out, you instead had to look past people posing for pictures, many of whom wanted several shots and seems rather agitated if fellow posers got in the way of their picture (although that was quite funny to witness!). There were some turnstiles to head up to a slightly higher part of the structure, but without a clear price (I understand it to be 800 HUF from other reviews) we weren't that interested. It was a shame that part of the structure was being renovated at the time as well, as it would have been good to have seen a little more of the building. If around Buda Castle, it's only a small walk away though so worth heading over to.

Enjoy the view. Old and beautiful bastion, one of the greatest in Europe. Stroll around, grab a bite and enjoy the view. All sorts of sightseeing activities are all around and you must see everything.

First level is enough for awesome views!. A must while in Budapest. Climb up all those steps and you will be awesomely rewarded with amazing views of the city. You can be at first level and have super views, or pay to go inside for even better views. I didn't go inside, so can't compare, but not much could compare with the views we had from the first level, so save your money. It's crowded with people taking photos across the river, especially of the Parliament building, but this is one of the best places to get a good shot of it.

Do not buy ticket for the bastion. The views are good...but paying 800 HUF is not worth at all...the place is free for tourists just next to the entrance...bell tower and church tickets are worth it...not the bastion...tc...

Beautiful and historic restaurant. The location of this restaurant is both beautiful and historic. The interior is breathtaking; we were seated in the Knights' Room. The food was very good, but not outstanding, but I would definitely recommend it!
Amazing views. Pity that part of it was closed due to restoration. May I suggest that such works are carried out after the tourist season.

one of most beautiful Budapest´s monuments. built in honor of the seven Magyar tribes that founded Hungary in the year 896.The bastion of fishermen are 7 towers in honor of the founders who settled in the basin of the Carpathians.This place was in older times a marketplace and a fishermen neighborhood..Buit in neo gothic and neo romanesque styles this place is perfect to contemplate and take wonderful photos of the view of the Danube and Peste wiht the parlament .
What a view!. You have to pay to go up to the staircase to the upper terrace. Skip it. The view of PEST is just as awesome from below.
Nice view over the city. Located in the castle district near the matteus tempelum. You can overwatch the city from there and there is a small market of handmade products nearby.

My favourite view of the city. It's a must go place especially in the evening!!! I love it especially very late around 1am the lights for all the bridges etc turn off it's a delight to see! I advise everyone to see for themselves
Perfect views . Go take some touristy photos and explore the castle hill area :-) There's a beautiful church here and the Buda Castle is a short walk away.

Beautiful place, wonderful views . The name doesn't really suggest anything but it's a beautiful place, gorgeous buildings and great views of everything... Buda and the Buda hill, down the danube and across to Pest. We went on a segway tour and went back when visiting the buda castle history museum just for a another look. A few shops and cafes but mostly just go for the view, day or night!

Another Jewel In The Crown .. Enjoy spectacular views of the Danube and Pest , if you visit during daylight hours , you might have to pay , but so what ! It,s well worth it and you can be assured the money is spent on keeping this magnificent monument and surrounding area clean and tidy . Just before sunset admittance fees are not charged , so if you are on a tight budget go at night and experience the magic at night , you will not be disappointed.

Perfect Place to Enjoy Budapest Views. Fisherman's Bastion is located close to Buda castle and has very nice views of Parliament and St. Stephen's Basilica. Watching Sunrise from the bastion is super cool. Sun rises over either Parliament or St. Stephen's Basilica. Perfect opportunity for pictures.At the left end of Bastion, there is a souvenir shop. They sell Budapest post cards for cheap amount. I bought two post cards for 200 HUF whereas other places same postcard were 200 or 300 HUF each.
Stunning and historical. Another must see sight...Prepare for a lot of people but be patient for stunning photograph opportunites

Visit in the evening.. We visited both day and evening, and the evening visit was wonderful. The tourists had left for the day and we wandered at our leisure. During the day you are charged admission to the top lookout, however free access in the evening. The lights of the city are breathtaking.

charging you for the air will be next. The fact that it costs money to enter and walk up one flight of stairs on a wall is a joke. I used to go up there all the time, no charge, no gatekeeper, it's a shame, and a tourist trap. And you can see the same views from so many places, for free.

Don't pay for Admittance. The views from here are wonderful however we paid for to walk up one side of the Bastion only to find out you don't need to pay on the other side so don't be fooled into paying for it. On a clear day like we had the sights and views are wonderful and I would highly recommend a visit. It does get busy and there are a lot of tour groups around so get in there early. Alternatively there is a restaurant underneath so you can have lunch with a lovely view.
Great Views. Fisherman's Bastion is a beautiful place with magnificent views over Budapest particularly the Danube the various bridges and Parliament buildings.
Good Views of The City. Nice views of the city below, but beyond that not much to speak of beyond that. And they charge to access to access which was a minor disappointment.

Lovely views . Yes it is annoying to pay an entrance fee to every tower, church, castle, museum and bathroom in Hungary. But this is worth the money, for the excellent views of the city and the castle-like spires that are best seen from on top of the bastion.
Beautiful . Amazing architecture that you can appreciate even if you aren't into buildings such as myself! Free to visit. Lovely views of the river. Definitely recommend.
Like a painting!!!!!. Definitely a must visit when in Budapest!!!! Right on the Buda hill, just next to Matthias Medieval Church.

Stunning Views. The Fisherman's Bastion is beautiful, although there was quite a bit of construction work going on at the time of our visit which meant that you had to be quite clever with your photos to avoid the scaffolding! you have to pay to walk up on the top wall during the day, however in the evening this appears to be free, and it is worth coming back in the evening as the illuminated buildings are stunning.

Nice view yet too expensive.... The castle hill is great with the church, the museums and little restaurants, yet you have to pay to get a look which is just stupid. This is a central spot for many tourist so of you're looking for a quiet place you won't find it:)

A Must See for all Visitors. This is a historic attraction with many different aspects, and offers great photo opportunities, including of the Danube and the city. It is a good day time experience, as well as sunset and night time, with the building in lights.

Lovely view . I really recommend go up to the castle district and see the Fisherman's bastion from where you have a lovely view on the city of Budapest, including the river, the parliament and the bridges. You have to go up there in the day time and the night time too when it's dark and the lights are on. It's a great place to go with your girlfriend/boyfriend

beautiful place with a great view. A beautiful place with a wonderful view over the parliament of Budapest. It feels a bit like a fairytale and reminded me of the castles in Bavaria. I liked it a lot and recommend it if you visit Budapest.

Great view over Budapest - but lots of tourists. Going from the Metro it is good to reach and there is a phantasic view over budapest, but you might be a little patient as many tourists want to enjoy as well, and there are lots of them (=us), which is not unexpected.
I think its definitely a must (when the weather permits).
Beautifull.. Marvelous spot for looking over the pest side, beautiful . Feeling like going back to times with horses and Knights
Most picturesque place. There are so many breathtaking sites around Budapest, and this is probably one of the most beautiful! A MUST see, with loads of great photo opps.

Beautiful. A must go. It is one of Budapest most popular tourist attraction.
Wonderful view . We never miss to visit it when we are in Bp.
Great View. I recommend you start with the garden Bazar, work your way up to the Buda Castle and finish with the Fisherman's Bastion
Beautiful zones. Amazing so much to see and do. Great restaurants coffee houses also. Great views and pic opportunities. Lots of tourists also.

Must to see. This is one of those must to dos in Budapest.
If you are located in Pest side take eg. Bus number 16 which stops next to Fishermen Bastion.
Place is full is tourists but worth of coming. You can also easily to walk here (lots of stairs)

Very beautiful place. Perfect for the fellow traveller who enjoys photography. Beautiful views and an interesting place to explore. I was here briefly due to travelling the sites of Budapest with a tour guide.
Most see. The most beautiful place with the most beautiful view in Budapest. Tons of impressive building all around. You can climb up there by foot. It's rally not that hard.

A must visit for anyone coming to Budapest. The Buda hill with the St Matyas Church and the Fisherman's wharf area are tourist's mecca. On a sunny day when you can see the Pest side is the best time to come.The area can get very crowded at times and I prefer to have a drink or coffee on top of the wall operated by the Hilton Hotel as a restaurant. It is quiet and the view is amazing. Plus you avoid most of the tourist crowd.Spend time walking the streets of the entire walled area .... outside of the central courtyard area the streets are pretty quiet. Even the residential areas below the hill are worth walking.If you have time, exit the the Vienna Gate and walk down. It is only about 20 to 30 minutes.
Lovely view. It is a very nice place in Budapest, totally worth visiting it. The view of the river and of the Parliament is very nice. Once you are there you can also visit the arts museum.

Best of Budapest. This is the must see attraction if you travel to Budapest the view at night let alone the day is absolutely amazing. I visit Budapest often and ALWAYS make a trip to stand on the Bastion
First time visit to Buda side. Good viewing point from the Buda area can get crowded. some parts may be closed due to private functions.

its a must!. the whole castle district is a must if you are in Budapest, the bastion is just one part of it,as hungarian i evven go up here time to time, just to catch the vibe, the ambiance, the air. :-)
Unparalleled city view. Definitely worth the stop while in Budapest. A lovely walk about market nearby. This is the only sight worth seeing on the Buda side of the city

As if Disney had been the builders. This battlement structure all gleaming white stone is more of a viewing area with a restaurant, cafe, bar made to fit within. You have to pay to walk along it but the free views over Budapest are probably just as good.Beautifully lit at night.

Like a dream . All around the castle and especially Fisherman's Bastion was lovely. Streets, Budapest view from castle, walking in day time and evening were amazing. It was a little hard for us going upstairs with our son's stroller but I strongly recommend to see the city from castle and around.

Birds eye view. We were with the Viking Tour group, They let us off at the bottom of he town and we walked to the top. It was a fun walk seeing all of the local shops etc.The actually view is worth the walk.You enjoy a view of the Budda side from the top of the Pest side! It was very crowded and a lot of other tourists also wanted to see the view. We did not take as long as we would have liked, just to give other the same opportunity we enjoyed. Yes, it is a trip worth taking and enjoying. the breath taking view.
Lovely walk and views!. Took the funicular to go up and loved it! The overall walk, old buildings, church and views are totally worth it!

Best view in Budapest. This was my favourite view. Everybody goes up to the top and looks around. Be sure you go right too and turn around to see the church. Best view of the city and church in one spot

Great view. We visited the Fisherman's Bastion as part of a group tour of Budapest. Although only spending probably 10mins all up on the wall itself the views of the city and river were superb and come highly recommend by me. After the view was captured in photos we toured the church and walked the castle district to feel the area. This was a pleasant afternoon.

A little crowded but a great view. We wandered around by ourselves before our dinner reservations, just before sunset. The views are amazing if you can get people out of your way. Say a few groups sitting and drinking, just hanging out. I am not sure of the rules about this but I wish we would have thought of it.

Beautiful views of the city. This is a beautiful area but very crowded. You have to pay to visit each area. There are many shops and restaurants in the quaint area. A great way to spend part of a day!

Beautiful view from Buda. The Fisherman's Bastion (Halaszbastya) together with the Matyas Cathedral is an iconic site of Budapest. A little North to the Royal Palace, it is easily reachable by foot. The architecture of the Cathedral and that of the bastion is breathtaking and you can get a fantastic view of the Parliament and the Lanchid from this place. It is a must if you are in Budapest

Lovely and disappointing at the same time!. I was really looking forward to walking along the bastion so was disappointed to find that our 'entrance fee ticket' only granted access to a particular length of it, The remainder was roped off and accessible only to those willing and able to visit the expensive restaurant/bar area it's currently being used as. This seems both exploitative and elitist and seemed to be causing similar feelings among fellow visitors. Having said that the views we did see and the areas we were able to access were very beautiful.

White, white, white. Situated next to Matthias Church. It is built on the site of the medieval fish market, whereby the fishermen protected its walls. Nowadays, it is for decorative function only. You would not miss this white colored attraction
Nice views. Clean and pleasant place to walk around. There are plenty of shops, bars and restaurants nearby. Finally, there are some good spots for scenic views.

Worth going at sunset, after seeing the castle!. Great little district with beautiful views from the top, you can see across the Danube over to Parliament. Go just before sunset for the gorgeous panoramas.
Enjoyed this area alot.. Great views of the river and the City from the fisherman's Bastion. Amazing architecture, lots of restaurants and little shops. It's a must-see area for a tour of Budapest.
Not worth the money.. The enry fee is only about 3$ but one does not get anything for his money. No brochures or explanation boards, the panorama is breathtaking but you can see it from other points
Beautiful!. Beautiful area, amazing views, one of the highlights of our trip. Just as stunning at night! Almost fairytale-esque
Nice place by the water. Fisherman's Bastion is a nice place to walk around on the river. It was a little bit less exciting than what I expected.
Beautiful views. A must do! The views from here is fantastic. Also, it's inside the castle area so there are many things to do around! Cafes, shops and gardens!
Very commercialized. Liked this site much more in the past. Now it became very commercialized, lots of tourist traps. Lost its charm

Disapointing. Some part of the buildings with a better view are only accessible if you are willing to pay to get in or use the restaurant. Not very nice at all. Otherwise it is very nice to visit, but it is most touristy place in Budapest.

Beautiful views. Beautiful views of the city, however you do not need to pay for a tour. It is quite easy to walk up to the palace and then carry on towards Fisherman's Bastion, it is a lovely walk with breathtaking views.
Interesting place. Interesting place to visit and if your lucky you might find someone to explain its history as we did
No need to pay. The main attraction of this place is for the views which are just as good from the terraces as from the turrets,so no need to pay.

Magnificent city. Budapest is one of the most interesting cities I have visited. Plenty of fabulous buildings and museums to visit plus the river trips on the Danube. Plus food and drink is not expensive .

Special occasion - special meal. Our wedding anniversary required a special place to eat, so we reserved a table a few weeks prior to our visit to Budapest. The main restaurant was not available on the day however the restaurant made alternative arrangements for bookings. We were not disappointed as the ambience was still lovely. We were located in the "Arcade" section of the restaurant which overlooked the City and River Danube. Having chosen the 5 course taster menu with wine pairing, the food wine and service were outstanding. Although the cost of the meal was not cheap, it was certainly good value compared with something similar in the UK. The location is first class along with the food.

Very nice place being used as a romantic decor for Wedding and other photo-shoots. Knowing the history behind this place it was very interesting to visit it. We were very lucky to be there on a very sunny day.

Great view. Castle like walls and ramparts. This gives the impression of a castle on the hill which adds character to the buildings on the hill, but in truth this is facade. but one does get a lovely view of the city from this raised point. There is a charge to access the ramparts for the view but there are several lower spots below the ramparts that have about the same view.
Beautitul structure. What a beautiful structure and what a view you can have from here. Walking around was a delight...can easily spend a full day

Fine Views of Budapest. The walls which make up the Fisherman's Bastion in Buda give fine views over Pest, including views of the Chain Bridge and Parliament House. This is adjacent to St Matthias Church and its square and was constructed in the late 1800s and was named after the Fishermen whose duty it was to defend this part of the river.

Best Views of the City. This was a great way to get stunning photos of the Danube river, the parliment building and the Pest side of the city. Worth the extra small entrance fee to get to the top level of the first set of battlements—not as crowded as the free section below and you can get some amazing shots without getting elbowed out of the way. There's a restaurant housed within the second set of battlements, but we didn't visit. It seemed like some tour groups were allowed upstairs, but they were keeping out regular tourists. This is a definite must-see while in Budapest!!
Brilliant views from here. It's well worth the hike - fabulous views from the area. There is plenty to do in the area too. Worth the visit

OMG.... literally . Dear Lord,went here during the day, the views are out of this world, I have seen some stunning scenery in my time from Norway to America to the rolling green hills of homelands Blighty. But my God this takes some beating in the dark.... picture this, after darkness has fallen we walk by enroute a restaurant and we have to walk via the steps of fishermen bastion, there is someone somewhere playing a violin, it was mesmerising and haunting at the same time.. day or night if you get the chance to go here go,,, you dont regret what you've seen, only what you haven't.....

Walk a little further round..... The views from the Bastion over the river to Pest are indeed wonderful and a camera is a must.However there is a charge to go up onto the Bastion and for budget watchers it is definitely worth strolling just a few metres further - the same views are still there to be seen (and photographed) but it can be done for no charge.Perhaps not quite so good for a Selfie with Pest as your background...but easier on the walletMy recommendation - save the money and spend it on a coffee in the small restaurant on top of the wall at the far end. And if you do want to splash out then add a portion of their dessert! Lovely.
Beautiful View. Beautiful architecture and lovely views of the river and of Pesht.Interesting history, worth the trip if you're in the area.

Must see. Because of an exceptional view this place is one of many you shouldn't miss when visiting Budapest. Nearby you can find many restaurants and cafes and can have a perfect end of an adventurous sightseeing day.
Gorgeous views of parliament across the water. The view across the Danube to parliament is beautiful. The hut-like architecture is interesting. It is certainly worth a quick stop for a photo-op.

A wonderful view of the city.. This place is very attractive in itself, but, in addition, it offers some spectacular views of both parts of the city. Buda with it's hilly surrounding and, by contrast, the flat Pest side.

Fisherman's Bastion. This is a series of battlements that provide some of the best views of the River Danube and views across Budapest. It attracts the tourists as it provides excellent photo opportunities.

Wonderful Views. We had a tour guide who explained the history of the bastion. We went to the top & got some excellent photos. Even if you don't pay to go to the top, you will be able to get some good photos. The Castle area is nice place to walk around.
Beautiful place . Go to the restaurant at the top of the Bastion. Great wine. Great food. Really well priced with a lovely atmosphere and amazing views.

Great views from this site.. A definite must see - accessible by bus or funicular or just shank's pony.
The views are spectacular and it affords an opportunity to just walk about!
Beautiful Landmark. A beautiful landmark which offers tremendous photographic opportunities and magnificent views of the Pest side of the river.

Must do when in Budapest. I really enjoyed wandering around Fisherman's Bastion. We had just finished a walking tour which ended by Matthias Church and we decided to carry on exploring. We paid to get to the top (worked out at £1.35 each, or slightly cheaper if you're a student). I'm glad we did this as it was so much quieter at the top and we managed to get some beautiful photos. We did think the top area spanned further than it did so we were disappointed when we thought it continued to find that it in fact didn't. There was a wedding on the day we visited and they were using part of the Fisherman's Bastion so I'm not sure if this would normally have been accessible or if it really is just a short bit on top. Nevertheless, I would recommend doing this whilst in Budapest, whether you decide to pay to see the viewing platform on top or not.We got some great shots including some panoramas of the city. The Fisherman's Bastion itself is very pretty and you can definitely see why it's been used as inspiration for Disney Castles!
A must visit Place. A must visit place if you are in budapest you get a fabulous view of the city with the Danube river and the bridges. The Royal Palace and the museum located there were also great

An absolute 'must' on a trip to Budapest. It all depends on what you like yet for me the trip to Fishermans Bastion was a highlight (amongst many!) during a long weekend In Budapest.It's a cross between Le Sacre Coeur in Paris and Park Guell in Barcelona.On a hill with great views back over the Danube and the Parliament building, the architecture is simply stunning.There is a restaurant along the ramparts which has superb views although we were too late for lunch and could not sample the food.

Strange and Unique desitation. The Fisherman's Bastion was a bit like a movie set, you don't quite expect it to look the way it does. Overall, a very quirky destination with some shops scattered about, that were quite expensive for quite basic Hungarian food. Views were incredible though and can't be faulted for what we saw. Best thing is it's free! So definitely worth it if visiting the Castle District of Budapest.
Gorgeous Views. Beautiful by day, gorgeous by night....must see. We did not pay to go all the way to the top but it wasn't necessary to go up to appreciate the stunning views from Buda.

Amazing view of Budapest. Actually, you are in Buda looking down over Pest! Gorgeous view. Some viewpoints can be accessed free of charge, others charge a small amount...we found the free areas! Also a cafe which looked good.

Good views of the city. Located at a higher elevation near Mathias Church, it offers great panaramic views of Buda and Pest. There is a chrge to go on the top level, but really you can get great pictures from ground level abd save a few Euro.

Picturesque & Historical. This is a lovely place to take some great photos & learn some history. You can walk along the top of the Bastion and see beautiful views of the cathedral and also of the river, Pest and Parliament.
Amazing. Went to the Bastion during the day and then again at night to watch the sunset over Budapest, magnificent view, loved it ,worth a visit.

Amazing View. Walked up from where the boat docks . This climb to the top is not for the faint of heart . Very strenuous walk , but worth the effort once you arrive . The structures are unique and beautiful . No need to pay to climb the small tower as the views from just below and left of that point are equally awesome .

Tour and business reception. We had a guided tour of the Fisherman's Bastion prior to a reception outside at the Hilton Budapest. The structures are amazing, the church is beautiful with a unique roof. The sunset views across the Danube are outstanding.

Romantic. Perfect view of Budapest too bad is so crowded.I'm sure that many have fallen in love there because while we were there, about 45minutes we seen 3 couples going inside the church to get married ❤️

interesting spot good views. fishermans bastion is on the top of castle hill, an interesting area of very old buildings and streets, easy reached by the no 16 bus from deak frenc square. good views and some nice restaurants, also the labyrinth(worth a visit) from here you can stroll to the royal palace and presidents palace

Great views, very busy.. Great views of the river, parliament and Pest. But it's really, really busy. You look out through the little arches, but if someone is in front of you (which they always will be because its so busy) you can't really see anything. So you have to wait your turn to get to the front. And unless you're looking out at the view, you're looking at a Starbucks, lots of tourist shops and a Hilton hotel. It's a long walk up the hills to get to it. Husband moaned the whole way up.If you like a nice panoramic photo and you've got the energy and patience it's well worth a visit.
A must see in Buda. When visiting Buda, pay the amount of cash needed, not too much and visit this place.A must see in Budapest

Great views. It looks majestic at night with all the lights on. If you choose to climb the steps from the bottom of the town then be prepared to be slightly tired but it is worth it. It has restaurant with those views but only open during the day.
Great city views. Te views along the bastion are terrific though it is rather Disneyland in appearance, sort of fake American history style. Do go if only to enjoy the views over Pest.
short stay after river cruise. The bastion is a marvelous example of old castle building structures. Great view of the city and the river from the top.

Great views - but no need to pay admission charge. There is a lot you can do in this area and it is worth budgeting several hours or possible several trips depending on how long you are staying in Budapest, so you can take in the view at different times of the day and night. During part of the day they charge you to climb the short flight of stairs to the viewing platform - which we did. The views are great, but walk along the turreted wall is quite short and it did not make much sense to have to pay to do this, as there are other nearby vantage points which give you nearly the same view for free. When we came back to the area a few hours later, because we had dinner nearby - the access had opened and it was free. Very picturesque part of the city. You can walk up, take the funicular, or take a bus - in any event it is well worth a visit!
A must see. You do not need to pay to walk it for the views as to the left you get the same views and not pay. We got the 16 bus after the chain bridge and it dropped us right outside.

Great Views. We toured the area twice. We pre-booked a tour on our own and the weather was great. The Bastion itself was impressive and the views of the Pest side of the Danube and the Parliament building were great. We did a tour with Viking as part of our cruise and the weather was rainy and the views were limited.
Nice view. Perfect location to view the city and take some nice photos of the parliament building. Try to go here in early morning or right around sunset to for nice photos.

Amazing views of Budapest. Take the time to visit and (as always) pay for access to the fishermans bastion. I went just as the sun was going down for full views of Budapest. Also stayed until dark and watched the city light up. Definitely recommend this :)
Go to the restaurant!. Lovely restaurant here, that is not expensive and has great views. It looks fancy, but you do not have to book (unless a Saturday) and the views are wonderful over the city.
Nice. It's a long walk,if your walking, you can go on a hop on hop off tour, however we chose to go up ourselves. Some nice views of the city.
Go at night time, worth the view!. It is a lovely spot, definitely worth a visit, I recommend to go at night time when you can see the whole city in lights.

Fabulous views!. The fabulous views from the Fisherman's Bastion are well worth the long steep walk up the hill from the river. A vast panorama of Pest on the other side of the river from Buda opens up before you!

A long rewarding walk. Fisherman's bastion is an obvious in the must see list of Budapest. It's a bit of a walk uphill, specially if you are pushing a pram. Buses are an option but they are mostly quite crowded. So we preferred the 20 min walk. The place is really big and nice and offers spectacular views of Budapest parliament from the top. It's also neighbours Mathias church. There are a good number of local shops and cafés to serve your appetite and offer some relaxation. And on the way there is also a small Hungarian market where you can find many local art and craft products including their regional dresses. Overall a very rewarding experience.

unusual. As with a lot of things in this city, it isn't quite what you might he expecting. We paid to enter to see the views across the city, I'm not sure that they were any better than, but the price wasn't high.
Great!. This place you should visit at a day time and in a evening, it's really different! In a evening u can enjoy musician and free enter on the wall))
Nice view. Very nice place to spend a couple of minutes. It is not anything extraordinary but it is great to take some pictures and it is close to the castle.
Sightseeing.. Great spot to enjoy along with all the other buildings on Castle Hill. Good place to be at sunset to watch the sunset colours on the city.

Not much here but great views. This is a nice central area of the castle district with many shops, restaurants and St. Matthias church. The Bastion itself is nothing much. To get up on the upper wall, you either have to buy a ticket or use a cafe. Probably not worth it. You can see the view from several places here without a ticket.
View Pest from Buda. Natural compliment to church visit.....pleasant Plaza overlooking the Danube and Pest.....especially scenic at night with the building lights accross the river.

Spectacular Building. Best seen from the other side of the river at night when it is completely lit up. Hard to belief it was built in honour of fishermen as it resembles a very grand palace on the banks of the Danube.

Magical, superb views, kitsch. The magical structure with a fairytale character provides superb views across the Danube that change throughout the day and the seasons. Well worth a visit, but plan to avoid peak-times if you're wanting to avoid the crowds. Also plan enough time to visit the surrounding cobbled streets, plentiful eateries and atmospheric architecture.

A great vantage point over Budapest. This location, in addition to some interesting architecture and historical significance, offers probably the best view of the Hungarian Parliament building. Not to be missed when visiting Budapest.

Very picturesque . This whole area Is amazing! The views were spectacular. There was a charge to onto the Bastion which we kind of did not understand as we thought we could walk along the whole lot but we couldn't so you pay to go up a relatively small portion but the cost is fairly small so not an issue but something to be aware of. Well worth a visit

Great view, at a price. This balcony type area with great views of Pest across the Danube is great for photos. Since there's no building and no guides and no signage, why have tourists pay to just go up the stairs ? Seniors are charged 400 Hungarian (ok, just about $1.50) and other adults more, but I don't recall exact amount. Toilets? Another dollar. And the ticket takers in both cases were surly.If you want Budapest to be a tourist destination, you have to treat us like you want us -- not just our money.
Fantastic. Fantastic views of Danube and Pesta. Very beautiful architecture and it is worth seeing it. It also very close to Matthias church.

Either start our end here your Budapest visit. What is the Eiffel tower for Paris, Red square for Moscow or the Colosseum for Rome, that is Holasz Bastya (Fishermen Towers) for the Hungarian capital. The atmosphere is always festive and touristic there. And there is an explanation - the best panorama over Danube to Peshta side of the city on the other bank. Of course the mediaeval look of the cathedral and the surrounding streets rivals the vista thus completing the satisfaction from the visit.When up on the left tower, try to sit at the terrace cafe. All the tables have a look over the city and the live cymbalom music makes the moments spent there unforgettable.

Incredible views of Budapest both at night and in the day. I would definitely recommend visiting the Bastion once during the day and again in the evening/after sunset because the views over Budapest at both times are absolutely stunning. The Bastion itself is a beautiful piece of architecture. A definite must-see in Budapest!

Amazing views. Amazing views!! We went on our first night and didn't have to pay to go onto the bastion as it was after hours. It gave us an amazing view of the city at night. Went back in the day time to visit the nearby sights and the views were stunning, although it was packed

Amazing . One of the highest views you will get of Pest this is an amazingly beautiful place to visit. It was named after fishermen who defended the wall in 1906. Visit Matthias church as you will be stunned at its beauty.
Beautiful view of Pest. The view from the bastion is breathtaking. However, since the walk on the bastion is very short, it's a shame you have to pay to get in.
Breathtaking views. Stopped for drinks at this place, the views are stunning. Will return for dinner on my next trip to Budapest. Very classy place!
Gorgeous views!. We also sat at the Cafe underneath and had some goulash and coffee. Views are amazing and worth sitting in cafe.

Fishermen's Bastion.... Gorgeous. Architecture that dates back to Year 896. It was built to protect the fishermen from a
near by village, that have been protecting the area for centuries. The 7 tent like structures symbolizes the 7 hungarian tribes that came into the basin.
Probably the best part of Budapest. This place is magical and wonderful! It is very romantic and it is definitely a must see! Especially at night the view is amazing.
Breathtaking!. This whole area was beautiful. Great views and we loved hanging out here. Loved going in the church too.

don't be tricked!. OK it doesn't cost very much but you are only going to see a view which you can see the other end - or better still go and have a beer at the cafe (I think it belongs to the Hilton) and then you can sit and look at the view (Which is worth seeing) at your leisure

The best views from Buda across the Danube and the city (Pest). There is small restaurant with views of the city that are incredible. While you snapping pictures, eat Goulash (around 5 dollars) and drink a Hungarian draft beer (around 3 dollars): price for the meal, 8 dollars plus 10% tip (automatically added to the bill), the views: priceless...

Very good view. It has a very good view however you can see the same view from outside as well
You can enter the church near the bastion and just take a quick look to the Bastion

After visiting the castle, walk there to enjoy the view. In front of Matthias Church (which was closed), we enjoyed the view on the Danau and the parliament. We didn't pay to go upstairs but not sure it adds smtg
Best view of Budapest!. The perfect place to take pictures of the whole city and the Danube! A "must" if you are visiting Budapest!

Impressive . Impressive view of the city especially from the high walkway (pay). Newly cleaned and attractive near the ceramic tiled cathedral with the sculptures of black birds and black towers. Ornate.
Very nice. I recommend. Nice bastions with beautiful views. An enjoyable walk. Very close to Mattias Church. Expensive bars nearby.
Nice "palace". This is on top of the hill, the view from the top is unbelievable, quite romantic and fun to visit. Go!

Visit this for the Church. The Church at the Fisherman's Bastion is beautiful and vibrant. With the regular entry ticket you can go to the second floor which is a bit museum like. For the tower you need the special ticket and you can only book a tour.

Very crowded. Visited on a Sunday afternoon. Positively mobbed with tourists. Couldn't take a decent picture. I was so awash with the flood of humanity that it seamed difficult to breath. Once out and down a few stairs, the sensation diminished.
Go see it, but go on a weekday.

Stone disneyland. We took the bus from the city to the funiculat, took the funicular to the palace, walked to the Bastion, and walked down from the bastion to the metro thata crosses under the river to the Parliment. Quite confortable trip.We walked from the funicular to the Bastion, is a short nice walk betwen small streets and cute houses, great views all the way.The Bastion was a bit of a shock for me, as it looks quite modern and artificial, but it was my fault for not informing miselft properly. It even has a hotel and a starbucks insite, Most of the top of the walls are reestaurants, or accesible buying a ticket, so if you want to see the views, you have to pay. Anyhow, the views from the few places you can gaze trought are nice and the construction has a Gaudi feeling to it. The church in the middle also charges for visiting.

Top place in Budapest :). ...where history meets romance. My favourite place in Budapest and in my opinion it's one of the most beautiful, most romantic buildings in Europe, as well. Fantastic and unique views of Budapest and the Danube River. It can be visited at any time of the year. My tip for travels: visit Fishermen's Bastion at night, too. Adorable panorama to the lit city. If you visit Budapest around the 20th August on our national day enjoy from here the fireworks. (See picture among my pictures). Highly recommended! :)

Like a page plucked out of a fairy book. Seeing the turrets of the Fisherman's Bastion reminded me of the many fairy tales I have read when I was young and could have imagined them just like the ones I am seeing in real life.The Fisherman's Bastion is a free attraction that you can visit day or night. And try not to miss the perfect photo op in that place. It seems like a page out of a fairy tale. It's also free!
Magnificent view to the river. This place seems wonderful, like being taken out of a fairy tale. We enjoyed it very much. You should visit it

Must go. Some beautiful views from Fishermans Bastion. Free of charge attraction. If you want to go right to the top, I think there was a charge but we did not need to go as the views were lovely anyway.
Must to visit in Budapest. Nice view to the city at day and night. Very impressive. Sometimes live concerts take place in the square. The cafe at Sundays was close to private event. Check in advance

Impressive fairy tale style structure. As part of a general walking tour, we ended up here at around 4.30/5pm. Fantastic views to be had from here over to the Pest side. It wasn't too busy late afternoon, but I would imagine earlier in the day it would very crowded.Very interesting architecturally. Quite a few other things to see in that vicinity including Matthias Church.
Great views. Cheap and great views over Budapest. Well worth a visit for the photographs alone. Did find the Hilton hotel and Starbucks a little strange however.
Amazing veiwd. Amazing views of the river and pest! We walked up as the funicular was closed for maintenance but worth it for the views!

Magical looking building with great views of the city!. Stumbled across this on our travels over to Buda side of the city. It has a disney castle feel about it due to the structure of the towers. It was quite busy and we were there at 10am, but you were still abel to take photos. The views from the towers are wonderful as you can see Parliament. You can pay to go higher up but I didn't feel this was necessary as the news were great from lower down.
Amazing views!. Fisherman's Bastion is paradise by day and night. It offers the most gorgeous views of the twin cities of Buda and Pest. The visual is imprinted in my mind and heart for a lifetime!
A must see. The view from the Bastion to the Danube is awesome. It is on top of the hill on the Buda side. It is a very near St Matthias Basilica.

Must see. You can't miss Fishermans Bastion. You should visit it during the day and at night. At night you get amazing views of the Parliament, bridges and rest of the city beautifully lit up. You also avoiding having to buy a ticket to walk up on the wall.
View point. Worth a visit for the panoramic view over the city and a photo opportunity. Area generally worth a wander around.

It's a pleasant place to wander around.... There are terrific views across the river (particularly of the parliament) and it's right beside the cathedral which is a must-see attraction for those who like that sort of thing. In itself it's nothing special but plenty of visitors go there.
Fairy Tale. Beautiful structure with a great view of Budapest. Can be crowded on weekends, but several cafes in area and a fun place to visit.

Wroth a visit at night time!. On your visit to the Buda side be sure to pay a visit to this place. Situated on the hilly Buda side, you can catch beautiful views of the Danube River, the pest, and all the bridges connecting Buda & Pest. After 8 PM all areas are free to visit and be sure to take your camera and take pictures at night! Magnificent views of the city!!! It is also a romantic spot for couples!!! Group it together with the Castle Hill and the Matthias Church and you have a perfect self guided tour!

Great views. The views from the Bastion are second to none as you look out over the Danube and look over to Pest. A great way to pick out where some of the main sights are. We enjoyed the views so much we sat in the restaurant on top of the Bastion for a couple of hours just taking in all the great views. Avoid at night time as you cannot access it to its full potential.
