Best view of Budapest . The location offers so much. Take the tram up the hill It drops you off at a place and Dailey they have the changing of the guards. A short walk around back will bring you to the Fishermans Bastion. With a great view an monuments. Once there see the church at the square the communist era Hilton and quant town around the square. Lots of band for the time and money. It's another do not missPs where you catch the tram below get a tube shaped pastry cook over a fire Yum. Opa Opa Opa
Another beautiful builidng in Budapest. This is an interesting and beautiful piece of architecture surrounded by other beautiful buildings. Definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful Site. This is a wonderful place to wander around with great views of the river and the city. If you enjoy walking then it is a nice walk up from the river. Don't miss it.
Amazing views of city.. Amazing views, beautiful architecture, definitely worth a visit. Short walk between here and Buda Castle, and I recommend a quick stop off at Ruszwurm Cafe.
Great views. Worth the climb up the stairs. Very interesting church and the neighbourhood is very nice with restaurants and bars.

Interesting architecture. We enjoyed walking around this interesting structure seeing it from different directions. It looks like mini castles with 7 towers, built in 2002 on the foundation of the old castle located on the older side of Budapest.

Free after 7. We didn't fancy spending money to walk along here, especially after having great views of the same area from on top of Matthias Church. Wait until after 7 and you can go up here for free where arguably the view is even more spectacular as Budapest is lit up!The place was packed full of tourists and people hanging out chatting. You'll have to fight for space to get shots of some of the views but the pictures are worth it.
Day trip on tour bus. Stayed in the area for the afternoon and there was a book fair and entertainment going on, all free.bastion is very pretty area.

Eyecatching but so full of people as to be offputting. Looks great but during the daytime it is packed with tourists and a bit oppressive. It is also dwarfed by the hideous Hilton building they have allowed to build right in the middle of the square. Unusual but too full of tour parties to make it enjoyable to walk round.

Don't pay. Fisherman's Bastion is a tiny section of the castle wall which now has an admission charge to walk on it. Behind the entrance (as in turn around) there is an opening to downward stairs, go there instead for views, or dive into the restaurant under the Bastion.
Ok. This is nothing but a fairytale castle kind of structure. There is nothing to do as such but it is a pretty neighbourhood, so one can walk around and get a good feel of the place.
Nice view. Very pretty buildings. Almost fairy-tale like.Excellent view of the Pest side of the city.I guess, this is a must-see.
Best location. Good food! . The location was to die for! The place was out of a magazine! The food was good! We had a private party so we had book the entire Resturaunt. Would love to go back there!
Can recommend a visit. Beautiful place with an amazing view. So a great spot to take some holiday pictures. We also walked around the small streets in the area, which I can highly recommend.
Great views. The views from Fisherman's Bastion looking across to Pest are fantastic, even from the lower level, which is free. Well worth a trip.

Great view. From the Buda side of the city this place had the perfect view of the pest side especially the Chain Bridge that connects the Buda side to the Pest side of the city with the Danube river in middle. The only thing I did not like was that if you wanted to get up into the turret area or the top area of the fisherman's bastion you had to pay. By the way the view from the lower free section is the same and I would save my money instead of paying to get up in the upper level.

unforgetable place. Beautiful vieuw from the top of Buda HillFisherman's Bastion is fantastic bastion , the best panoramic over Budapest Tou can use small bus no 16 from the front of Ritz Carlton Hotel , on the Deak Ference ter

Beautiful! . I arrived via the Vienna Gate (did the "Neighborhood Walk from the lonely planet guide). Amazing introduction to the area in terms of architecture. Arriving at the Bastion, I understood what the fuss was about! Stunning views of Pest waterfront. Made better with glorious weather.!
Panoramic Viewpoint. Wonderful views of the Danube and the Parliament building. Can see all the bridges, St Stephen's Basilica and panorama of Budapest.
GREAT VIEWS OF PEST ACROSS THE RIVER. A late 19th Century monument to the Guild of Fishermen with a plaza and decorative turrets - and a great viewpoint over the River Danube and the City of Pest.

Awesome city view from here.. Fisherman's Bastion is same area with St. Matthias church , it is really beautiful and impressive view up here , I recommend that you visit here in night time and day time. You will found the view is awesome.
Stunning views- worth a trip just to take in the setting. The town around the bastion is also lovely. There are many cute shops and restaurants in the same neighborhood.

One of the best outlook points in Budapest!. The fishermans bastion is one of my favorite places in Budapest! why? because it has a great view all over the city, facing the beautiful parliament and located in front of the Matthias church, which is very beautiful too. locked in the castle district, you can easily combine going to the castle, fisherman's bastion and the Matthias church, last but not least enjoying the great view on budapest and the Parliament
2016 Summer vacation. The upper section has a very nice view to take pictures and definetely worth the the eight hundrend Forints ticket price. The bottom part is free.
Disneyland. Impressive, the turrets reminded me of Disneyland. Worth a look and views overlooking Budapest are good.

Very different by day and by night. This place has a beautiful church and hilltop vantage point to admire the views across Pest (which I saw you need to buy tickets for), but the main draw for me was the phenomenal view of the Parliament building, which you can see for free at the rear of the church or next to the cafe. The place is easy to get to with busses stopping right outside there (public transport in general is pretty great in Budapest). In the daytime it is busy with visitors and cafe goers. The place charges to get up some steps on to a higher battlement wall for the premium higher views. My tip is to go after dark. The place is quieter, you no longer have to pay for the higher views and mainly the photo opportunity for this place/Parliament/Chain bridge illuminated is not to be missed.

Popular with tourists but still worth it. It's obviously on everyone's to-do list but still worth passing by. Good views but anywhere up in that area gets good views so we used the Bastion as our access point to walk around the castle area, visited the bunker hospital etc

Adjacent to Matthias Church and of similar architecture.. They require a fee to go up to the top rampart. Skip it and get pics from the lower level accessed through the restaurant. Beautiful stone work!
nice view. nice view from bastion. We visited on Saturday early morning. We were lucky: entrance was free of charge. Not too many people are here in these hours.
Very beautiful, but you need to pay to see it. Awesome setting, very well preserved, best view in town for the parliement building...but you have to pay to access the belvedere. Disappointing.

Extremely beautiful, so so packed with tourists. The bastion is definitely a place worthy a visit, but really, be aware that it's packed and personally I can't take that type of crowd for too long. Good thing the rest of the castle district is also worth exploring !
Interesting. It is an interesting place to visit, sad cannot get to the top as restaurants / eating places occupy them
wow. one of most beautiful places in Budapest, good looking square, old church and also ready steamy with view on while Budapest. This is one of must see in Budapest, stunning view on city
Unbelievable Views. The buildings are shaped like tents so unusual. I really enjoyed the views. There's a small walk but so worth viewing.

Marvellous views across the Danube. To go on the walls and get unparalleled views you will have to pay at a. Cost of about £4 each. Pensioners go free (over 65)
There are other view points at ground level but they get very crowded.
interesting architecture. There is a nice architecture around, some markts and a good view direction parliament. Perfect area to have a small walk
Beautiful Attraction. Amazing views and beautiful sculptures..picturesque place.. Places to eat and coffee shops around.. Short walk from the palace and Charles bridge.

Beautiful scenery . Fisherman's Bastion offers a beautiful viewpoint of the parliament building and the rest of Budapest . I was disappointed as I was not able to go in to Matthias templom ...again . There were so many tourists and there was also a charge to go into the church !
Overall this is one of my favourite places in Budapest .

Awesome place. Very touristy but not to be missed. Awesome awesome place. Great view of the region and Danube. Very touristy and expensive for food. But has good picnic spots We got here with a walking tour (free) and so we saw both Buda side and Pest side from here. Really gives you a good perspective

Fascinating place to spend an afternoon. Fascinating complex of buildings, walkways, turrets and staircases. This is a real draw for the tourists but it wasn't overly busy when I visited. It may be at the top of a hill, but its an easy walk from the river. There are a range of places to grab some food and some great photo opportunities overlooking the Danube. Definitely worth a look when visiting Budapest.

Super Renovation. The most popular spot [especially for marrying couples] of the Castle District, as it offers a grand panorama of almost the entire city. Its architecture is neo Gothic and neo Roman. Its architect, Frigyes Schulek, wanted to provide a worthy setting for the Church Matthias, when building it [1896-1903] while using the remaining stones of the old Castle wall.Rebuilt in 1949 after the WW II, as most of Budapest. Impressive that the Hungarians are deadly serious when it comes to rebuilding.

Beautiful spot. I visited with friends this weekend and this spot was very beautiful and worth a visit. We needed to take the Funicular up the hill to get here, but it has amazing views of the Danube and Parliament building. There was a few weddings taking place which we got to watch too. Don't miss out on this!
Sunning city views. The views are stunning from the Bastion. There a restaurant, shops and cafes.The Cathedral is well worth a visit.
Worth a visit. Great views, beautiful cathedral - go up there, an there from through the lovely streets up there, to the castle. 2-3 hours slow walking. Then down the tram, by the chain bridge.

Great view. This location is really a viewpoint - sure, the architecture is pretty, but that's not worth much unless you're planning on using it for a photograph. It is however right behind the cute Matthias Church which makes it worth a trip if you're in the area. When I visited there were some wedding photos going on and it certainly lends itself to that exercise.

Beautiful views of Budapest. This amazing castle overlooks Budapest on a hill and the views are incredible! Worth a visit when your there....there's little cafes in the castle and you do have to pay to go up part of the castle but you get to go in so many places anyway if you didn't want to pay
Amazing views. Took some great photos of the "Pest" side. There is a restaurant on the top (second terrace by the tower) of the Bastion that had some very good food for lunch.

Great Views. Want to see the Danube and Budapest from a different perspective? The view from the Fisherman's Bastion will give you that. Set on the edge of the Buda hill overlooking the Danube River and Pest, this iconic white stone landmark is one of the best lookouts I've visited. The view across to Pest and the Hungarian Parliament building is stunning. Take lots of photos and visit the Matthias Church and have the coffee and cake at Rustwurm while you are on this side of the river. Visit the Buda Palace if you have the time and then ride the funicular down the hill and walk across the Széchenyi Bridge back to Pest to complete your visit.
Great View. This is a great spot for the view. Sit back in the great small cafe that overlooks the Danube and enjoy a coffee or drink.

Lovely view. We had been a couple of times at this site amd the view is always spectacular. The surrounding buildings are lovely and detailed, the view of Budapest is fantastic. You can include this as a stop in a lomg walk around the hills in Buda.

Expected more. It is just behind St. Matthias church, which is great. The point here is the fabulous view of Pest, across the Danube. The Bastion itself it ok, or even disappointing depending on the expectations.
Excellent view of the city. Beautiful, whimsical place. I would recommend paying the couple of bucks to go to the observation area, much less crowded and great view, easier to take pictures.
Great spot for photos. Saw it on the free walking tour. Great views of the city - recommend for good photos. Interesting architecture.
Commanding View!. This is a very nice view along with some interesting shops and restaurants in the area. Well worth the visit and a look around.
Commanding View!. This is a very nice view along with some interesting shops and restaurants in the area. Well worth the visit and a look around.

Over crowded. It's a beautiful view. But it's sooo over crowded of people trying to get a perfect photo/selfie. Soo if you can find the time when there's less people, then it's perfect. Also...wear comfortable shoes.

Simply amazing view!. The view here is amazing and there are some street artists willing to paint you for a fair amount of money.
A must to visit!

Very nice view of the city on top. One of the most historical area to visit while in Budapest. there is a restaurant there but only very few tables you have to wait a while to be seated. they have not much choices of food but the view of the city is fantastic.

Great views . This is one of the best places to get a view of the city. They charge a small fee to allow you to climb up a few flights of steps to take sweeping photos of the Danube and the city. Totally worth It!

Beautiful site, though it feels like a theme park.. Beautifully renovated site with nice buildings that seem to be from middle ages. Actually, it's just over a 110 years old. Still a nice place to visit with a great panoramic view of the city. View at it's best in the afternoon sun.

Iconic part of Budapest. One of the must see places at budapest, easy reachable with bus, taxi or even tram+Funicular (needs some walking if you take this one).
Good place to take photos, great view to Pest's side.

Best views. . Loved just getting to this point. We had 3 days in Budapest, and we stayed on the Pest side. We walked across the Bridge and climbed up here every day, sometimes twice.
You can also taxi here.
There is an elevator shortcut near the left hand stairs. Less stressful.
Very pretty!! . We loved it up there the views were amazing and so was the architecture! A very long walk up though 😊
Great place to visit. Amazing view of the city, the parliament and birdges. The lighting is amazing at night. The parliament view is amazing at night.

Best views to Pest and Danube river. Views to Pest, Parliament and Danube river are for me the most remarkable feature of this place. It has been restored recently, so in my opinion looks quite artificial

Beautiful Place and views. This is a large area that you walk through. The Fisherman's Bastion is on the side of a high hill in Budapest, and the views are spectacular! You can walk around as long as you'd like, it's open and like a big square like they have all over Europe. There is a resturant you can eat at and if we had time I would have tried it. There is the church to tour as well, and lots of shops along the street leading up to it. Beautiful place.

Pretty just like the photos , great views . It's fully renovated so looks like Disneyland. Tourists swarm this place at all times of the day. Best time to go is during sundown. Going up the tower is not worth it. The tower is just a few steps up from the main common floor, not worth paying any extra. Great views of the Parliament.
One of the most places visit in the city. Nice views inside and outside: beautiful views over the river other side of the city, e.g. parliament house at night, inside full of history.

Photo Op :). Hmmmm perfect picture setting. You would have the view of Pest. For Americans like us, starbucks made it perfect! HAHA. How i missed a good frappuccino!!! Oh, and they have abd will give you ICE! :) you will understand whats with the ice comment when you come here in Budapest :)
Disney look a like?. Reminds me somewhat of the Disney castle. Great photo opportunities. Can get great shots of Parliament.
Great views. The Fisherman's Bastion afford some fantastic views of both Budapest and The River Danube. Easy to see all of the main bridges and Margit Island.

Out of this world. If you don't go to the trouble and see this amazing place you are missing out on one of the most beautiful surreal places on earth! I wish I could have a day there all on my own with my camera without all the bustling crowds. IT'S A MUST DO !!

best place for panoramic photo-shooting of the Pest side. besides the views that you have from the bastion on the Danube and Pest, the towers and the Matthias Church are well worth a visit. I have seen at least two different restaurants and a Starbucks there, but there are probably more places to eat. expect food and beverage prices to be on the costly side, of course. i think that of all of Budapest attractions, I like the bastion the most.you can't be in Budapest without visiting this place.

Interesting Place For a Short Visit. We went to the Buda side and took the Funicular to the top. Once on top you are in the Castle area and the town that was Buda (was enclosed by a wall around the Castle and town. We walked down to Mathias Church and then to the Fisherman's Bastion which was next to the church. The Bastion is named after the Fisherman's Guild that once was based on the Buda Side. There were seven tribes in the guild so there is a tower for each. It was beautiful and interesting but not a place to spend hours. We walked over and around the Bastion and were off to see more in 15-20 minutes.

Such a surprise. It looks like something in a fairytale. I had to look it up because I thought it was a new addition, but time has been very kind to it. There is a drinks bar and restaurants where you can sit in the open air and enjoy the beautiful view.

Beautiful Views. This is in the Castle Hill area near Matthias Church. We walked the bastion - it's on the short side. We didn't pay to go up the towers. The views from the "bottom" were gorgeous. There are a lot of people there, but still are able to enjoy it. We even sat on the stairs for a while just taking in the view.

800Ft for the view. My second time to enter this place. Gorgeous view with many tourists, if you don't want to enter it, you may still climb up the hill and stand on the stairs below. It would be better to come here in early morning then might be more quiet. Many tourist groups will pass by the place and quite noisy. It's still a very nice scenery which you can buy tickets with other nearby sightseeing sites. During the first time of visiting, I was joining a free walking tour, which was also meaningful and fruitful for understanding more history about Budapest. They bring us up and down the hills then describe the story of the city.

Amazing!!. This place is absolutely beautiful. You can go inside the church, up the tower and along the bastion for a reasonable price. It's stunning and there is a nice bar to have a drink or two with panoramic views. Highly recommend this place!
Unbelievable VIEWS. Looking at Budapest from the Fisherman's Bastion is breathtaking. No need to pay for a ticket as the view is great from anyplace up there including the little cafe. Worth it!!

wonderful place to visit and enjoy views. This is a perfect location for viewing Budapest. It is up on the hills of Buda and looks over the Danube and Pest. Inside the Bastion is wonderful as are all the old buildings and churches in Budapest.

To be seen...beautiful views from here!. A not to be missed spot in Budapest! The area around it in the Buda Castle District is pleasant to stroll, shop or stop for a coffee. We sat outside & got iced coffee as it was warm.

Great vantage point. Excellent location on the BUDA side to view most of Budapest, especially the Parliament building and the various bridges across the Danube. Good location to start or end a walking tour of the Castle District.
Amazing views!. Beautiful architecture and amazing views Make sure you go around to the left where you can see the remains of a Roman Church
Nice place . Very nice enjoyed the walk and the views over the river nice place to relax and enjoy a drink after a long day would recommend it to anybody who enjoys history and great views

Beautiful plié win great view. It was really very beautiful there. Even it was hot,we went there twice just to take more photos.
A unique place and my favorite one in Budapest !
Great view of city. This was a beautiful viewpoint to the city. The town and the church were remarkable. The decor in the church was not typical of other churches, but beautiful to see.

Vacation visit. Ok but hot in The summer
Wine festival, and every Street was closed.
Nice to see The guards change in The president palace

Loved it!!! . After having a look around Buda we were amazed to see the fisherman's Bastion and how usual it is. A lovely atmosphere around there with people chilling out and taking in the breathtaking scenery. Worth going from the Pest side to see definitely.

Beautiful location. Buy the ticket (800 HUF) and walk the wall. Beautiful view of the city and tons of great photo spots ;) While in the area; be sure to grab a coffee and a sweet at Walzer Café about 3 minutes walk from here. Look it up on trip!
Brilliant location . We really enjoyed our visit such a fabulous view and lots to do close by. Clean and tidy with good cafes

Beautiful . One of my favourite places that myself and my boyfriend visited in Budapest. Really lovely place, had a little market on when we were there so we had some food and a beer :) was really pretty with views over Pest.

Looks like a Fairy Tale. If Shrek were to walk around this area, he would not appear out of place. Very quaint and old worldly. The very expensive restaurant there looked nice a nice place to get a drink and enjoy the view of the Danube.
Beautiful place. This is like Cinderella's castle and wonderful views across the Danube to Pest. Lovely place to wander and enjoy an ice cream on a hot day
Incredible view of the Pest side of Budapest. Fabulous views; good restaurants. It's an extensive uphill walk if you don't ride the funicular but you can stop along the way and it's not too far.
Worth it. Located in the Buda side, this landmark is so worth it. The sites are all connected that you need to see in Buda. Great views. The Funicular is not expensive at all.

Great photo point. This is an interestinliy designed place and also been changed a few times ( church ) throughout the invades Budapest had. However I mostly liked the fact that I can take a good picture of the parliament from here. We only had a chance to see this place in the evening but it was worth it. So get your camera (no tripod required as you can lean on the wall ) up there. You will need a good camera to capture the lights of the parliement. It is accesible by car/bus/bcycle for who cannot go up on the steps. Be careful when you are there with the little ones as it isn't completely safe. I saw a cafe shop with the view but was closed when we were there. Unfortunately I don't have photos taken by my phone for this location. You should def see the view and great for evening photography.

Impressive fortress of the historic side of Budapest.. This is a unique area of the capital with hundreds of years of history within a moderate size plateau. The old walled city is incorporated as part of this fortress. Fee are charged for walking up staircases and entrance into the church.

Straight out of a fairy tale book. This place looks like a castle and straight out of a fairy tale book. The entry is free and can be reached by bus which takes you straight up to the buda hill. You get a beautiful panoramic view of the city from here. There is a nice ice cream parlour there.
Leisure. Amazing views of the city and Parliament from the Buda side of the city. Recommend going to the top on the furnicular carriages for a small fee
Nice. Unusual funny buildings with great view of the city, river and parliament. Nice to visit if you are in Budapest

This place looks like a castle from the world of Walt Disney. TravelBudapest: Fisherman's BastionAugust 30, 2016|Feed The Couple This place looks like a castle from the world of Walt Disney. It is a quite a touristy area with many, many people around but it is a lot of fun to check out the different fortification walls and the views from different perspectives ... And the lighting was perfect for photos!   This amazing castle of glistening white stone brought back our imagination of all those Disney fairy tales from our childhood. Its round turrets, crenellated parapets, and spiral columns made us imagine a palace of which Walt Disney himself derived his imagination from. We kept expecting a princess to emerge with a flourish of trumpets (Look at us being childish, haha). The views were unique and you can fully appreciate the beauty and splendour of Budapest (Buda and Pest) stretched out before you along the Danube river, either day or night, but best time to go there is when it’s twilight, just before night.~Feed The Couple
At the Eurosensors2016. There is a new restorant open at the lower level. Now it is excellent,calm differing from the central city restorants. The red wine was saturetad, well legged, strong.
Beautiful place. Beautiful architecture and very windy. Great place to get a bird's eye view of the city too. It is a great place to relax
An amazing view from an amazing place.. You can come here for the views alone. The place is amazing and a must see while in Budapest. Its free, and part of a great walk.

A magnificent view of Buda. The trip up to the castle top is a great expedition. Only small buses and cars are allowed. There was a good size crowd when we were there, so photography is a bit of a gamble.
Amazing architecture. Here right now. Amazing architecture. Stay at the Four Seasons and take the bike cabs, always ask for the price before you get into a cab because they will rip you off

totally amazing view of the Parliament building and city lights. We booked an evening meal here for the Hungarian Independence Day and were not disappointed. The view from the terrace across the river to the Parliament building at night is stunning. A bonus was the fire work display that went for over 40 minutes. The Bastion itself has many levels to explore and would be one of the most beautiful settings we saw in Europe. It has been wonderfully restored and was clean and tidy.

Worth it for the views. For $800HUF you can walk the wall and get great views of the river and Parliament building. As well the church behind you with amazing roof tiles. 7 turreted lookout towers for the 7 clans that founded the country.

Stunning views . Visited here in January and the views were amazing. Wonderful photo opportunities if you're into photography. It was snowing when we were there so it was like something from a fairytale! A must do for anybody travelling to Budapest!

Midnight view on top of the hill. Went trekking across Europe recently and travelled from Berlin, Prague, Vienna to Budapest then Venice and Milan. Budapest was definitely the highlight of the trip. The fishersman bastion was something I read about and informed that the views were amazing. I decided that we should climb up to the top of Buda Hill and take photos at night. Luckily after we crossed the Chain bridge, there was a funicular to take us up top costing 2200 HUF return. However a number 16 bus will take you there if you take if from Deak Ferenc Ter to Disz Ter - if you have a Prague card or bus pass then this will be the cheapest and most comfy option. The view was amazing and violin players were about which just completed the atmosphere. Would definitely return to Fishersmans Bastion

The best view of the city. Marvelous views. you can see the whole city from ip there.Try to find a clear day which helps. It could be very windy so try to find a less windy day.There is some good coffee shops near.
Literally a Top Location. Fisherman's Bastion should be on every visitor's itinerary. Lovely architecture, magnificent views and some very pleasant places to eat.

Great views, no need to pay. A fantastic area, as described by so many people already. We did not pay to go up into the towers, and did not feel we missed anything. That said, it's not expensive, so on a day when we had more time may well have done so.
Fairy Tale. Ibspiration for Disney's Cinderellas castle :) Truly beautiful and felt like I was in a bygone era. A must for everyone visiting Budapest
Wow!. We were there during a festival. Great local eats and art. Views are amazing. It's like a fairytale. Check it out!

Fairyland - No, it MOST REAL!. My bride insists that Fisherman's Bastion should be rated as SIX stars! She is probably right!
The photo opportunities are endless! The architecture stunning.
And it is free- totally Free!
An absolute, hands-down MUST!
Fantastic . The Castle Hill is absolutely a must to visit in Budapest and the Fisherman's Bastion is not to be missed. Very elegant construction and great views.

the view. Great panaromatic view. You can see all of the famous bridges of Budapest; my favourite city. Beautiful architecture, good parking facilities and cozy little shops where you can buy local products with stunning embroidery. Very beautiful.

Nice view but not much else here. I paid a few hundred florints to check out the view and it was very nice but nothing that stood out from other nearby vantage points (which were free). Stonework is impressive but it was all rebuilt in recent years anyway.

Views monopolised by restaurants. Last time I visited this place there was almost unrestricted access to the battlements with amazing views of the city. Now sadly the opportunity to take your cash has taken over and swanky restaurants seem to have occupied the best viewpoints. Shame.

Nice views. It was free when we visited, I think because a wedding party had closed St Mathias church to the public, therefore it was quite crowded (although saying this is it was a Saturday lunchtime). Good views over the Danube and Pest, but I'm glad I didn't have to pay for it as it was very busy!
Beautiful. This is a must see stop in Budapest. The views are amazing, even if you don't pay to climb up. And I must say, the vendors here were polite and selling lovely crochet sweaters.

It looks a bit like a Disney sand sculpture. You must see this area along with the many other must see's in and around this location. Wonderful views of the Danube and for a romantic evening have dinner here, sunset is brilliant.
Pretty cool. Lots of overpriced restaurant s here but the architecture and views are amazing. Plenty to do culture wise.
A beautiful sight. One of my favourite sights in Budapest. Interesting and rich history compliments a stunning design. You won't regret!
A must see!. Amazing views of the whole city definitely worth the trek to it. Guy playing the violin really added to the ambience! Gets very busy but that expected.

Most photogenic spot in Buda. This place is unlike anywhere else we've been to in Budapest and certainly the most beautiful. The views and the area itself are just amazing. Plenty of activities to do and things to see nearby, including the Matyas church, caving activities, the museum of military history etc. Lots of street performing going on as well.
Nice View. It's really beautiful and also the most lovely views of across the Danube to the other side of the city!!! You can get amazing photos.
Wonderful experience. Only the Hilton hotel was messing up the nice neighborhood. Also, only some parts of the bastion were open.

Interesting building. The most unusual building that we came across on our travels in Budapest. Lots of different levels and different view points across the river. Go at sunset and it naturally frames the parliament building so you get the most beautiful photos.
Worth a visit. So pretty, i just loved the buildings in Budapest and this is up in the top. The whole area is just lovely and you get amazing views across the Danube.
Worth a visit. Absolutely stunning, and lovely views over the city. Some lovely, unusual shops. Don't forget your camera.

Must see sight . This is definitely a must see sight in Budapest. You will see several interesting buildings like the Mathias Cathedral among others and get to enjoy wonderful views over Budapest.
It's worth walking up the hill by foot.

Stunning and amazing photo stop. It looks like a sand castle and feels more likely to be seen in Disneyland, Make visiting the Bastion part of your walk on Castle hill. It's location is convenient and the views are splendid.
Up the hill. You must go up the hill to experience the view over the Danube and across to Pest on the other side of the Danube.
Beautiful scenary. It is a must for part of the sight seeing in Budapest. The Matyas church is beautiful but not always available to visit on the weekends when it is packed with weddings.

Beautiful view. A must to visit in Budapest. The best view, nice local atmosphere ...and a Starbucks.
Easy to reach with bus number 16, or climb from the 'chain bridge'

History preserved . Amazingly preserved, it was a real treat to spend a sunny afternoon here. Lots to see and the views over Budapest are lovely, be sure to take lots of pictures! There are plenty of areas to just sit and relax if you do not want to pay to eat in any of the surrounding cafes/restaurants. An easy stroll over from the Palace area and back down the hill.

Nice walk with nice views. We had no idea about this place. We were just roaming around and found a shortcut from the castle. Loved the weather, walk and views. Ice cream at hilton was lovely and a typical hungarian wedding was taking place. Enjoyed it.

Lovely views. This was my favourite place to visit in Budapest, the building is beautiful & has the most lovely views of across the Danube to the other side of the city! There's also the loveliest church right by the side!

Beautiful day at the Bastion!. The Fisherman's Bastion is one of the most beautiful places in Budapest!! Not only because of the scenic views across the river to Pest, but just the area in general is beautiful . . . the Bastion turrets, Mathias Church, the golden Hilton, the little garden cafe for Langos, having a quick snack at a Bastion cafe, etc. . . . all make for a great afternoon!
Excellent views of the Danube. It is defiantly worth going up here just for the breathtaking views of the Danube. The castle district is a very interesting area.

Splendid views. Although the area is a tourist trap of the first water, and a bit of Disney in Hungary the views of Budapest from here are spectacular. It's a must to visit this spot, and there are lots of cafes/restaurant where one can relax.

Special architecture and stunning views. The bastion didn't serve as a defensive part of the city but was build for the view it offers - and my are they stunning. We were there on a beautiful late summer's day with warm weather and blue skies which only made the view out over the Danube and Budapest even more amazing. The architecture is unique and intriguing as well - most of all it resembles an oversized sand castle.

Stunning views . Definitely worth the walk to Buda castle to see the views from the top. Sunset is a must from the walls of the bastille. I think they charge in the daytime to walk along the wall as there was someone guarding the entrance but there was no one there when we went around sunset so I would suggest avoiding the toll.

Beautiful, but sadly partly private. This is a lovely area to walk about and get views over to Pest. The only problem is part of it is private and charges to let you walk about, which is a sin for something that should be a public monument. It is still worth visiting for the public free areas though.

Like something out of a Disney Film. Fishermans Bastion is absolutely magical to look at and we just thought it could have actually featured in Disney Film. The architecture is stunning and the views over the Danube stunning. It is located right next to the Matthias Church and is near to Castle Hill. It takes it's name from a Gulid of Fishermen who defended this part of the city in the middle ages. The viewing terraces have many staircases and passages. This is yet another historical site which had to be restored following its near destruction during the Second World War. You can book tickets for a walking tour of the area via the Web.

Amazing.. Its a great place. I spend maybe the most time here from all attractions. Maybe because its on a hill so we took a longer rest but still its amazing place with good view. The name is from fishermans that defended the this part of the city in middle ages if am correct.

Beautiful sight in Budapest. A must visit while in Budapest. You can either take #16 bus up the hill or enjoy the climb up. It's a bit tiring to climb up if you walk here from the Central Food Hall, which is what I did, but it's worth the walk because the view along the way is very scenic and everything is just perfectly photogenic.
Very different type of church , original . The whole area is mountainous , but has buildings that survived the Second World War . It is something that should be seen when going to Budapest.
Great view. If you're looking for a place to see the Budapest view, it's the one :) easy to find, totally for free. Easy to reach. With great climate :)
What a view!!. This view is spectacular! The ground are lovely but the view of Budapest is worth the effort . Beyond ant expectations

Beautiful Architecture with amazing View. Bastion is amazing place to stroll around and soak yourself in the beauty of the Bastion's Architecture and beautiful view of Pest side also Parliament. Most of the place is free of charge, only some parts are charged but i would recommend not to buy as you get awesome views from the uncharged part too. There is restaurant at Bastion, where we had lunch with great live music. It was a great experience. For dinner one must book at least 24 hrs before. I would also recommend to visit at night as there is 180 degree shift between day n night view.
Great view. At the top of Buda Castrle, a great place with a magical view! Wherever you look there is something to admire.

Lovely Views. Located just next to Matthias Church, the Fisherman's Bastion is only a shirt walk from Castle Hill, and commands spectacular views down across the Danube towards the Parliament building. Well worth a visit.
Beautiful. Beautiful place.Very clean everywhere.One of the best place to visit in Budapest.Must to see this place.

Fascinating place high up with great view of the Danube. We visited Fishermans Bastion on a days tour to Budapest from Vienna. The architecture is beautiful with several towers and terraces. It is named Fishermans Bastion because the fishermens guild protected this part of the river in the Middle Ages.. Nearby are some shops which sell beautiful traditional clothes - I bought a peasant style blouse for my little granddaughter.

Beautiful historic buildings. The Bastion is a beautiful setting high above the Danube overlooking the city. we were there during the day and returned for dinner. At night the view and the venue are beautiful and well maintained, maybe better than some other old properties in the area.

Wonderful. It's a wonderful building on Castle hill.
It offeres a wonderful view of the city.
It's mostly free, apart from some spaces that are to be paid during the day but are not controlled by night :-)

Beautiful View. The Bastion is right outside the St
Mathias Church and give you a wonderful view of the Pest side of the Danube. You can see the Chain Bridge and the fabulous Parliament Building
Super!. It was a special experience and I recommend to all! There you have a great view and you can see all bridges over the Danube.

Nice Views, But A Bit Disneyland-ish. The architechture of this place seems very Disneyland to me, and although the views were nice, my understanding is you can get better ones on Citadel or Gellert hills. Was it worth standing in a long line to get tickets for this and Mattias Church (next to it)? Well, with two complaining teenage boys along, maybe not.
Nice. Amazing architecture .looks good at day and night.Inside some restaurant,coffee shops with lovely view

Interesting Historical Area. We recently visited Fisherman's Bastion which is part of the Castle District on the Buda side of Budapest. The view of the Castle District from the Pest side is outstanding, especially the gorgeous Royal Palace. We crossed the Chain Bridge and took the funicular (reasonably priced) to the top of the hill and turned to the right, away from the palace. There were a number of shops and restaurants along the way. Fisherman's Bastion is basically a wall with several towers left from a fortress but it offers some great views of the Pest side. Matthias Church is near the wall and was lovely. The whole Castle District is definitely worth a visit.

Best location to view the sunset. On the Buda side of Budapest you can go onto "Fishermans look out" which allows you too look over the Pest side
It is the perfect place to watch the sunset, however it is still beautiful to go up and look out during the day
Amazing view of the Pest side of the city. The view from up here is so breathtaking. You simply have to go there to witness it yourself. St. Mathias church is also there to see.

Fantastic view of Danube and Parliament buildings at Night. It can get very hot during the day. So night time is the best time to visit Fisherman's Bastion is when it is lit up. We got in for free at night time. We arrived at 11 PM. Bus 16 runs late into the night and is the best way to get here, if you don't fancy the hike up the hill. Don't use Funicular as it is a rip off. The Mathais church is also worth visiting and is illuminated. This attraction presents awesome views of the Danube, the City, Chain Bridge and Parliament Buildings. Its nice to have a walk around and we spent 2 hours taking some really nice pictures. There are lots of restaurants open late in the night.
beautiful. Beautiful view of the city from here. Visited during the day as well as at night time. Lighting at night is beautiful. Took some of our best pictures here.
Brilliant Views. Excellent views of the parliament and St Stephens Basilica from here! It's definitely worth visiting especially as it's next to Matthias Church. The architecture is beautiful too

nice sight of Budapest from this place. I was there different time, there is a very nice sight of Budapest and after i possible going down into green for the Buda hill going to under level of the city.

Our Budapest trip. Did the tuk tuk tour today, that was really good in its self. However when we visited fisherman a bastion and stopped at the bottom for us to get a good look the only thing I can say is WOW. It doesn't look quite real, something out of a film set (I'm sure I won't be the only one to think that).When we got to the top of Pest, and when you take the time to walk around the bastion it really is something very special. Don't come to Budapest without visiting This area and the fisherman's bastion.

Visit for the view and some stunning photos. Without doubt, I got my best photos of my trip to Budapest at Fishermans Bastion. Its quite near to the church and the castle. I visited in the afternoon which was really beautiful sunny day but a lot say that the dusk is even better.There is a small cafe at the top of the bastion where you could grab and drink and sink with the view of Budapest

Nobody knows why it's called fisherman's bastion, but we don't care. fantastic views from the top. good pics can be shot from various parts of the building. bit of a climb to get there but once on the top it's a good experience

Beautiful uphill walk. You can get up to this area by walking/ the funicular/bus or taxi. We thought it would be easier to walk and it didn't take very long. We started across the river at the Parliament and walked across Chain Bridge, stopped at the funicular area for gelato and continued our uphill walk. Along the way there are many steps to get the plaza area. Once there, you can buy tickets to walk on the catwalk. For 2 adults/2 kids it was $8USD. The catwalk itself is maybe 100-150m total but it wasn't crowded and provided a nice view back towards the parliament building and the Pest side of the river. Not sure how long the funicular cost but there was quite a line to use it. Easier to keep walking.
Great view. No need to buy tickets. You can enjoy same panorama for free. Besides that, the view from Buda towards Pest is great.

Great views of the city. I have to say the place is very good and not crowded. The place to be at during sunset to capture the great pictures. There are restaurants nearby or a Starbucks if you fancy a coffee

Just wow. We came across this by accident whilst wandering the streets around Buda Castle, I'd seen that Fisherman's Bastion was one of the top attractions in Budapest but had no idea what to expect. We bought a combination ticket that allowed entry to Fisherman's Bastion and St.Matthias Church, swerving the other ticket for the bell tower on account of the concern that climbing 200 steps in 30' heat might finish me off! The church was beautiful - both the painted walls and stained glass on the inside and the gloriously shimmering tiles of the exterior. Fisherman's Bastion was something else, on a warm late summers day with a blue sky behind, the fairytale turrets were a joy to behold. Both areas reminded me of Gaudi's wonderful architecture in Barcelona. There are some beautiful views across the Danube towards Pest including the Basilica and Parliament. One of the highlights of our trip to Budapest.

Panoramic view from a panoramic site. This is really nice from the opposite side of the Danube. When you get there, you realize that this is also great from the square where the equestrian statue of the first Hungarian king stands. The square is generally crowded. From the bottom level you can have a nice view of Pest side of the city, including the Parliament. If you pay, you can also get to the upper floor; the panorama is basically the same, but there is generally no crowd there.

Awesome views!. The architecture is very nice and you get an amazing view over Budapest. If you stay past 7pm you can get onto the towers for free and the view is amazing! Also I would suggest staying for after sunset as the city lights up and you get a great view of the parliament lit up.

Do not pay to see panorama ... not much taller than free access. This is an open area to walk around. There is a charge to climb the steps for a panorama view but you can get other great views right below for free. You will cross this off your list visiting the Castle district

Miraculously beautiful, both the building and the view from here to Pest. I was impressed by the Fisherman's Bastion and the Mathias church. Both are well located on the Buda side. From the Fisherman's Bastion you can also have an amazing view to Pest ( Pest is The flat city and Buda is there where the hills/ mountains are)A good guide will tell his story with passion and take you back to the past. You got to know the story of the Bastion and the Matthias church. Well let me say it this way, if you are curious about history and historical buildings, than Budapest is the place to be. But then again you need a GOOD, passionate guide.I had this guide from Pest of “The original Budapest Scooter Tour”. The guide name is Andras.
nice views. a very nice area to walk around in which has wonderful views over the Danube, and over the Castle area.

fairy tale bastion. Must see place in Budapest, crowded but very beautiful. you can walk there from Buda castle, passing the Mattias church. good place for rest and to take 1-2 glases of mulled wine :)

Wonderful place to visit. The Fishermen's Bastion is ideal for a break and a nice view over Budapest. Beautiful buildings, especially the church, makes it a nice spot to take pictures and to spend a sunny afternoon 'on top' of the city.

Amazing Views of the City. We didn't have much time in the city so wandered up here not really knowing what to expect.
The sun was just setting and the views over the river were simply stunning!
Beautiful 'fairy tale architecture'. We went during the day when it was very busy and then at night. In the night it is a lot calmer with beautiful views of Budapest lit up.

Romantic. We went at sundown and it's beautiful.
I think during the day you have to pay a fee for visiting.
You can see all the city, there is Starbucks at one corner and there is a beautiful restaurant from were you can eat and have a view of the Danube, but you need a reservation because it's full.
Amazing structure.. A must see if staying in Budapest as this is a very famous structure with plenty of other buildings to see in the area as well.
Best place in the city. I have been there early in the afternoon, late in the evening and night. The place is amazing. It is like living in a fairy tale. The view is really breath taking.

What a view.. Make sure you have a good pair of walking shoes on. Walk to it if you are able as there is so much more to see. Once there the view is breath taking. The street can become busy but there is plenty room. You can still get up close to the walls with out having to pay to get up unside the ramparts.

Go at night . Great views overlooking the Danube and towards Pest. Very cheap and definitely worth it. Try to visit during night for an exceptional view of the parliament building lit up. Also a place to grab great photos of your trip .
I wouldn't pay to go up.. Much better to pay to go up the tower of St Matthias Church than for this. Not high enough to get a much different view.

Amazing neighborhood with fantastic views!. Amazing... We toured here in the pouring rain. Went into a few very interesting shops that were attended by very nice folks. Even found the House of Houdini!The views from the Fishermans Bastion were delightful even in the rain! So the next day we returned in the sunshine and walked to the castle and hiked there from the Danube River port... Good 30 minute walk. Also see St Mathias church.

Favourite thing in Budapest. The fishermans bastion is a must see. The bastion is very beautiful and very different from anything I've seen. The towers of the bastion look like sea shells. Its stunning and the views over Budapest (particularly Pest) are great. Must see attraction for sure.

A beautiful building with good free access. Had a wonderful walk up to this impressive building which did not cost anything. Beautiful gardens. Could use funicular but well worth exploring on foot as covers a huge area.

Beautiful view of the Budapest from the bastion.. Nominal fee to walk on Fisherman's Bastion. Not a lot to see regarding the Bastion itself, but a beautiful view of the city and immediately adjacent to Matthias Church.

Spectacular View - Why do I need a ticket. There is no better view of the Danube and Pest. And it's location near St. Matthias makes it very desirable from a tourist point of view. But why I need a ticket baffles me.

Beautiful Restoration. The towers, walkways and stairs have been cleaned and restored as can be seen in the photo attached. Wonderful views of Pest from the Buda side of the Danube. Close to shops, restaurants, churches all at the top of the hill.

Wonderful views to the Parliament . The view to the Parliament house are spectacular from this place specially during the night when the Parliament house is illuminated, during the summers there are restaurants set up here which is both annoying and nice. Annoying as you have to pay to get in and nice if you want to have your coffee looking at the Parliament house and the city from here.

Excellent place to visit for magnificent views across to Pest. Great place to spend a couple of hours walking round and stopping for a drink/lunch. Walked up the steps rather than wait in the queue for the funicular. Extremely picturesque at the top and almost disney-ish with the ramparts/turrets. Great views from the restaurants - well worth stopping for a drink or something to eat. Walked back to Pest via Margit bridge, Margit island.
What a view. One of the best spots to have a panoramic view of the Danube and all the architecture treasures built around it.
You can see the whole city from here!. Beautiful place, near St. Istvan church, (1,000 year old) the first king of Hungary who was coronated there. Just renovated and totally beautiful.
Lovely view.... The Bastion offers you a marvellous view of the whole city, Danube and bridges included. Lots of tourists in summer, obviously but do not let that deter you.

Awesome Views. The fischermen bastion is one of the town's most visited landmark. Built in the late 19th century in neoramtic style the bastion is definitely worth a visit. The views from up there are really amazing. You can either take some sort of cog railway to get up there or just go by feet. In the vicinity you find a couple of churches (like St. Matthias) and, built on the base wall of an old monastery in the 1970s, the Hilton Hotel. Which, from my point of view, doesn't fit in there very well and fazes the harmony of the whole ensemble a bit.
Rip off. It should be free of charge. It seemed like a rip off to pay any price for some views of the city. Would not recommend as even better view can be seen from elsewhere.
Ok. I was not really impressed. You can, however have a nice view from here. I noticed that after 7PM people could enter for free, I wish I knew that before I payed.

Good views from Fishermans Bastion, Budapest. We went to visit this site together with our visit to Buda castle. Its views are nice and pleasure is somewhat dampened by the commercial establishments that have set up on the more scenic/strategic viewpoints...they charge money for viewing from there whereas the other points are free.
A must see!. Beautiful location overlooking the Danube River and Budapest. Great place for photographers and weddings. Little shops not far away.

Beautiful architecture and view of the Danube. The Bastion is an arched walkway with turrets behind Matthias Church. It's a great place to take photos and to enjoy the view. There is also a wide set of stairs that goes down to the Chain bridge.
Very scenic and beautiful place. Visited as part of a walking tour, and visited the restaurants nearby. Good views over the danube and the city walls

Very nice. It's the best place in Budapest I loved it.
Best for taking photos from top .
You can see the river from it.

Fine but not impressive. Fine view .. but a little short .. the ticket also includes the church.. and the church is UNIK.......
♡♡♡♡

Estunning views. We took the bus to just below the castle and walked the short distance to Fisherman's Bastion. The views over Budapest were amazing - maybe it helped that the sun was shining! It was a lovely place to relax for a while and admire the Danube winding through the city. There was a restaurant on the walls, but they only serve at certain times, we found it difficult to have a snack type lunch close by. However the place itself more than made up for this.

Beautiful Views . Our visit to the Fisherman's Bastion was on a very hot day. The views are wonderful and the whole complex on top of the Castle Hill is an experience of to be missed. We actually went back two days running. Accessing the castle hill can be confusing but we simply caught the number 16 bus from the Pest side of the river. There are other options but we didn't like the queues at the Funicular Railway and were unable to climb the steps to the top.
Breathtaking. A great place to see the city - views are breathtaking, and photo opportunities are everywhere. Don't miss this sight if you are in Budapest.

Another very historical place. We caught the public bus up to Fishermans Bastion which was an experience in itself. It was a number 16 and it was jammed packed with people. I could have taken my feet off the floor and remained standing it was that crowded!!! Once at the Bastion lots of interesting buildings and some magnificent views of the city.
Beautiful views especially at night. This place is so charming - totally different by night as you get to see all the buildings around it illuminated plus it's free in the evening.

Nice view but not worth the fee. Fisherman's Bastion is right next to St. Matthias Church. We wanted from the Buda Castle to the Fisherman's Bastion. It is about a 10 mins easy walk from the Buda Castle.We did not pay the entrance fee to go up the steps so cannot comment on the views from there. But we get a fantastic view of the parliament and the river when you are getting down the steps to walk towards the river.

Must see in Budapest. This where most the photos you see of the Parliament buildings from high were taken. As well as the stunning Pest city views. It can be crowded but the Bastion itself is amazing and worth the crowds.

Crowds abound on Sundays. Our river cruise included a tour of Buda which means water. The opposite side of the Danube is called Pest. Anyway, we were at this location on a Sunday morning. Throngs of crowds made our visit less enjoyable. Nonetheless, it was still a great site to visit.

Beautiful for watching the sunset. I love this place, I came here 3 times during my stay in Budapest.The first time I went, it was during the day, it was hot and uncomfortable and full of tourists trying to get a good picture of the view (which was a beautiful view, but it's hard to take pictures when everyone else is). Also, it cost money to go to the very top of the Fisherman's Bastion for an even better view (so I didn't go).The next two times, I went at around 7pm. It was significantly less crowded, and I was able to see Budapest in the day, at sunset and at night. It's absolutely gorgeous. Seeing the city light up, and seeing the shiny Parliament house from the Fishermans Bastion at night was really cool. Since there were a lot less people, I was able to get much better pictures. It was also a lot quieter, which was nice. The cherry on top was that it didnt cost me any money to go to the top of the Fisherman's Bastion this time (for the best view), nobody was checking tickets at night time so everyone just walked right through the barrier.After the sun set, there was a man both nights playing the most beautiful violin music. Admiring the view with the violin music in the background was really lovely.I'd definitely recommend this place but don't go in the afternoon when everyone else is there. Wait for the hour before sunset, so you can get the most out of your trip (less people, quieter, no need to pay for a ticket to the top level, more epic views etc)
New profile picture opportunity!. Endless amounts of photos were taken here, with so many silly poses - basically just ruining the view! Really pretty place that is worth the walk to get to!

Stunning views of the city!!. The Fisherman’s Bastion hands down was my favourite when it came to seeing the breathtaking sights of Budapest. We, like most people went a little crazy taking pictures as were done sighing over the views of the city and lovely Danube. While most of its balconies and cloisters are free of charge there was a certain higher section that was chargeable as far as I remember.Watching the sunset was soo romantic unfortunately I was only there with my best friend. The Fisherman’s Bastion is probably the best place to go to if you want to see the nicest UNESCO World Heritage site in Hungary, namely the river Danube with its promenade, views, the (Szechenyi) Chain Bridge, the Hungarian Parliament, the Castle Hill, the Gresham Palace, etc. all in one fascinating panoramic view.The breathtaking beauty makes you realize why Budapest is often mentioned as the ‘Pearl of the Danube’.We even found some amazing little stores at the top selling beautiful artefacts and crochet merchandise.

Unbelievable views of the Pest side of the city.. This top ten tourist site is easily accessible by foot. There are ramps and steps a bit to the left or to the right of the Funicular. You might just see some daring Hungarians climb up the steep grassy hillside. They risk damaged ankles and knees, but gain a sense of accomplishment for conquering the climb. Once you are on top, follow the crowds to the gathering spots for both locals and tourists. Takes a moment a listen to the many languages you hear. How many can you identify? The views are magnificent. You d not have to pay for the slightly higher vantage point to have a spectacular view. There is good shopping, and good eating in the nearby shops. The famous Holy Trinity, plague column is in the syare with the Fisherman's Bastion. You could probably spend two hours on the top of Castle Hill, all for free. There is so much to see. Make sure that you wander around to the hilton and view the ancient ruins outside the hotel.

Nice view, but not worth the price. The view from the current version of the Fisherman's Bastion (this one is a replica from the original) is beautiful - but so are the views from several other free spots at the Castle Hill. No need to pay the entrance fee to the Fisherman's Bastion...

One of the best View of Budapest. Its one of the best place to see the great view of the Budapest, The Danube river and the Parliament. Well worth the cost. Together with the Mathias Church, its nicely maintained, clean and beautiful.

Good view, but don't pay for admission.. This overhyped tourist attraction is actually a reproduction of the original, and is populated by multiple restaurants along with hordes of tourists. There is an admission price to allow access to all parts of the bastion, but the best advice we got was to avoid paying it, as you can simply walk along the inside until reaching the far end to the left (about 100 feet) to access a stairway that leads you to a perfect and impressive viewing area of the Pest side of the city. We walked over from the Buda side, then up well constructed stairways to the top of this hilly area to see other sights first, but those uninterested in the climb can simply access the area by the tram.
Great view of the city. Great view of the city, no ticket for entrance, a beautiful cafe inside the monument. Visited after going to the caste

Beautiful views . I visited the Castle District today and thoroughly enjoyed the story of, beauty of, and view from Fisherman's Bastion. Everything about the area is enjoyable. There are so many things to see and do within the few blocks. If you love beautiful scenery, architecture, shopping, religious icons, and/or history you can not go wrong visiting this location. If you don't speak or read Hungarian I would recommend doing it as part of a tour group so you can hear the stories about the buildings and people.
excellent views. worth visiting. I'm not sure if it is free, but we were during a festival and we weren't charged anything, so if you have a chance to visit just do it.
Nice!. Great view and nice to do with kids  It costs 800fl per person.  Next to the church.  Their is one ticket office but there is no combined ticket.
Happy snaps. Excellent vantage point for photos over the river and Parliment house. Lots of history and quaint little cafes close by
Stunning as it always was. Having spent my childhood living near and visiting regularly it is still as magical as it ever was.The entire area in Castle Hill is just stunning and a must see!

Must be seen. Beautiful site. The interior of the Church has to be seen. Breathtaking.We had visited on and earlier trip but hadn't been inside the Church.The views out along the river are worth the walk either up the hill or climb the steps from the bottom.
Just goreous!. Don't miss this, it is a must see, must do place during your visit. Located neer the Mathias Kirche and the Castle of Buda.
Not interesting. Did not find it exciting at all. visited during Nov not many tourists so was able to view it hassle free

Stunning views, architecture, and more. Sort of a tourist trap area. However, the Bastion has fantastic architecture and views, and close to other nearby landmarks.
Consider walking up the hill if you can instead of the funicular, and get some extra exercise and spectacular views of the city and river. Pack some water, snacks and your camera/phone.
Good view of Pest. This vantage point gives you a good view of Pest from above. The statue is interesting but the view is the thing.

Lovely fairy tale-like architecture.. On the top of Castle Hill a genius built a gem, that gives this city most of its charm.
Part of the Bastion is covered by restaurants grounds, other part by (mostly Asian :-) ) tourists, queuing to get a good photo. Best time of day to visit? Just before sunset.
Historical. Interesting name to be called Fisherman's Bastion since it is about 2 miles from the Danube River, however this was the Fisherman's Guild area to protect against an invasion

Amazing view. Beautiful view, rode bikes up here but the walk is not too bad. Definitely worth a visit. Couple nice buskers up here and ice creams that are pretty reasonably priced in comparison to other touristy spots in Europe.

Superb views across Budapest. The Bastion is a fortification with turrets that affords a great view across Budapest (notably the Parliament building and bridges) from the Buda side. Expect large crowds with cameras jostling for prime position to get a photo. We visited as part of a coach tour and had to have timed tickets not only for the Bastion but also the coach as there is no coach parking and waiting is strictly regulated. If you are on foot, there is a funicular (expect long queues on a nice day) from the riverside up the very steep hill to the Bastion and town. There is also Matthias Church, which we didn't have time to visit but others said it was very pretty.

It's a nice area but to get the best views you have to pay.. You have to pay to get the best views but not much better than where we stood. It's in the castle area which is well kept. Small shops and restaurants round about.
Terrific. We had a wonderful 4days in Budapest with many visits to this wonderful city's attractions the views from the Fishermans bastion are superb
Sightseeing with family from Australia. The view from the top is fantastic. Great way to see the city side of Budapest. On a clear day you get a really good view of Parliament House.

Great views, but so so busy.... Worth the hike to get the views, but shoulder to shoulder tourists. One of those things you have to cross off the bucket list, but you really only have to go once.
Clean, well maintained.
Follow the visit with a hike through the castle district and take a walk on the boardwalk that overlooks Buda. That was more enjoyable.
Great views of Budapest. This is a great place to get a good overview of Budapest but it is very crowded. Shops while "colourful" generally tourist traps.

Beautiful Bastion. Beautifull Bastion that no one must miss to visit whil in Budapest
We was unlucky that at cathedral there there was a wedding ceremony and we wasent allowed in

Stunning views and history throughout. When you visit Budapest there is the Buda and the Pest sides. Of course both need to be explored but do start with the old Buda part and climb up to the Fisherman's Bastion. Besides walking the ramparts do go inside the Matthias Church where you will be so pleasantly surprised by the interior. It truly is beautiful.

Fairy Tale setting. Spectacular architecture and magnificent views will delight you on the Buda side of the river. You can walk around and there are spots were you will have a fantastic view of The Parliament building across the river. Also, this is a great place to see the lights of the Pest side come up at night.
Interesting viewpoint. Worth a visit. Frequently in use for weddings downstairs. You have to pay to reach the top level but everyone we spoke to said the view for free was just as good.
Lovely views across the city. Nice area of the city on the Buda side, with wonderful views across the river to the Pest side. Took a walk across to Fisherman's Bastion through the palace grounds.

Skip it. Great view but that's all there is to it. Not worth the price of admission in my mind.
If you're still interested, you can buy the tickets right next to it at the same time as you're buying your admission to Matthias Church.

Beautiful views and great to visit. If you're in Budapest you have to come up here! There are great views of parliament and the centre of town. There is also a cafe where you can have drinks looking out of the Bastion (Panorama), unsurprisingly a little over-priced but what do you expect. We didn't eat here hence no review...

Stunning!. Absolutely loved this place, stunning buildings and little places to eat along the way.
There's a cute little bar/restaurant just outside the Fisherman's Bastion with an outdoor area but there's also another restaurant within that's got some fantastic views.
The castle is right next to the Bastion.
Magnificent . Excellent, lovely day out sightseeing, you must see this place to truly grasp it's magnificence. Definitely spend a day in Buda and visit this great piece of history.

You go there for the view.. First of all it is nice historical venue. But it is the panorama over Pest, which makes it really special. If you are there, visit the Matthias Church. If you get hungry there is the Miro Cafe just a few hundreds meter from the square. Excellent Hungarian and international dishes.

Great view. Nice architecture. We walked around and took on all the sights. We did not pay to get on top and we do not think those we missed anything. There is an opportunity to eat at a restaurant overlooking the whole thing and the Danube

Fun place to wander around, day and night. This place is located next to Matthias Church and the famous Hilton Hotel. It is not ancient, having been built in 1896 and is sort of a "fantasy bastion". It is well worth a visit and you can get gorgeous photos of the Pest side of Budapest from here (including the Danube and the beautiful Parliament Building). Some parts of the bastion cost money to visit but you can get many great views with out paying to go into those sections. You can also walk down stairs from the bastion and look back up at it for great photos. Beautiful views at night, too, as it is lit up. Also next to it is a gorgeous bronze statue of St. Istvan, Hungary's first Christian Kiing

Nice panoramic view of the city. Like the guidebooks say, don't pay to go all the way up and walk around -- just as spectacular views from a few feet below. Really nice views of the Danube, Parliament. Worth a visit!
Great views. Not much to do here except get the best views of Budapest. Really relaxing to spend a half hour on top of the world. This is a must see in Budapest

Night times the right time. We went during the day when you have to pay and it was very busy. We didn't go up on the ramparts as you can see the view from other areas below them for free. We went back at night when it's free, much less busy and you have the same amazing view over the city in the night. Very romantic!
Great view. Must see in Budapest. Sure, it's touristy but what place like this in any other major city isn't? Wait for a window table at the little restaurant and sip a dupla with a view!

Lovely place. A lovely place for one to take in the view of the city with the stunning Matthias Church right next to it. Would have been better if there wasn't an 'entrance fee' (not sure how much) for just a few steps higher for views of the city - there are many locations around the city for great view of Budapest without fees :)
Great views. A section of stone rampart, that allows great views across the Danube to Parliament etc, as well as back on the square and St Matthias, with its gorgeous roof.

Great view. been there during Chinese New Year 2016, amazed by their structural building, splendid view all over Budapest city. Not forgetting when I was there, there's one violinist playing while walking..i feel like in a movie because the feeling is so so lovely! will definitely go there again!
good view. Good view but lots of prices which would provide the best views. but there are many good views for no extra fee. Be wry of transport a there are few buses. Its chilly in the winter to.
Wonderful view. Well worth doing as view is fabulous. You have to queue for a ticket. Not expensive. Doesn't take long to do.

Picturesque panorama. The panorama is amazing from here. You can see the river Danube with its beautiful buildings. The Bastion is just opposite to the Parliament. The entry is free and I recommend to come here early to avoid the crowds.
Linda vista . Really close to the castle, this place offers a great view from the city, specially the river and parliament. The neighborhood is lovely as well.

One of Budapest's significant landmark. Part of the UNESCO WORLD HERITAGE SITES in the Castle area. A Romanesque building constructed in the 19th century. The views of the Danube are stunning. Look downon the magnificent differen styles of bridges and all arounc, photo oppottunities which you must miss. There is a small charge to walk across but well worth it. Make sure your camera is fully charged as you take so many snaps. Trust me.

Amazing views. There is a lot of amazing views if you walk up you see a lot there is a mono rail to but the line to get on it is far far too busy. The views are breath taking, there a toilets close by, you have to pay to use. There are also a Starbucks too to sit and rest.
Beautiful view of Danube. While this place is nice and old, the view of Danube is excellent from this place. Be ready to walk her....not so long though.

My number 1 in Buda. Almost nothing is old or historic in Budapest. And in the list of the new monuments is the Bastion number one. It seems you are a part of a Disney movie when you are in front of it. Beautiful system of buildings with an amazing view to Parliament.
Beautiful! . Go there with good walking shoes, it is worth walking all around. The arcs are amazing. The view to the city is breathtaking.
Nice view, but pricey.. A paywall for a better view, nothing more, and with slow service, too. I recommend going to Gellert hill instead.

Good views, very busy!. Coming up here is a must if you visit Budapest. You get great views of the parliament building on the other side of the Danube. It is right next to Matthias Church Gets very busy in the afternoon. You can pay to go on the walk way, you get a slightly better view and there are less people to get in the way of your photos

Beautiful surroundings. This area of Budapest is beautiful and well worth a stroll and visit but why they are now making people pay to walk on top of the Bastion is beyond me! I certainly would not pay as you get the lovely views through the gaps in the bottom of the Bastion. That is very disappointing as it feels a rip off but the Bastion itself is a must visit for anyone visiting Budapest.

Beautiful. Beautiful views and atmosphere to eat a picnic etc. only down side was that the town peddlers trying to sell stuff literally set up in the areas with best views blocking pictures or requiring you to get harassed. More annoying than anything. Worth the trip up the hill!

Outstanding not to be missed. This is a magnificent place above the Budapest castle overlooking the DanubeTicets easy to purchase when you get off bus 16, it takes you right there. You get a ticket for the Fisherman's Bastion and the beautiful Saint Mattias CathedralThen you walk down to the castle, you can not go in.At the edge of the castle there is a flight of steps which take you down the hill and you can catch bus 16 again, or walk over the chain bridge.There has been much comment about transport in Budapest and how hard it is to get up to the Bastion.We are senior independent travellers and was no trouble We also purchased 10 ticket books and used metro, you can go to all sights on metro

Great view of the city!. Climb up the small bump they call mountain. Past Buda castle is the fishermans bastion. Lovely area to take pics with a great view of the chain bridge, cathedral and all of Pest.
Great view!. The view is great, the entry tocket is equivalent to about 3, - €. One can only view the half of the building since the other half is a restaurant.

Great views!. The Fisherman's Bastion is located on a hill, so you can get a lot of cool pictures of the Pest side of Budapest. The architecture is amazing. The problem is you have to pay to get to the upper level of the wall, which I think is not necessary. I would've like to go there, but decided not to pay the 850 ft. fee. The whole area is really nice too, so you have to go even if you are visiting only one day!

Family trip. As we visited Budapest we decided to see everything within the 2 weeks what we spent over there.This is a lovely city with hundreds of beautiful historical buildings, places such as this place.Wonderful view, nice place really!

Incredible view, totally worth the climb. Not only do you get to see the gorgeous Matthias Church, built in the late 14th century, you also have an outstanding view of the Danube, the parliament building and the bridges, we were lucky enough to go on a night of the full moon... Unforgettable

Stunning for sunset, take your own water. Beautiful views across the city. We went around 20:00 and didnt have to pay for a good view point. Take your own water as you will need it after the steep climb to get up there, and also it cost 1110 HUF for a bottle! Standard price for water elsewhere in Budapest is around 350 - if that!
Enjoy
Beautiful views!. Beautiful location for awesome views! Worth the trip up hill - take the bus - makes it much easier and cheaper.

One of the cities hearts . Beautiful and the view is incredible ! There was a wedding on there when I was there so I got to enjoy all the live music too. You can pay to walk on tower but but view is the same. Also a 3D theatre where you can watch a history movie of it. Better to spend money exploring the labyrinth closer to the castle. The view and the statues are so amazing! An absolute must see and so accessible. Take the number 16 bus, walk or the funicular.
