Romance! . Lots of nice streets with a nice overview of the city. There are many restaurants and bars. I would recommend a walk around the bastion, to see the city from many angles.

Marvellous construction and view!. Firstly the Fisherman's Bastion itself is a stunning construction, where you can imagine how soldiers in the past guarded the city behind the walls and from the lookouts. Also, and what actually mesmerises more tourists is the view to the Danube. From here, you can have see most of the icons of the Hungarian capital, ranging from the Parliament to the Chain Bridge. In fact, the view from here is much more magnificent than that from Buda Castle as the latter's proximity to the Chain Bridge limits the view it offers. One transport tip: If you don't want to queue for the funicular or walk uphill to the castle area, take bus no.16 from Deák Ferenc tér, which takes you across the river and uphill.
Worth a visit. We did not spend too long here, however it is definitely worth visiting as it is beautiful! Gorgeous architecture - you feel like you are wondering around a fairy tale castle!

Nice place near the Buda castle. You can visit the Fisherman s Bastion on your way to Buda castleIt s not free of charge even though it s just a wall but it s worth itYou have a great panorama over the Danube and Budapest

Great view . This is such a great spot to get a good view of the city. It will be quite crowded during the day. I came up here several times and the best time was at night during a light storm. No other people around and the vantage point gives you a great view to watch a storm roll over all that flat land.As well as seeing the city you will also be right next to the church which is a great sight also. The bastion was built to frame the church but it is quite impressive and beautiful on it's own.

Go to tower level where there is open terrace & drinks. We were at tower level due to business private event. So cafe served us free flow of drinks & cheese snacks (Budapest popular?). So wonderful to sit at open terrace with great view & company.

its a good hike. we ask people how to get there and they tell as you just need to walk and hike to it ,there is a bus to the place but we didn't bother to find out how ,it takes 20 mns to get there .but ones you there you can see a nice view of Budapest with the majestic Danube dividing Buda and Pest

Beautiful Relic with an Amazing View. However.... I thought the Fisherman's Bastion was very good. It is a beautiful structure in its own right and offers a nice view of Budapest. However, you do have to pay to go up certain parts while it is free to go up another part. As this isn't clearly indicated, I ended up paying to get the same view on the same structure that I would've gotten for free. All in all this is a MUST SEE in Budapest, but DON'T PAY TO GO UP.

Special building with stunning views. Can be reached by car until Paid parking is very close to to the site, a short walk from ParliamentIt is highly recommended to come up to a lovely cafe that overlooking the Danube

Awesome city views especially in evening !. We visited this place in evening and there was a huge crowd as it is the perfect place for capturing the beautifully lit city once all the monuments are lit up. Since this is on slight altitude in buda you can see Danube in the setting sun and the whole of pest along its bank. There is the church and wonderful eatery very close by.
Beautiful old village. This is a have to when in Budapest. It is worth the climb..;) its beautiful old, small village on the top of a rock with a gordous view of Budapest.
Views. it is worth going up there to have a nice view of Pest and Parliament and enjoy the serenity and tranquility of Buda
Beautiful place with a beautiful views!. The buildings are well main, clean and beautiful. This place is a must to visit when you're im Budapest. Lovely view from the top!
Nice view. Breathtaking views of Budapest overlooking the Parliament, Chain Bridge, and the river. Lots of photo opportunities.
YOU MUST GO AND SEE. The best great panoramic view of Budapest. Don't miss Fisherman's Bastion , with church, monuments and old buildings.

Great View worth the walk.. The church and area offer much for the visitor, but go early as it does get very busy. Take the time walk around and also the squares and shops nearby. Toliet is in the soveneir shop.

Awesome view!. We walked here from Margaret Island and we thought that the upclimb never stops! But after arriving to the top, view was absolutely great. There were loooots and lots of tourists so we needed to use our elbows to get to the windows to see the view. Some people even had courage to sit by the edge of the wall, hanging their legs out.Recommend for everyone visiting Budapest.
Highlight of my trip. Spend some time while you are there and not just mark it off your list. Take in the atmosphere, the bastion, the church - it is breathtaking.
Great views. This is always very busy as all the tour parties pass through here so you may have to wait a while to find a spot to take photos of Pest across the river.
Great view even on a rainy day. Excellent views, beautiful buildings. Caught the bus up and walked around the area on a rainy day but still spectacular
Great view. Wort the visit, great panoramic view of Budapest .. Don't miss it, worth the drive .. There are other points to see the city don't miss this one

Beautiful historic location you must see. Beautiful old stucure over looking the Buda side of Budapest. Great view of the city in what is the old town area of Pest.No trip to Budapest is complete without a visit to the Fishermans Bastion
Blue hour . Come back around 8 pm, guards leave and you can capture the view for free. Amazing place to photograph!

To many visitors but with a reason. Absolutely must see. It's a real beauty! You can't miss this place. It is the biggest crowd of tourist in all of the Buda there with a good reason. It's romantic, it's breathtaking, it's real beauty! You can't stop trying to see all of the details of the Bastion, looking through many groups and tourists so, in one moment, you should also think about the rest of your group because it's really easy to loose them because you really can't stop to enjoy in this romantic sight.
One of the best view . When you wake up very early you can see the sunrise. I think this program can makes a very good memory from Budapest. Try it and you will like it.
Charming and with a great view!. Beautiful view and buildings! Nice little walk up from the danube and entrance is free! Would definitely recommend this!

Great Views. Just a really pretty place with great views over the city and the beautiful Matthais church next door. And it's free (no need to pay to go to the top)! Some great photo opportunities; our favourite location in Budapest and up there with some of the most unique places to visit in European cities (nice to see something a bit different to all the mainstream Europe city sites).

Nice views; Good place to start your visit to Budapest. There are great views of the city from here, and you can figure out how the city is laid out while taking photos. The nearby cathedral is pretty spectacular from the outside too. It's beter, of course, if you when the weather is good.
Go in the evening to avoid paying entrance. Not only is the sunset over Budapest a wonderful sight, but for our case, noone was there to control the entrance after 8 pm.

Very nice site on a beautiful day. From the bastion you get a very nice view over the entire city, especially when the weather is nice. A place with a lot of unrestored building; very beautiful. However, it is very touristic, so expect a lot of people when you go up there.

Beautiful photo opportunities. We visited this area as part of a tour group. Our bus stopped on the way up for a wonderful photo of the buildings from below. The view of the river and city buildings from the location is wonderful and costs nothing just to be there. We didn't pay to do into the beautiful St Matthias church, nor the tower, just admired the view and ambience of the area and shops. We did purchase a delightful glass framed copy of Klimts kiss form a little shop hidden up an alley - great find!
Great views. Don't pay to go to the upper level; the views you get for free are just as good. It's going to be very crowded on a nice day but it's worth it for the views.
Nice view. There are no signs to find the place. The city view is fantastic. A bit crowded but one can find a quiet spot.

Special and Unique. Fisherman's Bastion offers a smaller and more intimate opportunity to get some fantastic views over Pest. Best times to visit are probably morning or late evening to avoid the crowds and to catch the sun rising or going down. A great place to take some photos of the city as well. The structure itself is beautiful both inside and out and complements the nearby Matthias Church and Buda Castle

Now mostly rented to cafes. Disappointing that most areas now rented to cafes so is roped off. Need a ticket to go on upper level and only takes local currency or credit card. Upper level not worth the hassle.
Renovated for tourists. Renovated for tourists, not much to do but the view is fantastic. if you want to claim on the bastion you have to pay - tourist trap

Perfect view. I take the hop on hop off buses during all my vacation to Budapest (i have only 2 days there), with a valid ticket for 2 days (extra discount for students)
The castle is free to see it outside, with this magical image.
And of course it has amazing view to Danube and to the whole city.
1000% to go
Beautiful area. Another must see area of Budapest. Beautiful architecte and great views over the parliament and the city. We didn't pay to enter the tower, so cannot comment

Loved this area of Budapest. Loved this area of Budapest, such a pretty view as the sun goes down over the Danube river. The view from here is a million dollar one, check it out, have an ice cream and watch the view ;-) Do take a camera.
Great view without paying if you look around. There are views by the cafe where artists paint, no need to pay. The shops and neighborhood are really lovely.

Well Worth The Hike. Amazing views of the city await you if you climb up to Castle Hill. We went in the evening and got some great photos. Once you get here, you can tour St. Matthias, and you are steps away from shops and cafes.

Must visit there!. You can take bus number 16 from deak ference ter straight there! It a an amazing place, seems like a fairytale!!! The best place I visited in budapest!! You visit there for free by the way :)

Beautiful, must visit. My second visit to Budapest and made sure to return here to see this fairytale-like 'castle'. One of my favourite structures around Europe, and the bar at the top of one turret is perfect for looking out onto the river and Parliament etc. Its a shame you can't easily get the whole building in photos, but wandering along the wall it definitely feels a bit Disney-esque (which I love!). A must-see in Budapest, even if just for half an hour.

Super picture backdrop, if you don't mind others in it too!. It is definitely cool and with great views of the city. It is VERY crowded. We enjoyed seeing brides getting their wedding photos taken, and the world walk by!

A small town hiden inside a huge and beatifull city. That's like a small town with a couple of streets, church, amazing builldings and really beatifull and good views of Budapest in the top of the city
beautiful. This is one of things, that you definitely must see in Budapest.It's good to see it at the evening where there are less tourists.

Una vista espectacular!. Don't miss this views during the day, but mostly at sunset. Enjoy the many musicians who love to show off their talents on this gorgeous spot, we danced to a beautiful waltz and watched a couple dance a tango while blessed by a full moon.
do not pay to get through the gates. it is free to enter but to get to the upper level costs money. if one wants to see budapest from a higher viewpoint go to the citadel, thats free.
Beautiful views. A must see area of Budapest. It is a beautiful architectural area and gives great views over the city
Crouded. A nice attraction but extremely crouded from early morning till late evening. Well positioned in the Castle District overlooking the Danube
Uber-fantastic views !. A visit to the Fisherman's Bastion is a MUST when visiting Budapest, as it has the best views of this charming city. The architecture is beautiful and the views are priceless.
Great roof. This is a perfectly located church. you will love the details of paterns of the building. The view is so good from the balcony in fronf of it.
best view of budapest. another must see attraction in budapest. you can overlook budapest. I went there both during the day and at night.
City panorama. After you cross the Chain Bridge you can see the Bastion on the right, and you can imagine how great the city will look from that height.
Picturesque. A great focal point in visiting this area of Buda. I was impressed by how picturesque the buildings and setting was with great views, too.

Simply Beautiful!. I had high expectations of Fisherman's Bastion and I was not disappointed! The architecture is absolutely beautiful and very picturesque. I felt like I was in a fairytale walking up the pretty spiral staircases and observing the unobstructed skyline of Budapest. My only recommendation would be to visit this on a cooler day as it is a long steep walk to the top (however, once you have reached the top there is plenty of ice-cream and jaw-dropping views and scenery to make up for the strenuous climb!)

Its cool, but dont waste you money. The view on top of the Bastion is the same as that on the "non-elevated" free-of-charge section of the Bastion.
We got a tip from our tour guide, that you sould visit in the evening. The view is more spectacular. Especially after 20:00, when the guards go home and you dont have to pay to walk on the Bastion wall.
Fisherman's. One of the best view in tonw. It is a must once in Budapest. One tower can be visited withuot to pay.

Stunning views. One of the point to see when you're in Budapest.You have the Bastion which looks like from a medieval city with stunning views across the Danube and Parliament especially in the evening.Great to walk through there and you can discver many beautiful places.You can also choose to have a lunch/dinner with a view as there is a restaurant on the edge of the Bastion
Beautiful views of Budapest. The views were amazing from the Fisherman's Bastion. The area was really nice to walk around. There was an outside cafe that had the best strawberry lemonade.

Beautiful, But Don't Pay to Enter. The views of both the back of Matthias Church and over the city were fantastic, but you don't need to pay extra to see this sight. You can get almost the same views from the terrace or little cafe (you get to walk up one flight of stairs - not worth the extra fee). The architecture of the Bastion is worth a look as well, but like I said be wise and only buy a ticket for the interior of Matthias Church.

Fabulous views.. It is well worth the walk up the steep hill for the fabulous views. There is the funicular for those not wanting to walk. The view of the parliament building is excellent as well as the Chain bridge. The architecture is stunning. Matthias church is beside it, I didn't go inside, but it is architecturally beautiful to look at and somewhere I will visit another time.

A great afternoon visit. In the afternoon you won't be bothered by the sun that stands opposite the bastion in the morning, and the view is fantastic. Try a lemonade in the cafe in the bastion, and view a 15 minute presentation of the history of Budapest. You haven't been to Budapest if you haven't been here.
Lovely views at night. Wander along the ramparts at night and view Pest from the other side. The evening we were there a violinist played.

The colourful architecture. Unusual architecture very colourful roofs.The labour for its construction was provided by fishermen of the area.One has to climb many stairs to get to the top thus not very conducive for old and infirm.Parking is a problem.The view from the top is panoramic
Excellent. We visited in the afternoon. Provides a nice panaromic view of Budapest city, Danube river, Parlament Building and others. Recommend.
Worth a visit just for the view. Nice place with excellent views of the city. Beautiful setting and well worth the walk to get here. One of the must see places in budapest.

Mesmerising views of the city!. Take the bus to Buda Castle and walk over to Fisherman's Bastion. There you will have the chance to witness spectacular views of the city! Would recommend to dine at any of the restaurants there for a relaxed evening!

Fairy tale setting with spectacular views. The setting is taken out of a fairytale. If it isn't medieval, it sure looks like it. Love the way it perches on the edge of the bluff. The cafe that was open was an open air arcade between the fountain square and the overlook to the Pest side. Great view of the Danube, Parliament, Szechenyi Bridge, etc. Every tour group in the world stops here, so you will enjoy the people watching. Highly recommend just stopping in for a glass of wine or beer and just taking it all in. There is a Starbucks nearby but it doesn't have the spectacular views. If you hike up the back castle stairs to get there instead of taking the funicular, you will definitely want to stop in at the cafe.

Great location for photos. Great for panoramic views of Budapest. If you are in to photography, you will appreciate this vantage point. Evenings are probably best as there is better access to the edge. Take a wide angle lens - you'll get great use from it.

Amazing location. It was one of my favourite places to be. The square market and the small church and the hill and the sculptures and the openness is amazing. I wish there were guides around so we can pay for a tour but oh well. We discovered ourselves and took great pictures.

Nice, but not exceptional. This is a nice place, but nothing particularly special. It does offer grand views of Parliament and the Pest side of the river. That, more than anything makes the visit worthwhile. Note also, that this sight places you very near the Hospital in the Rock (a must see), as well as Matthias Church.
Good view. Not much to this & much you cannot actually visit or walk round as they are taken up by restaurant & cafe. You do get a good view of the Danube but not much else.

Amazing view, amazing architecture . In Budapest 's heart on the top of the hill in the castle you can find this gem. It has a beautiful tower from where you can see Pest in all its glory. This gives you the best opportunity to watch the Danube and the Parliament too. In the tower you can have a drink or two, the waitress is beautiful and very kind to the customer. Excellent place to finish a holiday have a romantic moment along with a drink. Highly recommended!
Wonderful views. Beautiful views of Budapest! Enjoyed walking through streets and exploring the excavations! Not a lot of places to eat

Superb. This whole area is well worth seeing. It's clean, historic and relaxing. A small orchestra and singer play on a balcony overlooking the square some afternoons at around 15h,00 to 16h,00. This just adds to the pleasure that this place brings. Don't miss it. Beautiful views over the city and Parliament building too.
View. AMAZING view from this area. Surprised that you have to pay to go to this area. Still it's worth it. Great fortress type of structure. Very popular

Beautiful view of the city but crowded later in the day. A real fairytale looking series of minarets and walls next to the newly cleaned church and surrounded by a square, the Fisherman's Bastion is a great place to view the city from high above. For those wishing the scale the steps direct to the summit from the river, it is about a 15 minute climb, first through streets and alleys and then the dramatic steps leading to the Bastion itself. It is not for those who struggle with hill climbs. A gentler way to ascend is to either walk up the gentler slopes to either side of the Bastion via the palaces, but these could still present a problem for some, or to get a bus or the funicular railway to the top of the hill and walk along. An early morning visit is not devoid of crowds, but by lunchtime it is filled with tourists taking snaps or using the many local bars and restaurants for lunch. There is a good selection of both, but be aware that prices will be higher than in the city given the location, but not by an excessive amount. The food at the nearby Piknik Pavilion is good, and the seats under a shady tree are a welcome respite on a hot day.
above average. The view of the city was awesome. There is a restaurant on top where you can have drinks which is also very nice.
Awesome!. This place offer a perfect setting for a fantasy movie. The panorama from here is very nice ! The Mattia's church is multi-decorated inside and outside.

Beautiful view of Pest side. Went there 4 times in the week I was in Budapest. It's a touristic place to be (as in, full of tourists, gift stores and some restaurants) but has an amazing view of Pest side. Specially beautiful at sunset (the sun light hits the parliament directly) and at night, with Pest full of lights. As a fun bonus, you can see a lot of bats flying above the church there, shinning due to the holofote lights (the same can be seen at the parliament).

Absolutely gorgeous!. A definate must-see - if you have to choose between the many different plages to look out over the city, then this is the one to pick. You'll get an amazing view of the city as well as many spectacular sights of the castle and the cute little streets around the area. We took the funiculare up and a bus down.

Beautiful. A very lovely place to visit with views over to Pest. We didn't buy any entrance tickets we found that we were able to access a lot of the bastion free of charge.There were plenty of places to stop and take photographs.
Spectacular views of Budapest. The Fisherman's Bastion is a centuries old structure, next to St Mathias Church and having awesome views down and across the Danube. Heartily recommend!
Must to see. If you are exploring the Buda part of city, you cannot avoid visiting this elegant structure. There also is the best view to the Parliament.

Typical covered bazaar. We had time to visit Fisherman's Bastion. You can buy foie gras and everything about red pepper. Red pepper is a symbol of Hungry. You can find cheese, fish, meat, red pepper everything you need for cooking ;-)))

Wonderful views and architecture. There is lots and lots to do in Budapest and reflecting on all that we did I think the visit to the Fisherman's Bastion was probably my favourite. The view looking out to the Danube is excellent.

Gorgeus Views - Not Worth Paying For. You can see so much here without paying to go to the observation area. I feel that areas such as this should be free to the public with the maintanice paid for by business who charge inflated prices in the vicinity.

Very Beautiful!. A good spot to see the whole Danube river. The Bastion resembles a castle that came out from the pages of a fairy tale book. I was actually hoping to see Rapunzel. Though the area is open for public, you would have to pay if you like to go up the towers to have an even better view. This is not really necessary though.

Rather romantic, packed with tourists. Don't be misled by the ticket office nearby. Most of the bastion can be visited for free, only a raised level can be accessed through a £2 ticket; frankly, that terrace is just less crowded but view on the river is identical to the rest of the landmark.Typically crowded with tourists, the bastion is set in a romantic little square nearby with the beautiful Mathias Church in the scenery (the Church and its bell tower are not to be missed!).Castle Hill is a must for any tourist in Budapest but the square with the Bastion is clearly the heart of it. Just be there in an off-peak hour...

Just don't pay. People queuing to go into an area that is identical to another area 50m on for free is a bit mad. Views are nice and it is a lovely area for photos, we just didn't pay and went to the other side.

marvelous View. Splendid View of the Danube and the Pest side. Getting up the wall requires entry tickets, well worth the cost. The beer bar at the top has great beers, albite on the expensive side, to offer and marvelous views
Worth the climb!. The Fisherman's Bastion is quite a hike up from the river, but definitely worth it. The view is amazing, and we didn't have to pay for it!

SPECTACULAR VIEWS. The Fisherman's Bastion is a huge and offers great views of the river and city. Although it look like it has been there forever, the Bastion is just over 100 years old. The area has plenty of shops, stores and visitors.
Great to visit - not worth the fee. You can see enough of it without paying...the views are lovely, but not that much better than those you can see for free.
Sightseeing in Buda. Amazing structure and fantastic view. This was part of an inclusive walking tour of Buda provided by Viking.

Stunning. Built in stunning style of Middle-ages, this fortress not only gives you a great view of Budapest but it also hides so many great lications and viees within. Great for winter visit since it gives it some special feel.
First time here . It's busy but people seem to be getting their order on time. Near the fisherman's bastion and a close walk to other restaurants and shops as well as Matthias church

Nice view. I didn't go up to the high point as I read it is practically the same view. The view is beautiful and the bastion itself is well taken care of. Their is also a cafe a bit further from the ticket office. When I come back I'll definitely grab a bite or drink their as I can only imagine the view from their while eating ore drinking.
Marvelous views. If you are looking for a photo op this is a great stop. There are lots of steps to climb and restaurants and gift shops to visit. There is a fee.
Jewel of Budapest. A stunning place that include Matthias Church and fantastic views of the city. A must see place on any trip to Budapest.
Terrific views . Well worth the visit while on Castle Hill. The structures themselves are lovely. And the views of the Danube and the Pest side of the city are spectacular!

Beautiful location - wide view of Danube from Buda side. Amazing place - you can get there using bus line 16 or walk if you want to feel local . on top you have Coffee places with view and even Starbucks under the Hilton.

You are going to be here - so why not?. This lookout is right by Matthias Church which you are going to visit so a quick walk up to Fisherman's Bastion isn't going to take you out of your way. It has a very beautiful panorama view of the area. It is only 4 stars, because you wouldn't go to this site if Matthais Chrich wasn't there. You can check out the view for nothing on the lower level or if you go up to the check out the restaurant on the far left. If you can spare the change, buy the ticket and get the full experience - nice photo op and a good shot of the Chruch looking back - the roof is unique and this is one of the better vantage points for a photo.
Bastion. Nice place to see Budapest , on top of the Hill you see all the city , with the River between Buda and pest.

Buda' greatest place. Fisherman' Bastion looks very old although it was built only in 19 Century, in it present form. It's great observation point to see all of Budapest, and it is beautiful by itself

Beautiful!. The sightseeing is beatiful. The best place to sightsee the Parlament. Even more astonishing at night. If you go in a hot summer day, there's a very good fresh water fountain in the square.
Beutiful! . Just a beutiful view over the parlament and danube river. It feels like walking inside of a disney castle!
Great views of Pest.. The Bastion offers great views of Pest, particularly the Parliament Building. It is located in a picturesque location although the Hilton Hotel is some thing of an eyesore.

Quick trip. We spent the weekend in Budapest and were just roaming around. We found the Hospital in the Rock/Bunker Museum and took the tour. As we were leaving, we saw a bunch of stairs and decided to see what was at the top. We truly stumbled upon the Fisherman's Bastion. It was beautiful. Plenty of great views of the city. Would love to see it at night!
Best Views. I went here with a tour group and this was probably the best view ever! I went during the day and at night! Worth the trip.

Impressive structure overlooking the city!. Fisherman's Bastion is a unique Hungarian location that has survived hundreds of years in the tumultuous European landscape. Its architecture is something else and is definitely worth the visit.

Beautiful vantage point. Easy enough to reach by taking the escalator and lift up Castle Hill, avoiding the wait for the funicular, and walking across the areas in front of or behind the castle. Beautiful in itself and the views over to the Parliament are stunning. Unsurprisingly busy on a sunny afternoon, but not crowded.

Beautiful, Fairytale Views. Even though it was lashing rain when I was up on Castle hill, the beautiful terrace design of Fisherman's Bastion, and views overlooking the Danube and Pest side of the city were well worth getting drenched for.

Magnificent Views of the City. Stunning views of the parliament building, the bridges and river Danube from this wonderful location on Castle Hill in the heart of Buda. During the day it gets very busy. Restaurants are open and getting a seat with a view can bd hit and miss. Guided tour parties can be a pain. At night its a different place. The views from the top are stunning and free at night (there's a charge during the day). A must see place if you visit Budapest.

beautiful walk. Great spot to take some beautiful pictures, take in a great panoramic view of the Pest side of the Danube River. Right by the St. Matthias church and St. Stephens statue and close to the palace museum.

Beautiful Architecture. Its a beautiful place to visit! It is up a bit of a hill, especially if you're coming from the Metro line, so try to go early morning or evening so it's not as hot! The architecture is amazing! It really does look like more of a Princess Castle than a Church!There are some amazing views to see up there also, a lovely morning exploring the surroundings too.
View is amazing. Nice sight seeing,Dont spend more than 30 minutes.The fun is also they way to and back.If you have the energy, walk it to the hill and back

Vantage point for a good view. Up the hill, but not too high, next to Matthias Church. Need to pay a fee to go onto the top but it's free in the evening. Street musicians play music all the time. Overlook the river and the parliament building. After sunset, there's breeze, music and view. Perfect place for a walk after dinner.
This is a a tourist trap. Don't bother to go here. They have a menu but nothing to eat!!! I was very disappointed as they have a huge menu and have none of the dishes on the menu.

A must-see when visiting Budapest. Take the cable train up to the Royal Castle, and you are almost there. Strolling along the streets iin Fisherman's Bastion is a very pleasant experience. Wonderfull surroundings and a beautiful quietness. With it's location well above the big city, it's like an oasis.

Probably our favourite place to visit in Budapest. You get great views of the city as well as an opportunity to appreciate some history. We got some of out best photos of our trip to Budapest at the Fisherman's Bastion but we were very lucky with the weather. On our first day we visited late at night and it was freezing (keeping in mind it was July) but when we took our friends the next day it was warm and sunny. Despite it being cold at night we did get some lovely shots of the city under lights.

A place with a beautiful view of the city. The site has a beautiful view on the part of the spread.Instead there are restaurants and cafes where you can sit and watch the scenery while eating or sipping a cup of coffee.

Worth a wander. Take a short walk up the hill and take a look at the city from up high - Budapest brings many great memories from one of its most spectacular points. If sculpture, art and design are your thing, head on up. Yes, it's touristic. Yes, there's many tourists. Yes, it's tough taking a photo without tourists in it. No, it doesn't change the fact that it's still a lovely piece of design and fairytale in looks. Worth the wander.
Walk across the chain bridge. We went up the little hillside train, walked around to the bastion and sat and waited for the sun to set. All the lights came on in Buda, it was so pretty.
Definitely worth seeing! . Definitely worth seeing, beautiful views, most parts free of charge, great place to drink coffee. ☕ One of those places that you must see while being in Budapest.

A must see, like a Disney-fairytale!. Be there EARLY in the morning or after dark (all lit up and amazing view). In the middle of the Day there is houndreds of touristsgroups and you wont get any good photos ;) all pics i added are my own and taken in the morning before the tourists hits this Place. It feels like something out of a disneymovie, just stunningly Beautiful!Take a taxi here or take the buss. Bus 16 and 16a stops just outside, busstop "Szentháromság tér".
Beautiful to wonder around.. We didn't pay to go higher but the view you had from where we were able to go was still fantastic. Worth going over to Buda to visit here.
Good view. Not all that much to it really - good view but you get that from the castle as well. Best view is from up the cathedral tower. I wouldn't do it if I had the visit again.
Great to visit. Well worth paying the extra 800HF to go on the upper level - less people, fantastic views. Also worth walking down and looking back up at the Bastion from below.
Must visit if in Budapest! . Beautiful views of the entire city, can see lots of the main sites of pest. The architecture is stunning, can't be beaten! The heart of the castle district.
Bastion. Lovely area. Great views. Even better views if you pay to go up on the wall. We paid him 5 euro's for 2 adults. He just put the cash in his pocket very casually!!

Spectacular building. Spectacular building seen through hotel windows. This is on Buda side of the city. Many visitors arrive dailey. Sometimes tables set up along walkway for refreshments. Excellent views from here.

Great views of the city. When buying your tickets to the church, pay the extra to go up to the upper level of the Bastion. Not as many people and for the money it's well worth it. You get some great views of the river and city on one side and the church on the other.
Beautiful . Stunning views over the city. Definitely worth a visit. Perhaps better in the evening when we bit quieter though

Fabulous place to visit. We visited fisherman's bastion on a very wet day in Budapest but it was worth it. A magical looking castle with stunning views of the city. A lot of steps though so bring your walking shoes.

Great Views, even in the rain. We walked to the top of this in the rain, we should have taken a bus. The metro doesn't get you close enough so get on the right bus and you'll love it. One of the most beautiful cities in the world.

Beautiful views from this outdoor castle structure. This is basically a long fortification wall from the turn of the century (early 1900's) with majestic castle spires and beautiful winding stairways that offers a lovely view of the city. It is a short walk from Buda Castle, and along the way you pass several nice little shops and homes as you travel on cobblestone roads.
Worth-seeing. Castles on top of hills are really beautiful although they made for war-strategies but now, we could enjoy a panoramic view of the city.
Granddaughters in Hungary. This was the first time I was able to show my birthplace to Hope &Kylie . This was a high school graduation present to them.

Castle district. From the other side of the river, the castle district looks every bit the fairytale. When we got there, it really was! It's so clean and beautiful. In the sunshine, the white buildings were so bright and stunning. The details of the statues and the roofs were amazing. I'd recommend to anyone.

amazing budapest :D. I was in Budapest with one of my best friend... was amazing! The Fisherman's bastion was such a perfect panoramic place to take a lot of good pictures! I would like to came back...a bit cold but was ok :D

Right next to Mattias Church with great views of the Danube. Beautiful in its own right especially at night, it has towers and walking areas and great views of the river and Pest below. Also has a restaurant and is often closed for weddings in the evening. Every woman's fairy tale wedding site with Prince Charming
Great views. It's only a short activity but it doesn't cost too much and the views you get from here are fantastic. I recommend going in the church behind also.
Excellent. This place is on the Buda side of Danube on castle hill. Built in early 20th century in neo gothic style. From here one have a panoramic view of river Danube and Pest side.

Nice photo opportunity while in the Castle District . We walked through this area while touring the Castle District. There's an overpriced cafe at the top and they charge admission to walk up one side of it, but we just walked up the free part. Beautiful views and a great photo opportunity, but it wasn't a life-changing experience.

Impressive . You have to visit this when you visit Budapest.
Catch the cable car train up the hill and it feels like you have gone back in time.
The buildings, the view and the architecture is just amazing.
Quite a popular tourist destination but never felt like it was over crowded.

Marvelous lookout. Fabulous architecture and wonderful lookout
In a marvelous neighborhood. Unique structure in the world.
I saw a remarkable air show from here.
Amazing sight. Fishermans Bastion is one of the most beautiful buildings .It gives an amazing view over Budapest ,fabulous architecture
Beautiful building and views. A very short trip, but the views are beautiful. There is also a restaurant on the top of the Bastion which has unprecedented views.

Excellent views over the city.. Good views over the city, area is popular, so tends to be busy. Plenty of places to sit and enjoy the surroundings and get your breath back. Pleasant 'street musicians' playing traditional music on accordion and violin, some easy listening.
Good views. You get good views of the city, the parliament building and St Stephen's Basilllica and its free. Well worth a visit.

Only For the Views. Its basically cones on an old heritage wall, but they do offer spectacular views of the "Pest" Area of Budapest, and if you really dont like tourists trying to take as many selfies as possible, then you should possibly skip this attraction.

Rampart & Towers lifted from the pages of a Fable. This high up structure, one of the most distinctive on the Buda side, is a viewing terrace looking down the Danube & across at the Pest District. Originally in the Middle Ages there was a fortification here that was part of the city castle walls manned by city fishermen responsible for keeping watch in the event of the return of Mongolian raiders (hence the name "Fisherman's Bastion"). The sliver/white coloured structure has a Medieval appearance but is actually Neo-Gothic (dating only from the end of the 19th century). The impression it conveys is that of a fairytale castle, like something improbable you'd find in Disneyland. Some interesting old wall relief-sculptures on the staircase worth a look. There is a charge if you want to go up to the turrets for higher views. A cafe is located downstairs on the terrace level.

Impressing view!. It was worth the walk up hill to the bastilion. A beautiful building, unfortually closed when we arrived, but the exterior was beautiful never the less! The best view is held by the restaurant on the wall of the bastilion BUT you can go up in the small tower to the left for a better photoview over the city.
Interesting point, great views. Excellent views of the city, but very similar as from other points. However, it worth the visit and it's close to a must: Mathias Church.

Nice place. It's one of the city's highlights. This neoromanic corner allows you to take really nice pictures of Pest with the parliament ahead. It's crowded of tourists but you can't leave Budapest without visit it.
Nothing Special . I just expected so much more. It disappointed unfortunately. The unbelievable crowds didn't help. We arrived early and even hours later it hadn't abated.

Great sightseeing place. Lovely vibe around this tourist attraction. Very clean and easy to walk around. Two brides having their wedding photos while we wandered around. Hilton hotel has been tastefully built here to blend in with the surroundings. Beware of overpriced 'fresh flavoured lemonades' being sold in kiosk.

Beautiful Views. Great place for some beautiful views of the city. There isn't much to do here, just take in and enjoy the fantastic views. The location makes for a good photo opportunity with the unique architecture.
Beautiful place.. I came here because my partner had visited it 30 years before. Do see it. If you come here, it's a must.
Nice architecture if you like theme parks. Nice architecture but very dead - no ambiance or atmosphere and populated by wandering bored-looking tourist groups..(see our blog retirednomads)

Amazing view. Part of the Buda castle, place from where you have amazing views of the Pesta part of the city, across the Danube river.
The architecture of the place is astonishing, but it's not that old, some 150 years at most, so it has no connection with the medieval times of the castle.

Disneyland in Hungary. It's highly rated, but historically and architecturally it's a recent confection, and it's thick with tourists - there's an ever-present danger of being impaled on a selfie stick.
However, if you're patient and creative there are some photo opportunities.
wonderful views. It's attractive. It offers panoramic views of the city. You needn't spend more than 5-10 minutes there. I imagine lots of wedding photos are taken there.
Cool place. Great place with a spectacular view. Give yourself some time to enjoy yourselves, sit on the grass and have 20 mins of absentmindness

A special place!. Beautiful views over to the Danube to the Pest side of the city. Its like stepping into a fairy tale - absolutely breathtaking scenery all around this area. Amazing architecture, statues etc, the tiles on Mathias church were beautiful. Just have to sit for a while and take it all in! A truly special place.

Nothing to see there!. Just a small tower full of tourists and a small cafe on the top. With all the respect to the history of that place it s just a tower that you can find almost in every village of the wold.
Beautiful. One of the most beautiful buildings in Europe. They have even high class restaurant inside a tower. Breathtaking panoramic view.
Pay to not see much.. There's not much to see. You can walk along the wall and can take pictures of the Pest side of the Danube, but that's it.

The best views in Budapest!. Our hotel was at the Bastion so we saw all the sites and wonderful views over to the city on the other side of the city!There is a good bus service or taxis going to this area and plenty of people will tell you which ones to take.You can walk from the city on the Pest side of the river but you will have to climb up steep paths and steps to reach the Bastion on foot,quite a hike for the over 70's but if your fit it is quite possible!Their are plenty of places to eat and drink on the bastion and a number of museums and churches that are a must to visit whilst up here.Toilets are in all the restaurants and hotels.This is a must see area in Budapest, please don't miss it !

Well worth a visit. If for no other reason, visit Fishermans Bastion for the views! I loved it here and could have easily spent half a day overlooking the other side of the city. The architecture of the structures themselves are amazing. I would recommend visiting earlier in the day if possible (we visited from 8.30-10.30) allowing photos and time at each surrounding site.
Great views. The views from the ground and the top are amazing. But, it is quite expensive to get in. I advise you to just walk around because the view of the whole city is

Amazing views and very romantic place. Definitely a must in Budapest !!!!. You can take there amazing pintures !!! Beautiful place like a fairytale. Both day and night is a place to visit. The views of the Danube, Pest and the Parliament from there are really impressive.

Fairy tale Castle...MUST SEE !. Fairy tale Castle...MUST SEE ! More beautiful at night with music and lights and cool breeze. We went there at sunset and stayed till late in night. Restaurant on the castle top is decent.

Amazing view!. I'd seen photos from fisher mans bastion and they loooked amazing so I planned to visit it when let in Budapest . We visited on our first day and was not disappointed. The views are out of this world can not recommend visiting here enough. It does ge t very busy!
No.1 spot in town. Amazing view of the Pest side, day or night, rain or shine. Less noticeable is the wonderful Zsolnay tiles of the Mathias Church.
Great views. Felt like a scene from Disney great views, very busy nice areas to sit & take in the views. Walking distance to the castle which is currently under construction.

on top of the world. beautiful landmark and great viewpoint in one of the most beautiful old towns of europe. most beautiful in the morning or early evening - ideal program before dinner. make sure to try out the gastronomic quarter of the neighborhood featuring the best restaurants in budapest.
Right out back door of Hilton. Great views of the river and city below ... only took a few minutes to enjoy this very special spot.

Beautiful View & Interesting Architecture. Views of Danube, Parliament and St Stephens Basilica. Gorgeous panorama of entire Pest side of city from a very cool architecture. Several little carts selling souvenirs. Very cool place
Beautiful place in Budapest. This was propably the most eye-catching place in Budapest. Beautiful view, nice people and many restaurants.

Stunning . Architecture and views to melt your heart. Everything is stunning, behind the buildings sits some cafes shops and restaurants with a village like feel. If you head over the back of the hill also a little cocktail bar with views - gorgeous at sunset
What a view. Beautiful cathedral on the hill of Buda with an amazing overview of the city and the Pest side, a must.

Not just a great view some amazing buildings too.. You can get a local bus all the way up to the top of the hill. Tour buses are restricted due to the poor state of the foundations. It appears the tunnels under the site were blown up by the retreating occupiers and the city is concerned about them suffering damage from road traffic. You can walk up from the river side and I suggest you take plenty of water and keep a gentle pace on the ascent. On the opposite side there is a road which climbs up from Vermezo park. We stayed at the Mercure and you can see the bastion from there. It might be worthwhile to join a guided tour, as there are lots of hidden gems. We learned that all the modern buildings had been on sites of ancient ones destroyed during WW2. Get there early it gets really busy.

Beautiful view top of the city. Spectacular view from the Bastian, go by bus or Siklò to the Castle from Clark Àdàm Square. No use own car, because from 15 minutes wait extremely expensive and no place to parking. Free to enter the Bastian.
Must see to get a great view. Must see to get a great view of the river and the other side of Budapest and to see the Parliament building... but you can go down past the crowds and not pay the fee.

LIKE A FAIRY TALE. This is a lovely spot on the Buda side, reminds one of a fairy tale castle. Lots of spots for great pictures, places to eat. Of course it was fairly crowded as such a popular place.

Great view. Worth the hike. The view from the bastion is simply arresting. It was quite a walk up from the city centre but well worth it. I wouldn't pay to access the tower as there are similar photo opportunities from the free to access Buda castle grounds just a short walk down from the bastion. Definitely recommend a trip by day and by night if time permits!
best view in Budapest. Everyone will like the fairytail views from here. The buildings are attractive and there are plenty of good photo opportunities. THE place to visit in Budapest.
nice view of the city. must seen when theres a good view thru the day theres somme attraction near the placealso theres some small market

Just amazing. This is in a small village up on the hill and the whole place is amazing. It was the highlight of our trip... Even my teenage son agreed it is a very special place. There was lots of tourists of course but even so sitting around the area soaking up the atmosphere is a great thing to do. Lots of photo opportunities from there as well. Definitely a must see in Budapest.
Great views. Great place for photos out over Budapest. The structures are very interesting as are the surroundings up in the castle district.
Best views of the city. We came up to this area with a gate 1 tour. Fantastic views and architecture all around. Definitely worth a visit. Took many pictures,
Amazing views. Best place to have amazing views of the city and danube. If it gets too hot there is a great lemonade stall right beside it !
Underwhelming. You would expect views to be free but they charge for everything here. Travel books over-promote this I believe but as you are sure to be at the Castle, then go there
Nice architecture and good views. We really liked strolling around in Fisherman's Bastion and taking a look at the city. Beautiful buildings offering nice photo shootings.

Fairy tale castles. Bastion is defined as the projecting part of a fortification built at an angle to a wall, to allow defensive fire in several directions. In Hungarian, Fisherman’s Bastion is Halászbástya. The neo-Gothic/Romanesque towers and terraces are situated on the Buda bank of the Danube on Castle Hill, and surrounds Mathias Church, having been built between 1895 and 1902. It was virtually destroyed during WWII. The seven towers represent the seven Magyar tribes that settled the Carpathian Basin (modern-day Hungary) in 896AD. A bronze statue of Stephen I mounted on a horse, erected in 1906, can be seen between the Bastion and Matthias Church.But all that’s history. Views of the Pest side of the Danube and superb. Although there is a charge for entering the section that offers the best views, there are many areas that are free. The fairy tale castles rival those of Disney World, and photo ops abound. I half expected Rapunzel to let down her golden hair from one of the towers☺

Fairytale architecture.. Interesting for its romantic interpretation of a fortification. Extremely popular and busy with tourists of course. Strangely enough the modern Hilton Hotel immediately behind the bastion doesn't intrude. Terrific views across the river to the Parliament Building especially from the tower at the far end.

Beautiful structure and great views of the city. This was a beautiful location with great views of the city. Definitely a must-see when in Budapest. The views of parliament and the river were stunning.

The Picture says it all.. The view from Fisherman's Bastion is beyond words. The beauty will stop you in your tracks. When the bells of the church are ring in the background to are stuck to the spot your are standing. It is a pinch me moment.
The view. Visited here as a part of a "free" walking tour. Enjoyed the architecture and the beautiful views of the river and Pest. Definitely worth a visit.

Great View over Pest, But Do Not Pay!. As others have said, do not pay the HUF 700 to visit the Fisherman's Bastion, just use the entry closest to the Hilton Hotel which is for free. Great location to take photographs of the Danube, Chain Bridge and the Hungarian Parliament. You can tell the paid entrance because a poorly dressed security guard will be sat at the base of the steps on a chair!

Wonderful views of the city and the Danube. At the conclusion of our Viking River Cruise we had a tour of Budapest. As part of the tour, we went to Fisherman's Bastion. It is high on the hill of the Buda side. It has interesting architecture and has wonderful views of the city and the Danube.
Definitely worthwhile.. In Buda, so gives a very different perspective. Not hard to get to,and definitely worthwhile. Beautiful views.

A "must visit" place in Budapest. Outstanding views. Amazing views and quirky architecture, the kids would love it too. It IS crowded in the tourist season, but never mind there is room for everyone. Spell binding.

Fantastic view . Incredible view point . Looks over the Parliament , the river and the city. You can take bus 16/16A from outside Szell Kalmann Ter station on metro line 2 (red). The bus will go up the hill to the church. Alternatively you can take the funicular to the castle and it's a short walk up from there. Small fee to get to the view point.
A wonderment!. Beautifully maintained gorgeous attraction, proudly situated on the Buda castle hill. You are compelled to just spend the day gazing at the city below.

Disney type Towers and Turrets. The Fisherman's Bastion is a bit like a border at the top of the hill by Matthias Church. The original rampart was apparently a fortified lookout position defended by the guild of fishermen. It was rebuilt as a major tourist attraction in a Disney type style with lots of towers, turrets and stairways.The view across to Pest is really great, prime position goes to Parliament.Between the Bastion and Church there is an interesting statue of Stephen I of Hungary on his horse.If you go to Matthias Church it is well worth the few extra steps to take in the Bastion as well.My Tip: You can get a good photo position from the little garden opposite Matthias Church.

Excellent . Very wonderful place. Nicely connected to Metro by tram 16. Tram 16 A keeps on moving between two sides of Budapest castle every 5 minutes. Place had excellent museum, nice shining architecture and places to rest and have own food. Good facility for drinking water. At every place in Budapest castle there are total maps with pink dot showing where you are. So even easy to walk. Do not miss
What a beautiful place. Such a beautiful place, busy with other tourists but not so busy that it becomes irritating. Such a lovely area, we ended up spending all day there.

Fantastic site at night. This place looked fantastic at night when all lit up, unfortunately didn't get the opportunity to go inside as we only found this place an hour before we had to leave for the airport.

Great views of the city. There are two parts of the Bastion - one is paid entry and offers a walk along half the Bastion - there is a turnstile gate at the exit and we saw a number of people vault over the exit gate to get in without paying. The other part of the Bastion (and the higher, nicer part) is free entry and has a small, expensive cafe in the upper "tower". Personally I would not bother with the paying part and simply go to the free part - same if not better views and just as attractive. The main reason to walk along the Bastion is for the views of Pest and particularly the Parliament building. We went to the Bastion during the day and I can imagine the view is very pretty at night when everything is lit up. In fact I think at night the paying part is closed (except to those who vault over the exit gate!!). Well worth a visit and particularly when combining it with other parts of Buda for a day out in the Castle area.

Majestic. Wonderful views to the city and Danube river. Nice to go there by the lift or if you prefer to walk choose not too hot day for this activity. There is a nice small caffeteria up where you can get an icecream to chill.
Always stay for a drink or two. Great experience but would not have been the same had we not stayed for a drink, and really breathed in the views from the upper restaurant.
Best views of Budapest. As everyone says, come up at dusk and see the lights come on. Its beautiful. An afternoonn in Buda and maybe a dinner is enough.

Sweet Home. Best panoramics of the Pest side of the river Danube. The old site of the Buda castle walls built by the charge of the reconstruction of Matthias Church is Schulek Frederick's plans between 1895 and 1902, Neo-Romanesque style. The name refers to the medieval castle walls to defend this part of the guild of fishermen.

Highlight of my trip!. We were there at sunset and it was AMAZING. My friend lives in Budapest and she said that's the best time to visit this place. You could easily spend hours here just absorbing the magnificent view & having a good time. There are several bars open so you can also have a drink if you want. If you're on a budget, pack some beers & you're good to go!! We were there for about 3 hours and all we did was watching the sun goes down.
Fairy tale :). We were there during winter time. I can recommend mulled wine :)...to warm up yourself. And continue to enjoy in nice streets and the view.

My favorite in Budapest. My favorite place in Budapest. Situated in old town of Buda, near the Imperial Castle, whole area were very nice renovated. Fisherman's Bastion and Matyas temple are very impresive. You can have a nive panorama of Donau and Pesta.

Close to the tourist trap. The place itself is very interesting and the view is simply amazing. Being so, it is also full of knick-knack sellers, most of the bastion is part of private restaurants. If you wnat romance visit early morning.
Lots to explore. Great location, getting a view of Budapest. Lots to explore and really picturesque. Highly recommended for all explorers.

Great views. It a must see when You are visiting Budapest! The Bastion itself is gorgeous but the view You get when You go on it is amazing, especially at night when the whole city is lit up. We walked around all day in Budapest and this was one of our favourite part.

It looks beautiful.... ...but the view itself is no better or more impressive than any other view from Buda across the Danube to Pest. Maybe what tempered our enthusiasm was the fact that we purchased the obligatory ticket - only to find out that the bulk of the bastion was inaccessible, reserved for a private function.

Take a glass of good wine with you. I recommend to go in the evening and take a bottle of good wine and a stylish wine glasses with you - for friendly or romantic conversations and a beautiful view of Budapest! :)
Like something out of a Disney movie. A truly beautiful place, immaculately clean with stunning architecture and magnificent views of The Danube and Pest.

Absolutely beautiful and a fantastic viewpoint.. Went here on a sunny day to enjoy the view over the city and have a look at the architecture. It is just fantastic and if you don't visit you definitely miss out on something good!
Best view. Its a MUST if you are in Budapest!!!! Its up in the Castle Area just next to the Matthias Church....a beautiful walk with stunning views of the Danube River and the Parliament!
Mixed. The Bastion itself is rather kitschy and a historical--or, better, unhistorical--mishmash, but some of the views of the city from it are absolutely spectacular.

Excellent views of the city(Pest). Not sure why it's called Fishermen's Bastion. It looks to me like a fairy tale castle with its turrets and ramparts (7 turrets represent the 7 Magyar tribes)but the view you get from here is amazing with pride of place going to the parliament buildings. You also see the Danube and its bridges. Has to be worth a visit.

get the best view of budapest from here. Visited this place for two times already, during the winter and the summer. Honestly, i hate my visit to budapest during the summer because i don't really get the beauty i think but somehow, when i went to visit it during the winter, i get the aura of the beautiful budapest. During my summer visit, i went to the bastion and takes a lot of pictures from up there. It gives me a lot of good pictures. So, i went back during the winter and yes i still get the best pictures from here. That is why i like the fisherman's bastion to be my top list during my visit to budapest
Romantic location with spectacular views. Beautiful views from this location. Together with St Matthias Church and Castle District, it makes for a great day!

phenominal view of city-. located immediately behind of Cathedral. Name is misleading- it is like a fortress wall , with elevated views looking down on Danube and city - including lighted Parliament building in evenings.

Beautiful location. Definitely go here. Nice views and nice outdoor eatery on the outskirts under the umbrellas. Lots of cafes, souvenir shops, castles,museums to visit. Could stay up here for a full day.

Best way to have a view of the whole city. Every time when I am in the city I visit the "Halászbástya". The view is astonishing, I can spend hours just looking around and drawing. It is usually crowded during the day. The architecture is amazing. I recommend this place if you visit the city, anybody can find here something interesting.

Lovey place to visit, dont miss it.. You have to visit this place, nice museum and good restaurant just next to the district. You dont have to take the funicular, it is easy with the stairs next to it.

Pay the 2€ to walk along , lovely place to visit. You have to pay 2 € to walk along the top , but it's worth it. We had an expensive beer in the restaurant, but if you walk to the top tower you can sit at the cafe bar and get cheaper drinks and snacks

JUST GO I will be back . A beautiful city beats. VIENNA read about Spoons restaurant in my food guide
Sometimes TA you dont.need. 100 words
Best view of the city . Totally worth to come! Takes some time to get there but the view is superb. Especially if you have some guide with you to talk through regarding the history.

Absolutely gorgeous looking buildings. The fisherman's bastillion is as nice as any of the pictures you see of it.
The area it is in is so clean and well maintained.
Great view of the city from here.
800 florint per person to get onto the walls and tickets purchased nearby.

Stunning. A must do. . For my first two days in Budapest, I eyed the top of this hill and the hillside ski-lift type thing, and was in two minds about travelling up there. It's very high and I'm not one for heights! Anyway day three and I plucked up the courage, although I didn't really know what was there to be honest. However luck was on my side and the ski lift thing was closed for maintenance, and just as we were leaving, a tuk tuk appeared out of nowhere with a bargain price for a trip to the top. Hurrah!! It took about five minutes and we drank in the hillside sights that you would normally not see in the lift thing. Reaching the bastion, I can honestly say, it was the best part of my whole holiday. The architecture is phenomenal. It's so clean and pretty and looks like it's on the film set of a Hans Christian Anderson 1950s film. Absolutely stunning and a must do. Also, if lucky, you might get to see and hold Nadia, the golden eagle who sits up there with her owner. She is just as beautiful as the rest of the bastion. There is also a little gift market up there too, and the walk down is really easy. Just go. Go now.
Spectacular views. Well worth the visit. Spectacular architecture and views. Very busy tourist location. Recommend seeing as part of a tour to appreciate the background of this site.
Stunning views. Stunning views here and even more beautiful at night. There is also a wonderful fine dining restaurant perfect for a special occasion

Absolutely fantastic views!. We went here on an extremely hot day but it was well worth the climb up. The area itself is stunning and the views are amazing. Well worth a visit. If you go to Budapest I would rate this as one of the top things to do. It has a fairytale feel about it. The pictures you can get especially of the parliament are amazing on a clear day.
Got to see it!. Beautiful architecture with and amazing view of the "Pest" side of the city, Parliament Building and the Danube river. Went with a guided tour so we got lots of historical facts.
very busy. interesting architecture but very busy in the afternoon. \lovely views over the city. Looks like there are some interesting bars etc. but they were closed between lunch and diner time.
On the way to buda castle . One of the must dos while in Budapest... but closes at 5 so bad careful... walk from buda castle... nice walk not views
Amazing place. This place seems to be take out of a fairytale. It's just amazing. For me this was the most beautiful place I visited in Budapest.

Beautiful buildings, great views. Check the opening times prior to your visit (weird opening hours). Amazing views, beautiful building
Couldn't get into the Mathias Church because they close at 12:15 on Saturday.
Bought the ticket to go up the bastion, don't think it was worth it (you get the same view for free on the other tower 2 minutes away). The bus #16 will get you up and back to the Buda side.
Fantastic Views. I love the pictures I took from here. I got great shots of the beautiful parliament building. The church was beautiful and I enjoyed the little shops.
From old to new. Amazing view above the city.. incredible.. gorgeous and antique.. you can join the city's antique and modern parts together from the sky.

Visit at night when it is free. Beautiful views of the Danube and the city. During the day there is a fee but at night it is free. We visited about 7:30 pm and the view in the evening while still light is quite lovely. One can wait to see the city lit up too.
Not Value.. It is only a tower for seesighters!! You have to pay for the sight seeing!! I do not like this places where you have to pay to see the sight seeing.

Go at night. Part of the castle district, the whole area is stunning. Go at night time and you'll avoid the crowds and the entrance fee (although, all the other sites will be closed). It is very atmospheric, with the views of the city, the well lit archways and the buskers playing violins with a lot of talent.

A bit less than expected. The place is under serious renovation, so looks like there is none original stone left. Bastion wall is occupied by tables of cafeteria/restaurant that is nestled down on the zero level and basement. So the whole arrangement (especially when it's getting crowdy) is making restaurant clients privileged in enjoying the panoramic view.
Nevertheless, worth of visit.

GREAT PHOTO OP BUT SAVE YOUR MONEY. Overall the Fisherman's Bastion (lookout tower and decorative fortress located in Buda Castle, near Mathias Church) is well worth seeing and taking some photos of both it and the surrounding area (Danube, St Mathias, Parliament, etc.). However, there is no need to pay the entry fee to go up one level to the top turret as you can take the same photos from ground level for free. We paid the extra fee before realizing it.
A Gem in Budapest--#2. Fisherman's Bastion is an important site in the city, and sits high up on the Buda side of the city, providing beautiful views of Pest, and is beautiful, in its own right.

Tremendous across across the river to Pest. The bastion sits on top of a hill in the old part of Buda and has great views across the river to Pest. It is within easy walking distance of the funicular railway so there is no need to climb the hill unless you really want to. There are cafes and market stalls Close-by and you can easily spend a couple of hours soaking up the atmosphere, enjoy the views and generally chill. We visited on a very wet day and the bastion provides shelter as well as views,
busy place. very busy place with good views over the city either go very earl or late afternoon to miss the crowds

Fabulous scenery . It is a very beautiful and photogenic area of Buda! I was lucky enough to be staying in the hotel that over looked it so I got to walk through it every day and night! You don't need to pay anything if you don't need to, to enjoy the details of the basilica

Wonderful views. A popular spot for tourists but it is easy to see why, it gives you a wonderful view of the city and the beautiful city of Budapest.There was a small charge to climb the small tower but it is not necessary as the views along the wall are just as good. There are a few places to eat and drink and plenty of shops selling the usual souvenirs etc.
Fabulous views. Walked here from Pest side. Great views from the top.Did not pay to walk along the battlements. Listened to two gentlemen playing violins and singing,very good.
Gorgeous. The Fisherman's Bastion is a lovely piece of architecture! Such a magical place with a gorgeous view, there is also a beautiful restaurant up here, very idyllic.
An unbeatable view. This is a lovely evening hang-out spot by Matthias Church with amazing views of Parliament. Very romantic, but good for families, too.
Lots to see!. So many beautiful buildings, shops, restaurants. We saw three wedding parties the day we visited. A new Jamie Oliver's restaurant had just opened and is also worth a visit.

Things changed. No access without pay!. It was un unpleasant surprise to see that access on top of the Bastion was forbidden unless paying 800 HUF / person. It was not so several years ago. Under the top all it is blocked by expensive restaurants. This gave me a feeling of too much mercantilism. And take care about parking place when enter the Buda historical center by your car. Read carefully the signs otherwise you can have your wheel blocked. Validate your parking ticket at the restaurant or caffeteria so parking is aprox.150 HUF not 560 HUF. We parked in the first parking place.It is an automatic parking mashine there and when wanted to pay we couldn't and called. The man at the phone directed us to exit and we was pleased to see that we have to pay nothing more. We validated at Ruszwurm. A car besides us had a blocked wheel because parked on the place it was forbidden till 14:00 hours. So be careful with parking !

Spectacular views. We visited in the heat of a summer's midday. Although the shadows were harsh there were ample opportunities for spectacular river and city views. The church offered many interesting angles and textures to photograph.

Great vibes, peaceful, and breathtaking view. One of my favourite spots in Budapest. Just didn't want to leave. You feel like you are in the middle of a well kept medieval fortress overlooking the Danube and Pest right across the Parliament.

Breathtaking . To stand on the bastion and view the Danube and Parliament and all the sights was jaw dropping even on a rainy day when the rain was coming down in sheets. It's worth the walk and there is a fine dining restaurant with great views if you are lucky enough to get a table. We weren't but it is called Halasbastya.

the front of this were all blocked off by restaurants. the free to tour areas are very restricted - most of the free to access frontage were taken up by overpriced restaurants! it was not like this when I visited some years ago.

Magic place with a stunning view over the city and the river!. This is a magical place, because you can enjoy a stunning view to the city and the river. The architecture is neo-Gothic and is like a fairy tale!Don't miss it!
Wow!. The site in itself is wonderful and has much to commend it. The views from teh bastion make this a 5* experience - highly recommended. Fantastic!

One of the most romantic spots in Europe!. Beautiful during the day, breathtaking at night! You can enter through the main gate of the castle or walk up from the Tunnel "Alagut" . The whole place is lit up at night and you get a beautiful view of the parliament! Pro tip: If you want impress someone, stay there until midnight (1:00am in June/July/August) to see how they switch off all the city lights at once!

Amazing view. Maybe the best day view. In my opinion the best view you can get of the city. Not to mention that the scenery up there is stunning in its self. Only other comparable view would be doing good a night cruise on the river.
very nice. a special place very recommended. Although it was a very very hot day - we enjoyed the visit. there are many places to sit & have coffee or ice cream. the view of the city is very nice
Absolutely stunning . Went both during the day and at night. Talented Buskers add to the ambience. Take a bottle of wine up and enjoy the view while watching the world go by
Beautiful, scenic,. excellent place to spend an afternoon and gives a great view of budapest. Their is an excellent Jamie Oliver restaurant near by... a must try.
Busy, but good. This was a good vantage point over the city, which looks to me to be better from the outside. The location was very busy with tourists, but worth a visit.

Great View of Pest. Fisherman's Bastion gives you a great view of Pest and the Danuba river. I was there twice, evening and noon, and while the view in daylight was nice i found it to be much more breathtaking being there after dark when the city below you is well lit.
To understand Buda and Pest. the views of the Danubio are beautiful, the church is very interesting....is a very good location for nice pictures....
Beautiful place!. Definitely grab a table near the tower for drinks and watching the sunset. Such a great place to be!

Great views but not worth the entrance fee. I read if there is no one sitting the right hand side you can just walk up, personally i didnt think it was worth paying to get views u can easily get from other areas, also if you are adventurous enough there are stairs down the hill to the left that you can gain access.

Fantastic views. I loved the architecture of the Fisherman's Bastion and it offers incredible views over the city. You can pay to go in or further up there is a cafe where you can buy a soft drink and get the same views so I would definitely recommend this.
Well worth a trip. Beautifully maintained building with fantastic views over the city and Danube; it looks fabulous from the river at night time.

Beuatiful views from this stunning monument. The views you get from this beautiful monument are amazing, right across Pest as far as the eye can see. There is a charge to go up on the top level but if you don't want to pay then you haven't missed loads as the view is there for everyone to see.

So beautiful. We walked the stairs on the side and were really surprised when we entered the square with all white buildings - what a beautiful sight! It is definitely a must see in Budapest. A bit overcrowded but that's to be expected. There is also a nice terrace bar to get a glass of wine an enjoy beautiful views of Danube and the parliament building.

Nice spot for views of the city. Fisherman´s bastion was relatively recently built. There´s no much mystic about it. There are very nice views of the city, but we have enjoyed htose views from the Budapest castle. There is a café in the arched terrace, expensive and not much to offer. Part of the Bastion can be visited for free, but if you want to walk along all the terraces, you must pay a ticket, which seemed expensive to me.

Wedding at Fisherman's Bastion Breathtaking Views from the Turrets. We came from the U.S. to attend a wedding at the Fisherman's Bastion. Could not think of a better backdrop for a fairy tale like wedding. It sits a top of Buda Castle hill and it was magical. As the bride walked out from below the turrets all the tourists above stopped to take pictures as it truly looked like a princess walking down the aisle. You can get fantastic pictures of the Parliament building and the city across the Danube. 7 turrets represent the 7 tribes who founded Hungary in 895. The Fisherman's Bastion was built in 1895 to serve as a lookout tower over Budapest. There used to be real castle walls there that were once protected by a guild a fisherman in the middle ages and that is how it got its name. It sits next door to the beautiful Matthias church which has the most beautiful colorful tile work on the roof. Its open year round, day and night. It is worth spending an afternoon on Buda Castle Hill. There are restaurants,shops, Starbucks and the Hilton Hotel too. I would recommend going at sunset because once the sun goes down all the buildings light up for spectacular pictures!!!

Beautiful place for pictures. I think that you can't say that you've been to budapest without visiting this place. The FISHERMAN'S BASTION is a nicee historic place there is an amazing view to all the city and you can get there easily
very nice. this is so a must visit place, located in Buda, part of places that next to each other. don't miss it.

Long walk. Well worth the walk but do take into account that there are a lot of steps to get up if you decide to walk. There are buses and taxi's of course for those less able but an absolute must see.

Beautiful castle!. This is my favourite place in Budapest because of the fascinating architecture, with arcades, turrets, fantastic views! You can also visit Matthias church or just walk around and have cold drink overlooking the Danube and take loads of pictures of the amazing white brick buildings. Souvenir shops, canteens, restaurants can be found in the area.
A really nice view . You can go by car or bus, as there is a parking. The whole complex is amazing and is one of the things I enjoyed the most while in Budapest
Fantastic view. Looks down over the city fantastic view of parliament. Castle like setting great place to walk around visit the church walk the shops great day here
Worth the waljk up the Hill. Tremendous view over the Danube and much to see...free Wi fi at the Visitors Centre too. One of the great views of Budapest!

excellent views. We camefor a 4 day mini break in Budapest the weather was stunning the views from here are excellent and didn't disappoint us you are on the Buda side of the danube and in myopinion the best side it has stunning architecture and is steeped with history we shall definitely be back
Nice view. Nice view from there and interesting architecture. Theoretically skipable if you don't go to the church (1500 Forint).

One of my favorite place in Budapest. If are going to stay in Budapest, this is a must see! There are really amazing places here, so deffinetally don't miss out on this one, ohh and the view from it is jawbreaking!
Also, recommend you go in the morning, less tourists and not so crowded.
Breathtaking View. The view of the river and bridges here is gorgeous. You have a wonderful view of Pest also. The surrounding area has some small shops.

Very nice view & pleasant place to walk around . Opt for late afternoon so you can enjoy sunset hours for nice pics & experience.
Starbucks Coffee is about to open soon there 😎
Like in a fairytale . Like you are in one of the Disney fairytale! Perfect view on Dunav and the Budapest! The view is breathtaking! You must be there!
