Stunning Views. Beautiful views across the Danube - visited during the day and at night and at night was probably more stunning. Tip don't have to pay for view at left hand side only the right. Lovely square beside the church.

Very nice. This one is part of the view when you look at Buda from Pest. Three saints square. That's I think where it is with the Mathias church. Breathtaking experience. You can see the whole Pest side from here. Amazing.

Better to visit at morning.. It's better to visit this place at morning - no tourists there. :-) I always enjoy visiting the Fisherman's Bastion. You can take really nice pictures there. The view is amazing too!

Beautiful place to visit. Beautiful place to visit. Great view to the town plus you get really nice pictures :D
We did not pay for the entrance, just had the walk around the place. Romantic place :)
Beautiful . Great views from here and I thought it looked like a fairy tale castle, it's also next to a beautiful church and right near Buda Castle!

Views on views . A must visit for the views. Take the local bus #16 if you don't want to walk up. Would suggest a travel book or walk up with a free walking tour, no signs and hard to appreciate the history behind this place - which there is ALOT.
Very nice place to visit. To visit this place makes you feel as if you were in the beginning of the 19s, it has a wonderful view over the Danube and lots of towers and things to admire.

The best view in Budapest!. This was my favourite part of Budapest when we visited. The views were fantastic and the actual building/structure is beautiful. We paid to walk around/along it however there were two sections and you didn't seem to have to pay for the other one, so even though it wasn't that expensive, not sure we would pay again. Having said that, I do think the view was better from the part we paid for, so I don't regret paying!

Stunning view. The views from here are extremely nice. The entire area gives you a great feeling. It's like you'd be stepping into another world. It has a special charm and it's definitely worth a visit. You can spend as much time as you'd like over there.
Just like you pictured it !!!. Beautiful fairy castle you have pictured in your mind !! Beautiful views, pho op's. Walk up or take the finnuculiur, and enjoy an afternoon stroll.

Dont pay to go up. There is a fee to walk up the steps but honestly you can get amazing views on the ground level. The arches are so pretty and frame the background really well. We wandered down here after the military museum and it was wonderful. Lots of amazing views!!
Great view of river and pest area. you can see the entire pest area from these towers. we took the 3 euro pass to get on the towers. Hardly 50 steps and then you can click some amazing shots.

Definitely see this place. It's a beautiful place to walk around with fantastic views over the city.Lots of nice architecture to look at and the people are so friendly.It can get very busy at certain times of the day so I would recommend getting there early.Plenty of places to eat offering all kinds of food.
A must see. . Make sure you visit this place whilst in Budapest wonderful views over the city. Beautiful church beside it. Lovely restaurant for lunch nearby.
Nice place. Nice place to visit,catch a bus to top and do not pay for the ticket as it is free in few metres away when there is a cafe,you can have the panaroma view of Budapest ,without paying
Beautiful view . I was a bit skeptical about going to the fishermans bastion as we had been to so many view points in Budapest. But this terrace is simply stunning and is worth the visit

Great view. Perfect for taking pictures and there is a very nice cafe right within the complex. The view from the top is the same as from the lower parts so it might be some euros better spent elsewhere.
Stunning. This gives a nice view of central Budapest and the Parliament. It is great to visit during the day or evening. No one should miss a walk.

Stunning place to view Budapest. Wow -- this is the most stunning place from which to view the beautiful city of Budapest. The church of St. Stephan is best viewed from all angles, including this wall. The limestone construction is light and bright and the turrets are magical. The name of this location comes from the people who were its protectors - -they were fishermen. They did not construct it -- our guide explained that different groups were assigned different areas to protect -- hence this name. A fun fact.

Alright.. There are lots of places for good views of Budapest. I didn't really see the attraction of fisherman's bastion. Lots of overpriced cafes an expensive toilet and a fee to go on the wall which is about 8 feet higher than everyone else. Do yourself a favour, and admire the exact same views of Budapest from in front of the Palace about 500m down the road, without the cafés and 'viewing fees'.

Fantastic structure with great views. The Fisherman's Bastion is an architectural marvel offering a combination of styles that complement each other. The views from Buda are marvelous and provide a sense of what the city has been and continues ti be.

Great views. It is really a BIG tourist stop but it has GREAT views of Budapest and the Danube. You will be there with a few thousand of your closest Friends but enjoy the views. The earlier you get here the fewer "Friends" you will have.
Best view in town. Great scenery, especially in the evening when the sun goes down because the lights of the magnificent buildings are lit up just then the sun goes down
Fairy Tale.. Stunningly beautiful, Fishermans' Bastion is well worth a visit. There is a charge to walk along the ramparts but the views of the Danube are worth the cost.
Beautiful views!. A short distance behind the Budapest Hilton hotel with views of the Fisherman's Bastion. The area is very clean and easy to traverse. Enjoyed the brief visit!
A must visit in BP!. When you are in Budapest, don't forget to visit this place! Nice architecture and beautiful view of the city!

Like in fairy tale books. Definitely a must see!
Very beautiful castle and surroundings.
Nice view of the parliament and city center.
Must see the view from here. I have only one problem with this place. I do not understand why we have to pay for the entence. The building is nice, and the view of Budapest from here is wonderful

Gorgeous views. We stayed right next door at the Hilton and the bastion was a great place to hang out at night, once all the day trippers left. This is the absolute best vantage point to get stunning photos of the Parliament Building all lit up!
Beautiful views and photo highlights!. From here you overlook the city as well as have the opportunity to visit the historic church that is breath taking.

Beautiful!. Beautiful place with a great view! One can just sit there and take in the breathtaking view of the city from the top. If you're interested in the history then there's a 15 minute 3D movie that one can watch (at a minimal cost) to know more about the history of Hungary.
Beautiful views . Old castle that offers brilliant views across the Danube. Sometimes too crowded with tourists. Good to visit at sunset and have a drink while gazing across the Danube

FishermanBastion hmmm. The Fishermans Bastion sits along side of Matthias Church. Over 100 years old the wall and turrets offer an amazing view of Budapest. The perfect fantasy like medival experience. Wouldn't recommend the cost of the upper rampart, the view is just as good below.

Fisherman's Bastion. We visited the Fisherman's Bastion with a local guide on an excursion with Avalon River Cruises. The area is very picturesque with great views of both sides of the Danube River. Great photo op.
BEAUTIFUL. loved this palce in buda, its a must in buda. different than all those castles and way more pretty. picture-perfect.
Need to see!!!. Very beautiful place with a very beautiful view where you can eat and look at beautiful horizont of Budapest.

Stunning arcitecture and stunning views. Fisherman's Bastion overlooks the Danube from the Buda side of the river. We got there from central Pest where we were staying by walking across Chain Bridge and then catching the Siklo funicular railway. It doesn't take a huge amount of time to get around the Fisherman's Bastion but the architecture and the views of Budapest and beyond are stunning. It is a good idea to combine a visit here with the adjacent and beautiful Matthias Church.

Fantastic view - must see but don't pay. So, whatever camera you have during your trip - either a smartphone or fancy DSLR - you must go there, see the view - you would want to take photos and more photos. But no need to pay 400HUF something to go up to the balcony as it is not massively different (in terms of view) and 'paid area' is far too small - half of the area is occupied by cafes and restaurant so you are not allowed to to wonder around anyway. I had good time there with other ppl, took photos with each other's camera, share some tips about city (and camera skills etc), it's kind of spot you can mingle with anyone. Loved it!
Great Views. This is a great place forp hotos and just hanging about. The views up and down the hill are superb and you will take lots. Great hop on/ hop off bus service

Very beautiful. Fisherman's Bastion is a nice point to start your trip to see Budapest castle district. Its better to take bus 16 from Széchenyi István tér till Szentháromság tér. This will help you to avoid climb up the hill or waiting in the queue for Funicular. From this place its good to walk towards castle and then take the funicular to come down or just walk. Unfortunately, terraces in Fisherman's Bastion are now paid entry or there are few cafes where you can sit and enjoy the view of the Danube and Parliament.

Great spot to see the city and the river below. We spent about an hour here taking tons of photos of the city and the river. We also had ice cream at one of the gelato stands near the overlook. We had no trouble getting to a good place to take photos on a Monday - not sure about weekends. There are a multitude of shops in the area, but most are at tourist prices, of course.
Beautiful view!. Fisherman's Bastion offers beautiful views of the Danube and the Pest area during both the day and evening hours; however, the evening is our favorite time to visit.
Don't pay!!. Fisherman's Bastion is just a spot with a view, and there is a part you have to pay to get to and a part that's free. There is NO difference in the view! Go to the free part.

A small Disney castle. It was one of the first attractions visited and was quite impressed about it. It is like a mini castle of Disney movie and the church of Mathias is very nice, the tower is a must see. Also, the view from the bastion is very nice from where you can see Pesta.

Great view of the city. This is a must see of Budapest. The bastions themselves are great to see, but the view from the balcony is absolutely amazing.Try to be there early in the morning to avoid mass tourists and feel like you are alone in the city
Exceptional views. We hopped off the Hop On Hop Off bus and walked around for over an hour. The view from Fisherman's Bastion back over to Parliament are exceptional.

Budapest anniversary visit. Great views overlooking the Danube and the city but is certain to be busy. There is a fee to access the higher wall and turrets for the view which also gives a great opportunity for photographing the city.
A great view over the Danube. It's one of the good spots in the city to have a good view over the city and its very close to the church and the castle.
What a View of Pest. A visit to the Bastion is a must if you want to take photos from the panoramic side of Budapest. The view up and down the Danube and the view over Pest is incredible.

Incredible architecture . This is a tourist trap for a reason! The architecture and history of Fisherman's Bastion is amazing!!! There are coffee stops in every nook and cranny due to the amount of tourists. The views are incredible. Definitely a "must see" while in Budapest.
Nice. It has a great view of the city from the top it looks superb specially in the night will lights on. Its great to explore.its historical values

The view from Fisherman' Bastion, is the best we' ve ever seen in our life (especially at sunset). We had a gorgeous experience arriving there at sunset. The buildings started to light up in Pest and the Danube became blue. A fiddler was playing great songs and nobody wanted to live. Once for a life time.

Fabulous views. Took the tram ride up to the bastion and it has the best views by far. You overlook the Danube, chain bridge parliament building and can follow the river as far as your eye can see! It's lovely from all angles, there are cafes and bars at the top and it is perfect for absolute solitude. It was a great end to a fab trip.

Perfect Viewing Platform. A visit to the Bastion is a must if you want to take photos from the panoramic side of Budapest. Views up and down the Danube from the western side of the city, the Buda side, allows you to take in Margaret Island, Margit Bridge, Parliament, Chain Bridge, St Stephens Basilica ...and it's an easy stroll to the Royal Palace.
The best view of the city. It is a really beautiful place, together with the Matthias Church and it has the best views of the Pest side of the city.

Thronged with tourists, but still great views of Pest. The classical view is to stay in Pest because there is more going on and to have the views of Buda over the river. Certainly that worked well for my hotel, looking over the Danube to the castle. And yet one of the most popular, if not the most popular, viewpoint in Budapest looks over Pest. And it's worthwhile. Despite being very business with tourists, hawkers and all sorts of humanity, the views from here are great, particularly of the parliament building. The Bastion itself is also quite interesting and with the Mathas church right by it, it's definitely worth a visit. I just hope your phone battery doesn't die before you're done taking photos, like mine did :(
Breathtaking view. This is well worth a visit, although it does get busy the view of the city is well worth it. The best time to visit is sunrise or sunset
Fantastic views. The view from there is fantastic. Can see the Danube with the Parliament House and the city of Pest. But the bar at the top must be one of the most expensive in Budapest!

The View is Spectacular. Take the funicular to the top of the hill, and to your right is the Fisherman's Bastion. You've seen the views before on those Viking River Cruise commercials, but the real thing is far better. The Danube and the city are laid out before you, and you can see why the river has drawn so many expressions of love. Expect to see weddings taking place in good weather, but that's part of the fun.
Fishermans Bastion. Superb views. Next to the Mathias Church, well worth a visit - Do not pay to get the the upper levels, the view isn't any better
Stunning!. This was a fabulous place to visit. It has stunning views over Budapest. A few little restaurants and shops scattered about too.

Great to see from a distance. We enjoy seeing this from a distance (we lived on Buda Hill), but it isn't that interesting to see up close. The kids like how it looks at night. The views over Pest and the Danube (and the Parliament building) are nice.

Great views, but over-rated!!. Lovely views from the top, and a nice little bar to stop and get a beer (although was most expensive bar we went to on our trip). Great views over the river, over looking parliament, but not the best views of the city.

Beautiful but busy. The castle district was the busiest part of Bufdapest and the Fisherman's Bastion can get very crowded. Hardly surprising as it is a place that every tourist to Budapest must visit. It offers fantastic views of Pest on the other side of the Danube and in particular the Parliament building.You cannot get onto the places with the best views without having to pay but you can get equally good photos from the other viewpoints and it really is not worth paying. Some nice restaurants with good views. This is the place to people watch as the entire world seems to be here including the usual armys of Japanese tourists being organised by their tour guides.
Halaszbastya. Awesome views of Pest from Buda side, I recommend it. The visit is paid and there are a lot of bars/resturants around. It is located right next to Mathias' Church.
Great Views!. Great for a panoramic view of the Danube and city of Pest. Especially memorable at sunset when the Matyas church and Parliament across the river are lit up.

Good view . I didn't try any food but walked around the area. It was in the old part of Budapest. Lovely environment, really good view and lots of possibilities to take wonderful photos. Worth seeing!

Nice view. All my guide books said this site was free, but it is not. It will cost you money if you want to go up onto the upper level.
You can see the view on the lower level and it will not cost you anything.
Wonderful view but crowded. Wonderful views over the Parliament and the river, but usualy very crowded. Just be patient.... At the end it is worth the effort

Awesome towers. Very picturesque place and excellent for photos and grabbing an inexpensive bite for lunch. A little out of the way and only takes about an hour or two to experience. My only real complaint is that I felt like I was at Disney World. It felt too new and artificial a bit. The views are awesome and make sure you go to the restaurant in the tower for photos. Best views.
Cool But Don't Pay!!!. The views are priceless but don't bother paying for admission. If you go in the evening then it's free! Beautiful views of the Danube and Parliament!
Spectacular view at night. Go at night because the view is spectacular and it is free. Great view of lights of the city, the river, bridges and the parliament buildings
Like big sand castles. Lovely bastion, with a great view over the city. It costs to climb up during the day, but if you come later in the evening, you can see the city lights for free.
Worth a visit. I feel it was overrated for its view. I got better views of the city from the castle than here. But the place itself is still beautiful and worth a visit.

A great photo opportunity. Don't pay to go on the walls, it is not worth it.. This place is a wonderful viewpoint over the city of Budapest and overlooks the whole of the Pest side and the Parliament buildings. It is a wonderful place to take your holiday snaps.

Beautiful view. It is beside St. Matthias church. It gives you a panorama view of the pesh side of the city. It cost entrance fee to go all the way at the top. It's up to you to decide if you wanna go or not.
Great Point of view. The place is wonderful, the visit outside (free area) is enough for this attraction. Have a nice walk!

Must visit while in Budapest. Either during the day or at night - preferably both - this place is a must visit. Special athmosphere, very romantic, full of history. great place to walk, to enjoy the beautiful view, visit some good museums and have to eat (if you are willing to pay the price).

Another must in Budapest. On the Buda side of the river, up a lot of steps, you will find Fisherman's Bastion. It is an impressive building on its own, but the views of the city and the parliament are awesome as well.

Such a beautiful place. Such a beautiful location !! Excellent opportunity for amazing photos. The cable car up however ia really expensive when you can take a short cut and walk up for about 5 minutes and your there!! Something alot of people dont know. We also realised its a good location for weddings
So beautiful at night!. We got there around nightfall and it was so beautiful! Everything just glowed and it was nice and peaceful.

Delightful. It is great to spend the day walking around and getting to know the archtecture. I arrived early in the morning and was able to walk around with not so many visitors. Defenitaley worth visiting.

The view from anywhere is the Fisheman's Bastion over the Danube is wonderful.. While the Fisherman's Bastion is interesting and very picturesque it does not have any historical significance it is more a 19th century fantasy creation.

Beautiful architecture; lovely area. One day in Budapest we walked to the Castle District. It's a very beautiful area and great for a day of walking around looking at the lovely city. The funicular was closed when we were there so we climbed the stairs to the Castle and the Fisherman's Bastion and really enjoyed looking across the Danube at the beautiful views of Pest and the attractions on the Castle side. A definite must see when in Budapest…especially if you enjoy doing cities by foot as we do.

A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!. We took the hop on hop off to the castle station and went on the lift up. The walk over to the bastion is around 20 mins from there. The view is simply breathtaking! Didn't pay to walk inside it but there's few good sighting spots. A must. Definitely!

Amazing Complex of Historic Importance. On the Buda-side of the city, the Fishermen's Bastion. The bastion is a neo-Gothic folly built as a viewing platform in 1905. The Lonely Planet informed that the name came from the medieval guild of fishermen responsible for defending this stretch of castle wall. On top of this hill which compose of various attractions, hotels, restaurants, and various scenic lookout points. The FB must be the top site for tourists to visit when they arrive in Budapest. The best time to visit must be in late afternoon since the weak sun and the outdoor activities around the FB welcome the visitors well.
Thumbs up. A must see. . Amazing architecture and beautiful views. Don't miss out on this one. You can almost see the whole city from one vantage point. Spectacular.

Viewpoint with a price point . Historic and beautiful, Fisherman's Bastion is a part of an organized complex that is situated on top of the Castle Hill district. While the perspective is beautiful and contextualized with a historical viewpoint, we were charged a small fee for what might be otherwise experienced without payment on other vantage points.Pleased, but not.
Beautiful on the outside. Not worth the money, its sheap but it litterally is a walkway with a lenght of 100m. You can see everything as well without having to pay for it.
Very Beautiful. Nice to walk around the whole are, beautiful 14th century Church (Mtthias Church), go inside. Have a drink at one of the cafes and enjoy the views of the city and Parliament.

Amazing view over history. My family and I took a long day trip from Vienna to Budapest. It is a city filled with amazing history.Castle Hill and the Fisherman's Bastion is a very neat area. There are great restaurant's up there, interesting shops, and of course exceptional historical architecture.
Great view. An amazing piece of architecture overlooking Budapest with a great view of the city and the Danube,.
Nice View. It has a nice view from the above of the building. You can see the city from Buda site. Beautiful landscape.
Good stroll and view over the city. The walk last about 30 min and you'll pass by many shops and beautiful spot to take amazing pictures.
Magnificent!. Such a beautiful and unique place overlooking the river. It felt like I was walking through a fairytale!
wow!. I liked the atmosphere of space and place. Nice place to travel for a while in another era.THERES NO ENTRY FEE.
Photo op!. Beautiful view from at the top... They have little shops in and around this area, and gelato as well..... The family and I enjoyed the view!
Must see. Beautiful! A must visit when in Budapest. Lovely stunning views of the city, historical building and great location with bars/restaurants nearby as well as shops.

Nice but it's not worth paying to go in!. The place is nice and you pay just to have a "better" view of the city (which you actually don't). Not worth paying and wasting your time for a 3 min walk. You can have a great view of the city from many other places.

Good Pest views from a uniquely designed terrace with turrets located behind Matthias Church. Fisherman's Bastion and Matthias Church were the two drawing points for us to go to Buda Castle hill. Rather than take public transportation or the funicular at Clark Adam ter, we walked up from a ramped path just past the Clark Adam round about. This path was free and easy to find as it has a lovely arched patio and planted flower beds at its entry. The path led to an escalator and elevator which opened at the gardens of the Castle. We could see the lovely fountains and courtyard of the castle as we passed through it. From the castle grounds, it was a 15 minute walk to Fisherman's Bastion. The white stone Bastion was placed at the edge of Buda hill along the backside of Matthias Church. Very convenient for tourists to see 2 attractions minutes apart! The Bastion had 2 viewing areas - one was from a free balustraded balcony on the square; the other required a payment and a walk through a turnstile to walk up a few steps to the turrets and the terrace viewing areas. No difference in the views, IMO, of Margaret's Island, the Parliament, St. Stephen's spire, the bridges on the Danube, and even a glimpse of Gellert Hill. From the square, the 7 turrets/towers added interest to Fisherman's Bastion so called because fishermen in the medieval ages were responsible for guarding/defending this part of Buda hill. These white turrets had an interesting appearance - long conical roof tops placed on a round base with many arched glass-free openings for viewing the panorama in the distance. The 7 turrets were to represent the 7 Magyar tribes who had settled in Hungary after following a black raven out of Eastern Europe in the Dark Ages. While the Bastion, built in the early 1900s for decorative purposes, had been heavily bombed in WWII, its present appearance belied that fact - all restored and a beautiful sight in itself now.On the square, between the Bastion and Matthias Church, stood a large bronze statue of Stephan I, the first Hungarian king, sitting on his horse. The good sized pedestal on top of which the statue was placed contained carved scenes illustrating his life. After our visit we walked down the hill - about 10 minutes - to the town below where there was a transportation hub. We used a wide staircase located on the square at the back of Matthias church and just kept using stairs all the way down. Later that evening our river cruise ship sailed along the Danube from which we were able to see the Fisherman Bastion and Matthias Church all lit up - a glorious sight. One of our memorable visits to Buda.

City Views and great ambience. It is an interesting walk to the area passing through some nice stores. Most of them are local handicrafts and souvenirs. The views once you climb up the steps are a sheer delight.We spent a fair amount of time there soaking in the views and taking pictures. It is an architecturally aesthetic place.
Well worth climbing all the steps. Great view out over the river and the parliament building. definitely worth a visit if you are in the area

Visit while you are at Castle Hill. Try to go on a clear day to get a great view of the city. The view is similar to that from the Citidel. It is next to Matthias Church so plan on visiting both. Wonderful view of the city, the Danube and the bridges.

One of the symbols of Budapest. It is on the Buda hill, in the Castle district. You have the most wonderful view from there. It was very funny, that they collect money for the panorama! If you want to get to the upper level, you have to pay! Ridicolous! You have the same view from the lower level too. But the bastion itself is very nice too.

Beautiful Afternoon. Spent an hour exploring. Spend the 2 euros admittance to get up the wall and get breathtaking photos of the river and the city. There was a wedding going on when we were there do we didn't get to see the church.
Pretty view. A neat building with a pretty view. Don't bother paying the bottom level is always free and the top is after 9pm. Prettier to look up at from below.

WONDERFUL BUDAPEST . Beautiful! we enjoyed the amazing views
. The history is so interesting. I would highly recommended this site.

Great views , worth a visit. Really worth a visit when in Budapest. the area ( old little village) surrounding the bastion so charming. stunning place really. have a walk from downtown, really nice day out !

Great views of Pest.. We walked around the castle district and enjoyed the quiet streets and cafes away from the tourist centers. The Fisherman's Bastion was busy, but the views were excellent. We did not pay to go to the top of the walls. just looked out from the public lower section

Great view of Pest. This area by St. Mathias provides a great view, but don't waste your money on the entry ticket. Instead, move all the way to the left (north?) side and climb the stairs to the cafe in the small tower. You can move around up there with less crowds and the same view as if you paid to walk along the basion to the right.

Beautiful architecture and great views of the city. Fisherman's Bastion is a part of the castle district in Budapest. To reach it you can either take a bus or fernicular. We had the Bupdapest 24hr ticket so we took the bus. I'm not sure about the stop but it will drop you very close to the attraction.There is a fee to go up to the small watch towers but even from below you can get great views of the city.
nice. One of the famous spots of Budapest with a nice view over Pest side. Easy to reach by bus no 16. Recommended.
Picturesque. Set in a lovely area but very touristy and busy, stunning views over Budapest. Go up in the funicular as the walk up is steep then take a leisurely walk back down

So beautiful in summer or winter. The Fisherman's Bastion is located high on the Hill in Buda overlooking the Danube and Pest. Both parts of this wonderful city are so different from one another. Buda is quaint, quiet and picturesque with stunning views. In winter the landscape is transformed into a fairyland with knee deep snow. In summer the Danube sparkles below. Wandering around the old streets in the area of Listz makes the trip to Buda quite special.

Don't Miss the View from Fisherman's Bastion. This is one of those do not miss locations in Budapest. Be prepared for crowds at times but the entire area is enjoyable offering great views of the Pest side of the Danube.
Wanted more time here!. This area has several things to see/do. Not good in rainy or foggy weather as you'll miss the spectacular panoramic views.

Hidden Gem. Once you have had a walk round and marvelled at the view across the Danube to Pest, it is worth a walk round the village. I would have loved to have gone back and tried one of the many restaurants

Beautiful with amazing views. Definite spot to bring a nice camera and take some nice pictures of Budapest. You could do the hike from the bottom of the mountain all the way to the top and you'd get quite a touristy walk.

Best views of Budapest. Anyone who saw the most recent film based on LeCarre's "Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Spy" will recognize the views from this hill in Buda looking toward the Parliament Building in Pest. The views are amazing and it's worth coming to see the buildings as well as the views, even in rain or snow.

Great view. As expected the view from here is amazing. You can see all the parliament buildings and other sights of Budapest. We were here during the day but night view would be amazing. Very busy place with tourists everywhere.
Nice looking restaurant up here but we didn't eat there so not sure of the food quality.
Nice spot. I were here twice for my short visit to Budapest. The first in the morning and the second in the evening. Enjoyed the view and the atmosphere here for both visits

Some of the best views you will get of the city.. I took the walk to this place my partner took the lift we found this area Buda of Budapest to be a lot cleaner than the pest side the views from the Bastion are amazing I paid a small fee to access the top part which closes around 7 or 8pm I think not sure you get the best views from here, you can get good views from below for free and there is no time restraint, I found an hour was plenty for me here there is restaurants and shops around area and the matyas church is only feet away.
Views. The views of Budapest from here are amazing. Walk or funicular to get to the top as buses aren't allowed up anymore.

What a beautiful place... A visit to Budapest is not complete without time spent around the Fisherman's Bastion. We spent a good part of the day walking around it and the views of the rest of the City and the Danube is breath-taking. It was a beautifully sunny day which helped. Well recommended!
One of the best vantage points in Budapest. This place has one of the best views of Pest from Buda side. Located in the castle district, this is definitely a must to visit while in Budapest
A UNESCO World Heritage Site. The church, the bastion and the square make a unifed whole with an incredible view of the Danube set against the city. Climb around, explore, enjoy.

Gorgeous views from the Buda side of Budapest. This is the perfect location to get a good view of the entire pest side of Budapest.
The restaurants around this are pretty upscale.
Very very clean and an architectural beauty

Great views of the city. Make the journey !. Absolutely great views of the city. Truly spectacular. I could have spent hours here just watching the city. It's very photogenic and a nice atmosphere. Well worth the visit.

Awesome views. Definitely worth taking a look around
here. Fantastic views, awesome statues. Did a walking tour with a group. Interesting stories.

Beautiful landmark!. This was an easy place to reach. We took Bus #16 from in front of the Ritz Carleton. It dropped us off at the top of the hill, and we meandered around taking pictures. We also bought a guided tour for the Matthias Church. It is a good idea to get here early to beat the crowds. There are shops in this area as well as restaurants. We also took an elevator down from this area to see the Hospital in the Wall. When we left the area, we took a tram down the mountain, and then walked to the Market on the other side of the river.

Beautiful views of the Danube. This whole area is steeped in incredible history and there are tons of things to see here. The views offered from the Bastion overlooking the Danube and the Parliament are breahtaking.

Simply Stunning. A must visit.. Such a beautiful piece of architecture and history. A lovely place to spend the day or half day if you don't want to explore the village. Be sure to check out the wine tasting experience located under the bastion. You can access it via the side of hilton hotel.

Beautiful building and views. From the other side of the river, this building is beautiful. From inside the building gives great views. Plan to have a drink here. The tables in the cafe look out over the river and city and there is a welcome cooling breeze. Prices very good.

Pretty, but packed with tourists. Fisherman's Bastion was as gorgeous as we expected, with an amazing view, but we were pretty packed in with all of the tour groups - many of whom wouldn't leave room for others to move and take photos. Not that this is the fault of the attraction, but it's something to be prepared for if you visit in summer.

The best view is from the water!. As you cruise the Danube, Fisherman's Bastion is most attractive!We saw this by day & by night and lit up it looks magical!The next day, we took the Funicular up the hill and walked to the Bastion. A beautiful walk and the shops along the walk were pretty cool, some good ice cream and coffee places as well.The white is dazzling and on the hot day we went, nearly blinding! But the views of the bastion and from the bastion are just amazing!!Plan to walk a lot, there are other things nearby and you will end up spending a few hours here. Take the funicular up and walk to the bastion 1st and then make your way to the Castle and the rest and walk back down. The lemonade or beer at the stall near the entrance will be heavenly!
My favourite place from Budapest!. Great architecture,when you are visiting this place you feel like you are like in a dream with kings and queens; the view of Budapest is breath taking; it's a must!

Don't get caught out. I mistakenly paid the entrance fee to see the view from the walls. However this was a waste of time, they only give a small section of the wall. If you go to the left of the church you can go up on the walls for free.
Fisherman. The building is not too big, but you can a nice photo and drink a nice wine in the Restaurant which is in the Bastion

Excellent View! The history makes it even better. Amazing panoramic views of Budapest. On the Buda side of the city, up the Castle hill. Some of the nuances mentioned to us – 7 towers represent the 7 Magyar tribes, fisherman defended it in the Middle Ages (hence the name) and it is close to the Matthias Church.

Beautiful and Hogwarts-like. This architecture could be part of Hogwarts. It is so beautiful. There is a wonderful atmosphere here especially at night time when people gather to watch the day become the night - and the city lights up.
One of the best views. So much to see and do from this wonderful point in Budapest. It's worth see the old and new builds and learning the history of the amazing city.

Stunning and Awesome viewing point on the city!. We came by the Fisherman’s Bastion for a view of the beautiful turrets, after visiting the Mattias Church that is just located next to it (please refer to my earlier review of this church here too).It was sunny but windy here and there is shelter here (or you may go into the restaurant cafe and order a drink and see the city from another angle)This place was full of crowds as everyone would want to come here to snap photos on the city or at least selfie or wefie using the view of the city as a backdrop. Without much doubt, this place is one of the best and most ideal, if not the best, for a view on the Budapest city. Take note of the narrow walkway though but people here were orderly and took turns to take photograph.From the top, you will get an unblocked view overseeing both the new and old towns being linked by the Chain bridge, the Danube River and gorgeous Parliament buildings etc.The views here at stunning and awesome, so beautiful and this is a must visit place when you visit Budapest and you will regret only if not coming here!Highly Recommended.
Week in Budapest . This place is one the place you just must see at evening time. Great view to city and river. The restaurangs are expensive so cannot recommend those...

Excellent views of the river Danube and the Houses of Parliament. One of the highlights of the visit to Budapest is visiting the old city on top of the Buda hills called the Vár, which means castle. The best way to get there is to take a 4 or 6 tram to the terminus at what used to be called MOSZKVA TER now Széll Kálmán tér and then use the escalator to catch a 16 bus (also at the terminus) to Szentharomsag ter where the beautiful coronation church of St Matthew stands with its colourful roof. There is a statue of St Stephen sitting on a horse in front of the church and the Fishermen's Bastion.I recommend you take a seat inside the Fishermen's Bastion and order a drink so that you can enjoy the beautiful views through the arches. I had an espresso but you might like a lemonade which is much more expensive. Sometimes there is Hungarian gipsy music being played which adds to the special atmosphere of the place.

Fabulous views over the city and Parliament but crowded with tourists. Visited initially about 10am and it was already crowded with tours and other visitors. Later it was even more crowded. Had to admire the Chinese gentleman who moved everyone out of the way so he could have his picture take in solitary splendour. Views were great and the other attractions up there made it a very worthwhile day. Don't miss St Matthias Church and the Hospital in the rock.

Beautiful architecture . Beautiful architecture. Must visit if you are passing by. Tend to be overly crowded with many tourists including myself, can get a little frustrating but still worth the trip.
Review the city from top. Great place to visit at Budapest. i enjoined a lot there, you also will see all Budapest and river from there.

It's worth the time and money. A very friendly girl invited me for this 3D experience in the Halászbástya. In the hőt weather this 15 minutes in the cave is very good. The experience is fantastic. I visited similar movies in the states and in Rome. But this was much better.

Amazing. Amazing view from the top of the towers and unique architecture design of the entire complex. Definitely a must-see.
The Mathias church is also very close, so you can visit it as well.
Beautiful overlook!. This is up on the hill overlooking the Danube. The view is beautiful! It is behind the Hilton and the cathedral. Several small restaurants there for a picturesque lunch.
Stunning viewing point . Great place and no matter the amount of crowds you will always find a perfect spot to take a great selfie or panorama view of the city

Amazing views!. Lovely place to take in the views and take pictures!
We also had the hot chocolate in the restaurant... was so yummy
What a view!. The view from the Fisherman's Bastion of the river and the city is amazing. You can see Parliament and the whole area over the Danube.
great view.. very touristic. but: great view, nice relaxed atmosphere. wonderful view over Pest with the Parliament.

Worth a visit. Fantastic architecture and amazing views! Shame they charge to go on top the wall, but the views from the lower windows are beautiful well worth a visit if your on the Buda side of the danube
Excellent views. Only 400 Ft for students (show ID). Very picturesque, although buying a ticket only allows you to go up some of it. Go at sunset for best views
The view was amazing. The view from Fisherman's Bastion was amazing. It was basically free of charge, but if you wanted to walk on the wall it cost a couple of euros.

Wonderful view and ambiance. The view over the Danube from this location is stunning and the milling around of umpteen nationalities adds a joyful ambiance to the site. We visited on a Saturday afternoon to find the higher viewing closed due to a wedding.

Spectacular Views Here. Gorgeous views of Pest across the Danube from atop this. The seven towers represent the seven founders of Budapest. It sits on the top of castle hill near the Matthias Church. It is also visible from the Danube and the shore in Pest.

Big surprise for me. I didn't know what to expect, but this is a must see spot if you are visiting Budapest. The view from the ramparts is simply spectacular. As I was standing on the walls it came to me, it looks like Gondor in Lord of the Rings. The adjacent Saint Stephens Cathedral is very impressive as well.

Amazing place to stare one of the most beautiful views ever!. Beautiful sky with beautiful weather. Then you look at these historical structures in the area. Any place you take a picture at, is just perfect! Then you look down upon the river. Beautiful. You look at those buildings over the river. Amazing. I mean...it is like...you have to go to Fisherman's Bastion if you are visiting Budapest. Otherwise, you need to revisit this place.

Buda's magic. Most of the attractions are on the top of Buda Hill, so enjoy. The fisherman Bastion is really cool as it is the fortress of the city and it encircled the majestic basilic.The view is also majestic!

Great views. On the Buda side in the Castle district,Fishermans Bastion is adjacent to the picturesque St Mathias church.You get a great view of Pest and the Danube.There is a small charge or you could eat on the upper level to get an unrestricted view.

Beautiful views in spite of confusing signage. We had a really nice time taking pictures at Fisherman's Bastion, and the shade was a welcome respite from the heat, but our primary frustration from the visit was that we couldn't find the entrance and ticket queue for the attraction.
What a view from Buda to Pest. This is a great place to take pictures of the river and the city of Pest across from Buda. You will see the difference in the two cities that are now considered one.

Fairytale castle scenery. Stayed at the Hilton in Buda & had fantastic views of the Fishermans Bastion from the breakfast room. This also meant we could stroll around it a dawn & dusk which was particularly pretty with fewer crowds. The Bastion area is a walkway along the hillside providing stunning views across the Danube into Pest & at night, an illuminated Parliament building. There are nooks, stairwells & statues a plenty and we were never charged to access any area though this may be as we went very early or very late. Great photo opps & fairytale romantic. The surrounding area of Castle hill is also worth a visit.

Actually looks better from the river!. If you are in the Castle Hill area do visit - we paid for a ticket with our Matthias Church ticket so we could visit the upper terrace but no one checked tickets so I don't know if you have to pay or not! Views are excellent across the river but, for the best views of the Fisherman's Bastion, you need to be down at the river!

Great view, but not worth the money. We had to pay 800 Hu. to get up 1 stair and walk 100 meter... like really? The view was great, but if you walk 100 meter further to the north you could have seen the same view for free... really strange.
Amazing view. Architectural gem with an amazing view. Nice place to take pictures. Free admission. Definitely worth a detour!

One of the most beautiful attractions in Budapest.. One of the most beautiful attractions in Budapest. Very big and with beautiful views over the city. It has bars too where you cand relax and have a coffee after long walks, and enjoy the landscape at the same time.

Beautiful Architecture. This is a beautiful part of Budapest. It affords lovely views over the city, and the architecture is amazing! It can be accessed by a funicular railway for a small fee, or by a walk up the hillside by path or steps. Any way you get there, this is a 'must do'.
Must See in Budapest. This a must see when in Budapest - historic site and ideal to linger around for a few hours. The caste district is beautiful

Perfect place to look at the Danube . I have visited this place several times during my stay in here, and it does have an amazing view. The only 'problem' I have with this place is that during summer they charge a fee to go upstairs, whilst they don't during winter... I get is the high season, but it still feels somehow unnecessary. There is also a couple of bars in there which are definitely worth a visit just for the relaxing and nice view.
Its a must. You definetely have to visitit. Very nice area with good view if the budapest. Clean and well looked after area
More hype than substance. An interesting building with significant history and it does give you great views over the Danube but you need not allow a lot of time. 30 minutes is sufficient
Spectacular views. Loved this spot, happy to wander around up the top for quite some time, expensive area for shops but great views
Amazing architecture . Amazing view from this site, enjoyed the wonderful architecture of this building. We told the hill tram to the top which was very inexpensive.

Best views of the coty. This place is very picturesque and has the best views of the city but we warned that you have to pay (all be it around £2) just to get onto the main bit! Worth the trip up just to see it and the views!
Great view of the city. Visited on organised tour. Brilliant for view across the city. Busy spot for tourists. Large cafe below the viewing terrace.
Perfect view, perfect photo opportunities. One of the must sees in beautiful Budapest. Special tip: enjoy the atmosphere and changing lights at the sunset.

stunning with awesome views. I was last here about 30 years ago and it was very different. Now they charge you to walk into various parts of the bastion instead of the whole thing being free. That was disappointing.

Amazing view of Budapest, plus the castle itself is very nice. Its a white castle, I have never seen a white castle before. It looks like a castle from a story. The castle is on the other side of the river and at hight. This gives a nice view of central Budapest and the Parliament.

Beautiful location. From here, you've a great view of the city and the Danube. If you want to go to Fisherman's Bastion, you don't need to buy a ticket if you don't want to. There's also a possibility to take a path which leads you there.

Fotogenické miesto / Photogenic place. Veľmi fotogenické miesto z ktorého sú zaujímavé výhľady na Dunaj a mesto. Priplatiť si môžete za vyhliadku, ktorá je asi o 3 metre vyššie ako tá, ktorá je zdarma. Zvážte sami. Very photogenic place from which are interesting views of the Danube and the city. You can pay extra for the prospect, which is about three meters higher than the one that is free. Consider yourself.

Must visit!. Awesome place. We ubered it to the top as we were traveling with the 7 month old. It was nice hot day lots of tourist. The service at ticket station is not the greatest but awesome view points. We paid extra for 2 of us to climb the bell tower..of course without the baby and it was so worth it ! I have done that in London and Florence before so always enjoy walking the stairs for the panorama view! On the way back we took the funicular because no wi Fi to call Uber. The staircase is not so bad either ..coming down only takes about 10 min!

Fairy tale building. Very beautiful building, with a lovely view of Pest.
Lovely photo op!
The Buda castle area is a must-do, to get an idea of Hungarian history. Lovely hilltop views, quiet streets, excellent cafes.
One can easily spend a relaxing day here, taking in the beautiful Mathias church too.
Easy walk back to Pest, across the chain bridge.

Don't miss the view & no need to buy a ticket!. Fisherman's Bastion is a great spot from Buda to enjoy the scenic view of the Danube and Pest. The building nice but Matthias Church is the winner here. When there, make sure to stop at the marzipan store there and treat yourself to some yummies!

Beautiful vista. This is a beautiful way to spend an afternoon in Budapest. The castle and fishermans bastion are very lovely and offer wonderful views of the city and the Danube. It can be a bit crowed so you may want to visit early in the days to avoid crowds.
Beautiful location during the day and also at night. This place is striking and atmospheric. The views are amazing and the music being played by local musicians adds to the atmosphere.

Disney Castle: Great view, clean, awesome place!. This is the castle which inspired Walt Disney to create the iconic Disney Castle that is seen in the intro to all Disney movies, and at Disney world. You can climb up to the top of the (mountain) pretty short climb or take a tram/cable car thing up to the top, where there is the presidents palace and then the as you walk around you will come accoss the Fisherman's Bastion. This is one of the stops on the Sandeman's free walking tour.
Great view. Great view. Easy to park and friendly guides. Restaurant and guides available and even a Starbucks coming soon

Offers wonderful views of the Parliament building. Standing on the opposite side of the Danube, the Fisherman's Bastion is a very picturesque spot and offers great views of the impressive Parliament building.

Good for photos but not necessary. Great views but really for 1500 HUF you can see the same in many other areas on the hillside and if you do the Tower tour (297 steps) up the church - you'll trump the views altogether.
Views to die for. Worth the trip and views over the town and the Danube that rival anywhere in the world. Shops, cafes and restaurants and the a view like no other.

Undone by wedding booking. The place offers a good view but the view is similar to what you see from Buda Castle. The upper part was booked for a wedding when we went, so couldn't see it from there but had a good view from between the barriers. Restaurant next to it which can offer a similar view, so I recommend that you can eat/drink and enjoy the view from there.
Gorgeous. The views are breathe taking. Highly suggest you make it here if in Budapest. On a sunny day it is almost too beautiful. You won't believe your eyes

You must see this for yourself!!!. This was my second time visiting this attraction. When you visit Budapest, you must come here and see it first hand. The pictures simply don't do it justice!. The views from this site are amazing and there are many photo opportunities here. You will find an awesome view of the Hungarian Parliment building from this site. It is great to visit during the day or evening. There are also many restaurants nearby and other attractions to see. Please don't miss this one while in Budapest!

Fisherman?. It is really nothing to be seen and I really cannot believe that somebody is paying to climb a few stairs to the wall for a "better" look on the City downhill. The only thing about this place is that it is located next to the Mattias church
Fabulous views of the city. An interesting construction beside Matthias Church. Wonderful views up and down the river and across to Pest.

Amazing view,well worth a visit. Lovely spot near the church and the castle to stop and appreciate the city from the Buda side. Amazing view of Parliament, the Danube and all of the river traffic. Several small bar areas where you can grab a beer a rest a while.
Do not miss this historic site!. Walk everywhere! Photograph! Eat or have a drink, too. International visitors abound. Feel a part of history. Grand architecture, too.

Incredible experience !!! . This hotel was fantastic. Not only did it over very nice facilities but also the location was great ideal for a romantic trip. Out room on the 3rd floor had view of one side of the bastion. We were on fe executive floor. Also the lounge in the 3rd floor have a view to die for!!! It offered a snack/dinner from 6 to 8:30 which was very convenient to relax and have some snack or dinner if you like to have early dinner. Menu was good and included healthy options.Breakfast was nice nothing special but what you will expect from a Hilton. Location and the room were the best! Don't miss it if you are looking for a romantic get away.

Stunning views. A short walk from the castle grounds is the Fisherman's Bastion. The views from here are spctacular. The towers have a small charge to enter, but the terraces are free. Well worth an hour or two!

Simply stunning . Pictures and words cannot describe the beauty of this wonderful place. This is a 'must do' for any visitor. Not only does the architecture and decorations will make your mouth drop in wonder ... The view to the Danube river and Parliament is incredible. Allow yourself at least a good half hour to just sit and soak in every viewpoint possible.
Wonderful view of Pest. This place is a must to visit is close to Buda castle and next to the Matthias Church it offers great views and a from a restaurant or a cafe on top of the walls

Great Viewing Point over the Danube. Located behind the Matthias Church a terrace overlooking the Danube, opposite the Parliament Building.The domes representing the medieval fisherman's tents which once stood nearby. The terrace affords excellent views over the Danube.

Stunning Cityscapes and Beautiful Architecture. Loved our time here and wish we hadn't been so rushed with the need to catch our bus. This edifice was built, like much of the city in 1896 to celebrate the 1000th anniversary of the Magyars. But what does it have to do with Fishermen? In Magyar times this was where fishermen docked their boats and if the city was attacked, then the fishermen were responsible for fighting off the enemy in this area. So basically, its a gorgeous 120 year old photo opportunity, but definitely lovely and worth a visit. the people (and tourist) watching is spectacular.

No Fisherman But Beautiful. This site is a must when visiting Buda(pest). You can easily take public transportation to most locales including this one. Get a day pass, it is well worth it. The views are fantastic. It gets quite crowded so get there early in the day if you can. Enjoy, Enjoy!
Magical. No one should miss a walk around these beautiful stone turrets. I can't get enough of the views of this place or the night view of Parlement from here.

Worth the Climb for the Views. Gorgeous views of the city, totally worth while, though there is really not much to see in the actual Bastion . Note that, the ATM in front of it give a very bad rate for euro to HUF, so unless absolutely needed don't use it there.
Perfect. We really liked it, easy to find it, easy transportation, if you visit budapest, you HAVE to go there....amazing place for taking photos

What a view!. This part of the Buda side of the city offers very good views of the Pest side from above and a great view of the Parliament. There is not a lot to see in just the Fisherman's Bastion, but there are good restaurants nearby, the beautiful tiled church neaerby and sometimes a falconer with his bird which you can hold for 4 euros. Also nearby in the Hilton nearby is the remains of a monastery and park.

A high climb. We walked up and up from our hotel on the Danube as once we started, we not going to quit!Being a sunny Sunday afternoon, the area was unsurprisingly crowded and busy. But we did enjoy great views down over the city.The disappointing aspect was that most of the best vantage points were taken up by restaurants and naturally they charging tourist prices. Whilst one may expect that, at triple the cost of elsewhere is a tad distasteful!But we glad we got up there, enjoyed the views, just wish we brought our own drink!
Bastion with a view. Lovely views of the City. Catch a bus.Take a leisurely stroll call into one of the cafes or a bar. Try a Hungarian crafted beer.

Fisherman's Bastion. we saty hilton hotel. fishermans bastion next to our hotel .Fishermen's Bastion is only 100 years old, and is a favorite lookout. In medieval times, the fish market was nearby and the bastion was built to commemorate the fishermen who protected this part of the city

Exterior visit of Fisherman's Bastion. As part of our Budapest tour we visited the Fisherman's Bastion and the surroundings. It is a marvel of architecture. The building is beautiful from the Pest side when looking up across the Danube and also a fantastic vue from the Bastion looking down to Pest side and the Parliament.

Beautiful Views. Definitely include this spot on your itinerary, but unless you're with kids or have an otherwise compelling reason to climb extra stairs, save your Florints and stick to the 90% of the area that's free to visit. You actually can get the same climb and the same lovely views by skipping the entry point to the right as you face the river and climb by way of the stairs on the left which lead to the bar and restaurant area. Same climb, same view, free. There is no need to buy a drink and the outdoor restaurant itself was actually closed and being reconfigured for a wedding when I was there.

Beautifiul site, crawling with toursits. Striking romantic architecture. Best part is the views down to the Parliament, across the Danube. So think with tourists it's hard even to get a picture. But fairly abandoned at night, with great night views of the Pest side
So worth Visiting. This was at the end of a seven day cruise down the Danube. A great way to end a week was to be on the Buda side of Budapest for a day.

Sightseeing. Went across the bridge to view the sights in Castle hill and luckily there was a wedding taking place near the Bastion. Lovely to watch a Hungarian Wedding. Fisher mans Bastion well worth a visit.
Gorgeous view. Spend a half day strolling around the area---lots of little shops and beautiful church. Interesting history! Graf place for panorama pictures of the city.

A Nice view of the Danube and Pest. Site is in the Castle District. If you are on the Pest side, it's a nice walk/climb to this bastion which gives you a panoramic view of the other side of the river. Gets crowded if you want to take pics.

Great to see but don't pay the fee. It's nice to see this but don't spend money to be up there. The view is as good a little further and free. You should really go and look at this but just from a distance. The church nearby is really interesting

Beautiful, but very busy. The fisherman's bastion is gorgeous, and right next to Matyias Church - so definitely worth a visit. Parts of it are free to visit; other parts you do need to pay a ticket price for (it's pretty cheap). I was a little disappointed by how busy it was with tourists, and how rude some of them were - I'd say for most of the big sites, make the effort to get up early and avoid the crowds. It's also open pretty late though, and gives you a great view.

Blown away. This is certainly a very special place. The architecture and the buildings are absolutely amazing. Go up the steps and be blown away by the incredible views of Budapest . This is a must do.

Fantastic High-Point View of the City.. Interesting architecture providing MANY spectacular views of Budapest. Portions of the upper level require an admission fee, but almost equal views available for free.
best views of city. great place to walk around and see the city. the view of the city is easier to see from here than Gellert hill.

Great views. We enjoyed walking around at night. Stunning views. Extremely quiet compared to attractions in Rome, Athens, Prague, etc. We felt like we had the place almost to ourselves. Very beautiful and extremely clean and well-kept.
A lovely view of the city from here. Fisherman's bastion is a beautiful place . It is on top of a hill and is an old structure with amazing architecture. it is a must visit
Spectacular view. The assent by stair is worth the effort. The view of the Pest is beautiful. Many important sites including the Parliament Building and several beautiful bridges.
Good view . We walked all the way up the hill to get there, well worth it for the view. The only thing that spoil it is the new hotel right next to it
Great viewing location. Set high above the river on the Buda side the location makes for an ideal position to appreciate the layout of the city.

Not very impressive. Do not buy a ticket to this attraction. The ticket gives you access to the right had side of the walkway but you can access the left had side for free. There is a coffee shop on the left hand side that is at the top of a small tower. This is the best view and it is free.

A must see!. If you are visiting Budapest you have to make a stop here! I would say it's the reason you visit; architecture that duplicates a magical fairytale. Extremely well kept area, always busy no matter what time of day and the view is amazing!

We made it on an E bike tour!. You probably already know that this is a Buda must do, and the views are spectacular, including the impressive Matthias Church. What made it special for us is we made it to the top on an E bike tour. We are not avid bicyclists, and we are not anywhere near being considered young, so the thought of surmounting the castle hill was questionable. Surprisingly though, our guide led all 4 of us to the top with just moderate effort and the reward was well worth it. The view of the Danube river, with its many bridges, and the Pest side of the city beyond, puts it all into perspective.

Worth the hike up the hill - beautiful views of the Danube and Pest. It's quite a climb to get to the top (you can always take the funicular or a taxi) but worth it for the views. If you walk in the summer - take a hat and a bottle of water. It get's warm in the afternoon.

Excellent views of Pest. This is free (during the off-season, I believe there's a small fee during the high season) and offers amazing views across the river, to the Pest side of the city, of the Parliament, the Basilica, etc. Definitely recommend!
Cool view. Neat place. They will nickel and dime you to see everything there, but was beautiful. We really enjoyed out time at the location.
Views. Well worth wandering and enjoying THE views of the city A wedding was being held on the ramparts and certainly not surprised
Fairy tale turrets. A beautiful area to wonder around and eat ice cream! The views across the river are lovely. The turrets are 'fairy tale'.

Beautiful . Great views of Budapest- nice walk for us. Easy to get to (we took Funicular).
We paid to go up St Michaels and into Matyas too
All this area. Thia area of the city is the most beautiful. Amazing view of the city and great building everywhere.
So beautiful. What an amazing place, make sure you visit here if travelling to Budapest. Recommend visiting Fisherman's Bastion at sunset, out of this world!
Beautiful. Visited on hot, sunny day. Great views.. crowded. Take your camera and enjoy the view. Best photo of the day was a reflection of the bastion in the glass window of the building behind.

Great views of the city. Free to visit and offers great views across the city. We got the funicular up which made it really easy to get to. This is on the Buda side and the nearby streets were quaint with lots of interesting restaurants and cafes, so a nice spot to visit.

lovely place. Specatacular view from Fishermans Bastion, we really enjoyed looking at the Parlament right in front of us. We definately recommend for people visiting Budapest, one of the best places aslo to make pics at night, lovely the way the city is illuminated.

Another 'must do'. Fabulous views but also take the time to explore the nearby streets where you will find lovely buildings and some of the best restaurants in Budapest.
Excellent public toilets near the access to the castle area (small fee payable in forints or euros).
So pretty. Such beautiful architecture and the views are amazing. One of the highlights of our trip. We ended up going up twice.
Always worth a visit. I've been here 3 times and would never want to miss it. Each time was a different experience because of the weather.

Amazing view. If you take a cable car next to the Chain Bridge, you can take a cable car and in a few minutes you will reach the castle. Then you can walk to the Bastion and enjoy breathtaking view over the city and the Danube.

Nice views. Beautiful architecture and has a great view of the Parliament, which is across the river on Pest. But disappointed not to learn anything about the history of Fisherman's Bastion. Maybe you have to go on some sort of your to get this information. There is very little food options directly in Fisherman's...and the one ice cream cart/seller we came across there was a little more expensive then other places near by. But again the Bastion does offer some great photo opportunities.

Wonderful views. A beautiful preserved place to learn about the history of this area. Our experience was good with our Scenic tour group although I would have been very unhappy about being there alone. The place is swarming with tourists and many buses, you could easily become disoriented. There are also dozens of local women harassing you to buy "locally made" knitwear which is probably from China. It was quite amazing how the price quickly changed from 30 EU each to 2 for 20EU.
Gorgeous views. Fisherman's Bastion has stunning views of the Danube and the Parliament. The actual building is gorgeous and there are some lovey ice cream places at the top for hot days.

Gorgeous!. I absolutely loved climbing to the top and taking pictures of the city! The Bastion is one of the best places to get gorgeous aerial pictures of Budapest and the Hop-On/Hop-Off bus goes right up there! Lots of cute shops and places to eat at the top as well!

Come Early - beat the crowds. No need to pay for a tour. It is very easy to take on of the BKK buses up and walk from the Castle. Check out the museum, we saw a Picasso exhibition, then take a walk over. You will see Mattais Church on the way, then walk back up the hill, catch the bus to Szell Kellman Metro and back to pretty much wherever you want to be

A nice walkabout. On a nice day, this is a good place to see the sunset and stretch your legs. There are cobbled streets, so it is not as friendly to those with reduced mobility. There are several "touristy" restaurants nearby.

do not pay Forints to see this. Fisherman's Bastion is an important part of Hungarian history i.e. where fishers landed & sold their catch on the Buda side of the Danube. Today, Fisherman's Bastion has been turned into an elevated stone walkway with solid views. You know what? This is worthwhile seeing while visiting Buda Castle, but why pay $$$ to see a view you can get elsewhere? While you are there, do not try and find a toilet! It will cost you another 200 Forints! We took a pass on this one & enjoyed a coffee instead.

Great views . I love the views of the river and pest from here. There is a charge to go to the higher parts but the lower part is free. Quick stop but lovely for a stroll and to take in the views(It's literally next to the cathedral)

Nice view but very crowded. If you visit when all of the cruise ships are in then avoid this area. We toured with a ship and found many of the crowds rude and pushy. If you can visit early in the morning or when the ships have sailed it is a really pretty view of the city and really interesting architecture.

Gorgeous views of Danube, Parliament & Pest. Ideal place to see the river plus Parliament. Great place to walk around Mattias Church and see Pest City & river boats. Also close by is Cafe Pierrot, an old cafe but with high quality food, excellent menu and service.

Something Special. This attraction is located high on the hill of the Pest side of the Danube overlooking the Buda side of the city To get there is a bit of an effort as it is so high but the views, once there, are breathtaking. It really has to be seen to be believed.It is also so clean, the likes of which I have never seen before for an attraction of this nature. There is even a fine dining restaurant located at the top. I cannot comment on that though but it is there. It adds to the special feeling that comes with this venue.Thoroughly recommend a visit. You will not be disappointed

Beutiful and serene .. Well located on hill top from where you get great views of Danube and the city . Great architecture. You get great vibes when the church bells sing . Take three hours to enjoy the place.

Feels like walking on the walls of your own medieval castle. Best spot to look down through a beautiful frame to Pest the inner city and then takes just a few steps to go back in time entering Matthias Church.
Quirky structure. Sunny day when we visited Fisherman's Bastion. Views across the Danube to the city well worth the walk. Commercialised otherwise.
Budapest for walks. There are a lot of stairs that are tiring enough but the view is amazing. You can take picturesque photos!It is a must!

Beautiful . It's beautiful, I would want to go up the stair to little tower but didn't want to pay for it for a little short view ... however without getting up tower and still able to see the view ... There's 3D film downstairs which it's okay, for about 10/15 mins, the film is out history and Budapest ... Paid ticket for the church next to this building, it's nice to see architecture inside but shame about the tower, didn't go up ... There's a small shops, bar surrounded ... walk is better to see ...

Don't miss it!. On a tour through Budapest, we visited Fishermans Badtion. Not sure what it has to do with fisherman...but it was an intriguing structure that offered wonderful views of the Danube and the city. Very near other interesting sites. Do go!

Beautiful and a great view of Pest. Great to walk around in the district and at the same time having a birds eye view of the Pest side.The walk up is not hard, so skip the cable cart, it'll save you time and money :)
A beautifull place. Nice to visit the place and took great photos from the top of the hill.There is a good restaurant and coffe shop up. Good food.
Spectaculair view. Beautiful building and super location with lovely view over the city. Take the train up the hill and walk to the church and enjoy the view.

Viewing towards Pest cityshape ...... Another treasure of the Budapest Castle Hill is "Fishermen`s Bastion" from where you can overview the Pest-side cityshape and the Houses of Parliament. Comprising seven turrets representing the Hungarian tribes who came here in the late 800`s interspersed with a row of vantage Points offering a fabulous view of the Danuberiver and the opposite part of the city.Moving from here youn arrive at the statue of Hungary`s first king St. Stepehns and Matthias Chruch named after the king who married here on two occasions; the most stunning are the multi-colored bright tiles covering its roof. Taking a short break after sightseeing you will find a restaurant located at the bastion as well as a coffee shop down-stairs the Hilton Hotel.

the ioce building with the nice view to the danube river and new city. You can enjoy the good and dramatic view from this building and imagine you are a prince or princess walking in your castle and look to the city that you own...

Avoid tour groups in the afternoon. We came to this place twice. The first time in the afternoon around 2pm-4pm when there were several tour buses. During the afternoon, one of the higher points of the area requires a fee however at night, the fee isn't required. The best time to visit Fisherman's Bastion is at sunset. There are plenty of seats to relax, have a picnic dinner/wine and enjoy a beautiful sunset. There are also wonderful spots to take pictures throughout the area.
Amazing views. The perfect place to see views of the city and the Danube River, right adjacent to the magnificent church of St. Mattias.
Excellent Views. Excellent views and a great place to stop for a nice cold drink or an ice cream. Lots to look at including the St Matthias church, Castle, statues, village and Hospital in the Rock.

Great find if you ride bus 16 or 16a easy on and off. I didn't look forward to the crowds to see this but it was really very easy. We took the metro to where 16 and 16a is found. Sorry but I lost my metro map so you will have to check which one it is--Det Freid???? The one thing we got lost and looked across the street instead of walking up the steps to the TOP of the metro/bus/tram stop. IT is a huge stop with easily 10 buses so it was easy to get lost so do go up the steps and cross the street to get the bus in the right direction We even took the bus back to the other side of town to see the Buda castle.. Drover right through and loved the views
great view. You'll find lots of tourists here enjoying the view across the Danube to Parliament. There's no need to pay to go higher in the Bastion; you get a super view for free.

Nice views - Not really worth paying for. You do get great views from the Fishermans bastion! However, it's a very short stretch of wall and you can get just as lovely and comprehensive views (for free) at the other lower areas. For 800 HUF it is worth it to get a great view of the Matthias Church though.
Beautiful. One of the best walking tours we had in Budapest was from our hotel (Marmara Hotel Budapest) to Fishermans Bastion. All the way up to the funicular, across the Chain Bridge!

Great views. We stayed at The Hilton and had wonderful views of the bastion. It is probably best to visit in the evening when it is less crowded. On Saturday it is a very popular venue for weddings and was cordoned off for private receptions so that might be a day to avoid.

Must-visit in Budapest. If you're in Budapest, don't miss a chance to visit this interesting construction, with a stunning view over the city. It's really nice to take a long walk along the bastion and around the area, where also Matthias church and Buda castle are located.
Nice location, tucked neatly. Behind the cathedral on the buda hill, great location for nice views of the city. Learn about the place through a walking tour. Tour guide etc and you'd love it

Breathtaking views. This is a important place to go in Budapest to have beautiful views of the city. You must pay to go up in a certain part of the Bastion, but if you are in a tight budget, you can pass without it.

Beautiful buildings and site. Beautiful building and site. Best way to get up here is by the funicular and a walk along. We paid 800 huf to walk around the walls and take photos which was cheap and worth it! Some parts were unnecessary roped off which was a shame.
Fantastic View of Danube. Enjoy a drink in the terrace bar and have a panormanic view of the Danube below, situated on the Buda side on Castle Hill.

Too commercial and a rip off. I'm a Hungarian and has visited this place for many many times. Over the years they have put in restaurants and bars and you are not allowed to go in and take a place of the view at all unless you sit and buy items, even than you will have to climb over other guests to take some amazing pictures of the breathtaking view. They have an area that can be visited with tickets. Ok. Strange but if there is no other way we will buy the tickets. It was the 3 of us. One of the kids had to use the restroom therefore we have to leave, assuming we just return but no such a thing is allowed. Once you leave for whatever reason you are not allowed back. I have gone to the ticketing agents and come across with no compassion at all. I was informed that I will have to buy all 3 tickets again. Also they claimed that it is the district decision but it is a private company who issues the tickets and an other who checks it. There are no signs anywhere about the one time entry at all!!!! I wouldn't go back again to these money hungry sharks again. No compassion at all and no useful information.

Great for Photographing. When visiting Budapest, a trip to the Fisherman's Bastion is a must as it provides an excellent vantage point to photograph the important buildings and sites in the city. It is also an architectural wonder.

Beautiful with great views. We took the funicular up the hill which was about £3 one way (the walk is about 20 minutes up hill but not too steep). We paid to go up to the top level of the bastion (about £2 each) which is a quite a short stretch but worth it for the views of pest. Very stunning architecture and pleasant atmosphere up there, especially on a sunny day!
Incredible view.. . I don't know the actual history behind it but the views are spectacular... Get some good pics and enjoy the view. Costs like 1 euro...

Breathtaking view of Danube and Pest! . Gorgeous The Buda side.. Had great weather today lucked Nagy vasarcsarnok budapestCan get across by public bus service from Pest very easy and accessible. We stayed on the Pest side.
Beautiful. One of my favourite parts of Budapest! A really beautiful structure with a fantastic view and a lovely cafe, would highly recommend!

great views over the Danube. You can buy a ticket for this for about £1 which entitles you to go up to the highest level, but you can also get a good view from the free bit and the cafe , but the higher view is better and you can walk further
