Great views. Amazing view from here both overlooking the city and of the cathedral. We enjoyed walking along and taking in the scenery

Incredible view!. Its a must for people visiting Budapest. The view is breathtaking. On the other hand only a small part of the place is accessible (without ropes prohibiting admission) since most of it is used by a cafe - restaurant.
Amazing!. Amazing views, and there were some cafes/restaurants around where you could sit and eat and admire the views of Budapest. This was right next to matthias church and holy trinity column.

Wow, what a view..... We were on a tour and the bus took us most of the way up to this area of town. We wished we could have spent more time here. The views were unbelievable. We saw people sitting in the concrete windows taking pictures everywhere. There is a small café right there as well - not sure what they serve but we did see ice cream.Must go to this location while in Budapest!

Beautiful place!. We had a great time over here. It is beautiful. Only two downsides. It's the most touristic place we have been and they build a ugly looking hotel in middle of it. But still the bastion it self is beautiful!
Nice view. Kindly recommend to visit this area. Amazing view at Parlament, Danube and bridges. Nice narrow streets for a pleasant walk.

The Fisherman's Bastion with the amazing view!!. The Fisherman's Bastion has an amazing view of Budapest! This is were all the tour buses stop and why not! The architecture is gorgeous and is a must see when you're visiting Budapest!

Nice view of Budapest but not much else. We found this to be OK but nothing grand; only the view of Budapest is grand. Otherwise it seems a bit commercialized. It is with the visit but it will not take long.

Best view of the city . Not only does it looking medieval and wonderful, it also gives you a fantastic view of the city! Theres a (small) fee to enter, but you dont ned to enter to experience the view.

Great view interesting history. A short drive from Pest the castle district of Buda is awesome and interesting with fantastic views. We were on a tour which eased the way for with tickets and provided lots of information. We enjoyed it a lot.

Fisherman's Bastion. This area of Budapest is outstandingly beautiful - the numerous towers along the bastion, with the lovely statue of St Stephen and St Matthias Cathedral are very picturesque. The backdrop of the Danube and the Palace enhance this area immensely.

Best View of Best. The statue is impressive and the bottom half is open to all but it is worth paying the extrance fee to go the upper level (small discount with Budapest card), especially when it is quieter in the evening to watch the Danube and relax. It is not a large balcony but less crowded. There is also a posh restaurant on the one side, but they told us a reservation was necessary, so we didn't get to try it.

Quaint, but...... A bit of a chocolate box lid destination. Very appealing, on the surface. A tourist trap, for sure, however....... It's a bit of a Disneyland concoction, aping medieval cuteness and charm, a la Prague and Bruges, but much of it is a 19th century re-imagining of a mediaeval hilltop enclave. Worth a visit, but not worth its UN world heritage status. Think of it as a Danny Kaye film set. Without the songs. The views across Budapest are sublime, though.

Nice place for night scenery of Budapest. Visited it after sunset (9pm+) to catch a night scene of Budapest from the hill. Pleasantly surprised by the number of restaurants here... would be a romantic area to have a nice dinner.

Brilliant views of Budapest. After a leisurely walk across Chain bridge from Pest and a 5/10 climb up the stairs, you will reach the Fisherman's Bastion. This site offers spectacular views of Budapest.
Tip: View from ground floor is same as that from first floor so you can easily save 5Euro entrance fee if you want!
Disneyland in Budapest. Fisherman's Bastion has amazing architecture and a beautiful view of the Danube, Budapest bridges and Pest.
A bit disappointing. Although it was a beautiful building when we paid to go round it we found that you could only go round part of it
good place to go. it is a good place to go. it just opposite of parliament. so you can take very good pictures over there.

Unique architecture, incredible views. A very unique architectural delight on the Buda side of the Danube, with excellent views back to the beautiful St. Matthias church, but more importantly, across the river back to the Pest side. From here you have a panoramic view, taking in the Parliament building, the various beautiful bridges that cross the Danube, and much more. It's a bit expensive to get up on top for what you get - but worth it once for the unrivalled view. The cafe on top is also incredible pricey!
Beautiful . It's one of the sights to visit in Budapest. Lovely view of the pest side and of course u get to see the church by its side. Definitely worth going up.
Beatufil place. I strongly recommend to spend some time visiting the Bastion. Views of the city are incredible and it is totally free. A visit to Budapest is not complete without visiting this place.

Beautiful building. It's worth visiting once .. It looks like Cinderella or snow whites castle . Was built by the fisherman who lived just outside the city.. The view of Budapest from here is majestic ..
What a view!. This was part of a tour. Very interesting. This is a great place to take pictures. The view over the countryside below and the river was outstanding.

Fairytale. This is one of the most beautiful places I have ever been. You can imagine Disney princess Castles being based on the fisherman's bastion. The fact that it is free to look around is amazing! Absolutely breathtaking and just s short uphill walk, passed a market, from the tour bus stops. Could easily pass and hour or 2 wandering round, and besides the structure itself the views are astounding.

Funky! . Awesome architecture with a beautiful view. It's a bummer you have to pay to go up top but you don't have to to enjoy it! It's also right next to a beautiful cathedral and has some good food places nearby!
Beautiful views. Part of the castle Hill area, this spot overlooking the Danube offers excellent views and photo opportunities. There is even a tiny coffee shop in one of the turrets

great district to visit.... cross over chain bridge walk up the hill and your there , a stunning area to visit shops , cafes , etc, church's , very pretty streets very typically European get lost around there and find your way back wonderful.....
Winter Wonderland. It was a cold snowy night when we visited. It was really still and with the snow falling it was like being in a fairy tale with lovely panoramic views of Budapest.
Most beautiful building.. Definitely the most stunning building visited out of all of them and gives great view of city. Was part of the free walking tour and a highlight of the tour.
Worth the trip. Great views from here,was very busy while we were there but plenty of areas to look over the city view
A must to visit here. I would really recommend visiting. Its really pretty. Lovely views of the river and the pest side of Budapest from the walkway.
incredible views of Budapest. Fisherman's Bastion is part of the Buda hill complex. There are wonderful views from here. There are also a lot of steps to get up to the viewing terrace
Save Your Money. Just walk to the railing or walk 100 meters along the wall and climb a free bastion. The view is all the same.

Enchanting Views . Situated just in front of Matthias Church, the Bastion offers fantastic views of the river and Parliament. This was probably my favorite spot in Budapest; the Bastion reminds me of a fairytale castle! I highly recommend it.

great place with amazing views. This is a great place to visit with amazing views of Pest side.
there is an upper terrace which can be accessed if you pay.
Don't bother to pay because the view from the lower terrace is also amazing.

A must do whilst in Budapest. One of the must do items on the tourist circuit whilst in Budapest. The views from here back over the city and particularly the parliament are stunning. Make the effort - you will not be disappointed.
Nice walk. Is one of the parts of Buda you should walk. Just make sure is not gonna be a very hot day because you have a lot of up and down.
Great view. Absolutely must do in Budapest. Amaizing view over Danube River, over to Parliament. Very well restored. Lots of tourists though.

Panoramic view . This is a very nice panoramic point of view where you can see the pesht side . Located in the VAR. Unfortunately the best place to see the view was converted to a restaurant but still there is place to see.

Breathtakingly Beautiful Panoramic Views. For the best view of the gorgeous Hungarian Parliament Building, go to Fisherman's Bastion. It was completed in 1902 to celebrate the 1,000th birthday of Hungary, and is one of the most visited places in Budapest.
Amazing sights!. The views from the Bastion were wonderful! I couldn't get enough pictures as I walked along! I bought the pass that grants access to here and the cathedral, very worth it!

Walk along the wall, but don't pay extra. The views from Fisherman's Bastion are good especially coming from the Cathedral. There is an add-on to your ticket that gives you another access to the views, but it isn't worth it.

Beautiful!. Such a beautiful place with the best views of Budapest, a must see, so much so that we went twice! There's also a lovely open food place opposite the church entrance up a few steps that sells excellent Hungarian dishes!

Fairytale view. I recommend taking the funicular up the hill and then walk to the right, following signs to Matthias Church and Fisherman's Bastion. Well worth the visit for the fairytale view across the Danube towards the Parliament and other beautiful buildings on the Pest side.We did not walk along the turrets, since we were a bit tight on time. But I belive it's fascinating and really worth the small price.One of my favorite visit during my short Budapest stay.

Scenery is beautiful. See during day and at night. We ended up on the Buda side in the late afternoon. And took a lot of photos. We ended up having dinner and stayed to then revisit the Bastion and Matthias church after the sun when down. I highly recommend you see them in daylight and after dark. Especially the views Parliament on the Pest side after dark.

Family day in the Oldtown. We have spent together with my family a day in the Oldtown, Halaszbastya is the place where we are always impressed of the view. So proud being Hungarian looking at tourists coming from all over the world and are happy with the panorama.

Fantastic Parliament View. If you're going up to the Buda castle district, this may just be the highlight. The walls and towers are stunning, and the views over the river are breathtaking. There's really not more to this spot than that, but I find it to be a highlight of the castle district. The beautiful church right behind it compliments the feeling too!

Worth the trip uo. Beautiful area to walk around and take pictures of the Pest side of the Danube River. Definitely worth the trip to the top of the hill to check it out. These views are well worth it.
Very charming. Have to come back after visit years ago and it was as nice and charming as before, there is something magical there.

Nice view of Pest. This beautiful terrace is on the Buda side of Danube next to Mathias' Church. The Hungarian Parliament and many other attractions on the other side Danube make spectacular views from top of this. Most of it is now occupied by cafes and very little is left to the tourists!
View over Budapest. The place itself is very nice, and when the weather is nice it is a beautiful view over Budapest (Pest).

Must see in Budapest. Fisheman's bastion has alot of histroy to speak about. Located on the Buda side of the city, the attraction is located high up on the hill. There is lot of walking around to see the whole area. The view from the top of the hill towards the Pest side and the Danube river is simply awesome!!

Amazing views . Literally one of the best spots in Budapest for views of the Danube river, parliament building, and panoramic views of the city. If suggest having a cocktail or wine at the bar/restaurant at the top. Lovely way to enjoy the view
Beautiful and lovely view . Beautiful building with views of the city. Shane about the ugly holiday inn at the back! Nice area to have a walk around and little cafes and shops.
A Spectacular Site. The Fisherman's Bastion is a beautiful site. The castle almost looks like a giant drip sand castle. It is amazing and has a commanding view of Buda and Pest.
Like a fairytale!! . Beautiful place, amazing sights and well worth going to see! A small walk, with views over the danube to the parliament building!
Amazing views. I was fascinated by the panoramic view of Budapest, such a nice location, it's definitely worth the money.

You have to hike. It takes a bit of a tiring hike up if you're coming from the Funicular. Unless you take the hop on hop on which has a stop on this location, you really have to take the stroll going uphill. But with that aside, the bastion is a real sight to see! Enjoy a cup of coffee at the top of the bastion while enjoying the view of the Danube river. Don't forget to visit the St. Matthias church as well as take a stroll inside the vicinity for restaurants and cafes. If you get too tired or if its already after sunset, catch a cab (I recommend cabs in front of legit hotels such as the hilton since they tend to be more honest).

Danube view . Next to the Marttitus church. Can be reach by bus no.16 and 16A. Extra fee for the walk along the upper level. If you would like to see the river view, better go to the top of the bell tower. There is a cafe at the fisherman's bastion. Really love hot chocolate!

Beautiful view. Really good spot to catch the sight of the city with the Danube, you can have the best view above a restaurant don't be shy to climb the stairs. Also a historic place and it is surrounded by the palace area,

Places to see around the castle . After visiting the castle, we walked around and came across this place. It's a nice place with many photo opportunities. The view is great and there are many places to shop or eat nearby. The church next to it is very beautiful.

Very nice view of the Danube. I recommend you go up the hill to the fisherman's bastion on the funicular before the sun goes down to appreciate the view still during the day, then visit the church and the castle area when it's already dark and you get the panoramic view of the city at night as well. If you go during the day, you can have lunch at the bastion (there's 2 restaurants, one cheaper and one expensive) or walk down the street and have lunch at any of the nice restaurants in the area (Jamie's Italian is nice too). You can end the afternoon at the hospital in the rock that used to be a hospital during WWII, a nazi bunker and a nuclear shelter.

One of my favorite places in Budapest . I don't know what it is about this place, but it is just so nice! Very cheap (800 forinths), wonderful view and you feel like you are in a Disneymovie going from tower to tower.

Beautiful place with wonderful views. Since we stayed on the Buda side near Fisherman's Bastion, we went about 9AM most mornings as we either walked to Pest or to the bus stop nearby. We had the place to ourselves or with a handful of other visitors at that time. It gets crowded later in the day. There is no fee to enjoy this beautiful place.
GREAT VIEW. Fisheman's Bastion is a must see when visiting Budapest. The views are amazing, especially of the Hungarian Parliament on the Pest side of the river.

Lovely buildin. We only visited the building on the outside, it's situated next to the Matthias church.
You have a nice view of the city from here.

Absolutely Stunning at Night. Visited Fisherman's Bastion both on day and night times. Day time was nice because of the many shops and restaurants. But the sight at night time is just beautiful. You get an excellent view of Budapest, Chain Bridge, and the Parliament building all lit up at night. There's a few tourists at night (but not crowded) and walking to get there is safe. Make sure to bring camera to capture Budapest's beauty at night.

Great views!. We enjoyed our visit to Fisherman's Bastion, and paid the 800 Forints to walk the short distance along the turrets, which gave great views over the Danube. We got the funicular up the mountain and walked to the right, following signs to Matthias Church and Fisherman's Bastion. You can also pay to see inside the church. Worth a visit for the views, and then if you have a spare hour, go across the other side of the hill and down in the lift to The Hospital in the Rock- tours every hour- fascinating!

Uncommon. Built by chance, loved by mostly anyone, it seems to have come out of a dream to give you a terrace on one of the most beautiful urban panoramas. Discover yourself if the Danube is blue, and please do it from the Fishermen's Bastion.

Great view, but save your 700fr.. If you're visiting buda castle, save your money. Sure, it's a great view, buy you already got a great view over the Danube and the city (Pest side) on the castle, for free!Visit the church, which is nice.
marvellous. both the building and the scene from the garden were all wonderful and attractive. ı really enjoyed being there

THE EXQUISITE ARCHITECTURE. The Fisherman’s Bastion was built between 1895 and 1902, as a tribute to the tribes that conquered the country in 896. The tribes are represented by seven stone towers located on the hill of Buda Castle, near the Church of Mathias (beautiful). The monument name was chosen in honor of the fishermen for defending the city walls during the Middles Ages. After World War II, the bastion was completely destroyed and its reconstruction was coordinated by the son of the original architect, Frigyes Schulek. In the square between the Bastion and the Mathias Church there is the statue of István I, the first king of Hungary, who reigned from 1000 to 1038. If you have time, go have a beer at The Fisherman’s Bastion Restaurant, there you can calmly appreciate the amazing panorama from all Budapest.

what a view of the city and Parlament. This is in old Buda and worth the time to go over the bridge for the view. From the bastion you can see the same view that is in most of the travel brochures. This is also were Matthias church is and worth the time to see

Perfect view of Budapest!. Great spot to see the entire city surrounded by a charming neighborhood. The streets and shops have cafes and souvenir attractions the architecture of St. Matthias Church is amazing.
Great view though crowded. This is a breath taking spot for the view, and a must for photos. It will be crowded so try to go early or late in the day.

Fab views. Sit and have a coffee overlooking the city, can be busy, Resturant inside was a bit pretentious, you have to cook in advance and was very very very expensive for a small meal. Save your money!

Great Views . From here the full length of the Danube through Budapest is visible with the Pest side in all its glory. We were there in the day but I'm sure that the night time views with the towns lights must be breath taking.
Beautiful scenery!!!. The scenery from uphill is just beautiful! Don't miss it!!! We climbed by foot instead of waiting for the funicular and it wasn't too hard.

Wonderful views. There is a Hilton Hotel there that is a great place for lunch. Get a table by a window and you have a wonderful view of the Danube and the Pest side. We enjoyed our food too. This area has great views, historical buildings, souvenir shops and small cafes in addition to the Hilton.
Beautiful. This is an interesting part of Buda and right next ti it is the colourful tiled roofs that you will spot on throughout Budapest, they are true works of art. I think I enjoyed these more.
Awesome view, beautiful place. A very beautiful place, and you can see a very nice view from the top. Public transport stops right infront of it,

Nice view. One of the must see in budapast , take the line 16 to the top , if u didnt buy the hop on hop off , for me the 72 h tickt did the job .
Long walk up if you donit alone .

Breathtaking views, amazIng and unusal architecture, wonderful history. Of all the places I've been in Europe this was one of the prettiest. So much to see, no matter which direction you turn. I see so many people have posted photos and reviewed this spot but I wanted to add my comments because I was absolutely enchanted. There is so much to see on the square adjacent as well, the Matthius church, wonderful sculptures and statues - takes you back in time.
Nice vantage point. Climb the stairs to this great vantage point... Well worth the entrance ticket price. We visited on a rainy day, but still had a great view :)
One of the most beautiful spots in Europe. Recently renovated and really gorgeous with a superb view on the Parliament opposite the river. Always a pleasure - something special...

A Definite Must See. One of the highlights of Budapest...beautiful architecture and elevated position in the city makes for great photo ops. Interesting place to walk around and soak in some culture and try some local food

Special place in a special area. Ok, its going to be very touristy and super busy. Try and have a seat and imagine how this place was built and how difficult the roof was to construct....also, the parties of visitors snaking their way around this neoclassical gem are an entertainment. Try guessing the amount of selfie sticks for instance....As an antidote to such a place, take a stroll away from the tourist trap and explore the rest of the castle district, well worth it as few groups do as there is so much else to see.

Simply beautiful. A beautiful place to visit giving superb views across the Danube. This attraction is free and even when it is busy it feels quite empty. A nice place to get something to eat. Visit both during the day or night to get two different experiences.
fantastic views. well worth the visit great views and close to other sights. great restaurants in area rasy to walk round
Fairy tale landmark. It is my favourite spot from Budapest. It looks like a Fairy Tale Castle and it has great views of Pest, specially the Parliament and St Stephen's basilica.

A great view and so much more.. The view towards Pest is fantastic and so at times it is overrun by huge numbers of tourists. The seven towers represent the seven founding tribes of the country and the nearby statue of St Stephen is a must see. As is the impressive St Matthias church towering above the bastion. There are quieter areas and cafes and ice cream kiosks for refreshment.

Beautiful architecture. We stumbled across the Bastion after walking from the castle on our second day in the city! It's absolutely gorgeous, with great views across the city. Looks almost surrealist/Gaudi like to me! Definitely worth a visit.

Great views, but don't pay. There is a bar underneath (same view as a friend said), but also there are two side areas which are free to wander around and sit. Not sure why the central area is a paying attraction, can't see any value for money there. Atmospheric.

Magical highlight. It is a must!
Visiting Budapest without checking out this place can be harmful later on! :-)
The view is one of the best. (The other one is from the Citadella.)
You can have a perfect view on the Parliament, the Danube and the bridges.
Be prepared, you can take your best photos from here!
Best view over Budapest. If you want to see the city from a high place, you should visit here. The architecture worths seeing.

Worth seeing-AMAZING. It would be nice to read little bit about the history so that you can appreciate the great architectute. There is an amazing view from the Towers to Danube and the Parlament. You can see the St. Matthias church in its all glory. The entrance is 800HUF, which is not expensive. 100% recommended. Make sure you visit the best confectionery RUSZWURM which is 5 min from the towers. Enjoy

Such beautiful and unusual buildings. You can have coffee along the battlement walls with spectacular views. Matthias Church is alongside as well. When we were there a gentleman in armour and his eagle were there, taking pictures with tourists.
Great for pics. You get a nice view there. You can pay to enter the higher part of the tower but no need. You can visit the marzipan shop just in front. It has the best marzipan at the best price
Beautiful sight of Pest from here.. Don´t miss the church in front o Fisherman´s Bastion and theres a good place to eat, Not expensive, live classic music and a stunning view of Pest.

A magical, medieval beautiful place. I walked across the Chain Bridge from Pest and meandered up to Fisherman's Bastion. I'm sure there's an easier way to get up than the one I took but all those stairs were worth it when you emerge from the final staircase and into an area of beauty and magic. Matthias Church stands in front of you and Fisherman's Bastion rings the platform. The views from under the arches looking out across the river are breathtaking. The area itself is really interesting to walk around although it would have been nice to do the walking tour to find out the history of it (didn't have time). Definitely worth a visit while in Budapest.
Very good half day trip. Well worth seeing if you have the time. Allow a couple of hours at least. Easy to get to and a very interesting area

Unbeatable views!. We took a walking tour that ended at the Fisherman's Bastion, and we enjoyed our time exploring there. The stone architecture is beautiful, and the views of the river and the Parliament are spectacular.

Photogenic. Sitting high on the Buda side of the Danube, this beautiful structure majestically looks down over the Pest side of the city. It is a stunning building looking like a Disney castle in parts, but it's crowning glory is the stunning views over the city and the river. It is an essential photo stop with many great vantage points for taking stunning shots as part of your take home memories. But for an even more breathtaking view, go on the night cruise on the Danube. The memories will certainly stay with you.
Good spot. Great viewing platform, bit too tourists with having to pay to do things and go up certain bits. But fabulous views.

Beautiful views, stunning scenery . Made the walk up here on our last day visiting the city, the weather was lovely thankfully. From the top near the cafe you get stunning views of the Parliament building and the surrounding city. The architecture is very unique and it's definitely worth a visit

Loved it and check out the cafe overlooking Budapest!. Definitely worth a trip. Amazing views, lovely atmosphere and the posh little cafe which is amazing value for money is a must do, with the amazing views!

A great area for entertainment. The Bastion was busy with lots of visitors flocking around local entertainers there were jugglers , acrobats and a guy with the most beautiful eagle owl , a couple had just got married and were posing with the owl, a great historic area surrounded by many great bars and restauraunts

Fishermans Bastion tour. The Fishermans Bastion is another must see place if you are going to Budapest.It's easily accessible and we got off there from The Hop on Hop off Red sight seeing tours.The architecture is fantatsic as are the views of the City of Budapest. Being not far from Budapest Castle it makes a great day out on the Buda side of the city
Very beautiful. Lovely place to see Budapest from. You can see parliament and the chain bridge as well as many other sights from here. It is also a very beautiful place to look around.

Simply Amazing. The dashing statue of St Stephen mounted on a horse in the bastion made me feel like I was in some epic defense tower in one of Tolkien's stories (maybe because the architecture has a mix of neoclassical and gothic style, and mostly colored in white it reminds me of Minas Tirith). The views of Danube from here were simply amazing. Should be on top of your visit in Budapest!

Pretty place, great to wander around.. Easy to spend a few hours wandering around the pretty streets.The Bastion looks like something from a fary tale.The views over the Danube of the Parliament Building where amazing.

Beautiful Views!. This attraction is located on top of a hill in the old part of Budapest, called Buda. It is a free attraction that overlooks the Danube river and the new part of town, or Pest. The views of the city are spectacular with ample opportunities to take selfies and panoramic photographs. Also try to see the same view at night. The Parliament House across the river Danube is especially well lit up along with other structures and bridges and it is a beautiful sight to see. This attraction is near the St. Matthias Church which is also attractive (needs ticket to enter). Within walking distance is the famous Castle district as well. It is a good 5 to 10 minutes walk with lots to see. Do not miss this!

Great views of Pest from Buda. Situated in the Castle district on Buda the Fisherman's Bastion offers fantastic views of the city and Danube river. Great area to explore with cafe, restaurants and shops to enjoy as a pit stop and lots of places to sit and admire the views and people watch.
Beautiful architecture and views. We went there while on an arranged city tour. Definitely worth going as apart from the stunning buildings, the view over Pest and the Danue is amazing.
Fantastic views of The Pest side of the city. Disneyesque structure close to the beautiful church and palace in Buda that gives you an excellent view of the city, if the crowds allow.
Great view ! Lovely day. We got here on the big bus tour, it was a beautiful view and a superb bit of architecture! Defo worth a walk around not much to do.
lovely views but it is quite busy. Great to have the iconic view of the city and appreciate the river, Chain Bridge and Parliament building.

Incredible views and beautiful architecture . The views looking out over the Danube are stunning, especially on a clear night. You get a full panoramic view of the Pest side of the city including the superb Parliament building. The architecture of Fisherman's Bastion itself is is also something to behold. Certainly one of the main attractions to visit whilst in Budapest!
Like a disney scene. This place is a must to see it is like Walt Disney had put it up and reminded me of a magical place. Although it is really just a façade it still looks wonderful
Fishermans Bastion . Awesome. Such a pretty place. Beautiful views of Budapest from here. Highly recommend that you take time to see it. Easy to walk to from the Buda side.

Great view. Great view of the city. Didn't like the fact that every corner is filled with cafes and you cannot have a nice view of the city without buying something. The last unoccupied areas of the panoramic terrace are overcrowded and there's no chance getting there

Amazing. We visited here when it was a sunny winter's day and it was amazing. The views are spectacular and there's even a gorgeous bar up there that you can have a drink/bite to eat and take in the amazing views.
Beautiful views!. One of my favorite views of the city, Fisherman's Bastion combines amazing historical architecture with breathtaking panoramas and excellent people watching.

Such a beautiful picturesque site!. A tourist hotspot, but not one to miss. It is like having a little slice of Disneyland in Budapest (without the annoying mice!). The views are stunning and the buildings are lovely. Slightly ruined by a few tacky cafes, but expected in this day and age! Definitely worth a visit after a Castle Hill trip :)

The tipical must-see. Located in the castle, the Fisherman's Bastion is one of the coolest historcal venues. It's interesting for both the younger and the older generations and gives an excellent view to the city, the Danube and the Parliament as well.
Gorgeous views. Glad we paid for the ticket that included the upper level of this attraction. The views were amazing. Would have been sad if we missed it.
Fabulous atmosphere . St mathias church was beautiful. The atmosphere was v good. The views of the city were good. Try to reach early to beat the crowds

Charming spot with wonderful panorama. On the hill of Buda you can find this area surrounded by white buildings. These buildings have medieval architecture, but the bright colour gives them a fairy tale charming image.
From there, you have a great view of Pest.
Inside the building there is a cafè. I really suggest a break, having a drink and looking the panorama.
Great Photo Opportunity!. Beautiful place for photos! If travels are unable to "hike" up there is an option for a paid lift up. Worth the trip, lots to see up there.
A Fairytale castle!. Amazing architecture around the whole area and the panoramic views of the city keep you there for an extra half hour. Stunning building, lovely and relaxed atmosphere
Do not miss!. The views from here are gorgeous! The architecture is stunning and photography enthusiasts will love taking photo's here. Highly recommend!

Amazing view. Impressive with characteristic architecture, that you do not see everywhere in europe. Beautiful view and surround little shops and cafes. It is one of a sight that should definitely visit in Budapest.

Stunning architecture . Unfortunately we didn't get chance to go inside, as we kept arriving too late. However the external architecture is just stunning. We were blessed with great weather which made the roof sparkle. Seeing this at night when it is all lit up is breath taking. If you walk to the wall you have the most spectacular views across the Danube and again the parliament building at night is a sight to be seen. I cannot speak highly enough of this place and the whole of Budapest. I just hope the tourists continue to respect the place and its people so it remains stunning, friendly and pure.

Stunning!. The view from the top of the Bastion is breathtaking with great opportunities of panoramic photos but the Bastion itself was an architectural wonder. Almost looks like something you would see in a Disney fairytale sort of thing. A must see.
Great virws. Fabulous views of Pest. Lovely walk up from the river. Didn't pay for the views don't think you needed to. Definitely see the Matthias Church

Halaszbastya. Amazing Architecture with Great view on Budapest. Like in a fairytail. To get by car or you can walk over the Chain Bridge and use old chair elevator... Also by using stairs you can reach it. Organised round tours available

Views to die for!. We have visited Budapest 4 times now and could not go there without a trip up to the Fishermans Bastion.Firstly it is pristine white stone and shines out from below. Secondly it is close to St Matthias church and the magnificent statue of St Stephen.If you want to get the sense of atmosphere that this area has then view the you-tube flash mob of Kodaly's Evening Song, you'll want to go there too!
Best romantic spot and view at night. don't go and pay to walk above during the day with the crowds. See it then while touring the church but come back at night!!
nice veiw. great attraction to spend afternoon walking into hill visiting fisherman's bastion ,museum and church. / near by also 'nuclear' underground hospital.

Great place. It is a beautiful place to visit. We felt a bit cheated as the sell tickets to walk on the wall. Before you realise it's end of it and you have to come down. Then you realise that couple of metres later is almost the same wall on which one you can get on for free!!! Don't get fooled and walk around first and then make your decision whether you want to pay or not. Overall this is a must see place in Budapest

Not to be missed. An absolute MUST for visitors to Budapest. On the Buda side of the Danube adjacent to St Matthias Church it provides amazing views owner the river and Parliament House.The history is well worth taking in and whilst there don't forget a stroll around the Palace which is only meters away and access to Buda after exiting the Chain Bridge is via a quaint funicular, Tickets have to be purchased at the ticket office.
Fisherman's Bastion, Budapest. A wonderful Vista Point and a gorgeous sight itself. If you go up the Castle Hill, this is a must-see!

Incredible period architecture, shame about the tourists.. Amazing architecture, feels like you're in Lord of the Rings. Is let down by the amount of tourists, though get there early morning and you should be ok. Great view of Pest and the Parliament building, free too.

Great View of Budapest. This on the Buda side of Budapest on the Buda Hill. It is free and you have great view of the Parliament and the Danube river. The St. Matthias Church is also here.Go in the evening and enjoy the views when it starts getting dark.Restaurants and cafes close by 6 - 7 pm so get your dinner before that. You can. Walk down or take bus No.16.Useful to have a 24 hr transport pass as the bus will not sell tickets.
Amazing and very imrpessive.. Definetely worth a visit while in Budapest. Amazing architecture and very special. Do not miss it !!
Beautiful! . Just absolutely beautiful and a must visit when in Budapest. Great inexpensive tours too. Amazing architecture

Wow!!!. And I really mean it. You just have to go there, at least twice. One to visit in daylight and one when it's dark enough and all lights are on. Especially the ones of the famous Chain Bridge and of the Hungarian Parliament. You want regret it. Plus... Late at night, you can visit and enjoy the view to the city from the top floors of the Fisherman's Bastion without having to pay the entrance fee.

Brilliant. On the Buda side of the river. Great views of the city and The Danube. Lovely architecture and it comes alive at night with many good restaurants and the buildings lit up. We walked back to Pest, took us an hour and was lovely. A taxi from Pest can be expensive as the roads are busy and the journey very slow.
Fisherman's Bastion. I liked this place, because when I was there I had a strong feeling that I was in magic fairy tale. Charmingly.

Beautiful. There's not much to say other than this place is spectacular! I would recommend talking a long walk along the river and ending up here, walk past the pariment too and cross the lion bridge!Travellers tip: Do it as it's starting to get dark in the evening. It's prettier then.

Magnificent view. According to tradition, this part of Buda was defended by the fishermen's guild in the days past. Situated under the square of Holy Trinity, the Matthias Church, the statute of St. Stephen, from this bastion you may have a breathtaking view of both Buda and Pest. The place is easy to reach either from Széll Kálmán tér or from the Pest side by bus, or from the Buda side, right beside the tunnell at Chain Bridge (Lánchid), you may take the funicular. If you turn to the right when you get off, you reach the Halászbástya (Fishermen's Bastion) in 8 minutes..
The most beautiful sandcastle in the world. Absolutely gorgeous, we could have stayed here for hours. The views of the city were awesome, photo opportunities wonderful! And it's free....

Beautiful!. Definitely worth the time. We took the funicular up to stroll around Fisherman's Bastion. Beautiful architecture & views of the Danube. We stayed past sunset to see the lights along the river. Very charming.
Beautiful area. My favourite of all the districts ...simply beautiful lots to see and do ...best to get the bus up there though as its bit of trek

High point of the tour. Quite exhilarating to come to this point and look down over the Danube and Vienna. Particularly spectacular view of Parliament. A moment of reflection on the history that has unfolded in this city.

Beautiful!!. OMG, this place is beautiful!! Perfect view to the Parliament too! Great pictures taken here too. It is also just 10 minutes walk from the Castle.Attention if you are travelling on a budget: Do not take the funicular, it is the most expensive way up. Take the bus n. 16 across the street from the funicular. Leave at the third stop and you will be facing the amazing St. Matthias Church.
Beatiful place with stunning view. Everbody during his stay in budapest have to visit this place.There is near the castle on castle hill
What a view!. Well worth visiting Buda. Fabulous history, castle, cathedral, medieval hilltop fortress, and superb view from Fishmans Bastion.

A nice place to stroll around and also to watch Budapest from the top. Old castle area. A lot to see. Many tourista and people though, and rather touristique. But interesting, and you have a great view to the Pest side of Budapest and to a great part of the wonderful Donau river.

Fisherman's Bastion. Truly a most visited attraction in Budapest and with good, obvious reasons. Great panoramic river views, turrets, steps, lookout towers...ahh, I enjoyed it, despite having to battle crowds!
Great place for photos. The view of the Danube and Pest through the columns and archways can't be beat. Great place for photos!

A great observation platform in Budapest. The fisherman's Bastion (Halaszbastya) is a decorative platform on Castle Hill, with seven towers symbolizing the founding seven tribes. It is of relatively recent vintage, having completed construction in 1902. From its various openings there are wonderful views of the City, particularly the Pest side. The terrace itself is frequently the site for ambulant salespeople offering Hungarian and regional folk art. This area is like a square and being next door to Matthias' Church, it is an deal meeting place. Before or after mass, the terrace fills up with people, mostly locals; at other times, visitors constitute the majority. In the middle of the terrace there is a magnificent equestrian statue of King Stephen, Hungary's first king, who led the conversion to Christianity.
Good views but Overcrowded. The Bastion offers some good views and it is quite a walk up the castle hill. Best visited on a weekday when there isn't much crowd .

Nice view, beautiful construction. You have an amazing view from up here. The construction itself is gorgeous because of the material. Fun to look around and take some pictures, but you can spend more time on the church and the surrounding area.

Beautiful views of Pest. You can get a ticket for entry at the the ticket booth next to the Bastion, as well as for Matthias church. Really you can get the same view, just a few feet under it, for free. The ticket grants you access to a small walking area at the top. It's not expensive so you might as well do it. You have views of Pest on one side. And views of Matthias Church on the other. This is a high tourist area.
Buda side. This is part of Buda side very nice. Wear a comfortable shoes. Very romantic at night. Visit castle yard while you are in that area.

Visited in April 2016. The place is really beautiful and we climbed it at night (because at night you can access everything for free, but during the day you have to pay to access the highest grounds), so the lights and and view to the parliament building was fabulous. Plus a street musician who played violin added extra to the place. It is a bit pity that we didn't find a great place to view the Bastion from afar, because it is in midst of other buildings, but being in there was also great, yet when we climbed to the top, I felt that, if we would have payed, we would be disappointed because there wasn't much difference.And by the way, the church is amazing as well!
Nice area for a walk. This area is great for a peaceful afternoon walk and is close to other attractions such as the royal palace.
Stunning.. Views across the Danube to Pest and its historic buildings is superb, and the Architecture is stunning.
Beautiful view!. It is a very beautiful place and you get a great view across the city. Definitely worth a visit!!!!!

Amazing at dusk!!!!. Amazing architecture! Visited at dusk while it was snowing. It was magical!!!! This is a must see while in Budapest!!! Some of the best picture we took on this trip were from the Bastion.

Great photo opportunities and other sights nearby. Best way to visit is to take the Big Bus hop on , hop off tour . Don't take other tours like giraffe had many problems with them.no time to explain here but will on their site page. The tours are cheap and can see all or 95% of the interesting places in one day if you start early around 10 am.
Definition of Tourist Trap. This is by far the best definition of a tourist trap but what a sight! The towers were exciting to see up close and explore.
A beautiful view of Budapest.. We had tickets to the restricted are of the Bastion, but I understand there are good places to get nearly the same view without a ticket. Worth seeking out, anyway.

Lovely area worth a stroll and a photo op!. Fisherman's Bastion is right in the middle of the "touristy" area and adjacent to Castle Hill and Matthias Church. BUT, it's so darn gorgeous, who cares if it's touristy? Stroll around the area and enjoy the lovely views of the Parliament from across the river and the gorgeous statues and architecture. No need to pay to go up the steps; the views from the free spots are just as lovely. Tons of photo ops in this area!

Wonderful sight, visit as dusk or dawn for some extra magic!. The Bastion is a beautiful place and delivers a great view across the city. Vanishing (or arriving for early birds) sunlight makes the place all the more special. A great place to end sight seeing.

So beautiful! Worth the walk from the Castle... I had a wonderful lunch there overlooking Parliment and the Danube. The photo taking opportunities there are wonderful with the arches overlooking the river.
Gorgeous. If you have made the effort to get to the top of this hill, it is definitely worth it to walk toward the Bastian and take in the beautiful views of Pest.
Spectacular views. A beautiful landmark in Budapest, right next to the very beautiful cathedral, with spectacular views of Pest and the river Danube! A very scenic spot

Great for photo opportunities. The views from this custom built viewing platform were well worth seeking out, though we had to jostle with many other tourists, some of whom needed to have their photos taken from every conceivable angle with iconic Budapest as a backdrop.All good fun though, and we were in no hurry.
Great, but toursity. Mega touristy as you can also get a great view of Pest. Really beautiful worth a visit. Again if you do not mind herds of tourists!

Well worth a visit. We went there on the big bus tour and spent quite a few hours walking about. It was a beautiful day and there were lots of tourists, but there is a kind of quietness to this place. Lovely views over the city, there is a museum, cafes, a small market selling local products. We watched the change of guard, then walked to the town which has a few hotels. Visited the lovely church. It really is something to see, in fact Budapest has you stunned every time you turn a corner, there is so much to see.
One of the best viewpoints. Fisherman's Bastion with the Matthias Church is a must see in Budapest. You have a fantastic view over the city. Walk around the Water City - a really well restored area.
Beautiful view. This was part of a guided tour and offered breathtaking views of the city. The guide included historical and architectural info, too.
What a view. We were lucky to have a hot weekend, and although it was busy to visit it was a great experience. We will have to go back to the city to explore more. Cannot recommend too highly
No need to pay. Although it's a pretty background for photos, we thought it unnecessary to pay to ascend. The views on the ground were beautiful through the arches.

Beautiful but touristy . Beautiful views, fascinating architecture. The bastion almost doesn't look real. We got there at about 9.30am and it was already swarming with tourists so I'd recommend going as early as possible before all of the buses start to arrive. There's a lot of steps and it's on a large hill so be aware if any of your party is less able.
Perfect location. This building almost feels unreal. It is beautiful in its design and the view over Budapest was staggering. A top location to visit
Nice stroll. Placed adjacent to Matthias church this is a beautiful place to stroll through while visiting the area of Capitol Hill in Buda.

Favourite part of Budapest. Classy ornate buildings with the best views of Budapest. Previous TA reviews said it was free other than the turrets but when we went they were free too albeit access only granted to 1 of them. We sat and had a beer basking in the sun and enjoying the amazing sights. Matthias church adjoins it so you get 2 great attractions in one.

Worth the steps up the hill. I didnt take the bus like what others so instead i walked all the way from vaci street. Its cool when you end ip there you soo too many tourists taking pics, but the views is superb. Definitely is a thing you should do when you are there
Great views from hill above Danube. It's a nice section of Budapest to walk, visit the sites and eat. The views from the ramparts were spectacular. Have a cold drink and overlook the Danube.

A magnificent evening overlooking the Danube. Made reservation for dinner from the hotel. We had visited the castle during day timeand were told about the place. The view is spectacular and at night the view is thelightened city of the Pest side beyond the Danube river. The food was very good andwe enjoy the musicians entertaining the guests at their tables. It is a little pricey for Budapest standards but not by American standard. The experience is worthy. Just asI was writing this review my wife saw it and said ,"that is enough reason to visit again".
Great views of the city. These buildings are different in style from what you usually see. They offer real great views of the city and house also a restaurant/ bar (little on the cost upside however)
Very nice place, incredible view. Very nice view over the whole embankment! The area near by is very nice as well, you can visit the cathedral, several nice restaurant and squares.

Beautiful view from the top. The fisherman's bastion, located in the Buda side of the city, it's a must visit landmark.
On top of being a very nice building itself, it offers one of the most amazing views of the city, overlooking it from the top.
Great views. Best way to see the city from another angle. We got some beautiful photos from here and the architecture itself is truly beautiful.
great views. best panoramic view of the whole city. great for pictures, right next to mathias church. good to go upto the tower
So beautiful. This bastion is really beautiful ans special, and you really need to see it if you're going to budapest! At night, it's really nice to look at the rest of budapest.
Discovered my own. had lost in the amazing city, enjoyed the walk on the sunny day, admired the architectural design building. Recommend visit
Great views. Great views over the Danube. A must see when visiting the castle district. Most of it is free too. A beautiful place and a must see

For the best view of Pest !. The view of the Pest side from Fisherman's Bastion is marvellous! One need not waste money taking ticket for this attraction because we can enjoy all the beauty of River Danube and the scenery on the other side even by visiting the ground level areas [which gives entry without ticket] .
Beautiful in the late afternoon. A must see when the sun is illuminating the Pest side of Budapest! Take a stroll through the romantic and impressive building and enjoy the scenery.

Stunning!. This place was one of the highlights of our trip!! It was stunning and it gives you a beautiful view of the city below! You almost feel as though you were in a Disney Movie! Definitely worth a visit!

picturesque. Nice place with panoramic view, there is shop with Marzipan there, few icecream stalls, loads souvenir places and very nice restaurant with local food next to church. Not very historic but worth visiting.

Must see in city. Must see place, beautiful views of the city, architecture. Must see for anyone visiting the city.
Learn a bit about history while touring here.

Favorite place. The first time I came here I could not believe my eyes! It was so beautiful and the view so special! They even have a great but a little pricey cafe where you can sit with a view of the city. (if you need a nice clean not very known bathroom look for the wooden door to the left of the cafe. Go down the stairs and turn left. Very clean and fancy bathroom that belongs to the restaurant)

Iconic and free. If you're in Budapest, this is a must-see. Yes, it's touristy; yes, it's a long hike up the hill (if you don't take the bus), but it's absolutely worth it for the views and the iconic photos you can take.

Best sight in Budapest. This was the most exciting part of Budapest for my wife and I went we visited. It was beautiful and nice to walk around this for free. You can pay to see more but even just the free part was nice and you have the church as well which was worth viewing. It's a definite must see and actually should be rated number one for things to do.
Beautiful architecture. This is an amazing place to visit. The views from the top are fantastic. There are several cafes here too.
Beautiful despite the crowds. Stunning views from the top of the fisherman's bastion gives you a realistic view of the sheer vastness of Budapest.

One of the best views in Budapest. Pay the small fee! The view is worth it! Or you can just grab a seat at the restaurant on the top. The drinks were great and the prices were cheap for a room with a view!

Great View!. A place where you are able to capture many beautiful shots of the city and just take your time to walk about. It can get crowded as it is really popular. Could get a little cold and wet up there so do prepare warm clothes and a lot of walking involved, so comfortable shoes are recommended. Go earlier in the day when it is still bright. A good activity for the whole family.

Beautiful spot. Defiantly must come along ...its quite big and the surrounding area has amazing shops bars and beautiful restraunts. ..Jamie Oliver s new Restaurant is opening very soon . You'll love till amazing place . It's a complete must visit and sit in the sunshine enjoying the hustle and bustle of the place.
Impressive structure on top of Budapest. The architecture is striking and you get a great view of the city and Pest side. Its right next to the church on Castle Hill so you can see both.

Walk the Wall. The Bastion is narrow and spans along the edge of a hill overlooking the Danube and to the Pest side, including the Parliament. It's free, except entry to the wall walk, which is less crowded than the ground level portions. There is a cafe at one end of the Bastion on the wall walk and and a restaurant on the bottom. There are turrets, nooks and stairs to walk.

Don't follow the crowd. Explore the top of this hill differently as everyone sticks to the popular views but look around you and enjoy the wow factor. Step of the track and explore. You will be impressed at each turn.

Great Danube View. It is your first time in Budapest, you must visit there. Bastion's view in my humble opinion second great view of Danube in the city. (first, imho definitely Gellerthegy) But Bastion's view has more different angle than Gellerthegy. If you accept Danube as a way, Bastion's view is almost mid of this way. Not as high as Gellert but you can see different things of Budapest from here. If you want a iconic photo from Budapest, you should take Parliament behind you at Bastion, and shoot ! :)
Pretty view. Beautiful architecture and pretty view but wouldn't bother paying to go up...basically the exact same view!

Great view, but long walk.. Take the bus 16 up there, it goes in a loop from downtown Pest. It is a pretty view over Donau and Pest, but crowded. Eat somewhere else, nothing genuine can grow with so many turist buses around.

BEST. VIEW. EVER.. This honestly MADE my Budapest trip. The views from this place are gorgeous and awe-inspiring. The bastion itself is gorgeous and the cathedral right behind it is just as beautiful. But THE VIEWS. Made my entire Europe trip the best, and Budapest became an instant favorite form this one location.

Awesome site!. Budapest is one of the cleanest and elegant cities in Europe, although sometimes the people are not friendly. The Fisherman's Bastion is simply a place you cant skip when you visit this city. The architecture is unique and beautiful.

Must visit it. This is one of the most famous tourist attraction of Budapest as far as I know so we won't missed it even the weather was not soo good. You can take amazing photos of the river Danube and the city. We went there by a special bus. The restaurant is a bit expensive.

Beautiful place and great view of the Pest side. Visit this place...it's gorgeous, has one of the oldest bakeries, the cutest post office and tons of tourists. In case you feel compelled to buy a lace tablecloth from a sweet older lady, knowing FULL and well that she's charging 40% to 50% extra (true story) but buy it anyway, since she's all the way up there and has grand kids etc, then go for it!
Must see. This a must see for any visitor in Budapest. Just make sure you have enough time as it can be very time consuming to see everything here.

Beautiful, picturesque, don't miss it. You surely won't resist the temptation to take lots and lots of pictures here. Looks medieval, but in beautiful condition. Don't know if it was reconstructed in the last decades, but it's nevertheless beautiful and historic.
Beautiful views. Great place to see views of the water and of parliament. Definitely a must-see for photographers and selfie-takers everywhere
nice view. nice to seedefinitely worth a visitvery busy with touristsfree to wander aroundwithin walking distance of other main attractions
Very nice spot for views on the Danube. It's a tourist spot, nice to see and take pictures of the Danube and the parliament. Close to the Mathias church

Like a fairytale place. The place is very beautiful and it offers a splondid view. Unfortunatelly in the summer most of it is ownd by restaurants so the access is denied unless you are a customer. Otherwise, a wonderful place

Great views! . Beautiful views of Budapest, although obviously very crowded. The lights of the city in the evening look beautiful from Fishermans bastion. Worth the trip - went on the sightseeing hop on hop off bus.
Worthwhile. Worthwhile going to. Some interesting architecture and the view over Pest is very worthwhile for photos.
Nice place. A lovely place and worth a visit. We spent a lovely afternoon strolling around here and stopping off for a small libation. Worth a visit. Great views.

Great view of the city. This area is pretty cool, some really neat architecture and a great view of the city. There is a really cool neighborhood behind it to explore as well. Definitely a good use of time.

Good to walk around after Castle Hill. We walked around Fisherman's Bastion after Castle Hill, which was the perfect compliment to the Architectural views. We chose not to eat here, because looking in the menus it looked rather touristy and pricey, but was certainly nice to walk around, which was free of course.

Commanding View. Fisherman's Bastion was very busy the day that we took a walk across the Chain Bridge and up to the top of the hill. It's very worth if though. There is a small square with restaurants built into a wall that is slightly more ornate than battlements. You can see the parliament building and the chain bridge from this area and look up and down the Danube. There was street music too which made for a nice atmosphere.
Beautiful view. . The view is incredible! Lots of tourists and you have to pay to go on the upper level. But it is certainly worth it. A must do for Budapest tourists for sure.

Not good enough. Problem seems simple. My wife wanted Duck no more than medium and it came well done. I wanted steak medium and it came rare so neither order was correct. I got the impression that the kitchen decided how things would be cooked rather than the customer. Service was absolutely fine but the waiter should not have been in the position of apologising- the maitre was nowhere to be seen. Wine was reasonable but we had far better meals elsewhere in Budapest that were cheaper too.
Nice Stroll. Such a beautiful and magical place to get lost in time! Would recommend this location as the views are spectcular

Bastion with a view. Although it is a relatively modern creation. This viewpoint looks great and provides a stunning view across to the parliament and the pest side of Budapest. Some towers were closed when we went due to filming but still enough open for a great view both day and night
Beautiful historical place. Beautiful historical place, with a best view of Pest! You can have coffee or something to eat on the walls of Fishermen's bastion.
Vacations. . Very nice history place. The shops here are cheaper than on the main streets of Budapest. Lots of walking and lots of beautiful scenes for pictures.
Nice 19th century Disneyland. Overcrowded, nice in the morning and evening only. Great view on the city. Walk down to the city using the stairs starting at Halászbástya.
A bit disappointing . Unfortunately most of the structure is taken up by a restaurant. The part that is publicly accessible is nice, but not amazing.
Good view, but there are nicer places.... Just a placefull of tourists. Nothing special. I would recommend any other place on higher ground to see the city overview.

A lovely view. Was led to believe most of the bastion was closed off/in the hands of private business, but that's not true. You can still access enough of the bastion and walk to get a wonderful view of the Danube. The white brickwork glimmers in certain light, adding a fairytale edge. I suspect the area may get busy during peak times, but when I visited (on a very sunny day) it was relatively quiet and I was able to take plenty of tourist free photos. Well worth a visit, if only for the view.
beautiful from far ... but .... very beautiful from the river shore, slightly disappointing when closer (it looks like a Disney land fake)

Okay for a short visit. It was quite cloudy the day we went so the views may not have been as impressive as they should have been. It was a nice area to visit but we didn't feel like staying too long.
Wonderful views. Paid £2 to walk along the bit of the Bastion that you pay for. You can climb up at the other end for free but still only £2 and great photo opportunity

Beautiful place to visit. Sstunning views of the Danube from a commanding position. There is a small charge to enter, but well worth it. Many cafes and bars in the surrounds. Ideal for a sunny afternoon. Easily accessible by bus from Budapest city centre.

Worth while. . We decided to take the escalator up to the top and walk around and then down the hill. The Fisherman's Bastion is a nice area with great views and interesting architecture. As others have mentioned, there is little point in paying extra for the elevated views as there are ample opportunities for excellent photographs all around. When you have finished the tour you can grab a coffee at one of the cafés in the area.

A must see tourist stop. This is a wonderful way to spend the day. There are amazing views of the river from the wall. The churchs alone are worth the trip. There are many little cafes to stop and eat or grab a hot or cold drink. Go early in the day to avoid the crowds.

Amazing!. This is by far my most favourite place in Budapest! Parliament is stunning but the Fisherman's Bastion just has something about it! The views of the Danube from the walls of the Bastion are incredible!You pay a small fee of 800HUF to walk along the outside wall. Week worth it. Best place for lots of pictures!There is also a very nice cafe where you can stop and look out over the river!
Exquisite. It's like looking at giant sand castles. Definitely a unique sight to behold. Views of the city from here are also lovely.

A must for the best views. The citadel in Pest is what I liked best on my visit to this city. It is a Unesco historical site, very tourist friendl and with the best views of the city and the river. Fisherman´s Bastion is, in the citadel, one of the best places for the pictures you will delight your FB´s friends with.
Very touristy. But has some great views.. Very touristy. But has some great views. Place is kept nice and tidy. Can be crowded at times. Views over the city are magnificent.
Free to visit. Provides a grear view on the Pest side. Totally free to visit. It is located in the Buda castle. Matthias church is in the near.

Most awesome architecture and great views. This is one great place to explore! The architecture is awesome, like in a fairy tale – and the place offers most amazing views, overlooking Budapest. For best photography light, come here in the evening, when the other side of the Danube is bathed in orange light!

This is an absolute must, to view for itself, and for its views of Budapest. Nobody should visit Budapest without including the Fishermen's Bastion. The position, marking the end of the square of Mátyás church, so as to look out over the Buda slopes down to the Danube, and across to take in all of Pest, not least with its riverside sights such as the Parliament. The building itself, in beautiful white stone, with carved arches and gallery, statues, and carvings, provides excellent settings for photos.
Beautiful beautiful. Worth the visit stunning building and well worth the visit to see it would go back again for sure. Bring water as you'll need it

The best attraction of Budapest. One could easily spend half a day here. The present day towers / fortifications of Fisherman’s Bastion were built in the 19th century to serve as a lookout tower for the best panoramic views in Budapest, Hungary. Its seven towers represent the seven Hungarian tribes that settled in the here in 896.It offers spectacular views on the Parliament, the many bridges, the Citadel.

Beautiful vistas. We visited on a sunny day and were treated to beautiful views of Parliament across the river, as well as other architectural gems. It was a bit crowded, but with the wonderful arches, plenty of places for photos without strangers in the background. The spectacular church in the square looms over all and is another must-see! There were clean restrooms at the Bastion and people you could pay to take special photos. It is definitely worth the trip to the top!
amazing. goreuse plase and surely worth a wisith, i went there at daytime, nighttime and afternoon and its just so beautyful

Wonderful Views of the City. The best way to get up here, in my mind, is by bus. I picked up a bus from Széll Kálmán tér which toured the castle area. I got off at the Fisherman's Bastion and the Cathedral.The Bastion was built between 1895 and 1902 on the site of a 13th century Dominican church. The style is neo-Gothic and neo-Romaneque. It was nearly destroyed during WW2 and so has been undergoing periods of restoration and repair since. Bits of its were being patched together when I was there. It is an amazing structure with its seven towers representing the Magyar (Hungarian) tribes and the statue of Stephen 1 of Hungary. More impressive though, is the view right over the Danube and across the city. It seems to be a popular place to have your photo taken.Nearby are shops and restaurants.

Great view of the Parliament. From Fisherman's Bastion, you can get a great view of Pest side of the town, especially the Parliament and the Danube River. It's free, and offers great photo points. I would budget 30 minutes there to ensure good photos are taken.
Stunning. This building has the wow factor absolutely beautiful .. Even if your not religious it's a must see .

We stayed at The Hilton, Castle District and this building was the view from our window. So beautiful.. This building was extremely beautiful and available to walk around free of charge. Fantastic views over the river and Budapest.
Amazing . A key place to visit when in Budapest offering great views of the Danube and couple with superb architectural magnificence a must for history buffs and sightseers alike.

Fairy Tale "Castle" with Fairy Tale Views. Though not a true castle, the turrets, towers and crenelations have the look of a fairy tale castle. It's the perfect place for taking photos of your family and from which to take photos across the Rhine to the Parliment, the Chain Bridge and other spectacular views. Don't forget to check out the restaurant located at the north end. Extremely fine food and the views don't get any better.
Beautiful! . What a beautiful place! Great view of the city and nice people all around. And the History Museum was cool :)

Worth the view. Went up this week, an easy walk if you can do hills, not far. Great views go on a clear day to see as far as possible. Think there is a fee to go onto the balustrade, we had a coffee in a cafe on the top, no fee paid.
Another must see. Mattais Church where St Stephen was married, beautiful views across the Danube to Pest. Also visit the nearby underground hospital.

Very Pretty. I went here 3 times while I was in Budapest during the day if you want to go up on the first floor of it you have to pay, if don't want to pay you need to either need to go after 8pm when its free or just go in the free bits (ground level)

My favourite spot in the city!. Wow! What amazing views and the architecture all around is just incredible. We were lucky enough to see it in the morning sunshine just before the rain swept in during the afternoon. Definitely worth a visit!

If you are traveller without a group dont go on Saturday morning - lots of tourists around. This beatiful museum on open area is something under must see. There is many many tourists on Saturday morning, more better to go some other day. Also walk over bridge and by steps through wood is very very nice. Great atmosphere. Beatiful streets around makes you feeling like you are travelling through time. Good organisation of public transport makes your retourn easier. Bus station is in the center of this lovely hill. Next to it is Buda Castle so you make it double visit. Very very nice

Beautiful, beautiful. I was absolutely enraptured by the beauty of Budapest, the area around St Matthias Church and the Fisherman's Bastion is so beautiful, there are stunning views of the city, we went in the evening and the daytime as it looks very special floodlit. I really cannot express how beautiful the city of Budapest is, it tool my breath away.

Fantastic views over the city. Worth a trip up here for great views. Not worth paying the extra to go higher. Gets very busy though during peak of day - worth coming up early morning or early evening for a more peaceful visit

Impressive Architecture with a Beautiful View. Located on Castle Hill on the Buda side, this place offers you an amazing view over the Danube and Pest. Surrounded by other worthwhile attractions, this is a "Must-Visit". I think you can pay a fee to go up and have an even better view. I was there on a Monday morning and the place was packed with tourist. This looks like a place worth visit especially in the late evening or during the night.

Beautiful views of Pest from here!. Free unless you want to climb the towers or pay for the funicular to get to Castle Hill. Sunning views of the city, clean stonework and makes you feel like you stepped into medieval times.

Wonderfull view.. From the Fishermen's Bastion you have a great view on the Danube with the Chain bridge and the Parliament building across the river. It's worth a visit during day time, but if you have the opportunity to visit during the evening hours as well you will have highly romantic view on the city. I would definitely suggest you take the steps down when you leave and every now and then look back over your shoulders to have a look at the Fishermen's Bastion. You will appreciate what you see.

Fabulous Views. Like everyone else said, the views are just gorgeous. We went back at night time so we could see everything illuminated - it was well worth it. Don't bother buying a ticket for the upper level, the views are free everywhere else!
Great Views from Fisherman's Bastion. Doubt whether it is worth paying to climb up a level as free views of Danube and Parliament building available alongside.

Great view of the Parliament!1. Beautiful structure with great views of the city below. Enjoy the walk through the cobble stone streets. Take your time to enjoy the amazing architectural design of the building and walk down without having to take the bus. Get lost in Budapest which is a beautiful city to discover while your discovering your way around.
Beautiful!. You have a great view from the Fisherman's Bastion all over Budapest. It's just greater when it's sunny!

Go for the Fantastic Views. Like the wall of a castle 'Fisherman's Bastion' sits high above the river with commanding views of Budapest. The area surrounding is also quite charming - while we visited there was a wedding taking place at the nearby cathedral and one of the buildings was being archaeologically researched - amazing and interesting all at once!Also at the far end of the Bastion are the ruins of an older cathedral!A must visit.

Absolutely stunning!. An amazing view of the city and also of this beautiful monument! I just loved budapest and this place was a very big part of the reason!!! I was just enchanted! A lot of great pictures to be made here!

The view from the top . As others have said before fabulous views across the Danube to the wonderful architecture of Pest. The views are free or you can pay a small fee to climb to the upper level. If you are not already staying in the castle area you can get there either by the funicular railway or use the route 16 bus. I would also recommend getting a Budapest card as they are very good value.

great way to end our trip to Budapest. Stunning, amazing and phew, what a view! I'd recommend not taking the funicular (tourist trap!). Walk up to the castle instead. It's a beautiful canopy walk. It's flat for the most part. On your way down castle hill, don't miss the historic pastry shop, Ruszwurm. Heads up, they are known for the cream cake and let me warn you, while it's absolutely delicious, it is practically a "CREAM CAKE" with 2 thin wafer cookies. good tho!

Stunning views!. Walking around Fisherman's Bastion was an amazing experience. Looking across the river from here was breathtaking. The architecture of the Bastion was beautiful. It was a wonderful place to experience.

Great View - but go here in fine weather. The Bastion is spectacular in itself, a series of covered spaces along a rampart with wonderful views of the Danube and the City. You can also get lovely photos of the multicoloured patterns of tiles on the nearby cathedral roof. There's a good view across the river of the Parliament buildings.Many of us sheltered in a nearby coffee shop where you can get very good cake.

Stunning. We were staying at the Hilton Budapest which is adjacent to the Fisherman's Bastion and we could see the Bastion from our room. In addition to the Bastion being a tourist attraction in its own right, the views from the Bastion are amazing, especially at night. A must visit in the heart of Buda.
Nice view......but ... The attraction offers great views of Pest. However, there is no need to spend the 800 HU to get in one side of it. The free side side offers better photo ops.

Nice Day out… Must do in Budapest... This is a nice place to get a bird's eye view of the Budapest Parliament Building & the Danube. You can just sit there and relax on one side is the colourful church and the other side is the danube & parliament & the chain bridge.
"Fisherman's Bastion". Fisherman's Bastion is the most marvellous place I have ever visited in Budapest!, also the church of St. Mathias in the same square is worth visiting.

Stunning views. There are two main reasons to visit this place: first the architecture is amazing and impressive, then come the views on the danube and on the city that you can enjoy from here. They are simply mesmerising and I kept taking photos. I would suggest you take the funicular to the buda castle and then you go down the fisherman bastion's stairs after admiring the landscape. While going down you can find some nice local pubs which are ideal to take a rest

Amazing place to see the downtown of Budapest and Danube river. The Fisherman's Bastion is one of evidence in Hungarian History.This building has historical value. And you will also see the beautiful city of Budapest and Danube river from above.Many restaurants, coffee shop and hotels near by. You can spend the night around this area.

Stunning views but get there early. This is a really lovely place but do your best to arrive as early as possible. It becomes so crowded as the day progresses. Amazing architecture, amazing views back across the Danube.
Beautiful place . Let the pictures speak for themselves!But they don't do it justice as it's so beautiful and lovely little restaurants

Most Beautiful. It is most beautiful with a very marvelous view of the pest side. There is a small fee to climb to the upper level. Adjacent to Mtthias Church in the same complex of Buda Castle. As being one of the most visited attractions in Buda side, the area is very crowded during peak time.

Bird eye view of Danube. From Fisherman's Bastion enjoy a bird eye view of Danube River. Required to climb about 3 storey of stairways to reach. An admission gantry (fee applies) before another stairways to reach the viewing gallery. Good spot for photography.Next to Fisherman's Bastion is roman catholic St Matthias Church. Some souvenir shops and cafes around.

Fisherman's Bastion. On the Buda side of budapest the fisherman's Bastion is definitely worth a visit. I recommend taking the funicular up to see it or visit through the hop on hop off bus service as it can be quite a walk. It is a busy spot so if you want to capture some pictures, give yourself plenty of time to explore.

Stunning architecture and beautiful views. This area of Budapest was the one that was most crowded when we visited, but understandably so, as apart from the nice architecture, the Fisherman's Bastion offers beautiful views over Budapest. Try maybe going early morning to beat the crowds. Entrance is free at the lower levels, which offer magnificent views just the same.
Good. It was good. Not a lot more to be said. Had a hot drink and a beer they also fired up the heat lamps and brought a blanket. Wifi was complimentary also

Wonderful carving. You can just stand next to the building and marvel at the detailed carving work of the past.
You'll not find craftsmen to do it nowadays.
Stunningly beautiful. The travel books don't really give this justice. It is well worth visiting. The streets in and around it are architecturally beautiful and well worth strolling about

Architecture and Views of Danube. Interesting architecture to look at as well as great views overlooking the Danube. Some entertainers around the area to keep tourists engaged. There's not tons of historical information provided about why it is there, but still a good stop along Castle Hill.
