Nice view. If you're visiting Budapest this is worth seeing. It's really touristic but in May it's not a problem. Enjoy the view! The area around is also nice to see.

Stunning view point. I came here on Tuesday with my partner and I was blown away by the view. Night or daytime, the views are simply breathtaking. You can see over the city and see parliament along the river bank. It was really lovely. Smaller than I expected but still a lovely place to visit. I recommend although it wasn't quite what I was expecting.

Eastern Europe tour. I loved Budapest and one of the highlights was Fisherman's Bastion and the views. Our guide was very knowledgable and gave the group a good overview of the significance of the Bastion and the role it played in the history of the city.

One of the most beautiful places i have ever seen. With views spanning the whole of Buda and Pest, on a clear day it would be criminal not to visit. Everything about the Bastion is stunning: the architecture, the views. It looks like something from a fairy tale. Not to miss

Last meal of the week. I booked here for our last meal of a short city break, I was not disappointed. Possibly the best restaurant I have been to for service, food & setting. Not a bad word to say really, expect to pay a bit more than your average restaurant but once you witness it you will see that it is definitely worth it.
Fisherman's Bastion. It is one of the attractions in Buda hill ( castle ) . It gives a panoramic view of the city and the Danube .
Good view of parliament. Has the medieval feel. The best location to get a better view of parliament and surrounding area. Matias church and royal palace are close by.

Beautiful views of the city . A must do if you are visiting budapest.Great views of the city and such an impressive building.We walked from near parliament on the other side of the river, it was about a 30 minute walk but quite steep uphill. Check out the oldest cafe in Budapest nearby Ruszwurm, they have a great selection of cakes and pastries. Although the building opposite is being renovated which makes it a bit noisy if sitting outside!

Lovely. Lovely place well worth a visit if only for a photo opportunity. So pretty and perfect. Would highly recommend. Prices are a little high for refreshments etc but that's to be expected at a popular tourist site in budapest.

Amazing view over beautiful Budapest!. Really enjoyed visiting the Fishermans Bastion. I thought the architecture was stunning and the views were definitely worth it after a short walk up the steep hill. I'd recommend going at night - the view of parliament lit up across the river is incredible.

Touristy. It's a nice place swarming with tourists slinging cameras and selfie-sticks about. There is, however, a bit of a restaurant with a thin menu, but decent beer that looks out from the bastion wall toward the parliament and is worth a stop. Most tourists pass it by, but the chairs are comfy and your partner can go trinket shopping while you relax with the view and your thoughts.

Рыбацкий бастион/ Fishermen's bastion. Perhaps one of the best architectural sightseeing of Budapest! I love visiting it and return there again and again! what a beauty!it will be interesting for children, couples, single visitors and to enjoy with colleagues.Places and streets around are very marvelous as well/ Одна из самых замечательных архитектурных достопримечательностей Будапешта! Люблю возвращаться туда и наслаждаться красотой этого творения.Будет интересным всем: детям, парам, одиночным поситителям, для визитов совместно с коллегами.Окрестности также очень живописные
Wonderful view. Many students here, quite crowded. Come early for a more peaceful time. There is a coffee shop where you can enjoy the view
Beautiful view . The view is beautiful but not much to do other than that. Everything is pretty much within walking distance, so wether u want or not, you'll probably hit the place
A must do!!!. The most incredible lunch and service I have ever had. Musicians playing all afternoon, the food was fantastic and the view of the city is unmatched. Could not recommend more highly

Worth the visit . Go for the architecture and go for the excellent view of the river and the parliament and that's pretty much it, don't bother in paying for the bus trip of 28 euros, get a taxi from the city for about 6-7 euros and get there or if you are renting a car well it's free then ;-) I wouldn't call it exciting and it's one of those visits if you have nothing to do then do it on a lazy afternoon.Most definitely the architecture aficionados will love it ;-)
Tour group . The history alone is fascinating. The views breathtaking. Even on a rainy day you could see miles back into the "pest" side of Budapest.
Sam. Great views from it. Nice walking around, but crowded with tourists of course. Take the funicular up to Buda and bus No 12 down to the chain bridge.

Must see. Very nice place to just walk around. The view of the city is great.
Very nice to just walk around the view of the city is great

Beautiful architecture and views!. The views from the top are beautiful – especially on a sunny day! The architecture was also really beautiful. It was quite crowded when we visited (around 2pm) so it might be better to go earlier in the day. Definitely recommend visiting
Beauriful view of the pest part of budapest. You get a really nice view of the river and the parliment from here! A great place for photoshoots! Even the square around it is really pretty!

Great views, a must, free at night. No doubt this is a crowded area for a reason. The bastion offers great views over the city and is a great outlook point to view parliament, particularly at night. Access to the bottom of the bastion is free and a lot of people pose and take pictures in the "Windows" for lack of a better word. You can buy a Ticket to go to the top during the opening hours, they are sold at the same ticket office that sells tickets for the Matthias church. However if you wait until nighttime you can go up there for free and take some Great pictures with the city all lit up. Would reccamend visting this area and also going to Matthias church as well.
Beautiful architecture and splendid views. A magnificent view from the Buda (palace) side of the river Danube over towards Pest and the Chain Bridge. Quite spectacular!

For the scenery. Its a good place to see the view of the Pest side. But i think its a lil crowded with people so you have to wait for your turn to take pictures else you will have many heads photobombing the pic. A must go to when in Budapest.

Beautiful night views. In early May, a quiet and romantic spot for viewing the city at night. We walked up at 10pm or so and had the place to ourselves. The Bastion itself is very pretty - Game of Thrones-esque walls. A couple of tips. First, if you don't fancy the walk, I believe its possible to take a public bus. Secondly, if you're a photographer, be prepared to deal with the fact that there are spotlights shining at the walls which you may need to contend with.
Lovely place, great views of Budapest from here!. A must see. Walk up to it if you can. Spend a good hour there. Nice restaurants nearby. Great place to take pictures.
Bastião. i like this place, very beautiful and crowded. Worth to visit and take many photos! If you are going to Budapest, dont forget to come here

Beautiful views of the city. I would recommend visiting Fisherman's Bastion, you get lovely views of the city from the towers and also the architecture itself is stunning to walk around. It's free to enter and it's a nice way to spend an afternoon.
magnificent. I was lucky to find this place on a walking tour, which I recommend doing this because it is known more

Must see in Budapest, the castle area is great for views of Pest and the Danube. The surrounding streets and squares - like Fortuna Street - are quaint and charming. Well worth the climb! Although a funicular is also available.

Great for those panoramic photos!. Wow!! What a view! Just behind the Matthias church the seven spires of the Bastion is a great place to visit. The walk up to it is lovely but may be a little steep for some people but the views from there are definitely worth it.
We used the hop on/hop off bus to get there which worked perfectly!!
Worth the walk up .. Buda is quite quiet compared to Pest but still has it's own charm. Great old coffee shop just a few moments from Bastion

Beautiful Place and great view of Budapest. Worth the trip up from the city. Quant 14th and 15th Century buildings that are well preserved make a beautiful backdrop as you make your way to the Bastion. The views from the balconies of the parliament building and Pest side of the city are breathtaking. You want to make sure it is a sunny day to get the full advantage of this location.
Views to die for. Spend a day up on the Buda side, you won't be disappointed! The views from the Fishermans Bastian are spectacular.

Sunset fun. Great place on castle hill to enjoy late afternoon sunset with a drink. There is a supermarket nearby to buy beer, wine and snacks and a few eating places close by as well. Busy place, great for people watching and views of Danube and beautiful buildings of Pest as the light changes in the evening. Great for picture taking !
Must visit in Budapest . A great view over the city and impressive architecture. It is worth the long walk and also the money in order to get in one of the 7 towers

Beautiful view. If you want to see the whole city, you definitely must to go there! Brilliant panorama, can see the Parliament and the Danube. If you want to go in the Mátyás church is 1500ft, if you want to go in the Halászbástya it is 800ft, but there are some free place, where you can go, and see the beautiful view. I can recommend to everyone who is visited Budapest.
Great . Really loved this place, it felt like being on the set of a film or something! A really lovely fairytale style building! And lovely views across Budapest too!

Beautiful view . What a great view! Bus 16 takes you all the way up or just hike. The hike is quite easy with a paved path, most of it in the shadows. Beautiful architecture once your up and great views on the pest-side of budapest.

Make sure to visit when sunny (and warm) . I have been here a couple of times and been fortunate it was sunny and clear, so that I could make most of the great views over the Budapest City. The time I visited last in March the guide suggested we postpone visiting by a day due to rain and it is something to consider if you have the option. Definitely a "must visit" location on your Budapest tour.

Magic!. This is a wonderful area of the city, and the views are spectacular from the top of this hill, looking in either direction along the Danube. Most of the Hop-On-Hop-Off buses will get you here. It's close to the Art and History Museum, so if you want to explore this as well, you'll probably need a full day. This area is like being transported into another world when you've come through the city centre. General traffic is restricted, so it's best to bus it. Plenty of places to eat and drink. If you do use the Hop-On service, make sure you check the time of the last bus down - it's a long walk back to town.
Great views of Budapest!. Been here twice now and love walking around this district and the views over the river and parliament. A must do in Budapest!

Great place to be! Don't miss it!. A very nice place to be. You can visit it during night when after 7 pm (not sure but around this hour) it's free to enter. The views you get from here are amazing and Budapest during night on Danube shore are amazing (you can see that in my photo attached here).
Must see. Beautiful place to visit in Budapest with interesting architecture. Nice view on Danube and Parliament.
great place for walking. great view and great for a relaxed walking. Not for rainy days. There should be more places for food or coffee
Beautiful. Great views of the other side of the river. The church is extremely beautiful. I recommend going early in the morning to avoid all the group guided tours.
Visit it at night. We went both day and night to fisherman's bastion I highly recommend you visit at night the view and the parliament look amazing.

Fisherman's Bastion is a place that you cannot miss. Walking around once twice or more it is never enough you want more and more,all the people around hearing tens of languages and by night just no words.
Beautiful Beautiful Beautiful! !. One of my favorite parts of Budapest the views alone from the top of the fisherman's bastian were breathtaking. It reminds me of a Disney Princess castle.

Whole Pest in side!. If you want to have a panoramic view of Pest and Danube, then Fisherman's Bastion is the place to be. Surely a must if you visit Buda and an attraction that can be combined with several others like the Buda Castle and Matthias church.
Amazing view. It is a public place open at all times, I went their at the early morning to enjoy the sunrise with amazing view of the city.

Such a nice spot nice view . Rooftop restaurant too!
Lovely views so pretty.architecture is really interesting to see. The whole area is nice with lots of nice restaurants dotted in and around here.
Picturesque with beautiful views. Picturesque with beautiful views - we passed by at the end of the day. views over Budapest and the parliament or amazing!
View point. Is a perfect place to have a nice view towards the Danubio and Buda's side. It is also located next to a gorgeous church which has nice details on the roofpart

Beautiful but busy. I visited this location on a walk around Budapest on a beautiful warm sunny day.This would be a great place for couples of all ages to go - provided that you can tolerate quite a few stairs as the road to get to the location is quite steep (though with that said, there are many bus tours that can bring you most of the way).Spectacular view of the city, multiple places to eat (though over priced as you would expect at tourist-y locations), and local musicians playing classical instruments.Immaculately well kept, but quite touristy as one would expect. I would imagine it would be best to go at odd hours such as earlier in the morning to avoid the throngs of people.Beautiful. Definitely a must-see while you are in Budapest!Wouldn't recommend going if you're feeling kind of lonely because it will probably not help your situation to see all the happy couples in love

Gorgeous View of Budapest and Unique Architecture. My friends and I almost didn't put the Fisherman's Bastion on a list of things we'd try to get to. I'm glad we ended up making it there, because it turned out to be really cool. The architecture was unique, which made it interesting. The view over the river and Budapest was stunning.

Fantastic Views of City!. This place has the 2d best views of the City, behind only the citadel. This is easy to get to, right behind the Matthias church. There's really nothing historic about this place, and nothing to see or check out in terms of the bastion itself. But the views across the Danube into Pest are stunning. Be sure to skip the paid excursion. Go to the far left, and up the stairs to where the coffee shop is located. It's free, and the views are no less spectacular.

Stunning views. The funicular railway is a good way to scale the heights to enjoy the stunning views and sites of the Castle Hill area if your staying in other parts of the City as otherwise the steps are very challenging!
Fantastic view. One of fantastic Budapest landmark, easy access by public transport so you should not miss to make a visit. Can get good view of majestic Parliament as well.

Cool lookout, but DON'T PAY!. There is a booth where you can purchase tickets for the church, bell tower, and bastion. We bought tickets for the church and bastion, and after perusing the church (quite interesting in itself) headed to the bastion. There is a small staircase with someone taking tickets that leads up to a good view of the city, but it is only one very small section. The part underneath, as well as the taller section with a better view off to the left, are completely free of charge.The only reason to pay would be to have a slightly less populated area in case you were looking to take pictures. Other than that, save yourself some money and just go to the taller section (complete with cafe/bar!)
extremely nice view!. excellent place to visit, take photos. Probably the best view of Budapest. Its worth being there during the evening as well.

Amazing view!. From the Fisherman's Bastion you can see the Danub river and all of Pest. It is a breathtaking veiw, one of the best in Buda. The buildings themself are pretty cool and fun to walk through, little kids would love them. Nearby there are many little shops and cafes,

Good photo opportunity. Great place for photos,there is an entrance fee to actually walk up and over the tower,but my tip go in the evening and no charge plus you get some great night pictures of the fisherman's bastion,and also night pictures of parliament and bridges etc.Catch the Var bus 16? I think, go to Szell Kalman ter by bus,metro tram,etc bus stop is on the road above,just look for the high ground and look for steps(escalator new not open yet)tip use 1,2,3,or,7day travel pass for trams,metro, bus etc

Nice panoramic views of Budapest. Besides its historical significance, while walking around the Fisherman's Bastion, you can enjoy really nice panoramic views of Budapest! .. Its a short walk away from the main castle area and the Matthias Church.
Good view. Did not find anything exceptional . Few souvenir shops, photographic spots.. Came here as part of a city tour .Overall OK type place
Perfect place for fotos. Interesting place with amazing view. There is a place for coffee and there is a museum of marzipan, where you can buy interesting things with different flavors
Like in the fairytale. This building is like a building from a fairytale. The view is very nice, you can see the whole Pest and the River.

Like a fairy tale castle. Unlike more functional old defense walls, the Fishermen's Bastion looks more decorative and pretty, like a picture out of a fairytale castle. The Bastion itself is great for many photo opportunities, and the panoramic view you can get from the walls of the city and river, is amazing. I'll recommend a visit.

Amazing view early in the morning. Got up for an early morning walk. (6.30am) had the place to myself. it was free at that time (well the barriers were open).
From here you get great views of the parliament, chain bridge, city etc.
Stunning views.. This is a lovely place to visit for great views over the Danube and Pest. It gets busy but its still worth a visit to pretend you are Rapunzel.

Impressive view. It's a great place to spend a few hours. Amazing views and picturesque scenes. Great architecture. Definitely have to visit if in Budapest. Some really nice cafes and bars nearby also.

The spot for the postcard view of Budapest. You don't really need to buy admission to the climb the stairs up to the next level. The same photos are available for free from the street level. Watch your wallet & purse. This is the most heavily visited spot in Budapest. The crowds can be thick, and are the target of some pretty good pickpockets.

Not worth 800 to go on the upper part of the wall.. While I wasn't expecting this, the views are fantastic of the chain link bridge and up and down the Danube. The 800hf to go on the upper part of the wall isn't worth paying however, no better views to be had there
One of my favorite parts of Budapest. The best views for a nice stroll whether in the middle of the day or during sunset. Great little bar to have a nice drink and relax after the hike up.

Best views in budapest. A must - do when in budapest. The views were amazing. It doesn't feel like you're going the right way when you walk to it but then it opens out into a lovely courtyard.
The bar at the top also comes highly recommended. The drinks are very reasonable for the location.
the view is amazing. is a must if you are going to budapest for first time, the view is stunning and the area with the square and the church of Agios Matheos picturesque

View!. If you wish to view Budapest from above this is the perfect place to be.
It's a nice old town only with pedestrian acces.
Recomand to drink a caffe/juice in the restaurant upstairs, not to eat, in order to admire the view.

Great views of the city . You have 2 options , wander on the lower sections which has great views of the city or pay a small extra amount at the kiosk opposite Matthias Church and gain access to the upper and the complete complex. Definitely and interesting structure and worth visiting. Seniors get a discount. You can combine the ticket with the church , visit the church tower and the Fishermans Bastion.
Stunning Views. The money that you are charged for this is worth every penny it is just beautiful. The architecture of the bastion and the views are breath taking.
Fisher- man towers!. It is located on Buda side. It is worth to see. It has good view. Every tourist visit it once they came Budapest. One of the famous and touristic places in Budapest.

Views to die for and feels like your on a Disney film set. . Views across the city and Danube river accessed through winding tree lined streets and beautiful houses leading the way. Climbing this beautiful structure made us feel like we were entering an enchanted Castle. Very romantic to boot.

Too busy still worth a walk up there tho . It was far to busy and touristy. Yes it's a nice view but The citadel is nicer. The walk up there was nice and the church is lovely to see. But don't bother paying to go up on the wall just walk over to the cafe on the other side and go on the walls for free. So many tourists chucking money away :(

Beautiful place near the St Matthias church overlooking the river. Lovely place, overlooking the river Danube and great view of the Parliament and Pest. Easy to reach by bus or funicular. Close to Castle Hill.
very interesting. beautiful views across the city and a very interesting museum, make sure you have good walking shoes.

An excellent view of Budapest. This gives you an excellent view of the city. There is a fantastic view of the parliament from here. It's quite a walk up though. Most tour base will take you there. If you are going on foot, be prepared for lots of stairs. But it's all worth it when you get up there.
Must see on the Castle Hill . There is a great view on the Parliament. Fotographers should appreciate it in golden and blue hours. Of course it's a nice place for a romantic walk as well.
Awesome view. 800HUF to visit this place. It only takes 5 minutes to have a look around but it's worth it because the views are amazing.
Views, History. Magnificent views of Pest from the Buda side of the Danube. Walk accross the Chain Bridge to get over the river.
A nice walk. This is a beautiful spot to walk to and also one of the iconic places to visit when you're in Budapest. We happened to be here on a public holiday and saw an air show over the Danube!
Great views. The Fisherman's Bastion is a beautiful place with great views of the Parliament and the city. On the way back, it was nice to walk down the stairs into the narrow streets of Buda.
nice. having walked to the Fisherman's Bastion unfortunately it was closed, but from the outside it looked gorgeous, A few cafes to admire the view.

Beautiful view of the city. The view from Fisherman's Bastion is best part. This is a free activity and great to visit when you are visiting Matthias Church. It is very beautiful and the views are great. The only disappointing part is that part of it has been converted into a night club, restaurant and shop. It takes away from the beauty and history a little bit. This is an activity that won't take you very long since there isn't a lot of information available about the history. You do need to pay for access to the top section. To buy this ticket there is a building across from Matthias Church that will sell you the access ticket and a ticket to enter the church.

Nice views over Pest. This is considered a must visit location, but its Disneyesque looks flatter to deceive. While it is pleasant enough and has great views over the Danube and Pest, for me it lacks the authenticity of other parts of this attractive city

Beautiful setting. We reached Fishermans Bastion by ending the Free tour at this location.The view from this vantage on the Buda side is stunning and the immediate vicinity is also very pleasant. I cannot claim to be a fan of the modern Hilton hotel that has been allowed to occupy such a prominent location behind the Bastion.In all it is a lovely spot though and great panorama for photographs.You do need to buy a ticket to go on to the higher ramparts, or perhaps eat in one of the places with tables up on it.

A pleasant walk in lovely surroundings. The whole area of the bastion provides a fantastic view over the Danube towards the city. It's a busy area with a few bars in the bastion itself but these were very busy, if you walk around the town there are a number of little restaurants dotted about allowing you to sit outside and people watch. A good way to spend a couple of hours in BUdapest.

Great views!. The story goes that this location inspired Walt Disney and I can see why. Lots of fanciful turrets Nice to walk around especially early morning before the crowds. Staying in Pest? Just take the 16 bus across from the Ritz Carlton. Bus fare incredibly reasonable!

Breathtaking . Stopped here with a tour group. Words and photos cannot describe how great this view is. Pretty busy area and lots of little shops in the area. The view overlooking the city will hang on my walls
Loved it!. First thing we did in Budapest was to go to the Fisherman's Bastion. Beautiful skyline views and amazing fairytale like architecture. Well worth a visit

Spectacular. This area just like the rest of the city is stunning. The architecture and vistas in every direction is wonderful. A beautiful building which is just made better by all it's surroundings. A must see whilst in Budapest.

Beautiful views. Located just behind St Stephan's Basilica it affords outstanding views over the Danube River and Budapest. There is a small charge to climb to the overlook. It was a wet Sunday morning when we were there and the stone steps were a little slippery plus there are no hand rails. Reading the history of the Bastion was interesting. It's called Fisherman's Bastion because back in history that section was defended by local fishermen.

Perfect place to see whole the city. The Fisherman's Bastion was one of the best spots to take photos of the Pest part of the Budapest city. You can reach this spot by walking, by taking the funicular or by using the 16 and 105 numbered buses. I recommend you to take the bus, which is a lot cheaper than the funicular and I strongly recommend you to buy a 24 hour free public transportation cards and take buses or tram lines everywhere. It is less time consuming and tiring instead of climbing a hill. The view is amazing here and there are a few spots to sit and watch the city. And also there are stairs here at the Bastion that goes down the hill when you are done at the castle district.

밤에도 낮에도 좋아요. Both night and day time are nice. 낮에도 예쁘고 야경도 예쁩니다.Both night and daytime are nice특히 부다페스트는 야경이 최고죠.Especially Especially Budapest is the best with its night view 부다페스트 야경 포인트 중 한군데입니다.This is one of the points of nightviews다만 입장료가 있어서 조금 아쉽네요.It has an entrance fee

The # 1 Attraction in Budapest. For me this is a must-visit destination in Budapest. The towers remind me of Topkapi Palace of Istanbul and the view from the rampart was great. We went up there twice. In the morning, we walked up from our hotel Mercure Budapest Buda ( 15 mins ) and in the evening, we took the light blue mini bus ( # 16, 16A or 116A ) beside the maroon building that looks like a castle outside Szell Kalman ter metro station ( red M2 line ) to Szentharomsag stop ( 3 stops ) . The whole area ( Plague Column, Matthias Church and Fisherman's Bastion ) is FOC but there is a small fee ( HUF 170 ? ) to go up to the rampart.
Beautifully restaured. Espectacular views and great photo opportunities. Could be crowded in summer but is worth it for the views of the city right below on the Pest side.

Fabulous monument, stunning views.. A magnificent monument atop Castle Hill, with an interesting history and offering simply spectacular views over Buda, Pest and along the beautiful Danube. Breathtaking on a clear sunny day.

Bring your camera. Lovely area,stunning views of the pest side of budapest nice area to walk around and stop for a spot of lunch,we went up on the hop on hop off bus,local buses also go up there or you can walk up if you are fit enough.or take the funicular,either way dont forget the camera.
Fabulous views. A special area which was enhanced as the band was playing in the adjacent garden whilst we were there
Fantastic. From here you can see the entire Pest... and part of Buda... Perfect is to come here the evening so you can see the city with the light.

Idyllic Castle Experience Amazing Views of Pest. When we entered Fishermans Bastion we felt as if we were on a Disney set, as it is an idyllic mini castle experience that is extremely well maintained. It also provides a vantage point that provides sweeping views of Pest, in particular the Parliament building.

Fisherman's Bastion. Beautiful architecture in the centre of Buda, walking distance to Buda Castle and Parliament of Budapest. Nearly Danube River. Beautiful place of Buda. Just awesome, especially at night.

Fish? On this wonderful high vista?. This is perhaps the most iconic attraction perched atop Buda's nearest hilltop, looking down onto the Danube and the plain of Pest beyond. Take the tram up the hill to get topside in the afternoon to wander through the entire plateau: village, church, Roman ruins, palace, beer gardens, etc which you should explore. Expect to wander back downhill by streetlight after dinner. Choose your dinner site so that you can watch the Parliament and bridges, below, light up after sunset
Interesting spot on Castle Hill. Neat architecture with a good view of the city atop Castle Hill. It is a good place to takephotos of Pest.
What disney was aiming for. Beautiful fairytale walk around the pretty ramparts. YOu can pay to go on the top, but the view is just as good from the lower free section.
Fishermans Bastion. Reached by a uphill walk , this attraction offers great views over the city. It is very popular , remaining moderately crowded day and night .

Beautiful. Went here on a sunny day. Beautiful view over Pest and Donau. We went to see the 3D show on 15 minutes, which gave a good impression on the Hungarian history. Sat in the restaurant for a beer afterwards, with the most beautiful view and some live musicians.

Amazing view. We did buda in one day (the rest we did in pest). Everyone told us there is an amazing view, and they were right. We didnt go up because it costs money and the view on the first floor was great.

Amazing Views and History await you on Castle Hill!. Visit the iconic Fisherman's Bastion on Budapest's Castle Hill which is on the Buda side of the Danube River for amazing views of the Danube and Pest side of the city. The Fisherman's Bastion towers represent the 7 Magyar tribes that settled Hungary. Beautiful St. Mathias church is at the center of Castle Hill with the former Palace close by. Many small shops for gifts and bistro style or full restaurants available just off the main square.
Very cute place. Very cute place. You can see a big part of the city and you can take a lot of pictures! We recommend it!

Great view to the Pest. We were there at around 6pm and there wasn't a lot of people there. The view of the Pest was lovely and you could walk up to the tower after 7pm for free. It is a landmark in Budapest and more people are walking up for the sunset and light up of the city when we walking down through the castle area before dinner.

view view view. Please do practice climbing steps before arrival - very nice location and good view of Pest and Danube .Good to read about the location or have a guide . once finished tour there do not forget cofee and great cakes in square behind . Fruit cakes !
Nice View. Baultiful place to go in the afternoon. We arrived near 5:00 pm and went all the way through the area. Exploring the Magnificent sunset over Pest. Must Visit.
the best view in budapest. Fisherman's Bastion is my no. 1 in budapest. i love to sit on one of the lovely windowes and fill budapest...great place!
Wonderful. This is the place you must to visit in your Budapest tour. Very nice place and wonderful view to the city

Peaceful setting with amazing views. We were the first to arrive that morning before going to Matthias Church and found this to be a beautiful place for a memorial to those who lost their lives. The views of the Danube and city below from the arches was beautiful. We took a few pictures and savored the moment. The Castle Hill area is wonderful. A great way to start our visit to Budspest.
Amazing . We visited this on a lovely sunny day. We got the bus 16 upto it and back. Amazing views in my opinion best we saw of the city. Go some lovely photos.
Beautiful. Amazing view and beautiful architecture. Very recomended!The gulash soup we had there was the best we had and never got better view of the pest side
Great view.. You get a stunning view from up there and it's not expensive per se but be prepared for the fact that it is just 100m of wall top.

An amazing place despite the rain. This is a lovely and historical place to stroll around with amazing views of Budapest and the river Danube.
Even though it rained all day, we really enjoyed strolling around the area.

Beautiful. My class went during the day. It was still very beautiful but I feel like traveling here in the evening with the lights would be better. If you love castles you should definitely travel here and check this out. We really enjoyed our time here. The photos from here were amazing.

Nice to see with great view of Pest. Great place for pictures, both of the Bastion and views of Pest. We didn't stay around the town but it looked interesting. Also, there is a memorial statue for those lost during the plague.

Must see this place!. I really enjoyed visiting the Fisherman's Bastion.
It's worth our time.The architecture was very interesting!
If you want to walk on the wall, you have a little fee to pay. Otherwise the rest is free access.
Perfect for photos . Fisherman's Bastion is lovely, the sun was shining and there was so much to see, the architecture is outstanding.
Great place. Walked up here on a lovely sunny day. Place was simply stunning. A must see if you are in budapest. Lots of parts to explore.
Castle District. Located on the Buda side along with the other castles it is a great walk up. Not strenuous or long. On a nice day it will led be a great walk with the kids.
absolutely romantic place. specially during the sunshine.. before some years when another cafe was oppened , were better.. but still now is very very nice place to sit and enjoy the amazing view

Interesting piece of architecture with excellent views. Best views in Budapest from this reproduction of a neo gothic piece of architecture
Named after the fisherman guild who used to defend this section of the medieval wall
Great view. This is such a great vantage point for viewing the Danube and the Pest side of the river, as well as the Parliament building.

Nice view. Look at the othet side of the city, we went during the day and i heart that at night it's even better.
It cost some money to go up but you don't have to cause you can see tge view from the bottom floor as well
Beautiful view of the Pest side of the river. A lovely structure, its elevated walkway shows off the St. Matthias church, river and modern side of this twin city.

Fisherman's Bastion. We were taken there by our guide as it was a part of our tour.
It is on top of a hill, and from there you can get a beautiful view of the Danube river, the Parliament and the city.
Super place. Super place to hang out...was with family and we spent a full day looking around the great structures and the viewing deck over-looking the river was fantastico..

Pretty place. A friend recommended me to visit this place, he said it was a bit like a Fairytale place.Indeed, it was really pretty, the architecture was interesting. If you want to walk on the wall, you have a little fee to pay. Otherwise the rest is free access. You can also find stores and restaurants/snacks around. I tried the plum ice cream, it was delicious.

Good viewpoint in Buda. Luckily at this time of year not too many people, so able to get good views over to Pestand the Parliament Building across the Danube. Good walks around the Cathedral to see the old town or have something to eat and drink in one of the cafes or have a meal in a restaurant. Lots of interesting buildings to look at and walk around the Buda walls.We had a sunny day and had a really good visit.
Amazing Views. Access up the stairs of the Bastion was free when we visited (Feb), I believe they charge during peak season? Views are amazing both in the day and at night.
Great place to visit. Great architecture, Matthias chuch its in here as well, a great looking church and from the Bastion you can get one of the best panoramic views from the city

Great view!. It is a beautiful place to visit and take a selfie of you and the view of Budapest. I live in the city and always take visiting family and friends there! To avoid the crowds in the summer months, go in the early evening or at night. The view is even more spectacular and there are some great bars and restaurants in the area.

Worth seeing!. Probably impossible but try and go when not as busy as people get in all your photos/everywhere and that was in February so goodness knows what summer would be like!It was free at this time of year and gave great views over the City, also good to see/be in the landmark you see from the other side of the DanubeCombine with a good wander around Castle Hill and it all adds to a very atmospheric time!

Place of outstanding beauty and atmosphere. Whether exploring the Fisherman's Bastion on foot, accessing it by bus or by the famous cog railway, the views across Buda and Pest, the magnificent Parliament and the beautiful Danube are simply stunning and breathtaking. A particular gem is the Church of St. Matthews - however, it's a bit of a tourist trap as anyone entering needs to pay, no matter if you want a quiet moment in prayer or if you want to see the sight. Take special note of the beautifully coloured ceramic tiles of the roof. Early morning is a good time to enjoy the Bastion before the onslaught of the daily tourists. Just take a gentle stroll along the old and tranquil streets and paths, or enjoy the changing of the guards at the fortress palace. You will be rewarded by stunning views across that lovely city and the surrounding hills.

Great view, felt in Gondor.. We got there in the sunset and the place was amazing, apart from the panaromic view, all the towers were red coloured by the sunlight, it was really seeming like middle earth. had an amazing experience! Recommend going to see the sunseting there, just because of the atmosphere.

You don't have to pay :). We booked a Big Bus tour and received a free walking tour, on this tour of Fisherman's Bastion he advised that lots of people leave negative reviews because you have to pay to go up the turrets for a view, but you don't. Walk around the left hand side and there is a higher one you can walk up to the top, take photo's - for FREE.beautiful area, must visit.

Fairy-tale location. This whole architectural looks like it's taken directly from our childhood fairy-tales: pointy tower roofs, sugar-white stone walls, mosaics, stairs, sculptures.... One of the most beautiful places I've seen in Europe and the entire world.

Stunning Views. A bit Disneyesque in appearance and not as old as you might think. Stunning views from the viewing gallery. Don't bother paying to go up to the viewing platform, you can see just as well from the left-hand end (which has free access through one of the towers) and which also has a terrace café.

AMAZING! Must!. The view is amazing, you can see the whole Budapest from up there! You can have a free tour as you wish, but if you want to get a rooftop view, you will need to pay some money! I did only visit the ground floor of the building and was enough ;)

It is beautiful with amazing views!. Fisherman's Bastion is a terrace in neo-Gothic and neo-Romanesque style situated on the Buda bank of the Danube, you can watch over the Pest side of the city. If the air is clear on the day it would be evem more amazing than it was for us.
One of the best view from here. I've been many times in the Fischerman's Bastion. And I realy love the view from here. In the early mornings when the sun comes up very nice photos can be taken!
super. the mosta amazing place in budapest that you must take a visit...its like that came from a fary tale...

Beautiful . We got a little confused as to how to find this place but you get a very beautiful view of the Pest side of Budapest so definitely worth it. The Matthias church is absolutely stunning and definitely worth a visit too!
Wow!. Amazing view, totally romantic and worth going there. The architecture is amazing. It looks so nice and you have a good view down to the city...I felt totally amazed!

Works on three levels. Fisherman's Bastion works on three levels. It is a visual treat in itself, but also allows great views of the Danube and the Parliament Building on the opposite bank. Furthermore, Matthias Church is in the same place so you get three attractions for the effort you put in. Alternatively take the 16 or 16A bus and it's no effort at all.
Nice. Nice panoramic view. A long way to come from Pest but all panoramic views of the city are on the Buda side. Worth a stop on the same visit to the castle.

Great impressions. When you climb up, you get impression of fairy tale setting. Personally, I would love to see it without so many visitors on the streets, stairs etc, but still: so charming. And the view from over there is perfect!
Fisherman's Bastion. Definitely worth the walk around the old buildings. There are also fantastic views to the city and a restaurant to relax and enjoy the views.

it is a must, so make the best of it. more than the location and the construction itself, it seems people visit the bastions for the memorable view of the city. Since the orientation to north-east, I suggest to visit it at the sunset in order to enjoy the golden light spreading over the city and wait until most of the yellow lights of the monuments are on. Great view of the Parliament. The restaurant-cafe' on the upper floor is not worth a stop: too touristic and overpriced.

Built for the 1000 year celabration. Never used for what its called but does afford great photo opportunities from all angles. The 7 spires (i think) represent the seven tribal founders of the Mygar confederation.

Magnificent!!. This is absolutely one of the places you can't miss when visiting Budapest. If possible walk up to the castle hill because the views while walking are exquisite. It's not a long walk it takes about 10-15 minutes to climb up depending on the speed. The Bastion itself looks like it's from a fairy tail. It's a real princess castle. The scenery from the arched windows is glorious. We spend almost two hours admiring it. You can see the whole city on the other side of the river and the parliament building that looks amazing from up there. Don't forget your camera!
Beautiful . Start from the bridge and walk to the top - then you avoid the que and get the motion as wellThere are some nice restaurants at the top, with some really amazing views!
Amazing architecture.. You get a beautiful view of the city from any of the arcs here.I simply loved the way they have maintained the pristine beauty of this place.

Nice view, don't pay for admission. There are great views of Pest from here. If you want to take photos, you need to go in the morning for pictures of the Bastion, but go in the late afternoon to take pictures of the Pest side. You may have the stamina to stay all day, but two trips is probably better.

Nice place. When u come to Buda u can go to that place. Just travel there, look on the view and enjoy pretty Budapest.
Some things cost $ but most of the time it's free or real cheap.
Part of visit to castle hill. Visited the castle hill and bastion all at the same time lots to see wonderful views of Budapest and surrounding area from this high vantage point

Nice view over the city but only in late afternoon. Only in late afternoon can you find some peace and romantic moments, because of too many beggars and ordinary tourist with selfie-sticks and "i don't care people" people.

A must see in Budapest. Fairy tale walls and towers overlooking the Danube and Pest. The white colors makes everything look fresh and clean. Climb the stairs or take the elevator to get to this place. You can also take a taxi.

Emits see. Stunning views and brilliant camera ops from all directions.
Cannot park close by so 10 minute walk uphill to get there but downhill all the way back!
Excellent Views. View the entire city. Beautiful day for sight seeing. The Danube and the Parliament looked spectacular. In the courtyard was a man in costume with a hawk for picture takers.
Fisherman's Bastion. I found to get the best out of being there was to go at 7.30 am, when you had the whole place to yourself.......
A must-see in Budapest. This is a nice spot in Budapest that offers wonderful views of Donau and the Pest side of the city. There is no point in paying full climbing up the wall.
No need to pay. We only went to the free part, but there's no need to pay. There are really good views from the free part. You definitely need to visit.

Great and beautiful. Beautiful place, great view of pest
We spend a lot of times there. We got a lot of beautiful pictures.
Don't miss this place.
Like a fairy tale. Beautiful, we were lucky enough to visit on a beautiful sunny day and it was gorgeous, we felt like we had entered a magical kingdom. Recommend a visit. Great views of the city,

Super beautifull, really worth to visit.. Really beautiful place and a must if you visit Budapest. Spectacular located with a super view over Budapest. We came there later in the afternoon to enjoy the sun set and the view of Budapest in light. The lighted Parlement is great to see from there. And in the afternoon it is not so crowded anymore.It reminded me at Sacre Coeur in Paris, seems to have the same Architect. There are nice small restaurants around.

Wonderful views of The city. You must visit the fisherman's Bastion if you are in the castle area. The views are amazing of the Danube and Pest. The quiz question is why does a landlocked country have a fisherman's bastion?
Goooood. Big territory to visit , fishermen bastion , Mathias church and castle all together , sky clear weather is necessary to enjoy city and Tuna views...

Gorgeous view from here. Almost missed it as the stunning church in front of it captures your attention, just look at the great details on the roof.But when you do get here and climb ghe stairs you get a magnificent view of the city especially of the Parliament.

Dont miss this at night. Very very busy by day with so many people around its hard to take it all in. Go at night and you can look upon the city dancing with light. You can also go to the top level free of charge as there is no one manning the gate. I wouldnt recommend paying to go up top during the day as the view is the same from either level... there are just fewer people which has its benefits. An easy stroll through the castle district will bring you here.
Astonishing. Take a walk here in the evening and you can see the lovely Budapest. Your eye won't be dry when you see the beauty
fantastic architecture. this is one of the most beautiful parts of budapest great sights can be seen from the turrets the whole area is magical. this is a must see in budapest.

Gorgeous view . Absolutely stunning view of the city, the restaurant cafe inside was superb. The musicians were fantastic and was a well needed retreat from the crowds and heat.This is a definite must in visiting Budapest and taking the cable car down the mountain was like that out of the Grand Budapest hotel movie was fantastic!
Fabulous views. A must do on your visit to the city. Sit in the sun and enjoy the coffee and views from the Bastion. Or enjoy lunch or dinner in the evening when all the city is lit up
city views. outstanding views over the city.fantastic walk over the danube & to see all the padlocks from all over the world.well worth the visit
WOWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW. Full of things to see. Beautiful architecture. The church on the premises is absolutely gorgeous. Beautiful view of Dunavi and the other half of the city.
Beautiful views. Stunning views of both buda & pest and the river Danube the walk up to here is lovely great way to spend the day

Great walk. Part of what makes the Fisherman's Bastion nice is the walk leading to it. I suggest taking the tram up then walk over to it but make sure you stroll around the adjacent streets. They have lovely buildings and nice shops. The Fisherman's Bastion itself offers nice views of the city and has a nice energy with all the visitors and vendors.

Wonderful Views. If you are visiting Castle Hill anyway the Bastion is a worthwhile stop. It's views of the city are excellent but can also be seen from just about anywhere in the area. Don't waste your money buying an entrance ticket to the Bastion if you just want to see the views.
Nice view of the city. Nice view of the city. You have to buy a ticket to go tot he top but you get a chance to view the city. Don't forget to try it also in the night.
Amazing view!!!. Come here for the best view of Budapest!!! Very castled-like building and great for taking photos. You will not be disappointed!
Amazing!. Wonderful view on Pest, one can enjoy the beautiful Parliament building view from the most preferable point. There is a small caffe with a nice choice of beverages.

Sunny day. Don't know what I was expecting but what I got was more than anything I wanted, the views are incredible, beautiful little village surrounds the church which has incredible tiles, lots of steps to get to it so prepare to be out of breath
!. spectacular view from almost the top of the city and it is free!!! In Budapest one of the "must see"!
Love it. I recommend to visit that place! It's really amazing! You can see all Budapest which is amazing ❤️ there is also some restaurant so you can rest with a nice view ;)

Next time they will charge for air.... We loved walking around the historical area of Fisherman's Bastion but they charge for entry to the first (second if you are American) viewing area over the river, which is crazy. Not impressed.
Nice view. Nice walk and view of Pest from the top of the hill. Couple of places to grab a drink and sit to enjoy the sight. Recommend taking the tram up from the river.
Holiday. Lovely place lots of steps and walking but in a lovely area worth the visit it is on the bud side where the are lots of sites.

The Views are beautiful from the Fisherman's Bastion. Put your walking shoes on and get going. You will want to climb to the top of the hill, the views are amazing from Fisherman's Bastion. If you are a photographer, you will capture some amazing sites!

Fantastic Views!. It is well worth a visit with the other attractions as well around it. Excellent photo opportunities. Like all others have said - just great views. Particularly of the Parliament building.

Great Photo Opportunity. Taking your photo in the arches with the Danube and Parliament in the background is a must! Surprisingly there is also a little bar up the steps in the towers that's adorable as well as a tiny table seating area. What a relaxing place to enjoy the views. We were there in April and it wasn't crowded but I imagine in the summer it's hard to get a spot because the seating area is so very tiny. Try it off hours instead of in the prime tourist time.
Good views . Great views of the city - don't pay for this though. The payment only takes you about four ft higher than the free viewing area.
excellent views. this is great part of the city to spend at least half a day f not more. the views are great especially at night. the old city walks and the royal palace next are worth to see
My favourite part of the city. Visit here on a sunny afternoon, grab a gelato and take in a panoramic view of the city from sitting in the arches - it is really something special!
Nice views. Beautiful architecture. Very nice views to river Danube and to Pest side. Worth of visiting, especially because of views and photographing.
Picture-perfect birdview. Magical place, picture-perfect, with one of the best views over Budapest. A must go, even if you're in the city only for a few hours!

Historical highlight . A great view over the Danube and a chance to catch up on some Hungarian history ( they have a lot of history)
Well worth a stroll up the hill

Awesome view. Terrific place for panoramic views of Budapest.
You can see all the River and its bridges from this point, the only backdown is its highly crowded but a must do anyway.
Great views across the Danube to Pest and Parliament. Great place for view up and down the Danube, of Pest, especially the Parliament buildings almost directly opposite.
Lovely Place. A beautiful area with tremendous views of the River Danube, a must to see ! the whole place is gorgeous, Make sure you have your camera with you it is so photogenic.

Beautifull view!. One of the best view in town!
You can take a lot of pictures!
Try some panoramic!
It will be perfect!
You must visit!!!!!!!
Beatiful view over the city. Beatiful place giving a nice look and view of the city from above. Perfect in sunny weather and it's for free.

Awesome view of the city but super crowded. Went there on a Saturday afternoon. Place gives you a pretty view of the city but was jammed pack. Try going at dawn so you get the sunset view along with the night time view.

Great views and a great place to hang out. The castle as well as the church are all here. Great views and photo ops of the city and the main features and attractions. Nice cafes close by as well as the baths at the bottom of the hill.
The View. If it's your first time in Budapest, you have to visit this place. Not only it is a perfectly kept castle, but it also offers an amazing view of the city!
Wonderful place to visit and stroll around. Beautiful building, atmosphere, surroundings and view of the city. Highly recommended, get an ice cream and climb the stairs, the view is magnificent!

Beautiful. This place is incredibely beautiful. The buildings are really wonderful and there is a nice view of city.
Only ugly think there is the Hilton hotel right next to this..
Definitely recommend to visit this place..

Great views. Fisherman's bastion along with the church nearby is my favorite spot in Hungary for views down on the Parliament building. You can capture some amazing photos from there and there is a nice coffee terrace up there. Worth paying a bit more for the drink !

Most beautiful of locations - must see!! . Had the pleasure of spending a good few hours exploring this wonderful place. Simply stunning and you must visit when in Budapest.
We opted to have a couple of cold beers and the cafe and made the most of the time to relax and enjoy the views... Although pricy for a drink it was worth every penny. Go!

Sightseeing . Worth a visit, skip going inside st matthias church as more spectacular outside. If you go to the bar near the hilton (right side) you can get to the top of fishermens bastion free. Admittedly you need to buy a drink but who wouldn't want to sit up there and admire the view with a few drinks
Beautiful building, lovely views. We went here on a beautifully sunny day and the blue skies provided a perfect backdrop. I highly recommend a trip to Fisherman's Bastion.

Beautiful architecture. The view from the Bastion was breath taking, it was definitely one of the most beautiful places I visited in Budapest to observe the city. I definitely recommend visiting it, and perhaps having mulled wine or a hot chocolate with the great view on a chilly day could be one of your best experiences in this amazing city.
My favourite!!!! . I LOVED this place!! Soooo beautiful and interesting! Never seen such a place and it was amazing views! Do yourself a favour and put it at the top of your to do list!!

Some wonderful views. An amazing structure with a real sense of history in a delightful position overlooking Pest across the river. Good opportunity for some excellent photos.
The two café bars are very pleasant, if a little over-priced, however.
Girls weekend . Beautiful architecture, pictures don't do it justice! Great views from here also. Would recommend for all groups- couples, families and friends.
Buda. Very nice part of the city, I appreciated being able to get a great view to take photographs, best visit on a clear day.

4 days in Budapest. Fabulous building well worth a visit, there is a lot of hills for walking but wort it. it is easy reached by the site seeing buses. the views over the Danube and Pest is spectacular. if you are into your history you will love Budapest.
4 day break. This place is so clean it is unbelievable. The church is so beautiful and the views from the battlements fab.
Worth a visit. If you are in Budapest, take the extra time to stop here. The church is stunning, the view is beautiful and the local dessert shop is delicious.
Amazing view . Went by taxi and was set off just outside. Sent about an hour walking around admiring the beatiful buildings and the amazing view across Donau. An absolut must see!!!
Simply beautiful!!!!. Its a beautiful place; very calm yet beautiful. I think its a 'Must Visit' destination and would highly recommend it,
Miss. I cannot put into words how beautiful it is. One has just to go there and see it by him or herself. Another must visit.
Impressive view. Great view and interesting history! Join the afternoon free walking tour to learn more about this place!
incredible views and architecture. Quite a steep walk from the river, but you are rewarded with some great views of the city. The architecture is beautiful, too. well worth a visit!
Worth visiting. It's a must-see in the city. If you want a nice views over the city (day or night), go to the Fisherman's Bastion balcony (you have to pay during spring a summer during the day time).

Spectacular views!. This interesting area in Buda, overlooking the Danube and Pest on the other side, offers a magnificent view of the Gothic style Parliament building. Go any time of day, but evening and night views are special for the lights on the Chain Bridge. This attraction is not to be missed if you are in Budapest!

A view to die for. Fishermans Bastion is based on the top of the hill overlooking the whole of Budapest - a great place to take pictures at night whilst the lights brighten up the bridges and building of Budapest. There are several ways to get to it, walking - steep - lots of steps - gets the heart racing - when you get there you can climb on to the walls for excellent pictures. Alternatively you can take the Vanicular or the local bus. Plenty of places to visit and its free.

Seems like a castle. You get stunning view of the parliment which is a definitely must go in Budapest. You don't really need to pay to go in as the views is the around the same. I would not recommend going in the afternoon as the sun is shining in the direction which would be difficult to take photos.

Great view at the parliament building. If you want an unobstructed view at the parliament, come here to take great pictures. Especially at night the view is great. Use the railing at night to stabilize your camera for sharp shots.

great view. For a great view from the Buda side, this is for you. It may look crowded, but just take your time and wait for a spot....it is so worth it. There will be ladies selling their handicrafts, but they are not overbearing and it appeared that the items were fairly priced and well made.

Amazing place! Fantastic views. A must-visit for Budapest.. The most beautiful part of the city - a must-see even for a short trip. If you have time to spare, get a drink at the small bar behind the fountain; it's set into the cloisters, is sheltered and has gorgeous views, very good table service and a lovely atmosphere.
Excellent views of Budapest. Worth the climb up for great views across the river. Would be nice for an outdoor coffee on a nice day

Brilliant views. Used tram to get as close to it as possible. Walked rest of the way, was nice weather which added to the views of the city being clear and nice to see! Looks totally different from what it is behind the walls! Amazing place to visit, look around and stay for,coffee. It is free to enter!
Old world charm. The view from this place atop Castle hill is stunning! Recommend visiting the area at night, but be sure to wear comfortable footwear - loads of walking and tons to see

Fantastic views. We reached this by walking across the Chain Bridge then getting the fenicular up to the castle area.....not the long queues others have mentioned but it was a cold, grey day. Spent a few hours seeing the attractions......fantastic views of the whole city.
Fairytale. Loved this peaceful beautiful place. Great for photos of the other side of the river, as well as being picture perfect itself.
fine dining. Excellent food, Excellent service lovely atmosphere beautiful building spectacular views its a must in Budapest

Excellent views. Amazing views over Parliament, worth a visit - not sure what exactly you're paying for to 'enter' as it seems you get the same views for free so we didn't buy a ticket and don't think you need to really!

Beautiful buidlings. In my opinion this was worth a visit, the buildings are very beautiful. The views of Pest and the Danube are amazing and it is a good photo spot. We got off the hop on/off bus and had a lovely walk around on a fine clear day

Breath taking get view. One of the best place to view the parliament from.
Amazing scenery for both sides of the city Buda and Pest and don't even mention the Danube.
Amazing walk around here and the Mathias cathedral short walk to the castle and the prime ministers residential.

Wonderful view. Wonderful - perhaps the best - view of the city from here. Rather than pay an entry fee, if you go to the far left (North) of the bastion, you can climb the stairs to the Northern most tower of the bastion for no charge.

Stunning venue!. Went here with my partner for the afternoon and have to admit it was well worth it. The views are amazing and the Bastion itself is beautiful. I do not advise people to eat or drink here though as the prices were 4-5 times more than the average cost we paid elsewhere. Also I don't advise paying to go to the higher parts as the views from the parts you can access free are just as good.

Must see great views. This is a must if you go to Budapest. The views are incredible, the entire area is quiet and quant. Took some time to walk the streets and ally ways. There is a beautiful church (coronation church) with a amazing colorful roof but our visit was a Sunday and we could not go in.

Terrace view - in neo-Gothic and neo-Romanesque style. Fisherman's Bastion (Halaszbastya) with fairy tale towers offers among the best panoramic views in Budapest. The terrace is in neo-Gothic and neo-Romanesque style and looks like a medieval castle! Up the hill!
Great views. Super views, and you can see how Disney would have got inspiration for this castles here. Would not bother paying entry, just walking around does the trick!

A nice view. We walked up to Fisherman's Bastion rather than join the huge queue for the fernicular up the hill.
The views are spectacular, but unless you get a table at the restaurant at the top, you don't much time to enjoy the view before you get crowded out. It gets very very busy in the middle of the day!!
Beautiful!. There is few sites to visit on the Buda site but this is one not to miss - let yourself wander on the terrace and admire the view on Pest, beautiful!

Fantastic View, great for families.. Want a stunning view of the city from up high? Get yourself to Fisherman's Bastion. We traveled to the top by foot but took the funicular down. Additionally, there is a nice gated playground adjacent that my children really enjoyed.
Stunning. A must see in Budapest! The architecture is just magnificent. There is also plenty to do and see around Fishermans Bastion, and the view it over looks is gorgeous

Great Views of Pest. This is a must go to site while in Budapest. It is on the Buda side and provides fantastic views of Pest. We were there during the day and the views were fantastic! Great for pictures with Parliament or the Basilica in the background. One tip: you have to pay to get to the Fisherman's Bastion technically. However, there is a cafe and another bar that are free to get into...you just have to order something. If I were to do it again, I would just go to the bar (which we did anyway), order a drink and take in the views from there. Either way, you can't miss this place.

Lovely place with beautiful view. Its is lovely place with beautiful view to the Budapest Parliament building, Danube river and Pest. You have the option to drink a coffee and enjoy some time watching the city. The only thing which will surprise you is attached horrible building of Hilton hotel.

Incredible views. You have to pay to walk up but the views are incredible and it's cheap. I was surprised to find that if you look left, you'll see another lookout that is free, has a clearer view of the Parliament, and a bar!
Unbelievable. This was my favourite place in Budapest. It was unbelievably beautiful. Easily one of Budapest must go areas! I can't wait to be back.

Brilliant views. Visited as part of walk upto Castle Hill, the Bastion is around the Matthias Church, just took in the free to visit sections you can buy a ticket to walk up the steps on one of the turrets and around the top of the walls (battlements), but the arches below you can access free, well worth a look. When you have finished walk down the road towards the Castle and have a snack and drink at the Var Bistro (see other reviews)

Amazing views!. This was my favourite part of a recent holiday in Budapest! There are such fantastic views. Don't know what else to say about it really - it's just lovely and worth walking along the whole length of it, including paying a small fee.
Spectacular View. The view from Fisherman's Bastion are wonderful. It is a great way to get a panoramic view of Pest. It is a great starting point for a tour of Buda.
Fantastic views . Definitely worth a visit- great views of the city. We walked from here to the castle and palace building, a lovely morning.

Too beautiful to be missed. You can get a great view of the whole Budapest from the bastion. Located on a hill, this building is definitely an awe to the eyes. So beautiful, though you will have to climb the steps to get there but seriously, it's totally worth it.
Amazing views!. Great views of the city and such an amazing building! Really enjoyed the short time spent there.. got some amazing shots over there. Do not miss this place!

lovely views. A really nice part of Buda with stunning views over the Danube opposite the parliament building, we were there quite early in the morning and it was already busy in waves as walking tours were beginning to make there way around the Castle district, but it still makes for an excellent photo stop.

Beautiful! . This is a MUST, you can see it from a majority of Budapest it's lovely , we went right to the top and there's a little cafe right at the top so you can enjoy a beer! Be aware there are lots of steps so take comfortable shoes! and a good camera! This should be enjoy both day and night but not something to for the entire day.
Fabulous views over budapesty. This is a must, even if only for the views over Budapest. if you go to the side by the restaurant, you do not have tp pay, and can sit and enjoy a coffee as well.

Stunning view of the Danube and Houses of Parliament, particularly by night.. Fantastic view of the Danube River and the breathtaking Houses of Parliament. At night it is particularly beautiful as it is all lit up and there are considerably less tourists (the only drawback during day time visits!)

Beautiful but beware of street vendors. We stopped here on one of our site seeing tours and it was really a very pretty place and the view was great. The only downside was the amount of street vendors following our group around constantly.
so beautiful!. I visited Fisherman's Bastion twice. Once a bicycle ride with a tour and once with my mom, we walked to it. It is such a fairy tale structure with a spectacular view of the city!
BEST VIEWS OF THE CITY HANDS DOWN!. A must do! Make your way across the chain bridge and walk up to Fisherman's Bastion, it's WELL WORTH the trek!
Visit . Amazing views, wonderful architecture . Bus 16 to the top and back is great or the funicular railway.

Visit At Night for a Magical Evening. We were referred to a restaurant right by this amazing place and wandered over almost by accident, jet-lagged, after our arrival in Budapest. The views and the place itself were amazing, lit up at night. We had the place nearly to ourselves. We didn't realize how special this was until we went back in the daytime and the place was swarming with people and you had to pay admission! Go at night, and go in the daytime too!

Worth getting a ticket to the tower?. You can purchase the entrance ticket to one of the towers of the Fisherman's Bastion at the ticket centre where you can also get tickets for the Matthias church and its tower. I would not recommend buying a ticket for the Fisherman's Bastion as the other tower has an even better view of Pest, you can get a view with the parliament. That tower is far more crowded. So I would recommend if you want to get good photos of yourself with the view of the Pest and the Matthias church, it worths getting the entrance ticket. Otherwise, I think it is meaningless.

Beautiful fairytale environment . This is a must see during your stay in Budapest! From here you can look to the Pest side and have a great view of the Parliament. Whith the wind in your hair, you turn 180° and then you look at Matthias church and the whole environment and the almost embroidered rooftop makes you wish for a loveone to kiss you only to fulfill the moment

Stunning architecture, views and great alfresco cafes.. Stunningly beautiful location. The buildings are fantastic and the views over the city towards the parliament buildings are just amazing. Plenty of cafes, unfortunately I was on a bus tour so we didn't have time to stop and chill with a glass of wine in the glorious sunshine and watch the world go by.Budapest is a stunning city and I intend to return very soon to have a proper look around.

Fantastic view of the city, nice atmosphere. We took a taxi up to the Citadelle, a nice drive from the city centre. We walked around a bit, took the mandatory pictures and walked down. The walk down took approx 10-15 minutes and was beautiful!

Wonderful views beautiful place. Well worth the climb to get to this the views are amazing and the architecture superb. Although it was busy with tourists it has a wonderful atmosphere and we took lots of photos as a reminder of how beautiful it is.

Amazing views of pest and a good photo opportunity. Great spot and lots to see and do.
Great photo's and there is a guy with a hawk that you can take photo's with.

Always wanted to see this and now wonder why?. Every time I have seen pictures of Budapest I have wanted to visit this and now I have I cannot fathom why I wanted to, it is not really anything interesting at all, one part contains a café and another a restaurant but that is it, no more than a very simple decorative feature so if you do not have time to visit during your trip to Budapest do not worry as you have missed nothing.

"A Lovely place". This is a lovely place to visit; a beautiful terrace, with 7 distinctive white cone shaped towers and beautiful terraces. From there you can have an incredible panoramic view of the Danube River and especially the full view of the Parliament. A little history about this place, long ago a group of fisherman protected this stretch of the city walls. That’s why it’s named “Fisherman's Bastion”. It was a very refreshing walk and every turn and corner is a photo op. Happy Travelling!

Great first port of call!. We were staying in the Castle District and wandering up the hill to Fisherman's Bastion was a great first thing to do. It not only gave us beautiful views, it helped us 'orientate'. It's free and surrounds the east end of Matthias Church (which has a charge to get in).
Wish we had more time. Very beautiful place. We had a limited time to see, part of our cruise tour. It was cloudy and we got rain. Would like to see it again.

Beautiful view. Nice walk to get there - go up through the park. A little steep, so you should be in good health to make it up some steps and the cement path. Once there - nice to walk around and see the markets and shops selling souvenirs. When you get to the church and plaza, you can look out over the river. You're pretty high up. The St. Matthias church is a bit pricey for the tour, but worth it. We didn't need a guide. The museum and the rooms are beautiful and you can learn a lot from the interactive displays.
Amazing!. awesome place to sit and sip on a cold beer and view the breath taking view of Budapest. The place offers a nice walk through and some amazing food if you feel hungry as well.

History with a great view. The Buda side of the Danube in Budapest offers a wonderful view of the Pest side, but it also offers a quaint village, restaurants and beautiful architecture. It felt like being at Disney World. The church was closed during Easter Saturday mass, but the outside with it's spires and patterned roof was spectacular. We were there in the daytime, but the view at night must be amazing.

My Favourite Place in Budapest. This place is beautiful for views, the buildings are beautiful. There are a couple of cafes up here, but I would recommend the one at the very top (Cant remember the name) we had yummy hot chocolates and listen to a live pianist whilst looking over the city. A definite must see in Budapest.

Overrated. The Bastion is overrated. You need to pay to access the Bastion (even being in maintenance). Just near by you have a nice cafe with the same view where you can also appreciate a coffee while taking pictures to Pest.

Wow factor very morning. If you stay at the Hilton castle hotel and lucky to get the view from the window you see this amazing architecture every morning. Will be reluctant to close the curtain at night. All at the door step to wonder around.

Spectacular. Having heard that Fisherman's Bastion inspired many of the castles in the Disney films, I was so looking forward to seeing it for myself. I was not let down, finding every turret and winding staircase completely enchanting. We were lucky enough to visit on a beautifully sunny Spring day, with many wildflowers in bloom, and it truly felt like a dream come true.

Inspiration for Disney. If Disney did not get inspiration from this place then I will be very surprised. Very romantic location, fantastic views, and nicely renovated. A must see for any trip to Budapest.

Great Views, Don't Buy the Ticket. While tickets to the Fishman's Bastion's pinnacle "roof" are inexpensive (700 HUF per adult), the views are no less spectacular than those offered by the other Castle Hill stops (Royal Palace, Matthias Church, etc.). Would definitely recommend visiting as a part of the other Castle Hill sights, but forego the unnecessary walk along the top and enjoy the free views of the Danube/Pest offered by the area's many other scenic attractions.
Fantastic views!!. Definite must do. Great morning to wonder and enjoy the views; Amazing views of the city. Kids held the hawk in front of the statue and enjoyed the experience.

Nice views of Pest. I loved the architecture and the views over the river of Pest and the bridges was lovely, well worth the walk up the hill. Didn't think it was worth paying to get one level up and glad I didn't as when I walked to the end there was a restaurant / bar that allowed people up for free (and they didn't even force you to buy a drink which was a pleasant surprise)

Beautiful architecture high above the Danube. This is a nice old set of stone sculpture and stone works in the old town. Part of the Bastion is used as a restaurant and cafe. There are two parts, one on either side of the Mathias church. It looks nice from up here - almost better from the other bank on the Pest side. Not worth it on its own, but it's worth visiting the old town in Buda, walk the little streets, good to visit the Bastion and enjoy the superb views of Parliament and the Pest side of town.

Free with fees. . There's no easy way to get up here (unless you pay for a taxi, but that's cheating). If you choose to take the walk up, it's tiring. Lots of steps or steep paths that just suck the energy out of you, take a drink! Once you arrive, it's free entrance to roam around but if you want a tour of the tower or to access the higher platform you have to pay. There is also a fee for the toilet too (seems common in attractions). View is amazing. We went during the day but an evening view would be lovely. Its a must for Budapest. Nearby you have souvenir shops, small cafes and a few art galleries.

good view. nice weather, good view... you can bird view the city along the river very well. though a bit too much tourist spot. lack of information on the history and background, a bit pity.... the terrace belongs to a restaurant, you have to be their guest if you wanna a better view....
worth the climb. the Fisherman's Bastion is impressive, the roof tiles are colored and glazed and have been laid in intricate paterns. the surrounding area is very pretty.

Perfect on a lovely day with friends.. As it is pretty touristy once you're in the Forint Swing of it, this place is pretty expensive in comparison. So, we didnt go in. Mu ha ha. Anyway we walked around the free bits admiring the gorgeous architecture, so anyone who likes that sort of thing this place is a MUST visit. It was a beautiful day when we went and we just spent hours gawping at the build... cafe looks like a ripoff so didnt go in there either! Beautiful views from the turrets (if you can call them that?). No idea about its history, going to look it up!

To end a trip to Budapest on a high!. So how do you end a 4 day trip to Budapest on a high? Dinner at the exclusive restaurant in the Fisherman's Bastion! Besides boasting the best views of Pest on the Danube as the Fisherman's Bastion is part of the Royal Palace Complex on the hills of Buda, it had been built for the Fishermen responsible for the protection of the royal court. In modern times it boast most probably one of Budapest's grandest and best restaurants!
