The whole experience is of historical romance in an unbeleivable setting backed up by great service and first class food. It must be said that one eats well in Budapest, be it street food, cafes or restaurants, one is never let down and at relatively reasonable prices every time. This place needs a reservation and then it is smooth sailing towards an unforgettable evening of old world charm all enhanced by a two man orchestra playing classics and movie themes to enhance the mood. A pleasure!

Nothing spectacular but worth going to. Views are good but no more so than from other places on the Castle/Citadel. Worth going to, but the views from the top of Matthias Church overshadow them completely. We also had a drink in the bar that was on top of the Bastion. The service was very slow and the drinks were the most expensive we had in the city. Wouldn't stop here again
Gorgeous architecture and view. A lovely place to spend the afternoon wandering around. Great views and lovely architecture, this is a truly unique building.

Nice but not necessary . We paid to go up this thinking that it was a walk all the way around where we could see people sitting down having a drink further along. Don't be fooled! It's not true. Yes it does have amazing views but you don't need to pay to get the same view by walking past the Bastion further along its free to enter and you can go through the bar onto the terrace to get just as good a view. I suppose for 800Huf approx £2.40 I can't really complain... But it was misleading as it did look like you could go to the terrace from there.
Best souvenir of Budapest. This place was indeed my best souvenir of the city. If you have only one day to spend in Budapest, that's the place to be.

like you live in a dream. amazing place like it has come out of a novel that you were reading as a child. you look araound and you wait for the prince and the princess to show up from any second. amazing experience

A must see for Budapest tourists!. gorgeous gothic style castle with amazing views. free which is a bonus! spend how ever long you want here. no cover so probably not best for rainy days but we went at sunset and it was gorgeous. amazing place for keen photographers and art history lovers. I'm 21 and went with my boyfriend and we both thoroughly enjoyed it, walked around for an hour or 2 just enjoying the sights. Was romantic and worth seeing!
Just beautiful. This place is beautiful - the guide books do not do it justice. You really must visit. There is a lovely café at the top and the views are spectacular.
Beautiful. Well worth the long, tiresome walk up the hill. This place is truly amazing and the views across the Danube are breath taking.An absolute must

Beautiful views . This is an iconic and beautiful piece of architecture not to be missed. It's free to see and is less than a 20 minute walk from the Hungarian parliament. Perfect place to take in the views of Budapest and get a perfect picture of the Hungarian parliament.

Beautiful Views. It is worth the hike up here for the views of the city. The church exterior here is beautiful, although we didn't venture inside as it was a bit pricey. On the way back down we stopped at a great little craft beer spot! You can spend at least half the day wandering around through the Bastion. Go early to avoid massive crowds.

Come and see!. A must in Budapest. My recomendation is visiting twice: one during the day (and you can take the opportunity to visit Mathias Church (don´t miss the tower) and maybe have some lunch up there. And another one during the night to enjoy the views and the Parliament.

A must see. Took the long walk up but the view from the top was amazing.all the major sites of the city could be seen and there were plenty of places to have refreshments , a beer , before the descent. well worth a visit.

My favourite place in Budapest. This was like a fairytale castle and my favourite place I visited in the city. The whole area was very clean and you got exceptional views of the city.We visited late afternoon one one occasion at 5 pm,when it was less crowded.

Views to die for.... A great place to wander around and see the sights, although you do have to compete with the ubiquitous selfie sticks! I would love to see them banned entirely. Some beautiful views across to Pest and you can take your time just meandering around the whole area.....

Amazing architecture and spectacular views! . I really enjoyed wandering around here! There's so much to see you won't know what direction to look in. I spent a couple of hours wandering around with my friends taking in the views and looking at the fabulous architecture.
Worth a visit. Even if this is not your piece of cake, the view over the Pest part of the city is breath taking particularly when the weather is clear!

What a view!. This looks almost like a castle from afar. On a clear day you can see across the Danube far into Pest. There are parts that charge entrance but other spots that offer the same view for free if you prefer.
Must see. Don't forget to look for Woody Harrelson's statue! The church is not worth the money but luckily there's plenty to see ll around.

Apparently inspired walt disney. Numner 16 bus from city drops you right at it, ir a 30 minute walk, Great cafe across the road (ice cream and deserts), and apparently it's towers inspired the Walt Disney towers on the castle

So unique. We went here first on the Monday after Easter (which is a holiday in Hungary), and it was mobbed with tourists with selfie sticks. The second time we went was about 21:00 and it was much more quiet and even more beautiful and romantic lit up with the lights. You can't beat the view of parliament.
Wonderful views.. Get the bus to the top of the hill then spend an hour or so visiting the local shops in the old town before walking to the palace.

Fantastic views. Wonderful views of the city and a great place to sit and watch the world go by on a sunny day. It is free to walk around and you have to pay (400 huf each for students) to go on the higher balcony.
Definitely worth walking up and to appreciate the view!
Great Views. There were great views of the city. We'd didn't go to the paid level as it made little difference to the overall experience.

Great City Views for FREE!. The Fisherman's Bastion is a terraced viewing area which overlooks the city and features fabulous views. It stands where the old city walls previously stood and the present day lookout towers were built in the 19th century. As a free attraction, this is a "must do" while in Budapest.

Nice place, beautiful views . Probably the best views of Budapest, along with stunning architecture. Worth the journey up to it, you can either walk up long winding slopes & stairs to the top if you feel like a challenge. Or the easier way is to get the cable car at the bottom of the hill which then leaves a short walk along to it. There are also plenty of places to stop for a drink or a bite to eat. There's a nice peaceful park at the top with cute single person benches if your looking for a quiet spot to relax and take in the sights! Only downside is once you get to the top they charge for use of toilets & you have to pay to go up onto the higher balcony. Definitely worth the trip though
Beautiful . Very nice place to wonder about . Alot of nice architecture in this city. Friendly locals and also the streets are kept well clean
Great views. Amazing views over pest ! Worth walking around this including the church. Don't how ever buy a beer in the top turret in the bastion as its the most expensive in the city !!!!!!!

Great view on Danube. In the winter it could be very cold and windy up on the hill but the view is breathtaking from this place. You can see the parliament building from there. There is also a church. Some cafes. Nice place and is worth a visit

Great view on Danube. In the winter it could be very cold and windy up on the hill but the view is breathtaking from this place. You can see the parliament building from there. There is also a church. Some cafes. Nice place and is worth a visit

Beautiful views. The place is beautiful and you won't miss because you will probably visit Matthias Church which is pretty much in the same place. Get there early to avoid the hordes if tourists. It is not an easy walk up for the elderly or people who might not be in the best shape. You can also pay 1500 f to climb a balcony, but I personally thought wasn't necessary.

Beautiful but crowded. As one of the main tourist attractions, it can be expected that there are a lot of people visiting the bastion. But is was quite annoyoing that there are restaurants in the bastion, making it hard to walk on the walls and viewing the city. Despite this, the bastion is a beautiful building!
Magnificent views . Thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the Castle District. The views were fabulous. Plenty of souvenirs too.

Great views and lots of fresh air. Budapest is so beautiful and full of oxygen and parks of green!If you go on the Buda side of the city you will surely walk up to Matthias church and the Bastion...the views are simply amazing, you will load your cameras with dozens of photos and you will inhale all the freshness of Danube and of the greenery situated all around. You don't have to pay to visit the Bastion, only one part of it requires payment-too expensive for a balcony and a few stairs-so I would recommend to skip paying for the specific part of the Bastion as all you can see and experience can be seen from the part that you don't have to pay for!

Great views and a toilet!. You can get great views from this spot which overlooks the Pest side and the Parliament. The spot is also close to the Buda castle and it's also next to the matthias church which in itself is also worth visiting. Next to the fisherman's bastion and the church there are a couple of stalls selling food. Next to them there is a toilet inside of a small building (there is sign at the entrance of the building). Be prepared to have 300 huf or 1€ for the toilet. If you don't have some change, you can go to one of the stalls and ask them to exchange some money. Since toilets can sometimes be hard to find at tourist spots, this is one that can serve your needs. I dont't know if it's als open in the evening, when we went at 17:30 it was still open.

Lovely views. The Fisherman's Bastion with it's seven towers are amazing to look at and the terrace with panoramic view of the Danube, Margaret Island, the stunning view of the Parliament from the top, even more so with the beautiful weather we had

Worth the walk. Superb views over the river, lovely area to wander round. Plenty of cafes, we found a little snack bar on the other side of the area up a small alley serving coffee and snacks to take away, really lovely.
Worthy a photo. The bastion itself is nothing special, however it is located near the Matthias church (which is a must go, by the way), so it is worthy a photo.

Another amazing building in Buda. How I loved pottering around the Buda Castle district and this building is straight from a film set with you as an extra.The views are divine and it is just great to linger and absorb the atmosphere.

Budapest from the top. Location: it is 15 minutes walk from Buda Castle, or you can take bus no.16 from Buda Castle (Dísz tér) or from Széchenyi Chain Bridge (Clark Ádám tér) and stop in Szentháromság tér.Experience: it is free to take a picture from outside the building, you can even get in into the place where everyone take a famous picture of Budapest, framing the city with the building. You will only need to pay if you want to get to the upside part of the Fisherman's Bastion.
Very interesting.. An incredible spot to visit to get great views of Budapest.It wasn't too crowded as we were there in off season.
Stunning scenery. One of the must do's in Budapest. Plenty of tourists but definitely this should be on top of the list. There are some cafes as well in this area.

Great little spot with fantastic views. Upper balcony is not free. But I doubt the views are more majestic. We didn't go into the church. There is a little playground just by the cafe to the left as you exit the stairs.
It is worth it to visit the area day and night. Visit the area . Use bus 16 or the rail car ! Excellent view !!!!day and night . You can take fantastic pictures of the Pest side of the gown .
Fairy tale turrets and photogenic at that.. We spent a bit of time looking round here, and were very lucky because our room in the Hilton overlooked the main stonework.

Beautiful, a must see in Budapest . Clean friendly and inviting with amazing views. A must see when visiting Budapest. Some trinket type shops and places to eat, fisherman's bastion also leads to the palace

Sense of a fairytail!!!. The view is amazing and from there you can admire the Danube and the entire city. Just next to St. Matthias Church. You have to pay a small amount in orgder to visit from the inside.

Best views. Have been there in a cold and sunny day. The place is amazing and you couldn't have a better view of the parliament than from the top of the hill. The restaurant is very good but a bit pricey.

My Budapest Highlight!. The architecture at the bastion is beautiful, the views from the bastion are the best to be had in the city, it is also home to my favourite church in budapest. Matthias chuch. This was a free attraction until march 16th. Lucky for me i was there before. You can purchase to visit the area 2 metres above the other view. i dont think many people will bother if i am honest as you still get to soak it all up from below and experience the views even without purchasing a ticket. you can purchase a ticket now for the matthias church, the tower of the matthias church and the fishermans bastion viewing platforms. It worked out around 7 pounds each. If you are doing the matthias attractions i dont see why you wouldnt go for the bastion aswell. Enjoy this beautiful area and the beautiful Budapest! Happy travels!

Beautiful views and architecture . Beautiful views and architecture from the fishermans bastion. Great views across to parliament and the church itself beside here is amazing. There is a little market right beside where you get off the bus that sells hot wine. We grabbed one each and took in the views while keeping warm with delicious hot wine. It was a lovely experience.
Great view. From there you have a great view on the city and the nearby Parliament. Restaurant Pierrot is also in the neighbourhood. Visit also the Mathias church.
A must to visit. Very beautiful monument and great place to get a skyline view from the city. You can't access all of it without paying.

Fantastic view of a beautiful city . Got the cable car train thing up and walked along past the castle and nearby church, the views were spectacular, with the whole city spread out in front of you.
The bastion itself is very pretty, with towers rising up like the Disney castle - the best part was that it was free!

Holidays in Budapest . The best views of Budapest, dont miss the chance of visiting this amazing place and it surroundings. Best pictures taken and get in st mathias Church, it is worth it. Impressive
Nice look out. Nice look out on the Danube. Nothing special. Don't bother buying tickets. First floor is enough and free.

Lord of the ring minas tirith: Most beautiful Place in budapest. It seems to be within lord of the ring movies: huge Stone construction with amazing landscape, reachable by a Nice ancient elavator; very suggesting and romantic

Impossible to miss!. Assuming you are already going to Matthias Church, this terrace is located just outside. Take your time to enjoy the panoramic view of the Danube and the Pest side of the city across!
We did not pay admission to get to the upper level so no opinion on the view from there.

Views are breath taking. This is a must if visiting Budapest, we sat and had a coffee and admired the views of the whole of Budapest was very clean and a great tick of the list of things to see whilst in Budapest
Great lookout. It was pretty busy when we arrived but well worth a visit as the view across the Danube is fantastic and the building itself pretty spectacular.

Great views. We came here twice, worth seeing in the day and also in the night when the Parliament building is lit up. Amazing views over the River Danube. Great when the weather is good as you can spend a while walking around.
If in Buda, see the Pest. This place offers good views to Danube and Pest-side of the City. Nice place to visit, but perhaps slightly overrated.

Awesome Views. Fishermans Bastion is an awesome wall-like structure that gives you a beautiful view of the city. There is a restaurant in it, where I suggest you stop for a drink to soak it all up. No need to pay to go into it, you can go for free to the 1st level and get just as great views. You'll spend maybe 15 minutes here.
Easter time. This is well worth the journey to Fisherman's Bastion. To see the Church also the views are well worth the trip to see the Buda life and enviroment

panoramic view!. Ideal location for taking pictures!It offers panoramic view of the city.Visit Matthias church, enjoy a coffe or just wander around to this part of the city that is more elegant than the center! Choose a sunny day - if that possible- for better view.If you visit Budapest you just have to go there!
Beautiful. Amazing view of the city, do not miss it! Climb the stairs and walk around as much as it is allowed, well worth it!

Beatiful place with awesome panorama to the city. There is the oldest church in Budapest however restored now. The view is great and it is totally worth to go there just because of that. Entrance to the curch is not for free, although still unfortunately i didnt have time to go there.
Fantastic viewpoint. Great viewpoint... An amazing starting and closing point for a visit to lovely Budapest. I would advise going there twice (during the day and in the evening)

Beautiful. This was absolutely beautiful and great for views. It was also next to Matthias church which is a stunning building. Unfortinately when we were there in Febuary there was some scaffolding and building work going on which detracted a little from the scene but these things happen and it was still worth the visit. There are also a lot of cute little shops very nearby, great for Hungarian souvenir shopping.
Best view of the city. Definitely a no miss when you visit Budapest. A nice walk especially when the sun is up and probably THE best view of the city!
A great work of architecture. This beautiful architecture sits high above the Danube, overlooking the Parliament. It is a beautiful structure with a view that is not to be missed! Jon

Great View. Fisherman's Bastion provides great views City skyline both day and night. Be sure to visit at night. It is absolutely beautiful. During the day there is an entrance fee, but at night we were able to walk in for free.
Pretty spot with a view!. Really pretty architecture with great views of the city. Go to the bar at the top at sunset and watch the parliament light up for an unforgettable experience.

So wonderful. take the tour up to this place well worth it
being Easter the weather was cold and coler up there so dress to suit
Fantastic views. Beautiful church and surroundings plus a fantastic view of the Danube as well as Parliament. Can be crowded, but worth it!

19th century kitsch, with great views. One of the cliche tourist attractions in Budapest, great and cringeful in equal parts. What appear wedding-cake-like fortifications are actually a 19th-century folly built on top of the actual past fortifications. Built as a tourist attraction, it works like one really well, given the commanding views from the ramparts of the Danube and the Pest side, including the Parliament house (a rather more elaborate late-Gothic folly itself). Near-constant crowds of the location make it ripe for pickpockets and the ripoff merchants of the authorities that, on and off, have been collecting a fee for getting up to the bastion.
Princesses and dragons. One of the best sightseeings in Budapest. Perfect for a walk and admire the beauty of Budapest. Awesome!

Enjoyed seeing the history in this wonderful city.. We visited this spot while waiting to tour the nearby church and castle hill. From the top of this wall you have beautiful views of the rest of Pest.
Nice panorama of the city. It's useless to buy thicket, the free part of this place is beautiful as well as the paid part. One of the best places to shoot photos with Parliament and bridges

Interesting building . This was interesting- didn't buy a ticket to go on the wall as you could see the same view and plenty of it without. It's right next to St Mattias Church which was unfortunately closed when I went.
Most beautiful point of view. This is the most beautiful point of view from Buda Castle, looking over Danube and entire Pest side of Central Budapest.
Best pictures ever. At night or during day time, you can get the most amazing views of the city and the Danube! Not to be missed for best photo shots!

Seagulls view. Beautiful in its own way, it's the stunning vista you get from the viewing balconies that makes it a great POI. Indeed, you can see the whole of Pest from this vantage spot and take some lovely photos of the City, the river, the bridges and surrounding area, all through the quaint arches. The cleanliness of the whole area is impressive, as is the architecture of the surrounding church's, statues, Palace and general buildings so it's well worth the bus trip over to Buda.

Stunning view. From the Bastion you have a great view over Pest and the Parliament and can take amazing pictures overlooking it. Have a walk up to the Bastion and start your excursion of castle hill from there.

Spectacular views of Budapest. Stunning views of beautiful Budapest. Highly recommended lookout point for any tourist and a very romantic spot for couples. A nice walking activity if you walk from fisherman a bastion to the Buda Castle. In winter it can be a bit windy but in warmer weather it is absolutely perfect. Beautiful both day and night.

Amazing structure. The Fisherman's Bastion is a must-see when visiting Budapest - such an interesting structure in old Buda. You can buy tickets to visit, but in my opinion you don't need to - the ground floor of the structure is open to the public, and if you walk round to the Northern end of the bastion, you can go inside by visiting the shops and cafes. In particular, there is a cafe on the first floor which gives you the opportunity to relax with a glass of vino and marvel at the view. The ticket only really gives you access to the first floor of the southern end, which is much the same as the rest of it. Save your pennies!
Blown away. This is amazing and so happy we went. What a spectacle. Looks like something from "game of thrones" It's just amazing, Loved it...

The best place in budapest . Even if you are only 2 days in Budapest you must go to buda and get up the hill and get to the fisherman's bastion . An amazing experience which I will remember for the rest of my life

Fisherman's bastion!. When you visit the fisherman's bastion, it's like you hop in the bus from downtown and the 21st century and hop out in the middle of Snowhite's village! A magical place, with a breath taking view of the Parliament and the Danube river with it beautiful bridges!

Absolutely amazing!. I was blown away by this place. It was a sunny day when the bus took me in front of the Matthias Church, and I was blinded by the view. The sun rays were reflected on the white walls of the church and the Bastion, and at that moment I though that was one of the most beautiful things I have seen in my life. The church is built in the Romanesque and Gothic style (like the Parliament Building) which I adore. And the Bastion and it's 7 towers look like they are in the middle of Sahara and not busy Budapest.I would most definitely recommend everyone to visit Fisherman's Bastion (especially on a sunny day). It is a view you will not forget.

Absolute Top Attraction in Budapest. This is one of the most beautiful spots in Europe. The views from Fisherman's Bastion are spectacular and it's an incredible place for photos. There is a lovely casual place for drinks right there and my daughter and I sat there for hours enjoying the view and watching the day turn into evening! At night the parliament glows and again another amazing photo opportunity. We liked it so much that we went back there again our final night to take it in one last time!

The view is amazing. Just absolutely amazing!! Beautiful view from top and next door to Marriot hotel and a few great places for lunch. We ate in the palace which was amazing experience and food is great.

Amazing views!. I can't say enough good things about this square! There are gorgeous views and a great restaurant. I visited for my birthday to the restaurant and I was treated like a princess! We went back the next day to walk around the square and take some pictures. It was a wonderful place to see!
Interesting stop . We stopped here just by chance and like it said in the book it's a place not to be missed I would give it 10/10

grreat sight. Fantastic place to see and wonder at how they built it all those years ago, do not bother with the 800HUF tour of the bastion, you basically walk up some steps and along the top wall before coming back down again in 10mins.
Danube view. Fishersman's bastion is in a nice square at buda side. Very nice budapest view from that side. A nice cafe is near where you can rest. Good place to visit

Great viewpoint but currently under renovation (March 2016). I've just returned from Budapest and thought anyone planning a trip might wish to know that Fishermen's Bastion is currently undergoing some renovation/restoration work. This doesn't appear to be preventing access (there's a terrace at the top accessed via a turnstile), but a large section of the central area was under scaffolding and debris netting (as at Friday 18th March), which will have implications if you intend photographing the Bastion itself and, possibly, the view of Parliament though the arches at the top. I couldn't tell how long the work might go on for, but there's a lot of stone stacked up at the site).
Worth a look. It's worth a look for a good view over the city. Expect to be strong armed into adding a 20% tip to anything in the cafe. Wouldn't go back. Wouldn't spend more than half an hour there

A view of a lifetime.. The vista from the Fisherman's bastion is one of the greatest I have ever seen. the rooftops of Europe are always terrific, but check out the Church roof tops from this view. mind blowing.
Ok. It was quite nice, expensive beer and a good view, but very overrated. Since a cant write a shorter review I will put in some words in the end here.

Don't pay. I'm only rating the fact that you have to pay 800huf to walk 20 metres there while the other part is accesible for free. Save your money for coffee you can have in this free part of the tower, don't buy tickets. Views are beautiful in any case.

Beautiful place. It's been a view years since we visited here but I will never forget it! The view of Budapest from this place is amazing! We paid to tour the inside of the building and it's so worth it as it is beautiful. We visited Budapest again last month and I really wanted to revisit this place at night time to see the view of the city all lit up but it was too cold so we didn't bother. I would recommend that anyone travelling to Budapest to visit this place!

Special meal!. We made a visit here as a group for an evening meal. After champagne on the wall taking in the incredible view of the city we headed to our table. Inside the building is breath taking. But the staff, service and food was the highlight! Really high end restaurant and you simple can't leave disappointed!! Defiantly a highlight of our trip! Go enjoy.

The place to go for fantastic views. Amazing views of Pest from the gantry. The marzipan shop just round the corner(next to the Hilton) is well worth the visit if you like the stuff and the coffee is nice and cheap as well. Try the food at the open air restaurant, bit expensive for Budapest but cheap for us and delicious local food.

Amazing views of the city. From here there are amazing views of the city. We took the hop on hop off bus up there and walked down. You could take the fenicular railway down if you have limited mobility / pushchairs etc. with you but with very little effort walking down is quite easy for anyone with moderate walking ability, it has easy steps and slopes / could be very slippy if wet. Up st the castle there is plenty to do and see as well as having lots of eating / drinking options.
Scenic overlook. The structure is fairytale-esque. The views are breathtaking. There is a fee to climb onto the structures but it's worth it!
Fantastic Architecture. Definitely a place to visit, fantastic architecture and amazing views of the River Danube and the Pest side of the city.
Great Views. Panoramic views from this area the buildings are neo-Gothic and neo-Romanesquewell preserved. You can visit the site by taking a bus we used the hop on off bus
Just great!. Excellent views, a must see while in Budapest. It is walking distance to the castle, and Matthias church is just behind it.
Very nice. You need to visit this place at night and also during the day. Both views are magnificent on their own,
Beautiful. It's one of the most beautiful places I've ever seen. Amazing architecture, scenery and lots of wee cafes and bars around.
Interesting. Interesting place to visit and see the cool structures and check out some awesome views of downtown Pest

Fairy Tale location..... Breathtaking views from the Bastion and at sunset/dusk viewing the city and all of the illuminated buildings alongside the river is magnificent, worth the trip either on foot or using the funicular train.
So charming. Very good place for buda view, there is anpther top spot with fees so yiu can see better view, i liked it and recommend it
A place that worths a visit. If you are in Budapest, you have to visit this place. You can enjoy a relaxing walk and the great view of Budapest from there!!
nice view. good views and worth looking at if you happen to be up here to see other attractions, but nothing particularly special about this place itself.
Great views. Great views and extremely well preserved. Had the opportunity to have dinner in the restaurant. It's beautiful inside and the food was excellent. Highly recommend!
Fairytale-like fortress with a great view. Make sure not to miss this on your trip to Budapest. The Halászbástya not just looks wonderful, it also offers one of the best views over the city.

Best vantage point of the Pest side of the city. I highly recommend paying a visit to the Bastion - it offers a wonderful view of Pest, and in particular the parliament. You can avoid paying the ticket to enter the towers by entering one of the towers that functions as a restaurant - the most northern tower.

A must see!. For those that appreciate architecture, you will be in awe! The Fisherman's Bastion is like no other! Just wear comfortable shoes as there are many stairs, that were slippery as it was raining the day I went. And don't forget your camera, you will want mementos of this place.
Noble splendour. Very impressive castle like building with wonderful views across Danube to the city. Intriguing passages and stairways to explore.
Nice. Nice area, nice view... But in general, the best is around this area. Just dont it in the cafe on top of ot... Waste of money

Great view to Parliament.. Fisherman's Bastion is a perfect place to observe the Parliament as it stands right opposite from the iconing building on another side of the river.The whole area around is also nice and it worths it to stay for half of the day here in order to see other places close to Fisherman's Bastion such as Buda Castle and Matthias Church.Just don't forget your camera as it is a great opportunity for great pictures!
Fantastic romantic views. Fabulous views from the ramparts & extremely romantic at night when you overlook Pest - the parliament building, bridges & buildings all lit up.

Perfect Vantage Point. Place can give you a bird's view of Budapest, especially the Pest side. Stay until around 6 pm when the lights turn on to see Budapest at night. There is a bar nearby where you can enjoy the view with a Hungarian beer. You can also get a bowl of Goulash for about 5,5 euro.

Impressive. I didn't go inside. But the views you get from here are incredible. The architecture also very nice! I went here twice in my first week in budapest. I would definitely recommend, also get a very nice view of Parliament

The Views!. Absolutely don't miss the Fisherman's Bastion! The views alone over the Danube of Parliament make it worth checking out. I'd recommend visiting in the evening so you can see the building lit up. Be sure to walk around the castle area over to Buda Castle.

The best views. This is a must, for the fabulous views of Pest if nothing else. A great little cafe nearby, with authentic Hungarian food and huge mugs of mulled wine...and very reasonably priced considering the location. Ideally placed for visiting St Matthews church and all the attractions of the Royal Palace.
A little bit crowdy during the day !. It's a nice place but you have to go there early in the morning (specially during the summer) because it is really crowded ! Nices shops & restaurants !

weekend trip. This is one of the iconic spots from which to look down on the city. it requires a good strong trudge uphill (this being a castle and all!) from the river below but your efforts will be rewarded. Take your photos through the archers slits to get the effect you will have seen on a hundred tourist posters and flyers. Then relax under the arches and enjoy a coffee and ice cream... if, that is, you can find a space among the tourist hordes - the only problem in this lovely spot.
Also totally amazing buildings. This part of Buda is gorgeous, what with fantastic views over the Danube and fairy tale castle lookalike.

Fairy tale - disney eat your heart out!. I am sorry but you simply cannot go to Buda without visiting the Fisherman's Bastion and stopping for a well deserved coffee in the Bastion cafe itself. It is quite fairy tale, they are currently carrying out some reconstruction but you cannot miss this.
Go back in the evening.........! wow
Beautiful!. Amazing and beautiful! Such a great place to visit in Budapest and the buildings themselves are outstanding.
Great views . Excellent views and a beautiful building. Took a stroll up here on a really sunny day it was really picturesque and has outstanding views of the city
Best place to have a coffee. Whenever I show the city to someone, we alwazs stop here for a drink. Smoking also allowed. Not that I care...

nice place but no historical value. Free to walk around. Seems like it was built for tourists and the view is stunning. We avoided the food places and walked down the road directly in front of the church and found some nice little cafes.

A must visit while in Budapest. Was in Budapest in 2014 and revisited this year. This is for sure one of the more touristic areas and a must see while there. Great view in Danube river and opposite to the Parliament. I cannot tell if I prefer to visit during day light or in the night. Would definatelly go there again. Be prepared to walk some kilometers if you choose not to rent a car, since the nearest metro station is not that near...

Stunning. Fisherman's bastion is a short walk further on from the Royal Palace so you can combine the two.There is an enormous square with a compilation of bronze figures which were stunning.There is a museum but we did not enter but the outside was lovely especially the coloured tiled roof which appeared to be a feature of Budapest's historic buildings. The views of the Danube and all Budapest were beautiful although the day was slightly hazy so go on a clear day if possible. We meandered down through residential streets to get a feel for where they live and had coffee in one of their café's and was made to feel welcome very cheap.It is quite steep so use the funicular if required.

Anniversary trip. Fishermans bastion is a wonderful place. It is absolutely beautiful just strolling around exploring it and maybe stopping to enjoy a drink and take in those spectacular views of Pest.
odd. this is an odd wee place it was just different from all around but well worth taking a look great view

Very touristy but understandable. A lot of people are here all the time it seems but the view is fantastic (not quite as good as on the top of the big hill) and the area is very nice with great cafes around
Bastion. We stayed a 2 minute walk from here. Unbelievable views of the Pest side and Parliament and the chain bridge

Magnificant View. From Fisherman's Bastion you get a wonderful view of the Danube and over Pest, especially the Parliament area. Right there is the castle, Matthias Templom, toilets at the marzipan museum, good restaurants and Ruszworm, the oldest coffee house in Budapest. Don't miss teh hospital in the rock, Szikla Korhaz.

Beautiful architecture. This is one of the most interesting constructions along the riverfront, and is worth a stroll to take in the scenic viewpoints and some of the architecture of this construction. It is really only a wall and series of towers that are recent construction in the history of this amazing city, restored after virtual annihilation during WW II, but worth the time to visit.
Amazing place. Going to the Fisherman's Bastion is must when you visit Budapest. The architecture is amazing, and when you go to the top it's breathtaking.
Amazing Views. If you visit Budapest then you must take a trip to the Fishermans Bastion. So much to see and do, amazing.

picture postcard perfect.. THE FISHERMANS BASTION is without a doubt one of the most beautiful and popular tourist attractions in Budapest. It can be seen from most parts of the city and when you make the trip up there the views afforded from the wall's looking out onto the mighty River Danube and the city are truely stunning. It's alway's busy with tourist's so there are souvenir stalls aplenty and a bar for refreshments. Bring your camera as the picturesque views of the Bastion and city are perfect for the keen photographer. A great tourist attraction and well worth checking out.

A cool part of town. Visiting here didn't take long as we were just passing through but I did get a very "travelling through eastern Europe" feel when I was there. Mainly due to the really cool architecture and stuff.

Best viewpoint in the city.. Unfortunately some of the Bastion was closed on our visit. However it provides a marvellous viewing platform down on to the Danube and across Pest. Enjoyed a drink here while admiring the scenery and sunshine.
Wonderfully Scenic. This is a gorgeous part of Castle Hill. You can see the city, the Danube and in the spring all the gorgeous countryside. It is an amazing structure for architecture buffs.

Breathtaking view view of the city. You can visit this magnificent site and Matthias Church in the same visit. It Is beautiful,and such a pretty area to stroll on a nice day.
The views across the Danube and Margaret Island are perfect, too.
Would definitely recommend.
Truly amazing views. This area is great for walking around, however you will be truly amazed by the views from the Fisherman's Bastion. Definitely take your camera.
Woww. My first stop in my trip to Budapest. Absolutely stunning! The roof is amazing. And the views?? Can't get better, really. TOP
Amazing Budapest. Coolest city in Europe, must have for couples or families. More and more new fancy bars, restaurants. Amazing historical sites. A whole dictrict for parties.

Stunning. Simply amazing.
Free to visit and walk around with the most amazing views of budapest from the walls.
Theres a little bar on the walls where we had a beer (a very expensive beer as far as budapest prices go) but it was well worth it.

picturesque view on Danube and Pest site as well as the Parliament. The bastion is in the centre of the Buda Castle on the top of the hill with beautiful view surrounding good turistic places, restaurants, caffees etc.

Lovely Views . Fantastic views over Pest part of the city from the fishermans bastion. Stunning and a lovely walk around the fairy tale turrets. You can see across the whole city and it really is a breathtaking site. Although it's quite a walk up from the Danube.Steep in places but you can also get the funicular. Little 16 blue bus Or the hop on hop buses

"SUCH HISTORY". This is such a very old area once used by the wealthy to live in and to shop. The views are wonderful and look out all around the river and Budapest. Its much better to go on a coach as parking can be very difficult and by going on a coach tour you find out all the history and best places to visit and eat as there are quite a few lovely cafes in the main street area. These are worth a visit if not simply to try the local cuisine and especially the cakes

A great view and sights nearby. Beautiful stroll with a great view over the city. Take time for the sights nearby, especially the Matthias church where Kaiserin Sissi was coronated. For a coffee break nearby there are several cosy and historical bakeries!

The perfect place to view the city. A beautiful item of modern architecture, I say modern as it is not as old as the surrounding buildings, to view both sides of the City - Buda and Pest - and also to follow the Danube as it goes North out of the City. A series of walkways with towered viewing "rooms" spaced along the way. Not to be missed

Magnificient. This building is very interesting, and a rare sight. if you travel with one of those hop on hop off bus tours and see this Grand built as it shows up from the turn you will be amazed. It certainly blew my mind. After seeing it from beneath, where it looks like it's part of the hill, we went to visit it from above (the other side which is not shown on this picture), and it had a lovely cafe with a live band performing all kinds of music (they were asking guests where they are from and performed songs from their country), with a beautiful view over the Danube river.

Beautiful gothic architecture and amazing views over the city. Beautiful gothic architecture and amazing views over the city! The whole area is lovely to wander around. Make sure you take a camera as the architecture and views are breathtaking!
Lovely views. We had a lovely day , lovely buildings. Free to look around. Toilets have a small fee. Lovely views of parliament. Opposite saint Mathias church.
service. bad service Staaff, it´s take very long time to get service but ther was a very nice look over the city

A fairy tale lovers dream. As a huge fan of romantic fairy tale castles, this place ticked all the boxes. The high pointed turrets and white washed walls of Fisherman's Bastion are nothing short of enchanting. Statues of armoured figures and knights in draping mantles line the interior walls, and it's hard not to lose yourself in the beauty and rich history of this stunning structure. And of course the views are incredible.
Great view. Excellent view of the city and very beautiful architecture. If you're going to Budapest, you have to visit it.
Like a fairytale. Lovely place, very pretty, view is amazing. Can climb the turrets and get great views of Pest. It's free as well! Catch the no 16 bus up so you don't have to walk up the hills!

Gorgeous views. The views from the bastion are stunning and it's a lovely walk around. You can see across the whole city and it really is a breathtaking site. The walk up to it is quite steep but you can get the funicular.
Great view of the city. If you are traveling to Budapest, make sure you go to Fisherman's Bastion. The view of the city from here is amazing.

Worth to spend a few hours here. From the bastion, you will enjoy the panoramic views of the Danube River and the old buildings.On the bastion, there were some local artists selling art objects which some were very nice. Having a cup of tea and enjoy the view is recommended.
Great views over pest and buda. Went on a nice sunny day in March, great views, low crowds, hop on-off bus took me most of the way, otherwise a steep walk up.

Fishermen`s Bastion. This attraction in Budapest is located in the Buda castle district (a World Heritage site), on top of the hill, dates back to the 1890s. It is a white stones Gothic structure stretching along almost like a fence around Buda castle. From here you get the most gorgeous views of the Pest side and the Danube. It has seven towers representing the seven tribes arriving in the Carpathian Basin in 896 founding Hungary. It is right next to the Matthias church or Màtyàs templom" a medieval church all renovated and offering beautiful organ concerts. There are many attractions around and seasonal street fairs and markets such as Christmas and Easter are normally placed right in front.
Wonderful view over Budapest. Definately take a walk up here whilst in Budapest, it's up beside Buda Castle, so you can't miss it if you are up the hill...don't forget your camera!
Superb Viewpoint. The bastion provides a great viewpoiint across the Pest side of te city both day and night. Easily accessed after a short climb from the chain bridge.
Amazing views. We came up to the Bastion at dusk. With all the lights it felt like a fairytale. The views of parliament and Pest were amazing. Evening visit essential.
looks like a castle. what an amazing building the detail in the building so nice the views from the other side of Budapest to die for , well worth a visit

Turnstiles?. Beep used to be a fishermonster and has never owned a Bastion, so we were suitably impressed that a single Fisherman appears to own this very grand structure.We've never even come across a Bastion before, but we're recommend one be built in York, as it seems to be a very helpful building which keeps almost all the tourists in a city retained in one area - rather than having all the selfie stick wielding types wander freely, spoiling the rest of the city. Beep nearly had to perform a colonoscopy on one particular owner of the wretched contraptions when they waved it across his face once too often.The views across the city are wonderful and the building itself very picturesque in an almost sickeningly Disney way. It was free to walk up and along the battlements when we visited but a turnstile was being installed at one end so either fees or queues or both look likely in future.Try going early morning or later at night.

Great views. In the Middle Ages, the fish market was below this bastion, so the bastion was guarded by fisherman - hence, the name. Completely rebuilt for the 1896 celebration. 7 towers represent the 7 Magyar tribes. Views over the Danube toward the Parliament are great!

Stop for at least one hour if you are taking the hop in-hop off tour. I have been in Budapest a few time. The first time I went I didn't stop in this attraction I don't know why. The second time I went I stopped in this attraction and it was so good. Better than it look from the bus,there are so many things to see, restaurants and also you can walk to the big building you can see from the river. My boyfriend was amazed but the beaty of the construction. Also it has a very good view to the "Pest' side.

Beautiful. Surrounded by other must see sites (Buda Castle and Matthias Church) Fisherman's Bastion is another wonderful piece of architecture with incredible views of the river and Pest. If you're heading this way you can't miss it! It's a lovely spot to soak up the Budapest atmosphere and stop off for an amazing hot chocolate at the restaurant overlooking the river.
Lovely walk - great views. Has such an interesting history. Absolutely wonderful views. Look out at sunset, it's beautiful. Again great statues nearby and plenty of places to eat and drink.
Great views!. had great sweeping views for Budapest at this viewpoint. Great place. Bit of a hike but def worth it.

Very pretty. Lovely stone architecture. Definitely worth a visit, looks like something out of a Disney princess book! Nice cafe at the bottom too underneath the viewing area, overlooking the parliament building and river. Reasonably priced too.

Amazing views. Any visitor to Budapest should make a point of a trip up the Funicular railway and a walk around the Fishermans Bastion.
The changing of the guard is nice to see, but the views over the city has to be the main draw.
Nice area. We stopped here as part of a tour. I wish we would've had more time or a chance to get back to the area. It's pretty and there are fun little places to explore
beautiful. Next door to matthias church and overlooking the danube it is well worth walking up the hill to walk around the building and enjoy the views it offers of Pest and the Danube

One of must see places. I think Budapest is one of most beautiful cities in Europe. There are just so many things to see and enjoy and the bastion is one of them on the top of the mountain next to the castle. I went there late evening and the view with the parliament and the rest of city is breathtaking.
Favorite Part of Budapest. Stunning courtyard with beautiful views of Pest, as well as proximity to Matthias Church and Buda Castle. Definitely go!

Amazing views- must visit. Amazing views from the Bastion looking across to pest and the parliament building. Free to walk up the towers and walls which is nice. Very well maintained and clean with workmen repairing the old sections when we visited but this didn't distract from the visit. A must see attraction even if your visiting for only one day

Quirky.. Stayed in hotel with this tourist spot right opposite our window so could appreciate from different angle. Fantastic when lit up at night with Parliament building lit too in background. Went up into Bastion during cold day and had gluhwein which was very warming. Beware, smokers allowed sadly.....Been there, done that - worth a visit.

Stunning views. If you want free views of budapest then this the place to head for, from the fishermans bastion you can see across the danube to the pest side, fantastic place for taking photos, the castle is next door.

Wonderful views over the city. Great views over the city. You can see onto the Pest side, with a view of Parliament. I recommend going up during the morning during sunrise as it's a lot quieter and you basically have the place to yourself.
Very good place. Fisherman's Bastion is very good/nice place for walking and to make pictures with perfect views on Budapest. This is gate to old city and other place on Budavar.
Nice place, day and night! . Great walk up and around. Perfect for pictures of the city and parliament. Go to the restaurant within and bar up the tower.

Stunning views. This is a great spot for photos as the view is beautifully framed by the pale stone. The funicular tram was not working when we went but it really isn't that bad to walk up the hill and the Fisherman's Bastion is right next to some other great attractions.
Well worth a visit. Great views, lovely atmosphere, bought a lovely oil painting from one of the stalls. We walked from the castle and it is very doable.
Favorite place in Budapest. This is by far my favorite place in Budapest. It made me speechless because of its greatness. No time to explain, just go there! :D

Great viewing terrace . Amazing terrace with beautiful views.
King's palace and Mathias's church are right behing.
Amazing view on parliament and Danube river.

Oh my god - that view.... // This view is the best you can get in town - better than one from Gellert Hill. If you're looking for panoramic photoshoot this is a go to// It's right to St Matthias church - which in itself is a very important landmark and a beautiful building// You'll be 1 minute from Buda Castle - which nowadays features the most important gallery of fine art in Budapest// All that aside - just sit here for 5 minutes and enjoy

Budapest sightseeing . Situated on the Buda side and right next to the Matthias Church this is a great place to visit. Great photo opportunity across to the Parliament building . If in Budapest a must visit.
Picturesque View. Good vantage point for photo opportunities very pretty walk around wall between turrets. Next to a beatiful church and well worth a walk from the castle.

Great view . Amazing view and a great restaurant which is worth the trip. The bastion is not original but is very nice.
It is next to a great church and should be part of any trip to Budapest
Utterly wonderful views. The ambience of the area is wonderful, the views of the city, particularly the parliament building are breathtaking - highly recommend visiting
Lovely views. There are some very nice views of Budapest from here. It would be especially lovely on a sunny day, but it well worth a visit in any case.
beautiful view. From the Fisherman's Bastion the view is very beautiful.You can see the parlament,the Cathedral and the chain bridge.people walking around,the Matthias church is worth watching inside
great view!. You can have a nice view of the parliament and see the church (the roof is very beautiful). There are some cool places to take pictures.

Nice viewpoint among many on the buda side. This is a nice view, but St. Mattias chuch is better and worth the 5 euros for admission. Fishermen were indeed important in the region and the monument is necessary
fantastic. It is a must see but very touristy. And fatastic views from the Bastion. It's a pity they built a Hilton right next to it.

Photographs galore . This place is really pretty a lot where saying like a Disney castle and you can see why the church nearby is also beautiful and once you get up on the walls of the bastion the views are breathtaking the bar restaurant built into the walls is well worth a visit also and the mulled wine is gorgeous

Odd Castle. Quite an interesting construction with magnificent views over the Danube and Pest.
A couple of decent bars and restaurants.
Fantastic Views!. Once you've climbed the hill to get there this is a stunning area and the views are amazing. Worth the exercise!

Trip with my partner . Me and my boyfriend visited here during our time in Budapest and enjoyed the walks around the city. The views from the fisherman's bastion were amazing. Definitely recommend it to others
Amazing View. This is probably the best place to have an awesome view over the city. By day and by night. Definately a must do
The views over the Danube are exceptional. This is a lovely building which is undergoing major reconstruction. The views from the towers across the Danube are fantastic.
Lunch in Cafe. Good views over the Pest side of the river Danube. Good view of the Parliament buildings. Good service good food. Can imagine it would be very popular at high season
Must visit with your camera. Superb architecture, nice views, nice clean location, took some great photos here. Must visit if your in Budapest

Great views and quite a magical atmosphere. My hotel was near to here so it was an amazing find just down the road. The views are amazing. You can see the Hungarian Parliament Building and River Danube. It’s even more magical at night time but I’m glad a saw it in both daylight and at night.
Amazing views!. We walked along the bridge over to Buda to go to fishermans Bastion and the church! Amazing views, we could have spent hours just walking about and chilling! Highly recommend!
Nice building. If you go for the Castle, after the visit go to the Bastation. It is 10 minutes walk but you are going to enjoy it.
The best views over Budapest. Visit the Fisherman's Bastion on a sunny day to get the best views over the Danube and Pest side. This is a perfect place for taking photos, so don't forget your camera.

Really beautiful, a must see. I love this place! High up on the hill on the Buda side of the Danube, the Fisherman's Bastion offers some truly stunning views over the river and across to Parliament. The building itself looks very fairytale and is stunning to walk around. Look out for beautifully crafted pillars, dragons and winding stairs to explore by. Definitely worth going when the weather is good, partly because this is outdoors, but also to give you the best views over the river.

Wonderful, make a point of going!. I loved everything about this place. There's a lot of fantastic architecture around, and it makes a nice change seeing the view from the other side (from a pretty high vantage point).We found a place which was showing a 3D history of Hungary in a range of languages (made possible via multiple audio streams to headphones) and we both really enjoyed it - really informative, and set in an old chapel building.There's also plenty up there to eat and drink at a range of nice cafés and restaurants. Budget a few hours to enjoy it all!

Nice views. This is an interesting structure. There is a cafe at the top of one the turrets and was nice to sit and drink gluvine and take in the view. However loads of people come in don't buy a drink take photos and walk out. Worth a visit for the view.

Great view!. A popular tourist destination, but if you have a few days in Budapest, go there to enjoy the view at off hours. On a nice day, a great place to have a beer and kick back. Go late at night (after 10p) to get iconic photos of it lit at night without many tourists.

Otherworldly - well worth visiting. Incredible architecture - imaginative and unexpected. Spent an hour or so sitting on the walls, people watching in the sun. Musicians accompanied the view of Pest and for a while we were in another world.
Holiday sightseeing . Went with the big bus hop on hop off tour. Totally work it. I recommend it. Free to see. Worth spending the day there while you are in buda
Beautiful Sight. Very beautiful to walk around and take in the sights. Men with birds to take pictures with for 6 and 4 Ft. Lovely Views

Nice views over Budapest. Lots to do up near the Bastion. We didn't realise this until we got up there - it's like a whole new village up there with a castle, church, pub and other attractions (Hospital in the Rock, Old Pharmacy, etc). Well worth a visit, and an unusual structure. Busy in Summer on a hot day, but still calm and enjoyable. Lovely.
beautiful. beautiful place with a great view over Pest with a nice weather. better coming here early in the mornings to avoid dozens of tourists
Stunning views. We stayed in the Hilton behind/in front of this depending how you look at it. It is a good place at night to go and take photos of the night scene over the city.
Amazing view. One of the most beautiful places in Budapest. Easy access with bus. Good for morning or afternoon work.

Beautiful Views. Lovely area just to walk around. A few shops to browse in. Didn't have time to spend in any of the restaurants, but they looked inviting. Cafe on one of the Terraces in a Tower which looks over the Danube and Pest side is lovely to sit and recharge batteries. Well worth the walk....or the funicular. Lots of local buses too.

Beautiful. We visited here and it blew us away with how gorgeous it was! We visited during the day and came back at night for a meal in the beautiful restaurant that offered lovely food and service as well as amazing views!
Great view. The best view point of Budapest. Tip: have a coffee at the cafe which is inside the tower left of the bastion as you look at the Dunabbe, the best place to take photos.
perfect view. the view from there is amazing and worse the walk or the funicular 3 euro. and this part of town is more medieval as well
great sight. have a great sight of the city from this place, part of Buda side overlooking Pest side. a must place to visit for every tourist.

Best hang out. 30min hike up the hill from Batthyany Square metro station line 2 and overlooking Duna river and the Parliament building this place is the best day hang out in Budapest. Great photo spot with cozy coffee houses around plus the mild work out uphill hike makes this my favorite morning destination!!

Beautiful architecture and stunning vewpoint.. I visited Fisherman's Bastion by bus from the city centre and had a great ride up castle hill for 80p! The Bastion is next to Matthias Church so you can wander around both places (entry fee for church). From here you can see the 'Pest' side of the river especially the Parliament building. Must do sight.
Busy with stunning views. It is what it is! Great architecture and amazing vantage point over the city to take stunning photos.
Great views over the Danube towards Pest.. Lovely buildings. A must see. Fabulous views across the Danube towards Pest. A range of really good restaurants
Beautiful place, beautiful views. Beautiful views of Pest. The Parliament looks fantastic from here. You can set and have a drink, very friendly bar staff.

Great walking around. Make your own path around the Fisherman's Bastion. It has some really lovely things to see,without necessarily going inside any of them. We meandered rather aimlessly but had we been looking for things we might have been disappointed because although there are signposts and map boards everywhere you can't actually find anything. Little delights we found were: copper signatures in the pavement, old torch sconces on a wall of a hotel, an apothecary museum, beautiful old wooden doors, a window full of padlocks in one of the white walls near the Matyas church, and a copper sculpture of a coronation robe outside a church that looked like 4 different buildings had been built on top of each other. Very enjoyable.

In the Buda Hill. U can see the castle, Fisherman"s bastiona nd the St.Mattias Cathedral in one go as it is all located on the Buda hill..Budapest is divided by Danube into 2 parts as Buda and Pest..All these attractions are in the Buda side.

My favourite attraction in Budapest. Fishermans Bastion is absolutely stunning. You can climb up into one of the turrets and take photos over the River of Parliament and the bridges etc. As the sun sets this place is a simply stunning area to be in. Just beautiful. Photos don't do it justice.
Best view. One of the Best view of the city can be seen from here. Church is a piece of art itself, but beware of the praying times

Fshermans Bastion. Take the hop on - hop off bus around the city and you will drive through the Fishermans Bastion area, It's just like Hogwarts from Harry Potter..........Go at night after dusk. Magical !
Great views, easy walk up!. This was an easy walk from "pest" over the chain bridge, and up the hill to the bastion and magnificent cathedral. Great views of the city!

Great view . This is possible one of the best places to be able to get a glimpse of the whole city at once . We were luckily enough to be there on a clear day! .. Defiantly recommend to get some great pictures

Spectacular. The view from these bastions is simply amazing and will surely be remembered in my mind for a long period of time. From here one can practically see all of Budapest and thus one will then appreciate more the beauty of this city. Moreover, it is a must see for everyone who goes to Budapest.

Some magic in the middle of the city. When I saw it, I felt like some part of Hogwarts somehow got into Budapest. It looks so pretty, magical and romantic. Built from light stone it offers a wonderful view on the city in the daylight but also at night. In the winter time, not so many tourists there. And it is really easy to go there by bus or just walking.
Great view of the city!. Definitely the first place to visit in the city. It offers a great view of Pest and is located next to a truly gorgeous church.

Don't miss this esp at night! It's magical!!. I went there at night - it wasssssssss soon beautiful.
Don't miss this place. It's very amazing. There are bug flying around it - with the light - wow...I love it here.

Beautiful and touristy. Seeing the fisherman's bastion is essential for a trip to Budapest. It's busy and there's a lot of people there but you've got to do it. Great views and exceptional architecture.

Best part of Budapest!. I visited here in January and it was easily my favourite part of the trip. I'd recommend walking up if you can instead of using the funicular as the views are terrific. The snow made it breathtaking.

Step back in time. Grab a hot beverage and take an hour out of your busy day to climb the hill overlooking the most panoramic view of the Danube and the imposing Pecz riverside. Nestled in the shadow of the towering Matthias Church, this staunch imposing fortress yields the mind to past times and peoples, a meditation which helps throw the modern heart into perspective.
Amazing Architecture. These are the pictures you always see and go …ah yes! That’s Budapest. I think Walt Disney got some inspiration from Fisherman's Bastion.

Atmospheric. Fantastic views from up here of the Pest part of Budapest and the Danube. Pretty place to wander around - partly pedestrianised - some bars set in the turrets and battlements. You can get the funicular up, but if the queues long it only takes about 8 minutes to walk up.
Great place for photos . The building is the same style as Budapest's parliament, but it's worth to go to mainly because of the nice view to Buda, which gives great pictures

A must see in Budapest. The whole journey there is an experience across Chain Bridge on The Danube and up the Funicular . This is a fabulous experience. From Pest side across Chain Bridge and up Funicular railway and meandering through cobbled streets with beautiful views of whole of Budapest. Can't come to Budapest without seeing this!!!

Best spot in the city!. We were lucky in that Fishermans Bastion is right outside our hotel (Castle Hilton) as it turned out to be the most picturesque place in the city. The views are to die for and some of the best I've ever seen. Be sure to visit during the day and at night for a complete experience as the character of the place changes hugely. Also the earlier you come the better, we rolled out of bed at 9 and the place was practically deserted, but come mid afternoon and it's thronging with huge crowds of tourists. Definitely worth setting an alarm for!

A real ripoff. This used to be free, now they charge. It is a good view, but not worth the money. Just walk down to the Royal Castle and take your pictures there for free. Do it soon before the Prime Minister kicks out the National Galery and makes it his home.
AMAZING. Amazing view! If you go when its geting dark you'll see one of the bests views of your life but its a perfect place to vist at anytime. Enjoy!
Great trip for a dry day. . Walked around here on a slightly damp day. Really is worth a visit and ties in well with Buda Castle etc. Lots of quaint cafes etc nearby to refuel. Great day out

Very impressive Bastion. The place is very big and biutiful. You need to come early for good walk around. Thera is a nice roses park. Near this place is a very good restorant Aranyszarvas - good place to eat lunch!

You will take so many photos!. This place is so beautiful from so many angles! We went there during winter so it wasn't so overcrowded and we were able to take some good photos. The church next to it has beautiful roof. It was a nice leisure walk from the castle.

The view form here is great!. This was on on the "top 10 things to see" list for Budapest. Personally, I did not think it was that great but the view of pest is nice from this area and you might as well stop by here when you are in the area.

What a view!. We walked uphill (lots of steep steps!) to get to the Fisherman's Bastion and it was definitely worth it. Brilliant views of the city, interesting architecture and we had a mulled wine at the top. Easy to walk from here to everything else at the top of the hill - Buda castle etcetera.
Another stunning Building with views of the City. Take the Bus or funicular to the top of the hill in Buda to climb the Fishermans Bastian. It gives amazing views of the whole city of Buda pest.

Stunning views, stunning architecture. The title says it all. We visited here on a cold crisp clear day and it couldn't have been any better. The views of the Danube are great and there are many great vantage points to get the perfect picture. There is quite a lot to explore so make sure you go round it thoroughly.

Great Place to Walk around. My husband and I went there from the Parliament building. We finished brunch there, then took Tram 2 in front of parliament, get off at chain bridge, cross the river, by walking through the bridge.This time, we climbed the castle hill, instead of taking the hill train. The Buda castle will be in front of you, It hosts art exhibition rom time to time. You go on the direction of Matthias Church, the fisherman bastion is there in the same area. It is a great place to take pictures, and have a bird view of the whole budapest city. There is a piknik pavillion (restaurant) in the middle, which is a good cozy place to take some rest, with mulled wine, or other hot drinks.We walked a lot around, found some interesting shopps, galleries, lots to see, then decided to take bus 16, to go back, which takes you back to the foot of the hill.It is a good experience to spend a casual day.
Be amazed. This is a beautiful place to eat, sight see, and walk around. Great place to see the Danube and the layout of Budapest along it's banks.

View from fisherman's bastion . One of the must visit place when in Budapest. Panoramic view of entire city can be seen from here. We went on a day went temp. Was almost two degrees and raining. It was very foggy, am sure on a bright sunny day view will be much more beautiful.

Great views of the Danube and Parliament. This overlook has a beautiful statue and many walkways to look at the Pest side of the city. We visited many times and noticed that there was an area at the end with a heat lamp. Nice in February!
Beautiful. Loved it so much went back the second day to have another look round, amazing place and the views are fantastic.

Beautiful pano. you are on the top of the city centre, from here you can take beautiful photos, especially panos.If you're lucky and you find it empty you can take it from inside one of the little towers
Nice view. But not much else. It was free, during season (summer) i hear it isn't, and don't think the view really is worth paying fore, there are other places to see the same view.
The best of Buda.. It is a pleasant place to spend some hours of your afternoon and admire the views of the Parliament and Peste side, also it is nice to go there during the night.
a "must see" place. a "must see" place in budapest. wonderful few of the city, the river and the parliament. you can simply walk and enjoy the view

Beautifully restored area with fantastic views. The whole area around the Bastion has been beautifully restored, the buildings cleaned and pavements renewed. The views down to the Danube are breathtaking. We walked up all the steps from Buda however there is the Funicular or various lifts to assist. We returned to the Fisherman's Bastion several times as we enjoyed it so much. We were lucky to be there at midday to hear the bells. The only draw-back was that, on a sunny day in February, it was crowed so I can only assume it is even more popular during the summer.

Great renovation work. A fascinating around this area where a lot of money and skills have been and are being spent to upgrade this historic area of the city. Looks wonderful at night when floodlight.
Amazing . Like a fairytale, a Budapest must!! Absolutely stunning views and a stunning place! Favourite part of site seeing whilst in Buda!

Gorgeously romantic. Fisherman's Bastion is very beautiful and provides many view point on castle hill. From here, you can see the entire PEST side of Budapest and the whole Parliament/ Chain Bridge can be seen.
Understand from my guide that going up to the bastion will be chargeable from March onwards.

breathtaking view. This is one of the best tourist attractions in the city. Inside there is a church and you will also find some shops and cafes there. From the bastion you will be able to observe the other side of the city and also the Parliament. It is better to visit the place in good weather,because it is situated on the hill.

Good view from the hill !. The Fisherman's bastion is near the Buda Castle. I visited during night and you could see the illuminated Parliament building from up there and a view of Danube which was great for taking photographs :)
Grand views. The views of the Danube, the Houses of Parliament, and the whole panorama of Budapest from the Bastion are unequalled.
Beautiful View. Located in the Boda side of the river, not difficult walk and then you have such a beautiful view on the city with the Bastion and the small arches. Must see in Budapest!

The Highlight of the Trip!. The Bastion is beautiful and the views of the city from here are magical. We managed to book a table for dinner inside the Bastion a few days before and it was fantastic. The ambiance, views and service all superb! Highly recommend!

Budapest. Budapest is a very intriguing and beautiful city. the fishermans bastion gives one the opportunity to see the city from a hilltop and marvel at its beauty. getting there is not as difficult as it appears because of public transportation that work quite well and convienient. we had luch there and there was a string quartet playing, really quite good. the musicians in the the cities of eastern europe are very good, and it seems everywhere you go music fills the air.

Fairytale castle. Definitely a place to see in Budapest. Beautiful view over the whole town and magically looking castle especially in the night. There is also some cafe in the tower, but we went there late and it was closed. Pretty close behind is Matthias Church also.

The best part of Budapest.. We used the funicular to get up castle hill (great views!), walked all around Fisherman's bastion, with it's beautiful towers and church and the views are truly amazing. You could spend hours wandering around (which we did!) Some parts were closed when we went, but assume these open in peak season? There are some bars inside of the towers, with great views over the Pest side - worth stopping off for a drink and to watch the world go by! By far my favourite part of Budapest. - such a wonderful place, full or charm and history.
Place to go!. Famous point on Buda side in the castle area with a super panorama for whole city and the river Danube!
Beautiful structure, great view - FREE. This is a beautiful structure with breath-taking views of the city and makes for a perfect place to get photos clicks or tryout your photography skills.
Wow, what a view!. Amazing views and free! It is unique and random. Views over the Danube are amazing g day or night! Well worth a visit!

Very pretty. This is stunning location, very pretty spot for photos.Could get a lovely photo from across the river just near the parliament house.Recommend combining with a visit to a pastry shop just up the road (Ruszwurm Cukrászda) - it's the green building and I can't remember the name but the pastry with cream inside was recommended to us by a local in the store and it was lovely (though very rich- good to share for 2)

Located next to the Matyas Church and the Budapest Hilton.. The Bastion is part of the whole experience of seeing the Matyas Church. The view from the ramparts of the Fisherman's Bastion is worth it on a clear day. The Church next door is the star though. It is fantastic if you are a history and architecture freak, don't miss this one. They used to have the Crown of King Steven but it was moved to the House of Parliament - another must see.

worth a day and a night walk too. In medieval times, the fish market was nearby and The Fishermen's Bastion was built about 100 years ago to commemorate the fishermen who protected this part of the city. Today its a popular tourist destination due to the beutiful view and the surrounding old buildings, church, and small colourful streets with coffees, restaurants. There is a fee to enter to the top level , but you can enter the lower level lookout for free and the view is similar, or come back by night when the top level is also free, and the panorama is magnificent.

A beautiful site!. This was one of my favourite parts of Budapest! Going in the day is lovely when the sun is out and you can see all the beautiful architecture, but it was quite crowded. My recommendation would be to go out night, and have a bit of a picnic in one of the little nooks, an amazing view with less pushy tourists.
A beautiful view. One of the best views of Budapest is from Fisherman's Bastion and even better at night when the city is lit up.

Fabulous views, doesn't cost a penny! Go there at night if you can.... We didn't bother with the bus tours, we actually walked around most of the top attractions, granted we did 15 miles in one day :-) but it was worth it! Take a cable car or walk up to the top (there are lifts also)! We walked and took in all of the sights! It was wonderful. Don't forget to take your camera for the amazing views!I GOT ENGAGED HERE so it was a pretty special place for me! But even without the engagement, it has a fairy tale feeling and spectacular views of Budapest.

Well worth a visit. We included our visit to the Fisherman's Bastion in our walking tour of Budapest. Located on Castle Hill, the Bastion is an impressive sight and despite its popularity, it wasn't too busy in December. Take time to enjoy the beautiful views of the Danube and city below and also look in at the beautiful Matthias Church.

A must do when in Budapest. This was definitely my favourite thing about my trip to Budapest. The fishermans bastion is like something you would see in a fairy tale! We got the funicular up to it and then its a short walk to the fishermans bastion from there. I would definitely recommend this to everyone!
Love this area!. See Matthias Church at the same time. Probably our favorite area to visit during the day. Spend about an hour max.

Wow...amazing. Allow at least 1 to 2 hours to really take in the atmosphere and views.The area is so much more than just the steps.The story behind the scenes,the architecture and the views are worth the extra time.Must do in Budapest.

A real must. This place is amazing, I got the feeling I was in a lord of the rings movie or something, It kinda reminds me of Gondor the white city. The architecture here is stunning, it`s almost to much to take in. I love this place and it`s one of those "have to see" sights. It`s easy to get here both with taxi, bus or walking. It`s a short (30min) walk from e.g Vaci street. When you visit you can also check out the castle at the nearby church.

Very pretty. This is a very pretty place to see Budapest from. A lot of the sightseeing tours come up here, but having said that it didn't feel too busy. You could still get a good view of Budapest, without having to push and get in the way of other people.

Spectacular views and superb photo ops!. Just outside of Matthais Church, Fisherman's Bastion offers some spectacular views of the Danube River, the Chain Bridge and Budapest. Makes for some great photos with picturesque backdrops.
A beautiful spot. We spent a few hours walking around and enjoying the views here - such a beautiful place with some great buskers and lots of nice local shops around the area too.
