Beautiful!. Very beautiful building that reminded me of a magical Hogwarts castle! Everything is so unique and pretty. Well worth climbing up there!There is a bar in one of the towers where you can enjoy stunning views over the city and Danube. Also there is a cafe in the main section which I don't recommend due to poor service.

Views over the city. The Fisherman's Bastion is a viewing terrace on high ground overlooking the city in honour of the fishermen of the Danube who defended the city in the Middle Ages.It is highly decorated with many statues of Hungarian heroes and kings throughout the ages. It sits alongside the impressive Matthias church in Trinity Square, and as you might imagine, is always busy with many groups of sightseers throughout the day.However the many viewing windows offer many opportunities for photography.
Budapest 2015. Very nice and beautiful place with a lot of historical buildings. Amazing view to the Danube river and Budapest.
Beautiful place & Amazing views. We went there at sunset and it was absolutely amazing. The place in itself is beautiful and the views on the Danube and Parliament are gorgeous.

Stunning views and truly magical!. We stayed in the Hilton next to here and a view of the Fishermans Bastion and the Danube from our room. I've never seen anything like this and love the sense of drama and magical quality it creates. Next to the beautiful Matyas Church too.

A nice walk with great views of Budapest. Excellent views of the city and parliament. Very close to Buda Castle and Matthias Church. Personally I started at the far end by Buda Castle walked down past the church and finally admired the views from the Bastion. A very nice afternoon out.

Fisherman's Bastion. Beautiful place, clean and stunning views of Pest.
It's about a 5 minute walk from the palace, which has now turned into a museum.
You can walk up to it, but there are the hop on hop off buses which will take you to the palace and from there you walk.

Must be done . If you head across and upto Buda Castle then a visit to the Fisherman's Bastion is easily combined. The views are great and having been recently restored the Bastion is pristine. The Labyrinth and the Hospital in the Rock are both nearby and combine easily.

Stunning views. The best views of Budapest! Go when the weather is sunny if possible, we waited until the last day for the weather to clear so we could enjoy the views. It's a pretty steep walk up hills/stairs to get there, so if you're unfit or struggle then Segways looked like a fun way to get up there or even get a cab.
Where are the fishermen?. A typical tourist venue but with stunning views across the Pest, especially the parliament building. No visit to this city is complete without a visit over to Buda.
Excellent views of the city. This was the end of our guided walking tour. Nice small stone clad streets around to explore.Great views of the city.
Beautiful place with great views.. Such a lovely building with with stunning views of the city... Free to look around and if you have a hop on hop off bus pass it's easily accessible x

This was a part of our walking tour and one of its highlights. One of the most important historical sites. From here there is an spectacular view of the city which is well worth the climb. If tiered there is a bus that runs regularly back to the centre.

Fantastic location to view the city.. At the top of the hill to the right is this splendid spot to view the city from. It's a must visit as the best church in the city is nestled behind it. There is a small tea room at the top which is a great spot for photos.

Excellent views & interesting history. Great to wander around! Great vies across the river.
Lots of good coffee shops with good cakes plus some nice (although a bit more pricey) restaurants.
Stunning views . This is a little walk up from the river but worth it for the stunning views over the city and the church. There is a lot to see and the walk along the battlements gives good views

Romantic architecture with great views of Budapest. Great photo opportunity and free! Lovely terraced walkways with unsurpassed views across to Pest and the Parliament buildings. Even in winter it's worth a visit and in one of the turrets there was a cafe selling large cups of gluhwein with heaters and fleece blankets to wrap up in. Lovely!

Has to be done. You cant visit the city without getting up high and taking in the views. Simply stunning with lots of perfect picture opportunities. Incredible views over the beautiful city and a lovely way to pass time.

Like a dream ....... This is one of the most beautiful places I have ever been to. The architecture is stunning ...and such a breathtaking area to walk around. Lovely cafes too, and like the rest of Budapest not once piece of rubbish to be seen! Not easy to park, but worth it.

Beautiful views . Spent part of a day here in Fishermans Bastion & St Matthias church. The Bastions itself looks like Hogwarts or something from a Disney film. It is simply a beautiful piece of architecture. The views are completely unrivalled. Beautiful panoramic view of Buda, the Danube & Pest. There is a small bar/cafe in one of the towers which is well priced and again has lovely view points. A must see!

Beautiful!. Excellent location for panoramic views of the city. Beautiful terrace which has fairytale qualities. Reminded me of Disney's Magic castle. Architecture is beautiful. We visited this from the Big bus hop on hop off tour at the Castle Atop. It was a very wet morning but this did not impact on our enjoyment of the stunning views across the Danube.
Amazing views. You can take amazing pictures from this site. A definite visit when you are on the Buda side! It's a definite tourist spot but the views of Pest is amazing from this angle.

Amazing views and unique architecture. . A must do! The bastion is located on the Buda side right behind St Matthias church and extends directly across from the Parliament building. Great views and good spot for picture taking. Located nearby is a Lovely little bakery/cafe since 1827 called Ruszwurm which I understand was a favorite of Queen Sisi. It's across from the church on the right side.

Incredible views. One of the first things that struck us about this area of Budapest was how clean and immaculately preserved the entire area was. The views of the city from here are incredible. In the day it was quite busy with tourists, I would recommend going at night to get some stunning views of the city with all the famous landmarks beautifully lit.

Grate view and history. What can i say about that place .The place is beautifull we walked up there the view is just breathtaking we didnt go in the church we had to pay, but we had seen enough churches lol.There is a caffeteria there also and a restaurant ,we also took photos with an eagle it was great experience!

A splended view of River Danube and the Pest. I walked up to the Castle Hill where the Fishermen's Bastion is located. This white structure serve as a backdrop against the Matthias Church. It's free of charge and offers a spendid view of the River Danube and the Pest area.

Amazing Bulding, Great View!. A must see if you are visiting Budapest. Climb the stairs to the top to enjoy a great view. Also a lot of tour start from the top of this building, so it´s a good place to start your day if you are visiting Buda part.
A nice area with a nice view. Not much to say on this, it has a lovely view and if you walk up the hill - as we did - then it's a good rest point to catch your breath.
Beautiful!. Amazing views of the city. We visited here but stopping off from the Hop on Hop Off tour. Perfect for photos over the city but it was very chilly as we were so high up!

Great Views Guaranteed !. A bit strange as one section was ticket only whilst the best view was from the Tower & bar on the left ? Mind you a new mortgage was required for the drink prices but the spectacular view was Gratis ! Another quaint part of Buda Castle & surrounds and well worth a look see !

Absolutely marvellous.. This whole area is incredible, a mixture of neo-gothic/neo- romanesque built to celebrate Hungary's one thousandth birthday. There are 7 towers to represent the 7 Hungarian chieftains who led to this unity. Even though it was raining really hard, the views from here were impressive and we had the joy of hearing a violinist playing away very nicely, so both the eyes and the ears had their fill.

Very pretty!. A beautiful place with a beautiful view! Unfortunately the weather wasn't good but I can still recommend it to anyone who loves old buildings and castles etc. The view is just WOW as you can see whole Budapest. Very good place to take pictures of the parliament!

Must Visit. Interesting and absorbing wonderful church fantastic architecture definitely worth a visit . Great views of the city as well. Used the hop on hop off service on the Big Bus Company which stops very close by.
Wonderful. You cannot miss this place whilst in Budapest. It's magical to explore. I had a guided tour and it was worth it to understand fully the history.

Beautiful . Even though it was pouring down with rain when we visited the Fishermans Bastion, it didn't take away anything from the experience. It offers amazing views of Budapest and the architecture itself is wonderful to look at and walk through, there were 2 men playing violin in the arches which made it even better! Must see when visiting Budapest.

Amazing views in a fairy tale style buildings. Beautiful place with stunning views! We had a bit of fog but the city was still visible from up there. Lovely building it feels like being in a fairy tale or like a fantasy set up.. Do not miss!

fairytaile. Do not miss this place if you are going to visit Budapest! You will feel like the princess of the fairytales! The view of Pest and Danube is also stunning from here. There is a coffee bar you can ejoy the view opened everyday till 17:00 in winter time.
Majestic views. . This was my favourite place to see. Simply breathtaking views, worthwhile going in the evening to see the majestic sites. Also very interesting to see Buda!
Stunning. Great views from this site. Opposite the Cathedral which was beautiful. Can be windy up here so wrap up.

Typical touristic course for the panoramic view. There are several view points over Budapest and the Fisherman's Bastion is one of them. Crowded with tourists to take shots as always, I just stayed for a while with not tham much impression about this beautiful city.

Amaizing place. Absolutely beautiful, the views over the river and city are incredible. The place is very well kept I thought, looks recently restored. Go at dusk and watch the sunset with all the city lights coming on – it’s breath-taking.

Beautiful structure, exceptional views. First, a warning. We encountered an out-of-commission turnstile at the entrance which leads me to believe there has been or will be an attempt to charge for visiting. However, the views over Pest could not be any more spectacular -- Parliament, Chain Bridge, St. Stephens, as well as looking south to the Liberty Statue or Freedom Statue on the Gellért Hill. Of course, one does wish for a crystal clear day -- but even on an overcast afternoon the views were breathtaking.

Breathtaking . This place had the most breathtaking views ever, it's so beautiful and a great backdrop for many pictures. It is a tourist hotpot and it's definately worth a visit. I think 30 mins to 1hr is enough to look around this place depending on how interested you are. We didn't go to the any of the cafes as we were warned they would be pricey, so walked 10 mins further into the Buda side and found a pub that was full of locals.
Beautiful Place. We spend a couple of evenings in this place , you can just sit by and enjoy the view of the entire city.

Beautiful what ever time of year. Lovely views
Great building lovely to walk around
Just beware toilets in area are expensive
Fantastic view over Danube
Don't forget to travel the funicular
Beautiful place. We came across this on a free walking tour. When the lights come on for the evening it is stunning and you have a great view of the Pest side of the city.
One of the best view in Budapest. This place is amazing, stunning and have one of the best view of the city, doesn't matter if you are going by the day or night. I truly recomment

a fairytale magic. 20 years ago, in January, I arrived first time to Budapest. With temprature much below zero (-15) it's hard to enjoy any outdoor activity, but the castle area was one of the most beautiful things I have ever seen in my life. After climbing many stairs (can also use the funicular) the view seen from up is breathtaking and so are Matthias church and the picturesque narrow streets with their small houses and statues. Finally we ended up at the small famous cafe Ruszwurmwhere where cakes are so good that Empress Elizabeth of Austria (Sisi) wife of famous Francz Jozeph, used to get her favorites cakes from. Beauty, colors, breathtaking view, good coffee and cakes - a perfect place for a few hours break from the daily routine. One of my most beloved places in Budapest even after 20 years of living in the city. a must see!!

Wonderful views of Pest. In the castle hill area, next to Matyas Church. great views of parliament building, chain bridge etc... well worth a visit at night the views of old buildings lite up is an amazing site
Stunning. A fantastic area to look around. Unfortunately it was a rainy day so the views out where not their best. Matthias church is lovely to walk around too.

Pretty "castle" on the hill. We walked up to the fisherman's bastion, not too difficult to walk up even for a person like me that's not super fit. The weather was not helping but I can assume it will be so pretty with better weather and look like a fairytale castle. There are many things to look around and nice looking restaurants and bars, even a mini bar up on top of the castle, unfortunately we only had limited time for this attraction so did not try any of them.
Great views. Stunning building with great views over Budapest. The labyrinth (Dracula's prison) nearby was also a fun, creepy visit
Good way to view the city. The Bastion is very impressive and was free to walk along in January. You can take great photos of the city from here.
Incredibile view!. From here you can enjoy a fantastic view over the Danube river, the bridges and the other part of Budapest,called Pest! Beautiful place :)

Walking through a fairy tale. I love Budapest and this must-see stop is one of many reasons. It's a place steeped in history and imagination, the backdrop a fairy tape, and the views of the city are spectacular.
Rainy day - still great views. The sun had disappeared by the time we reached Fisherman's Bastion and a light drizzle had started. The views were still good even with the drizzle and cloud cover.

Such a unique place. there is so much to see in this area. The church is a most especially if you like lots of decoration. Small charge for the church. The area itself is a little like a fairy tale castle. Fabulous views.

Beautiful views. This is a great spot to get fantastic photographs of the Pest side of the river and, as it is covered, perfect regardless of the weather. We came via the square (we cam up the hill via the no 16 bus) so we didn't have to climb up the steps, which I can imagine are a pretty steep climb, but the views definitely make this a must see on any trip to Budapest.
Beautiful . Great views of Pest across the river! Beautiful buildings and great food options around the corner!This is one of the awesome sights of the Buda side on Castle Hill!

Beautiful view, but modernized. Great way to look at the city of Pest from a high altitude, but nothing too spectacular. Everything around it is modernized, there is a restaurant and bar on site as well. There is also a hilton right behind it.

Best view in Budapest. I went during the heat wave of last summer and it was a bit of a hike to get here, even from our hotel which was up on the hill but absolutely worth it to see stunning architecture and a breathtaking view of the whole city!
Cool views.. Have to go there in day and again at night. Be prepared for the nice views and dont miss the Mathias church & Buda castle nearby.
Beautiful structure. Though it was nasty weather all weekend, but this was worth getting out and walking . The building is just beautiful and there are some fantastic views/photo ops
Fantastic buildings and views. Particularly good at night, quiet and with fantastic views of the city, the river and the parliament building.

Excellent views. Excellent viewing of the whole city of Pest from here. Perfetc for both rain and shine as parts of it are covered. Also sits next to a beautiful church so the views are great from all sides. It is up a steep hill with lots of steps though, so be prepared to walk or get a bus up there! Would recommend going at night too - very beautiful.

Beautiful. It's definitely worth the uphill wander. Beautiful views of the city and especially amazing at night!We went in the evening so it wasn't so busy but it does get touristy in the day. 100% worth it though

You feel like you're in a magnificent fairytale yourself... I had seen some photos of the castle before, but what I saw with my own eyes just knocked me out.. Although it's winter and green leaves were nowhere to be seen, the fact didn't decrease the gorgeousness of the scene. You could see so far to the city from up of the hill surrounded by absolutely startling historical setting! Not to mention the vibrant embroidery of nearby Matthias Church.. Total eye candy!!

Well worth a visit . Loved the cleanliness of this whole area , we took the funicular up to the fisherman bastion and that I can recommend even know it's a very short ride .The ramparts were open and free to walk in and the view is spectacular.While there we caught the changing of the guard that appears to take place every hour outside the presidents residents.There's a few wooden huts selling gifts and hot drinks by the museum that was a welcome visit .There's lots to see and do up in around the area so well worth a visit
Beautiful. A spectacular piece of architecture with stunning views across the Danube to the Pest side of the city. Worth a visit!
Dreamy bastion. Beautifful view of the Pecs part of the city and the Parliament building. Bastion is an absolute must to visit whenin Budapest!
A good walk in the castle district. It's really close to the Buda castle and also has some beautiful views. I don't know much about the architecture or history but it's worth visiting!

Fishermans Bastion. If you enjoy the views, traffic free walks and beautiful surroundings this is for you. Take the steps not the funicular rail car as this will make you feel so much better after those lovely restaurants you have been indulging in.

Impressive Site. This is a beautiful and historic site. We went there as part of a group tour and then while we were walking through the city we visited it again. There is shopping, cafes and restaurants close to the site.

Amazing Views of the City!. This is such a beautiful sight, allowing you to view across Budapest. There is bar on the top which is very relaxing and gave us a chance to take lots of pictures! Recommend for all sightseers!

Breathtaking Views. Fisherman's Bastion is an absolute must in Budapest! Visit Mathias church (amazing in and of itself), then head out to walk the bastion for a good photo-op. It's a great way to spend an afternoon!

Awesome views of Budapest!!!. Fisherman's Bastion is one of the 'Must-Visit' places in Budapest, a very interesting square and complex of Disney-like structures that look right out of a postcard! Last Sept 2015, my wife and I enjoyed a few hours strolling the area and even savored the fantastic goulash for lunch just down the street! I climbed up the short series of steps to the Bastion's top tower area to be awe-struck by one of the most beautiful views of the Danube, Parliament and the City. Back at ground level, we visited the picturesque Matyas Church and the Marzipan store and museum, where we bought a lot of these Hungarian delights as gifts for our friends. This is one of our most memorable stops in Budapest!

Beautiful view and place to walk around!. we came here in a very sunny day which made it super nice and beautiful! the view is incredible! I highly recommend this place and is super romantic to walk arounf

Fisherman's Bastion Budapest Hungary ...A historical & magical plac.. one of the best historical place in East Europe. he bastion is located right behind the Matthias Church in the Castle District. It is one of the city's biggest tourist draws and functions as some sort of ornate viewing platform.The Fisherman's Bastion was built at the site of an old rampart that, during the Middle Ages, was defended by the guild of fishermen, who lived nearby in Vízívaros (watertown), at the foot of the hill. Thus the name of the bastion. An old fish market also sat at this location during medieval times.

Visit when it's dark. Truly beautiful and definitely worth a visit, not only to see the Bastion itself but also for the incredible views you get up and down the river and onto Pest! Very romantic but also just a great place to hang out with friends (weather permitting). Best visited in the evenings when the buildings on the riverbank are floodlit.
Very cold, great city views. Not much else to do except to take pictures, but worth it just for this, spend the day in the castle district, this is just part of that experience

Nice place to visit but don't go when it's foggy. Visited as part of tour group in December. Bit of a waste of time as it was soooooo foggy you couldn't see a thing beyond what was directly in front of you. You pay an admission fee to climb the steps of the Fisherman's Basin but was a waste of money. The buildings are castle like and very impressive. Worth a visit if no fog.

Super. It wad a long walk and up so many stairs especially since my friend and I had our luggage with us. But it definitely was worth the walk once we reached to the top. It was and most like you were transported to a new place in a fairy tale. I loved it.
Always lovely. This is always a good spot to take in the views and visit while in the city. It is so worth it to spend some time, get a little gelato, and perfect for pictures.

Fantastic views !. Didn't know what to expect when we approached Fisherman's Bastion. This place is its own village type community with hotels, restaurants and buildings of interest. Most of all, it offers some of the best views you'll ever see. If in Budapest, visit this place - it's well worth it.
Beautiful view and architecture . One of the most important touristic attractions of the city. Beautiful architecture and a very beautiful view of the city!
Walk ely surprise. We had lunch in a cafe and then took in some amazing views across the river. It was a very clean area and the bastion was exceptionally well kept

Great views over the city!. Fabulous vies, pity it was raining while we were there but a little water didn't ruin it for us and with mulled wine in one hand we still managed to get some pictures taken!
Fisherman's Bastion. A really interesting structure with incredible views of the city and close to a lot of other attractions.

Great veiw. I visited budapest in december the veiw from the Bastion at sunset was one of the highlights of my trip, despite the rain! Also recommend a small little cafe/bar at the top, great place to warm up and have a few drinks.
Great site. A stuning view of the Parliament building and bridges across Danube river. Beautiful architecture and magnificent towers. Must visit when in Budapest.
What a wonderful atmosphere!. Step back in time and admire this wonderful place. The views are splendid both during the day and at night. Climb up to the top of one of the bastions and enjoy!

What a View!. If you want to get the perfect picture of the parliment building, look no further. Along with a fantastic setting, this is an absolute must for anyone visiting Budapest. My warning is, if you are going to walk then be prepared for a lot of walkig up hills. This was fine for me, but local buses do regularly go to this site.
Interesting buildings. Love the architectural design of these buildings. If you go up to the top of them you will get a great view of Budapest! A must see in Castle Hill!

I felt like I was at Disney World, but really there!. What a gorgeous complex. Many spires and fabulous views of Budapest! I enjoyed a drink with my husband in one of the many cafes and had a great time watching people from all over the world!
Best view in all of Budapest. This is my most favourite attraction. The views are spectacular and the structure itself is very cool - like a sandcastle or something.

What a view, what a place....... The most of us enter the Castlehill, but near by, at the same height you have an incredible couple of buildings. All of them whiter than milk, and with an atmosphere you must visit to feel. The panoramic view over the city.But, the Bastion, white again as told, can compare with all the other places anywhere. Because of the buildings themselves, the music always playing around, the Chapel. Yes, you can't believe without experienced.

Great views . Not only are the grounds impressive the view of the river and the Parliment building is amazing. Didn't tour the church (additional cost) but seeing the grandure from outside was enough. There are also street vendors and a restraunt with seating for the view of the city.

An amazing view! Looks like a sand castle!. This is a must see area! The view from the fisherman's bastion is quite amazing and it looks like a sand castle. There's a lot to walk to from here. I would actually recommend going early in the morning before it gets too crazy. Also a beautiful view at night! We went to the restaurant for dinner and it was a once in a lifetime experience!
great view. great view of the danube and the bridges!!!u can also have an espresso or a wine on the "balcony" relax and enjoy the view!!!

Lot of walking...eyes wide open. I dont want to tell it is close to everything BUT walking up there worth a shot. Budapesh showed us European history and that is what we are searching for. Beautiful neighborhood, millions of steps up to the place, but it is not only the beautiful view that you get at the end!

Great views. We went up the hill on a clear sunny february lunchtime. The views were incredible and the area very relaxing. We had lunch in the small restaurant overlooking the river and Pest it was wonderful and very romantic.
See the entire area. This entire area is great. We did the short tour, which is plenty. It takes about 3-4 hours depending on how in depth you wish to get at each site.
Special. If you are in Budapest you should definitely go visit the Fisherman's Bastion. The panoramic view on Budapest is breathtaking.

Really interesting and great views of Parliament. Lovely to spend an afternoon wandering around with great views across the river of parliament. We had a coffee overlooking the river which was lovely and is really close to the hospital in the rock which I highly recommend. Little unnecessary having a man in costume with a wild bird to take pictures with tourists but all in all, a really interesting visit.
Spectacular view, hand in hand with history. It is next to the castle, and offers you one of the best panoramas in the city.Full with tourists almost every time of the year.

Stunning architecture!. We stumbled across this area after walking up Castle Hill and it was a nice surprise.The architecture was stunning and looked like it could have quite easily been out of a fairy tale.The views are beautiful and there is a great little bar to enjoy them from that serves pretty pricey drinks, which are worth it considering the surroundings.

So much history. It was charming you fell like going back in time the area is so fantastic and we were not so lucky on the day we visit with an organized tour it was really foggy and we had so little time but still we were very impressed.
Very peaceful. Amazing views over the city and an incredibly peaceful atmosphere, particularly with the buskers playing.

amazing views. All the place is beautiful and with a amazing view... You don't have to catch the transport to arrive well there.is a little high point but I did it walking and take more or less 10/15 minutes and you enjoy much more.
Best view in Budapest, it's a shame you have to pay for it!. Best view in Budapest, it's a shame you have to pay for it! Cit administrators should change this, is really a joke!
Impressive . Very nice spot on Buda side with view across the river over the city and parliament. Interesting architecture and buildings

Wonderful view over Pest and the parliament. We went there in the evening when it was already dark. The view over the pest side of the river is amazing. We took the funicular to get to the castle and walk from there (which we realised going down the stairs back was quite a good idea) The place feels quite magic and is definitely a must see if you're visiting budapest.
put it on your "TO DO"-list. great views on the well restaurated walls and towers. Beautiful restaurants and bars on strategic point which limits the possibilities for random toerists and passers-by

Amazing views of the Danube, Buda and Pest!!. Fisherman's Bastion was one of the top things I wanted to see in Budapest and I was not disappointed. Looking at it from the Pest side of the river, it looks like a medieval castle. When you cross the river to the Buda side, Fisherman's Bastion is even more beautiful close up! We wandered around and found a little cafe at the top of the 'tower,' there were some amazing views of the Chain Bridge and the Parliament Building. Definitely cross the river and visit!!

Tourist trap . Once this page was quite a nice place with great view, pretty buildings, lots of place for lots of tourists... Then one part was closed behind a bloody expensive paywall, the other part was sold to be a restaurant and the rest down there is for the tourists who succeed to squeeze themselves close enough to see anything. Everything is expensive here and lots of fake, useless or crappy stuff are sold at ridiculous price. If you keep your expectations low enough it may be an okay place, just watch your purse.

Ideal for History lovers. This place is fantastic. Honestly only according to pictures i was not interested, and decided to walk to other locations in Budapest... But once you're there you understand the greatness. You just can't miss if you love history, and i'd advise to have a guide to really know everything that happened there. It's rich in details, just amazing.

Beautiful place. The bastion is really beautiful, it also gives you a great view over the city. Easy accessible. Around it you can find many shops for souvenirs, restaurants, coffee places and other attractions.

Stunning view suspect violin playing. Although the February weather was dull the view over Pest was amazing the Castle area is well worth a visit. ( a guy playing Those were the days on violin over and over was not so good)

Great views. This a good starting point in the exploration of the castle. Just looking down on the Danube and the spires of Pest on the other side of the river. I marveled at the number or River Cruise boats moored on the opposite bank.The Hop-on/Hop off bus is the way to go.
Very interesting... We visited this attraction as part of the city tour, very interesting with great views over the city
amazing place. really loved this place with excellent views over to the parliament building, worth the walk to the top
excellent view of the city. It is worth taking the effort and walking up there, the view is breathtaking....not only the view of Pest but all the different kind of towers and churches you see .
Beautiful view over Budapest . I loved going there. It's very high up and you will have the most amazing view over Budapest. And it's for free. You can relax up there and enjoy the great sight.
Interesting structure. Historic building, interesting structure, good views. Was a little crowded when we went but no charge so good to wander round and get some pictures.
Beautiful panoramic view of Budapest.. This place is definitely worth checking out. You get to see a beautiful panoramic view of the city. A great place both during the day and at night.

Worth it!. We (stupidly) left this till the last day and didn't have that much time for it but it was the highlight of the trip. The bastion itself is beautiful and so picturesque. To get up there, you just have to walk up some steps and a sloped road. It gives you the most magical views of Budapest and was particularly beautiful when the sun was setting. This is a free attraction but I'm sure many people would agree with me when I say that I would have happily paid. Great place to take pictures because you are high up and an even better place to really take in the city and appreciate it.

One of the 'must to see" in Budapest!. The views over Budapest from this area were unbelievable. The area looked like a towers from fairy tales or "Hobbits".Very easy destination to get by public transport.

Rivendell / Minas Tirith . It looks amazing from a distance but is so worth heading up there in person. The views are great and the actual structures are indeed like something you'd expect to see elves guarding.Just watch out for the endless selfie sticks, they're a bit over the top.
Not to be missed. This is lovely. There is a great view of the Danube and parliament. It can get crowded, so I prefer early morning, but it is also great for photos at dusk and after dark.

Amazing views. This place is so beautiful. It feels like youre going back in time walking up and down the stairs and through corridors. not to mention the amazing view of parliament from across the river
Beautiful. Loved it here. It's a must see when you are in Budapest. I've nothing else to add which hasn't been said already by previous visitors!
Superb views of Pest..... Another cant miss in Budapest. Wonderful views from a really quirky setting. There was a violinist there just adding to the charm.
Beauty. Very lovely walk from the river, nice views, romantic at the fog, great panorama at sunny day , good families, sightseeing

Beautiful scenery . The Fishermans Bastion is the fortification from where fisherman of the time would defend Ou Buda. There were three original parts of Budapest: Buda, Ou Buda (old Buda) and Pest (pronounced Pesht). One you get to the bottom of the hill after crossing the Danube, if you come from Pest, the walk is not to far and although up Hill, not too strenuous. One you get to the base of the stairs up to the top of the bastion you will notice how clean the stone work is. That's probably because the fortification has been rebuilt. You will never the less be forgiven for thinking that you are in a fairy tale. The architecture had all the makings of a fairytale. The top is basically a large viewing terrace. Don't be too eager to rush off to the Castle and St Matthew church, because at the top of the bastion is a coffee shop that serves traditional Hungarian cake and is well worth it. On a clear day whilst making the short walk to the castle you will be treated with the best view of Pest which really is stunning, including the magnificent houses of Parliament. Whilst enjoying your view take note that no building in Budapest (measured from ground level) is higher than the parliament buildings. That is by design to emphasise the supremecy of the time of law. The fisherman's bastion is a worthwhile sight. Don't get caught out by the higher prices at the top of Buda. Youre better off buying your sourvineous at the market in pest.

Unbelievable Views. The views over Budapest from this area are unbelievable. The parliament building, St Stephens Cathedral and the chain bridge just a few of the sites on display from this area. The walk to the top of the Fisherman's Bastion is quite a hike so try to go late on in the day when you can see the city turn from day to night because the view is even more impressive at dusk.

Breathtaking. the best area to visit in Budapest, the Fisherman's Bastion and Castle district, very easy to get up by public transport. nice cafe with wifi next door. lovely views of the river and the city and the parliament, would recommend at least spend half a day here in the castle district. We spent almost an entire day. We went into the cathedral as well as it was free entry on the day.

Beautiful view. You find this castle on a hill with perfect view. In the area you find cute small shops and diners, all in a old nice litte part of the town. The view is stunning, and you will definatelly take some good pictures from the hill
Far Horizons. Very nice views down to The Danube, the Parliament and Pest. Would also recommend returning at night when lit up. Well worth the climb.

Great views, weird construction.. This place is weird. It has no other function than just being scenic, and you really can't beat the views. At the same time, it's seriously strange that they decided to build a fantasy castle on the palace hill.

Stunning views. Amazing views over the river, parliament buildings and the bridge. A few places to have lunch with great views but the food was quite expensive compared with other meals. Would still recommend for food and a walk round.

Beautiful. Was a walk to get here but we'll worth it. The views of the city were breathtaking and it is generally just a very beautiful place to walk around. With Matthias Church right there it is a primo destination for tourists.
Amazing view!. You can enjoy the beautiful view of Danube and take panoramic pictures of the Budapest ! Defiantly very popular and worthy attraction! There are 7 towers !
Fantastic. Just a beautiful area and the church is so beautiful day or night and the few over the Danube is awesome also.

Great view in a amazing architecture!. The view is amazing, and the place is not very crowded. The architecture is impressive and great for pictures. There's a restaurant there, but I didn't have the chance to go.
Astonishing view. Going there late at night when it's quiet is highly recommended. The view is beautiful and it's free to go up to the upper floor.

Beautiful Views. You can just imagine people coming here over the centuries - lovers, mothers, wives, searching the water for their loved ones to come home. This place is absolutely beautiful. Lovely architecture.
Stunning views. Stunning views over the city, even though packed with six or more coach loads of tourists & a wedding. Terrace cafe was a very pleasant pit stop before venturing back down the hill
Castle hill. Well worth a visit to budapest we did the touristy bit by going on the hop on hop off bus which helped us get our bearings stunning up on castle hill
Nice area for walk and lunch. Worth visiting for a great walk and lunch in one of the great places all nicely suited I the area. Not to miss.
Amazing views. We stayed on the Buda side and loved walking through the area at night when the tourist busses were gone. Stunning view of Parliment and local music in the square at night
Stunning yet expensive if you are a non eu citizen. Gorgeous location but too pricey if you are a non european citizen it doubles up, which I find to be rather unfair

Magical historical place. One of the best Budapest attractions without a doubt. Beautiful panoramic view, perfect for taking photos. Bastion reminds me of Disneys castle, its like you're in a fairytale. There is a nice Matthias church, little shops, restaurants and cafes. There are a lot of tourists but the place is still very nice for a walk, coffe and taking pictures. Beautiful architecture and view of Danube river and Pest.

Fantastic pictures . This place is filled with great photographic opportunities. Lovely to walk around and quite easy to navigate through. Nice little restaurants and a market also. It was a lovely stop on our trip

A nice view, but not much else. . The view from the Bastion is lovely. There is no denying that looking down from it is wonderful, but the view from Buda Castle or Gellert Hill seemed to be better. You simply get to the Bastion and that's it really, just a view with not much else to do. Worthwhile on a nice day to look out and say you've done it though, and the view and the area is still wonderful.
Magic. So wonderfull view.It is really worth it.!!! The aera is like a farytale....you should definitely visit it! Aproppriate for taking photographs!
nice. beautiful. very touristic. but still a great view. budapest without visiting this place, is like going to egypt and not sseing the pyramids.

Favourite place in Budapest!. This place is beautiful! It makes you feel as if you're in another world. One of my favourite sights in Budapest, would definitely recommend everyone visiting this place.

Great Views. Wonderful views of the city from here. The areas architecture is amazing and reminded me of something from a film set. We were lucky enough to be there while it was snowing and this made it feel even more special.

Surprisingly special. It's so difficult to describe but you have to come here to experience it for yourself. I remember coming here years ago during the day and it was ok. But to experience it at night is a lot more impressive. Magical!Lovely views. But with the castle and church lit up at night, it's a sight worth visiting. I read somewhere part of Lord of the rings was filmed here. There you go!!Worth a visit. Get the funicular up. Walk to the church and steps. And then walk down to the river via the steps is my tip!

Nice view on the Danube, and Pest. Next to the Matthias Church. From here you will have a nice view on the Danube river and Pest. Don't forget to visit this place at night, which is even more special then at daytime.

Breath taking. Before we went to Budapest, I read about Fisherman's Bastion so I allowed a day to visit this interesting place. It was full of tourists. The layout is so picturesque. Taking photos is a must. There is so much to see as you go up the stairs and the view is 360 deg. Also, do pay a visit to St Matthew's Church which is right in the middle of the top square. There is also a place for mulled wine at the top. Nearby there are a number of restaurants and souvenir shops.
nice place to see budapest view from above. weather is not good when you have fog you cant see much. but is nice walking area. climb for 5 minutes. you can see budapset from above.
Lovely . Really enjoyed the walk around here and had a lovely lite lunch in the cloisters which was so atmospheric in the fog
Magical place. Really lovely building to walk around and see Budapest from a height. Lots to do around the area as well.

Nice View in the evening!. Worth going. The night view is simply amazing! And as it is located uphill, you can see the bridges and the parliament from here.
And next to it, there are main attractions of Budapest(walking distance) so definitely you should go!!
Amazing views. This place had an amazing view and the church was gorgeous. It was also pretty easy to get to. The walk wasn't strenuous in the slightest.

Nice view. It use to be even paid actually, and now is for free =D
It has a nice view to the parliament, even if it is quite modern, it is still nice to go around. And come on, if you are around castle district, go to see Mathias Church and you are already on the Fisherman's Bastion.

An amazing site of architecture. ,we reached this attraction by cable car the views were spectacular and the site amazing, well worth the visit and a lovely little cafe very close in the small park by the information centre, wanted to try the main restaurant in the Bastallion but not there at the right time but looked fab with great views.

Need a clear day for the great views . Try to visit on a clear day and if you do you will be rewarded with magnificent views over Pest and the Parliament building. Some of the scenes in Lord of the Rings were filmed here. At the moment the walk along here is free but it looked like there is a charge sometimes.
Great view!. This place really felt magical under a fresh blanket of snow. A must see site on any visit to Budapest.

Romantic and Surreal at night. Fisherman's Bastion is on the Buda side of the Danube in the Castle Hill District. It was a good 10 minute climb, but the view was worth it. Check the hours for the Matyas Church if you intend to see the inside. (We missed it.) Stop by Ruszwurm, a bakery for the royals since 1827, for some delightful cakes.

Best view of Budapest. A great view of the city with a nice cafe for a warm drink and a cake. I would not recommend the meals as it seems that the food has to be brought from outside the cafe, not an issue in the summer but in January it -8C outside!!

Worth the walk up the hill for an excellent view!. Quite a hard walk up to the top, with a lot of uneven steps but the view at the top is stunning on a clear day. Cheat your way up by taking the funicular to the castle and walking across then take the stairs back down.

wonderful view. Budapest at his feet, panorama of the Danube and the city's prominent buildings. Overlooking the neighboring hills of Buda, Margaret Island. Fishermen in itself is an architectural masterpiece can be seen behind the Matthias Church.

Unique structure, easy axess, best city views.. Can stay as long as you want. It is free and great location. Fantastic city views. Can stay as long as you want and enjoy views of Parliament Building, the Chain Bridge across the Danube all the way down to Margaret Island as well the City Center views.

Everyone need to see. This place is the best in Budapest. The view is awesome, and I just love this area with the casle, and the church. It is a shame you need to pay to check the 'Halász bástya' and the 'Mátyás templom', but it is nice from outside as well. (I'm from Budapest)

Amazing!. Interesting and original architecture, and you get a stunning view over the Danube and the Parliament! A must see during your time in Budapest, absolutely beautiful! you can easily reach it from the Buda Castle, and there is also St. Matthias church nearby
Great photo opportunity. Amazing design and detail to be found everywhere ! This is worth the photos - however, you also can't miss the huge Hilton which is bigger and next door : (

The views were astonishing . With views of the whole of Budapest, this viewing point is amazing at night primarily, the church was absolutely amazing to look at let alone the city itself, it's quite far away however so photos are very unclear and there are fog lights pointing against the Bastion so you have to stand back from the edge unless you want a very powerful light in your face, these lights ruined a few photos I must admit but it's still an amazing experience!

Freezing with a view and a cup of hot chocola. We had just finished the walking tour around Buda (which is free on the Budapest card). It was -12 degrees Celsius but we continued to trek on, then we saw a bunch of towers and a walk way. It was like something you would see in a princess story or a book of fairytales. It was beautiful and in the top of the tallest tower there is a little cafe that serves hot beverages. It's still out doors though but it has overhead gas heaters! Lovely little place I'd highly recommend it, preferably on a warmer day.

A great place!. I just loved this place when I visited Budapest, it's gorgeous!It has a great view over the city, you can see the Parliament from up there, you can't miss this great place when you viait the city!

Amazing views of the city. Made my visit to the Buda part of the city midway through a week long stay and enjoyed a great day in this area with the highlight being the views firm the Fisherman's Bastion. The views back across the Danube are stunning and this is absolutely a 'must do' on a visit to Budapest. It is very busy owing to the number of buses of tourists who come here but not enough that it could ruin your enjoyment of a few quiet moments on your own appreciating the scenery.
Like a fairytale . It was so nice that we visited it twice.Amazing location and view of the city.Easy access with bus.If you ever visit Budapest you must visit the Tower.

Beautiful. This is a really lovely building which overlooks Pest and the gorgeous Danube..it was an incredible warm and sunny day with musicians, re- enactors in medieval costumes..men with birds of prey..lots to do and see in the area..plenty of cafes, St Matthias Church and the Art gallery and museums..the views are spectacular..I travelled alone and would have loved to have someone with me to share it all with..
Great view!. The view up there is great! You can see the parliament and the bridge. Strongly recommend a night visit.

Outstanding Views. This was a great part of our visit to get some lovely views! We did not go to the top but went high enough to see over the city! It's very picturesque and I would recommend this! And it's free!!Please be aware there are loads of steps and it can be a bit slippery when it's snowed. You need to have some level of fitness if you want to go all the way to the top

Wonderful views of the Danube!. After 15 days on a River Cruise, our last stop was Budapest. We spent a morning here high up on the hill at Fisherman's Bastion. The sky was crystal clear blue which made the views of the river, bridges and buildings across the river beautiful. The grounds are kept up beautifully and the walkways are clear and plenty of room for tourist to walk around and take photos.
Great view. . Was a lovely stop on our Budapest tour. Best view in the city. Plenty of shops and cafes to fugue anyone's needs. Great for a pic
beautiful. the Fisherman's Bastion is amazing, with a great view, I didnt made any special tour, I only walked around, its also a good place to seat and enjoy Budapest.
Perfect to stroll for sundowning. Superb view over the city. Good place to stroll around and to get a feeling of the old place. Take time to get the feeling.
Great view. It's a must. Great view and delicious cafes. But there are a lot of tourists. You can have a nice walk there.

Amazing. What an amazing venue. As the 'Fisherman's Bastion' I expected to visit at the waters edge, but not so. Built high on the hills above Budapest it's an enchanting mix of Medieval Parapets and Turrets more commonly seen on Castles. Stunning views.

beautiful!. me, my brother and my father went to Budapest, and offcourse the fisherman's bastion are a must-see. its beautiful and grandeur! but on the other hand that's about it, its beautiful. it doesn't really move you, doesn't really leave a permanent mark on you. but still, dont miss it

Beautiful views and gorgeous hot chocolate!. This is a beautiful place to walk around, or even better to hire segways and go around on! The only negative was the ugly Hilton hotel behind it but that is just a small negative! We ate in the little restaurant in one of the towers, gorgeous views from high up in Buda over looking the river Danube and you can see parliament and Pest!The hot chocolate is amazing, it warms your cockles up and is made with milk, cream and chocolate so it's thick and luxurious! Again everything is so inexpensive here, checkout my other reviews, defo worth a look it's beautiful
Excellent way to see the city. A must go to get lovely photos of the city. You can see for miles once you are there. A great way parliament and chain bridge.

A must see . I can see why this would be a top tourist attraction in Budapest... Absolutely stunning views. Certainly worth a visit. Especially if you're always looking for photo opportunities like myself. There were street musicians, and a beautiful church near by to visit for a small fee. Bring at least 200 HUF if you plan on needing to use a restroom whilst visiting. They are relatively clean, but you do need to pay to access.

Beautiful views. Highly recommend going here as it offers wonderful views of the city including the river and parliament! Lovely little cafe serving hot chocolate and mulled wine up the top so you can relax whilst taking in the scenery!

Beautiful. A great attraction to visit if you like magical-castle-looking-buildings. It's like a real life Hogwarts! As if the view from the Bastion isn't amazing enough, just looking at the building itself is a treat, especially at night!

My visit to Fishermans bastion. A beautiful plaza with a great look down on the city. This turrets are quite like Disney !! A definite must if you visit the city and ideal for photos of the Danube, bridges and parliament building

Perhaps the best European city view I have yet had the pleasure of seeing. Our timing could not have been more perfect as we approached the Fisherman's Bastion. The sky was a light pinkish color from the fading sunlight. It wasn't long before our breath was taken away by the beautiful and extraordinary Matthias Church nestled along the hill right near the Bastion.The architecture of the Bastion was romantically enchanting with lots of towers. We just exclaimed "Wow!" as we approached the exquisite structures. We felt as if we stepping into a fairy tale, or, perhaps a Harry Potter movie.The views of Budapest from the Fisherman's Bastion were majestic, especially with the sun setting behind the beautiful Hungarian building. The sky over the dome of the Parliament building was a light pinkish color. It was perhaps the best European city view I have yet had the pleasure of seeing. We were extremely lucky because the lighting was perfect. It was truly spectacular. Fisherman's Bastion appeared majestic as the sun faded away and the sky turned pitch black.
Perfect wedding venue. This is a perfect wedding venue. Superior food, great wines, excellent service, amazing interior and breathtaking views. It just doesn't get much better than this.

Great views. Right next to the cathedral with spectacular views of the Danube. The architecture is lovely and enchanting after dark. Many good restaurants near by. Take the bus from Clark Adam Ter. or ride the funicular up to the Royal Castle.

Short walk with MAGNIFICENT views day and night. If you are in Budapest and want one of the best views in Europe you must go to Fisherman's Bastion (Halaszbastya) in Buda. We went this time in the winter and the usual pay barriers were left open, but even if they are charging it is well worth the minimal charge. Although you can get almost the same stunning views from the walkway below, but it is usually very busy there.

Stunning View at Night. We stayed at the Hilton, and so we walked the Bastion every night. One night it was shrouded in fog, another was rainy, and one night clear. The view of the Danube was stunning. Also, at the very top, you could get a warm drink and soak in the view....we were there in December, so this was much appreciated. The church was right next door, so you could go inside there as well. Hint: if you need a restroom, the Hilton has lovely ones. Just walk in like you are a guest. All in all a beautiful sight.
Fantastic view . Well worth a trip up here on a clear and sunny morning, we received fantastic views of the city below which made it a perfect photo opportunity.
Fairytale!. What a wonderful place - so pretty! Make sure you let your hair down at the turrets. Explore the surroundings and admire the architecture!

Amazing Views. Great views of Pest! It's free during the winter, I'm not sure I would pay the fee to enter during the summer considering you can just head over to the Funicular and get a similar view.
Phenomenal View. We went up there to get a view of the city. Luckily, it was a clear day and we could see everything. It is definitely worth a visit!

Beautiful views!. We went to Fisherman's Bastion by bus and then the next day we rode the Funicular up. The architecture is beautiful and the views are spectacular, especially of the Parliament Buildings.
Amazing!. Amazing view!! Very peaceful place! It's too bad that we couldnl't be able to visit the cathedral near...
Insane turrets. This is beside the Mathias church and is basically lots of towers and ramparts with great views over Pest.

Incredible view!. The view from the bastion is amazing and makes for a good photo op. The bastion itself is beautiful as well and in addition to the plaza and the church looks like something surreal (very clean and bright).

A must to be done. Nice architecture and a point of view on the danube river with the parliament. A nice restaurant is located in it with an amazing view. Definitely a must to do in Budapest (by night with a clear sky it's even better)

Fairytale Looks. Visited the Fisherman's bastion at dusk on a cold January afternoon after crossing the bridge and walking up the hill. The building shines brightly at night and gives you fabulous views over Budapest! We walked around the bastion and up to the tower that was open as a cafe. Two delicious hot chocolates were ordered at a rather high price, and we sat outside in the cold watching the world go by. Quite magical! We were staying in an apartment close to the Parliament building and it was great to have such a great view from the tower. Likewise, Fisherman's bastion looks like a Disney castle on steroids from the Pest side! Great visit, albeit short.
Wow. What a nice impressive building. It is clearly renovated and cleaned up. From there you have an amazing view over the city, but the buildings and fortifications are more than worth the climb.
Best view of Budapest on a clear day. It is an easy walk from the Pest side. Some hills and lots so steps to climb but well worth the panoramic view when you get there. Outstanding architecture.

Amazing View!. There is plenty to do in this area of the city. It's easy walking distance to Buda Castle, and many museums, and located right beside Matthias Church. Inside Fisherman's Bastion, there are a few restaurants/cafes for differing price ranges, and if you walk a little further, you are close to some Wine Cellars as well. This is a beautiful spot to get some cityscape shots, and just to enjoy an afternoon. My husband and I were here multiple times in our short stay in Budapest, and it was probably our favourite location in the city.

Lovely place - get food elsewhere!. Lovely to go and see, the views are great and the buildings are beautiful. However, the general food outlets in the area are overpriced and not great. It felt a bit of a tourist trap! We walked from the Castle to the Bastion and it was lovely, would be sad to miss this on your trip.
Beautiful. Spare a few hours on a clear day to walk from here up to the Citadella and soak in the phenomenal views of the city
Photo shoot. Best views of city, day time and at night,amazing placeLift from chain bridge if you don't fancy the walk
Like a fairytale. Very pretty and lots of photo opportunities. Buda side of town is very beautiful and great for walking. Beautiful view of pest from the bastion. Wrap up warm.

Amazing Vista. The views from the Bastion are are absolutely spectacular, and I would not want to miss them. At the time of year we visited, there is no charge for going up the stairs to the top terrace or the towers, so we did so. I don't feel the views were significantly better along the 'paid' part of the bastion compared to the lower terrace, so if we visit Budapest again, I wouldn't bother with queuing and paying to go that little bit higher.

Best place to spend New Year's Eve in Budapest.... Fixed menu for New Year's Eve (which I hate), but the quality of the food was good. Hungarian string music for ambience. We snuck out between courses to see the fireworks exploding around the city; they started at 10 pm and didn't finish until well after midnight. Excellent views. I would love to go back to this place on a regular night to really try out the food.

This city doesn't disappoint, and this is a gem in the crown. As part of a tour group it was an absolute delight to end up at this point at dusk early evening. Even in November the weather was a balmy 8*. The views stunning

Stunning building magnificent views. Lovely place to stroll about. A spectacular vista. If the sun's out sit out under a blanket and enjoy a mulled wine and if it's too chilly there's a nice cafe which also showcases the viewing
Fantastic. I love it. Must see. It feels like you are in other dimension. Easy to find and there is a map so you know where you are every moment
Beautiful architecture. This was a very interesting area to visit because the architecture was unique. We spent an afternoon here.

Best Sight (& views) in Budapest . Not much to say other than this is worth a visit. Really beautiful and amazing views of the river and city. It was pretty quiet when we visited mid week which was great!

Beautiful. The Fishermans Bastion is an absolute must see and provides everything from interesting art shops to restaurants with spectacular views over the city. The cobbled roads are closed to traffic and every little alley provides some gem.
A bit touristy. its OK but you get better view from the castle... what is about 10 minutes walk from here. For my taste its too touristy

Fantastic View. This is a great destination on the Old Town. I would recommend walking here from near the palace as you get a feeling for the area. great view out over the city and back towards the old town hall.
Very beautiful. We visited this in the snow. Very beautiful. Such a neat fortification. Contrary to what others said, it was not fishermans village. It was a fortification protected by fisherman.

Worth Every Step. This Fishermans Bastion is just on the opposite side, where you have to go walking on the long bridge that seperates Buda from Pest . But as soon as you reach there you can feel the difference in the culture, in the houses and the way of living - as before it was divided between poor and rich. Its really interesting to see if youre in to culture and history lovers
So beautiful. The architecture is something special and it comes alive at night. Worth a wonder around and gives great views of the city
Free walking tour. Went on the free walking tour which finished here, good views but the restaurants were a bit pricey (expected in a tourist area)

**offers a magnificient view of the Danube specially when its a "fog free day"**. better go there when its not foggy, to be able to see the view of the bridges, the Danube with the new town, it is a beautiful view! it is FREE of charge going up/around.

Lovely to walk along and take photos.. Very nice area of Budapest. The architecture is very pretty and the views over the Danube to the other part of the city are amazing. You will get some very good photos from up here. Nice place to have a wander but won't keep you entertained for a massively long period of time.

Budapest must see. OK it's a bit Disney, but still well worth a visit. In winter the turnstiles are deserted so it's free. There's a loo close by, so you can spend 50p! All the hop on hop off buses head up there at some point, or walk over the chain bridge and get the funicular railway to the top.
A 'must see' site. A beautiful place to visit with amazing views across the Danube and the city. Matthias church is also sited here in the middle of the Bastion.

not something special to see. We told that we should go to the market! Ok this was nice but not something special!
The building of the market is nice and ok it is worth it just a small walk around.
But really nothing special!
Beautiful and Free. Free to walk up and around the tower. Directly next to Matthias church. Beautiful architecture and great view of Budapest from the tower.
Awesome. Lots of steps but very picturesque and well worth the walk. Lots to see and do, and great for photos. Do not miss!

Amazing architecture and view. We were surprised by amazing architecture and view. You have the best view of Parliament building from there. There is little bar in one of towers, where it is nice to relax and souk up the city vibe.

Lovely . While in Budapest you must visit The Fisherman's Bastion. Situated in the Buda side next to the Mathias's Church this is a great piece of architecture with lovely views over the Danube and some of the bridges.

Nice architecture and great view. This structure is beautiful with its Neo-Romanesque and Neo-Gothic architecture. This is sitting on top of the Castle Hill and it has the great view of the Danube river. Near this structure is Mathias Church.
Wonderful monument!. A wonderful history monument.. Great architecture and a awesome view.. Don't miss the restaurant in the monument!
Historical visit. High on the crest of the Buda hill overlooking the river with nteresting architecture as well as historical. Worth a visit. Impressive view of Pest on the other side of the Danube
Beautiful. Even on a cloudy day this place it's pretty beautiful, and it's free. Have amazing views from the parliament and the city
Beautiful. Stunning architecture and a fabulous view of Pest. One of the highlights of our visit. I'd seen fabulous photos before I went and it really did live up to expectations.
Beautiful scenery. The view was amazing, defiantly recommend visiting as you can see the landscape and the view is defiantly worth seeing, I visited during the day.
very nice bastion. Amazing, what beautiful can create human hands. I think it shows honor to people which is dedicated to.

So Beautiful!. We arrived on a misty day in December which made this beautiful building even more mysterious and enthralling. Free to wander about and take some interesting pictures in the nooks and corners of this lovely, historical building.
Wonderful view of the city!. The Fisherman's Bastion is one of the most beautiful places we visited in Budapest. Don't miss it for the history!

Best View to the city. One of my favourite places in Budapest. The Bastion's view to Budapest (Pest side) is one of the best views in Budapest. It's free and has a unique atmosphere. A must-visit palce in Budapest.
Awesome views. Perfect location to see Budapest at day and night.You can relax in cafe-restaurant in one of that "tower" >prices their are high but worth tostay there and relax after exploring City..

An amazing view. If you want to take amazing pictures of Budapest you must go here. You will have to pay 200HUF entrance for the higher levels of the bastion but is absolutely worth it. Its ideal for people who like to take amazing panoramic pictures

Beautiful sight, great heritage, and amazing views across the river.. This place is so beautiful - not only the architecture and the history here but also the incredible views across the river really made Fisherman's Bastion a highlight for me. Really amazing atmosphere. Highly recommended to people visiting Budapest and easy enough to get to via public transport or the hop-on hop-off buses.

YOU FEEL LIKE YOU LIVE A FAIRY TALE!!!. Totally an unforgettable experience!!!Once you get there, you start to live your own fairy tale!Very beautiful views of the Pest side of the city,especially at night time!Don't miss to visit the little cafe' based in the Castle,from where you can enjoy the views while you relax and enjoy a hot drink,after a long walk all day long!The best time we had at Christmas time!It is located right next to St.Mattias Church,so you can visit both and take fantastic photos!
Romantic. A very nice side trip from the palace This romantic stop is great for taking those great shots of Pest. Set in clean surroundings next to the Cathedral.
Interesting architecture. We went there both during the day and night. It was even more crowded during the night than during the day. The view was stunning.

A great *bar/lounge* there with good prices overlooking the river!. There was a great bar lounge there with fantastic views and prices. Its a lovely place for photos and is free and open 24/7 Avoid the Restaurant as it was overpriced, go for the Bar lounge instead
Lovely architecture nice views... on a clear day. Great views over the Danube, still unclear as to what it was but it was lovely to look at and detail of architecture very intricate
Very wonderful place. It was a wonderful place but the real problem was the weather. its sooo cold and our kids was crying bcuz of that. so we return quickly. but the view was fantastic

Amazing view. Absolute must when in Budapest . Cross the chain bridge , few steps and you are by Mattys church and Bastions 7 of them . If you don't want to take steps , there is Funicular for around 2000ft There is a small fee around 1400 ft to go in to church , it is worth it , for the view it is free . The view is unbelievable . The day I I visited ; there was a snow , breathless view. There is cafe or two next to church on the top . You can order mulled wine or coffee . From there you can take a small bus and go to shopping center by the name of Mammut , about 5 min.

Nice place to visit and soak in the view. Fisherman's Bastion is located on the hill overlooking the Danube river and the city of Pesta. The battlements and walls are renovated and it shows. Even though not all the parts of the sights are free, you can still enjoy the ones that are and just rejoice at the beautiful panorama you have in front of you. If you are in Budapest, it is a must see destination.

Beautiful site see. My husband and I started the day by walking around the Buda castle and then walked over to this spot. It's a beautiful place with Matthias Church right beside it. There's a lot of stairs so I would keep that in mind in case that might be troublesome for you. There's a few cafés nearby and also a 3D film.
Must in Budapest! . If you are visiting the castle hill...thus place is totally a must...beautiful especially if you are lucky to look around and listen to the street artists!
Beautiful attraction. One of the most interesting tourist attractions. Must-visit it definitely! The view of Budapest from that place is breathtaking
Nice view. We liked to walk around..nice view.Full of tourist and it was pretty cold, but was worth it. Castle is not far away, so we went there after.
Great place with fab views. It was Beautiful exploring this amazing place. it is So big and there are great views. Highly recommend a visit.

Fisherman's bastion. Lots of Hungarian history here. Some areas were sectioned off as inaccessible which was disappointing and confusing as how these areas could be access by payment etc. But a lovely place to visit nonetheless.

Wonderful views . Stopped here on a hop on /off bus tour, good to get the Buda side of the river, great views of the Pest side and some great architecture to see here, didn't go on any tours here but a different feel to the rest of the city, quieter and more relaxed in my opinion.
I love this place. It is lovely.like you are in other century and you can feel the dinasty around you.I just love it and I reccomend this place for visit

Beautiful views. This place has beautiful views! Lots of places to eat and drink although we didn't not go in any. Very near buda castle. The church was so beautiful the tiles on the roof are a must see!
Fairytales come true.. There is not enough time to take enough pictures of this beautiful fairy landmark. It is what dreams are made of.
Fantastic views . Fantastic views of Budapest - would recommend a day trip to the castle district to see everything, not just a trip up for this only. Lots of amazing things to see up there!

Stunned by the view.... Its present on the Buda side on a hill.. hence you get a great view of the whole city.. the entire Pest side is visible along with the beautiful Danube... it can't get better than dis... dont miss..
Beautiful place. On the most beautiful places in Budapest. We more or less felt like being in a fairy tail setting. Also good view to the city. Quite crowded by tourist but these places usually are.

Stunning architecture. This is an absolute must, the views from the top across the riven are worth it alone, but it has a magical almost Disney feel to it. The violinist was decidedly mournful, and off putting, but you can avoid him. A bonus was the generous cup of mulled wine on sale in the topmost turret, under heaters with blankets provided.
great place. Beautiful place to take pictures. Very romantic place, you can see the river, there are many small towers etc...
Breathtaking. A truly breathtaking vista and architecture. It is both beautiful to look at from a distance and up close. It is a must see in Budapest!
good walking tour. a good view to the Chain bridge and the other side of the city. took a walking tour, it is worth a visit.
Excellent viewpoint. Best view of Pest and Parliament. You feel like an eagle perched on top of the hill. Our visit was on a foggy day and the view was still very impressive.

Stunning both day and night!. Just back from Budapest and the Fisherman's Bastion was our favourite place. The architecture and views are amazing! The surrounding cobbled streets with their unique buildings, shops and cafes are not to be missed. A short stroll around them leads you to Budapest castle, another attraction not to be missed.

Great place for a view of Buda. The Bastion provides a great view of Buda and is really a nice place to see the early 20th century architecture in the city. We went both during the day and at night and enjoyed seeing the city.
Breathtaking views . Took the Vanicular up and walked back down. Watch changing of the guards. Stunning views across to Pest. Cafes and restaurants expensive and poor quality in that area.
A bit climbing. If you enjoy climbing and hiking as well, then pay a visit to Fisherman's Bastion, walk from the bottom, it isn't a long or tricky way, just a little bit exercise.

great view!. What a tremendous view of the River Danube and the City of Budapest from this look out! There are seven pillars, like seven Hunn tribes, and each one offers a great view. There are stairs where you can get a higher view, just breathtaking. The area around the church, Bastion, Hilton (old monastery), pillar to remember victims of the Plague, and the statue of St Stephen, is a nice open area to relax, let the kids run around or enjoy a Christmas market.

Astonishing!!. If you havent been there you havent seen anything in Budapest is what people say and they are right!! Its lovely the view is amazing this historical part of the town is beautiful.Take your camera and just dont stop clicking.Fell in love with the beauty of this place.Take buses 16 and 16A to reach the place any other will leave you under the hill that it is situated and you will have to walk all the way up.
Stunning views. We got here early and the views and photo opportunity were amazing. best done on a clear day. Great view of the Parliament buildings across the waters.
Great. Take the metro and bus number 16 or 16a to reach the attraction. It has amazing views and have a walk around there.

Beautiful with outstanding view. Fisherman's Bastion features a beautiful cathedral and monuments. It also has restaurants and shops for somewhere to eat. It also offers outstanding panoramic views from a tower like walkway which is free to walk around but does get busier during peak time as you can imagine. Definitely worth a visit!Number 16 bus takes you back to the main city over the river

Magical! Highly recommended. A not to miss place!One of the most magical spots I have seen in my life. Try and eat at the restaurant inside the Bastion. If possible see it in the winter, it was freezing but the snow made it magical

Fisherman's Bastion on New Year's Eve. A brief visit and time to take a few photos of this historic spot. We were primarily in this area to visit the Matthias Church, which I will review next. It is a wonderful area with so much to see within a radius of 200 metres.

Best vantage point for views of Budapest . Absolutely beautiful architecture and views across the whole of Budapest. Definitely recommend visiting this place at night too, looks so magical, romantic and a perfect opportunity to take in the city

Visit this and Matthias Church!. The Church is right behind the Bastion. They are both worth a visit at least once! The Bastion is a giant old wall where fisherman are said to have used to guard the city!

Beautiful architechture with an unparalleled view of pest!. This was one of my favorite activities as the Coronation church was alongside the Bastion. A welcome added attraction to an already magnificent bit of history. The position on the hill offered a fantastic view of the city below, and across the river.

Amazing views. Beautiful views and not too crowded given how stunning the views are. Lovely spot for photos. Small cafe up the top of one of the towers; unsurprisingly overpriced but lovely to enjoy a hot chocolate while overlooking the snowy rooftops below

Bastion at the back of Hilton. This is a surreal place to visit. We were staying at the Hilton which is located at the back of the Bastion and we've enjoyed this magnificent monument everyday as a walkthrough. A must see in Budapest.

Worth it for the exercise getting there and the view once you made it.. Has to be experienced, lovely atmosphere and great views. You can use the steps or take the little railway if you are unable to climb the height.

Great city views by night. This place never stops to amaze be, specially by night when the city's lights are slowly being turned on. The fall of darkness offers beautiful opportunities for great City pictures. Besides that the whole area is beautifully restored and with the exception of this misplaced modern bank/hotel building offers a nice skyline view from the opposite Danube river bank.

Not What I expected. When visiting Budapest I was looking forward to seeing this attraction thinking it was some special area of interest but in fact you could easily visit it and pass by without knowing you were there. Not a bad place but also not very memorable.

Straight out of Disney or is that vice/versa !. Marvellous spot for catching up on the history of the area & great views in terms of the buildings & the sights across the river. The small 3d movie is worth a watch to quickly run through the ever changing history of Budapest. A must visit more so than the castle.
Fisherman bastion. Very pretty place, and just outside of Matthias church. Also, this is a great place for a nice view of pest. At the same time, there has bunch of good stores and cafes around.

Architecturally Bizarre, Amazing views!. Fisherman's Bastion is situated at a high point in Budapest, so being there, you can get amazing shots of the city below as well as the Danube river. The architecture is just so fascinating, ornate and almost mythical looking! We climbed up one of the towers to find a cafe situated in the midst of the tower itself; we did not order anything, but just toured around the round balcony of the tower. The staircases leading up to this tower in particular have amazingly detailed dragons on the foot and top of the staircase. Really seemed like this structure came straight out of a Fantasy epic. Must visit :D
On the blue Danube. We climbed the hill on a sunny day and enjoyed the stunning view from the top. We returned many times by taxi to see the city by night and in the snow
Very nice place and view. We really loved pictures of Fisherman's Bastion so we couldn't miss this place. It was very nice, even it was very cold (-5) and foggy. Worth to visit.
