Top of the line... This top service and food enjoyment of my life (and I did see a lot of restaurants aroun the world.)What a class we were there with my wife an daughter and enjoy every moment of the evening.Definetly a place to visit.

Amazing sandstone craftsmanship.. Amazing sandstone craftsmanship. I found the variation in column details on the walkway very interesting. Make sure to also see the structure from the bottom of the stairs.
It was nice . Didn't go inside since they have entering fee, just looked around. Looks beautiful as all the area around. I do recommend to travel around, pretty view.
Grand. Budapest has amazing scenery and architecture, it is a gorgeous city. Fisherman Bastion is fabulous, grand and a must see area.The view from above is breathtaking

Visit at night for a very different feel.. In the Buda district. Great example of the old original city. easily accessible. Great views of the city, Danube River and Pest. At night it is very well illuminated adding to the experience.
Beautiful building and virw. The fishermans bastion is a beautiful building definitely worth a visit. The view from the place is fantastic as well overlooking most of Budapest.

Mobbed. Even when we visited in September it was very busy. We didn't pay extra to go up onto the structure juts fought our way to the low level viewpoints.It was probably the busiest place we went to in Budapest so spoiled it a little but it's worth visiting for the views, the contrast of the white building against the blue sky and the nearby church.Should have gone back at night.

Highlight of our day. After a long walk from Hero's Square over the Chain Bridge and up the hill we were thinking we needed a snack break...but when we saw the views we just couldn't stop. It's stunningly beautiful. We were there mid day and got great photos--I want to try it during golden hour on our next trip.
Awesome views of Budapest. Nice Bastion to walk and enjoy the views of Matthias Church and Budapest's skyline. Very crowded, but I guess it's normal.

Amazing structure and great views, too!. Even on a cloudy day, this place is beautiful. It offers tours for a fee, which we didn't do, but you can still roam around and take in the sights. There is a great view from this side of the Danube to the Parliament on the other side... just fantastic!
Must see. This is an amazing place to see Budapest , beautiful location with a birds eye view only go if it's not foggy else you won't see a thing

Views to die for!. The views from here are absolutely breathtaking! It captures the best views of the city and allows for fantastic photographs. It's easy to get to by bus, and the buses come every 10 minutes or so from both sides of the river. Can be cold in winter as its at the top of the hill and can get windy, so wear a thick coat in the colder months! It's a must see if you are in Budapest!

Interesting. Wish I had done a tour to learn more about this building. This is a stunning piece of architecture with some amazing views of Budapest. It is right next to Matthias Church which has some interesting designs. The were two things I didn't like, firstly when I arrived there were too many tourists I think a couple of coaches full of them had just arrived which meant I wanted to get away and not hang around to find out more. And secondly, there were a lot of people trying to sell you things like artwork and tapestries when you are walking around the turrrets but I did not feel this was the right place for them to be standing as yes there are tourists but they are trying to take in the beauty and don't want to be bothered with the souvenirs you are trying to sell. As others have said it really felt like you were in a fairy tale of the neogothic kind.
Hello Eastern Europe!. The only negative thing is the man who collect money at the restroom was very moody and not friendly ( you have to pay for the fee to get in )
iconic views. Despite the cold weather, the huge number of tourists, this is a wonderful place to visit. The best time is first thing in the morning before the hordes descend.

Like being in a fairy tale.. This is such a great spot to get fabulous view of the city. There is a restaurant in the largest tower and it is magical. The church is breathtaking and the statue of St Stephen is captivating.

A good view of old architecture. The architecture of the buildings were amazing, and the tile roof of the adjacent church building had all kinds of designs, St Stephens statue is nearby, as are some restaurants and shops.

Great views of Danube and Parliament. This impressive structure on the Buda side of the Danube, gives you beautiful views of the Danube, the Parliament building, the Chain bridge and downtown Pest. Definitely one of the best places to take photos. The structure itself is very impressive and the are is loaded with shops and places to eat. You can walk there from the Pest side across the Chain bridge and the ride the tram up the hill side to the top of take the long winding sidewalk to the top. Numerous tour buses and city buses also go the Bastion. It is definitely one of the must do's when visiting Budapest.
Perfect view!!. Excellent view of the city. Definitely a must see! Try a walk on the sunset, the night view is remarkable.

Views Views and more Views. Adjacent to the Hilton Hotel, Fisherman's Bastion looks like a castle. There's a restaurant that is very busy (I didn't eat there), and the area has great viewing spots overlooking the Danube, the 3 main bridges and Parliament. Lots of stairs but you don't have to climb to have a view. Small park/grassy area adjoining.
Save the big tower until last.... Great architecture and brilliant views. It was bitterly cold when we visited, but there is a bar in the last tower where a mulled wine was welcome!
Beautiful views. A very popular tourist destination. The views are excellent but the architecture is slightly falling behind.
The Views Are Stunning. Have a walk up to the Fisherman's Bastion and you won't be disappointed! The view of the Danube is at it's best here, especially at night.

Stunning. The whole area of Buda was amazing but the views from Fisherman's Bastion really were out of this world. The architecture, views and story made for a really enjoyable start to the day. Would also recommend walking up through the streets of Buda to enjoy the view even more!

Lovely views,. I really like this place even though it is very touristy. The view of the danube river/parliament, and parts of the city is just gorgeous.The entrance for the most part is free but if you want to get up to the very top there is a small fee. (after a certain hour in the evening it is free though) There is also a nice church here worth visiting, matthias church.
Great history. Beautiful pictures...dress warm if visiting in winter time. When I went it was windy, 14 degrees and snowing...

Beautiful. One of the best places to see the Pest side and the parliament from above. The architecture is really beautiful giving it a romantic. A must-see for every traveler in the hungarian capital.

Fantastic views!. We visited by Hop On Hop Off tour bus which we found great value for visiting Budapest. We need to go back so we can visit Fishermans Bastion again. Lovely views and setting and they have a cafe which has fantastic views over the Danube, Parliament etc. So pretty here.

Vacation . A beautiful panoramic view of Budapest is seen from this spot. As for the Hungarians, this is the toure eiffel of Hungary and they are right, you can see Buda & pest with the Danube river as well as the bridges. It is just spectacular

Amazing views!. Beautiful views from this landmark. A very fun, heated bar at the top of one area and another area has a glassed in restaurant with great goulash and a wonderful dessert that was light yet super tasty!
Perfect walk. This area is the part of the World Heritage. Go for a walk and amuse the panorama of the city. Try the restaurant in the main bastion or the cafe under the arcades with live music.
Best part of castle hill. This is the coolest part of the whole castle hill. It's quite small, but amazing details. It's also a restaurant inside to sit down for a drink.
a fine old building. 5 stars place in the night. You can see thousands of lights over the bridges and Duna river. I recommend to visit here definitely in the dark!!!

Amazing pictures and view. See the architecture and look into the parliament. It's a must!
There are some ice cream places and restaurants near by.

Good but expensive.. It is one of the best places in Budapest, beautiful view, well maintained scene, the only thing is that I found it ridiculously expensive. I visited once around Christmas, it was oj for my foreign wallet, but if you visit in the summer be prepared for high prices!

Come VERY early in the morning. Too crowded! The views are more spectacular from the Gellert Hill!
So if you stay somewhere close try to be here very early, than it's much nicer!
Fascinating in night. I was in Fisherman's Bastion several times during a visit to Budapest but every time I was fascinate at night walk in this place!

Amazing!. Lovely location overlooking the city of Pest. Nice architecture, nearby is the castle and the Matthias church. A nice café is also there but you may have ti wait fot a table with view. Nearby is a big well known hotel and a fine restaurant

Children love this romantic monument with a great view to the Pest side. This Romanesque revival construct was built at the end of the 19th century. With its arcades offers an unusual lookout to the city. Children love it.
amazing view in a sunny day!. It was really beautiful with all the view and design. We heard from the tour that it was designed and built in order to match the Mattias church in style.
Beautiful by night!. This is a must see when you are in Budapest, the views at night time are just breath taking. Simply stunning.
A must see in Budapest. I like the fact that this place is located on a hill overlooking the city Buda and Pest. And at the top of it, there is a stunning St. Mattias church to explore.
Great view. Is is reachable by local bus and foot. It is free and it shares a great view from the top. Top 3 of the budapest

Gorgeous place plan a few hours if not more. Loved the view. Amazing architecture. Right next to st Matthias
I would have planned a half day there to really feel the place

Amazing views. This is a beautiful location to overlook the city, the view is amazing but the location is just as awesome, it will have you feeling like a princess overlooking your minions LOL. Definitely worth a visit.
A beautiful place to visit. A fun and unique place to visit with wonderful views of Parliament and the Chain bridge. Several other places to see in the area as a bonus.
A great dining experience. Lovely atmosphere, setting and service. Food delicious. Well worth it for a treat. Not the easiest to find.

Amazing service and setting. We had the most amazing evening here. The food and wine was unbelievable. It was our most expensive meal whilst in Budapest but we certainly got what we paid for! Such attentive service, lovely food and beautiful views across the city, I cannot recommend it highly enough.
Incredible view!!. From here you can have a panorama look of the whole city. Went here in December - off season time - so it is free. Usually it is 750 HUF which is around 2.5e.
Over looks city center. Early morning is the best time to visit. Not so many people and light is good for photographs. Bus number 16 takes you there from Deak Ferenc Ter, bus stop Szentháromság tér

Lovely. Hidden away so we were extra surprised by what it had to offer! An incredible view of the City and with so much character! If you can't make it to Citadella I would strongly recommend visiting Fishermans Bastian!
Very pretty on sunset. It is lighten up very beautifully on sunset, and the view is also pretty at that time (if weather is not foggy).
Great views. The Fisherman's bastion gives some amazing views over Budapest from its interesting and charming architecture.

Love it. Visit this place at night. After a long walk around there, you should let yourself relax to the cafe ( which I don't remember it's name ) and enjoy the city view. Take some energy and get ready for the getting back to town.
Lovely!. This was the first place we visited in Budapest and it was beautiful. Lovely views over the city and across to parliament. Wish we could have spent more time here.
A beautiful must. Perfect view, lovely surroundings and perfect for taking pictures. A cute little bar is found in one of the towers.

Best view of the city. This was a bit rushed due to the tour timetable, but we managed to get some wonderful photos of the structure itself and of the views from its Windows. Well worth the trip to have a look.
Cool View. This place has a great view of the city. It was also a nice walk to it and has a pretty church next to it. I didn't spend a lot of time there but what I did I liked. Plus it's free.
nice views. Nice to visit, impossible to miss when visiting the Buda side of town and the caste. Good views of the city
Go here. . This place had great views so I wanted to photograph everything. You get a great view of the whole city up there. Winter is windy so be prepared to be really cold.
Beautiful Budapest. Take an evening cruise on the Danube to get the best photo opportunities . The city is easy to navigate by bus or train. Enjoy the open air Christmas markets
Highly romantic place. One of the most romantic places in Europe! The place comes from the kings era and has amazing view to the close to Dunav amazing architecture buildings. Must see in Budapest!!!
Fisherman's Castle. I lived near the castle and even day and night , excellent views for taking photos and look over the whole Budapest!

A must see in Budapest. Really nice view of the city from the fisherman's bastion. It's free as it is a big wall that can be walked from end to end. It's in the same area as St Matthias church and Buda castles. You should definitely go there.If you stay only a few days in Budapest, you might want to leverage the day by starting with the Parliament in the morning, then st matthias, fisherman's bastion, hospital in the rock, lunch in the area in a deli store in the area at reasonable prices and finish with the Buda castle when it's already dark (about 4 pm in winter). That way you will get the view of the city during the day from the bastion and at night from the castle. Regardless of your time in Budapest, all this is a must!

Best view of the parliament. This is more of a viewing point for the parliament and the Danube than any other thing. I say that so you can have the right expectation on what to get out of your visit. The 16 and 16A bus will drop you right at the Matthias church and this is right behind that in the same area. Enjoy the views in the day and the night as the lighting can really make a huge difference to the experience.
View. This is the classic view from castle hill looking across the Danube toward parliament building. Kind of fogged in when I was there but definitely a spot to visit.

Unbelievable view over Pest. Take your time to wander around Fishermansbastion. Best time is evening when most of the tourists are gone and you have an amazing view over the illumanted parliament. In the top of one of the towers you can enjoy a drink while enjoying the view.

Hogwarts!. No one told me there was a real life version of Hogwarts in Hungary! This whole area is absolutely beautiful - the views and the colours are amazing. We went up at sunset and it was perfect - the view down the river is lovely. In one of the turrets there is a mulled wine bar - you will be able to smell it from a mile away! We enjoyed a warm drink looking down on the amazing parliament building. Highly recommended

The perfect place to watch the world go by!!!. We visited the Fisherman's Bastion during the summer and it was beautiful in the sunshine. The Green Line Hop-on, Hop-off Bus Tour has a stop a 5 minute walk from the site so it is easily accessible. There is a lovely park area nearby where you can buy an ice-cream and enjoy views over the Danube and Pest. We sat at a cafe and had a beer with a cool breeze blowing through the columns and a three-piece band playing classical music in the background. It was bliss! The walk around the Bastion is also enjoyable and we were sad to leave. A must-visit attraction when in Budapest.

Go at night - and in the winter. We went here the week of Christmas, but at night. It was heavily foggy every day and it gets dark early in December but we weren't ready to call it a day. We had the whole place to ourselves and the views in the foggy were fantastic. It was so peaceful and the conical shapes of the bastion were especially dramatic in the fog - not to mention views of parliament across the river. We went back the next day in daylight and were disappointed by the crowds.

Excellent panoramic view of the city. To many stairs, but worth for the upcoming panorama city view. Very windy and cold at this season. Not so easily reachable by public transport - 20 minutes walking distance from the nearest metro station.

Great view!. Fantastic view to be had of the Pest side of the river. If you're visiting the castle or the Matthias Church it's worth the look. The Bastion itself is beautiful, especially when lit up at night and viewed from Pest. There is an admission charge to walk on the top level - I'm not sure why you'd bother.

Beautiful !!!. A must visit in Budapest ,try if possible to visit the fisherman's bastion in a sunshining day . The view is beautiful and don't miss Matthias church.The seven towers symbolise the seven chieftains, who conquerred the land for the Hungarians. The Fishermen’s bastion greatly contributes to the cityscape and offers a breathtaking panorama on the Pest side.

Visit at Sunset. I read this was one of the top 10 sites to see, but ran out of daylight to see it. The sun was actually going around when we arrived and I would describe it as a magical experience. If you are looking for something really romantic, take your date here for dinner. It was foggy and probably about 0C/32F when we visited so I was worried about getting good pictures. I was blown away at the beauty up close, and the fog and darkness made the pictures even better in my opinion. The views were awesome enough we decided to go into the restaurant and buy a bottle of wine so we could enjoy the views from the warmth, well and get our liquor coat on for the walk back to the hotel on the other side of the Danube.
Great view!. Beautiful place with a great panorama view over the city and the river! Definitly a must when in Budapest!
Not sure why they built it, but is beautiful.. Large built up area fronting the Hilton Hotel and Matthias Church. Lot of great views and great place to have a wedding reception as we saw several.

Stunnig views and a lovely hidden cafe. We walked from the Castle to the Bastion which takes about 5 minutes. It is truly a stunning building and boasts the most stunning views. We had read that you had to pay to visit the top pathway for the best views but the turnstile seems to have been removed and everywhere outside was free. Not sure if this is just because we visited out of season but it was appreciated. The views are spectacular. You can get a photo of the Parliament building, the Chain Bridge and St Stephens Basilica all together from here. A great place to visit and we managed to spend about 3 hours here just walking around taking photos. Head as far as you can to the largest turret and you will find it hosts a small cafe where you can get tea, coffee or mulled wine. Its not expensive and standing out on its terrace, overlooking the Danube with a cup of hot mulled wine is an experience you will appreciate. The only downside is that you can not just pay to climb the tower. You have to pay and take part in a complete tour of the place. That's a shame as this put us off and we ended up giving that a miss. Otherwise, a stunning building with views to match.
Great view. While it won't take very long to get around this, it does give you a great view of the 'Pest' side of the city from here. It is worth a visit if you're in the area.
Like being in a fairytale. One of a kind.Very interesting piece of architectureThe veiw is absolutely wonderful.Right in front of the st Matthias church, on castel hill
Nice. the Fisherman's Bastion is not that intersting, the view is great and the place itself it's great to visit and see, if you there go to Matthias Church‬ .

Stunning view. The architecture is just amazing. It was built in 19th century, but it looks like early Gothic. The Bastion has two "floors" and the entry to the second "floor" is paid. But the view is absolutely stunning from both of them, so it´s no need to go upstairs. You will see the huge blue Danube and Hungarian Parliement.
Great place. One of the great places to visit in Budapest. Great spot with a wonderful view.Great place for taking pictures.Worth to visit and spend the day.
Great views. Beautiful spot with great views of the city and the Danube. Great to walk around and experience the history of the city
Magnificent vantage point. If you want to have a magnificent view of Budapest from a beautiful vantage point, then you must visit the Fisherman's Bastion.

Great views of Budapest from here . This was one of our favourite sights in Budapest. We saw this both during the day and at night - I'd do both if you can/have time. It's such a lovely structure and I think it's the second best view of Budapest (after gellert hill/the citadella). This and the adjacent st Matthias church are beautiful and 2 buildings that will always remind me of Budapest.

Amazing view. Fisherman's Bastion is definitely worth a visit. Looking out from this vantage point is truly amazing. If not part of a tour, this would have been missed. Definitely recommended, however, try to visit on a clear day - unfortunately the day we visited it was very misty, but still worth it.
Great view over the city. Very nice place , best view over Best side and the river . go there for pictures . better when it's not foggy .

Astounding views. The views were breathtaking!! I can spend all day just staring at the view but we went there during the winter so we need to go to the cafe and sip a hot chocolate and cover ourselves with blanket to keep us warm. We stayed till night so we got a view during the day and night. It is all worth it!!

Bird's Eye View of Budapest. A relatively easy walk up Castle Hill near St Matthias Cathedral yields a neo gothic structural complex that yields the best views of Budapest. At the highest point there is a small cafe that is a wonderful place to get a snack and take in the views. Well worth the visit if touring Castle Hill.

Beautiful!!!. Not only the Fisherman´s Bastion but the whole area is really beautiful: the church, the neighbourhood...everything. You won´t get tired of strolling around. It´s worth visiting twice: during the daytime because of the great views you have from up there, and at night because of the way it is illuminated. I prefer the latter. It takes your breath away!!

Beautiful and amazing view point. We vitiated not knowing what to expect. It is beautiful and the views stunning. We then walked back down through the palace and although dark it still had that wow factor. Thoroughly recommend this area of Buda side of Budapest.
Could spent there whole day!. The whole area is really beautiful! Great place for a memorable photos and quick histry and architecture lessons.If you are in the Budapest you cannot miss it!
Great Views of Pest!. Spent a few hours here. Worth the trip up to see the views of the city. Find a simple book on the history of the hill. Lots of history too!

Amazing views of Budapest . When living in Budapest, I have visited here several times in all weathers. In the winter, wrap up well as the cold wind is brutal. In summer, fantastic views but can get very crowded. There is a great cafe bar where we had hot chocolate under blankets and heaters, looking out over the Parliament building.While you are there, visit St Matthias church - one of the most beautiful churches I have ever seen. Simply amazing.

Impressive!. We visited the Fisherman's Bastion (you have to walk a bit until you get there) during a freezing December morning and it was totally worth it! The square right before you reach it and the architecture of the Bastion itself is truly stunning.Once you get there, you have the chance to get a view of Budapest and the Danube river which was really impressive. Other than that, there's nothing else you can do there but just wander around and appreciate the architecture and the beauty of the place.
Beautiful area. Nice place for walking . Nice buildings sorrounds the area with nice restaurants . A good place for spending a pleasent afternoon . A place full of history , too . I recomanded .

A picturesque vantage point. As I visited in December, it was dark and foggy, even at 4.30 pm. However, it was a great way to finish a day on Buda's Castle Hill. The whole area is lighted and the views of the Matthias church from one side and Pest on the other side of the Danube are very rewarding.
Beautiful place. Nice walk to this place once you cross he bridge.The area is really beautiful, and you can get really nice shots of Pest :) highly recommended!

Amazing view!. Went right as the sun was setting, which made it all worth it.We went up the Bastion by foot from the tram station, going up through all the residential areas which was beautiful. Although there is a bus line going straight to the Bastion and down from it.When we got to the top we were greeted with an amazing view of the parliament and the Danube! Many things to do around the Bastion, such as the Matthias Church as well as a very small cafe, Ruszwurm Cukrászda, an old little place with a lot of character and great delicatessens.

Really nice view. It was really good and very nice view the bus could take you until fisherman square. Also there was a restaurunt up there that you could have your meal or your drink with a really nice view.

Beautiful place for photos and view of Pest. Packed with tourists, yet so friendly and welcoming to everybody, Bastion is a definite place to visit when in Budapest. Next to Matthias Church, you can't miss it!!
Worth the climb. Beautiful to see, especially on a sunny day!! Well worth the climb up the stairs to get there. Take your camera!

Beautiful!. Stunning sandstone architecture. There is also a restaurant and a place to drink coffee and mulled wine in the Fisherman's Bastion and look at the views. We recommend walking along the backstreets, there's a lot going in behind the church. It's also very close to Buda Castle.
Impressive!. Suggest walking thru the tower and the ramparts. Great view of the town and the building / towers are impressive. Would recommend the visit.
Fabulous view of Pest and the Danube from here. A tourist area but a great view of the river and Pest from the Buda side of the city. The church is well worth a visit just by Fishermans Bastion.

Beautiful even in the Fog . I believe I have a habit of going in the wrong weather but I would still say that this place is simply beautiful and worth visiting. You can enjoy the view ( which I could not) but I am sure it must have been awesome. The best thing I liked is the sheer level of detail and the astonishing architecture. While in Budapest its a must must see place.

Worth seeing. Went up to the fisherman's bastion which was built in a very cool style and offered spectacular views from of Pest from Buda. There's also a nice little bar type thing where you can have a drink while looking at the view.

Unique structure, nice view. May as well just walk around if you are visiting Matthis Church. It goes around the church, and you can look out the cloisters. If you can walk down the hill trough its staircase at the back, it's even more stunning.
Breathtaking views of Pest. This is directly behind St. Matthias in the castle district. Great views, and opportunities for beautiful pictures. It's worth a stop while touring the castle district.

My 3rd fav view in Budapest. If you are strolling in the Castle district you must stop here to snap some pics. The view is nicer from Gellert hill Citadella #1 my 2nd choice also from Gellert hill but facing south east towards Freedom bridge. This one is easily accessible by public buses. Spice up the view with a hot wine...

Like a Disney set.. Really pretty, sure children looking for Rapunzel would love this place, great city views. Free to enter but lots of steps around the area, not good for anyone with reduced mobility.

Fisherman's Bastion. The buildings there with the towers are extremely beautiful and the terraces offer a breathtaking panorama of the city (Pest). Just next to it it's Matthias Church with its Gothic architecture. Really give it a try!Both of them!!!

Worth the effort! . Like pulled out of a fairy tale, this is a must for all visitors. You'll be amazed not only by the beauty of the bastion itself, but by the arquitectural detail, an of course the view. It can get a bit busy, but trust me... it's totally worth it!
Fairytale architecture. We enjoyed a walk through Fisherman's Bastion and the architecture is very pretty. There are also fantastic views of the Pest side and the Danube. Well worth a visit!
Stunning. Reminds me of the Cinderellas stair case when she ran down and lost her glass shoe. Even more amazing at night.

Stunning views!. The Bastion is lovely and allows a wonderful area from which to see the Pest side of the city and especially the Parliament and Danube. Be sure to check out the actual architecture of the bastion and the church as you will find fun surprises. The church has a fee entry but is worth it. Small and not as over the top as many others. The history here is what matters! This church was converted into a mosque upon one of the many times the city was conquered and the inside is still painted as if it were a mosque.Walking the entire area takes a couple of hours and allows for a respite at one of the several cafes.

What a view!. This is well worth the trip. You can walk up the hard way, lots of steps, or my daughter and I walked the longer way up at a slightly less steep climb. It is really a beautiful place and if you like amazing views and beautiful architecture, you must visit this place.

Don't miss.... Don't miss a visit to this area. We took the funicular up from the Chain Bridge then walked along to the Fisherman's Bastion etc. Wonderful views. There is a small bar within one of the parapets with a viewing area outside.

Busy but beautiful. It is very busy at the Fisherman Bastion so you'll be lucky if you managed to get any pictures without crowds in. The buildings themselves are beautiful and immaculate, it would only take 40 minutes out of your day to have a walk around and take a few pictures, it's well worth it.

It may not be "historically correct," but it is VERY COOL. Your trip up Castle Hill will lead you to Fisherman's Bastion. You will think you are in Harry Potter world! Created for the 1869 celebration, it will probably only get "better" with age. In thirty minutes I probably took 100 pictures here. Every angle unique. The view of the Danube and across to Pest, including Parliament are just breathtaking. I give the folks with the vision to build this nearly 150 years ago simply for "decorative purposes" a ton of credit. This place is just cool.
Great attraction for photography. Fisherman's Bastion is great attractions in Budapest. We did a lot of photography and selfie when visited this place in april 2015.
Fantastic panaromic views. Lovely area to walk around and particularly impressive at night. Great view of the Parliament building on the other side of the river.
Photo opportunity . Great place to take photos of the city. Lovely to walk around. Great views. Fun to take photos of the other side of the city before and after dawn.

Xmas vist. Arrived here via hop on hop off bus at dusk. It was spectacular, great views over Budapest. The church was beautiful and a great area to walk around. One of parapets had a little bar to enjoy a hot wine or other beverage while taking in the view and appreciating the immediate environment. Well worth the visit.
Must See. One of the most impressive buildings I've seen. Beautiful view in the evening onto the Parliament building. Coffees all around available.
Fantastic area and views. Really nice walk up the steps to this historic area, well worth a visit but very busy with coach tours.
A Highlight. This was my favourite part of Budapest. It is truely wonderful. The church is a fee entry but the general walk around is a joy
Nice view overlooking the pest . I love this place for its view. Great place for photo taking. Expect a throng of tourists though. Explore some of the cafes here too.

Great viewing gallery. The Fisherman's Bastion is a viewing terrace with many stairs and walking paths. It offers a superb view of the Parliament building across the Danube. The Halászbástya Restaurant is located under the base level. Access is through an iron gate and statue laden tunnel.

The View... . This was the perfect place to stop, have a drink, and enjoy the views of the city! The Castle Hill area is great, but the view looking back down on the Pest area is postcard worthy you can see Parliament, the Chain Bridge and of course the Danube. We had the drink/soup or dessert combo. Good value with an even better view!

Great views of Pest and the Parliament. Great views and also you can see a few other landmarks at the same time. This is a photo opp. space, and beware, there are some places where you will have to either eat or pay to see views from the top deck. The Hilton behind it is an eyesore, but as far as a protection wall that was built after Budapest needed protecting, it is beautiful.
Just beautiful. A beautiful building itself, with a fantastic view and wrapped around a stunning church. What more could you want?
Nice view over city. Seven towers of the Bastion provide ideal place for pictures and view over the city. Nice spot and worth a short visit.
One of the best views on the city. One of the best views on the city, Parliment and whole Pest side. There is a bar on one of the tower, evening coctail there should be at your must do list)

Make this part of your walking tour. We went here with the 'free walking tour' and wouldn't have missed it for anything. It takes about 20 minutes to walk around it and photograph the amazing architecture. It also gives a wonderful view back across the Danube to the Parliament Building and Pest.
Stunning. The Fisherman's Bastion is a must see in Budapest. It is a stunning piece of architecture and the view from it is amazing.

Beautiful structure and views. The bastion is beautiful day and night. It was right outside my hotel room window and to say it was a picturesque view is an understatement. It is a lovely place to walk through and around, and the views of all Budapest and the Danube from here can't be beat!

View is nice but there is an entrance fee just to go up. View is nice but there is an entrance fee just to go up. I think there shouldn't be any entrance fee for that. There is not much to see for it to have entrance fee. But is is nice overall.

Great view!. After a mighty walk up the stairs, you can see the whole of Budapest from here.
As it is such a high point, even on a misty day it is still worth the climb.
Beware, it is selfie stick hell!

Go early before the ocean of crowds disembark their buses. . Fisherman's bastion is just a small fraction of the whole Castle hill. The view is great if not excellent. The restaurant has great view of the city and Danube river. Just make sure you get there before the crowd or make early reservation for window seat for the view.

nice place, crowded of course. watch your pockets, lots of people, really nice place to walk around, probably best in Budapest. make sure you eat before or after getting there, restaurants are really poor and touristy.

Fishermans Bastion. Well worth a visit to walk around and see some fantastic views of Pest from the Buda side of the city. You can get some amazing pictures and breath taking views of the Danube river and the Hungarian parliament building

What a place :). Fisherman's Bastion is a great place to get an amazing view of Budapest.
Must see this place, i was amazed with it :)

Beautiful tourist attraction.. This is a nice attraction with a gorgeous view of Budapest. In general is free of charge, only if you want to go in some of the towers you will need to pay a fee. Along one wall there is a restaurant inside, not so cheap but not extremely expensive. Also expands to one of the towers. You can enter just for visiting and taking pictures to the view.

Excellent location to get a great view of Budapest. Fisherman's Bastion is a great place to get an amazing view of Budapest and a perfect location if you want to take photos of the Parliament from across the river.The art of the bastion is beautiful and probably one of my favourites from Budapest, not to be missed!!Easily accessible via the main road from Buda Palace. Free access to the Bastion itself. There are plenty of cafe's, restaurants and souvenir shops nearby, heck even a marzipan museum!! :)

Fairy Tale Like Architecture and Great Views!. Our last visit to Budapest we thought we had planned it out so well and went all out on the sight seeing; the castle of course being high up on our to do list! I have absolutely no idea how we missed this....really don't! Oh well, well made it this time albeit a lot colder than nice and warm June of last year! A real must see! Lovely design and enjoyable to walk around the area. The view across the Danube to the Parliament was brilliant so have your cameras at the ready! If you're planning a day out to the castle then DON'T make the mistake we made last year and miss out this place! It's not far away and it makes such a highlight to the day out!

Amazing architecture, great views of Budapest. Short walk from metro to the top and it was worth it. Amazing architecture with stunning views of Parliament, Chain Bridge, Basilica of St Stephen and Danube river
Top tourist activity. Views are well worth it. Take the funicular up and take in the views and then take a leisurely stroll back down
Very pretty.. Extremely pretty place, with fantastic views over both the Buda and Pest banks of the Danube, especially nice views of Parliament
A short visit. I visited this attraction as part of a tour towards the end of November 2015. It is a beautiful area with panoramic views of the Pest part of Budapest. Well worth a visit.

Good to take in the sites. The combination of Mathais church and Fisherman's Bastion is extremely beautiful. The views from the top being particularly beautiful with the addition of a bar with heaters and blankets!!

Spectacular views of the city and the Danube. There is so much to see and do on the Castle side of the Danube, and the Bastion really caps it off with its beautiful architecture and close proximity to many other wonderful attractions and eateries. It's free and a super place to watch the beautiful people of Budapest. Fun to sit quietly and take in the views, and imagine all of the history that occurred in this area!

Good views on a clear day. We got to Fisherman’s Bastion at Sunday lunchtime on a dank murky winters day. It was packed and the views though pleasant were nothing special because of the weather. Essentially you walk along the ramparts looking down on the Danube and Pest, from a distance the building is attractive. Worth a detour on a good day when visiting this area of Budapest

A must. It's a must visit while in Budapest, it's difficult to think of many landmarks which are more famous. You can get there either by walking or by using the funicular, which I recommend if you're not ok with hiking. There's a nice cafe there and you can get great views on Budapest from there.
Nice views.. Nice building with spectacular views over river to city good to walk back via the impressive vanicular
Beautyful views. The place what you must see ones you visit Budapest.Beautyful views to Danube, romantic walk with your partner...ect.

Amazing. This was an amazing historical landmark, the workmanship which has gone into building this beautiful building was breathtaking, and the views from the viewing platform across the river Danube where breathtaking, it was a beautiful clear day with the sun shining high in the sky and we were bake to see all the great landmarks of pest from here .not to be missed .

Amazing during the night!. It was nice during daytime but absolutely dreamy during the night! We went on a cold foggy day and it wasnt that crowded. Walk around, take pictures, enjoy the view to Pest and travel back in time!

Stunning Old part of Buda!. This place is simply beautiful! It's part of the Old City, and is located up on a hill. If you would like some exercise, I highly recommend walking, and the views are breath taking. If you're into photography, definitely bring your camera! There are many bus stops to get you up and down, as well as a gondola. Highly recommend!

Worth the climb up for the view. Got off the hop on hop off bus to view this place. The view from here is amazing. This place is free to walk around and the streets surrounding it are very picturesque.

Unique architecture. This is a must-visit site in Budapest. The architecture is so unique and it makes for very good pictures. There is a small coffee shop/bar in the highest tower so go there grab a hot chocolate and see the views.

Looks like a castle. This area looks stunning. It's not a castle, but that is what it looks like. I did not pay to walk through the entire area, but I still feel like I got to fully experience this landmark. A must-visit in Budapest.
Stunning views over to Pest. The whole area is beautiful and the views from here looking over to Pest are outstanding. We had a drink here and watched the sun go down - hard to beat.

Gerat views, but feels a bit like a Disney location. I must confess that this area seems too clean and sanitized to be real. There is a pleasant walk up the hill from the Batthyany ter metro, and the views over the Danube across to Pest are spectacular. But almost the whole hill-top area was destroyed at the end of World War 2, and so the vast majority of buildings are very recent - though carefully constructed so as to look sort-of old.Tourists arrive by the bus-load, so the crowds can be a bit overwhelming.But there is a lot to see on Buda Hill - it's definitely worth a visit.
Spectacular Views of the city. The top of Fisherman's Bastion offers marvelous views of the city. It is part of the Castle Hills historic area.

Beautiful views. We had a terrific visit at Fisherman's Bastion. There are numerous photographic opportunities and the view is great! Lots to do and see in the area. Do not miss if you are in Budapest.

The most romantic place in Budapest!. This is the place where to bring your wife, or your girlfriend, anyway your love!
Overall with the sunset, the view of Budapest is amazing, the colors of the lights make this place really amazing and totally romantic. ;)
Great place to visit and also, why not, stay for a bit!
Enjoy!

Interesting architecture and good views. At the time the wind-chill factor meant that we didn't stay long. Good views over Pest are available from here as many have said. Not much more to say really. It's worth walking around the surrounding area streets too but the weather was near freezing so we didn't cover the whole of the old town.
Amazing views!. It is very majestic with spectacular views of the Danube and of Pest. Mathias Church is nearby and worth the visit also. The streets behind it are lovely for a stroll.

Beautiful. The only thing that wasn't amazing was lack of safety catches around the place, my five year old kept getting a little too close so I was ready to move on. The history and the architecture- moved me to tears.
I loved it.

Fairytale castle and Church best feature in Budapest. A visit to Fisherman's Bastion is easily accessable by foot from the Danube and well worth a visit. There are some great photo opportunities at this site and the architecture is amazing. One of the best sites to visit in Budapest

Beautiful architecture!. Stunning architecture. This building alone is worthy or your awe. The curves of the architecture are awe inspiring. The lovely little gift shops are also worth a gander through.

Great views of the city. . The Bastion is an area full of superb architecture and has a fabulous view of the city. Be aware that the bar is very expensive ... Clearly you are also paying for the location.
Nice view to bidapest. Great view to Budapest but not easy to find a place to drink coffee or eat something. The best is to visit between day and night so you can see Budapest by day and by night
Absolutely amazing. Well, no time to tell,.....YOU HAVE TO SEE IT! That's it! I done it 5th time and i still want to see it again!
Great views. Worth a look to get some great views and also a lovely area to explore. Once get away from the main area is much quieter.

Beatiful Place to sSend the Evening. Walking around this area reminds me of Dubrovnik. The lovely stone roadway, the very clean buildings, it really is a delight to walk around. Good restaurants, hotels and shops. Don't miss this gem on the Buda side of the river.
Beautiful views of Pest. Worth the walk up to take photos of the Danube/Pest cityscape! Next to Matthias Church. Lovely places to eat, but with tourist prices.
Photo opportunity!. Great views across the river and easily combined with a visit to St Matthias' church. Look out for the statues with fabulous moustaches.

The best view of the city. A lovely area, walking along the raised ramparts/old city wall you will be treated to the most amazing views along the Danube and over the second city of Pest. And it's all for free.There is a restaurant built into the old wall which has the benefit of the same views but in the warm, but only if you can get a table, it's very busy.
Well worth the walk. Great spot in a great city with wonderful views across Pest, you will not be disappointed by this tourist hot spot
Great Viewpoint. Great views across the Danube to the Parliament building as you approach up the steps from the chain bridge. The statues of the soldiers on permanent guard are atmospheric.
Beautiful Views. Fantastic views over the Danube. Go at dusk for changing colors. Nice walk back down castle hill and over the chain bridge
Perfect view of Budapest. Very nice view overlocking Budapest. Interesting and beatutiful buildings. A must to visit when in Budapest.

Awesome walk or funicular ride up and down, unique structure. Mist do. Visited twice on two different visits, and love this part of Buda (the castle district). Very nice structure, nice church and the shopping area is very nice too. Add to that excellent views and it's a must stop.

Mountain Top Experience in Buda side of Budapest !. Our Gate1 Tour Guide took us to the Fisherman's Bastion and it was spectacular looking down over the Pest side of Budapest. The view of the Danube and city below was beautiful and the palace stood out with its unique styling.For me it was extra special as I had the opportunity to hold a Golden Eagle on my arm (with well-padded leather sleeve) for a few moments, then he returned to his owner with wings outstretched. A memory I will always hold special.

A birthday treat. This was truly amazing. Views and service out of this world. There were four of us in the party and we all indulged from the al le carte menu. Trout tartare, goats cheese and cauliflower soup to start followed by chicken, beef cheek, pork and beef steak. Wine and puddings. A must on any itinerary.

Great place!. You should visit the place , not only once! We went in the morning and there were many tourist so we couldn't have so many pictures that's why we returned late in the afternoon and we met only a few people. The view was amazing. Definately the best place in Budapest!
Absolutely Beautiful . Like a Disney castle, stunning attraction, no cost at all. There is a cafe and restaurant and you can by mulled wine at the top.
Great !!. This is a lovely part of the City on the Buda side of Budapest, it's a lot calmer and peaceful than the main City well worth a visit
Very scenic . This is such a beautiful place. You can never get tired of it. The feel of it at nights is totally different from the day view. It's a must-come!

A fairytale visit. A beautiful spot to walk through with amazing views over the river. The "fairytale" like design of the castle makes the visit very enchanting and a great spot for photography enthusiasts
Beautiful. Crowded but it has a nice view and nice architectural for photos. The building are beautiful and u can have a nice view of Budapest from here .

A walk back in time.. Theres such a mystical quality to this place. It is an enchanting and romantic building. Street musicians provide ambient sound as artists peddle their wares. A unique experience.
Good views of Pest. Got the bus up here due to the walk. Nice views of Pest from the church and bastion. Very busy and crowded but didn't ruin the visit.

Beautiful spot . Best views of the city and such a fantastic spot to watch the sun set.
We spent hours just soaking up the atmosphere so worth the visit
Awesome Views. Awesome views of Budapest. This is a must if in Castle District. Go to Hospital in the Rock if out this way, too. Both are must sees.

Best views after dark. Cold and windy up here during our visit, but well worth it for the phot ops and the views! We were there during the day, and again after dark, and the view of the Parliament after dark was wonderful. There is a place to get hot drinks at the very top.

Great views. The amazing thing about Budapest was the amount of places like this where you don't have to spend a cent. The whole castle and surrounding old town are free. Just entry into the Museum and cathedral charge entry but are well worth the reasonable fee.

Best view in town. The restaurant with the best view of Budapest , great Danube panorama . Make sure you book in advance in summer for the terrace. The food is not the best in town and a bit pricey, but overall the experience is well worth it

Incredible Views. Fishermans bastion is in the castle district and provides incredible views over Pest. I did not see anywhere to pay and we explored it without charge mid-day. The whole area around is stunning with meticulous buildings and of course the castle. We took the 4 tram from margarit hid and then the 16 or 16A bus up the hill and it drops you right at the spot. Alternatively from Liberty bridge the 41 tram takes you to the base of the furnicular or you can climb the stairs to the castle
Great views. This is a great place to get a panoramic view of the Danube. I don't recommend paying to go up to the top level. It's seriously the same thing as the level just 10-feet below. Why pay?

Nice place. Nice place. But less interesting than Buda Castle or Parliament. Restaurant at the bigger tower disfigures the whole view and atmosphere. There is an old walls of ruined church near new building in the neighbourhood.

Gorgeous view across the river. Buda and Pest were formerly two cities divided by the river. They are different, the one flat and the other hilly leading to the mountains eventually. Fisherman's Bastion is the gorgeous outlook built on the cliff allowing the river to lead your eye along its meander and see the Parliament buildings, the parks, the squares, the glory of other other side. It is in the Castle District, so only one of a half dozen very interesting places of historical and architectural note.
Must see. Really nice part on Buda hill! Stunning views, nice walkaround... We took the historic lift from the bridge and than walked around whole area...
Love Budapest. This was one the most beautiful landmarks on the Buda side of Budapest. The views and history was wonderful. I have been there 3 times and can't wait to return.

Amazing place. This place is really beautiful you get to see all of Pest from there and the view is breathtaking!! I would recommend you go early so you can take nice pictures as it gets very crowded afterwards!

Great photo opportunity. We went here as part of our free walking tour any took plenty of pictures , it has a beautiful view! The architecture on the bastion itself is very cool and medieval looking - a lovely watch tower over the city.
So grand and insipring. This place was very impressive to walk around and take in the beauty of the structural design. Also get a very good view of Pest. Must do when in Budapest.

what a view!!!. The entire city of Pest shows itself from here!
Despite the crowd we loved visit here. Do not miss it

A Budapest Must-See!. The fisherman's bastion is in the heart of the old city and boasts some spectacular views of the Pest side of the city. You can see perfectly across the Danuba to view Parliament. A really wonderful experience. While they sell tickets to walk the fisherman's bastion (and they aren't expensive), there is a bar/restaurant you can walk through that has the same views and doesn't cost anything. We were surprised when we walked through the restaurant to find dozens of tourists taking advantage of the free part of the view, so if you're strapped for cash, this is an option for taking in the views without having to pay the entrance price. However, this is a really wonderful attraction and if you have the means, I would encourage you to pay the nominal fee to access bastion so that they can maintain it properly.

Oustanding location on Buda hill!. Castle-like turrents, glassed in colonnade, and a stunning view across the Danube to Pest make this a must for a romantic dinner. We dined in the quieter colonnade, past the larger room with its enormous circular table. Exquisite service, well choreographed. The food was pleasant. Two musicians played traditional music with skill and verve. Our view of the Parliament building as dusk set in and city lights sparkled made this a highlight of our trip. Definitely reserve ahead!

Unique structure. Historians will hate me - but i liked this because it looked very much like fairy land!No seriously, It was a lovely view too, a pleasant stroll. Can get busy. unique in that it is not the same style architecture that I have often seen travelling Europe.Definitely a must go see.

Go at nighttime to see amazing lights. You have to come here at night time. You are right across from the Parliament and chain bridge which are both lit up like a christmas tree and are beautiful. There is also a nice bar where you can get hot chocolate or hot wine.

Set in an interesting and beautiful area.. Great views towards Pest. The Mathias Church, with its splendid roof, is next to it, and the unique Hospital in the Rock is a couple of minutes away, via an outdoor lift.

Era meal with a view. What a fantastic location for a restaurant. It's a little bit special but the price rflcts the quality of food and the level of service. Give it a try for something a bit different.
Nice views!. Very nice views from the city! You can go there by bus or go walking, similar views than from the citadella, but from here you have direct views to the Parlament

Splendid view at the castle. At the Fishermans bastion you have a splendid view over the Pest side of the town and of course the Donau. Easy to access by taking the bus from Deak Ferenc Ter up to the Castle area.
Very beautiful. You should visit this when you are in Budapest. Looks like a building of Disney. Really nice restaurants in the neighborhood.

A place fairytales are made. What a magical spot!
It helped that we visited on a clear sunny day but the place was unbelievable - so pretty and magical!
Great Building and Arhitect. Great Building and Arhitect, best view from the pest side of the town, from the river side, I 've liked budapest very much.

Beautiful view over the city. Took the little funicular up the hill (worth the queue!) and walked around the castle area. Touristy but beautiful. The little bar in the highest tower of fisherman's bastion was nice. All in all a beautiful area.

Well worth a visit!. As circumstance dictated, we toured the Fisherman's Bastion on ourt first day in Budapest, and while exhausted from the long flight and suffering from the extreme heat of the day, we found this an interesting introduction to the city - typical of the magnificent landmarks we would see during the rest of our visit. In addition to this wonderful complex, the site offers unbelieveable views out over the Danube and the Parlaiment buildings at the edge of the river. Well worth a visit.

A lively yet peaceful time. The bastion offers the best views of the city, bright surfaces and gorgeous architecture. The style is peculiar, even for European standards, it evokes a feeling of romanticism and fantasy, like a mixture of Lord of the Ring's Minas Tirith and the world of E.T.A. Hoffmann novels. The stair fence seems too short to me though and it's always packed with people. I guess the only exception can be wintertime. Restaurants with a view of the Danube are quite pricey, but there are some other, simpler cafes right across the bastion. We took lots of pictures and had a coffee while enjoying the view. Best to go there on a sunny day!

Views of the city are beautiful from this vantage point.. You don't have to go up the many steps for a fantastic view of Budapest. Just go anywhere along the rock wall and you will have a good vantage point for photographs of the city below. Many tourists think otherwise and don't procede to the wall - a shame as they miss much!
Excellent. Fantastic experience! Great food, great service, great venue, brilliant musicians! A great place for a very special occasion.
Lovely view over Pest. This is lovely and elevated looking down to the river and over the city. Nice views and very clean, certainly worth a visit
Magical. Beautiful setting for lots of photo opportunities ,breathtaking scenery,,,take your time to enjoy,,great for all the family ,,,easy to walk round ,,,plenty of local eateries
Amazing place beautiful. Beautiful place great tour worth visiting wish in England had more places to visit like this weather was sunny went yesterday a place to visit
lovely area and view. It's December so it was really cold and the colours are not sharp and the view is a bit blurry, however we had a lovely time and had hot drinks in a lovely cafe there...

Fisherman's Bastion. If you're in Budapest, you absolutely should pay the Bastion a visit. The views are breathtaking and the castles are really impressive. You can take the funicular up or just go by car. There's a few cute cafes, bars and restaurants up there so stay a few hours and enjoy the scenery. Very beautiful, highly recommend

Great Views of the City from here. A great view from here overlooking the city of Budapest (actually overlooking Pest From Buda!).
A magical fairytail castle top when seen up close akin to Disney.
Worth a visit here
Nice place for a cool evening !. This is a must visit if you are walking around Buda castle. It gives lovely view of the city and is really pleasant to sit here.

Wonderful views of Pest ... and a great little restaurant. Fisherman's Bastion affords amazing views of Pest, the Danube and the Parliament building.... we also found a small restaurant (just next to the main restaurant), not sure of it;s name, which not only gave you a great views while sitting behind glass panels to keep you warm on a chilly December day.... but the Goulash that we had for lunch was perfect - bags and bags of flavour !!
Lovely. Well worth a visit, spectacular architecture and amazing views over to the Pest side of the river!We walked up the hill rather than queue for the funicular and it was an easy walk.
Stunning architecture and great views. This beautiful piece of architecture is well worth a visit for stunning views of the river and city.

Fisherman's Bastion. Lovely monument. Bit like a castle or city wall. Looks out over the river and Pest. Lovely building and free to walk about and climb. Great cafe restaurant that do a good Goulash soup. A must visit place.

Great views. The views from the Fishermans Bastion are great. Lots of different viewpoints along the walk. Can get crowded of course but worth the wait to take your place at the front and take some lovely photos.

attention to detail. goodness, these people no how to look after you. sublime setting ,more than attentive staff excellent food , if you go you will remember this restaurant . On the higher price end of our restaurant prices on our visit to this city but hey you will not get this at home espically for the price
A Great View of the Danube. A walk on the top of Fisherman's Bastion give you a great view of the Danube river and the bridges of Budapest.

Great views. we took the cog railway to the top and the Fisherman's Bastian is about 500m walk through the village. Very quaint and historic with cafe's and a little market area with souvenirs. The Bastian is very impressive and the views over the Danube and Parliament building are amazing. There is no need to pay to climb up the stairs to the next level as the view is no different. We didn't have great weather conditions but on a clear day the experience must be even better. We saw the changing of the guard at the presidential Palace which was intriguing to watch. The funicular railway is very historic and the payment booth is so low that a chair to sit on to be face to face with the teller would be useful. Great visit
Great night out. Very good food in amazing surroundings. We dined on the upper floor which was very romantic with amazing views over the river.

Great Views, Unique Buildings. Located on a hill on the Buda side, offers great panoramic views of Pest and is where Matthias Church and Buda Castle is located. It's a village by itself so you will need to spend some hours here and there's food, shops and toilets available. You can cross the Chain Bridge to get here but it's an, er, uphill task: There are Hop On Buses that will bring you to mid-top, while trams and buses will lead you to the base where's there's also a cable car that comes up here. A must-visit especially on a clear day.

Beautiful. Its so lovely up here with the cleaner air, and the peace from the hustle and bustle down below! The views are spectacular, and there is a lovely cafe at the top with some of the best views out of the windows. The chapel at the very top is also worthy of a visit. Dont forget to walk around the cobbled streets and take in all the different styles of buildings and have a drink in one of the small bars. Well worthy of a visit. And free!

Great view. High on the hill on the Buda side of Budapest this site has the best views of the city. It is not something to be tackled on foot unless you are seriously athletic but assuming that you have transport it certainly rewards the effort.Apart from the Fishermens Bastion itself there are other interesting sites, plenty of cafesand restaurants, including a Hilton hotel.

Great views of pest . The place is on buda side and very nice o take a walk and get some great shots of pest side. The actual architecture and the stone is beatiful and makes for beautiful pictures too. Definitely cannot be missed

Good view of the city. Fisherman's Bastion provides a great view of Budapest (Pest side) including the parliament building and other beautiful landmarks. Walk around, take your time, experience the city and the views. It is a great place both during the day and to see the lights at night. I would not, however, spend the money to go up on the higher level. The view is not that different. The bottom level is all you need to experience fisherman's bastion.
Superb views. Looking back from the Buda side of the Danube across to the Pest sideband the Parliament building is superb from this fantastic vantage point

The most beautiful place in budapest, undoubtedly. Make sure you are planning coming here on the best weather day you have on your trip. Enjoyable walking in the beautiful buda streets leading to Matthias Church next to the bastion and to the amazing sight seen from here.

View that won't stop. Looking from Buda towards Pest from in front of the Hilton Hotel this is a wonderful photo spot. It is marvelous by day or night. There is even a small coffee shop so you can sit down and slurp while you enjoy the view. On a clear day you can almost see forever.

Amazing Views!. Fisherman's Bastion is a terrace in Gothic and Romanesque style located on the Buda bank of the Danube next to Matthias Church and close to Buda Castle. From the towers and the terrace, you will be able to capture amazing views of Parliament, St Stephens Basilica, The Chain Bridge, The Danube.... This was built between 1895 and 1902. The Bastion takes its name from the guild of fisherman that was responsible for defending this stretch of the city walls in the Middle Ages. This is QUITE beautiful!

Great views of Pest! . Definitely worth a visit - and it's free! Great views of Pest from the Bastion, and, if you wait until sunset, even better views of Pest at night when everything is lit up (Parliament in particular looks great!).
Walk up the hill . Really good place and definitely worth a walk up the hill- if not can take a lift for 1200huf per person. Nice views and even better sunset in the evening.

Great late at night!. We were staying in a hotel nearby and got dropped off here after being in Pest for a few drinks. It must have been just shy of midnight if not afterwards and there wasn't a soul kicking about. The entire place looked magical all lit up in the cold air.

Spectacular. The Fishermans Bastion stands out on the Buda side of the Danube and is well worth the trip up the hill to see.It is breath taking up there.there is so much history to take in but it's done in a very relaxed way.There is a red light shining from the bastion and they are actually heated lamps inside a bar and you can also get anything from a coffee to a fine dining experience there.

Fascinating fishermans bastion. Got here using the excellent hop on/off big red bus.Great day lovely blue sky superb views of the Danube and the sheer size of pest !!Plenty to see and explore here great way to spend a few hours.
Fairytale castle!. Such a pretty building - girls will imagine princesses living here. A must visit photo opportunity - especially in good weather. Brilliant!

Beautiful . Fishermans bastion is a beautiful place to go visit when staying in Budapest. Beautiful scenery when looking across the walk. A man with a hawk willing to let you take pictures of it and with it for a small price. But beware of the lady in the Souvenir shop shes not very polite. And if you need to you the lavatory you'll need to pay. Saying all that a beautiful place to see in Budapest.

Interesting Site and Beautiful Views!. This is the highest site in Buda, so there are magnificent views of the Danube. There is a small restaurant here and also a snack bar. One of the walls of the square is actually a wall of the Hilton Hotel. This is a "must see" site for anyone going to Budapest.

Delightful!. It is like a scene from a fairy-tail with bastions and towers - and not to forget the panoramic views over the rest of Budapest - in particular over to the Pest side. Of course the bastion is an integral art of everybody s visit to the hillside where you have the cathedral as well as the Buda Castle..
Pesta view over Danube. Very nice view over Danube to the new town of Pesta, including the Parliament panorama. A lot of Asian tourists with a lot of cameras.

Looks like a small town inside Budapest. Looking like a small town inside Budapest, you really can see the differences between inside and outside of The Bastion. Amazing view to Budapest and great architecture.There's a coffee on top that has blankets for people to cover as it can really get cold in there!

We could see our riverboat below and our hotel across the river.. Lovely statues, amazing views. We were there for peak fall leaf season and it was beautiful. Great little restaurants and shops on the streets just hind it.

Spectacular Panorama. A great place for an overview of Budapest. These elevated ramparts provide excellent views of parts of the city and the beautiful Danube below. Lots of stairs and climbing. Also plenty of photo opportunities.

Passing through Budapest. Another magnific objective for visiting in Budapest, near Matthias Church. You can visit entire area with Castel Hill in half a day with plenty of time to enjoy a cake, a cafee or the you lunch in one of many locations with style from old times.
Great Views. No visit to Budapest is complete without sampling the views from here. Really breath taking without any charges so put it on your list.

Fairytale... We got there in the morning.. it was amazing and we took so many fotos!!!
tip: take the metro to Szell Kalman ter. from there get the 16 or 16A bus. it stops right outside of this!!! don't use the funicular to go upthere. Maybe it looks fantastic but it costs a lot for this small ride..
Great view of Budapest. Beautiful impressive building on a hill were you will get a breathtaking view of Pest. Take the funicular to go up the hill.

Amazing views. Highly recommend. Not only is the architecture of the Bastion interesting, but you get amazing views over Budapest, including the parliament. Also lets you get a bit closer to St Matthias Church, which has really interesting ceramic roof tiles. There are also a couple of restaurants in the Bastion, which would make great places to stop and admire the views.

Beautiful spot!. Lovely place to stand and watch the city. Worth walking all around the area. Lots of people though and very exposed so wrap up warm and prepare to catch your moment of solitude when it comes. Don't buy the overpriced mulled wine from the street seller, there's an incredible glass pannelled into the next section of Bastion outside the Hilton that is better and cheaper.
Beautiful . This is a must when travelling to Budapest it is absolutely beautiful and the hungarian people are so nice
Best view in Budapest. Great viewpoint, free and lots to see nearby. Perfect place to get the perfect panorama of Budapest.

for a city panorama. It's a nice building itself and was it is located on a hill you'll get a nice view Pest. Buda itself is not so nice as Pest, but a visited to this place is a must. If only for the pictures with a view ;)

Surreal architecture and phenomenal views. What a treat - just bring your elbows to fight the teeming masses for a decent place to take it all in. The cathedral close by is stunning as well, there is simply no reason to skip this - just don't pay for enhanced access, you don't need it.

Nothing less than excellent. The view, the service, the restaurant, the location, the people. All 5 star service. The restaurant was recommended by the Hilton City location, and they could not have made a better recommendation. Had an opportunity to meet the chef and compliment him on the wonderful meal. It was absolutely wonderful.
Really nice place!. great view, great building.would have been even better if we were luckier with the weather... : )Highly recommand

Beautiful!. If you're in Budapest, you absolutely should pay the Bastion a visit. The views are breathtaking and the castles are really impressive. You can take the funicular up if you like, or if you have a car or a tour guide, it's faster to get up there by car. There's a few cute cafes, bars and restaurants up there so stay a few hours and enjoy the scenery. The Fisherman's bastion made me fall in love with Budapest the city. Very beautiful, highly recommend

Great View and Beutiful area of Budapest. Great view from the Fishermans Bastion. Probably one of the best in Budapest on the hill from the pest side. As mentioned almost across from parliament and most of the bridges in view. Doesn't take long to see and the Mattias church is next door. 5 Min walk from the castle. My son found the penny press machines (require 2 X 100 Florin coins and 1 X 5 Florin coin. Its a pain to get change around there so make sure you prepare. There are 3 machines in the main area.

Excellent views over the Danube.. A pleasant way to pass a morning in Budapest. From the Pest side of the Danube walk over the Chain Bridge to Buda. Take the funicular up Castle Hill to Buda Palace and then stroll along to Fisherman's Bastion. Great views.
Breathtaking. This is a beautiful place to view BudapestIt is a very popular spot to look over the city and a very popular place to see the city at nightThis is a must see attraction

Snowing in Fisherman's Bastion. Budapest has always been on my bucket list. In researching where my wife and I would visit here, Fisherman's Bastion was at the top of the list. It is on the Buda side of Budapest overlooking the Danube river. From here you can see the Chain Bridge, Parliament, and St. Stephen's Bastille. We even had fat snowflakes falling during our visit. It was chilly and romantic.
Great views of the city. Great views from here of the Danube and Pest side of the river and amazing architecture.Close to the Hilton Hotel and St Matthias Church.
Best View. the view of the city was my favorite from here, some local on the bridge selling 'handmade authentic' painting, looks printed to me but still nice pictures for the price!

Better views for free elsewhere.. Don't waste your florints for a view that is easily accessible from elsewhere on Castle Hill or even better from Gellert Hill from where you can view both Castle Hill & the parliament building.
Stunning views. A must visit while in Budapest, amazing views over the city and easy to walk to all attractions on the buda side from this location.
Simply perfect. I can't remember how many times visited this place. MUST see in Europe!! Very interesting 3D Hungarian history movie in the basements. 15 min only but you should see it

Spectacular collonaded viewpoint looking over the Duna. Part of the historic Buda Castle complex, this elaborate walkway and viewpoint on the city walls looks out over the Duna (Danube) river and across to the lower city centre of Pest. The area includes a number of historic buildings, squares and gardens which are well worth a visit. You can get there by bus or by the funicular elevator or by walking up the series of stone stairways which lead from the Riverside to the Bastion. The whole area has been beautifully restored and maintained.
Beautiful!. very beautiful!! Gorgeous views!! very colorful place. It has a little coffe house in one of the towers which is great to be in, while looking on the view.

Beautiful architecture and great views. I completely missed this on my previous visits to Budapest. A friend who used to live there recommended that I should take a look. The whole area is amazing: the fisherman's bastion, Matthias Church, castle. The views up and down the Danube and across to Pest are outstanding. If you're staying in Pest, I recommend getting a cab there ~ up the hill. Nice stroll back and chance to walk across Chain Bridge.

Awesome visit to get to know the Hungarian History.. Majestic and with great view looking down to the "Pest" side of Budapest. Best to go in the day time to see more details on the area. It will take you back in time what the Hungarians did and fought for their land.

Scenic Sights of the City. – great views of city. We were only in Budapest 2 days. Doing the Big Bus Tour we saw Fisherman’s Bastion from the bus on a clear day but the day we actually visited it was rainy so the views were not as scenic. Still recommend to visitors as a good spot to see city from above. Both the Pest and Buda sides.
Beautiful and beautiful. Beautiful especially at night.. beautiful!! Great view of the parliament and the skyline of Budapest!
Beautiful view. Nice view on Dunai river, Parlament and other. Place for rest, watch and think about life. Just should be visited this place.

Amazing views. i visited there in a cold windy day but it worth every minute and i wish the weather was warmer to be able to stay there longer..i believe it is a must do in Budapest and doesn't need a guide

Very nice. Visited in August 2013 as part of tour group. This place is very good, a must visit if you visit Budapest. It can get very crowded during summer months.The church inside is quite nice with air conditioning during our visit in hot summer.

Historic and impressive. This is a beautiful, historic structure sitting on the Buda side of the Danube with views of the Pest side of the river, to include the Hungarian Parliament Building.If you are not part of a tour group when you visit this site, be sure that you have a tour booklet that gives you all of the information about this monument.
Fantastic views of Pest. The whole including the Palace is worth the trip up to Bastion, there's a small village up there too, and a knockout cake shop. Must see venue when you are in Budapest
Spectacular Views. A must do in Budapest. Beautiful structure, amazing views, a quaint charming side of the river with nice cafes and restaurants
The best view of Pest and the Parliament. Just beside one of the most beautiful churches I've ever seen, the place provides the best views of Pest and the Parliament. Really worth seeing!

My Favourite Builidng in Europe (So Far). Probably one of the most beautifully crafted, awe inspiring buildings I have ever seen. No trip to Budapest will be complete without visiting this Disney like bastion!I would recommend starting from the main entrance and taking a stroll through the grounds, the castle is also accessible from this hill. just continue along through the castle grounds! You can also stop for a beverage at the top of one of the spires for a fantastic view of Budapest from high ground. A MUST DO.

Amazing!. The view from Fisherman's Bastion is incredible and the architectural style is very unique. It's great for a solo trek or a romantic stroll. At the top there is a cozy bar with the best view and heat lamps which I was definitely ready for after walking for a few hours. The restaurant downstairs also has a great view and delicious mulled wine.
Sightseeing. This location was included in our sightseeing tour. Overlooks the city from across the river. Really nice view. Didnt have the time to go inside the chuch.
Lovely views across the Danube. Really worth the effort of getting to for the views. Matyas Church next door is beautiful too. Busy even on a rainy day in November.
Splendid architecture, posture oerfect. An amazing display of some splendid architecture in Budapest. Gives a breathtaking view of the entire city, which can only be seen by going there.
A must see in Budapest. This is one of the must see places on your visit to Budapest. Beautiful views of Pest amid interesting, unique architecture.

A fairytale world with stunning views. We got the funicular ( cliff railway up) for 2000 forint return I think. Which in itself was pretty and a unique way to reach the top. I had read that Buda was the castle district, but it didn't resonate until I got there. It felt like I was in a separate city, a fairy-tale world. The turrets offer spectacular views of the city, and you can stop in and have a hot drink or cocktail too. A really unique setting for a drink.
