Lots of tourist shops selling Hungarian souvenirs but I didn't shop in them so can't comment. You can walk around this area for ages, so can spend as little or as much time as you wanted. We got the funicular back down and walked across the bridge to Pest.

romantic. Romantic , very nice view of the river,the town,the chain bridge and the parliament.you can also visit easily the pinacotheque which is next to it.it is located to the side of budda.you get there by the chain bridge.after visited,you can go on visiting the romantic streets of budda.

What a venue ! What service ! The most romantic place to share a meal. From arrival at the amazing outer building, the warm welcome, the amazing staff and the fabulous food to the synchronised table service and attentive sommelier, if you want to experience romance and service then look no further. We opted for the set menu of 5 courses which was fabulous, not all dishes were our preference but we wanted to try something different ! The food was cooked well and the evenings ambience was added to by the live music that was providing the backdrop to our fabulous evening. If you want to to experience the ultimate in service and romance - look no further. An experience we will both remember for ever. Thanks to the staff for making our evening so memorable.
Buda. Soo easy to get to(jump on tram 4 or 6 & then get bus 16 upto the Bastion) this was easily one of my favourite places in Budapest; the views across the river are just georgous.
Breathtaking. The architecture of this place is spectacular. You will also have some of the most stunning views of Budapest that you will find anywhere. Definitely worth the trip!

Fantastic Walk. Budapest has so much beauty in its architecture. I loved walking around Fisherman's Bastion. We did this as part of a tour we were on, so I'm not sure if it cost anything or not. Very nice walk though!

Beautiful day and night!. We arrived here late afternoon on a Friday and were pleasantly surprised at the lack of crowds. The views are spectacular over the whole Pest side of the city and the Bastion looked spectacular at night. There is also a fantastic little bar at the top of one of the towers serving mulled wine which was a great way to warm up on a chilly evening.

Amazing... Even on a wet and windy Sunday afternoon the views from Fisherman's Bastion were amazing. As you approach the Bastion it is like stepping into the set of a Disney Princess movie. We arrived in the late afternoon enjoying the daylight views. We then had a beer in the small bar beneath the Bastion. Savoring the views as day changed to night. Spotting the lights pop on. You can see the bridges, the Parliament and St. Stephen's Basilica light up, as the timers click on.As a couple I would suggest lounging on the couch at the far end of the bar. Gaze out the window at the wonder of Budapest.

My favourite part of Budapest. I took the funicular up the hill for 1200 HUF but I noticed that the steps looked easily done so I came down the hill that way. The views of Pest from the top are amazing and I recommend everyone who visits Budapest has to come to Fisherman's Bastion. I stayed there for almost 2 hours just photographing the architecture. The atmosphere was lovely and all around just a nice experience.

Beautiful view of the city. Great historic area of a historic city. You can climb the steps or be driven up to the top. Either way you are going to be awarded with a great view of the city and the Danube. Some great walking streets around the area but a great place fo have a coffee or glass of wine overlooking the city. Beautiful views day and night.
Nice area with pretty views. Day or night...great views. Interesting walking area near other major attractions. Shopping, restaurants, Mathias Church all all in the area.

Hungarian classic architecture. Nice place, good views from their of the rest of the city, specially the Parliament building. Make sure you keep yourself warm, if going there in the cooler months. Downside, a bland looking (rear side) Hilton hotel close-by. That certainly did not look cool.Looks great though at night when it is all lighted up, specially from the other side of the the Danube river.

Beautiful architecture with amazing views. The architecture at Fisherman's Bastion can only be described as stunning. The white stones matched with the fantastic views from on top are a must see for any person visiting Budapest. I didn't truly appreciate the beauty of the city until I came up here. There are lots of cafes and places to eat up here, and we enjoyed a nice mulled wine with the church as our backdrop. Beautiful.
Lots of History. Lots of history here Lord of the rings has been filmed parts of its movie here, the views are just amazing as well. Def a must see
Beautiful. Gorgeous views, nice little bar at the top that sells, quite possibly, the most amazing hot chocolate I have ever tasted! Lovely little find!

View . Beautiful views, best for photos, look for the views through the "windows" and openings, just magic! Head up to the top and take in the beauty that is Budapest. Castle district is a wealthy suburb filled with ex pats.

excellent and the views outstandingly. A must place to visit. It is beautiful, clean on a sunny day (as ours was) so charming. Well worth a visit and with the cable car and lifts no one has to struggle walking up to the top but worth walking back through the palace grounds.

Great view between arches. Arches always fascinate me which this site has one too many. Here you can have the best view of the Parliament through its arched-windows and mingle with other tourists at the square of the Matthias Church.
day out. really enjoyed visiting this with friends. a cold day but well worth a visit. extremely popular and very pleasant area
Gorgeous view. Wonderful view of the city, lovely place well worth the visit. Great place to get some good pics. Wouldn't recommend eating up there, over priced and not that good.
Amazing views. Walked around the church and up the hill and saw amazing views of Pest. Also walked by the two oldest buildings.
Most Beautiful Place in Budapest. This is the highlight of the castle district. Looks more beautiful in the night, however daylight offers a different view.
A must for a Budapest visit. The architecture of this place is very beautiful. From this place, you could also get a lovely view of Pest, Danube river, and the Parliament.
A Great viewpoint.. Don't pay the extra charge to go up to the next level, it's not worth it, in my opinion. You can still take great pictures looking across the river framed by the white arches.
Lovely view of the city. Up here you have a lovely view over the river and the city. Worth going up just for the view. The building itself is also quite impressive.
Views forever. On top of Castle Hill overlooking Pest just outside of Mathias Church you can see the beautiful Danube and all of town - can be a bit crowded but well worth the time to see the view
Great place for pictures and a great view... beautiful!. beaultiful place to visit when in Buda... not possible to miss it! The architecture is amazing ad the view superb!!!
Best picture spot in town. This beautiful structure on the castle hill offers commanding views of the city and the river. Definitely come up here for your photos.

A good birds eye view of Budapest. Go there if the weather is walk friendly, since you have to walk the whole area to cover it. Gives you the perfect bird eye view of the entire city once up there, makes for a lovely photo opportunity. Has some cute cafes and shops around.

Quick photo opportunity. This is an excellent vantage point to take photographs of Pest from the Buda side of the Danube. It has toilets, shops and Matthias church next to it. The number 16 bus will take you there from Pest.
Even on a rainy day it was great!. It rained pretty heavily on our last day in Budapest, but I'm still glad we went to see this. Some of the best views in Budapest and a visually amazing place.

Wear comfortable walking/hiking shoes/boots. It is a long walk up to this attraction, so be sure and dress for the activity! You will catch fantastic views here and there and especially once you reach the Fisherman's Bastion and look out at the Danube from the interior of the castle-like structure. (I was able to get a great shot of the truly beautiful Parliament Building!) We were finally able to hear some traditional local music from within the structure and my friend purchased one of their CD's. Be warned that this place gets very crowded! Be sure and catch the interior of the Mattyas Templom when you are there (There is a small entrance fee, but we found it worth it.) Franz Josef I and Sissi were coronated King and Queen of Hungary there! We were here in 2009.We were here in 2009.

Impressive structures, great views of the Danube. While in Budapest we were able to visit this place and were enthralled with the structures and views of the Danube, great photo opportunities.There's a great view across the Danube of the Parliament Building.

nice view of the city, although not for free. It is a shame that it is not free as it was a decade ago, as there are many places with city view apart from Halaszbastya, so not worth visiting in my opinion.

Fantastic views from Fisherman's Bastion from Buda to Pest. The views from Fisherman's Bastion are breathtaking from Buda over the Danube to Pest. Most of the landmarks are visible from here and its right next to Mathias Church

Nice. We walk and finally we sew infront of ua the matthias church and some meters away the fisherman tower.we go nearest and there was a ticket point 1400ft the entrance to the church and i am not sure around the same for fisherman.we decide not to go as some reviews have a note that in the afternoon are open without ticket fee.we go near and we see that one person pass without ticket in the morning time and many people the same so we enter and not ticket.i do not know why it was a celebrearion and they do not work.we go up and rhwre was 7 small tower with very nice view to take photos.in the last tower was a small cofeeshop that there was not toilletes there so we need to walk some minutes on the left of the ticket office to the public toillets that we should pay 0.70cents you can pay euro or ft in order to use.was clean the toiletes.and the view was noce from there

Amazing view. The sky was a bit cloudy but the view was amazing to the other side of the Danube River and we had a pleasant walk around. It is not crowded when you go early in the morning to avoid the big tourists groups.
Lovely place. Really nice to walk around with stunning views. Lots of people and tourists milling around. Amazing sunset from behind when looking across towards pest.
who stole the fish. thought it would be a lot more exciting,,,slightly let down.the trip was on the way to the castle, so we saw it at night and in the day,
Great. Take Your time For a good walk all around the wall. It's a special Place for a good view of the city.
Dont missed at sunset. Nice view over Budapest.Best time around sunset.Just view minutes to walk up.Dont missed and its a nice place

Great views. 22nd October 2015. Some of this area feels more Alpine than anything else! Views are wonderful looking down on Pest, and you realise how flat it is down there. Parliament Buildings look stunning, as does the majestic Danube. Well worth a visit. Shops and cafes are very expensive however! I think you have to pay to walk along the top wall, but you can see everything below in any event.

Night walk. We visited at night and watched the bats flying around. It was a magical experience. The architecture is marvellous especially coupled with the church and gives the area an almost unreal feeling.
Scenic. A must when in budapest. You can either take the train or bus. Lot of photo opportunities. Great view point.

Amazing panoramic view. Well worth a visit,as you get an astonishing view of the Pest side,including the Parliament and the Opera. Can be a bit crowded,but not too serious. The bastion offerse exciting architechture,with unique skapes,towers and walking paths. A must when visiting Budapest.

"BREATHTAKING'. This area in Budapest is simple outstanding and a must see while visiting Budapest. The views are amazing, the architecture is unbelievable. Heavily damaged in the war the area was rebuilt it is know as a viewing area looking over the Danube & over to the Pest side of the river. This is one of the most visited places in Budapest & I highly recommend visiting the area. Also, make sure you have your camera for photo's & also to go into the Matthias Church, its beautiful.

Great view of Pest from here. The best part of this sight is the amazing view of Pest from this location. There is a cafe that offers a great view with less crowd and the price is very reasonable for the location.
Best view of Pest you will ever get!. Built on the top of a hill this complex offers a view of the Danube River and the Parliament Building is stunning. On a clear day you can see forever!
Overrated. I think it is a bit overrated but good views from this point. go at night to see budapest lighted, it is really nice
Great. The Fisherman's Bastion is a really important place to see when you are in Budapest. Close to it is the Matthias Church, which is also really beautiful. The view is stunning.

Great Views of Pest!. Worth the visit for the views of the Pest side alone. It was very crowded the day we went, but with a little patience, you can make your way to the edge and get awesome views and pictures. I'd love to visit at night!
Lovely views. This was one of the stops on the hop on hop off tour and would definitely recommend checking out for the lovely views.

Excelllent and fun afternooon. Great for a quick walk around ....entertainment there plus viewing a very whimsical building. Shopping nearby on the way there at a touristy corner was some of the best in Budapest for that sort of thing. Go by public buses, taxi, etc. is easy.

Nice view of the city . You can get there easily by bus nr 16, getting there like many years ago - by old Ikarus bus.
You have a fantastic view of the city.
Unfortunately always too crowded.

Best Photographic Spot !!. There is a 10-15 min hike to the castle hill, from where you can walk to the cathedral. The whole area is great viewing spot and the parliament looks amazing from the hill.
You can also take a funicular, which charges around 1000HUF

Great views at night. This is a great location to see all of Pest and the Danube lit up at night. Don't miss a chance to make the climb to Buda, see the statues, Churches, and castles, and the beautiful marble of Fisherman's Bastion by night.

Lovely Vantage Point of city. The Fisherman's Bastion is worth visiting after some climbing. It is certainly a great photo opportunity with panoramic view of the city below. The church is next door, and there is a lot to see on Castle Hill, so it is misleading to say that you only need to spend 15 minutes at this attraction. It is a whole day to see all on Castle Hill, but well worth the visit. There is food available within walking distance from this attraction, but none exactly at this location.

Spectacular views of the Danube and Pest. After checking into the Budapest Marriott on an unusually warm and sunny November Sunday afternoon, my wife and I walked over the Chain Bridge and up the hill to Fisherman's Bastion. At about 3pm that afternoon the sun shone down from behind onto the Pest side of the river, offering stunning views of Parliament and the Danube. But the view is by no means the only attraction - right next door we met friends and enjoyed drinks at Halászbástya Étterem as the sun went down. Even in this major tourist spot the prices were very reasonable and allowed for uninterrupted views of the city at dusk. Budapest in general is magical and Fisherman's Bastion is a must visit spot while in town.

Great views from Buda on Pest And river. Get over to the Buda Side of the river. Take the funiculaire up the Hill (not included in public transportation card). Walk over to bastion on a sunny day And have the best views

Busy, but worth the stroll. Great views of Pest and the roof tiles of Matias Church. A couple folks were selling paintings and souvenirs. There was a steady stream of tourists walking through when I was there around noon. Next time I might try to go later in the day.
Beautiful. So much beauty and history this is a fabulous place to visit get bus no 16 very small bus but quick journey
Great view of the city. It's worth the climbing, you get a nice view of the city, and there is small marzipan museum at top.

Oh just take me back!. This has an innnncredible view of the town! Oh it is just incredible! Tip - go at night also not just during the day. Far less tourists and excellent to look down on the chain bridge and Parliament House which is all lit up! right in front of Matthias Church which is also gorgeous from the outside- didn't go in! If you go on a free walking tour and they end here and you can ask for advice to go somewhere to eat. We went to this local canteen sort of place where they sell local cuisine it was great! And cheap!
A must. Another stunning building in Budapest and a must see as part of visiting the Castle District. The views present great photo opportunities.

It's like Hogwarts. If you thought that you will never see a real-life castle in your life, then this place is for you! Haha, kidding :) It looks very much like a castle, but it's actually a bastion .. albeit the fact that it doesn't look very much like a bastion because of a not-so-fortress-like structure. A good photo opportunity here!

The place to visit when in Budapest. You cannot come to Budapest and not visit this place. Specialy the view on the parliament is spectacular. There is no entry fee to the majority of the building. The places which do require a entrance fee do not really add anything special.Come in daytime or in the evening to see the city illuminated.You can take a bus up to the Fisherman's Bastion or just walk.I found walking to be more exciting and it was perfect for taking pictures.

Fairytale towers overlook the Danube below. Lovely place to wander. In one of the towers is a small cafe/bar and if you are lucky you can grab a table outside overlooking the river to Pest and just soak up the view.

Beautiful and historic. I've been there several times over the years, every time it has been improved and every time I find myself reflecting on the countless people who have had a part in the history over the hundreds of years.It was dusk on one of the occasions I was there, a mist hung below the walls and glowed in the lights. It was very beautiful and my friends felt like it was just a beautiful place to visit but is was also was a special occasion to be there as the mist rose and covered the battlements.
Beautiful. Went here as oart if the Free walking tour. It is free during the low season months. Great views of the Danube.

Gorgeous, Panoramic Views. Completed in 1902 in celebration of the 1,000th birthday of the Hungarian state, the Fisherman’s Bastion is one of the most visited sites in Budapest. With lookout towers, arched windows, and wide, sweeping staircases, the bastion was built to deliver a panoramic view of the Danube River and Pest side of the city. And deliver, it does!
Budapest at it's best. Don't miss the view from the Fisherman's Bastion. Great architecture to enjoy also. Take at you time here, you will enjoy it.
Beautiful views. Beautiful view of the Pest side from here. Took the tram up here and walked back down. Highly recommend coming here during dusk. Gorgeous!

Fairytale Castle. This building is stunning. It is a true fairytale Castle. You are able to enter the grounds and walk around. I would strongly recommend visiting in the evening, it is so enchanting with all the lights.

Breathtaking. The views were amazing! The history and architecture is just unbelievable! This is a must see! We went 2 different times. Once during the afternoon and then again later in the evening. The lights are incredible

Stunning buildings magical. The one place you have to go in Budapest - beautiful buildings and stunning views . Matthias church looked beautiful but didn't have time to go there. Give yourself at least 2 hours

Great for a romantic walk. The castle area and the bastion area is awesome by itself, unfortunately entry on the main bastion is not free, i am a little bit uncertain whether the price is worth it or not since other parts of the same building is accessible anyway. The view over the city is awesome from here and great for a romantic walk with all the cafés around, but I'd recommend it also for lovers of history and local culture.

Special Dinner. . no problem.. Party of 4 enjoyed a special anniversary meal in the 2d floor turret room with night view of Danube and Parliament building. Staff was absolutely perfect in greeting, seating, menu offerings, table service, and helpfulness. Our wait staff of 2 made the meal even more than memorable. A super picturesque table sitting for 4, view of Danube at night & Parliament building, and a step out small balcony. . . what more could you ask for. Strolling musicians? You got it. The Chef prepared 4 excellent meals of pork and beef dishes, extra delicious dessert and coffee/tea. Great wine list and staff that knows how to serve. Make a reservation for this great restaurant if you can, try the Turret tower seating especially. It is fine dining on the Hill after 6 pm.

Just picturesque!. Very nice views over the city, nice construction and a great place for taking pictures. I also like that you can just sit there and relax while watching the city. Despite the tourists there are some "corners" of quiet. And despite that fact that it's on the hill, it's very ease to get there, and even without the funicular (which is in fact available as well).

Not to be missed. Fairytale buildings with great views of the city. Lots of little shops and a small market where you can top up on souvenirs. Nice architecture and pretty tiles on the roofs of most of the surrounding area. Also a good cafe.. Food was tasty! You just can't stop taking photos!

The Best Pest View. Outstanding views across the Danube river. You overlook Parliament, Chain Bridge and downtown (Pest) side. The Byzantine arches and turrets are beautiful. You can wait in line and take the funicular up for a fee. We chose to walk on a combination of stairs and paths. It only takes 10 to 15 minutes and offers many stops for taking photos across the river. I recommend you visit during the day and at night for spectacular pictures of the city.

Amazing and Beautiful. I was shocked to find out that this place is called "Fisherman's Bastion". It looked more like a castle from one of those Disney cartoons. White washed majestic building. You need to walk uphill to reach this place. However, the walk is totally worth it. The structure is beautiful and the view overlooking the Danube is mesmerizing. Matthias Church is in this area. You can take bus no. 16 from Castle Hill to the Fisherman's Bastion.
Incredible views. A beautiful piece of architecture with incredible views of the city. It's not a far walk from central, and pairs well with seeing the church. Romantic place at sunset!
Good views over the city. Great attraction to visit with excellent views of Parliament over the river danube. Lots of cafes in the vicinity.

Another fairy tale photo opportunity. The history of the Fisherman's Bastion is only surpased by the fairy tale beauty of the structures with Byzantine arches and turrets with beautiful views in the background of Pest across the River Danube.
Stunning views..... This is a beautiful area reached by the funicular that has wonderful views over the city and the Danube River.
A must. When visiting Budapest you shold take time out to have a walk around this area of the city, you will not be in any way disappointed.

Beautiful Architecture and Fabulous Views. This is one of the most beautiful spots on the Buda side of Budapest. You overlook the Chain Bridge, the Danube, The Parliament and all of downtown Pest. It is particularly spectacular at night. It is free for wandering and picture taking, though there is a fee for going on the second level. The architecture if quite beautiful and ornate.
Wonderful!. Really worth the visit. Stunning views and grounds. Chitty the hawk is great! Wonderful photo opportunities. Great!!

Gorgeous. Beautiful in, out and all around! My only regret is that I didn't have enough time to grab a drink in the cute little bar located at the top. Nearing sunset, the view was that much more spectacular. You could see the whole city from up there!
Brillian architecture. A must visit place. outstanding architecture and a beautiful building. Visited on a Saturday and it was very busy.

Beautiful views. Fisherman's Bastion is a beautiful location for great views. It is right near Matthias Church and you can get there from Chain Bridge. It's a great walk and the whole area is very quaint.

Have a drink and enjoy the vew of Pest. After visiting the castle and the other wonderful historical sites, you should realy visit this beautiful spot and have a spectacular view of River Danube and the parliament while enjoying a nice hot cup of tea or coffee.
Beautiful views. Beautiful views over the city from a lovely location great for exploring on foot. Nice cafes nearby. Worth a visit

Excellent spot for views and backdrop for photos. My first visit to Budapest was in June 2015. I was on a tour with limited time to explore on my own. The guide took us into Matthias Church and pointed out the Fishermen Bastion. It was very crowded and I barely was able to take a photo from afar before we had to walk off to follow the guide. In October 2015 I again went to Budapest but this time our tour ended at Matthias Church which is next to the Fisherman Bastion. The day was sunny and to my delight there were hardly any visitors. My friends and I went to all the towers, lookouts, spots on the Bastion. The view overlooking the Pest side are wonderful. There were two brides having there photos taken at the stairways. To get there you can take the Hop on off Bus , Red line and get off on stop 13. From the base of Castle hill the Fishermen Bastion is accessible through some impressive stairs . Too many steps for me. The view from the base is amazing. It looks like the steps up to a magic castle. I am so happy I took the time to fully enjoy it on my second visit.
Great viewpoint.. This is a beautiful spot to get great photos of Budapest from above. We were fortunate to go after season when the fishermen's market is closed and the view is free.

Fisherman's Bastion. A equestrian statue of Saint King Strephen I who founded the Magyar Kingdom is a prominent landmark next to Fisherman's Bastion.It gets its name from the guild of fishermen who were responsible for defending this stretch of the land from invaders during the Middle ages."Fisherman's Bastion" was built between 1895 and 1902 and is a terrace which occupies a portion of the extreme boundary walls of Buda castle.It has seven spires which represents the seven chieftains of the Magyars who conquered this land that became Hungary.There was a luxury cafe along the castle wall of Fisherman's Bastion which offered its patrons a breathtaking view of the Danube, Margaret Island , Gellert hill and Pest to the East while musicians entertained them..

Fisherman's resturant amazing. Went from my birthday service first class waiters could not do enough for you the waiters sang happy birthday and had great voices. Food was fantastic and even though it was a more expensive restaurant it was worth every penny .The decor was beautiful and the views where amazing will definitely go back on my next visit.
Interesting structure. Great top-of-the-hill structure where you can also enjoy an expansive view of Budapest. Good place for memorable pictures of your trip.
Nice view. Fun place to explore. Amazing views of Pest. Well worth the hike up to the top of the Hill. I took some of my best photos from there.
Great view of the city . Walking up the hill to the castle district to the fisherman's bastion is definitely worth it for the view alone. A great place to watch the sunset over the Danube.

Fairytale views in Buda!. Right next to Buda Castle is Fisherman's Bastion, with beautiful views overlooking the Danube river and Pest. I went just before sunset - it's so photogenic! I'll be posting some of my favorite photos of it from Visit50.com.Tip1 - you can easily go to Buda Castle and Fisherman's Bastion in the same trip - it's the same bus stop, as they're right next to each other. I planned to visit these two and Matthias Church together (Gellert hill is a bit further)Tip 2- view it from the main level, but also check it out from one level below
Breathtaking views.. Beautiful part of the city. Only problem was the people trying to sell you things. They do not understand NO. I would still go back there. It is so beautiful.

Mesmerizing view of Pest. Located just outside Matthias Church, the Fisherman's Bastion serves as the best place to see an aerial view of Pest. The lower tower is free of charge, but if you wish to go up the upper balcony an entrance fee of HUF 700 applies. From here you will get an unobstructed view of Pest. It is a lot quieter up here than at the lower towers, allowing you more time for better photo opportunities. There's also another lookout point which is free of charge at the left side if you are coming from Matthias Church, where you will get an equally unobstructed view.

Felt like i was in skyrim!. I think the most beautiful sightseeing in Budapest.. The architecture is exceptional, you feel like you are in a different medieval - mythical age. Located in the top of Buda hill next to the castle. Don't miss it
10+. Amazing! Super romantic and the view is stunning! Perfect place to have a great overview of Budapest and perfect to walk around and just have a nice a quiet evening. Easy to get there by bus.

Magnificent!. Bit of walking involved - very worth the effort. The church is an architectural marvel! First time I have ever seen a scale model of the building (located in the courtyard) with accompanying Braile for those who are visually challenged.

Very Nice Place.. This site is located on a hillside in Buda, where you can see the Danube River and the other part of the city called Pest. You have to know the town consists of two districts divided by the Danube River, two districts, one being Buda and the other Pest both linked by bridges and form the city of Budapest. The Fisherman's Bastion is a very beautiful site and must see.

Fisherman,s bastion. Need to go early in the morning for fantastic sunrise view towards Gillert hill and then in the evening to experience the sun's glow on the white stone on the towers. During the day it is a very busy area and often the tower nearest Margaret's Island will be with restricted entry;there is a small cafe there to serving mulled vine when we went in October. Go down the steps and look back up to get some idea of the size and also different photo views. We have been twice now and still find a work around this area delightful
A must see in Budapest. Absolutely breathtaking. If you are in Budapest you must visit this place. Magnificent and such a fabulous view of the city. Would not recommend enough..

One of Budapest's Best. The Fisherman' bastion is one of the many sites you should visit and take the time to explore. The architecture is beautiful and when standing on the many ramparts you are afforded some wonderful views of the Danube and the Pest side of the city.

Probably the most beautiful spot in Budapest. I have been living in Budapest and the Bastion is the best place to have an overview of the city, get your photo taken with the nice background etc. And it is free. :-)

Beautiful. One of the bests views of the Parliament and Pest side of the city. If the sky is clear you can see absolutely everything. Great for a walk or a photo session. St. Mathias Church is just next to it.

Photo Ops of Pest. Fun to clamber up on the Fisherman's Bastion, if you are in the area. Great place to take photos of Pest, across the Danube. If in Buda, definitely take a walk over to Fisherman's Bastion - but I wouldn't make a special trip to see only this.

Really splendid. . Went in for lunch on spec while walking round Buda. Food was terrific - innovative, well presented and very tasty. Staff were attentive and knowledgeable without being in any way pushy. Since we speak no Hungarian the fact that they spoke excellent English was a huge help. The views from the restaurant are spectacular and, all in all, this couldn't have been a better experience. Particularly pleased to find a dedicated and extensive vegetarian menu among all the other omnivorous delights.
Amazing at night!. All the light up there in night are amazing. You will make your best pictures from Budapest from up there.

It's magic. I fall in love with this place! It's very beautiful both at night and in the morning. You will never regret if you spend few hours here. I was very happy that I had a chance to be here, to see all this beauty and feel myself like a princess! Must see❤️
Great views. We were here on a Monday with great views along the Danube.Weekends would be a little crowded and you may have to wait to get a good view.

Great to take the photos of and from. kids loved to run around. Lovely view of Budapest, kids loved to run around, I loved take their photos whilst doing it. USSR the panorama feature to take the great surroundings in one bog picture. No matter which direction you look in, beauty on every side

Gorgeous, gorgeous, gorgeous!. I think this may have the best view in Budapest. If you go up to Castle Hill, it is an easy walk to Matthias Cathedral and the Bastion. Great views, great place to people watch (there were 3 brides having pictures made on the steps when we were there) and everything is very accessible via public transportation.

Brilliant views!!!!. One of the highlights of our trip to beautiful budapest!! There is lovely cafe (warmly heated in the colder months) which you can order happy hour cocktails and watch the sun go down over the city - fabulous!!!!!!!
SEE CASTLE HILL REVIEW. See all info and photos about this magical place under my review about the Castle Hil ( Varnegyed ) area with some other must see sights.
Fairytale. Liking the place to Disney Land is not all that wrong, but, not to forget, this place came before Disney Land was created!!!!!

Part of the tour.. The views are impressive and it's free. But it's better from a distance with the lights.
The cafe inside is good but expensive by Budapest standard.
superb view terrace. seven white tent like bastions from 1895, don't miss it, climb up on the left part of the bastion for free
A fantastic area to take brilliant photos of Budapest. A must whilst in Buda. Next to St Matthias Church. Views across the Danube and Pest are breathtaking. Hasa little bar and a restaurant.

Must see... Beautiful views...one can walk around & check out the beautiful cathedral,have a look at marzipan museum/shop(for those who are fond of sweets/choclates) its the speciality here, historical streets & buildings etc...
architecture. I fell in love with this place. We spent one hour there. Great neighborhood. You find great hotels and restaurants .very calm and charming.

plenty of viewing spots on top of Buda Castle Hill without paying to walk up a flight of steps. I was in Budapest in 2009 and walked the Castle Hill. I don't recall having to pay to climb the steps of the Fisherman Bastion but now they are charging. lots of places on the hill for free to view the Danube and Pest.
the best view of the city. Must visit place - consists of museums and the oldest part of the town. Allow 1-2 hours to cover the whole castle area.

Beautiful view of the Pest. Located literaly next to the St. Matthias Church is this area where you can overlook the Buda side, and have a great view of the Pest side.There's no fee to get in, but there can be a wait, as the top portion of the walkway is a bit narrow. Plenty of people taking videos and photos, as well as street vendors trying to sell a song or a shawl.

One of the most beautiful views in the world!!!!!!. Took the funicular up the hill to the Castle district. SOOOO HAPPY we did! So beautiful and peaceful and the views were spectacular. We walked around for about an hour and then suddenly the rest of the world figured out this was a good place to be so we concluded our little tour! :) If you don't like crowds get up there before 9:00 AM.
Beautiful view to Budapest. Beautiful building. From here is beautiful view to the city part Pest, the Danube river and parliament. Must to see.
lovely view. A very nice place to enjoy the city view. I truly recommend to walk it through from the river u to the Bastion

Good place for a nice view of Budapest. . Worth a visit for a really great view of Budapest and it's free! Not too busy either. We walked up the hill, quite a lot of steps. There is a funicular too though.
Beautiful . After visit the castle, u can walk to the fisherman's bastion and mattias church. The fishermam's bastion is in light grey which is contracting the colorful roof of mattias church

Don't miss. This is one of the spots you need to do. Always consider the time of day - where the sun will be for any outdoor site you will want to take pictures. You will want to time it to have the sun behind you. When facing the bastion from the square (looking toward Pest) there is a small cafe in the top tower. Great place for a coffee or drink and they have a balcony great for pictures.

Lovely!. We had gone up to see the castle and came upon this lovely site. Quite magical. I recommend taking the funicular at least one way. StunnIng views and a charming little town area. There was a hurdy gurdy player and roasted chestnuts for sale. Charming.
a must see!. this was a great area for photos to be taken of the whole city. it was a fun walk and very pretty for lots of shelfies! lol

One of the top attractions in Budapest.. Located in Buda side. Went to this place as a part of my tour. This place offers great views of the entire city both sides Buda and Pest. A must go for everybody can be planned as a part of city tour.

Fabulous views of the Danube.. This place was very busy and there was a slight queue at the admission centre for the nearby St. Matthias Church. The Bastion itself is quite narrow but the views are quite spectacular - you have to keep moving. The architecture is very interesting but watch out for the guided tours from well known holiday companies as they cause congestion!"

GREAT VIEW. Rebuilt in a touristy style but an attractive area around the Matthias Church on the Castle hill of Buda. Views from this hilltop location are limited because of restrictions because of commercial enterprises located in the bastion and its ramparts.
Great view.. Great views of Pest, especially at sunset and early evening. Perfect spot for pictures. Nice way to end a day in the Castle District and steps back down into Buda easily walkable.

An amazing Dinner with wonderful views of the city.. We had dinner here last week as a group of 12 adults. The food and service was superb. This is really fairytale setting. The views from the restaurant are stunning.

Nice viewing point. A great place to see the city of Budapest from! Quint and interestlingly built, the terraces and small towera offer prime views of the entire city! Great vantge point it its your first time here!

Great views of the Danube. Walking along the ramparts and looking at the Danube is a great way to spend some time. It is all well preserved and clean and very high with good views. Well worth a visit.
Beautiful . What a great place! For us the best place for sightseeing! Beautiful architecture, great spot to make pictures from Budapest!

Wonderful vew of Budapest1. In beautiful sunny day it is a great view of Budapest! Great peace of architecture, mixture of neo gottic & Hungarian influence. There is enjoyable view of Budapest & Blue Danube from fisherman Bastion. There are a lot small cafe & places where you can buy souvenirs for your friends & family.

You can't miss it!!. It's a well preserved area with awesome view on "Pest". From the Bastions you may enjoy a really nice view of the Parliament. I'd suggest to be here again in the evening. With the lights the landscape is even more attractive.
Enjoy on a Sunny Day!. The last day of our stay in Budapest was thankfully sunny and we could enjoy spending it in the Castle District. We enjoyed the views across the Danube from the Bastion.

Really fascinating building. Suprisingly very young construction, I thought it would be much older, certainly looks old. The history of its construction is fascinating and a good guide is a good idea, we had one and she was brilliant as she told us all the folk lore associated with this site. The structure is amazing and a mix or neo gothic and Austrian-Hungarian influences such as the raven.... at night it beautifully illuminated . Also has bats which do brilliant flying displays at dusk.

Best viewpoint. History floods through here, staggering viewpoints along the walls and towers. Just don't rush your walk, enjoy the views and look at how it was all constructed. Amazing piece of Budapest

View of the city is great from here. Must go location if you want to try your SLR camera's. Do take the 3D movie as well.
I visited during the day, and it was good. Should try to see the budapest in lights as well from here.

Must visit in Budapest. Certainly one of the best views in the city. A panoramic view of the Danube and the parliament building along with the rest of Pest. A bus takes you right into the center of the castle area and it's a brief walk from there.
Understandably this area gets quite busy!

Great views in historic Buda. Take a walk north from the Castle in Buda to the Fisherman's Bastion. It affords lovely views across the Danube towards Pest and the Parliament building. It's romantic to wall along the walls from tower to tower on a monument built to recognise the service of the fishermen who defended the city. Its free and worth the walk for the views.
Top quality views. I would highly recommend seeing the view of Budapest from Fisherman's Bastion. It's free, great vistas over the Danube and plenty of room (even though there were lots of tourists).
Fisherman's Bastion. Situated on the foothills of Buda castle. A peaceful place to sitdown and enjoy the Danube. Nice gardens and fountains add value to this place

Beautiful panoramic view. Breath taking view of the Danube river and after having a walk around the palace and castle grounds.Great place for photography. Good proximity to the Mathias church also very beautiful place to catch.
Fishermans Bastion, Budapest. Superb location in Buda. It overlooks the Danube and has a spectacular view of the Hungarian Parliament building as well as being very near the Matthias church.
Be sure to visit !. Don't leave without visiting this spectacular landmark. Awesome views ! Lovely walks. A great place to take some stunning photos !

A fairy. The castle district is like walking in living history. From the great palace, through the offices of the president, to the beautiful coloured church and... The Fishermans Bastion.A great walk. A great stay
Great place to take pictures. Wonderful view, especially at night. Had a wonderful time with friends; a very busy spot - a must see while being in the Buda

Lovely but wear trainers. This place is amazing to see and the views are spectacular, however if you visit the church be aware that the way down from the tower is very steep and there is no hand rail so not for anyone who suffers from positional vertigo.

Romantic. The castle district is one of the most wonderful places to hang around in Budapest.The fisherman's bastion is a very nice and romantic place to take a rest,enjoy coffee or wine along with beautiful view of Danube and violin music

Great views and architecture. Part of the Castle Hill sightseeing walk, the Fisherman's Bastion was a great spot to rest, soak up the views and take in the Parliament across the river in all its glory. The Bastion itself is beautiful and I can't say I've seen anything like it anywhere else. Definitely worth making it a stop on your walk around Castle Hill.

Nice view. We were lucky to visit the place in a "free entrance" day, yet unlucky to have rain.
You feel like that you are living in fairy tale due to its interesting architecture. Must see.
Beautiful architecture. Beautiful place which offers a wonderful view of Budapest. Can't say more about it as I didn't get inside unfortunately but just the sightseeing worth to climb there!
Lovely at night!. Except for rain our visit to view the city from here was really with it! There was a little concert taking place in one of the covered areas, so it was quite a lovely experience.

Nice view, nothing special. Nice view of Budapest, but you get those from all over the castle area. It does look nice (towers and all). We spent 10 minuts there. Mostly people just stand there and take endless photos.
You'll be hooked !!. This is a wonderful clean stoned structure not I believe got any great age or history but impressive all the same well worth a look.

Nice views but a lot closed off. Very crowded and lost of people who have to get their 'selfies" done.Great view of the city and old. Horror is looking at the other side where the Hilton Hotel is.. really what were they thinking. Place is open and lit 24/7.. go late at night to avoid the annoying selfie narcissists.
enjoy a mulled wine at the best vista in town. Great place to enjoy a mulled wine with the best vista in town. You won't have a better view anywhere,
Excellent location. Located atop Castle Hill, the Fisherman's Bastion provides stunning views of Budapest and the river. Small entrance fee.

Beautiful church with incredible views. The church is just breathtaking. The coloured tiles on the roof are so vivid and the view from the "battlements" must be some of the best of Budapest. The streets all around are gorgeous too, they look as though they are unchanged for generations.

Stunning at sunset. Stunning at sunset, or indeed at any other time. This has to be one of the most beautiful places in Budapest to take panoramic river photos. Set on Castle Hill, next to the Matthias church and close to the Bus 16 stop, it is easy to reach. Don't miss it on a visit to Castle Hill.
Views. Superb views of Pest from here. Can be crowded, but on a fine day enjoy the afternoon or evening. Get a photo of yourself with the view
Interesting.. just barely... Nice to look at. Makes for great picture taking on a brilliant day. That's about it. Maximum 20 minutes for that obligatory picture.

Incredible views. Gorgeous architecture, very clean and friendly and wonderful scenery. It is also right next to a stunning Catholic Church. Not much of a god man myself, but the inside of the Church is unbelievable. Well worth £3 to go in.
Beautiful view when it is dark. Fantastic view, very romantic and it shows many fantastic sites all lit up. I do recommend to go here by evening.

You must visit-great views of Budapest.. We walked all over Budapest and this was the first place we visited.There is a bit of a hill to get to it but the views on a clear day are stunning. Also once at the top it has such a different feel, with a very clean plaza and old buildings.From here it is an easy walk to the museum and down the hill.

Enchanting place. Started on this side of Budapest for a group tour. Couldnt ask for more. Beautiful place, panoramic view. Lines not too bad and we were lucky with perfect weather in this early October day.

Great views, but rather despite of this construction. This is a mock-Gothic construction that fills a gap in the old town wall of Buda. This, without doubt, is the place to go to enjoy a magnificent view of the Danube and Pest.It was constructed at the turn of the 19th century as a decorative environment of the historic Matthias Church that was reconstructed under the direction of the same architect. The towers of the bastion represent the tents of the 7 Magyar tribes. The largest of them represent the tent of the leader Árpád. Supposedly, there was a bastion at the site for which the fishermen's guild bore the responsibility of maintaining and defending it.The views from this sight are magnificent and I would recommend anyone to go there, especially after dark, and enjoy the view. The site, probably, has the best view of yet another mock Gothic construction, the Hungarian parliament. It is, however, not this monstrosity but the site that makes the view. A simple parapet without the silly frames would have allowed a clearer view.As a sight on its own, I think it is a mockery of a historic town wall and nothing but a monument to an architect. I was in Buda for just an evening. Since my hotel was only 100 metres from the site, I visited it. At that time it, already, had gone dark. The flood lights gave it a certain charm. There were only few people around at that time.A section of the wall that you can walk on is blocked by turnstiles. These turnstiles suggesting that you need a ticket to pass were open, so you could get up on the wall for free.

Interesting story with great scenery. Hope for a clear day and you'll get wonderful shots of the Pest side of the river. Walking the wall with its nooks and crannies is great family entertainment, as well.
Great. Amazing view towards the pest side. A must visit If you are in Budapest. Some stairs to walk up though.
Loved it!!. Beautiful scenery and views. We took so many pictures!! Be prepared to walk around so will need sensible shoes. The lights make it look gorgeous at night.
Wonderful views. The views from Fishermans' Bastion are fantastic! We went as part of a land tour, so I don't know how much the tickets are individually.

Splendid View of city. There is a entry charge but when we went it was free and it has a splendid view of the city. Should go walking from the pest side and on return take the bus back. Must visit in the evening time
Great view. We did not visit the inside, only outside. It is a magnificent building and the view over the river and over to Pest is really magnificent.

Good views even on a rainy day. We got the bus up here as the funicular was not working. It was a very wet afternoon but we still took some good photos from the Buda side looking towards Pest.
We did not pay any entry fees and the viewing was free.

Enjoy this nice place and the great view. Just walk around and enjoy this beautiful place. You have a great view over the Danube and the Parlement building. In the evening with all the lights the place is fairylike

Beautiful views. We spent the day on castle hill and visited the fisherman's bastion as part of the day. The views were lovely from here, there was a cafe at the top that sold mulled wine as the weather was a bit chilly but wouldn't recommend it as it was quite expensive by budapest's standards. Whilst in the area we visited a lovely bakery and had some delicious, locally made strudels.

What a view. The greatest part of the Bastion is its incredible views of the city. We spent about 30 minutes walking the area and enjoying the views. Its a no-brainer to visit while in Budapest. We did not spend money on any of the tour areas and we don't feel as though we missed anything.
Good View. There is not much to do but go up the stairs and take pictures. It was a lovely view and had a circular expanse.
Amazing Views!. Instead of getting postcards just take pictures here! When the weather is good, your have a lovely view of the Danube and the parliament.

Best place in Budapest. a must visit.. We were trying to skip this one but somehow managed to visit and extremely happy about making the trip. It was a delightful journey on a small bus from the center of budapest. The views are simply fantastic and this is a must visit while visiting the beautiful city of Budapest. The Hilton hotel right next to this amazing and charming place is a great choice to stay. Will do so next time. Best time to visit is late evening while the sun is going down and the city lights up.

Great views across to "Pest". You can walk from the Chain Bridge , just be prepared for hills and lots of stairs, there is a funicular for a small cost that takes you to the top as well. You can see parts of the Bastion with out paying for it in a combo pass that includes St Matthias Church which I think would have been fine Beautiful views

Great views of city and interesting architecture. Tour bus stop off and interesting area. Café and shop for rainy days. Have a wander around the streets at the back and you can take the steps down to the river from here

Really pretty, great on a nice day. The views from the gothic openings, walkways and battlements are quite lovely, the white stone from which they and the church is made is also very nice. The first time we walked up through the royal palace gardens, past the palace and presidential residence to the fishermens bastion, the second time we took the funicular railway which was faster. The area around the fishermens bastion has a lot of very old buildings and souvenir shops in it and they make this attraction worth seeing. Shame about the Very modern Hilton hotel just behind the bastion as that doesn't fit in at all but overall I enjoyed my walk around the bastion and area.
One of the best. this is by far one attraction not to be missed. we visited the place 3 times during our stay, we enjoy the stay, the walk, the view and everything

Stunning Vistas await. When on the Buda side in the vicinity of St.Mathias church, stop into the Fisherman's Bastion. Wend your way through the castle-like labyrinth and your reward will be an awesome view of the Danube, Parliament, The Chain Bridge and all the glory of the Pest Side. While there stop and grab a coffee or bite to eat. Linger awhile as you soak in the sights. An entirely different feeling and experience than on the Pest side.

Amazing views across the city. Well worth making the trip to this area of Budapest.The views are amazing and it was surprisingly peaceful and tranquil.We,were here late afternoon and the buildings were all lit up and it looked magical.
Wonderful Danube & Parliament views!. In addition to the beautiful structure itself, the views of the Budapest, the Danube and the Parliament Building are all spectacular from Fisherman's Bastion.

Part of the Castle Complex. If you are up in the Castle District, you will naturally want to take a peek at the Fisherman's Bastion and its incredible, panoramic views of the Danube and the Pest side of the river and city center. History tells us that the Fishermen's Guild whoworked the Danube were responsible for the city's defenses in the Middle Ages.Fantastic photo op on the Buda Castle complex grounds. The day we were there, it was quite rainy out so we didn't spent too much time here, but the views are truly spectacular!

Lovely setting, terrific view. This is a not-to-be-missed place to visit in Budapest. The fairy-castle look of the Bastion and the magnificent view of the Danube and Pest will be treasured memories. I saw a turnstile, but everything was free when we were there.

Great views over the city. We walked up through the old streets of Buda and were rewarded by the stunning views from the bastion. Although there were a fair number of people around it didn't feel too crowded. The restaurants looked ok especially the Hilton Sunday brunch buffet.
Historic, with exceptional views of Pest.. In the Castle District with all of its unique architecture and history. From the Bastion one has great views over the Danube to the Pest side of the city.

Great view. Pros:Excellent lookout point to see the city. Stop on hop-on, hop-off bus (not sure how to get there otherwise)Cafes and shops offer place to sit, get out of thr sunCons: Lots of tourists jostling for pictures. We went in shoulder season so can just imagine what it is like in peak seasonTips: there is a cafe (Panorama) that offers a good placr to sip coffee whilst enjoying the view. You cant takr pix if not a patron. That said, the view is just as nice outside but here u get to sit and enjoy it in a bit of peace and quiet

Nice, But not for Me. Definitely one of the anchors to the Budapest tourism industry. Next to an important church, on top of Buda hill, with a fairy tailish terrace and some great views across the Danube towards Pest. However, these reasons for its success, led to why I I did not particularly enjoy it.Just too darn busy for me. Visited three times while in Budapest and never found a spot available to enjoy the view. For that, I needed to visit Gellert Hill.
Like a fairytale castle. Excellent views. Food nearby. Lots of tourists even in late October. Historical site worth seeing. Go if you can via a climb up the hill and a walk through the palace
Excellent view of the old city . Great views for free! Loved the vantage point & it had impressive views all around. Beware of some sellers on the Bastian, other than that it was great!
Very scenic. This is well worth a visit, the tourist bus stops is just outside, but it's easy enough to walk up the hill t the Fishermans Bastion and then up to the church and Castle area,
Beautiful views. Nice to walk around for free. You get beautiful views of Budapest. Close to the sights on the Buda side.

Beautiful views and beautiful architecture. A short walk from Buda Castle right outside of the Matthias Church is the fisherman's bastion. It's a beautiful (and very crowded) place with gorgeous views of the river and the Pest side. It looks like a fairytale castle/grounds. A must see. Nice little grassy area with benches over toward the right hand side where you can sit and enjoy the view/area.
It's nice. Just another great place to come and see in the wonderful Budapest. Great views and photo opportunities to keep the wife happy!

Bastion for all ages.. In the Middle Ages this location was the local fisherman's responsibility to protect against invaders.The current Neo-Gothic architecture was the work of F. Schulek, work started in 1895 and lasted 7 years.View from this location is covering several interesting landmarks, a must visit location for the individual interested in history and architecture.

Beaufiful views from the top of Buda. Next to Fishermans Bastion, you will have easy access to several other amazing attractions. Plan on spending several hours in Buda, or better yet the whole day. It is heavily visited, so of you want pictures think about going in the morning. There are several great, albeit, pricey cafes to have a coffee and a bite to eat.

Dreamy otherwordly. This spot has got to be the most romantic and beautiful spot in Europe. It overlooks the city of Budapest. It is well preserved and there are plenty of areas to walk through. It has a magnificent restaurant facing the view and excellent musicians to sing any number of local and international songs (hated the Sinatra ones, though. You don't go to dreamland to hear New York). Their deserts and coffee were delicious. Walking out of the area is the area of Buda filled with restaurants and quaint shops.
Fairytale. Thjs attraction is like a fairytale castle. The view on the ground as well as from the river is enthralling. My favourite place in Budapest.

Fantastic Views. Looking for a beautiful view in Pest and the Danube? One of the best is the Fisherman’s Bastion on the Buda side. The bastion was built between 1895 and 1902 to celebrate the 1000th birthday of Hungary, and to provide locals with a panoramic terrace. The architect’s intent was to recapture the romanticism of olden times. The structure consists of seven towers; each tower symbolizing one of the seven chiefs of the Magyar tribes who conquered the land for the Hungarians. The Bastion achieved the architect’s purpose in that the structure looks like a fairy tale castle. Why the name Fishermen’s Bastion? There are several theories. One saying the walls were protected by the fishermen who lived below the walls and who protected the original castle when under siege. Other theories say it was named for the fishermen who lived in the town underneath called Watertown or it received its name from the hilltop fish market near St. Matthias Church. The name of the structure is not as important as the fantastic views. St. Matthias Church is located in the same complex and the architecture of the Bastion complements that of the Church. A statute of the first Christian king St. Stephen is located in front of the bastion. Have your camera ready to get some of the best pictures of Pest and the Danube River.
Photo Op!!. The views of the city are amazing from here and there's so much to see!! A must see when visiting Budapest!!

church and area. Pretty unique church. The views of the Danube River and the Pest side were beautiful. Lots of interesting nooks and crannies to investigate and from which to take pictures.The area around the church is nice to walk around.
Amazing. The detail is amazing. Worth going to see, the view from the top on a sunny day is beautiful. Such a unique building.
Great magical place. Great magical place. brilliant views and it's like a disney castle up there. Shops and eats also up top. Easy access via public transport, tram and bus
Great views - takes your breath away!. It was a very rainy day when we visited but still beautiful and worth the quick stop to take in the views.

Beautiful Place to Walk Around. We happened to visit on one of the most beautiful days in Budapest and this place offered outstanding views of the Danube below. We took the funicular up to the castle and then walked down. It only took about 10-15 minutes. I had last visited here in 1993, and the buildings are much cleaner and better maintained. The air quality has also significantly improved.

Stunning architecture. Our apartment was at the foot of the bastion so we enjoyed several walks around the stunning grounds, day and night. The views across the Danube over looking the the majestic parliament building are beautiful. We arrived mid morning which did incur the modern day problem of dodging several selfie sticks but it's very spacious with room to walk around and enjoy. Would definitely recommend seeing the illuminated building at night time too. Very peaceful with less people around.
Beautiful place. Fabulous views over the Danube and back over Mattyas Church. The small fee is well worth it as less tourists are up there making taking photos of the view much less busy!!
The Views. Castle Hill is a must and the view from Fisherman's Bastion are wonderful. There is a cafe at the top and you can sit outside enjoy a drink or snack while taking in the scenery.
Good lookout to the Danube and pest. We were there in the morning, walked up from the bottom of the palace. The park walkway up the palace is beautiful and romantic

Not worth the entrance fee . We arrived here and quickly realized you can avoid paying the fee. There's a restaurant maybe 15 meters away that has the same view for free! I don't think there's a difference between the views. The views are stunning regardless of what option you choose. It can get pretty crowded to be prepared. There's a few restaurants and small stores that can buy food and/or drinks. I would recommend a visit for the nice views of the city !

Best views in Budapest!. Really interesting architecture and the best views of Budapest. The Fisherman's Bastion is located across the bridge, opposite the Parliament and is located really high. Worth the walk to get to the top! We went on a lovely sunny winters day and it was perfect. Don't go to Budapest without visiting!

A Must in Budapest. Fisherman's Bastion offers sweeping views of the Danube and the Pest side of the city. The main area was free, but there was a fee if you wanted to climb the stairs up to the surrounding wall that featured the best views. Definitely worth the time and money.

Take your camera. Like others have said, the views are great here. Loved the seven pointy domes that represent the original seven Magyar tribes. This was built for the millennial celebration of their arrival.
Great view. Great location for a view over the river to Parliament. It is very popular with tourists. Look all around while there.
Beautiful. Amazing views and beautiful architecture. A lovely walk around before lunch. The upper section is now free so no need to purchase tickets

Great Vantage Point. The bastion provides a magnificent vantage point for views across Budapest. The area is immaculately preserved and is a wonderful setting with many pedestrianised areas. The site is great for a gentle wander amount the historic buildings and varied architecture. The Fisherman's Bastion is free to enter and has a number of small turrets and walkways to explore.

Perfect sightseeing . Best sightseeing to throw parliament and chain bridge. Very croudy. A good place for photography.
More information needs to be writen on the boards in English.

One More Wonderful Surprise. We really did not know what to expect at this attraction. Not only was the structure beautiful, but it was interesting and entertaining. The views of Parliament, the Danube, the lower old town and Pest from this spot were amazing.
Perfect place.... Beautifully view of the city from the Budapest side....there is a parking five minutes walking but you will have to pay for it....avoid Mondays because the castle is closed...

Beautiful view of the Danube and the city. The site is just a stone's throw away from the Mathias Church. Nothing much except that it offered a great view of the Danube River and the whole city of Pest. If you are visiting Mathias Church you should not miss this place.

Superb views of the grey Danube and Pest side. Don't expect anything of great historical significance, it's a bit of nineteenth century architectural garnish, but it is free and provides panoramic views of the Danube, parliament etc.

Amazing Fisherman's bastion. Fisherman's bastion sits high on a hill on the Buda side of the Danube River. It has a commanding view of Parliament and other architectural wonders on the Pest side. The immense white structure is whimsical with lots of turrets, stairs, and Windows. It reminded me of a fanciful birthday cake! It was crowded with tour groups but was manageable due to its large size. It sits right next to the gorgeous St. Stephen's church. Truly a must see in Budapest!
Great City Views. Has great views of the city and a lot of small shops. There is also a restaurant in the top of the turrets.

Key photo stop. Best stop for photos of the area. Spent 2 hours in the castle area and inside the church. Easy walking, take a short look at the old castle ruins, used to store gunpowder by the Turks.

A Must-See. The Fisherman's Bastion boasts a magnificent view of the city (including the Danube River, Parliament Building, and several bridges) along with an impressive architectural structure in and of itself. It's located right behind Matthias Church, which is a two minute walk from the Buda Castle. The Bastion is free and easily accessible, and you can even walk along the upper rampart. There is also a restaurant built into one side of the Bastion with great food, coffee, and even live music in the evenings. Not to mention there are plenty of souvenir shops, tours, cafes, restaurants, and monuments nearby.
Nice View. This place was incredible love the views from the top they also sell home made craft nearby cheaper than in the city close to the museum of war

Best view of Budapest. We only visited the place on the outside and at night, but this offered us the best view of the city. The place is like a small city center in itself, very quiet and picturesque.

A great place to spend the afternoon. A UNESCO World Heritage site it sits on the Buda side of the Danube and offers a panoramic view of the Pest side. It's a wonderful place to stroll and take in the remarkable architecture and the many life size statues. There are many shops and restaurants close by. One worth mentioning is the glass walled Hilton restaurant which is perched on the side of the bluff and offers a spectacular view of the Pest side of the Danube. The menu is limited by a great place to stop for a coffee, beer, burger or pastry.
Not to be Missed. We only had a short stop here as it was towards the end of the day and didn't want to miss the bus, but it's definitely worth a visit.
View... Great view of the danube and budapest, definitely worth a visit. There are some other good sights in the area so plenty to see.

Buda at its best. Facing Pest, on the other side of the Danube, the Bastion is a most impressive place to visit and an excellent place to take beautiful pictures .... depending on the weather of course. Many things to see, Matthias Church, fairy tale towers, artists, singers, there is something for every one.

Stunning views. You can see for miles from here and so its great for photos and taking in the views of the city of pest and the River. We also ate in the restaurant close to the Bastion which I would also recommend if you have time to stop.

You must visit. Well worth the short walk up to the top of the hill. We visited during the day and wanted to return in the evening to see it at night but got caught up with other attractions.
You simply must visit up here!

Great views. This landmark is right beside saint Michael's church on the Buda side of the Danube. You can get to the top either by number 16 bus or by taking the funicular railway from the bottom of the hill.Once you are up there the architecture is beautiful. The view of the Danube and of Pest are stunning, even on rainy days (which is was when we were there). Well worth the visit and there are numerous other attractions nearby so you can spend the whole day in the area soaking up the history of Buda.

Great Views. From up here the whole of Pest is visible, as are the bridges over the Danube. The bastion is very historic and is only "spoils" by the presence of a modern hotel on the site of an old monastery.

Great Place For Photos of Budapest. The Fisherman's Bastion is a beautiful area right by the Buda Castle. There should not be a charge for this but there is. A great place to take pictures of the Danube and the Pest side of Budapest. It was built for the guild of fishermen in 1895 but it really looks much older than that.
Magical . We explored this area after seeing a concert in the evening in St Mathias and then again during the day on a walking tour. An absolute must see in your Budapest itinerary!
Amazing view. A very nice historical place on the Buda side in Budapest adjacent to the church complex. Having a great view of the entire budapest.

View the Danube from the Fisherman's Bastion. A very good site from which to view the Danube River, have lunch and stroll the small vendors in the area. Got to view the changing of the guards at the nearby palace. Spent about 2+ hours in this area.

Very nice. Very famous and old place with a full view of Budapest city and Danube river. It's next to the Royal palace and the main Cathederal of the city. You can find lots of bazars and nice restaurants. You have to go there.

Beautiful building with a perfect view. We enjoyed having cocktails while enjoying a spectacular view of the Danube and Parliament. The service was very good. The only issue was not having a bathroom and having to pay 1/2 Euro at the public bathroom around the corner.
Amazing view of Budapest. A must see place at least once when you go to Budapest. Provides an amazing view of the city. A nice place for pictures maybe for morning or during sunset

Nice view!!. Very busy spots during the weekend, which is not surprising given the excellent view towards the Danube river, Parliament building, etc on the Pest side of the city. cafes and shops a bit pricey compared to other parts of the city.
Nice panoramic view. This was crowded on Sunday, but I really recommend you to visit this place. The view from here is fantastic.

Imposing. It's beautiful and astounding. Near a church and statue of Hungarian founder Saint. Get a great 360 degree view of the Danube and surrounding areas. There is a ticket for entrance BUT it is free. Don't miss.

It's good. A must see in Budapest, we didn't go inside, I read a review that going in and not going inside is the same, I'm satisfied enough not to see the inside, good to come from the Matyas church by bus to see the Bastion then walk down the hill then along the Danube river to see the beauty of the Parliament from a distance.

Great view. Great view of the Danube River and the city of Pest with the Parliament complex and the Chain Bridge. And that’s that. Be sure to take a look at the Mathias church and the midieval-city of Buda nearby.
Busy spot. A bit kitsch but good views. Avoid weekends which are very busy. Shops close by very pricey compared to other parts of the city
Beautiful Castle. Recommend to visit after dark, the buidling is beautiful. The 15 minutes 3D movie costs HUF1400 per person helps you to understand Hungarian history, worth to watch.

Nice for a quick walk overlooking Pest. Right next to Matthias Church in Buda, this is a pleasant place for a quick look over the Pest side of the Danube. We probably enjoyed our walk near the castle better as it was far less crowded.

BEAUTIFUL PLACE. It is a nice location that every visitor must go there.It is located on a hill in Buda.There are a lot of interesting sights. Also the view of the river and Pest -if the weather is not misty-is perfect.
Expensive. The views are beautiful, however paying is not necessary. If you go just behind the church you can get the same views of the city and other areas of the bastion for free.

A great view over the river and city. We had dinner here one night and visited the following day. We were fortunate (thanks to our concierge at the Sofitel) to get a seat with a view over the Danube and the city. It was simply stunning at night. After dinner as were we leaving our waiter provided access to the upper levels of the bastion (which was closed at the time), to get an even better view of the city.The next day we came back to explore the area...it was equally beautiful during the day.

Looks like a fairy castle. Such a lovely piece of architecture adding to the other lovely building all over Budapest, situated in the Buda castle area and has the real wow factor on sight.. Also has wonderful views over the river Danube.
Nice!!! must go and spend some time. Beautiful view up there, Place around there is very pretty and delightful to eyes. they have a cafe up there, good to sit there.

Interesting bit of history.. This place is different from the average tour site. It opens to the water and was used to protect the city from a water invasion. It is a long raised walkway that is walled in with many openings. A beautiful piece of history.

Excellent views. Well worth a visit if you are in Budapest. The views are extraordinary. You'll be surprised to go up and find there is a whole village up there, which is not obvious from the bottom.We paid extra to go up an extra level - I wouldn't say this was a necessity, however, it's only a small price and provides a much better photo opportunity.
Wonderfull. I'm from Lisbon, Portugal. Travelled with a group of 50 people. Never thought that this city would be so wonderfull. Loved it!Wonderfull view over Pest
so beautiful. If going to Budapest make this place your no 1 attraction. It is just beautiful its seriously like toy town. There are some fabulous little cafes around here to.
Fairy tale Building. We visited both in the day and night. We liked the night views even more than the day, it was magical, and offers perfect views of the river, city and Parliament building below.

Nice architecture, a must see landmark in Budapest. Beside the beautiful St-Mathias Church is this complex of 6-7 towers. The view on the Danube and Parliament is imprenable on a sunny day. So beautiful. There is a coffe shop on the last tower as well as a museum souvenir store
Very busy. Didn't pay the extra as you didn't see anything different - saw the same form beside and a small section which isn't charged for.
Great views!. Set near the castle hill, just above the funicular, you can climb this terrace for free and have great views over the city and parliament.
Good scenic point. This is not a functional fortification like the rest of the walls of castle hill. It is really an ornamental look out point. Gives a good view of the city

Enchanting. We visited in September when the Funicular was having problems (bear in mind that it closes an odd Mondays). so we walked up the hill, not too bad at all. We were rewarded with this enchanting village which has its own special atmosphere and outstanding views of the Pest side of the river, but again go early and beat the crowds.

Beautiful views of Pest. Loved the Fisherman's Bastion for its gorgeous views and interesting shape and history. It was very hot when we visited but it still offered some shade and serenity. The Matthias church is a must see from inside and out and it is right side by side of the the Fisherman's Bastion. The little bar where you can sit down for a glass of hungarian wine perhaps is a great addition with view to the place.

Beautiful. Very popular place, expect crowds and lots of security personnel reminding people of the dangers of taking photos from some of the high walls, please take notice as two visitors died taking photographs whilst we were there.
Very nice place. It is not needed to pay in order to see the most od the place. Nice view of budapest from Buda side.
Nice place to have a view of Danube river. This place is not very far from the Chain Bridge. The bus no. 16 from Clark Ádám tér take us to the castle district. The place and the view are amazing.

Just for the view. Not so impressive but the city view from on top is something nice to see and good for foto taking. Make it as a must visit to this place as the castle concept of the structure might attract you.
Breathtaking view. It is a long way up but well worth it. the fairy tale castle, the view across the city, simply fabulous. Also the view from the river on a night cruise is simply unparalleled

Amazing views!!!!!!!!. We went on a Monday and the funicular was closed. There was a street on the left of the funicular office box to walk up which took us up one side of Castle Hill (we came down the stairs located (on the right of the tunnel). It was an easy walk up and took about 10 minutes even with us stopping to take pictures and look at things along the way. After walking through the castle, we followed signs to the Fisherman's Bastion. You walk through a cute little street which has cafes and stores. You also pass Matthias Church because it is next to it.There are parts of the ramparts that are free to wander around for free. Wander around and see if you are getting the views you want first and then decide if you want to pay beyond that. We ended up eating at The Budapest Café and Restaurant (the first café as you walk in to the right). My husband wanted to have goulash and I wanted a salad. Also beer and wine. It has amazing views and the prices were not that bad. They have great entertainment too.
