Incredible view. Great view of Budapest. Cafe here has good food and had live music. This is nearby a beautiful cathedral and an informative movie of Budapest history is around the corner.

Great View from Buda. This place is great as it is very walkable all around plus you get great views of Pest from Buda side. You can either take the bus, walk up, or take the funicular up and walk around.
It is a must for all tourists. It is jam packed with tourists, but the view back across th river is truly magnificent and this is a must see.

Stunning city views of Budapest. Amazing views, but you have to pay to enter the area and see everything. I think it was like $7 or so, which isn't bad.. We really enjoyed looking out onto the city up here, worth a visit for sure. Take the incline if you don't want to walk up from the metro stop!
Great view over the city. You can walk right around the stop, and get the most amazing photos looking over both sides of the river. the local bus and the hop on hop off take you to this attraction.

Best postcard view. The view from Fisherman's Bastion encompasses the Parliament Building, the Danube, the Chain Bridge and some of the Medieval buildings on Castle Hill. These will be some of your best photos of Budapest. Go in the evening to eat at one of the small restaurants and, beat the crowds and take in the stunning view of the Parliament building lit up at night.
Fisherman's Bastion - worth the walk. Great place to see the city skyline on a clear day.It is worth walking the extra bit from castle hill to see this area.

Good 1/2 day outing. Fisherman's bastion is in Buda, very close to the Castle. It is reachable via the metro or the funicular. It is a beautiful place and a great place for taking photos as it overlooks the Danube and Pest. It should be part of a trip to the castle and surrounding area. Strongly recommend a visit

What a view!. Fisherman's Bastion is a fun architectural structure with twisting towers and staircases to match. It is a great sitte for photography offering both the structural whimsiness and great views. Once you are up in the Bastion Budapest and the Parliament is at your feet. Definitely worth the visit and even more so if you walk from the Palace through the Old Town to the Bastion.
Don't waste your money. It isn't expensive, only 700ft, but you actually get a better view from the cafe right next to the Bastion.

Great views, no need buy admission ticket. This scenic overlook provides a great view of the Parliament and other sights on the Pest side of the Danube. Payment of the admission fee allows you to climb slightly higher onto a rampart. There is no need to do this, as similar views are available nearby. There is a cafe under the rampart with the same views. If you want to spend money, you are better off ordering some food from the cafe and sitting there. There is often a small band playing in the cafe.By the way, the structure is built entirely for scenic views and tourism, it has nothing to do with fishermen.

FISHERMAN'S BASTION. It is over the hill of Budapest where you can see the river, the bridges and the beautiful Parliament from there. Also it is very nice b building and area to walk around. I do recommend it

Great viewpoint. Visited as part of an Imperial City tour organised by Rail Discoveries of York. Probably the best place to get a view of the City. You need a ticket to enter and you have to go from right to left to exit. Usually very busy and space at the front is at a premium.

Beware of buying a ticket - poor value. When you get your ticket for the Matthius Church - which is well worth a visit - you can get a joint ticket covering the Fisherman's Bastion tower for an extra €4/5 a couple. There is no doubt the views are very good from this raised walkway (that's all you get for the ticket) but if you walk an extra 50 metres behind the church - still in Fisherman's Bastion, the views are just as good and free (especially from the tower that houses the cafe). In simple terms, save the money for your lunch!
Amazing. I am always taking my friends there when they are visiting me. All of them. Always. It is must in Budapest to see.
Amazing views. The views of the Pest side of the city are amazing. Must see attraction, although you do have to pay to walk on the ramparts/

De Rigueur. Of course visiting the Fisherman's Bastion is an essential part of a trip to Budapest. There are lots of things to do and see while up on the hill, and the views are a photographer's delight.
A bit short. Great view on Budapest and the Duna, but the walk on panoramic walls is quite short. From beneath,it gives you greater expectations. However, I recommend doing them.

Go for the view. Very touristic place, but what is a small vacation without acting like a real tourist for few hours. Nice to visit if you have a couple of hours to kill. Eat in one of the small restaurants on the street. Some of them are family owned, and the owners are serving you. Nice touch.
Lookout from the Castle. Major attraction of Budapest overlooking the Danube from the Castle area. Highly recommended for first time visitors.

Stunning spot! Must see at nighttime. . By all means check out this spot at night. The view over the city is breathtaking. The surrounding area is also quite nice for a stroll. Pop up and have a look.

Just stunning.. Rosie and I walked up to the castle, the church and the Bastion. It is hard to believe that it is "only" 150 years old, like most of the city. Go here. It is like something out of the Lord of the Rings. Statutes, trairs and wonderful views.
Touristy w/ good views. Walking around on top of Castle Hill is very touristy but kind of interesting. Fisherman's Bastion, to me, wasn't a highlight.

Nice view but not worth 700 HGF. It costs 700 HGF to climb up to the Fisherman's Bastion to see the Parliament and panoramic view which balcony of Buda castle can do the job for free. So I think it's not worth to pay for. Just look from below or you can take the steps to the park next to the bastion also have the quite alike view.
Lovely place definitely worth visiting. Beautiful buildings, lovely place to stroll around and some lovely restaurants and local craft shops.
great Pest views!. Well situated on the Buda side of the Danube overlooking Pest, where on a clear day you can see almost forever

Best View of the City. There are many things to do around Fisherman's Bastion... there is a beautiful=looking cafe that I have not been to yet, and there are stores and shops close by. However, the best part is the view, which in my opinion is the best place to see the city in its entirety.

Beautiful views. We bought the combo ticket to Matthias Church and the Fisherman's Bastion. If you don't want to spend the money there is a small bar at the top on the left that is free and offers the same views.

Gorgeous views. Lovely place to stroll - eat delicious marzipan exactly opposite - beautiful buildings around this area. There is also a restaurant sitting inside the actual bastion and some souvenir shops

Great venue. Don't be fooled by the facade of the bastions,thinking that there is nothing else except the photo shoot! Go inside the walls and there is a whole town to explore,with small shops,bars cafes etc enough to fill several hours .Excellent !

Beautiful Archtecture. This is a must visit tourist location as it gives a great view over the Danube and into the Pest part of the city. The area was crowded wtih tourists but it is well wroth a visit.

Must visit location in Budapest. Stunning by day - even better through dusk...
Brisk walk up the hill from the Buda side of the chain bridge or take the quaint funicular and walk across.
marvellous spot. one of the most romantic places on Buda's castle area. Worth a visit during sunset, the colours are amazing.

Best view in town!. To many, the Gallery Hill is considered to be the best view in town. However,I personally prefer the Buda-castle with the Fisher's Bastion by far.Enjoy a great view and go walk around the castle, discovering it's secrets and beauties.Plus, there are plenty of little cafés and restaurants to pick from. Pro-tip: If you go at night, bring tea and the local "Kürtöskalács" and enjoy free entry to the Bastion's upper level to enjoy the city in its full luminous glory.Perfect for romantic walks as well.However beware: When the weather is bad it gets quite windy up there.
Looked great from a distance. Not really suitable for anyone with mobility issues but otherwise to be recommended. Very close to the Chain Bridge

be prepared to pay. Once you have paid to ride the funicular railway you have to pay for everything else on the castle area. The cathedral, the walls, the labyrinth. but a nice day out and a great view of the city
Toy Town. This place is fascinating - like a toy town. So unusual and everywhere you look is a photo opportunity with great views over the Danube towards the Parliament.
Brilliant. Fantastic views over the Danube River and across the City, very atmospheric on a night time, with the music and bars located in the walls and arches.

A must in Budapest!!!. Fantastic views from Fisherman's Bastion over the rest of Castle Hill and Budapest. Simply stunning architecture and amazing attention to detail. You can't visit Budapest and not take a stroll through here.
Touristy and fabulous. Beautiful! The bastion is the Disneyland version of the castle but it is just so cute and the views to the Danube are just lovely.

Beautiful architecture and a great river/city view. While the surrounding area is a bit uncomfortable due to the Hilton restaurant and its many windows (every other view you take in will be of the diners staring back out at you), the Fisherman's Bastion is nevertheless a gorgeous example of the old city's architecture. Additionally, the view of the river and the city surrounding is wonderful to take in, no matter what time of day. As it is with most of Budapest, the lack of rules surrounding the property really allows you to take advantage of getting some breathtaking views from all vantage points of the structure (whether that's good or bad, I'll leave that up to you to decide).
Great views. Because of a visual sectors should not pay admission. View restaurant can be accessed free of charge.

Spend the Fee to Walk along this Lovely Rampart!. It is a beautifully constructe rampart next to St, Mattias Cathedral and is worth the short walk just to look down from the mountain. However, the view is the same from other parts of the wall if you do not want to spend the money on this secluded rampart.

Accurately reconstructed. The new construction of the centuries old fisherman's Bastion is an accurate reproduction of the former edifice. It wanders and winds around the top of Capitol Hill offering amazing views of the Danube and of Pest across the river. Lovely!

Fantastic . Great views. Definitely worth a visit and walk around, both during the day and night. You have to pay to access one part of the walls (not expensive, only around £1.50) but other parts seemed to be free of charge

Great Views of the Pest Side, Especially the Parliament Building. We made a stop with the Hop on Hop bus and visited the Fisherman's Bastion Saint Matthias Church and shops and restaurants. The views are fantastic and Fisherman's Bastion is also a great place to walk around. We had lunch at one of the local restaurants, topping it off with a slice of the winning 2015 Hungarian torte (cake), which was delicious. Along with the other attractions it was a well spent 4 hours.

The real Disney castle!. I went here with no expectation. After taking a numerous stairs to reach this place (you can still ride a venicular that leads you to Buda castle which located only 10 minutes from this place), tadaaaa! Here you go the Disney castle. A perfect place to enjoy the sunset. You can see Parliament building for this place as well. Love every piece of this place!

Romantic setting. A .public access promenade with beautiful views of the city and the Danube River. Excellent photo-op's. I have been to Budapest a number of times through the years, and the beauty of its surroundings always amazes me.
Beautiful view. Beautiful view from the top. No need to pay to get in, just go 10 meters to the left for free. There are lots of lookouts.

Great views. You just can't beat the view from this location. We took the funicular up and down and then walked over. You have a panoramic view of the entire Pest side of the Danube. Great opportunity for pics of The Parliament Building. I wouldn't pay the fee for a ticket. That only allows you access to a second level but not much difference between the first and second levels.
Great Views. Great views over the city and the river. A little difficult to find and crowded. A little expensive, but worth the views.

An Ideal Picture location.. It is strongly suggested to visit during a clear day when the photographs of Budapest are exceptional, and again in the evening when all the lights are on, and there is a string quartet playing during the evening

Brilliant. unlucky that the Danube terrace (as booked) wasn't open as weather was changeable. had stunning table by window inside instead (overlooking the river and Parliament), Staff brilliant - knowledgeable, friendly and spot on with timing and nothing was too much trouble, superb food and a special mention for the goulash soup with extra jalapenos on the side - great wine and beer. Start to finish from reception to departure absolutely brilliant.

One of the best views . This is one of the few places to get the best view. Can be a little crowded during tourist season. Wasn't to bad in Oct. This city is so beautiful. Many things to see, don't miss Heroes Square, and the market.

Best scenery. Walking in the castle, you must see the Mathias Church and the Bastion. Stop for the statue of St. Stephan and after check the small balconies, give you excellent wiew to the Pest side. Most people do not find the hidden ruins of a church built in the Hilton hotel's two parts. Just go to the end of the bastion, there are a few steps and you are there.

Best place to view Pest and Parliament Building. Sitting high atop Castle Hill, the Fisherman's Bastion provides great views of much of the city. No cost involved, but stair climbing will be necessary to see all the views
Stunning place. Simply - I loved it. We came here as part of our hop on hop off tour and stayed the day, just walked around and enjoying the view, the beauty and the shops.
Fisherman's Bastion. Very nice place; you have a great view from here: Parliament building on the orher side of the Donau; also nice places to have a quick lunch;

Worth a visit while in Budapest. The views are amazing from here. During day very full of tourist-go at night to make city views even better than daytime. Park before the gates and walk in no charge. You can drive thru but you cannot stop for pictures must keep moving. Several shops and restaurants in this area.
Fairytale building. Beautiful building so pretty just like a Disney castle...and great point to take some photos. We got there by the hop off hop on Bus

Great view. Fisherman Bastion is part of Buda castle with great view of Parliament building and Pest side . You can get up using stairs or come from inside of castle. A lot of restaurants are available inside the Castle.
Fisherman's Bastion. A must to visit in Budapest. Very beautifully built with fabulous views of the Pest side including the Parliament Building.

Interesting to visit - but similar views for free all around.. The Halaszbastya (Fishermsn's Bastion) has an interesting history and it's located just beside the Matthias church which is also worth a visit. The lower levels are free to visit at any time but if you wish to climb to the upper level and visit the towers there is a small fee of 700 HUF (350 HUF for EU pensioners).Similar views can be found nearby, without paying the fee. When we visited the area a second time, in the evening, we noticed that the entrance was open and no fee to go up and have a look out over the Danube and the Pest side of the city.Easy to reach by the funicular, or number 16 bus which stops nearby.
Best view of Budapest. On high ground on the Buda side of town, best possible vantage point to view the river and city. Not too many attractions nearby but the area is interesting.
Go Early if Possible. Go here early if you want good photos and to beat the crowds, if not you will still get some amazing views of Pest.
The view of a lifetime. This IS Budapest at first hand and first sight! Be in the very epicentre of the city, it will have a great impact.
first place to go. beautiful sight seeing when the weather is fine global overview you can go in the church and go directly in the Castle
Great views of the Danube and Pest. A must stop on the Buda side of Budapest, overlooking the Danube and close to Matthias Church. Go early to beat the tourist crowds.

What a great place!. . Go anytime.....dawn, twilight and night are awesome.Most beautiful photos and views. You can bring a snack or eat and/or drink in several cafes or restaurants right overlooking the best. Enjoy!

Great view of the Hungarian Parliment from here!. Follow the steps up along the Danube riverfront to be he castle district and you will see tt. The view is beautiful! There is a small cafe to purchase beer, wine, cold beverages and then a few high top tables to sit at and enjoy the view. There was a ticket booth close by that we purchased tickets to the Matthias Church next door and thought they also sold tickets to enter the Fishermans bastion, but no one was there to collect money or tickets to enter the Fishermans Bastion the day we were there. So maybe it's free?
Definitely worth a visit. This is a lovely, picturesque area by Matthias Church with wonderful views of the Parliament Building etc.

historic place. situated on hill at buda side of budapest . marked by statues , st. mattias church (entry fee required) , builing s and lanes . one can get stunning veiw of danueve and the bridges connecting the city.
Sneak a peak.. Don't pay for this. Go up the wall by the little cafe and sneak a peak. Great views. Right near the church.
fairytale setting. worth the hike to the top for the views and the setting do the area all in one go. very clean and bright.

Beautiful Budapest. Stunning views and lovely Bastion which I guess is not only a Wall that you can buy a ticket and walk along but just lovely to look at. Good restaurants set in the Bastion as well.

Romantic place. Landscape is mgical!!!!this place is very romantic.
We chose not to buy a ticket there. You can see the whole place by yourself.

Its beautiful, its stunning and its free. Of course if you come to Budapest you will come here, so my words or photos aren't needed for encouragement! Spend the morning on Castle Hill then walk across to Fishermans Bastion (stopping off for lunch on the way). A perfect way to spend the day. Views, building and statues are stunning.
Outstanding view. Exceptional view but I think to get to the top tier you have to pay. I advise to save your money and enjoy the free views. Then go to the national art museum in the

Gorgeous architecture and view of the Danube coast!. Fisherman's Bastion is a must-see in Budapest. Not only is the architecture breath-taking, but the view of the Danube and all the buildings that line both sides of the coast is just amazing! I was there in early September and the crowd was very dense, with tons of people trying to take photos in all the spots. If you want to be able to experience this attraction and Budapest in general without the crowds, definitely avoid summer and early fall.
breathe-taking views. ABSOLUTELY breathe-taking especially when over looking Budapest and the Parliament building, worth the walk uo to see it.

Number one stop!!. This is such a nice place!! Totally breathtaking views over the whole city. There are also some coffees so you can just chill and enjoy a little break. On a nice sunny days you can find some artist painting landscape. I just fell in love with this place! Number one stop at Budapest !!!
Panoramic view of Buda and Pest. Has the best view of the city, but make sure you time your visit right to take advantage of the sunrise/sunset
Nice for a wander around. Great hub in Budapest - lots to see and good views across the river to the city and the Parliament building. Stairs and layers make for good photos too!
Fisherman. Great views. Not much more to say about this. You can get the same view from multiple locations. Nothing more to it

gorgeous building, gorgeous view.. From all the images I had seen online I knew I was going to be in awe of this place. The building is absolutely amazing, as are the views. We went up during the day when the weather was sunny and it was so pretty. We also there at night when it was raining and it was just as pretty. we got some lovely photos day and night of the city.You have to pay to walk around some of the higher parts of the bastion, we didn't do that and I didn't feel like we needed to.You must visit!!
Beautiful View from an Emblematic Building. You can enjoy an unmatched panorama of the city. The building itself is an emblem of Budapest, planned by the famous architect, Frigyes Schulek.

Budapest a beautiful enchanting city. If you go to Budapest visit Fishermen's Bastion and all the historic area on the Buda side. Also take the river boat cruise by night - you think you are in a beautiful dream!

Wonderful views of Pest and Parliament. The fisherman's bastion built to commemorate the contribution of the fishermen during a war is an impressive piece of architecture that augments the Matthias church behind it and the Buda Castle situated a few meters away. One is required to purchase a ticket to get to the top, but the views from the bottom (and the cafe) are equally great.
views, views, views..... This provides a great view of Parliament and the rest of the inner city. Seen from the other side of the river it is a sight in itself.

A nice view of the city. Nice view of the parliament building and budapest. Rather than paying to go up on the bastion, go a little further down and go up into a turret looking tower (free) where there's a wine bar and view parliament from there.

Great panoramic views of Budapest!. This was one of our favorites during our visit to Budapest! Fantastic views of the Danube River and Budapest, also a café overlooking Budapest. They serve the best hot chocolate! We loved this area!
Wc booming business . Very pretty and worth visiting but the loos next to it have a long queue and charge 200 huf pp - what a business!
One of the highlights. Amazing view of the city! A must for anyone going to Budapest! The bastion and the surrounding area is a wonderful place to spend a day of walking

Very nice. Nice place and nice view. Cafe area was very windy so to cold to sit there. You have to pay for the higher area to get a better scene to see but I'd dined do it. The other views were pretty as well and good enough for me. Overall a very cool place to visit! !

Gorgeous view of a gorgeous city. Beautiful architecture, beautiful view, and beautiful view onto the Parliament.
Amazing history in a beautiful city :)

Fairytale. The 10C statue of King Stephen, founder of the Hungarian nation stands as a centre point to this area. The fairytale turrets, which you can enter and climb for a fee and the walkway round the Bastion give wonderful views of Pest and the River Danube. The nearby Hilton Hotel tastefully and beautifully incorporates parts of the Dominican monastery and also the 18C Jesuit college which form one side of the Bastion. (Views from the Hilton restaurant are very impressivre if you want to eat and view).

Majestic View of the faous Parliament Building. If you happen to be there on a good day, sunny and clear, the view of the Parliament Houses is breathtaking, perfect for picture taking from your visit to Budapest. Also, on the little street in front of the Church, there is a Herend (famous porcelain) store that takes Euros, Florins and credit cards. If you are a fan of this beautiful porcelain you have to stop and browse even if you don't buy anything!
Recommended. A beautiful part of Budapest with fantastic views over river and lovely church to visit.Well worth a visit

Brilliant photo opportunities from here. Amazing church was located at the top of this destination but the line up can be quite long if it is not included on a tour. Howeever the best part was the views you get and the photo opportunities. Don't be conned into paying to reach an area for an amazing view/photo, just walk across to one of the towers that doesn't ask for a fee, the view is just as good from any location.

Visit at Day and Night. This is just a beautiful part of the city that is a must see!!! It's within the old town of Budapest and within a sleepy village type environment which has so much history. I can't recommend going back to this place after dark as the views of the city are breathtaking.
A Stunning city. Loved this magnificent building took many photos from different angles. A lovely part of the Budapest skyline - on the Buda side.

Exquisite in every way!!!. A totally outstanding restaurant, visually, service & food. The highlight of our trip. Had lunch one day and returned for dinner another evening , taking 4 other friends who felt the same as we did.

Best views of the city . Best place to go to view the entire city, free too! We went during the day and at night. This spot is very touristy during the day but at night it is very peaceful and beautiful, the parliment building is gorgeous.

Breathtaking views. Beautiful building with great picture opportunities and great views, just stunning. Tends to be a little more chilly than the pest side (if you go during fall or winter) so take a jacket. Great place to walk around or enjoy some coffee with a view. Definitely need to visit it during the day and again at night.
Fabulous Architecture. Fabulous building, with fascinating architecture and also beautifully clean - easily accessible from St Matthias Church.
Good views. Lovely views from here of the Danube and Parliament and most of the cityfrom here. Nice area to walk round, lots to see.
Nice. Lovely, didn't pay to go in because of previous reviews but nice from outside, the bar this nice too.

Beautiful Buda. Buda is wonderful and the views across the Danube from the Fisherman's Bastion are fabulous. You have to pay a small fee to go up onto the bastion but well worth it. You can access part of it for free but this leads to a cafe and the view isn't as good
Fairy tale building. Well worth looking around, great views over the Danube from the turrets. The amount of steps isn't for the faint-hearted!

Fun area to see. You can see this whole area in a matter of a couple hours. We wandered down the side streets as well, but there wasn't a whole lot to do other than take pictures and just walk around. A few cafes here and there. Worth a trip if you have time.

A real gem. Visited the place on a fine day in April. It was sunny and warm. On the way up to the bastion, it was so peaceful and admirable. The bastion itself is a real gem - unique and beautiful architecture!
Interesting architecture, good city view!. It is definitely worth seeing! Place is very interesting and moreover you can have a great cityview from this place, especially in sunny day.

Unbelievable views. This is a great place to go and get great views of the Parliament building and Danube. Simply stunning and all from a building which looks like it could be in a fairytale. We got the funicular up there and the bus back down. We went up during the day and also again at night, where you can explore the lengthy walls of the Bastion for free (you have to pay during the day). A great photo opportunity and a definite must-visit.

Worth the trip. Same as Castle hill, lots of good picture opportunities, can be cold if it is windy at all. Some nice scenic vistas. You will visit this as part of a city tour, a half hour stop or so is all you will need.
Worth a visit. A wonderful place to look down on Pest and the River Danube. It is a part of the city you could spend a good part of the day.
A fairytale building. This building is truly magical a must to see. Like so many building is Budapest this must not be missed.
Great feature, but spoilt.. One of the key sites in Buda, and well worth a visit. The problem is too many tickets, view spoilt by large new hotel and access restricted.

Stunning City Views. A very popular area most times of the day. Free access to street level viewing, a small charge is made for the turret view. Stunning views of Budapest and the Danube itself. Accessible by local bus, tour bus, funicular with a short walk.
Must see when visiting the castle. Really quirky but fun. Very busy and had to pay if you wanted to walk round the walls. Lots of opportunities for photos.
Really nice. Nice view. Wonderfull atmosphere. Like in a story. It is perfect. Good to visit.i can go there every time just for the view

Beautiful construction. Besides the beautiful construction, the view of the Danube and Pest is great loosing only to the view from the Citadella.
There's only one thing missing: a nice restaurant where you can have a quality meal, drinking some wine while enjoying the view...
Best View of Pest. Best views of Pest ever! Beautiful place. You have to pay to access the right tower, but the left one is free.

Great view, cafe service is uninterested at best. Great view of a great city, there is a romantic looking cafe in the battlements. We tried this however after seeing the staff snarling at guests and after 10mins of no service but 3 attempts for cash from the band we left and gound another bar deeper into the old town. Would go for the view, but never go back to the cafe.
Very good. Liked the ambiance very much. Even though it is crowded its calm and peacefull. Worth visiting at any time of the year.
Spectacular. Remarkable - everyone visiting Budapest should visit this Castle and Fisherman's bastion and the executive office buildings - this is real history and I absolutely loved it
Fantastic views. Lovely views over Buda and the Hungarian Parliament. Great in sunny weather, can be quite a walk to get up the steps though.
Fisherman's Bastion. Fantastic place to visit. If fit enough ( there are over 150 steps on a spiral stair case with few rest stops) would suggest tower tour as view is spectacular.
Day visit. Beautiful overviews of the river and the Pest side. Saw St. Stephens statue and St. Matthias church (closed) the Holy Trinity square. This would be a great night photography spot.
Great views of the city. This was a nice stop for great photos of the Buda side of the city. It is right next to St. Stephen's Basilica.

Beautiful - must see. Beautiful walk up to the Bastion via Buda Castle. Gorgeous little village.We only went to the viewing point, not into the church itself. The views are fantastic!Theres also a little bar/coffee shop that you don't have to pay to enter that has equally good views too :)

great location and great view. the place is just great. u can have a great view of the river and city from here. easy to find out and explore.have a few resturants located near it. should at least take a drink and enjoy the place. must visit, if u r in budapest.

Stunning views over the river and city below. Fabulous location on the edge of the beautiful old city of Buda, this beautiful square and 'battlements' overlooks the Danube and the opposing city of Pest. Great place for a coffee after your walk around.
Halaszbastya!!!!!!!. One of the greatest places in Budapest.You can go there going to Matthias Church too.The distance for going there is very beautiful too.You have to go.

Magical Place . We spent the day between the Liberty state, the Royal Palace and then the Fisherman's Bastion. The views of Budapest are simply fantastic and in particular the Bastion is almost unreal. If you do not visit here when visiting Budapest you will definitely miss out so try it and you will not be disappointed.

Beautiful, romantic.... This place located in Buda next the mathias church. The view is stunning. You can see from there all the important touristic places from there, simply beautiful! The 16th buss taking you up from the four seasons hotel.

Beautiful and close to other attractions. Beautiful structure that overlooks the Rhine River and the Pest part of Budapest. Next to it is St> Stephens Cathedral and a very short walk leads you to the Buda Castle. Great spot to have lunch at the Bastion overlooking all

Beautiful views. Amazing views from the fishermans bastion, over the Danube and the entire city.. Definitely a must-see! Only thing is, we paid for a ticket to go up there but there wasn't a ticket gate so it didn't get checked anyway! Although the ticket wasn't expensive at all. Would definitely recommend.

Beautiful location, excellent views. Fisherman's Bastion is a nice piece of architecture, offering great views of the Danube and Pest. Its location next to the Matthias Church and the Holy Trinity monument makes it even more superb.Mind you, it can get overcrowded. Most of the building can be visited free of charge. You need to pay to visit a small part of the Bastion (top level). We did that, but failed to see what exactly this part had to offer extra - don't do it.You can have dinner in a restaurant inside the Bastion (enjoying the view), but we didn't do that. Before visiting the Matthias Church and climbing its tower, have a coffee break at the nearby Cafe Miró (down Szentháromság utca).Count some more than half an hour for the Bastion alone.

Not as spectacular as expected.. There is a good view form here over the Danube and the city. We paid (not a lot) to go up the towers. But 50 yards to the left is another tower which you can walk up for free. The bastion structure looks good. If you are on Castle Hill, you shouldn't fail to go here. But don't expect too much.

Beautiful View of Budapest. The Fisherman's Bastion is a beautiful area of the Castle Grounds on the Buda side that overlooks the Danube River, Chain Bridge and Parliament Building. It is definitely a must-see place in Budapest as it’s an iconic structure and sits next to the beautiful Matthias Church. This is a lovely place to wander around and has numerous photo opportunities. There is also an access to the upper levels that you can pay to access but we didn’t do that. There are heaps of eating places and souvenir shops as well. Be sure to have your cameras fully charged! Amazing views and stunning architecture. Definitely worth a visit!!
FISHERMANS BASTION. We climbed the steps to Fisherman's Bastion a while back. Lovely view from there, square full of people, close to other attractions like the palace Trinity Column.
FISHERMANS BASTION. Fishermans Bastion is great to see, visited a while back, good place to take photos, close to many other attractions.
Fairy tale. Fisherman's Bastion is located in the historic Castle Hill area and a little "fairytale" in appearance. Delicious.

Best Views in Budapest. For taking photos, it was excellent. Looking over to Pest, the view of the Parliament Buildings is superb. Looking south, you can see Chain Bridge and several other bridges over the Danube.

Must Visit. The Fisherman`s Bastion was defiantly one of the most picturesque locations in Budapest, with breathtaking views of the Danube and Pest, including the house of Parliament, St Stephens Basilica and numerous other iconic landmarks. The Bastion itself is relatively small and can be tackled in around an hour. However there are numerous restaurants in the surround area including a couple in the Bastion itself for those with more time on there hands. Just a stone throw away is St Matthias church which is also a must. I do suggest going early in the morning before 9am or later in the afternoon after 5pm as the area can get very busy with tourists which will spoil the feel of such a beautiful place.

Fishermans Bastion. Spent most of the afternoon there. The views across the river were fabulous and the site itself is really interesting. Did not see anywhere needing a payment but the walk around the walls was easy and insightful. Statues of many of the hereos of Budapest and stories attached. Arrived there with the tourist Hop On Hop Off Bus..a great bargain.

Wedding anniversary . Fabulous, not much else to say really, fabulous food, fabulous location, fabulous staff. I wanted the meal to last all night, our waiter was amazing, there was even live music, this place is so worth a visit, it's a very pretty fairy tale looking building, the cost is very reasonable too

Enjoy the free view from the lower level. The view of Pest across the Danube river is outstanding and you don't need to pay to go to the top as the view from the lower level is just as good. It's easy to pick out the Parliament Building but if you have toured around already you can recognize other landmarks like the Basilica, the Grand Market building and the various bridges. There is also an area with shops, restaurants, the Hospital in the Rock and a beautiful church up here.

Beautiful walk to a beatiful place. the second day in Budapest we did very long walk around the citi, and finished in the afternoon visiting Fisherman's Bastion... so nice!... we walked many kilometres every day!... better then taking tour bus!...

You can skip buying ticket as you will get nice snaps nearby this small wall. Fisherman's Bastion is a quite big area which consists of multiple fort walls. But only 1 has got entrance with ticket.You can skip it , as it's always crowded and you will get nice snaps at the steps to climb down the hill.The ticket would have been worth only if they allowed to walk on whole castle wall instead of just a portion of it.

The view from the top!. It is a lovely climb up the cobblestone streets of Budapest and when you finally reach the Fisherman's Bastion, you find a breath-taking view. Relax for a while, wander into the church and take the view in again. Worth a second look!

Interesting Architecture and Nice View. The terraces and building are beautiful. I'm glad that our tour bus stopped there. It is my opinion that the best part of the visit was the view of Budapest and the Danube from the terraces. There is an entrance fee but we choose to stay outside.
Worth a visit. Great views, with only a few people, if you miss the tours, don't go out of your way, but if you are wandering into Buda for lunch would be a worthwhile stop.

Beautiful architecture. The architecture of the bastion is fantastic, the whole site is beautiful. As well as walking around the beautiful front walls, we walked the circumference of the bastion. At the far end there is an array of artillery - cannons and such - and the place has a quaint village feel. Worth a visit.
Stunning Views and Archeticture. Fisherman's Bastion is an iconic structure on the Buda side of the river Danube that offers excellent view of the city including the Houses of Parliament.

Romantic place, amazing view, must see. The fisherman bastion is a must see place, doesnt matter if you are on a family trip or a couple. The view from there is breath taking and i am highly recomend to come at sunset time
Nice view of Budapest. А small but nice area on a hill with stunning views of the Danube and the city. There are a cafe, a marzipan "museum" and shop and a lot of tourists with selfie sticks.

It's a must!. Spectacular white towers and great view of the city make the Fisherman's Bastion a must for everyone visiting Budapest. What a shame that a big part of it is not free anymore - you have to pay for the entrance. The part with a souvenir shop is still accessible freely.

Interesting building/monument but views nothing special. Average views, but not better (if at all than those from the Royal Palace).The bastion looks good but is better to look at than experience. There is a charge to acess it and can be brought on a combined ticket with access to the nearby church. Save your money and your time.

Stay away from tour groups. Lovely area with great river and city views but area is quite congested with tour groups. There is a charge to walk the fortress wall but if you go to the end on the left side as you face the river you can climb the stairs for free and get a good view for photos.
Really nice place. I was really surprise that in BP you can find something like this plus it look very clear like they clear it every day (mean outside walls).

Stunning. Postcard views to die for. You can take the tram car up however we walked. Not too hard if you take your time. Once at the top you have the opportunity to see the magnificent st mattias church and wander to the palace and surrounds. Lots of cafes and souvenir shops selling wares a little more 'home-grown'. Fishermans bastion has endless photo opportunities of the Budapest scape.
excellent views. This is a lovely place to wander around, very close to the church and castle. You can pay to access the upper levels, but there are lots of photo opportunities without paying.

Fantastic view of the city. Visited here thankfully on a sunny day. You have to pay to get on the top terrace of the bastion but it is worth it with scenic views of pest and the Danube. A must see if visiting Budapest.
Superb. Walked here from our hotel. The place is fantastic excellent scenery for taking pictures. Free to look round. There are many eating places.
spectacular views of buda. the bastion offers spectacular views and interesting sites to visit. i believe one should include in the itinerary while visiting budapest.
Amazing views. The views are amazing from Fisherman's Bastion, so make sure you have your camera with you so you can take your memories home with you .
Fishermans bastion.. So much to see. Make sure you have at least half a day or more to see it all. It's easy to walk up and you get to see more.
Not to be missed. Great area, fantastic views of Budapest. Castle Hill is a must when visiting Budapest. Area has many shops. Best area to take photos of the area.
Fisherman's Bastion.. The views from up here are absolutely fabulous. Also the architecture, as in a lot of Budapest, is just beautiful.

Magnificent Up hill View. Great view of Danube river and the two sides of Buda and pest
you can go up there by the bus or there is a small tram.

Worth your time and visit. Stunning architecture and great view of Pest. Certainly worth seeing.
If you want to climb up certain parts of the area, you will need to pay. I personally think it's not worth paying extra. You can enjoy the view from the free area. :)
Best view of Pest!. The Fisherman's Bastion is responsible for the best view of the Pest side of Budapest, including the Chain Bridge and the awesome Parliament Building.

Great views and photo opportunities. Just steps from the beautiful Mattias Church in the Castle district of Buda, Fisherman's Bastion offers gorgeous views of the Danube below and Pest on the opposite shore. To get those views, you need to climb stairs, but it's worth it and it's very civilized. There's an "up" staircase on the right and a "down" staircase on the left. Once at the top, you may need to jockey for position for the best views and to take photos.

Cobblestone uneven paths. Big walk. Part of the castle grounds on the Buda side. Don't let anyone talk you into doing a walking tour as it will just kill you. Yes it may only be 30 mins walk to the castle but they fail to tell you that there's more walking around the grounds. We hired a bicycle and covered so much ground without tiring our legs. This is the way to see Budapest. The battlements wind up and around through the cobble stone paths and we saw so many older folks walking uphill through the winding paths feeling sorry for themselves. We just wiz pass them on the bikes.Don't pay for a 2 way funicular ticket as you will walk to matthias church and probably walk down from there instead of walking back to the funicular as this walk will take you to the bridge near the Parliament which is on the other end of the castle and battlements.Free to walk around here.

NICE VIEW BUT THAT WAS ALL. We had a few locals tell us that the Fisherman's Bastion was a "must see" on Castle Hill. So, we paid for the tickets necessary to climb up a few steps to an "L" shaped platform. The view of the Danube and Buda and Pest really was spectacular. However, there were other areas you could climb to get an equally great view of the city without spending anything for a ticket!
Buda-best!. By far the most stunning building in Budapest! Great views of the Danube, Pest & the Parliamentary Buildings! And the majority of it is free! A must visit whilst in Budapest!
Incredible views!. WOW! This place is incredible! IT's like a make believe castle. The views over the city are just incredible. MAke sure you visit during the day and at night! The city sparkles.
Lovely place.... I'm visiting Budapest Hungary twice a year and stop at the Castle Hill every time for the wonderfully scenery. It has a special place in my heart.
Romantic place. It is one of my favorite places in Budapest. There is a wonderful view to the city. I recommend also see the Matthias Church which situated close to the Fisherman's Bastion
Not to be missed.. Grand architecture & picturesque streets surround this wonderful building plus wonderful views over the city.
Well worth a visit!. Amazing views and stunning architecture. Definitely worth a visit. Although accessible by public transport, there is some walk involved,
Go to the left.. Se the view from the left it is free dont pay for 50 feet of thé same view. Visit the cathédrale St Mathias Just beside.
Best views. Excellent views in all directions. It is located high on a hill Budapest side of river so panoramic views of Pest side. Statues of course.

Disney like turrets. An interesting disney like place to visit right by St Stephen's Church in Holy Trinity Square. Worth a wander to enjoy the magnificent views of Pest and the Danube. We didn't pay to do the upper ramparts but remained on the free lower ramparts which were perfectly sufficient.

Beautiful views. This is well worth the visit, especially at night when the city is lit up. The views are beautiful on clear days! During the day there is a small charge and can get quite busy. At night it is free of charge and relatively quiet.
Beautiful Views!. Must see views of the entire city. I would not pay for the additional access. Family friendly and one of the key attractions in Budapest.

Nice view.. Nice view over Dunube ,Buda and Pest together,the most beautiful bridges ,but for me,after visiting the castle in the morning, seemed quite exhausting,and rather expensive.Nothing to drink,and no place to hide from the sun,so it was not a long visit.
A must to go when you are in Budapest. you have a wonderful view down to danube-river and the parliament. it is also a must to visit the church
Wonderful. Quirky in a nice way with good views over the Danube to Parliament Square and beyond. There is a lovely restaurant overlooking the citry

Amazing architecture and great view of Pest. The Fisherman's Bastion is not only an amazing piece of architecture, which - in my opinion and after repeated visits of Budapest - together with the Matthias Church creates one of the most interesting places in Budapest, but offers probably the most attractive view of Pest, too. If you only want to capture nice pictures of the House of Parliament, other Pest embankment buildings or Danube, you do not have to pay the entry, you can just enter the free outlook in the left corner of the place, where the local Cafe is located.
Amazing view!. A must see in Budapest. Lovely view to the Pest side. It's built for the Millennium and it's shape is symbolize the original Hun tents and the seven tribes.
Very Pretty!. This was very nice! I wouldn't bother to pay the money to walk along the top as you get just as good views from the bottom
Amazing View. Great history behind the Fisherman's Bastion. This is where you want to come to see amazing views of Buda and Pest.

Well worth the climb. Great views over the Danube and Pest, especially lovely at night. It is a bit of a climb up from the river but there is a cable car for those not as able. Highly recommended. The church in the plaza has a beautiful roof. We had lunch at one of the restaurants and the prices were cheaper than in similar restaurants in Pest which was surprising since the location was so lovely.

Phenomenol View of Pest and the Danube River. A visit to the Fisherman's Bastion (in Buda) was part of a bus tour. The walk to the Bastion itself is minimal. Once you arrive, you are treated to a view of Pest and of the Danube that is breath-taking.You see the city of Pest in its totality; the Danube River unfolds itself before you. The opportunity for picture-taking is endless. The guide's report on the history of the area was detailed. The Church alongside the Bastion is beautiful, too.You just want to sit and revel in the beauty of the scene. The sensation of walking, where so many historical figures walked before us, centuries before, is mind-altering!

Super romantic. Call me strange, but I found this more romantic than Paris. Paris is overrated. Try to sit in one of the windows between the towers, watch a sunset while sipping wine. Amazing. If someone popped up the big question, I'd definitely say yes just because of the setting. Great views on the riverside, parliament and all the landmarks located in Pest. If you are lucky like we were, there will be playing live music from the near tiny market square. Loved this. Worth seeing both during day light and at night.

What a view!. On a glorious sunny day the view was absolutely beautiful and gave us our first real view across the river to the parliament building and Margaret Island and lots of other wonderful sights.
Amazing river views. A must do. Amazing river views from above. Worth doing during the day (small charge) and at night (free).
Beautiful but you have to pay for the view!. Beautiful location, the palace was stunning. The only downside was that you had to pay to access the highest view point.

One of the most romantic places in the world. A place from where everything in Budapest is simply at your feet, breathtaking views, infinite possibilities to take wonderful pictures and, of course, very very romantic

Fisherman's Bastion great views. Thoroughly enjoyed this site. Fun to walk around and take pictures. Great views of the city and the Danube. Great place to see the parliament building. Nice walk down to the Danube.

Well worth a visit for the views.. Stunning views and expensive but welcome hot drinks. Blankets on chairs to warm you up and a musical trio to entertain you. Stunning views. Hearing the Can-Can played live over the noise of the rain, wrapped in a blanket and sipping hot chocolate is a memory we took away with us. Do go!

Good views. This is on the Castle Grounds. As noted in travel blogs it is definite reconstruction to the point of looking artificial. Good views for photos, no need to pay for rampart entrances. Shoppes and food in the area.
Very crowded. This is a very crowded location. As we were with a guide on a Tauck tour we had prepaid clean toilets which was very good.

Loved walking around it. Possibly my favorite historical place in the city together with the walk to reach it. Loved the building, the view and there is the possibility to have a warm soup with a wonderful view over the city with a provided blanket if needed.

Beautiful structure with a great view. An historical sight in Budapest, truly a must-see. I would visit this sight and go visit the Matthias church and the Buda Palace at the same day. Walking around the Bastion was very exciting, and the view of the city and the river was fantastic. I would also recommend climbing the 200 stairs at the tower of the adjacent Matthias church, in order to get an even better view (aerial) of this sight.

Superb, amazing views... As soon as i arrived here, i had to pay some money and get a ticket to go all the way to the top, (the price wasn`t much) you just walk upstairs and the views are even more superb.. Great place and a must visit..
Awesome area. Beautiful setting around the Matthias Church. Loved this area. Nice views of the city through the openings in the wall.

Great views!. What a great spot to visit!! Lovely views and so much to see up there! its a bit of a work out if you walk to the top but there is a lift of sorts that can take you right to the top.Definitely take your camera here!

Vistas, views and visitors.. Amazing views of the surrounding city and the Danube. Our taxi drove us right up to the entrance. Although there were many tourists the place is spacious and gives great views of the surrounding city.
Live music also filled the air and created a wonderful atmosphere.
Big views. It is in Buda side and has one of the most beautiful views of th Pest side. Take your camera because you'll need it.

Interesting Structure, Great Views. Fisherman's Bastion is a beautiful ornate structure with gorgeous views. Having said that this is not an "old" structure, it is just over 100 years old. Even by American standards, that's not very old :).It is however a place to relax and take in the views, rest up, bring out the map and guide book and figure out where to go next. As it is located in the Castle - Matthias Church area it is an easy visit.

Must see, but dont miss thebasilica. It's an excellent spot to visit, but try to avoid all the tourist traps in the area. you can buy much cheaper souvenirs in other parts of the city).If yoy want to go up on the walls you'll have to pay, I suggest climbing the tower of St. Stephen Basilica instead for the best view in Budapest.

Worth a visit , crowded but lovely views. The Fisherman's Bastion is a general description of the area on the Buda part of Budapest which is across the river from Parliament & the Pest part. It includes the beautiful Magyars church with it's tall Tower & the surrounding walls which you can walk along. You can purchase tickets for the church , tower & access to the turrets & walls but some sections can be closed at certain times. When we visited a wedding was taking places so some of the turrets were shut but the price remains the same. There are also sections that you can access for free so have a look before you buy a turret ticket.

Pay and Go all the way up. So once you reach Mathia's church, you pay a couple of more hundreds to go up one more flight of stairs - for that Perfect and lot more private view. That's fisherman's bastion for you - no idea why the name but worth every penny!

Between the hillside and St Mátyás Church. The neo-Gothic and neo-Romanesque style of the Bastion of Fisherman is always fascinating. Located immediately behind of St. Matthew Church in Buda is a walking path where you can admire the spectacular view of the historical old town (Pest) and if your camera and stuff is good enough you can take a nice picture of the Parliament from the hill. The scenery is so nice and you can take a look at all the famous bridges of Budapest in the Danube. Free entrance at night, not sure about the morning and the afternoon because of some fence I saw (but I have always gone there after 8pm and it was for free)

Beautiful views, popular tourist spot.. Wonderful views, but very busy tourist site for obvious reasons. Fee for everything but not too expensive. Food in the neighborhood is very expensive as are the shops. accessible by public transportation. WARNING!!!!!!!! everytime you get on public transportation stamp your ticket IN THE BUS of SUBWAY CAR!!!! Fines are very expensive and your tickets are regularly checked. This is a very good way for the city to raise tourist dollars.

Picturesque Budapest panorama. Any time of day or night the view from here is great. One of the most worthy (and free) attraction at 6 am - watching the sunrise. Challenging? Oh yes. But so beautiful at the same time.
Relax. A beautiful place and the most important place to get to, at Buda side. Here you can find peace and just stay.

Stunning view not to be missed :-). The view of Pest & the Danube is simply spectacular from Fisherman's Bastion in Buda. It enhanced the city skyline & showed it at its very best :-) Most definitely worth the trip uphill you will love it!!!!!!!
Stunning!. By far the most beautiful set of buildings in the city and all close at hand. This is a great area to visit and close to the castle.
Great views. This is a must see if visiting the Castle District. It gives marvellous views of the Danude and Budapest and for HUF350/pers (senior’s ticket) it is well worth visiting.

Castle Hills and Fisherman's. Great place to walk around and spend half a day. We took a taxi from the Marriott and for $12 we were dropped off right by the Church. Great walking area. When we were ready to leave, there were taxis at the same place. Much easier thatn traipsing across the bridge, taking the bus or walking up the hill unless that is what one wants to do.

Very pretty. Nice place to go for a view of the city. The structure itself is also quite nice. Don't understand why there's a 700huf charge to go up a flight of stairs for basically the same view. We didn't pay that fee because it was incredibly pointless, we had the same view for free just a few feet below. Gotta make money somehow I guess.

Best to visit at night. Impressive architecture with great view of Budapest town and the river Danube. A bit of a climb if walking from the Chain Bridge area, but you can get a bus to the top or take the vanicular railway.

Still beautiful, but commercial. The views from here are still stunning. As much as it is kitchy, the baroque style structure frames the Danube views perfectly. However I have visited this place in the past, and this time is was overwhelmingly touristy. Its nor the hundreds of tourists that visit, its the commercialization of the place. Most of the viewing terraces which are part of the historic building are now occupied by coffee houses that limit your access to the view.
VERY beautiful. The Fishermans bastion is like a fairy tale bastion to frame the cathedral perfectly ... Beautiful panoramic views o fate city ...not to be missed
Great view of both cities day and night!!. This is a great spot to overlook Budapest day and night. The cities absolutely sparkle at night and this offers a magnificent view!!
Scenic views. Part of a beautiful part of Buda with spectacular views over the River Danube. A very busy area but there is plenty of room for everyone. Well worth visiting.

Nice view. It is a great place to see the pest side of Budapest. Something you can do bun not a must. It is a promenade that has a view in the church and on Pest.
You can use the funicular to go up there which is very nice since it's old and not very expensive.
Don't pay for this. Use the free part.. You can go up on a part of this parapet-like structure for free and see the view. Don't pay to go up on the othe part. There is nothing different.
Splendid views and great location. We visited here at the same time as viewing the castle district. The views from here are just wonderful and it should not be missed when visiting the area.
marvellous views. this is a must see location with great views and excellent atmosphere . it is of course very touristy but authentic enough. visit if you can
Anothe Budapest tourist "must-see". High above the Danube in the Castle District, great views great photograpy. Another one of Budapest's "must-see" tourist destinations
Must visit. The views over the city from the Fishermans Bastion are absolutely fabulous well worth the climb up.

Fisherman's at Night. The best birdeyeview at night! Also 3 in 1- Fishermans Castle + The Hilton + Matthias Church. Its nice to walk around the night especially in the summer period, cause it gives such a good felling to your trip!

Great view of Budapest.. Place is a good old construction. But then the name 'Fisherman's Bastion' origin is curious - fisherman coming to the aid of the nation to fight excursions & were rallied upon much ore than the soldiers. Other than this this place gives a fantastic breathtaking view of Budapest.

Fantastic views. A great place to visit offering fantastic views over Budapest. If you want to go on the top level there is a charge but you don't need to as there are plenty of places to take photos on the lower level

Wonderful city. Budapest is a wonderful city! The fantastic, breathtaking panoramic of the capital is from the Fishermen's Bastion the best! Woww!!
Robert
Fairytale architecture. Worth a visit to just get the panoramic views of the Danube & the city of pest. The architecture of the fisherman's bastion resembles fairytale castles & looks very beautiful.

Fantastic views over the Danube and of Pest. Fishermans Bastion is in the castle district of Buda, close to the Matyas church. It takes the form of a renovated colonnade which houses several cafes and restaurants. There are steps which allow you access to the top ramparts (you have to pay for access though it's free after 8pm). You don't need to access the top ramparts to have spectacular views and photo opportunities. Be careful not to be ripped off in this area, prices are a lot more expensive than in Pest it really is a tourist trap but you can't afford to miss all that there is to see in the area. The number 16 bus takes you from Pest to the castle area, cost is 450 ft each which can be paid on the bus

What a view. To reach the Fishermans Bastion it's either the treck up the steps, a ride on the funicular or a short bus journey from the end of Chain Bridge. Which ever way you get there you will be rewarded with fabulous views over the city. Right next to Matthias Church and only a short walk from other attractions in the Buda Castle area, this is a must see.

Fantastic at Night. We were staying in the Buda castle hotel and one joy at night was to be able to wander down and enter for free and just sit and soak up the fantastic view that is spread out below you.After all the crowds had gone late out night there were only a handful of people enjoying this wonderful attraction.The number 16 bus from the center stops right outside Matthais church which is in front of Fishermans bastion. The terminus for this bus in the centre is opposite the La Meridien hotel, where the Budapest eye is situated. Takes around 10 mintes up to the castle area, cost 350.
A fairy tale come true. One of my favorite corners in all the city!! I highly recommend this fairy-tale to anyone visiting Budapest!!

THE must view to enjoy in Budapest. This is a MUST place to visit when in Budapest. The view over the river and city of Pest with the prominent Houses of Parliament, viewed through the arches, is just stunning. Be warned though, in hot weather it is a HOT walk up there, but you can always catch a bus, or use the city centre Hop on Hop off tourist busses, which are quite good value with all the extra add ons.You'll find the Cafe Panaramia here also, with the same stunning view though stone arches, with the advantage of enjoying a snack or just a drink whilst sat enjoying the view. There was a live Hungarian Trio playing while we were there - wonderful! Yes, the drinks were a little more expensive, but how do you value such a lovely experience.
View it by the day time.. Great View by the day. A lot of wind and breezy (be careful with cameras and tripods). It's reachable by local transportation.

Put on the walking shoes. This was amazing and wort a good look. The view is great and picture taking is amazing. Worth about half a day. There is a fountain around in back and a place to have a cup of tea and pastry.
Great Views. What beautiful views and lovely architecture around you. Pretty statues. Definitely worth the trip. The church is lovely to see also which is right there. A Hungarian highlight.

Beautiful views - No need to pay entrance fee. This is a beutiful place both for the architecture and the view. In the past the full area was just open to the public. these days there is one section which you must pay an entrance fee to go up. Really there is no need to do this, hopefully they will not try to blocak public access entirely in the future but for now, the views are just as good from places you do not need to pay a fee to come close to.

Exotic looking walk. Situated in the castle area and gets really crowded, as quite narrow for the amount of tourists wanting to walk it. The views can be seen with out going on the walls, but if you have gone up there you might as well.
Castle attraction. It was like walking around a part of Hogwarts, really lovely place to spend some time. Free to explore outside.

Beautiful. Beautiful but crowded! To get to the second etage was an entrence fee taken, totally unnecessary an stupid. There was also an restaurant situated in the first floor. So to get that fantastic view you need money...

Superb View of Pest. It will awe you how much of the Pest side you can see.
Take the stairs, it'll get you to the top quicker than waiting in that trolley line.
The stairs are historical too.

Enchanting. What a whimsical place! I truly enjoyed exploring the Buda side, and Fisherman's Bastion, its history and culture, cuisine and people. Make this a must on your Budapest list. Have a coffee or lunch at one of the places on top of the Bastion and enjoy splendid Budapest vistas...

Views. The central meeting point on castle hill represents the 7 tribes of the Magyars, with the pointy tents of the former nomads. Views are amazing and DO NOT pay extra for any views. Go to the far north where there is a cafe and photo to your heart's content.

great views. The only problem was the crowds on a sunday. Unfortunately, it is always busy on a sunday so I would recommend visiting any other day of the week. There are great food kioskis there as well as some shops but fabulous views

Great tourist atraction!. If you are in Budapest, don't miss it, totally worth it, specially if there's good weather :)
Tip: Before going, walk along the river and try to do it in the late-afternoon/evening.

On a tour. Wonderful place weather was amazing could see clearly in all directions. Good tip Hilton toilet is great if you need to go good ATM in the outside of the building. Was a fIry tale moment well worth the way up to have a look the walk down just as stunning. Even in the off season found a good place near the river to rest and recover a couple of drinks and good soup.

GREAT area to stroll and explore!. I lived in Budapest for a year and always enjoyed this area of Buda. There are a number of hidden gems that you should make the effort to find and explore. One is the Faust Wine Cellar under the Hilton Hotel. Yes, UNDER the Hilton Hotel. This part of Buda is comprised of limestone caverns and labyrinths and there is a wonderful and highly unique experience to have here. Call ahead and make sure they are open. Also, St. Matthias' Cathedral has symphonies at various times. Unlike most other parts of the world, European churches are activated for more than just worship. My wife and I caught Mozart's Requiem here and it was AMAZING! The acoustics are unbelievable and it was VERY inexpensive to attend. Enjoy!

The Bastion: A landmark not to miss. It is one of the most impressive landmark in Buda part of the city.from the Bastion you can have an impressive view of the Danube and Pest part. So Do not miss your camera.We sit there in a cafeteria where we had delicious snacks with some Hungarian Musicians playing international music. they were even able to play some Arab famous songs upon our request.The outside area of the bastion is for free. If you wanna enter the 2nd floor balcony or inside it, you will have to buy ticket. We did not have enough time for that.It is a place you must visit if you are in Budapest

It's worth a look. We used the hop on hop off bus to get up the hill and spend a good part of the day up there. The Fisherman's Bastian was our last stop before walking down to our hotel.The building itself is quite impressive but the atmosphere is improved by the cafes that are scattered around. We ended up having coffee and cake and enjoying the view and the music provided there.

BEAUTIFUL. This sand-castle like bastion is really charming inside and out. I only wish those ridiculous-a-bottle-of-cheap-cider-for-24,000-HUF places did not occupy the interior, so one could enjoy the view.

FISHERMAN'S BASTION. Wonderful place to visit to get an excellent view of the whole Budapest area. There is also a lovely church there to explore. In the area are places to grab a bite and wonderful ice cream too. Lots of souvenir shops along the road leading to the Bastion.Well worth the small fee.

A must see. Not only did we have fabulous views of Budapest and the Danube River from this terrace, but what an interesting place this is. It once was used as a lookout tower for the castle that sat on the grounds. There are 7 lookout towers in honor of the 7 Magyar tribes that settled in the area, in what became Hungary. It is a very busy tourist spot, that looks like a movie setting or a fabulous sand sculpture, when seeing all the turrets. Also here is a church, shops, restaurants, a Statue of St. Stephen on Horseback and a Hilton Hotel.

Second visit. A must see if you haven't been in Budapest before, I had been here before and would say that the second time it doesn't look as impresive. Yet it is free and the view is very nice and my friend who had been in Budapest before really liked it.

Excellent music, food ambient and view on Budapest. This was brightest moment of our weekend. Band played Cardas ... on violin, bas ... and it was perfect. We have eat gulash which was splendid. View on Pest and Danube was great.

Oh... we're here!!!. We were walking around and didn't realise we were actually here... beautiful views of the Danone, lovely cafes and restaurants around. Buda has a completely different atmosphere to Pest.
Fantastic view. Visited the tower and walked around . Fantastic views of the Parliment and river. Spent several hours there including a visit to the Church which is a must see.
Great views. Great view of parliament house, went at night and it was beautiful. Very romantic and nice place to share a gelato.

Views of the danube. Great views of the danube! We spent the better part of an afternoon walking around and visiting Matthias Church(climbing the tower).We also ate at the cafe in the park(Picnik???)which was very good for grabbing some snacks and enjoying the atmosphere.
Well worth the walk to this view point. The views on a sunny day are amazing - you see right across the river to the Pest side and the parliament buildings. A great viewing point of the city.

Great panoramic views . Amazing panoramic views of Budapest. It's just 700 HUF ($2.50) to enter but if you're a tightwad you'll probably complain since you can get a view for free a little lower that's only a bit worse.

amazing view amazing place. amazing place and the view from there is stunning!! you absolutle have to go there and see all the castle area!! you can take amazing pictures from the parliament and the church is amazing!! dont miss the place!!

Great view and even better food and service. This Buda restaurant has the best view is the Pest side of Budapest. It is just behind the Hilton and requires reservations. The food and service were exceptional, bring a camera!

YORK. UK. This summer i had the opportunity to travel and visit york. I stayed for only one day but i managed to wander through its victorian streets and york castle museum . the museum exhibits the prison cell of highwayman Dick Turpin. At the city centre i visited Minster Gothic Cathedral and the Roman Bathhouse, the shambles market, the Opera House and also wandered through the Ghost Trail which endorses a macabre legend that took place in that era. York is a marvelous city to explore and i wished i could have stayed longer to absorb all the rich historical sights.

Good place to visit in Buda side of Budapest. Great views over the Danube to the East, and good nearby souveneir shops. There was a small band playing while we were having coffee, enjoying the view. Architecture of the Bastion is magnificent.
Best view . The view is awesome. I didn't realize until I read these comments that people went there to dine or eat. I didn't but you still can access the amazing view. It's worth the walk

Disney looking castle. Went there both during the day and evening. the view was beautiful. If i lived in Budapest this would be my spot to get away and just be. its in Buda hills which is so calm and cosy. Loved walking around there, Had good restuarants aswell! we didnt pay to get to the top towers but i think u dont need to. The difference was not that big
Enchanting. This area of Buda is not to be missed. Especially in the evening . The view is spectacular and very charming.
Amazing view of Pest. Beautiful small castle with an amazing view of the lake and whole Pest side. Great for photographs :)

Wow tourist.. This area looks very nice but it is crawling with coach loads of obnoxious tourist. There is a Hilton hotel right in the middle. We took a stroll through it but couldn't wait to walk off to the surrounding streets which are beautiful.

Spectacular - Not to be missed. The castle area of Buda rewards its visitors with truly spectacular architecture and views over the Danube towards the sparkling Gothic parliament building.This is a major tourist destination so don't expect to avoid the crowds which start arriving in bus loads from around 10.00 a.m. Cafes and restaurants are also a tad on the tourist trail tarriff so be prepared. The Fisherman's Bastion was enlarged and enhanced in time for the millennium celebrations of the Hungarian monarchy in 1896. It was partly destroyed in the battle of Budapest 1944-45 but has been spectacularly restored.You really can't visit Budapest without going to see the Castle of Buda complex. Make sure you set aside a whole day - you will need it if you hope to see everything.

A Fantasy?. When one first approaches this landmark, the first thought is that it was constructed for tourists. Not so - it dates back to the thirteenth century. the upper portion was rehabilitated at the end of the nineteenth century. Walt Disney had to have seen this, or pictures of it, when contemplating Disneyland.

Spectacular view of Pest. The Bastion is a beautifully designed and maintained viewing platform and is the ideal location from which to view the Pest side of Budapest. It really is a must-see on any visit to Budapest. I recommend descending the steps below the bastion through one of the former fortress gates to view the walls of the Buda fortress from below.
For the View. Linger a while here.. .it is just outside St. Matyas church. Go to overlook to avoid tourist crowds. And don't try walking up unless you have unlimited time and energy!
Fishermen's Bastion. I had heard about it and seen pictures. Now I have seen the real thing. Beautiful area and offers great views of the river and Parliament.
Great views. Free photo opt.. Excellent spot to take a shot of the Hungarian Parliament Building from the Buda side. And it's free.
must see!. really love it!go there 2 times,at daytime but do that also at nighttime!!magical!!you have a great view over the parlement as well!

Beautiful part of the castle complex. This is also essential to visit in Budapest. You can spend a long, long time here looking at the views over Pest, wandering round the church or just enjoying the amazing imperial architecture. It is almost over the top but fits its surroundings. There are buses up, or an enormous set of steps that would not be out of place in a Disney movie. The area is kept in beautiful repair and spotlessly clean.

Full of life, fantastic panorama views, storybook scenes. We didn't pay to enter the bastion, but were advised we could see the same view from the terraces for free....which was true. The views from up here were fantastic. Able to look down upon Buda and Pest and along the Danube at beautiful building after beautiful building. The seven bastions have a fairytale quality....don't miss the chance to see this great place.

Stunning Architecture, Stunning View. Built in the 19th century, this shimmering white neo-gothic/neo-Romanesque lookout point is an architectural marvel.High up on the Buda side of the city, it is always crowded, but big enough to accommodate a large number of people. It affords a spectacular view over the Danube towards Pest, especially in the late afternoon when the sun lights up the beautiful Parliament building.

Must see . Fantastic view of the city of Pest from the Buda side. It seemed that you can see forever on a clear day. It is well maintained and easy to visit. We are a couple that has fished in several different countries so this venue was important to us. Highly recommended
Gorgeous views of the Danube. A must see on the Buda side. Beautiful views of the Danube and a fascinating part of Castle Hill. Other attractions and places to have meals are very close by
Should visit. The place is well preserved, situated at the high part of Buda, just in front of the center Pest over the Danuba.We took great pictures here.
Adventure Budapest. The words used to describe This fairytale castle is Disneyesq. It is just an absolutely amazing place to visit.
A must do!. really pretty buildings, and a lovely view of the city!Spent around 2 hours up there. And is really easy/simple too walk!

WOW! Too beautiful to describe. Recently got back from a Viking Cruise and we started in Budapest and Fisherman's Bastion was gorgeous. We took a funicular ride to the top and walked around and took many pictures. An amazing view to the city and it was worth the walk and the steps! Not to be missed!!
Good hike and afternoon visit. Fun to hike around and take the walk back down the hill. Beautiful stonework. Well worth the effort to see.

Beautiful building. This is a beautiful building and one of the highlight of Castle tour. Only thing which we did not like is some of the areas are blocked by eating outlets so everyone can not see it.

Lovely view. Great architecture and lovely views across the river and city. Several fairly easy walks up; slopes / steps and a funicular railway for those who'd rather arrive in style.Pleasant cafe bar under part of the structure, public areas under the rest.Nothing to be gained by paying to go up to the second level.Borders the Castle complex, all very nice.

One of the most beautiful compounds you'll ever see . A combo of Art Deco, Romantic and classical architecture, makes the Bastion look as if it was taken out of a fiction movie, except its real. Best time to visit is at late afternoon. See my pictures, and you will understand why.

Quintessential Fairy Tale Imagery. This place really does evoke quintessential fairy tale imagery. Take it for what it's worth: a highly popular tourist attraction. There are a great number of seriously amazing Buda attractions nearby. We happened to be there as a medieval lute band were playing in the courtyard area (which just multiplied the atmosphere). The view to Pest across the Danube is stunning.
