I have to admit ignorance regarding the historical reason for such beautiful turrets, but I imagine it cost some regent(s) a pretty penny to build these faerie-folk inspired structures.However, for me, one sullying feature is that the Hilton chain have managed to jack-hammer an eyesore of an edifice right next to the Western part of Fisherman's Bastion.

Beautiful. Either walk along this terrace or go up in the tower. Don't pay for both. Great views. Beautiful architecture. Outdoor so needs to be clear to really enjoy. Cafe with best view is closed on Mon.
Coffee with a view. Great views, and architecture. Well worth a walk around. If you need a coffee, walk to the top of the wall and overlook pest.

Best view in town. I had the opportunity to visit this site today. My guide explained to me that it was built by the an architect that felt there was something missing at the site of Matyas Church. She explained that the seven towers represent the seven tribes that settled Budapest, and the style of the towers are in the style of the tents the tribes lived in at the time. This place was really cool. This is a great place to take pictures of the city. Also, there is a cafe to sit and have a coffee or drink.

An unforgetable evening!. You are going to experience ashtonishing views and feel the medieval time machine. If you are with a scooter, you can pass the bar and park inside. It connects with the Budapest castle by walking distance.
Worth climbing the hill. Worth climbing the hill for the views you experience from here. Interesting to see such a different side of the city if you're staying in Pest, as we were.
Beauty and the beast . We was told the castle on beauty and the beast was based on this and we could see the similarities between them, beautiful views over the city.
Wonderful landscape. The whole old Buda district is nice, with some of the city's highlights, but Halaszbastya is surely the best.

Great views!. The sunset over the Pest side of Budapest are truly awesome from the Fisherman's Bastion. We were lucky enough to get the perfect room at the Hilton that looked down into the Bastion and across the Danube. One of the most spectacular views ever!
Fabulous views. This place is crawling with tourists and no wonder -- the views are marvelous. Allow a half day. We enjoyed walking and climbing everywhere as there is plenty to be seen in the area.

Living Fairy Tale. We took tons of pictures at Fisherman's Bastion. This place just made me feel like I should be in Game of Thrones and that a dragon might arrive at any moment! I felt like I was living in a fairy tale.

Essential stop on your Budapest itinerary. You don't need an admission ticket. You can buy one, but it only takes you to a slightly higher level. You might want to buy it if you don't want to jostle with as many other tourists for a view, but otherwise, the 3 meters of height doesn't offer views you can't see below. There are also wonderful vistas at multiple points on the stairs going down the hill. Skip the restaurant. There are better options on the hill.

Like Disneyland. The beauty of this building cannot be overstated. It is simply breathtaking and anyone visiting Budapest would be mad to miss it. There are so many fantastic photo opportunities as well. It's difficult to put into words the sheer beauty of this spot.

Best panoramic view on the city&The Parlament. Visited Fisherman's bastion in the evening. Wonderful panoramic of the city during sunset. Also visit an cafe nere by vith live music and panoramic views.

Amazing view -- Lousy food. The views from this location are stunning. Just realize .. the restaurant is set up for drinks. I ordered a salad. It was delivered in a little plastic box with a plastic fork on top. For such a stunning location, and high prices, I expected at least a plate. It took me a few minutes to realize that although they have a food menu they don't have a kitchen. Everything comes out of a refrigerator and is delivered "as is". They are set up well for drinks .. So order something to drink, drink slowly, enjoy the view, and then go eat somewhere else.
Stunning Views. Stunning views of the city from here so it is a must see. Don't bother paying for a ticket to go up to the next level as the view is no better from there.
Fantastic views. Available on the hop on hop off bus tours. This is really a lovely area with great views over the danube towards pest.
Stunning Fisherman's Bastion. Insulting to say perhaps but it looks like something from a Disney film. It is stunning and the views are spectacular.

Stunning view.. What ever you do a "must see" is a trip to the Halaszbastya, even if you ignore the shops and eateries, just go for the stunning panoramic views over the Danube to the rest of the City.
The view from Buda. Historically interesting, with great views across the Danube of the whole panorama of Pest, with the Parliament building a prominent feature.

Beautiful panorama. Each time we pass through Budapest during our travel we take a short trip to walk all the way up from the Danube to the Bastion. The whole area is so beautiful. The Bastion is next to the St. Mathias church, absolutely amazing.The view of the Pest side of the city and all the bridges that connect to the Buda side is breathtaking.Do not miss it if in Budapest

Fisherman's Bastion. For an excellent view down onto the Parliament and the broader Pest side of the Danube. Picturesque turrets and walkways. When we visited there were historical discussions in the square and a book fare. Some of the cafes in the vicinity are more expensive than in other parts of Buda.
Don't leave Budapest without visiting it. Best views of a beautiful city of Budapest, excellent for photo position, romantic and magnificent. Day and night.
Sightseeing. One of the best sightseeing locations - to be visited both during daylight and night-time for best effects. Beautiful architecture and layout.
Wonderful views. This is a must.. Do not miss this on your stay. The views are amazing of the whole city. There were at least 3 bride & grooms up there taking wedding photos.

Stunning location, below average food. The location is out of this world, like something out of a fairy story. Inside it is just as beautiful . However I would recommend going just to look at the building and the view as the food was distinctly lack lustre and very over priced. Our food was Luke warm and nothing to write home about. The overall bill was £100 for 2 with only one of us drinking. We had much better meals in smaller restaurants for a fraction of the price.

Breathtaking view. Its a must see in Budapest. The whole district in the palace has a special athmosphere, there is a lot of to see also in the near of Halaszbastya. Planty of restaurants, caffeterias, shops are there directly.
Very beautiful. Take time to enjoy this breathtaking spot to enjoy the views of the city and the church. Beware of Roma's trying to distract and sell you something.
What a view. What a view fantastic took my breath away could sit there all day the view of the city is amazing have a drink here it will make your holiday
Beautiful views. Gorgeous memorial under the beautiful cathedral. The views from here across the river to parliament are breathtaking.

Beautiful view of the city. You can’t miss this structure if you are at the castle district. The is an entry fee to go up top, which I think is worth it for what your eyes meet. Would strongly recommend a quick stop here, if you have the time.

Buda's view. The Fisherman's Bastion is located on the Buda side next to Matthias Church. The views from the Bastion of the Danube River and to the Pest side are stunning. There is a cafe where you can sit and marvel at the view. You cannot expect to walk in and take a photograph of the view- the management do not like it and will tell you off as I saw them do to a couple of American tourists. The place is always busy as there are many tourists there. The best time to go would be late in the afternoon. As with all tourist spots, the prices of water, ice cream and cafes/restaurants are on the high side. For example, an ice cream with two scoops on a cone will set you back nearly £2 (Aug 2015).I noted a couple of ladies selling traditional lace items. You need to haggle well to get a good price as the first price quoted is ridiculous price.

Like in a fairy tale. You can't miss this place. You will fill like being part of a fairy tale...and it's just 20 minutes walk from Budapest city center! It is localted on top of the Castle hill, called Várhegy in Hungarian. Take your time to enjoy the beautiful buildings, the colorful roof of the 700-years old Mátyás-templom, and the astonishing view of the river and the city just below your feet. The seven neo-gothic towers represent the seven ungarian tribes that conquered the land known today as Ungary!

Gleaming. Built as a monument to the Guild of Fishermen at the end of the 19th century, the Fishermen's Bastion is a neo-Romanesque collection of arches and turrets overlooking Pest. Don't pay to take photos, but move lower down where you can snap away for free. Can become very crowded. Quite a steep walk up, but try the bus 15 which stops nearby. Great coffee shop and buskers.
Beautiful Architecture!!. Absolutely beautiful. A five min. walk from the Palace with great views over the Danube towards Parliament. Well worth a visit.

Magnificent place, magnificent views. This is a surprising place with some of the best views of the capital, with Buda on one side and Pest on the over separated by the beautiful Danube River. The architecture is truly beautiful and its a pleasure to walk around. We had the added benefit of being able to hold a falcon (for a small price of 2 Euro. Definitely a must see.

Medieval Grandeur. Castle Hill is a must, its a great day out where you get to see such varied architecture all within minutes walk from each other. Out of the 3 main attractions on Castle Hill, Fisherman's Bastion is possibly the most interesting. Matthias Church is stunningly beautiful and Buda Castle is large and grand however the Bastion is quite different with its light coloured bricks and almost medieval feel. Its unlike anything I've seen before and makes for some lovely photos.

FISHERMEN PROTECT THEIR OWN!. Fishermen's Bastion is only 100 years old. It is a favorite lookout to view the Danube and Parliament.. It was built to remember the fishermen who protected this part of the city. The seven turrets represent the seven Hungarian tribes that came there in 896.Here's a hot tip. There is a fee to enter the lookout at the top level. But you can enter the lower level lookout for free and the view is still great.
Great views of the city . Worth the trip to visit the Bastille and the Basilica. We spent the morning between the two . Great architecture and art
Best views of Pest. Quirky building that is very aesthetically pleasing. Lovely views, nice terrace restaurant with live music.

Unique photo stop. Fisherman's bastion are ornate walls, turrets and a tower that is situated on castle hill (Buda side of Budapest), that surrounds St Mattias Church. There is an expensive entry fee, but the lower level (with 99.999% of the same views) is accessible for free - so it makes for a unique photo stop.

An absolute fairytale building . By far my favourite place in Budapest and have visited multiple times during my week holiday with my boyfriend. Just phenomenal. The white brickwork gleams in the sunshine and the turrets make it look like something from a Disney movie. The views are so beautiful and when coupled with the astounding St Mattias Church it's just ethereal! At night time this place is ten times more amazing and you can go up onto the battlements for free which is well worth waiting until night for. The whole city sparkles across the river and I cannot speak highly enough of this beautiful place!

Great view of the parliament building. Nice views from here of the river and parliament building. The place itself is unusual and worth a look. The hike up is quite steep but nothing to strenuous. There's a nice cafe in the right corner overlooking the city with good coffee and a jazz band.

Beautiful views and lovely old city.. The Fisherman's Bastion area of Buda was lovely. We didn't realize how large the old city of Buda was and how much there was to see until it was almost at the end of our short stay. If we return to Budapet, we will stay in the old city.
Worth a look. The fishermans bastion is a must see could have been stolen straight outta Disney but has a much more significant history definitely worth the trip

Beautiful. There was a stunning view over the river so it's worth going up but if you want to do it for free go up to the cafe part. It's a really beautiful place in its self and can be done whilst waiting to go up the tower or en route to the palace.

Not to be missed. Feels like a magnificent Church on a hill.With its majestic views over Pest, its coloured tiled roofs, beautiful white stone buildings and Austrian like terraces. Lovely place, not to be missed

brilliant views,lovely area. Fisherman,s Bastion is free.It is a lovely area,battlements,pointed towers,fountain,cafe,s,fantastic views of Pest and River Danube.Worth an hour or two before going to Mathias Church and the rest of Castle District.
Incredible view. The view was beautiful across the river to Pest. At night with the lights on the Parliament Building, it is even more magnificent.

Amazing. I had a walk at the Halaszbastya a nice evening in june. These buildings are amazing, like a Cinderella castle, and the views are wonderful, you can see miles away if the skies are clear. Anyone visiting Budapest will enjoy this place!

Worth the Hike ...... Up in the Hills of Buda, you get a great view from the Fishermans Bastion overlooking the Danube. Best time to go is early morning or late evening as totally over run with other tourists during the day . Its open all night, so great place to go for an after dinner stroll.

The heart of buda. Once I recovered from the walk up the hill I found the lift. Then after walking around a bit an old train-lift. I reminded myself to do the research before I start out. The views were wonderful from fisherman's bastion and many other sights and historic buildings were nearby. I was lucky as it was independence day and the was street fares and food stalls. There was a man with an massive eagle sitting by the fountain all adding to the ambience of magic. Do not miss this it is the heart of Buda.

A very romantic place..... in the late evening. Halaszbastya is a must for visitors in Budabest, Most people go there in the daytime, but it is much better to go there when it's getting dark, and the lightening is on. The view over Danub and Budapest is absolutely stunning, and the Bastion itself is also beautiful. Undortunately they now charge you for a fee if you want to go through the whole building, but there are still places which are free to go. There are also restaurants inside the Bastion. Good view, high prices and poor food.The Halaszbastya was build around 1895 to make Budapest as beautiful as Wienna.

Europe travel adventure 2015. I was amazed from the architectural structure of the buildings with the overlooking view of the the entire Budapest when your in fisherman's bastion.such a lovely view.great experience indeed.

Beautiful!!. One of the most beautiful places I have visited, the view over the Danube is truly amazing. We walked around the Castle area all morning just enjoying the views and none of it cost a penny.

One of the most captivating sights in Budapest. Yes, fisherman's bastion buzzing with tourists but that won't stop you from admiring the beautiful view it offers. To start with, the architecture of the bastion reminds of an old fairy tale. The entrance is free everywhere except a higher layer of the bastion (we did not go there, there's not much point to anyway in my opinion) I could spend all of my time there, if only we weren't in the whole "sightseeing rush". Try going there at sunset (which i did not manage to do) for stunning pictures.I would definitely visit the bastion when I'm in Budapest again. Do not miss it!
Lovely view. We were very disappointed that we could only walk a very small part as the rest is now a restaurant. Not sure how much it cost as we were on a tour.

Intriguing designs. This place was quirky and interesting! Unfortunately you had to pay to go through most of the building, but I there was an area where a cafe was on the far left where you could go through and see the views below! The architecture was intriguing throughout.

Interesting architecture and vista. When you visit Bude Castle you will find yourself heading towards Fisherman's Bastion as it overlooks the Danube and the Pest. Well that's about it. Do the Walking Tour if you want to learn more about Fisherman's Bastion, which isn't much.
Worth a visit. From here you have a breathtaking view over the Danube and the Parliament on the other side of the river. Building is not as old as you might think, it was build in 1895

Nice Views of Pest. Fisherman's Bastion is a very picturesque wall with small round towers above the banks of the Danube on the Buda side. After paying an entrance fee you may climb the steps and take a short walk along the wall. Here you have fantastic views of Pest and the Parliament Building. You also have a close up view of St. Matthias Church.

Nice church near bastions. The place is not so imppressing. There are just two bastions and a wall. I think the ticket won't worth the money, but is nice to have a drink up thare where are some restaurants, and visit the church which is beautifull.

Not what is once was. This is my second visit to Fisherman's Bastion. The views are still panoramic, but it has become too commercialized to enjoy. Every section seems to be roped off by some kind of restaurant or ice cream stall.

Great view, wrapped sandwiches almost as good as 7-12. Music, CDs of the band available and a wonderful view. But when we went they served us with Saran wrapped sandwiches from a cooler that were still in the wrap. Not quite up to the old 7-11 standards.
Great place with lovely views. This and Matthias church are a must in Buda. The structures of the bastion are lovely and the views of Pest across the river are absolutely wonderful!

Absolutely Stunning Views. This entire area, including the adjacent St. Mathias church, is a must-see, featuring amazing views and architecture. Built in the 1890s and in Romanesque style, the architecture of the viewing area is a must-see with stunning turrets, arches and places to see the Pest side of the city. Don't bother to pay for the view -- the free one through the arches is stunning.
Nice view. Very nice view above Budapest. Ideal for fotography, good for night watching. Potable water very close.
Great place, great views. Worth visiting. Great views of the river and Parliament. The church was beautiful. The underground hospital was really interesting.
A MUST SEE. such a beautiful place ,great to explore and the views are stunning .Make sure you you have got time to have a good look round

Yet another beautiful view of Budapest. A beautiful walk, picturesque, and close to other attractions. lots of stairs, and a great place for kids to let them move around before or after a museum or other, more quiet, experience. I've traveled a lot, and Budapest was the first time I've used Big Bus. They let you off very close to all these attractions and were a convenient way to see this part of Budapest. You'll take lots of pictures! :)

Halaszbastya. In the Varhegy hil when you are in the Castle district you can't miss to go to visit the Fishermen Bastions, in the oldest part of Budapest, where till 1903 was a simple place for a fishermen village! From a terrace, now a Unesco Site, you can have a splendid view of Pest.
disney land...ish. As it is part of the castle district it is worth having a look. views across the river are stunning. Charges for going up a few steps for the same view seem pointless.

Must visit. What a nice area and unbelivable buildings. It's a must seeing these gordious old buildings and seeing out over the whole city of Budapest. If you are interesting in old History, this is the place.
Beautiful. Beautiful building and a lovely part of Budapest. Fantastic views across to Pest and Parliament building

Not worth the money . It's a really nice view however it is literally less than 100m and you can get the same views from anywhere else. So if you're on a tight budget, I would miss this one out. But it is nice
More than beautiful . This is just a must to see if you're in Budapest. Together with the Matthias Church (located next to the Bastion) it's just a treat to the eyes.

Great views day and night!. The bastion is now inviting tourists instead of repelling invaders. The terraces provide excellent views over the city and Danube river. I always visit when in Budapest and recommend an evening and night visit too. see: http://www.lc-stars.com/budapest.html . You can eat on the terrace but it is fairly expensive at night and basically tourist catering. Instead duck into one of the many eateries on Buda hill or drop down to the Pest side of the city is you want cheaper and cheerful food.

You definitely wanna go there but don't buy the ticket!. The ticket to the Bastion is a trap and waste of money. There is one office near the Bastion selling tickets to the Bastion, Matthias Church (Mátyás Templom), and the tower of Matthias Church. The ticket to the Bastion is NOT NECESSARY at all, even though it's as low as 350 HUF (about 1 EUR). Only a very small portion of the structure is only accessible with a ticket. You can go to the restaurants in the structure and get a better view than in the ticket-only area. The restaurants may limit access to some areas, but it doesn't hurt! They do not stop you from getting to the top, and the top is substantially higher than the ticket-only area. After all, the tower is much higher than the Bastion.

Beatiful scenery. Budapest has been an eye opener for me and after so many years of traveling has definitively become my favorite city. I want to return as soon as I can to this marvelous city full of amazing sights and the most incredible walks. This particular area of town blew me away and quite obviously not only me as we saw in the space of 3 hours, 4 different couples taking their wedding pictures here! Well worth the visit!

Great view from here overlooking pest and city view . Next to the Mattius church. Fisherman's bastion will give you a towering view of pest and modern Budapest. Chain bridge and parliament will stand out from view. Nice stone structures will provide intimate shots of peaceful moments. Nice serous steps that will provide anyone a good exercise. But take it slow and enjoy the view from here.

Must do all 3!. Would highly recommend the ticket that allows you entrance to the church, the bastion and the tower. It is worth the price which isn't very expensive to begin with.The views from here are stunning across the Danube as well as offering a great view of Matthias Church and its spectacular roof.

Fairy-tale atmosphere. Saw lots of reports, photos; thought we knew what to expect here. Still stunned by the overwhelming fairy-tale atmosphere and endless entrancing details of this place. It is a bit spoilt by having a modern hilton hotel plonked in the centre but bills have to be paid and the good ole folks from the us of a still have a few bucks to splash around. Eventually we worked our way around to the Vienna Gate, then the Mathias Church and read the war stories on the display there. Walking further along we then discovered an Art shop with some very talented work on display/sale, then some absolutely fabulous little antique shops, and had lunch at the Miro Cafe. Highly recommended.

Must see. This is a Budapest must see, free attraction with spectacular view over the city and parliament building. Recommend to visit in summer time during nice weather period so you can enjoy nice walks around.
Great view . Nice view of the city and and enjoyable area to wander around. Don't bother taking the cable car up, it's a very easy walk up the hill
Medieval illusion. This was, for me, a very medieval alike experience! I really felt like if I was back in time of at least hundred years!!!

The Best Views of the Pest Side of Budapest. Do visit the Fisherman's Bastion on Castle Hill in the Buda side of Budapest. The views of the Danube and Pest from here are wonderful, especially the magnificent Parliament Building. It can be crowded at times during tourist season, but don't let that deter you from visiting the place. Also be sure to stop by at the nearby Matthias Church, it's beautiful and so full of history.

NICE VIEW. NOTE: you don't have to pay to enter the Fisherman Bastion!! There are two parts of tha bastion. The one is shirt and tiny and you have to pay for it... The bigger with the nice view is FREE!!! Trust me.

Medieval. It is something that you will visit, because is a part of many tourist attractions in a range of a 5-10 min. walk, like the castle Funicular, the palace, a complex of museums (some worth visiting others not depending on preference) and Matthias church. The towers that you see in the pics offer a great view of Danube and Pest side the bridges and Margaret island. In one of the towers you must pay a small fee to go, the other one has a cafe on top where you can visit for free to take a pic and sit if you like for a coffee. Nice walk if you choose to go downhill on foot instead of using the funicular.

Romantic and charming, with nice views.. One of the most beautiful spots of Budapest, accessible by bus (for example, the number 33). There are some beautiful views of the city and the river. The entire historic quarter is well maintained and has many historic attractions to enjoy.

Week in Budapest. This is just a tower bridge that allows for good views of the Pest side of Budapest. I don't know the cost but would not recommend paying more than 1000HUF (and less than 700HUF seems more appropriate) to walk across this. It was free the day I went due to the holiday. Nice view but nothing special. and almost the same view you can see from Gellerts Hill for free.

Great view. G react view but big crowds and no. Need to stay along time. Grocery store a great place to buy water vans paprika. Avoid the cloth packages and buy the foil ones or. The homemade ones in the market. Not family home. Made but local made and not corporate
Best views!. One of the best places to check the Danube river and the Pest side! At night, the view is just unbelievably astonishing (even though photos get ruined)

Amazing view, good food. If you can book a table and get there before sunset, the change in the city from day, to dusk to evening is worth the price of the food. The food is good, but expensive for Budapest. Great service. But it's the view over Pest you are paying for. Worth it for for a special occasion which it was for us (wedding anniversary)

Best view in town. Lovely area. We ended a brilliant free walking tour here. It was the perfect end to an incredibly informative walk of history. My daughter and I returned later in the evening to have a drink under the arches and watch the colours of the sun setting over Budapest. It was lovely looking across the river and watching the lights come on to the tourist attractions like parliament house and the chain bridge. Great spot to take some photos.

A must See. The views from here tell it all. You can see the whole city. There are some shops along the side streets and walkable for many. When you get to the top satisfy your thirst or hunger with ice cream.

Great architecture . Beautiful architecture and amazing views. However, it's not necessarily worth paying to walk onto the Bastion (cheap as it is!) - the views are great and it makes for some good photos, but the views are almost identical from the steps just below the Bastion, which are free!

Take your time. You have to see the fabulous city views from here during the day and after dark. Looking across the river and seeing the Pest side is amazing. And the bridges lit at night is great too.
Bot worth the money. The free section right next to it has the same view.So paying 700 forints each was a waste IMHO.I'd suggest skipping it.
Amazing place!. All the visitors have to visit this place. It's amazing all this area with the tower and the church !!
Just beautiful, views amazing. Just so unexpected. So beautiful and views over the Danube and city are amazing, must visit when in Budapest.

Breathtaking. Spend the afternoon wandering through the ancient buildings. Stop for lunch at the outdoor cafe and listen to the local violin players and soak up the view of the pest side of the river. Fabulous
Beautiful place and views!. Really nice place to visit and to take pictures. It is partly free of charge but if you wish to explore the whole area there is a little fee.
Amazing!. You cannot miss this place. Really amazing. A nice view on the city and if the sky is clear, over the reagion.

great view. located very close of the Buda Castle got Mathias church and its museum ,a historical virtual museum and a breath taking view for Buda. there is a gret restaurant sitting just at the side were u can enjoy the view. just amazing

Absolutely stunning. The Fisherman's Bastion was build in the 1890s. The architecture is beautiful with a panoramic terrace, 7 turrets and a lovely church. Most important however were the views across the Danube that were stunning. It is easy to get to using the stairs or the funicular. It is truly a site not to be missed!!
Lovely outdoor space.. This is the complex that St. Matthius is a part of. If you're going to see the church, then you'll be in Fisherman's Bastion. Has great views and is fun to walk around.
Must visit to the city. A must visit and some beautiful views across the river - highly recommended. Nice walk up but so worth it.

A must visit site beside the Mattyas Church. you can either pay 700 HUF at the Mattyas church Tiicket Office and be on a quieter - right hand side- part of the bastion or join the masses on the free left hand side of the bastion. Either side has fine views over the Danube, Pest and the Parliment building.

Beautiful Halaszbastya. Very beautiful - a few minutes walk from the Matthais church, Fisherman's bastion offers great views of the Danube and the parliament building on the opposite side. The cafe on the top is worth visiting.
Stunning and free of charge after 8pm. Go there after dark - entrance is free and the views of Pest is amazing particularly with a full red moon behind St Stephen' church.
Nice view. Been here from the funicular. We walked in the side of the palace and ended up in this place. I enjoyed the view from the river

Point of view!. Excellent point of view with the parliament building and the Danube in front!
A very nice castle and edifice.

Probably the best view of Budapest. The Fisherman's Bastion is a very nice complex in the middle of the Castle District. Its main feature is the astonishing panorama of the city - the Parliament building in front, the Chain Bridge, the Castle and the Gellért Hill on the right and the Margaret Bridge and Island on the left. The Bastion also includes a nice restaurant and café.

So beautiful!. My husband and I caught a cab to Fisherman's Bastion. It is absolutely beautiful! The views are amazing and the architecture, wow! There is no fee but if you want to go up through the towers you will require a ticket. I am not sure if it is allowed but we went to the barrier and the person collecting the tickets asked us for some money and let us through. It was about 1000TF which is about £2.40 for two of us. There is a restaurant with great views - apparently you need to book way in advance. We tried to book a dinner there but no availability - so probably a great idea for couples/romantic trips!

Beautiful with amazing city views. Amazing place, which looks like something out of a disney movie. A tip: They charge you to go up the turret near the entry, but if you just go to the turret on the other side entry there is free
Awesome view . The view is incredible from up here. I love that the whole castle is kept clean and in particular, this area is so nice with the church and the spacious square next to it.

My visit. A wonderful walking to the Bastion, remembering the history as told, the scenic beauty from the balcony the bridges on the Danube, number of icecream parlours, music while eating ^all put together had been a wonderful experience. Bring your camera and if available the zoom to capture the moments of lifetime.

Osamah visit . Fantastic view and excellent building. The architecture is so marvelous and the view of the city from there is great. The shops around the area are expensive. You can find the same items in the downtown shops with lower prices.
Part of the castle district. Beautiful fortifications in front of Matthias church. Must see, but it is a part of the castle district, so go for it!
Spectacular view.. Well worth the walk across the bridge to get a spectacular view of the city. Have a walk around the neighbourhood while you are there. It is a beautiful part of town.

Lovely views of the City. Really beautiful area with great views of the city and Danube. It was a shame everything required payment but if you walk right to the left there is a small section which is free to look from.
Great view. THe views from the monument are in fact monumental. You get to see all of Pest before you, great photo opportunity!

Worth the Effort. Perched at the top of one of the hills on the Buda side overlooking much of the city, including a long stretch of the Danube, this is a very interesting place. The are several spires, the tallest of which has a very small snack bar inside at the top with a few outdoor tables. The views of the city from all areas of this place, which is probably 100 yards or so wide are spectacular, especially if there is not a lot of haze. At night you can see many of the bridges, the parliament building and many other buildings lit up all over the city. It is quite spectacular. There is no admission cost and it is adjacent to St. Matthais church, another good attraction. It is also a popular place for weddings and when they are being prepped for or occurring, some or all of the area appears to be off limits to the public. We saw 3 brides over the course of an afternoon and evening on a Saturday. Lucky for us we were staying at the Budapest Hilton Hotel which is adjacent to both the bastion and the church.

Just don't miss it.. Don't miss this place, it's absolutely awesome. You can see all of the Pest side clearly from its balcony and the way to get on the top of the hill is quite cool too: I did not take the funicular and found myself on top without actually realizing it.
Worth a visit.. We visited Fisherman's bastion after our visit to castle hill. It's a pleasant walk from the castle back down to the chain bridge and gives you some nice views.

Worth a stop and a drink or two to take in the view.. There isn't a whole lot to do here so it won't take all day, but it is worth the view to go have a drink at one of the restaurants overlooking the Danube
Impressive . Beautiful place with marvelous view on the Danube. Interesting Walking through the streets. Some restaurants but most of them very touristic and not interesting.
Breath taking views and architecture!. This entire castle hill area is breath taking. However this particular site is so photogenic! You have to experience it in person to appreciate its beauty!

Lovely Lookout Towers. Interesting towers with free balconies that overlook the Danube and Pest. The views are wonderful. The seven turrets represent the seven tribes who founded Hungary more than a thousand years ago.

Good place for a date or a simple romantic walk. Visiting the Buda castle itself is worth a couple of hours, but the best view is definitely at the Fisherman's Bastion. It is right next to Matthias cathedral and is in the middle of the castle where some hotels, museums and somewhat medieval atmosphere welcomes the adventure hungry tourists.

Magical place. We had a room booked in the Hilton next door. We just arrived from South America few days ago. After we checked in to the hotel took a short nap, but when we woke up start snowing. We had about half hour during the night when only my wife, me and a violinist was around in heavy snow fall. That moment was magical. Seeing the sleeping city in the snow from the fisherman's bastion, listen the violin was one of those few priceless moments that happens in your life.
Really great view. A bit crowded, the view really is amazing! It's not easy to find where to buy the tickets, and we had to line up for 10 minutes.
Love to visit this place again. I love this place and would like to visit it again especially the view from the top is excellent, definitely must see place for tourists if they are in Budapest.

Great view. We thought the prices were high but we were with a tour group and we had limited stops tho to get souvenirs. Even the lemonade stand was almost 7 euro for a tiny cup. The building is just a beauty on the hills and there's a live entertainment at restaurant.

Nice view, partly free to enter. Worth visiting, great view over the city, stunning castle towers and up there is also a restaurant as a cafe. Note: if you visit during the hot summer months take your own water/juice bottles with you cause they are really milking triple price from the tourists in their drink stalls. Visiting this place takes from 30 to 60 minutes approx. Bus number 16 takes you there if you don't wish to climb uphills.

Amazing. Even that we were a lot of times in Budapest, we never had the chance to visit anything, this time was diffrent. One of the atraction we chosed was the Fisherman's Bastion...my thoughts...it's a must, there is a fee for the St Mathews Basilica and for one of the Bastion Tower but in my opinion you can also choose not to visit those, if you don t want to pay anything. The view from the Bastion is amazing, you can see from up there the entire Parliament and the Danube with the bridges. If you are coming here with your car, you need to know that you can park close to the Bastion, they have a paid parking lot. If you don't have time to visit other atraction try and visit at least this one, it s opened until 11 pm, you won't regreat it.

Trip to Budapest. I went to Budapest on a day trip from Vienna in last December. Looking at the city and monuments from the Fisherman's Bastion which was at the mountain top was amazing. Hope to visit again in the coming years.
Wonderful view of the city. A must see mini tower. I would recommend after 9pm where entrance is free and you could contemplate the Bridges and Pest are all illuminated.
Wonderful views of Pest.. Wonderful views over the Danube and to Pest. Allow at least 3 hours to walk the length of the bastion, more if you want to visit the museums and/or stop for lunch.

Looking at the views. Very warm day, loads of people. Very clean, great views over the city & Danube. One negative, there is an upper level to take in the views on the bastion, you had to pay for this, money grabbing! Bit overrated I would suggest, looks fairly contemporary having been built in the 20th C I believe.

Amazing views and surroundings . Well worth a visit. The 16 bus takes you to the centre of the castle district from Deak Franc square on the Pest side. You can bus to the top or stop off early and take the funicular railway to the top. Either way the views from the bastion are sublime and indeed the whole castle district is a lovely afternoon out. ( Even if it was 35 deg C when we went). There seemed to be countless weddings going on when we visited - but it's a fairyland location so am not at all surprised. It's a modest £1.80 to climb the viewing area on Fishermans Bastion and well worth it.

Compulsory stop. Very pretty view point from were you can appreciate all Budapest and learn about the important growth of this great city.You can go walking or by bus(number 6, not 6-A)It's a petty all the space that they have closed for different bars that don't lets you appreciate all this monument.Very close to here, there is an old coffee shop that has the original furniture.
A Must See. Well worth a visit, stunning building in a lovely area, perhaps only spoiled by the unsympathetic design of The Hilton Hotel

Fisherman's Bastion Wonderful View!. This area is above the city looking down on the Danube River and the Parliment Building in Budapest. There are several nice little restaurants in this cobblestone castle-like atmosphere. I think they charge @ $2 until about 6 PM to get up onto the walk that has the most expensive view. It's gorgeous and definitely worth seeing I liked this place so much that I went back several times. The first time by foot (many stairs) in the second by bicycle (huff and puff) and then I found the a16 bus. It was fun but the bus is easiest. It is very close to the ruins of the old castle and Buda Castle. Lots to see in this area if you don't mind walking a little, or have a bus pass. Beautiful in daylight, but it is magical at night. The church, the view and Sait Stephen all look magnificent at night.
Free tour with Budapest card. Took the inclusive tour of the area with the Budapest card. Tour guide was friendly and explained the history of the area well.

Not so European . This is probably my favorite place in Budapest. Budapest is a beautiful city and I've been there multiple times. The fishermans bastion is a great place because it gives you a great view on the river, the parliament building and basically all Budapest. What I love most though is that its style is different from most of the buildings you can see in Europe and brings you a little bit more east.
Worth the trek up the hill. Brilliant views of Budapest from here. It took us a while to talk all the way up the hill, but definitely worth it

A wonderful romantic dinner with magnificent views.. A very romantic dinner with excellent service and beautiful music. The staff were fantastic and went out of their way to make our evening very special. Great dinner location in Pest!

Not to be missed!. First of all, Budapest in an absolutely beautiful city. We sailed into the city on a Danube river cruise late on a clear night; and the view of all of the buildings (Parliament buildings, castles, etc.), statues, and bridges lit up along the shore and up on the hills was truly one of the most spectacular and memorable sights I have ever seen. The Fisherman's Bastion, up on one of the hills, is a wonderful spot from which to overlook the city and the river. The towers there are built in an architectural style that is quite different from anything we had seen elsewhere; and the roof of the church has tiles in a pattern of different colours which was also quite unusual. Not to be missed on any trip to Budapest!
Nice to get a great view for the danube river.. In here you can get great view for the danube river and for the parliement. Take photos and enjoy the view. There are some stores there too...

What a view!!!!. Unbelievable view all over Pest. You don't have to pay for a visit to all towers. You just have to sit for a coffee in the nearby cafe and admire the city even under the fog of a rainy day.

Fairy Tale Looks. This white stoned building located on the Buda bank of river Danube on the Castle Hill combines neo-Gothic & Neo-Romanesque architecture with turrets,parapets & stairways to climb which gives it a fairy tale look.There is a Entry fee for top level look out but you can go free for a little lower level look out & can get equally good splendid views of the city & the river Danube with lovely bridges across with the traffic passing by.There is a chapel inside & a cafe on top with lovely views .The 7 prominent looking turrets represent the 7 Magyar tribes who founded the country. it was protected by the guild of fishermen during the middle ages,from which it got its name.A monumental double stairway decorated with reliefs & coats of arms & various motifs connects the Bastion with street below.You can take fantastic photos of the surroundings & views below.
great view. great view. kind of two levels, you must pay to get upstairs, but I am not sure if there is any point.
After dinner place. This is a perfect place to take a walk after lunch or dinner. If you are with your car, they have a fee, but if you walk, I think it's free entrance.
Beautiful but busy. Beautiful building and view of Budapest, worth the trip up there I would say. However, it was packed with tourists
Bastion. Great views. Worth the wander up the hill which wasn't too hard. Great place to look over the pest side and get some nice holiday photos.

Nice view and interesting architecture. You could see the best birdview of Budapest. There is no need to buy a ticket to get up to the Bastion though, not worth the price. You can take a good picture of Budapest just below it.
Lovely. Short but cheap with amazing views so do it!! But tickets for this and the church at the same place.
Panorama views. Beautiful place to visit that offers an amazing view over the Danube. There are a lot of towers that you can explore and change the viewpoint.

Historic Viewpoint of Great Beauty. This is just lovely - admittedly it is not ancient, just a 130 or so years old, but it looks marvellous, provides great views, and most of it is free. Well worth a visit

The best city view. As a local of Budapest this is my favourite of all the tourist attractions. A great part of town to go, relax, and enjoy the beautiful view of the city. Lovely view at anytime of the day, but at night is when the city really shines.

Touching view. The view from Bastion is really stunning! You can see Pest just in front of you, like you can touch it! We didn't pay to have the tour but we went there and take some pictures! You can do it as well! I don't think is necessary!

My favorite place in budapest. I have been here several times during my stay in budapedt.
It is a great place to see the night view of the city

Excellent view of the Hungarian Parliament from the Fisherman's Bastion. A unique but interesting attraction is the Fisherman's Bastion which is situated right next to the Matthias church. The attraction is an imposing castle-like ramparts with turrets, stairs, terraces, and walls which can easily be mistaken as an old medieval castle.The fish market during the middle ages was situated here, and the "fortifications" were built and defended the the Fishermen's Guild. There is a restaurant which probably is a high end dining venue. The view across the Danube on the Pest side is from the Fisherman's Bastion simply marvelous. A most beautiful and picturesque view of the Hungarian Parliament on the pest side can be had from this attraction. Another must see attraction when in Budapest.

Classical Attraction. It's basically a nice building at a high place from where you have outstanding views of the Pest side. If you want to make a picture of yourself with the Országház in the background, that's your place :)
Marvelous views. To walk around and see all the marvelous sites is exhilarating. We went to the little cafe had a delicious hot chocolate with vodka, ice cream and whipped cream.

Spectacular view :). View from Bastion is spectacular!!! But it was pity, that were opened only two offices for buying tickets, because there was a lot of people and we were waiting for more than 40 minutes.

Unbelievable views for perfect photos!. Views from this structure are just unbelievable. The architecture and design of the building is very special. The building sits in a perfect spot for great photos and spectacular sights of the entire Danube and valley. This structure is just short of perfect for getting an overview of this part of Europe. It is a must see if you want a perfect picture of your visit to Budapest.

Must Visit!. This is a must visit place if you are in Budapest. Can see entire city when on top of the bastion. Its a stunning view and best view ever we can get of this city. There is a fee involved if you need to be right at the top climbing the staircase, however no fees from level 1. Traveled to this amazing place on segway.
Good views but not easily accessible except by taxi. From the promenade there is a good view across the river. But for the fee one can see other good views for free.
Save Your Money & Have a Coffee. The structure is impressive as are the views. I would not pay to go in though. Nothing special inside. Have a coffee or a beer instead.

Very impressive architecture and great views. One of the best photo opportunities in Budapest (actually it's in Buda). Adjoins St Mathias church in the Diz Ter area of the Castle district, so it's a lovely place to browse. There's a lovely little park nearby with some interesting statues. Easy to reach via no 16 bus from Elizabeth Square. The bus ride takes you all round the Castle District and the service is every few minutes. Restaurants/ bars are a bit pricey there.

Princess.... Fisherman's Bastion is a fairytale building and sure to make one feel like a princess! It was incredible to see the intricate architecture and it's a perfect spot for photos... Check them out here http://lonypamito.com/2015/08/25/eat-see-do-budapest-travel-guide/

Gorgeous views as you hike all over this hilltop bastion. Wandering along the ramparts of this castle top bastion created for the 1895 Centenary of the city of Budapest gives a fantastic view up and down the Danube looking from the Buda side over to the Pest side of the combined two cities.

Stunning views. Absolutely amazing views with beautiful sculptured architecture. Although we didn't pay to go into the higher level, we did take a trip with their cable car which provided us with stunning pictures of the city below.
Alright, nothing spectacular. Didn't find anything very special about this place, unfortunately. But if you are in the Castle District, it's worth walking around and taking a look!

Great view of the city. We visited Fisherman's Bastion both during the day and at night. great views both times. It is a short walk up to the hill once you cross the Chain Bridge, or if you prefer, you can also take the funicular to go up. A must see place if you visit Budapest.

Another incredible place to visit. The Fisherman's Bastion is a magical white heritage building with beautiful intricate architecture and stunning views of Budapest. Surrounded by pretty lanes, boutiques and gorgeous little cafes, don't miss out on a visit to this site as you will be blown away!

Disneyland in Budapest? Loved it!. This fairy tale looking castle was stunning - you have to go have a wander through the arch ways of the amazing building and the views from the little cafe sitting atop the Bastion are beautiful!

Great views, but no need to pay the fee.. The bastion itself is just a structure... there is nothing of interest inside. So skip the fee, take photos from the cafe or other freely accessible areas, and then explore Matthias church.

The best panoramic views in Budapest, Hungary. No wonder they select this place to build a Bastion. It is the best panoramic lookout tower of Budapest. One can wonder around the fortification for hours. The architecture is unique which can only be found at this place.
Beautiful. Def one to see, lovely to see during the day and at night. The tourist buses are a great way to see it if your not in the mood to walk around.

Wonderful city views. It's changed a bit over the years but it still offers some of the best views of the Danube, the Parliament House, and Budapest in general.
When you go there ... and you have GOT to go there ... look for some of the subtle details and close-up craftsmanship / artistic wonders.

Lovely Place. Lovely place.
Great view of the parliament house from across the street.
The souvenir shop has some good stuff.
Currency exchange is a bit expensive (not good rates).

Amazing city vista. At sunset this point in the city offers amazing views over Pest across the wonderful Danube. A great opportunity for wonderful photos and space to relax in before going to one of the nearby restaurants.

stunning views. this is what holiday snaps were made for!! I was up there very early so not to busy, but must be hellish in peak hours. (you can get the tube to Széll Kálmán tér then jump on the number 16 bus, which cruises around the castle complex)
From another time. It transfers you to a different time. Really, it's like you are back at time. Also it comes with a great view.

Amazing view and architecture. From the fisherman's bastion you have a really nice view over Pest the Danube and the Parliament. If you want to take nice Budapest pictures, this is the place to go and there is no general entrance fee (as long as you don't want to go "on" the Fisherman's Bastion).

Great views, lovely walk. We walked from the bridge to the bastion via the city walls. It's a short walk, with small steps so very easy.
The bastion itself is nice, with a beautiful view of the city. It gets crowded but we found many spots to take pictures easily.
Amazing views!. Great view point of the Pest side of Budapest. There's also a lovely bar and restaurant inside! And it's free, would definitely go back!

Beautiful. Just stunning,the views are amazing and a wonderful photo opportunity,just be aware the at peak season there are hundres & hundreds of tourist all going for the same advantage points,just remain calm,definatley worth a visit.

Great views of the Danube and Pest at night. At night, after the restaurants closed, you can go up along the top and get a great view of Parliament and the Pest side across the Danube - If you are a photographer, it is almost mandatory to be here at night - but don't skip sunrise either

Get the views without paying the money..... You have to go here and see the views!!!!
But... There is a restaurant on the left that will let you in and get a higher view for free.... don't pay the E10 to get in.
This is a great place to get pictures of Pest.
Fab view. This is a must visit spot of Budapest. Can be very crowded, but worth the view. Absolutely stunning.

Fishing for a View????. Fisherman's Bastion is walled/towered terrace and overlook behind St Mattias Church on Castle Hill on the Buda bank of the Danube.On it's own it would be a very nice attraction that overlooks the city. Combined with Mattias Church and the views you get of its glazed tile roof from its back side, this is a stop you have to make in Budapest.But the truly great views are the ones that look out over the city and the Pest bank. Just about everything you want to see can be seen from the Bastion. And because it gives you the positional relationship of most everything in the city, this is a stop you might want to do early in your trip.And after this stop there are some nice little shops and cafesin the area
Viewpoint. Marvellous vantage point to see all of Pest and the Danube bridges from the very centre of the touristy part of Buda - and it's free!
Trip July 2015. Impressive construction on the Buda Hill overlooking the Danube. Sofisticated and laborious work; a must for Budapest.

Amazing Views. Amazing views of Pest. You have to go here! You will be able to take beautiful photos of Fisherman's Bastion with the Pest as you background. There is a lovely cafe & small bar at the very top. You will not be disappointed.

Great views of the River and Pest!. Even though you pay to go up here, it is well worth the money. It's a long walk and can take some time, but it's worth it. You will have great views of the Parliament building, Pest, and the Danube.

Csalogány 26 Restaurant and Fisherman's Bastion. We had 4 full days in Budapest. Went up to Fisherman's Bastion during the day with a private walking tour guide. We had booked at the Csalogany restaurant for the evening. Beautiful views both during the day and in the evening.

Excellent Views. This structure is right next to Matthias church and is one of the must see sights when exploring the Castle Hill area. There are similarly excellent but slightly different views over Pest as you can get from near Buda Castle.

Think Montmartre, Budapest Style. Making the effort to get up to the Bastion on Castle Hill is well worth it. Just try to make sure you do it before the coach loads arrive. Its excellent to come up and take in the breathtaking views earlier in the morning, or later at nightThe fairy-tale likeness of the relatively modern walls and towers are definitely enchanting, and its easy to spend time looking through the arches toward the other side of the river (Pest), pretending you're either a Princess in her castle or for us guys, some sort of Knight errant (look it up)!For the adventurous, you could walk up (zigzag up the roads), or take the steep path through the grassy park areas if you're feeling particularly fit. Most people come by coach, or if the crowds aren't too bad, by Siklo which is the Funicular Railway, near the Bastion side of the Szechenyi (Chain) BridgeWalking along the high ground, and around the streets, there are a number of added sights to see and places to go (including some decent places to eat, museums, shops, and of course Matthias Church)When its time to go down, you can head back toward the Chain Bridge, or try the route on the reverse side of the hill which takes you down the inclines toward the Hospital In The Rock, and then further down to Deli Palyaudvar (Metro) Station. By the way, this station has routes toward both sides of Lake Balaton if you feel like a trip to the waters (tickets fairly cheap too)

Awesome view of Pest!. It a beatiful monument and the view for the other side of the city is simply amazing. My friends and I took a lot of pics here cause we could see the parliament behind and it so the pics had a pretty good scenario.
Brilliant views. It is very touristy around here but is very interesting. You probably want to allow a reasonable amount of time to digest and the views are just brilliant

Nice but very busy. We visited here twice. Once during a mass. It is quite small in respect of other churches in Europe. Lovely designed though with extensive murals. Free but beware you are expected to give donation on entry. We didn't realise and were shouted at by gentleman sitting at entrance.

Unsurpassed view. The Bastion has the best view of Pest and the Danube as you are so close, particularly to the Parliament.You can pay for the view or wait your turn on the rampart by the side of the restaurant!Great for photos including the walkway down from here.
Beautiful Landscape. Very beautiful place! Really nice to walk around! The best place to look Budapest! Really amazing the buildings!!!

Beautiful site with great view. A beautiful site with panoramic view of the Danube and the Pest side. We enjoyed the hike up to the site early in the morning. Get there early in the morning to avoid the crowd. Matthias church which is located right there adds to the beauty of the site.
Fisherman`s Bastion. A nice walk and view across the river to the Buda side of Budapest.Best not to do when it is to hot.

Fisherman's Bastion (Castle Hill) can not be missed. Located on Buda Castle Hill, Fisherman's Bastion is a commemoration terrace built between 1895-1902. During the Middle Ages the fisherman's guild was assigned protective duties against invading forces in particular the Mongolian armies (1240-41).Hence the elaborate sandstone terrace with it's projections, parapets, climbing stairs and seven turrets built to honor the seven Hungarian tribes who founded the present day country in 895. It is part of a UNESCO WORLD HERITAGE site.You can get there via the funicular from chain bridge, the public bus service serving Castle Hill or numerous footpaths. The complex includes Matthias Church, A bronze statue of Stephen I mounted on a horse (erected in 1902), the first King of Hungary, and Fisherman's Bastion Terrace. They are all free except for the upper turrets of the Bastion. There is a 2 Euro fee. Views of the Danube, St/ Stephen's Basilica, the Chain & Margaret bridges, Parliament and the Academy of Sciences can all be had at the lower turret levels as well. Fisherman's Bastion has a restaurant which leads to Margareta terrace which is the highest observation point. There is a small café also on the terrace .Fisherman's Bastion was featured on "The Amazing Race" as one of the Pit Stops on Season 6.

Wonderful. This is probably the most visited attraction in Budapest. Fishermans Bastion or Halaszbastya was built between 1895 and 1902 as a part of the millennium celebrations of Hungary. The architect, Frigyes Schulek, designed these towers keeping several things in mind. Firstly, they should not clash the buildings surrounding them like the Matthias Church. Secondly, the style should be early medieval so as to remind everyone of the thousand year old times when the first king ruled Hungary, hence Neo-Romanesque style was used. Thirdly, the number of towers should be seven to signify the seven Hungarian tribes and their chieftains. Moreover, he connected the bastion with the Fish-town beneath it because this was the point where the fisherman brought fresh catch from Danube for the castle. Last but not the least he was very careful that the bastion did not look ugly like other fortifications. In Fact it should add to the beauty of the city and be a panorama terrace. Thus he added romance, charm and class to these towers. There is a ticket for a specific section of the bastion.

The most beautiful Danube panorama. The panorama is really unique, from the Castle Hill in Budapest, in Hungary, in Europe, in the World. The bridges of Danube, the Hungarian Parlament and all others. Behind the Castle Hill with the medieval district. Unfortunately the bar is not come up to the place. Don't skip this place in Budapest if you visit there.

Budapest at its finest . Fishermans bastions is a mixture of east meets west the stunning church and the beautiful views of the danube and squares and monument to St Stephen make this a must see The fountain approaching the square is a good place to cool off before you look around this fabulous site take a camera and enjoy its beauty
Beautiful Sand Castle. Located just across the river from Parliament, this life size sand castle affords wonderful views and photo opportunities.

Lovely view. This place is great for a walk and a panoramic view of one side of Budapest. We payed for the ticket to get in the tower. Honestly, it wasn't much of a difference in terms of view but it was less crowded and we could stop for a breather as it was very hot outside and the tower was sheltered from the sun and a bit windy. If you are in a hurry, you can skip the paid part, as it's not very important. All in all, it's a place worth going to, and I would recommend it to anyone visiting Budapest.

Fine Dinning. Had Dinner here on Friday 14/08/2015 the food is wonderful, the staff very pleasant and helpful, service like clockwork very organised, views were stunning at night with the city lit up as we were eating outside, perfect place to have a special dinning experience. And the Gypsy band were good too.

The best views of Budapest!. This cost 490 florines.to go inside, but there are some places we you can reach for free. You will have very good pictures of Budapest and also of Mathias Church. Is a most!

Better at night. The Fisherman's Bastion is better at night, in my opinion. It can get absolutely packed and very hot during the day in Summer. In the evening, night and early morning it is quieter and you can appreciate it more. It offers wonderful views and some excellent opportunities for photographs. When lit up at night it is at its best. The area around is well worth exploring, including the parts away from the tourist areas.
Neat place!. Great views of the city. An interesting place to visit with lots of interesting architecture and good souvenir shops.

Beautiful monument with an interesting history.. Fishermen's Bastion is a beautiful monument to honour the fishermen who protected Buda Castle from an invasion from Danube. We were excited to visit the site, and we were not disapointed. However, it is a shame that the vantage points are reserved for café's only.

Great views. Such a nice place to check. You must go when the sun is going down. Go to the oposite side of the Danube to watch the sun goes, then walk to the Danube side to see the lights of the Parlament. My wife loved the "Gelateria" at the Szentháromság St, right at the side of Matyas Temple

Walk about in the warm rain!. We arrived and it was very busy, we opted out of not getting a ticket for any of the attractions as there was still so much to see and walk round and the views were amazing, it was raining, so we found a shop selling Pac a macs, so we carried on walking around as there were plenty of places to shelter and stop to eat & drink, all except Faust Wine Cellar as it was closed, it being a Tuesday and it's only open Thursday til Mondays!! Gutted!! I would definitely recommend visiting here as you can see all of Budapest.
Nice view but.... Why paying for a nice view you have for free at some meters from here. it is located on the matias Church placeReally not Worth the fee
Very busy. Best to visit here early in morning because it gets very very busy , great views are to be had from this excellent vantage point.

Fisherman's Bastion. The Fisherman's Bastion is a striking architectural site located along the Danube River in Budapest. This iconic location is well worth a stop. Read about its history prior to your visit to enhance your time there.

Snack on top on sausage to top your visit. Things here to enjoy: the Buda Hill, the walk, the edifice, the square, the view, the Matthias Church, the restaurants, it's a multi-thing enjoyment place. Take the #16 bus ride from downtown for ease. Snack on top on sausage to top your trip.

The best view of Budapest. This is a fantastic spot for a panoramic view of the river and city. The history of the bastion is worth looking up and gives you an insight as to what the towers were built for and the people who used this part of the city wall to defend the town

You will love the view. A must see view of the beautiful Budapest from up on the Bastion. Go and take too many shots :)Tip: dont buy tickets for Bastion, go up from the far end to the left, it is free and better view as well, enjoy :)

Best View of Pest. Up in the Castle District on the Buda side of the Danube this attraction offers the best views of the Pest side of Budapest. There is a charge to go out on the viewing deck but if you go all the way to the left behind Matthias Church you can go out for no charge.
Amazing Architecture. A must if you are visiting Budapest! The structure is jaw dropping and the views are magnificent. Worth climbing to the very top if you have the time and the stamina.
Beautiful views. Beautiful views from the fisherman's bastion, well worth the climb. Lots of other attractions nearby which are worth a visit e.g. Matyas Church, Buda Castle.
Beautiful views of Pest. Beautiful views of Pest (especially the Parliament building) and Danube. Go by day; return by night. Crowd a bit thick at times.

Great view enjoyable walk. It is part of a tour that you should do with time.with magnificent views it will be part of your visit to Buda the old town and the Castle Hill.Next to St Matias church it is a wonderful place to visit and stay for a while Some talented painters offer their work at very reasonable prices.With a talented wife that paints we bought one ourselves.Wonderful views.
Charming. Charming place with GREAT views of Pest especially. Bus service is frequent, or you can always walk up for a good workout.
Beautiful. Beautiful architecture and stunning views across the city, especially in the brilliant sunshine. Well worth a visit.
The Bastion. One of our favorites buildings in Budapest. The construction has a very attractive architecture and its located on the hills on Buda side giving you an astonishing view of the city.

The view!. Beautiful view across the city and a beautiful building itself. In the middle of the castle district in Buda you can't miss it while visiting Matthias Church. Nice little Marzipan Cafe and Museum across from it too.
Amazing. Went with my wife and enjoyed the best view I have ever seen. Easy access via bus. Recommend going here to everyone!

Beautiful but . We enjoyed walking - however the view with ticket approach more or less the same view from the other side (cafe side ) which is free !
The tower tour was very enjoyable and give spectacular view of the city

Superb vistas de la ciudad. Very good views of the city from this place, lots to see and do for the whole day. Views of Buda & Pest from here. Beautiful and interesting buildings and we saw the changing of the guard too. St stephens church is worth a visit also.

Great views of Pest.. This is next to the Matyas church and offers a great view of the river and Pest on the other side. You will want to take lots of pictures and at night it is even more dramatic.
The stairs are easy and faster than the line for the elevator.

Stunning view. Great panoramic view of the entire city. Easy to get there by bus we went back by foot and wasn't that bad as well). The place it self is very interesting and worth the trip even without the amazing view. Make sure to combine it with amazing cakes at ruszwurm curkaszda or with wine tasting at Faust wine cellar (or both)....
Amazing views of the city. It is a must. We walked up towards the evening time so we could sit and watch th sun set and see the city at night. It was beautiful with stunning views

A wonderful experience. We visited the fishermen's bastion on one of the hottest days. After climbing up the hill and the stairs to reach it we were in need of drinks. The restaurant at the top overlooks the Danube with stunning views of the Pest side of the city. To our surprise we were treated to delightful range of live music from a small group playing classical and modern melodies.Well wort a visit. Tip: easier access from the top road into the bastion. The Hilton hotel is situated adjacent
Amazing. Really impressive, you just can't sget enough of the wonderful view. Bring a good camera with you if you are willing to take some beautiful pictures.
Incredible view of Budapest. Incredible view of Budapest. A scenic little hike up, or I believe you can drive up from the other side.
Simply stunning. Just a small walk uphill but I could sit here for hours and look at the stunning views all around me...

Fairytale Castle. Looks like a fairytale castle next to the Matthias Church. Situated on the Buda side. Great view of Budapest. Few touristic restaurants and shops along the road. Take the Funicular Railway, it is much fun and less tiring. It cost HUF 1,200 (adult) one way, HUF 1,800 (adult) return. Be prepared to queue for at least 40 minutes. Unless you go very early.

Fairytale bastion. A beautifully maintained (and fairly modern) bastion of Buda Castle adjacent to the Matyas Church, it commands fantastic views of the Danube and Pest. Most of the arcades are occupied by an overpriced cafe with bad service but good live music, and the toilet
facilities require a coupon, as does access to the upper walls.

Nice. Good to see. I saw more beutiful places. The good thing you can have panoramic view of the city.
Have a good trip.

very intersting. They provided an interesting tour, but the greatest thing was the view at night from the River
They did not allow pictures in the Rotunda
Very good place . Very good place to visit. We have been there twice and each time it was great to see. If you are looking for places to visit in Budapest, this is it.

Stunning.. The trip up to Fisherman's Bastion from the riverside is simple enough to take up the funicular and is definitely worth the walk. The buildings are stunning and have magnificent views over the river Danube and of the Pest side of Budapest.

Its a must!. It is definitely one of the most superb views of Budapest. Absolutely a must in Your itinerary especially if You like to visit Castle or to take pictures. The walk up is not hard and walking back down is spectacular.

Worth the steps. The queue for the lift up the steps was very long so we walked up the steps. Ok if you are reasonably mobile. Although no cost to see the sights, the restaurants were very expensive here. Fantastic views over the city.

Must do while in Budapest. Allow your self time to explore and choose your time to avoid the coaches. The views are great but you can see them from the lower wall so not necessary to pay to go up on to the higher wall. At the far end there is a fortress that you can climb free. Tucked awy we found a small market
Wonderful. Exactly like all the pictures. Well worth the hike! Beautiful panoramic view. Take the time to stroll around the small streets and chill in the park next to the church.

The Perfect view of Budapest. The Fishermen's Bastion is amazing and a must visit if you are going to Budapest. Once you've reached the top there are the Castle Terraces with fantastic views over the city and the river, The Statue of King Stephen and the Matyas Church. All are amazing in their own right but together they are brilliant. The church is as impressive inside as it is outside with wall paintings and tombs.There are plenty of cafes and restaurants so it is possible to spend the whole day here but don't forget to take the Siklo funicular at least one way!
Charming Town. We went here on the hop on hop off tour, definitely worth a visit for spectacular views over Budapest. Lovely little cafes and small souvenir shops. Worth a wander around
Get your Best Panoramic view of Budapest from here. The lovely towers that built in 19th century enable you to have the best panoramic views of Danube Riverfront sight in Budapest,
Amazing historic structure. This is a must when sightseeing in Budapest, it is a beautiful structure. The view across the Danube and the city part of Pest is great.

One of the most beautiful places of Bp, but have to pay during daytime. I love this places so much, the building itself is very nice for me, and the view to Pest side is also great. During day time you have to pay entrance fee if you want to go to the upper floor, however you can enter the ground floor for free - but it is always crowded, so worth to go there in the evening for 2 reasons:- the city with its lights is much nicer,- during the evening you can go to the upper floor for free as well.
Beautiful Architecture. Although we visited at a busy tourist time, it was still easy to look around, the architecture and views over the City were incredible, well worth visiting

A 'must-do' site for visitors to Budapest. The defensive walls around the castle district are impressive, historically the different guilds contributed to the building. The richest guild was the Fishermen's Guild (from the valuable Danube fishing) so they build a magnificent structure, more for decoration than defence. The views across the city from here, and the general surroundings are wonderful. You can see this and walk around for free, but there is a charge for going up on the highest level where the views are best (free in winter and when quiet). This is a very touristy area, so all drinks and food near here are 2 or 3 times the price of the rest of the city. The gardens in the area are nice for walking around, the castle district has many very interesting buildings inside and out. Nearby, the brass statue of a horse has shiny testicles because it is "good luck" to climb up and touch them (the legal university students historically did this before exams).
Nice view. It was worth the bustrip up there, to experience this fantastic view. It wasn't too crowded, because it was a very hot day.

Must see. A definite must see if in Budapest. Together with the Matthias Cathedral and the horse statue it is an experience in its own right. Nice little souvenir shops around, great views of the Danube and lovely cafes.
Like a fairytale . We visited in winter at night at it was stunning! It felt like a fairytale, amazing architecture and beautiful views. A must do in Budapest!

Very Romantic. This was my favourite location in Budapest the views over the Danube are amazing especially looking across at parliament would recommend a visit in the evening it is less crowded and seeing the buildings lit up is magical also a meal in the restaurant is very romantic especially sitting outside overlooking the danube with the violins playing definately worth a visit.
Best view ever. I always visit this place whit pleasure, even if I came quite often! It is close enough to see the buildings from Pest, and a bit from Buda too!

Spectacular view of Pest and Parliament!. The small fee to explore this beautiful walkway is well worth it because the view of Pest across the Danube is stunning. Go in the evening or late afternoon before sunset so that you can see the city as the sun strikes it from the west and at twilight when the lights go on to reveal the lovely detail of the buildings lining the river. Picture perfect view !!!
Amazing. The architecture and the history here will have you in awe. The view from the Bastion is so gorgeous. If you think it's gorgeous during the day, wait till you see it at night..
stunning scenery. The views from the Fishermans Bastion are stunning. You really see Budapest and its wonderful architecture at its best.

Best view to the city. If you want to amaze your friend with some spectacular photos about Budapest, this is the place to go. Day and night beautiful view to the river, bridges, Parliament and the city.
Great views. A lovely looking building and you can go to the top free of charge to get a fab view of the Danbue and Pest.
A great photo opportunity. Well worth the visit for the view.There are other attractions in the vicinity.the rampards walk is a step back into the middel ages.

Very crowded. Apparently August mid-day is not the best time to visit this place. The view is amazing but difficult to enjoy due to the large number of turists occupaying the area. Better visit it earlier on the day.
Excellent. Great view over the Danube. Pleasant place. We had a coffee there. There was a traditional violin players who played great classical music. Love it.

So easy to get to and well worth it . Great views. We were hesitant as it looked like so much effort and a steam climb but actually we went up on a tourist bus and it was great and well worth it for the views and pictures we took.

So easy to get to and well worth it . Great views. We were hesitant as it looked like so much effort and a steam climb but actually we went up on a tourist bus and it was great and well worth it for the views and pictures we took.

Excellent for all . Great place with stunning views looking down onto the Danube. We had a 3yo and 8mo, took the funicular up, big queue on a weekend. Taxis are cheap so our 2nd visit we took these. Cafes up on the look out, not cheapest for budapest standards but it is the best view you get.

Verry beautiful, have to see... The best way to see this building is to go first to the palace by Budapest Castle Hill Funicular ( https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Budapest_Castle_Hill_Funicular ) so you don't have to walk the hil up and then walk to the dirrection of the fishermans bastion.
