It is also verry nice to vissit when dark. In summer you see manny bads flying arround when it is dark.
Great view. If you are in the Castle hill, next to the beautiful Matthias church is the Fisherman's Bastion, a great place to marvel the magnificiant panorama of the Hungarian capital.

Wonderful place. I always love to visit historical places, so this place is one of my favourite to visit often when I'm in Hungary. The government kept it nice and refurbished at all time, there are a lot different restaurants and coffee shops around, awesome view and landscape! Must to visit it!

Budapest view at its best. The perfect place to see Budapest panorama particularly the Parliament building with Danube river. The architecture of Fisherman Bastion is like fairy tale castle and the surrounding area is enjoyable.

Upstairs... one moment of Bastion´s history. At the night, just at time to see the end of the orange sunshines... A very nice place to visit, stay... and to see all the Pest town and the very wonderful Parlament House in Barock style...And the time to see another part of the town´s history, whith the Fishermen touch...
Excellent views. You walk around the bastion and the fountain in the middle sometimes has street performers. There was a hawk on display when we were there.
Yes it is pretty but............ View is spectacular and a very pretty area as everyone has said. Minuses - it gets very crowded and don't buy a fruit juice - cost us more than $10!

Touristy place w the best awesom views of Budapest. You go up by funicular for 1500 HUF ( or 1800 round trip). There is a fast food cafe there. It was built for tourists. Views are why you come up- several times.
Views, Views Everywhere You Look. There are great views to be had for free as people have said. Just take a stroll and turn around. There is something notable wherever your eyes and feet take you.

Fairytale like setting with a magnificent view over Pest. Great view over the old inner city! Fairytale-like atmosphere with beautiful pinnacle towers and an appealing church nearby. There's also a great little cake shop in the street leading away from the Fisherman's Bastion.
Nice. Nice to walk around as some of the views are excellent. Museum is also interesting and worth a visit.
Beautiful Views.. This is a magical place. Great views from the top. Nice area to see all the towers. There are many "free areas" so you do not have to pay money for the view.
Great Views of Buda and Pest. High on the hill overlooking the beautiful Danube adjacent to St. Matthias Church, with spectacular views of both Buda and Pest. A must see for any tourist in Budapest!

Incredible!. Beautiful views! You don't need to pay the money to climb the fifteen steps as the view is incredible by itself. I recommend sitting in the adjoining hillside cafe and watching the sunset over Pest with a glass of wine....a once in a lifetime experience!
A must see. This is such a feature of Budapest, you will find yourself here even if doing Budapest by own means - stunning

Great views - but go early or at night!. This area is a must in Budapest and has amazing views over Pest but is swamped by tourists, buses and touts during the day. Early morning or night time is the best to enjoy the beauty and atmosphere of this area.

Jam-packed with people. This fairly tale beauty was built more than 100 years ago, this marvel was built on the site where fishermen valiantly defended the hill (circa Middle Ages) from "enemies." This is the site of a medieval fish market.Gargoyles and spires and gleaming white beauty make it so special but it is actually prettier to see from a distance than it is when you are climbing up various staircases with about a million other people at the same time. And, too, the views down from this elevated location are actually worth the effort and wait. Crowds are like that.There is a little elevated park area where a band was performing and people were picknicking. Not everyone is in line to ascend the stairs (although it seems like they are).To me, it's a "been-there, done-that", tick-this-off-the-list type of activity. Given that it is not a historic building in the truest sense of the meaning, I looked forward to some quality museum time (and it was really hot weather, too).A ticket is needed to go up the stairs to the bastion.
Nice view over Budapest!. Nice touristic place to visit, with wonderful view over BP. During winter might be quite windy and cold... but stunning under the snow!
View over the Danube. Beautiful architecture and stunning view across the Danube River of the parliament building. Look the other way and the impressive Matthias Church is there.
Amazing view. Loved this place! So eerie and romantic at the same time - and what a view! Looking across the Danube was an experience not to be missed. Go. You will be glad you did.
Beautiful at the sunset. Unique in the world. Romantic and beautiful. Definitely it is worth a visit. Why did unesco missed it?
Fisherman's Bastion . Reminders of the pleasantest sensations. A great panoramic view of the Pest side of the city. Magical and very welcoming. Not recommended for warm days!

Beautiful at Night. There is such a huge sense of history surrounding the Buda side of the Danube and no visit would be complete without a visit to the Bastion. I recommend heading up in the Ewing and experiencing the changes in light from twilight to dark to get the whole experience.
Superb Night-time Panorama. Beautiful place to visit, particularly at night, when the views can be breathtaking. Surrounding area also extremely photogenic

Stunning views. If you visit Budapest and want to see this beautiful city you must visit hear stunning views are too be had looking over the Danube and it's many bridges. Try to visit during the day and night if possible you won't be disappointed.

Quick stop great views lots of tourists. Views over the city are excellent. Close by Matthias church on castle hill. Free admission. Most access via stairs. Street vendors selling embroidered table clothes 10 Euro. Restaurants on upper terrace.
Great view of the Danube. This is definitely one of the prime sites to visit. Check out the historical context and add the view, it is well worth the trip up the hill.

Stunning panoramic views!. This is a must see on your visit to Budapest, boasting beautiful panoramic views over the city. The castle itself is gorgeous and there are little cafes and restaurants too to relax and take in the views. One of my favourite sites.

Walk & view. Fisherman's Bastion is on the Buda side of Budapest. Best to take the funicular and cover the castle and the Bation. Otherwise buses are also easily available. it is a good spot to take pictures and walk around. Provides good opportunities for quality pictures. We did not pay any fee and walked around to enjoy the place.

Very nice view on Budapest. From the hill top over Budapest, you can have a look over the whole Danube river and all bridges, all Pest city. It was nice to visit it with my family. Be careful to hold your children well as no safety is there.

Panoramic Views of the Danube from Fishman's Bastion. You do not have to buy the ticket to see the beautiful views of the Danube from the Fisherman's Bastion. We had a lovely lunch in the patio restaurant there and thoroughly enjoyed the ambience and panoramic views of Buda and Pest, River Danube and the Parliament.
Amazing views from Disney-esque castle. Beautiful castle, lovely restaurant and cafe looking out over Danube, you can see the parliament building and lots of Pest!
A must see in Budapest. I have miwed feelings about this site as I on the one side find it beautiful but on the other side there's a lot of turists. Anyway it's a must see when you are in Budapest

Nice View. It's a nice view if the Pest part if the city. There is restaurant that has occupied part if the property and a charge to view from a particular spot. However one can still have a good view.
The Mathius Church beside it is excellent.
Also the adjacent Buda castle has some beautiful views.

Amazing. Absolutely stunning. The whole castle area is beautiful. Cobbled streets full of lovely little restaurants and cafes. (Try the Pest Buda, you won't be disappointed) there is lots to see up here and the views are incredible.
Very pretty. Lovely views of Budapest. Really pretty building and not at all crowded even in August. Recommend seeing.

Beautiful place with mind-blowing views over Pest. The Fisherman's Bastion is a place you must visit when in Budapest. It is a very beautiful place which reminded me a bit of a Walt Disney castle. The sights of Pest is also amazing. I recommend coming a bit later in the afternoon. It wasn't incredibly busy when we visit at around 4 pm. We stayed for dinner in Buda so we could also enjoy the place in the evening when it is dark. In the evening it is even more magical and the views are mind-blowing.

Must see. We walked from the castle to this area. It has the best view's of the city (even on cloudy days) and was packed with tourists so try to get there early. Fisherman's Bastion was beautiful. Don't miss it.

Best views in Budapest. To go to the top of Fisherman's Bastion there is a small fee (which we paid once) but you can still get really good views of Budapest without having to go into the Bastion, there is nothing inside - just marvellous views out. Don't bother paying a guide - you don't need one. We went back twice. It's worth going at different times of the day for the real photo enthusiast.
Great place to visit. Fantastic building, situated on the Castle hill. There is also a restaurant at the side where you will have a very nice view of Budapest.

Go for the view. It's a must-see place. Fun to be there, great view across the river. Bring your camera. Can quickly visit or stay as long as you like. Matthias church is right there, also worth a visit (for a fee). Easy access from Hop On/Off bus, or taxi, or walking if you are a walker/hiker. Explore the area further to see the Hospital in the Rock and/or the Labyrinth.
Best view of Pest from Buda. The best view from Buda over the Danube to Pest. You can get a proper panoramic from this beautiful building.

don't miss the hidden heated bar at night!. Really beautiful place with fab views of the Danube - and a little heated bar in the farthest peak, perfect on a cold day. Best views of the Danube and Parliament building from the Bastion. We strolled along it waiting for Mathhias Church to open.
Best views of the city, History, unique architecture. Fishermen's Bastion is great. The best views of the city. A wonderful walk back down. 5 stars!!! Highly recommend!!!

Amazing castle to see and walk around. Amazing castle to see and walk around. Easy to get by city transport. nice view from the surrounding, close to Buda castly - in a walking proximity. Near the Mattias Church.

Don't pay the fee!. The views of Pest from this attraction is definitely worth it. However, getting to the top of it (just like 15 steps higher) is not really worth its price. Not that the view isn't breathtaking, but you can see exactly the same view without paying the 700 HUF if you walk another 100 metres past the church. There is a small bar in the next bastion which serves coffee at a reasonable price and is even higher than the fishermen's bastion. Plus you don't have to wait the queue to buy the ticket.
The wow factor at every turn. Possibly re-furbished in recent years it may have looked all to new but it was still stunning and provided a great view of Buda and Pest.

STEP BACK IN TIME TO A PRINCESS' CASTLE!!!. I have visited the Fisherman's Bastion multiple times and each time I am amazed by the beauty! A must see during the day, sunset and night. Take your camera and be prepared to photograph pictures no one will believe you too.

Pristine Historical Viewpoint. Stunning 19th century Gothic battlements on the hilly Buda side of the Danube, offering panoramic views across the river to the city. There's a restaurant and a small cafe, and you can pay to visit the upper ramparts - but great vantage points are free. With the epic St Matthias Church close by, this attraction - with its definite Game of Thrones vibe - is an absolute must see.

Fairytales. Stunning a must! It is like a fairytale. Easy to get to via the Hop on Bus Tours. On our walk we found the Labyrinth which led to a wonderful experience.We found the place where Count Dacula was held prisoner for 10years. Alot of history there. Worth the visit.

Nice Bastion in Castle Hill area. This is one of the top choices in Castle hill area. It was built in 1890 and basically a tower.We were in Budapest during 2015 Easter period and on the second day we planned to visit this after seeing Chain bridge and then zero point. We took Bus no 16 from the zero point, just crossing the chain bridge towards Buda side. However the bus originates from Deák Ferenc tér near the yellow line metro station and going to Donáti utca.There is a funicular service available from that point for going to top of the castle hill area, however that appeared too costly for us as the fare was 1400HUK for return where as the bus fare was 300HUK(as we took a block of 10 tickets)It took 15 mins to reach the top of the hill, stoppage named Dish Ter.We took lots of photos from that point of river Danube, chain bridge and Parliament and then proceeded to other attractions.

Another must see in Budapest. Impressive landmark on the Buda side. We saw this using the hop on hop off buses and were amazed by the detail in the building. The view looking in the opposite direction spread well across the city though was even better further up the hill. Loved the turrets almost suggesting it was out of a fairy tale.
if time limited, dont bother. a bit too 'cleaned up' - looks like something out of Disney land! Good views, very popular with the coaches.

Architectural brilliance!!. Fisherman's Bastion is a must for all tourists of Budapest. Mathias Church, The Tower are definitely worth inspection. So much to see and do. Quaint little restaurants offering quality food and service. A vast array of shops offering plenty of choice for the keen shopper. Breathtaking views over Budapest from the Bastion that provide sensational shots from the budding beginner to the professional photographer. Allow a full morning or afternoon to get a well rounded visit to this iconic site. You will not be disappointed!!

Stunning view. This place offers a unique and stunning view all over the Danube river and Pest side of town. Lots of things to see around, so take your time to stroll along the paths and check out all the beautiful buildings and gardens. A few bars/restaurants available in the area, but they all looked like tourist traps. Definitely worth the climb. For people with handicap, I strongly suggested to catch a taxi up to the top of the hill.

Best views of the city and river below!. Awesome views. There is a cafe in the bastion, but they only serve sandwiches and salads, so we were hungry for more than that and didn't eat there. I would have loved to though, as the views were fantastic and they had live music.
Nice place with a nice view. This crowdy place is a must when you visiting Budapest.The place is beautifull and there is a nice view over the Danube river to the pest side of the city.
Must-See. It can easily be reached on foot from about anywhere in the city. The view is stunning and it is situated in a lively area. Great spot for photos.

A fascinating place to visit.... A walk at fisherman's bastion is like going through a time portal (which is a must for history enthusiasts)What a amazing location overlooking the danube river with a rich history which you can read around as you explore.The tour will definately be incomplete if you don't visit the matthias church which was originally built in 1015 AD.Inside you can visit different portion of the church each explaining the history of the place including a museum on the upper level. Its seven towers represent the seven magyar tribes that settled in the region in 896 whereas it was named after a historical incident when a guild of fishermen defended it in the middle ages

Magnificent . Visited this wonderful place high on the Buda side of Budapest. The view over the Danube was marvellous to the Pest side of the city with all the wonderful buildings. Well worth the climb.
Great viewpoint!. Very good viewpoint and nice little eatery nearby too. Enjoyed a couple of hot wines whilst overlooking the Danube and the parliament building.

Best view of the city. You have to walk and climb a lot of steps, but it is definitely worth the effort. I would advise you to go during morning, while there are not many tourists around, and the light can be amazing at this time!

History on the Hill. This lovely place lies on the hills overlooking river Danube in be Budapest and provides a panoramic view of the sprawling city. Very historic place, provides tourists beautiful photo spots and colourful buildings with architecture to marvel. The statue of St Stephen on horseback is a nice sight. You can reach the hill by road or even by a winch facility.

Gorgeous views of the City. A highlight not to be missed when going to Budapest. It can be reached either on foot, the funicular, or a bus. Stunning views of the city, great photo ops! Great place to watch the sunset and to have a picnic.

Fisherman's Bastion: your opportunity to feel like royalty. Romantic, historic, beautiful!. You can be a Princess too just by visiting this magnificent site at night, where you oversee all of Buda and Pest from this wonderfully romantic perch. It's a truly don't miss site.
Felt just like a Disney movie. Beautiful; everything felt like it was straight out of a Disney movie. It was lovely just to walk around and take in the scenery for half an hour or so.

Best Views of the City. Well worth the walk up the hill. Probably the best views of the Danube and parliament building from up here. The area is a mix of commercial and residential. I recall walking around the neighbourhood and finding various plaques and statues describing areas of significance and history. Many small establishments to nip in for a refreshment.
Amazing view. Best view in town!!! The square is amazing the church also and the best of all the view and the rounded buldings beautifull!

Historical place overlooking the Pest. The seven towers symbolize the seven Hungarian tribes; former fish market. The stunning view of the Danube and Pest. Hilton hotel too close to the historical experience.
Top 10 places to visit. just loved the different styles of architecture and the activity around the area.. the church roof was so different from any other

Worth the travel. As soon as I arrived in Budapest, I was told that Buda was the hilly side and it sure was. I trekked up the hill but it was worth the sweat as it was an incredibly hot and sunny day. As we reached the top we were rewarded with a beautiful view and music from people busking musicians. The place was extremely clean and well kept. Also, there was so much more attractions nearby to fill your day with. Definitely worth visiting.

Great architectture. Great architecture. Busy during the summer months. An additional fee is demanded during the summer months to climb the building. Walk towards the biggest tower to be able to visit it without additional fee.
View is worth it. Great view, totally worth the walk. Make sure to buy your water before you go up, everything is a lot more expensive up top.

Beautiful place. This place is the second best thing in Budapest after the parliament. It looks beautiful in the day while in the night the lamps and the bats flying overhead make it look straight out of a fairy tale. Its resemblance to Rivendale in Lord of the rings is uncanny.

Fairytale like.. Fisherman’s Bastion complete the picture when visiting the castle district a beautiful location with amazing architecture, lovely pictures and views. Feels like a scene from one of the fairytales we grew up on..  Also, the location has a nice restaurant offering Hungarian treats with a great view of the city from top.

Great way to spend an afternoon. This is a really beautiful spot high on a hill overlooking the Danube, parliament building and the Pest side. You can walk along the lower part and enjoy the view but they now have a small fee to go to the top. The architecture is lovely.
Great views. Spectacular views. Almost fairytale-like looking towers and buildings. Stay for a coffee and take in the views which are breathtaking. A great place on a sunny afternoon.

Beautiful view of Pest and the Danube. We visited Fisherman's Bastion as part of a tour mid-May 2015. The bastion provides a spectacular views of the Pest side and the Danube River. A definite must see if you visit Budapest.

Possibly the nicest part of Budapest. The whole place was lovely and quaint, everything was clean and all the old buildings very well kept, the view from above was great at day and by night! Would definitely recommend having a look up
enjoy good view. i do not understand to divide the sights. BUDA hills is just one and not necessary to take up fishermans's bastion as a one sight. as long as it is located in Buda hill. good.

Free, awesome views. A lovely structure, both day and night. In Buda. Lots more to see in the vicinity.
Free, no charge. Restaurant is there but we did not go.
Great views of Pest, day and night. Spend less than an hour there. Lots of tourists. Can get crowded. Take pictures!

A perfect view of the city from above. This is the best place in Budapest, you can see the Parliament, the Danube and the whole city from above.It is even better to visit at sunset when all the lights are on, it is magical.There is no fee to pay if you can climb the stairs by foot and not by car.I recommand it!
photographer's heaven. Following ascent to Castle Hill, loved the hustle and bustle, admired the views and quiet parts before our descent.

Beautiful view during day and night with very charming surroundings. The area around the Fisherman's Bastion and its towers is as charming as is the view from there. There are many restaurants in the area with typical Hungarian dishes which are a must try. No matter whether you go during the day or at night, you will definitely enjoy the stunning view to the city.

Fairytale . This was one of the best attractions in Budapest. Really lovely to walk around during the day and then the restaurant (can't remember the name) has the most incredible view of the city and Danube, the food and wine are fantastic too. Fisherman's Bastion and Heroes square are not to be missed!!

Fisherman's Bastion. Nice area to hangout for a few hours. Lots of tourists but you can find a quiet spot. Great for taking pictures. If you have time, take some time to explore the surrounding neighborhood

My favorite place and view in all of Budapest. This has always been my favorite place in all of Budapest. It has an amazing view of Parliament, and the scene there is so lively. You are also right next to Matthias church which is a beautiful site as well. There really isn't a lot to do there, but just relax, get an ice cream or just enjoy the amazing view of the Danube or the rush of the tourists as they pour in. I was lucky enough to rent an apartment nearby, so I came to this spot early in the morning for views before the mass of tourist buses poured in. I also came over at night and got to experience several live musicians sprinkled randomly through the area. It is hard to explain, but this site cannot be missed on any trip to Budapest.
Stunning Views. The views over the Danube and Pest are stunning so is the walk around the area and Mathias Church is a must visit completely different from any Catholic Church insude

A must to visit. Halászbástya or Fishermen's Bastion an excellent point to have a wonderful view to Pest side of thy city. The building which was built at the end of the 19th century os just a pure decoration having no real benefit though it looks nice from Pest side. The building is part of the Cultural Heritage area of Buda Castle, The name comes from the past when the building did not exist, in the middle age this part of Buda Castle was defended by the guild of fishermen. It is a must to see for all tourists.
A must see. The view is spectacular and a MUST for anyone coming to Budapest. This whole area is beautiful and a tourist delight

crowded and can get same view from several other places. I do not dispute that the views are good but we had already seen similar views from the road at the top of the steps. If it was not for St Matthias church I doubt it would get so many visitors. Very busy and full of tourist shops and some pretty average cafes that know you are only there the once and seem to not bother with civility or food quality.

Tips about the Bastion. Though it might be crowded in the day, it is amazing and more relaxing at night. The bus runs regularly, but please check on it :) If you want to go to the 2nd floor of the bastion without paying, go upstairs to the coffee shop in front of Hilton hotel, just walk in, pass by the coffee shop and go to the balcony :) Enjoy the view!

Nice view. Nice view of the river and of parliament. Quite crowded though. I've noticed a few people complaining about the cost, but you can walk up for free, you only have to pay for the lift/funicular. There's a few restaurants about to eat or get an icecream but they were overpriced compared with the rest of the city. The view was probably more impressive from Gellert hill/liberty statue and less crowded!

Superb view of Budapest from here!. It would be a sin for anyone to visit Budapest without going to the Fisherman's Bastion! I forgot the story behind it but at any rate, you get a super view of the city from the Bastion. Lots of opportunities to buy overpriced souvenirs there...

Too many tourists. I really think this place is overrated. It's quite beautiful, but it's packed with tourists and really expensive refreshment sellers. There wasn't much room to enjoy the view between those darn selfie sticks!

Best view in Budapest. You can have the best view to Danube and Parliament. Very close to Matthias church. Worth to have a nice, romantic walk.Not worth to pay to go to upper level because the level you can enter for free is similar.There is also a nice coffee shop in order to have a drink and enjoy the view.

Best view of the city. Built in the early day as a look out point and indeed the views from here atop the Buda Castle Hill is stunning. The panoramic view of the city and the Danube river make this the photograph center and thus full of people. You can pay to go up the tower but I think it is not necessary

Amazing!. This is my favourite attraction in Budapest! This building is just beautiful -like Disneyland. And the view is stunning too,overlooks the bridges,parliament.You can also have a coffee or tea and light snacks at the coffee shops and enjoy the lovely view. Must see!!!
Disappointing . Paid to go up and see the sites which were magnificent. When we came down we discovered if we had walked a little further we could have seen the view for free.
Stunning!. Went to visit the Fisherman's Bastion whilst in Budapest and I was amazed by the view!t A must see when the sun is setting!
Cool place. Neat views of the whole town. In great shaped despite being built in Middle Ages. Cool place to visit.
Nice walk and nice views. nice walk, nice arquitecture, very, very nice to see, a lot of tourist everywhere. Very unique design and style.
Amazing. The view was really amazing. Make sure to come from the river side, as the climb up to the bastion is very impressive.
The best view in Budapest.. The view is the best ever!!! You cannot get a better meal, with music, plus a view of the Danube and the city.

Beautiful!. really well worth a visit here! it is so beautiful, and has amazing views over the city. although it costs extra, it is worth paying to go up to the higher level, as it is quieter and you can see more and take photos with less other people in it!

A must see!. Must visit when in Budapest! Fabulous views of the city, including Parliament. Even if you don't pay the admission fee to access the upper level, you can access a good deal of the Bastion.
Beautiful.. Great views over the city. I would not pay to go on the upper tier again however as I do not see how the extra 20 feet benefitted my photographs! ! ! !

Excellent views from a beautiful building. The Fisherman's Bastion might be overpriced- it's free to walk along a little part of it, but for most of it you need to pay- and some might feel the views are average- well not average, but that you get ones just as good from sitting on the ground. But for me, going up on the Fisherman's Bastion was worth it, for the extra views, and for the beautiful building itself, which is a wonderful addition to an already beautiful area. The stunning white walls and columns add to the castle and church area, and the light at certain times of the day, especially at sunset, makes the white walls even more stunning. And while there might not be actually anything to do on Fisherman's Bastion, apart from look over the city at the views from even higher up, and apart from an overpriced restaurant, for me anyway, it was worth it. It's up to each person to decide whether it's worth it for them or not, but if you're in the area anyway, I feel it's good to see and do everything- especially in such a beautiful, popular area anyway!

A must-visit in Budapest. Fisherman’s Bastion is a slightly Disneyesque viewpoint built at the turn of the 19th/20th centuries on one of the limestone hills of Buda. It is said to commemorate earlier sieges (where this section of defences was allocated to the Danube fishermen to defend). It’s an impressive piece of work offering spectacular views of Budapest and the Danube and plenty of photo opportunities; there Is an entry charge for the main (and most popular) section of the battlements though the others offer views that I think are just as good.This is a must-visit site for visitors to Budapest, not just for itself and the views it offers but for the adjacent and colourful Matthias Church and nearby old but well-presented buildings such as the former Buda Town Hall.

Awesome!. If you're spending a day or two in Budapest, this attraction should be at the top of your list of things to see. Not only is it superb, it is also well located, at the top of Castle hill, giving you a wonderful view of Budapest and the parliament.

Well worth a visit. Very busy and a bit of a trek up hill, better taking the hop on hop off bus which takes you near to the top of the hill. Great views from here looking over the city and also places to sit and have a nice cold beer or something to eat.

Great place to spend some time . We are not big history buffs or museum goers but really enjoyed visiting here. Anyone with a little soul can appreciate interesting and beautiful architecture.It's not just the fisherman's Bastion but the buildings around also like the national library are very nice. The views of Budapest from here are unbeatable and it's only a short walk to buds castle. It also has quite a few places to eat or have a beer so nice place to spend a little time.
Wonderful. Beautiful views of the city from here and a wonderful place to take a walk and enjoy the day with family and friends.

Killer views of the Parliament building.... Offers killer views of the Parliament Building and St. Stephen's basilica, but I was a lot more excited about this until I learned about the history of it.From Pest, take the #16 bus from Deak Ferenc up to Castle Hill (Skip the funicular, it's a rip off) or hoof it up for a nice work out.
Attractive, with great views. The Fisherman's Bastion seems to get lost among all the other surrounding attractions. It's an attractive sight an worth a short visit.

Great views of the city. It's a bit of a hike to the Fisherman's Bastion but you will get some great views of the city. And it's a very neat place to hang out or walk. When you get hungry, there are some nice restaurants in the area with traditional Hungarian food.
Amazing views. Beautiful but very busy, the views from the castle walls are just as good, its quieter and its free. Nice little market up there bought some pretty jewellery.

Beautiful architecture, like a fairy tale castle. Well worth exploring and spending some time here. It's busy and we didn't go inside, but we still got a good look around the outside and enjoyed the local buskers as well.

Budapest Card best buy. We used our Budapest Card and took advantage of the free 2:00 tour scheduled at the fountain in front of the church. Fisherman's bastion is where the fisherman used to sell fish. A beautiful area with 7 spires on the castle wall.
Beautiful Views. Really Beautiful views across the Danube and a very interesting area to visit- I recommend walking across the Chain Bridge to get there for the views along the Danube.

Free area is just beautiful enough.. There is a short path you need to pay to walk through. I didn't get what is so special about it. You can enjoy the wonderful view fully from the free area. We were there on a beautiful day in May. I wanted to stay there forever to enjoy the view and breeze.

Pretty fancy fishermen. Haha, unsure about the background to the name but the place is really nice with a little cafe/bar on the top overlooking everything. Didn't have anything there as the prices were crazy, but we did have a look around and really enjoyed it. Not to be missed if you're in the castle hill district.
Brilliant lookout. Completely different from our last visit in 2011 with roads and footpaths all upgraded and the Church completed and you simply can't beat the views.

Unbelievable views. For the best possible views of the Pest side of the Danube River, go to Fisherman’s Bastion on the Buda side of the river. (Budapest is really a combination of two former independent cities – Buda and Pest.) It is on Castle Hill, a very high hill, which affords incredible panoramic views of the river, the spectacular Parliament Building, and other aspects of Budapest.The name Fisherman’s Bastion, a 7-towered fortress, comes from honoring a group of fishermen whose job it was to defend this part of the city in medieval times. However, the building itself is only about 100 years old. Nearby the beautiful Matthias church is over 700 years old and has quite a history. The coronation of the last Hapsburg king, Charles IV, took place here. The church’s most impressive feature to us was the colorful mosaic tiles that cover its roof. The inside is highly decorated with much gilding and many paintings.This area is well worth a visit. The sights on Castle Hill are wonderful, and the views from the hill are not to be missed.

Worth the bus ride up here to see the views. Wonderful views all around. The little bus up onto the hill is excellent, although gets packed. The restaurant is very good- excellent service and good value.

Not what I expected. . This was on first place on places to go on TripAdvisor. It was nice and some good architecture but this could be found on many places around Budapest. The staff on site was not so friendly and there was to many tourists at once. See it if you are in Budapest but you don't need to take so much time of the day for it. Tip, take bus number 6.
Beautiful view!. Beautiful view of the Danube and Pest. Well worth the hike, or ride up, and a great place for a cold drink.

Picturesque spot to view Budapest.. This structure looks as if it is straight from a Disney movie! Great background for photos and for views of the river Danube and the Parliament building, especially at night.

Don't bother paying... just enjoy the free view!. Well worth travelling or walking up but don't pay the extra 700ft for the official access to the viewing area... its just about 12 steps up and the same view you get for free!
The Matyias Church is well worth it though

Great views and much history. The perfect spot to take some nice photos and just admire the view! From here you can watch over Donahue and the great parliament building across the river. You also send the bridges and Margret island. Here is much to see and read if you like history. Just behind you is the magnificent Mattias church. It can be a lot of tourist here, but you don't have to wait to long for a good spot to take some pictures. The also have some stores and restaurants in the area, just besides Mattias church is a great place for a beer if the weather is good! Recommend it if you travel to Budapest!

More than I would have ever expected!. A must when visiting Budapest! You have the option of getting the funicular up (extra charge) or you can walk up, if possible take the extra walk - it's absolutely stunning, feels like you're walking in historical times up the old castle roads and once you get to the top it's just magnificent. Stunning views of the city. Well worth a visit!

Brilliant views over Pest. A great place to go to see some of the historical buildings in Budapest. Outstanding views over the Pest side of the city. If you visit the city you have to talk a walk up here!

Amazing views - climb to the top!. Well worth the trip climbing to the top of this tower. It is stairs so can be a little exhausting but really worth the effort. Ask to see the bells half way up, very special. I would not recommend the restaurant next to the tower however, overpriced and not very special.

Birds eye view of PEST. One of the favourite gathering place of tourists next to St Matthias. The Fisherman's Bastion is a serene spot that allows tourists to relax while taking in the sights overlooking the Danube and the Pest scenery. Close by the Hilton and a nearby cafe where tourists can escape the hot summer heat for cool libations and/or coffee.
tip. Tip for the cheapskates or people in a budget: if you walk a little further from the Bastion's entrance, there is a small restaurant upstairs, which has a good view too.
Fantastic views. This was our third vacation in four years which included Budapest. We never tire of the views of the city from here.
Beautiful!!. This is near the castle. Is very beautiful and it has a town nearly. But most importantly is the beautiful view on the river Donava.

Must do!. We decided to come to the Bastion towards the end of our break as we felt it is a 'must do', but it genuinely is! The Bastion surrounds Matthias church in a really beautiful area. It is definitely worth paying to go onto the Bastion terrace and walk along. The price is really low, especially for students as it's half price! The views from the terrace are incredible and it's great to see Budapest from this side as we had been staying in Pest.Unfortunately we didn't eat or drink at any of the bars/restaurants along the terrace but definitely wish we could have!
Views. Fantastic views from up here. Close to Buda castle good place to sit and view the world. Right next to the church and other attractions on the hill.

Must visit . I wasn't expecting much from the place but it took me by surprise. The views of the city are amazing from here. The whole compound is simply lovely. Worth all the climb too :) (about 200 steps)

Must see !! . Another must see atraction in budapest !
So eomantic and lovely views and castels !!!
We had a great time walking along the castel specialy when we got to the Fisherman bastion !

The Best View of Budapest. If you want to witness the entire city and it's grandeur, the Fisherman's Bastion is the place to visit. Great place to take panoramic photo shots and to see Budapest the way the monarchs of Austria Hungary did.

Incredible Views. Just a short walk from the palace, the Fisherman's Bastion is a great place for views of Parliament, the Danube and the rest of Pest.
Go early to avoid crowds. I recommend visiting in the evening also when the sun is behind you for better pictures.

Breathtaking City Views. We had lunch in the little cafe overlooking the city, with a serenading violinist to add a romantic touch. Near the Matthias Church and a short walk from the castle. Take a few minutes to relax and enjoy the view.

Fantastic place , a must see. We were amazed by this ancient area, in fact everywhere there is something given what has been found in the hills.
But this Fisherman building was a highlight as well as Mathias Church
Just a fee for walking the ramparts as well as the Church but worth it

One word: beautiful. Although you have to pay entrance fee, it is a very nice place to go to with a free view over Buda(pest). We visited the church and took a lot of pictures. Lucky for us it was also cool inside while the temperatures outside rises up to 34C.It is also possible to visit the bastion but you also have a good view from the square and the stairs in front of the complex.
Best by sunset and early night. A place to go with your partner, not in a hurry, to enjoy slowly. Wonderful views towards Pest, when the city is enlighten
Wonderful view of the city. great area with a wonderful view on the city during the day or at night. There is a restaurant with a lovely terrace. The food is good and the view is outstanding
Beautiful. Beautiful place, definitely recommend going. If you have a student card then take it! We got a taxi up and walked back down.

Great place to relax. Great place to relax - we climbed up in the early morning and arrived at about 8.30 am - as Matthias Church only opens at 9 am, there are principally no tourists yet which makes it one of the most beautiful place in the world
Local Legend. The legend said this castle was built by fisherman to defend foreign invasion, and the fishermen managed to fought back the regular armies.
Great for the view. The building seems out of place, Disneyland, but the views are outstanding. Didn't see the point of paying to walk on the ramparts as the same view is free a few metres away.

Lovely Viewing Terrace. We were lucky to get a nice guide. She explained us about this viewing terrace, about the church, about the people who stayed there, she showed us some of the old houses and the old bakery. You get to see a lovely view of the city & Danube. This is a must visit place while in Budapest.

Great Views. At the top of the hill, and just a few steps from the castle is the fisherman's bastion that was one a lively fish/farmer's market. In the early part of the 20th century it was remodeled and now you can have lunch there in the cafe and also stroll the high walls for an unparalleled view of Budapest and the Danube.
Beautiful view. Fishersman´s Bastion op top of Buda Hill is a very beautiful place. We was there to se the sunrise over Pest - is was very impressing.

beautiful views. Offers gorgeous views of Pest. You can take some beautiful views of the landmarks across the Danube River through the archways of the bastion. Friendly bartender in the pub in the tower, too.
Beautiful views. Absolutely gorgeous square. But really can't understand why u pay for this as u can go up further along the wall and get same view or better at the cafe or bar.

Could easily stay there forever. One of the most beautiful places that I have ever visited. The view over Budapest from the Fisherman's Bastion is simply amazing. The Bastion itself is, in my opinion, the wonder of architecture and it surely reminds of a nice fairy tale.

Wonderful!. One of the most famous place to see in Budapest, it looks a little artificial but it is beautiful with nice view on the Parliament.
Don't pay for the tour , you can enjoy the same landscape without any tickets.
Fisherman's bastion. Very nice view of the city. You can just walk through the restaurant to take pictures (they won't make a problem out of this).
One of a Kind Architecture. The architecture of this place is unique. It has a distinctive Middle Eastern /moorish/Ottoman Empire style to it. The view from it was worth the hike up the hill.

Wonderful views of Parliament and Pest. The obvious place for the Fuji moment - spectacular pictures of parliament, the danube and bridges, Pest and the wider area. You can view from the lower level for free and it's not really worth paying for the higher level in my opinion, although to be fair the cost wouldn't break you. Fortunately I read a really helpful review just before we visited and found the free entry to the upper level on the left hand side, just in front of the Hilton Hotel

Great for a break with a view. We had a little break at the cafe here for a drink and the amazing view. The three man band was playing classical and gypsy music, and played requests also. Fabulous view of Pest from the cafe!

A little bit of Disney. The turrets of this bastion reminds you of a fairytale castle. There are plenty of cafes to sit on the battlements and take in the wonderful sites, and from which there are spectacular photo opportunities of the Parliament etc. Again take the bus and combine the visit with St, Mathias Church and the Castle District.

Spend an amazing day. Amazing, not only the bastion architecture, but views of the city also. We took an escalator on the way up and didn't regret it - save the legs, there are lots of walking in the bastion itself. You can actually spend all day there wondering around and afterwards just relax in the restaurant on the bastion wall and enjoy the evening.
The view. The view is breathtaking, the best spot to view the city. My favourite spot in Budapest. I personally think Winter is the best time to visit Budapest.
Beautiful view. Great view from up there! Went there at night time and the city looked beautiful. Nice place for photo lovers!
day trip. was over crowded , and did not enjoy it much, but the citadells's history inscribed on the walls, was an educationalexperience
Worth visiting. Very nice place near the palace and the castel. Nice and cosy street with cosy hungarian restaurants.

Fishermen on a hill?. The Bastion is nicely built of white stone, but not made for fishing. It is on the top of Castle Hill. Read up on it...the fishermen we're the last hoe and holdouts protecting the city!
Beautiful architectual. We walk through the beautiful town of fishermen bastion. The architects of the building were beautiful. The view itself is fantastic.
The best view i could get . This was the best view of Budapest that I could get! The building is fantastic and there are few stores around (little pricey) we took pictures of the whole Budapest

Fisherman's Bastion. The history of the Bastion is very interesting and the view is amazing. This is a great place to be at sunset and take pictures not only of the Bastion but of the Parliament across the river.
A MUST of Budapest. Just incredible, the views are amazing, if you can, try to go for the night view and the sun rise, it is really worth it.
Delightful place for pictures.. Not a lot of history here, but the fanciful facade makes it both a great picture and a great place to take pictures of Pest across the river.
Best sites in Budapest. Fantastic views over the city - perhaps the best viewing spot. Not too crowded, lovely old gothic architecture. Lots of cafes for refreshments.
Great city view. The whole area is just breathtaking. It is the most beautiful part of the city. It is quite the hike but you can't come to Budapest and not visit.

Went there around subset, enjoyed the veiw. Nothing much to do there other than enjoying the view, having a long walk in the small city, perhaps do dorm tourists shopping and have a light dinner in one of the small side road restaurants or cafes.
The weather was freezing, it was February after all but I imagine it would be way much nicer during spring or summer.

Great architecture and provides a vantage point to overlook the city.. We came up at night and photographed parliament
From the bastion. The lighting is very dramatic and the view is fantastic.

Captures all of Budapest...... You feel at the heart of the amazing architecture Budapest has to offer here, with such an amazing outlook. There are plenty of small little cafes immersed amongst it too so it is easy to take a break whilst taking it all in. A must see.

Budapest. Beautiful views of the parliament and Pest.
Get the number 16 bus. Its the best way to get around this part.
Beautiful. Beautiful site, worth to go but a bit crowds, probably because this site is so popular ! Feel safe here

Beautiful view. This is a photographers dream. I did not take the tour but still enjoyed the views of
Pest and parliament. Also great area for people watching!

Best views of the city. We were lucky enough to be staying just round the corner from this site so passed it on foot a couple of times a day. A definite must see for visitors to Budapest, mid morning swarms of tourists on busses from the Pest side tended to arrive and it was busy like that most of the day, the best times to see it and enjoy the views are therefore early morning or evening as it's just as attractive, maybe even more so in the dark. Free to walk around and enjoy the views and you can climb up part of the walls.
Wonderful veiws. This is one of the most beautiful areas of Budapest, it has absolutely stunning veiws of the Danube and parliament building, and it's a world heritage cite so that is pretty awesome!

Beautiful view. Its close to Chain bridge and the castle, high up on the hill with breathtaking view of the river and the Parliament. Worth a visit. Yellow taxis are metered and convinient mode of travel if you are sightseeing with another couple.

It is all about the view. From the Fisherman's Bastion you get the iconic sweeping views across the Danube to Parliament House, which just about define Budapest. Worth the visit to the Castle area just for this. However, beware one of the greater rip-offs in Budapest. In the square behind Fisherman's Bastion and beside Matthias Church is at least one street vendor selling flavoured lemonade. The price is not shown, which is not surprising, as it works out to be 9 euro per cup - super expensive in any part of the world, but outrageous in Budapest.

Must Walk. The walk along the riverside of Buda is outstanding the area itself is almost fairy tale with great views of the other side of the city Pest. Fisherman's Bastion is just one of many beautiful buildings in Budapest.

Fantastic views, perfect place to take a book and relax. Although my first impression when I arrived at the small square was: it is cold and it needs some green, as soon as I approached the 'balcony' and got to see the views, my opinion changed straight away.This is the very good place to sit between columns and just chat, read or relax.There is also a bar under the colonnade that has the same views that you get also for free.There is an entry fee if you would like to see the same view from a few steps higher; the fee is approx £1You can't leave Budapest without having seen the views of the city from the Fisherman's Bastion, it is a must do!
Full city view. Amazing beautiful views nice restaurants specially the 22 restaurant near the Vienna gate is recommended
The panorama. It is a special feature of the city that Buda and Pest are separated by the river Danube. If you go up to Fisherman's Bastion then you get a perfect view of the city.

Great Views of the City. Take the steps up from the street and you'll find a treat at the top. Next to the beautiful St. Matthias Church are fantastic panoramic views of the city. There is a small cafe here as well so you can sit and view the splendor, especially on a nice summer day.
Great views. Crowded and hot in the summer, but it offers amazing views of the city... and it's one of the most visited places in the city for a reason, so join the crowd!

A must-see!. A beautiful view of the city, especially from the raised area - a lot of which has been cordoned off for restaurants and paid entry... However, head to the far left and you can go up the stars and through the bar to reach the viewing point.

Great Views and Worth a Visit. This is a must-see when you're in Budapest. But, it is somewhat underwhelming. The way I would describe this area is that it's a pass-through visit to other items on the Buda side. It has great views but there are basically no good places to eat unless you want to pay outrageous tourist prices.

Beautiful view . A beautiful place extremely picturesque....you can see the whole city from here where unbeatable architecture....you can spend upto 2 to 3 hrs clicking pictures and exploring the place. Bus no 16 directly comes from deak ference station to the top.Tickets can be bought either in the bus or at any train station 350 forent for individual tickets and 300 if u buy a bulk of 10 making it 3000.Don't forget to carry your sunglasses it can get hot as it is all open.CBA a general grocery store is around the corner so you don't need to worry about water and other stuff.
Beautiful view!. Were here late at night when it was dark already. The view is amazing! All the city lights and reflections on Danube... This is a must-see.

Mother of all viewing galleries. Located on a prominent segment of Castle Hill, Fisherman's Bastion appears to have been built as part of the defenses for Buda Castle. On closer examination, however, its whimsical fairy tale-like design means that the structure could never have survived serious warfare for long. Indeed, it's more of a series of decorative galleries and towers to provide visitors with various lookout points, or a rather useful set for an epic or fantasy movie. Certainly, the panoramic views of the city of Pest across the Danube River are rather stunning.Although most of the lower ramparts are free of charge, there is a small fee (approx. USD2.50) to enter the upper levels and/or towers. Nevertheless, the views from the free section are already pretty good. And there's always other areas of Castle Hill to get your fix of the Danube and city views of Budapest.
Amazing Bastion. recommend you spend as much time in buda as you can so much to see and do in the whole area the bastion is very Disneyesque with wonderful views

The view from Fisherman's Bastion is beautiful. The Fisherman's Bastion evokes Cinderella's Castle. The photo opportunities are fantastic. A combined ticket for Matthias Church and Fisherman's Bastion allows you access into the Bastion's towers during the day. The views of Pest are dramatic! If you are on Castle Hill in the evening the tourists are minimal and you can enter the towers without fee. The view is equally as dramatic.

Not enought salty. The Fishermanns Bastion in Budapest is really a nice place, beatifull vew to Pest side, the stone/made bastions, work of Schuleck Frigyes in 1902/1905, the same architect who renewed the Matthias Church just next to the bastions. If You spend a 2-3 EUR You can go up to the second floor of the Bastion, the vew is better from there. Together with the Matthias Church, the Hilton hotel and the statue ot king St. Stephen the place could be amaying touristic sight. But it isnt. Why? As we say, like dishes which is not enought salty. The last 2/3 years always something at the sight is under construction. It looks like hungarians want to do it better for the tourists, but in the same time push the tourists off.... I really cant understand it. Anyway, the place is one of those You just must see at least once in a lifetime.

Beautiful . The fisherman's bastion is stunning. The archeteture is beautiful as is the view. On a Saturday you will see numerous brides having their wedding photos taken there. There is a lot of tourists around this area and drinks are a bit more pricey, but it's probably worth it for the fanatic panoramic view of Pest. You can't go to Budapest without visiting this beautiful landmark.
Like a fairytale castle. Castle that looks like straight out of disney tale. Worth to see, but it costs to walk on the wall. Still nice atmosphere, we didn't try the restaurant.

Lovely building great views great history. This was on my top of my list when I came here. It definitely met my epectations. The building is so cute and awesome. I love the views of the city, it is great for taking photos. They history surround the whole area is great. I wiuld say a must see

Just a beautiful place to visit. Halászbástya is one of the places you just need to visit while you are in Budapest. The place is very clean, you have a incredible view over the city, the church is beautiful and you just enjoy yourself there.
So cool. I was brought here by my couch surfing hosts and I was amazed at how beautiful it was up there. Do make sure to swing by.

Truly majestic. During our first evening in Budapest, we visited this gem at sunset. Words can't describe how romantically beautiful it was and we ended up staying until dark, happily snapping pictures. The views were stunning and we had to return again to see the views when the sun is up and shining bright. Also beautiful.

My friends wedding. We went here for my friends wedding it was so beautiful and breathtaking we felt like stars the views over looking the river and the city were amazing. Also in areas they had people dress up as they would have in the early days and you got to try the archery and other hand made axe throwing and spear throwing if your were in Budapest this is a must place to visit I can promise you will not be disappointed
Fairy tale like. Beautiful and magical. Great views of the city and unique photo opportunities. If you visit with the kids, they will think it is a fairy castle.
Great view from the turrets. We took pictures of the structures from the turrets and there is a great view from it. A wedding was being held at the facility and I'm sure the pictures were lovely.

Beautiful view. The architecture of Budapest is unforgottable. This is true for Fisherman's Bastion as well. But the view from here is amazing. The whole city is laying for you. It is a MUST in Budapest.

Highlight of Budapest. The must-see place in Budapest, this place is perched on a hill overlooking the city and gives you great vantage points to get off great shots for memories. If you've got time, get a nice fruitcake or a drink and look out over Budapest across the river. 2 hours would be a decent amount of time here. Pray though it isn't hot when you go over for if it is, it's time to be roasted!
Nice view . Nice view but a lot persons to see. Better to go in the morning, less crowded and you can enjoy more time the view.
Great architecture and excellent view of the Danube and Pest.. It's well worth the time it takes to walk around the Halászbástya and all the buildings and greens surrounding it.

Great views of the river. easy to get to - quieter and well lit up at night when you can see the city all lit up below you - close to St Matthias Church and the funicular railway to take you down the hill

Visual Delight of the River and Buildings. An ideal location to have the stunning views of Danube River and the buildings on the other side of the river specially the House of Parliament. Day and Night viewing are both a delight.
Lovely view!. Beautiful central European architecture! I do not understand why should they charge an entrance fee, but it was worth it for the view.

Like a fairy tale site!. You will love the views over Pest from this beautiful towers! Really does feel like a fairy tale; I would say one of the best views over undoubtedly beautiful Budapest are accessible from Fishermen's Bastion; Take your time while you walk around there;

Stunning views. We came here as part of a walking tour but ended up coming back here to fully appreciate the view! It is one of the most beautiful places to see the city and the architecture of the building itself is very impressive.

Beautiful architecture and views. This is a must-see in Budapest. We loved it and enjoyed spending time in a quieter area of the city-at least on the Sunday we visited. The views of Budapest from here are amazing!

Wonderful View. An amazing view along the River Danube, especially of Pest and the Parliament building just across the river. You can pay a small amount to get onto the first section of the bastion though most other sections can be accessed free of charge.
A must--see part of any visit to Budapest!

the most beautiful view of budapest. it is recommended visiting this site before sunset. you will be amazed of the beautiful view of the side of pest and especially the amazing parliament.the easiest way to get there is to take bus number 16 in front of the hotel Kampinsky

Fairytale turrets, lovely view. Fisherman's Bastion gives a lovely view over the Danube, including Parliament, Pest and the Chain Bridge. The fairytale turrets are also really pretty.
It's conveniently located so you can combine it with a trip to attractions such as St Matthias Church and the Hospital in the Rock.

On Old Buda an nice view point.. Behind the Matthias church the place from where you have an excellent view on the other side of the Danube ( Pest). That area is worth a visit. Even with nice places for dinner of a ice cream.
Absolutely stunning . Absolutely stunning! Especially during the evening. Beautiful view of the city. An absolute must see for a trip though Eastern Europe!

Wonderful place to spend a few quiet moments with your significant other.. Great view over the city, you can feel the history around you, as you walk around through the walls of the old city. In order to visit the tours you have to pay a fee, but you can get awesome picture even if you don't go in the highest tours. I liked the fact that the place was very well maintained, most of the buildings were renovated and the streets were very clean. You can find small restaurant for a romantic evening dinner.What I did not like, and found it disgraceful was the enormous glass Hilton hotel place right in the middle of the market square, between old houses and ancient history. HOW DID THEY GET AUTHORIZATION TO BUILD THAT UGLY THING THERE? Very disappointed from this point of view. Per total, a wonderful place to spend a few quiet moments with your significant other.

Historical Budapest with a Disney-esque Look. Fisherman's Bastion is at the top of the cliffs overlooking the Danube across from the Hungarian Parliament (they spell it Parlament) building. On my first visit, I thought it looked like a copy of Cinderella's Castle from Walt Disney World. The round pointed turrets, and meandering brick wall with a big statue of St.Stephen on a horse right in the middle. Artists and other vendors are in the area selling their wares, as they are all along the Castle area walkways. You can get back and forth from the Metro (M2 at Kalman Ter) via a shuttle bus. Matthias Templom, with its colorful beehive-looking Zolnay tiled roof is adjacent to the open plaza. Some of the best restaurants and cafes are in the Castle area near Fisherman's Bastion. Souvenir shops abound, and a couple of places to buy Kurtos Kalacs (chimney cakes) rolled in cinnamon sugar, or nuts. Popular photos are taken of people sitting on the wall with the Parliament building in the background.

A romantic remnant of the pre-soveat era. The reason why the wall was built has been lost in history but any tourist guide can spin you a good story. Whatever the reason, it is undeniably romantic, and any couple visiting Budapest MUST walk this wall at least once. There are a few restaurant/bars on the wall itself but none are great apart from the location

Good view. Fine view - and the building finished off the square well, but of course it is not that old. Felt sorry for the hooded bird of prey waiting to be photographed for a fee. The whole area atmospheric.

Great place right in the old town. Very beautiful church, nice buildings and status around, very friendly atmosphere. You'll have an opportunity to make some superb shots and walk around. Also there is a good view on the river and the parliament - to the all Pest bank to be fair.
Gorgeous!. This looks like a fairytale castle, it's a beautiful place to visit and take pictures of the fabulous views.

Stunning views. This is a must see in Budapest. The place is amazing and the cathedral next to the Fisherman's bastion is breathtaking. The view is wonderful. This is probably the best place to take pictures of Pest side.

The views marvelous. From the towers and the terrace a panoramic view exists of Danube, Margaret Island, Pest to the east and the Gellért Hill.Its seven towers represent the seven Magyar tribes that settled in the Carpathian Basin in 896.The Bastion takes its name from the guild of fishermen that was responsible for defending this stretch of the city walls in the Middle Ages. It is a viewing terrace, with many stairs and walking paths.A bronze statue of Stephen I of Hungary mounted on a horse, erected in 1906, can be seen between the Bastion and the Matthias Church. The pedestal was made by Alajos Stróbl, based on the plans of Frigyes Schulek, in Neo-Romanesque style, with episodes illustrating the King's life.

Stunning Views of the City. This is definitely one of the places you want to visit. It has incredible views of the Danube and the Pest side of the city. It is a really nice place to take some relaxation and just soak in the city.
Superb !. Beautiful buildings and architecture ! Just like a fairy tale castle. Loved it ! The view of the Pest side is amazing from here.A must for all who are visiting Budapest, not to be missed!
Great views of the city. Climb up the steps to the top and you'll be rewarded with spectacular views of Budapest. Glorious by night!

Nice views. This is a nice area for incredible views. our first trip to budapest we stayed here (in the hilton which is part of the walls) and spent new years there which was a neat place to look out at the city. our second trip was just visited this place briefly. there is a pastry shop nearby, but otherwise we just came for the views, the photos and then went back down.
Great Views. Best location to take photographs of Danube River & City. Number 16 Bus to top of Hill is cheaper then cable car.
Beautiful. You must try to visit this at night as well as the place looks amazing at night and you can see beautifully lit chain bridge, parliament building and other buildings around the city.
Stunning views of the city. Fisherman's bastion was one of the first sights we visited in Budapest and it was beautiful! The building themselves, along with the views were beautiful!

Very beautiful & great views. Would recommend going, such a beautiful area. I got there at about 10:30am & it was already packed with tourists, so I'd recommend going early if you prefer it quieter! Lovely views over the city. You can get the 16 bus up the hill, v good value & a good local experience.
Ok!. Mostly a place built for tourists. Great view of across the Danube. the cathedral next door is spectacular.

fairytale disney castle. great views of Pest from the picturesque Disney like castle over looking the Danube. Even more impressive given that it was largely destroyed during the second world war and has been so well restored.

Breath taking views of the city!. You have to pay to walk along the top of the bastion however There are also many areas open along the wall for free but I would say it is worth the small charge for the full access to the amazing views.Located near Matthias church it offers fantastic idyllic views. You can see chain bridge, the basilica, the parliament and much more. We went round the church first then walked around the bastion in the sunshine with a cheap tasty icecream. It really is a must see!

One of the Best Views of Pest in Budapest.. The "Halaszbastya" is a wondrous view from Pest and offers the place where you can take pictures of people as they stand in the "windows" of the building. A nice place is the small bar at the left tower of the structure. Well worth the visit!
Views. Brilliant views - take a camera and make sure you visit this on a clear day as views of the city are amazing.
Must see. This is a must see in Budapest. This is a beautiful place to visit. This is .located in the Buda side

fantastic walk. On top of the hill, the Fisherman's Bastion provides a fantastic view of the city along the Danube. The church at the background provides a nice depth and the corridor and watch towers makes the scenery more interesting.

Must visit if you're in Budapest!. It was a lovely walk across the river and the views from the top were lovely! You don't have to pay the small fee to go up to the viewing tower (I didn't) because the views are still great from where you are. Have a look at the beautiful roof of Matthias Church whilst you're there, and then I would suggest a visit to Hospital in the Rock as it's so close by. There are also toilets for a small fee of around 200 HUF.
Beautiful monument. Wow! Gorgeous view of budapest with exquisite architecture, reminded us of parc Guel in Barcelona.We happened upon a hungarian flag dance marching band which was an added bonus!

Must see - a unique piece of European history. Much of Budapest is untouched by the ravages of WWII. This piece of the city has been renovated, and brings one back to what it was like to live the age of the Austro-Hungarian empire. You need to take public transport/taxi or a car to get here, but then be prepared to walk around a lot.

Great place for a panoramic view of Pest. Well worth the trek up the hill, easily reached by public transportation (though Széll Kálmán Square is a bit of a challenge now with all the construction). With just a little bit of patience to let everyone else finish with their pictures, you can take some great ones of the Parliament Building and Pest yourself. It may be heresy, but Mattias Church (the usual reason people come here) is, in my view, not the most interesting or beautiful in Budapest, but the Bastion is well worth visiting.

Great vantage point for taking a riverside view of the city. It's a brilliant vantage point to get great views of the city. The riverside views of Budapest are probably one of the best of Europe. Since it is at a good height , you get views of both Buda and the Pest side ! ( the mountains and the plain side) on both sides of Danube river. So if you are going to visit the parliament, do make it point to visit Fisherman's Bastion! You have to reach by climbing the steps, though they do allow some number of cars at the parking nearby.

Great city views!. The Fisherman's Bastion is well worth a visit as it provides excellent views of the city. Budapest has a many unique, large old buildings and a beautiful skyline. There is an entrance fee to walk up to the the higher level of the Fisherman's Bastion that provides the most scenic views - well worth it.

Castle Hill is much better. I didn't pay for the view from Fisherman's Bastion. It appears to be constructed for tourists (though not sure), unlike the castle on Castle Hill nearby. This has a limited viewing area compared to the castle, which has a similar view and is free. The castle viewing area is enormous (could easily accommodate 500+ people). We spent 2 days in this beautiful city but Fisherman's Bastion was a waste of time after going to the castle.
Stunning views. Arguably, the best views in Budapest. A beautiful place with incredible photo ops. My only complaint is the modest fee they charge in order to get up there.

Interesting place with great views.. Avoided the walk by taking the number 16 bus. Once at the top a great place to walk around and take in the great views. My visually impaired friend really appreciated the tactile scale model of the area. The Bastion itself is interesting with its tented turrets and Disney like features. Well sign-posted throughout the area to the other nearby attractions.
Beautiful view of Pest. This is a must see on the Buda side. We also ate at the restaurant that's connected to this structure and it was a glorious venue.
Great view to the city. After a long walk in the castle area it is a place you have to visit. The building is very nice, and you can see a the whole city from one of the best place.
Fisheman`s Bastion. This is extraordinary piece of the history, with a lot to offer , and the architectural design is wort of millions dollars.
BEAUTY. go up all the way and enjoy the view. you get the paranoma of the city . just beautiful also they have few restaurants , ice cream parlours , fountains .

A selfie taker's heaven; incredible views. The bastion offers incredible views of the Danube, Parliament, and is near Matthias Cathedral. One of my favorite elements of this attraction is the scale model with braille descriptions so that visually impaired guests can visualize the majesty of the monuments. Be wary of the selfie sticks and self-involved selfie-takers. There is an excellent restaurant and a few cafés on the bastion, so plan to grab some food while you are here. The Marzipan Museum is also steps away.
Everything you need. A lovely place to visit. Easy to get to and plenty to see and do when you get there. Plenty of free wi fi. A must when visiting Budapest.

Wear comfortable shoes for the climb!. This was a wonderful spot to take pictures and meet other travelers. I would suggest comfortable shoes because many of the streets have decorative or cobble stones and they would ruin heels or wedge shoes.

Scenic views. The terrace is a lovely place to view the opposite side of the Danube, including the Parliament Building, by day or evening. There is a small cafe below the upper terrace with refreshments, but the sandwiches there were pre-packaged, and a bit of a disappointment. There is another place to eat or dine in the terraces, but it wasn't open when we visited. Also, a chimney cake stand and a gelato stand were closing shop.
Nice but there are better views. Although this is a nice spot to see the city from and has nice architecture if you want a better view of the city the top of the citadel is probably the place to go.
a nice historical place. the whole place is good we took a bus to reach there not so far to go u can see the whole budapest from upper there

Lovely Views . Amazing views of the city from here. We went early in the morning and already it was getting busy, so I'd advise not to go to late in the day if you want to avoid the crowds. It was very easy to get their using pupil transport .
Great viewpoint. Busy but well worth a visit. Liked views and architecture. Nice shops around site but spoiled a bit by modern hotel building in middle of historic site
I take my Holland frend to visit the place. Beatiful panoramic view of Budapest ( Pest side) and the Danube,but you can see all of this with out to pay.

The view and panorama from the Bastion is excellent, You can make good photos!. If You are visiting Budapest as a tourist or businessman You must visit this place in the Buda side - Castle Area.
Do not make the mistake we did with friends - we entered the restaurant!
It looks impressive!
The service is bad, the food is bad but very expensive!

Best view in Budapest!. We had only a couple of days in Budapest, yet visited this amazing site twice on two different tours, and it was right outside our hotel room window in the Budapest Hilton (Danube View room). The view in front, facing the Danube, is spectacular in daytime and nighttime, with the stunning Hungarian Parliament building in full view along the river and views up and down the Danube and across to the Pest side. Just watching the river traffic can be mesmerizing. The architecture of the Bastion is interesting and even with crowds of tourists swarming Castle Hill one can easily find an overlook. Behind the Bastion, on the crown of Castle Hill, is the spectacular cathedral just steps from the Bastion, and next door the Budapest Hilton. So much worth seeing in Budapest, and on Castle Hill!

Fantastic!. One of the most beautiful building's I have ever seen, just Fantastic to look at. Went to see it with my daughter, she loved it too. It's uphill but Well worth the visit. Lovely roof-top bar too to relax in and take in all the view's.

beautiful. This is the must see in Budapest, in fact it’s impossible to miss! There is a charge for the upper level on one part but I don’t feel there was anything to see that you couldn’t see from the lower levels. It reminded me of a sandcastle and when it was lit up at night it was stunning. Absolutely beautiful.
The view alone is worth it. You won't get much better views of Budapest from here. Nice places to eat and some wonderful Gelato can be found here. Spend an hour or a day walking around,
Tourist trap. Nice views but otherwise not much to see or do. Surroundings are interesting to walk around. Hotel Hilton offers a nice bar.
Great attraction. Very nice building with beautiful view to Budapest in the heart of the Castle area. The best place to take photos about Budapest. If you are in Budapest, don't miss it.

Historical place in Budapest. We arrived here on our Scenic boat cruise tour. There is a marvellous view of the Daube and the city. Many of the buildings and statues contain bullet marks from the various battles fought in the area.Across the street there is a lovely restaurant which serves everything from coffee to a full course meal.

Fantastic Views. We walked up in the baking heat and were very glad we persevered to the top because the views were just fantastic! There are plenty of spots to take good photographs of Pest and also plenty places to rehydrate after the walk up. A must do in Budapest!

Overlooking the Danube. Fisherman's Bastion sits on the cliffs of Buda overlooking the Danube. It offers a panoramic view of the city of Pest, most pronounced is the Parliament. It's a great place to take a load off your feet and have a cold one after visiting all the Museums in the area.Reminds one of the Disney Castle or Vice Versa. It's fairly new (I think it was built in the 1930's) and it's NOT a castle.

A fairytale quality, but too many people. You cannot avoid seeing Fisherman's Bastion if you are exploring Castle Hill in Buda as it is next to Matthias Church. It looks medieval with an almost fairytale quality to it, but is only just over 100 years old. The main reason to visit is for the wonderful view across the Danube towards Pest Equally, it is very impressive looking back from Pest, especially when it is lit up at night. There is plenty of seating for you to sit back and admire the view, even a free WiFi area if you are getting withdrawal symptoms from social media and lots of bars and restaurants in the vicinity.I didn't pay to climb to the higher level as the view was perfectly clear from the bottom. What spoiled it slightly for me was the sheer number of people. I realise that this is completely hypocritical as I was also a tourist wanting to enjoy the view, but I would recommend avoiding the middle of the day and coming as early as possible

Beautiful view, but not worth to pay the entry - you can see everything for free anyway. Halaszbastya is a neo-romantic building in the Buda castle neighborhood, never used for any battles or anything like that, but as a scenic monument in Budapest. The scenery is truly gorgeous and you will have a lot of photo opportunities above the heart of the city, featuring the Danube river, the characteristic Parlament building, the Chain Bridge and the Basilika. Particularly worth visiting after dark, with all the floodlights creating a very dramatic effect!Expect the place to be crowded with tourists most of the time taking holiday snapshots and selfies, so you may have a hard time being able to take a photo without any strangers in it.
