There is a small cafe in the area, but the prices were quite high and the whole establishment not very attractive, so we avoided it.There is no need to purchase any entry ticket, most of the facilities you can enjoy for free anyway. Also, the beautiful nearby Matthias Church is worth checking out, but only from the outside. You will need to purchase a ticket to get inside, which is not particularly interesting.

great view. Very busy area but a wonderful view to the river. The area behind has lovely pedestrian areas and restaurants to choose from. The Hilton is directly behind this area .The funicular is close by or you can do the stairs to the bridge to cross to Pest.

Wonderful vistas at night.. The bastion can become very crowded with tourists during the day, but at night it is much quieter and the views are truly outstanding looking out across the Danube to Pest. The Bastion is situated behind Matthias Church and we spent some time at the Bastion one evening after dinner waiting for a concert at the Church.
A must visit place. It is an amazing place to visit. One of the main tourist attraction in Budapest. It is a representation of the rich history of the city.
A Highlight of a great City. The site itself is well worth a visit. Fascinating history and architecture. But the views of the Danube and the City below alone are worth going for,

Scenic location. Went here taking the number 16 bus across the square from the main metro interchange. This bus crosses the chain bridge and then meanders up the hill to St Mathias church where you get a good view of pest from the Bastion. There were a couple taking wedding photos here and it does make a fantastic backdrop. Was a beautiful sunny day. Unless you particularly want to ride the funicular to the top of the hill either walk up to be rewarded the views or take the bus. The former had long queues and is not operated by public transport so there is an extra fare.
Walking the castle district. A truly breathtaking view of the Danube and Pest worth the hike in 37 degree weather. The history of the area and the church are interesting and beautiful in equal parts

Great view. The surrounding wall affords a beautiful view of the river and Pest. Tends to be very crowded on weekends. There are public toilets in the area (70 eur.) so it makes a good rest stop. This is a more recent addition to the area, not historical.

Beautiful with excellent views of Budapest. We participated in a walking tour around this lovely place. Excellent views of the city, it is very clean and lots of photo opportunities. We couldn't go into the church as there was a service on (Sunday morning).
Fantastic view over Budapest. A must when you are in Budapest, fantastic views over the city and even though theres a lot of tourists around, you can still get a feeling of the history.

Great view of Budapest. If you visit Budapest you should go up to this area. It is in the old section which is the Buda side. The views from here is fantastic. You will also visit the church and there is a retail section with shops and restaurants
Great photo ops from here. Come here to get great shots of the city and to wonder the streets and look Into the little shops which sell artwork etc.

A highlight. The Fisherman's Bastion was one of the highlights of our visit to the castle area. It is a wonderful structure and very prominent on the hillside. The views of Budapest are spectacular so take full advantage of this photo opportunity. There is a bar on the upper level at one end that also provides a view. We enjoyed our ice cream from the square below.

Well worth a visit. You're almost certain to visit the Castle area during your visit to Budapest, so it would be a shame to miss this part of it, it's very nice and gives a great view across the Danube and Pest.Unfortunately it is spoiled by the absolute monstrosity of a concrete block hotel right behind it. Heads should roll for allowing that to be built - many backhanders involved, I'm sure.

Clearly one of the most famous and well known hotspots of Budapest.. The view over Budapest, especially during nightfall, is great. The surroundings are beautifully restored. If you go into the lobby of the Hilton hotel, you can see the well preserved ruins behind a glass wall. But there are way too many tourists.

A truly elegant and breathtaking site.. A breathtaking view of of Pest from this beautifully carved monument. Go early in the day to avoid the crowds, or better yet, wait for nighttime, when Budapest comes to life in lights. All of the spectacular buildings along the Danube sparkle at night. A truly elegant and breathtaking site.

Smaller in Person. Located right in front of the church, lots of gorgeous statues hand engraved into the stone, you have to pay to enter and walk the entire ridge its built on, however if want to save they're plenty of things to see on the outside, offers a great view of the pest side of the city.

Amazing View. The view from this location is amazing. A great photo op of Budapest.
Make sure to include this site in your visit to Budapest.
Worth a visit. The view from here is outstanding, both day and night. Stroll around the area, enjoy the view and possibly have a beer.

Fabulous night view. I went there at night and I must say, the view was incredible. The parliament building looks particularly pleasing on the eye. It's best to go at night where it is much cooler and less busy.

Must See in Buda. The views from Fisherman's Bastion are spectacular. We visited it during the day and nighttime and loved it both times. There was a bride and groom getting photos taken during the nighttime and the scenery for their pictures was breathtaking. It is worth the trip to see this site.

Very pretty and picturesque with views across the river.. Easy stroll up the hill or catch the funicular railway. Beautiful views across the river. Nice restaurants close by (do not choose the visitor set menu) Lovely stroll up the hill or make use of the funicular railway.

evening meal. my wife and I had a superb meal here on a warm evening overlooking the danube and Budapest. the food (though expensive) was of the highest standard. We didnt order a starter but were given a complimentary one while our main was beeing prepaired. The views were just breathtaking as the light deminished and the lights of Budapest started to illuminate the historic buildings. A violinist and chello were played on the terrace as we ate. It was a wonderfull start to our stay here.The only drawback I felt the duo who provided the music should not have been allowed to try and sell their cd to the customers lowering the status of a first class restaraunt,however we have now a great memory of a wonderfull meal.

Amazing!!. When standing on the Buda side of the river looking over to the Fisherman's Bastion you are met with the most amazing sight and the night time view is equally amazing. The building is magnificent. Its even more beautiful close up when you can see the intricate carvings and architecture. Absolutely a must see and the views from the Pest side back over to the Buda side are just as amazing with the views of the Parliament House amongst others buildings !!

More than a View. I would rate this our top pick in Budapest. To be more specific Buda. We arrived by local Metro train service at the foothills of Halaszbastya and walked up the hill for a good 20 minutes to reach the hill top (Fisherman's Bastion). I had no idea that it would take us a good 6 hours to see the entire area including lunch. This is not just a viewing spot (fantastic views), it is a cluster of other historical attractions within a walled area including a castle and many medievial buildings, St Mathias Church, palace and other buildings that I cannot recall what they were. There are many eateries, restaurants, traditional handicraft shops, to keep you busy. The moment you enter the walled area, the place transforms you back in time and there are moments you feel as if living in the past. If you are in Budapest for a few days, I would definitely suggest spliting your stay between Pest and Buda and staying at one of the hill top hotels (possibly Hilton) to enjoy the evenings and nights in the area. All signs are modernity have been carefully conceiled behind this otherwise medieval neighborhood that I am ready to bet is not as noisy and at times very roudy as Pest gets. This is not a place to be rushed. Take it easy and spend a few hours here. Feel like going back again soon

Beautiful old structure with fantastic view!. Don't miss this when you visit Budapest. It is surrounded by other tourist attractions. Beautiful view of Budapest from there. The structure itself is a work of art. It has steps going up so I don't believe that there is acess up but it can be viewed from below.
Must Visit. Our hotel was so close to this amazing sight. I ate breakfast looking at it. It's like a fairytale. Definitely one to visit for a photo opportunity. The view from up here is stunning !!!
Views. Great views and Disney's inspiration for castles, have a gentle stroll around and then find the steps by the church and walk down to the river and a beer.

Gorgeous views. This place has the best views of Pest and the Parliament. It's also beautiful by itself. But... The best areas are taken by cafes now. So if you want to see the views, you need to go to one of their restaurants and order food or drinks. Otherwise, you must to go to the top and fry yourself in the sun. We were there with the outside temperatures over 100 degrees. Still, this is a must visit place!

Might as well visit if seeing St. Mathias church.. You cannot miss Fisherman's Bastion if you go to St. Mathias Church (which is clearly worth a visit). It is located behind the church with a great view overlooking the Danube and Pest. When you first see the structure, your first thought is "Disney was here!", but the creation is all Hungarian. There is an easy walk up the structure stairs to a good viewing area. While I would not say that it is worth a special trip to see Fisherman's Bastion, assuming you are visiting or touring Buda, it should be one of your stops.

Fabulous views. Visiting the castle district was one of my favourite parts of our trip to Budapest. We visited the Fisherman's Bastion as part of a ticket which gave us entrance to the Tower and inside the Church. The view was beautiful and what made it even better was that we got a great view of the places completing the red bull air race course which was on during our stay. Don't miss this!
Avoid eating. The place is nice but not worth paying for. And avoid eating there. They serve ready made stuff from coop.

beautiful, fantastic views.. You can spend at least half a day here. The views of the river and of Budapest from the top of the hill are enough to justify visiting this site. Nice little coffee shops and stores to visit. Beautiful churches and monuments. A Budapest highlight.You can take a bus to the top or you can walk. I recommend walking , you get more view points for photo taking.

Beautiful Place. This is a great place to explore. There are amazing views, shopping, and food. Take the time to appreciate the history. Lots of great places for photos as well. Not a lot of shaded areas so on a hot day be mindful of this.
Wonderful Views of the city!. Last stop on our walking tour of Buda was the Fisherman's Bastion. This overlook offered a fantastic view of the city.
Definitely worth a vist. Beautiful buildings very interesting and beautiful church interior.Surrounded by lots of nice shops and bars

Fantastic viewing point. It would be easy to see the Bastion as no more than a place to look out across the Danube and the beautiful buildings on the Pest side. And it is certainly that! It is built at the top of the hills with the most panoramic views across the river. It is the best place from which to see the city.But it is certainly beautiful in its own right - a bit like a fairly tale castle. In fact it adds to the quality of the vista with its portholes, arched windows and seven towers. The best way to see it is to take the funicular to the castle area and then walk through the old town as far as the equally beautiful St Matthias Church which watches over the Bastion itself.It is also a lovely sight in its own right especially if seen from the Danube.A must see!

Fine Views of the Danube and Pest. Not to come here when visiting Budapest would be like visiting Paris without looking at the Effiel Tower. Stunning views, we were lucky enough to see the Red Bull Air Races from there. Cannot comment on the food, as we didn't try it.

Wonderful view. Great view of the Danube and Pest, including Margaret Island and the Parliament Building. There are places to get food and drinks that I would have loved to stop at if I hadn't been on a tour. Best view would be in the afternoon when the sun is behind you.

its a fab place from a distance. its a fab place from a distance. And provides a grand view of Budapest from its balcony. But the whole area is closed on Mondays which the hop on hop off guys don't tell you.

Looks great from a distance. The fisherman's bastion looks stunning from across the Danube from Pest but get up close and the attraction is spoiled by the sheer number of tourists swarming all over it and the fact that the structure itself has been turned, in places, into cafe's and restaurants. The view of the opposite bank of the Danube is great and worth the trip though. Don't go in the middle of the day or you'll be jostling with bus loads of people trying to catch photo opportunities in amongst the intricate stonework. When I went it was impossible to get a shot without a stranger in the background.
Beautiful. Very beautiful architecture with another amazing viewpoint of Budapest. Definitly worth a visit and a nice area to walk around in also.

Don't pay!. We saw the ticket booth for this, and assumed that you needed to pay to get in. Buying a ticket gets you access to one VERY small section, that is no more special than the rest, all of which is free. Anyway, other than that, it is a nice place to visit, and to view Budapest.

Great view from here!. Really liked this spot - great view especially as the sun sets looking at the parliament. It was nice to walk down from here. I would have gladly had a drink at the bar, but it seemed to close early.

Great views night or day. Beautiful to view from the street, but amazing once you have made the walk (or funicular railway) to the top. Probably the most accessible views of Budapest (as the Citadel is quite a hike) from a disneyesque viewpoint. With towers and walls this amazing construction has windows which overlook the very best of . Surprised it is number one, but sometimes the best things in life really are free.

Elegant and beautiful. The food and service was outstanding . The waiters were engaged and informative. They made this fabulous dinner even more spectacular. Oh and then the amazing view! Certainly not to be missed if in Budapest. Loved it!
A must see. I love walking round this area it is something very special I think and again the views are spectacular across the river to the parliament building

From Buda to Pest. If you go to Budapest you must visit to Fisherman's Bastion.
Just go there, take a walk and enjoy this area. You can see some interesting buildings, have a meal, and enjoy the views.
If you want to go to the upper balcony, a fee must be paid.

Well worth visiting. Fabulous place to visit, breathtakingly beautiful. We went on a really hot day which helped. Two good places to eat there and not too expensive. The town is also beautiful - a lovely place for a stroll

Cinderella castle experince, no cinderella ;). Overcrowded tourist attraction with somewhat annoying gypsy musicians all over the place. Stunning views, can take a lot of good photos, but won't remember it for the rest of my life. I've seen some better things.
P.S. I love Budapest, don't get me wrong. Just not as exciting as advertised ;)

A beautiful touristy building with no apparent purpose. The building is beautiful, but serves no purpose except to provide a place for tourists to gather and spend money on overpriced coffee. The surrounding streets are lovely.

Amazing. I think anyone going to Budapest has to visit Fisherman's Bastion. I thought I was in fairy land amazing also if you want to have an amazing meal over looking Budapest go to the highest point
Must see, beautiful architecture, great view. Really enjoyed our visit, very relaxing, fantastic photo ops, and a river view of the beautiful Parliament Building. Visited Dec 2011

Beautiful view of Danube and Parliament. I bought ticket to enter the Fisherman's Bastion, it is not expensive but you can also enjoy it for free as you still can see the view from below without enter the "paid" area, sorry don't know how to call it. The good thing if you buy ticket for it, it was not crowded as the free spot, so you can take your time to taking pictures or just sitting in the benches and admiring the view of Danube river and the famous parliament building.
Good view over Pest . Best location to have a view on Pest. Easy to achieve by foot via chain bridge and stairs. You have to pay a small amount for the best views.

Lovely views. One of the places on the Buda side to get views of the river and its various bridges, and a good view of the Hungarian Parliament. Don't pay to go up on the battlements, you can see just as much from various free viewpoints.

Walking Zone. You can walk to the Fisherman's Bastion from the Buda Castle through the down zone with the trees or up zone between the little old streets. This place is proper for photography and watch the river with its bridges. You can visit the Cathedral at the same time.

Leave your time for elsewhere. I knew the history of this place, so was not overwhelmed by what it represents. I think it cheapens the beautiful church nearby. They charge you to walk along the bastion now. While the views are good, there are other spots in Buda for free that are just as good.

Must see in Budapest!. Have been here with a friend! Architecture is stunning! Must see!
Very big territory and beautiful park around.
Lovely views. Lovely views of the city from this point, but you do have to pay small fee to access it. Probably best to visit on a clear day.

Fantastic location and view!. Loved our experience at this unique restaurant!
The view is spectacular, the staff couldn't be nicer and the food was excellent!
I recommend getting there in advance and walk around, the St-Mathias church is quite beautiful!
A must if you are travelling in Budapest.
You should make reservation.

Relaxing and historical. The Fisherman's Bastion is a lovely white vantage point in which to view Budapest and the Parliament Building. It has interesting arches for incredible photos. It's provides a quite place to reflect on the beauty of the Danube and surrounding area.

A very interesting sight. This is a very interesting place with an equally interesting story behind it. It has great views. The day we were there tons of tourists were also there! It was still interesting to see.

The view from the top is magnificent. I don't know if you can go there at night but in the daytime, we saw everything from the Danube to the Parliament building adjacent to the waterfront. I'm sure it would be lovely at night because there is nothing like Budapest and their lights at night
Must see when in Budapest. Loved this place! The buildings are incredibly beautiful. Great view of Pest and the Danube. Gorgeous at night when it is lit .
Tour with Viking Ship. This was a very interesting Landmark and we very much enjoyed our visit. It was well worth our time must see.
The Spires!. Really unique architecture. Definitely worth a trip to the Buda side to see. Packed with visitors, but still nice, and some places give you great photo ops of the Pest side of the city.

History teaches us about the present. A war memorial that should be experienced.. Underneath there is a war memorial where the wounded and injured were taken care of. It is a testimonial to the will of people to overcome incredible odds by surviving under extreme conditions. I was transported to a war and time that continues to defy reason and underscores the importance of confronting those same issues that pose threats to our liberties today.

Just wow!!. The view of the city from Fisherman's Bastion beats most other views, the hike there is definitely worth the effort. There is a gorgeous little cafe built in the bastion, make sure to get there for the sunset and relax with a loved one while having a drink. Perfect way to end the day!

This restaurant features in my top ten ever !. Fantastic Position, with great views from the top of Budapest, wonderful food, Music and great service.You will not be disappointed with this restaurant I promise

A must see for the commanding views of Budapest (well Pest, actually). You can get here by bus (free if you have the Budapest card) or the cable car (costs whether you have the card or not!) but you can always do it the way we did, by walking all the way up from the bridge. More rewarding that way as you get to "experience" just how high it is. You will be well-rewarded when you get there as the views are really nice.

Great view of Pest and good ice cream on route!. We visited this monument as part of the Free Walking Tour.Whilst the steps up to it won't be for everyone, the view from the top is spectacular. I recommend a visit to anyone looking for a great view of Parliament and the Church. Take a camera.
Great location and view. Even if the weather was not so nice, the view of this place is really wonderful. The parlement building is a nice view on the other side of the river.
Wonderful views. Great views of the city and a very quiet and peaceful walk up from the city centre. Was quite busy when I arrived at the top but still quiet so that I could enjoy the view in peace.

Fisherman's bastion was very nice.. The view from Fisherman's Bastion was great. You are on top of Buda with a fantastic view over the Danube of the parliament buildings and other city highlights. the atmosphere was vibrant and the place is spotlessly clean.
A must see area of Budapest. If you are in Budapest you have to visit the castle area.Lots to see and good bars and restaurants.A great view of the parliament building at night.

Pretty area, with great views of the Pest side of the Daunbe.. The day we were there it was rather foggy, so I didn't have the best view of the famed Parliament Building on the other side of the river. However, the Fisherman's Bastion complex is very attractive with lots of nooks & cranny's to explore. If you are really lucky you may get to have your photo taken with a Gold Eagle or Falcon (For a fee. It was 5 euro w/the falcon, 8 euro with the eagle)

Stunning views, great for meandering on a weekend. I love walk around here on the weekends. Usually there is some sort of live music to be heard from the restaurant. In the summer, there are many tourists which make it a bit less peaceful than it is in the winter. The restaurant caters to tourists and I wouldn't recommend it unless you want an excuse to sit around and enjoy the beautiful view of the Danube and Pest.

Meh..... Great views and the castle was fun in a Disney sort of way. That said, do not pay the 740 Forints to walk up the elevated view. Not a large sum, but anything would have been a waste. You can have better views by sneaking up to the restaurant. It is such a cool city that you don't want to spend too much time here. So much to do.

Disney style turrets but takes 2 minutes to see. Fishermans bastion is magical to see it as you approach it but when you arrive at it there is nothing to say about it. The only good thing is to see the view over pest from it. I rated it 3 stars as there is not much to see when you get there.
nice views from top. You have to buy a ticket to enter bastions.From here you can see nice views of danube and other attractions.Recommended.
Calming, nice view on the city,. Matthias church near Bastion, one of the most beautiful churches in the Europe. Nice restaurant terrace where you can have a drink. Fairy tale.

Viewpoint and restaurant. When you visit Buda castle it is empirious to visit the fisherman's bastion. It is the big viewpoint behind the Mathias Church. From here you have a Great view to Pest and specialy the Parlament. I didn't visit the restaurant, but the setting os most appealing.
Magnificent!. Being on Castle Hill, the views were magnificent, although I can't recall why it's called the Fisherman's Bastion!

Beautiful but little bit out of context. It is Beautiful and there have a great view, but because it is quite new (designed and built between 1895 and 1902) compared to rest of the castle hill, it wasn’t anything special or impressive to me.
Great views. Great way to see the city! This is a must see if in the area. We loved the area and the views. It was not overly crowded, which was nice.
walk through, good for pictures. There are excellent views of the city from this point, the structure itself is gorgeous and very interesting.
Nice views. Beautiful views and nice buildings. Not worth of paying the extra for the Fisherman's bastion ticket as you get practically the same experience without the ticket.

Like a fairy castle with fabulous view!. Fishermen's Bastion is a beautiful spot - on the old Buda side - to visit and from which to view the Danube, Parliament, and newer city of Pest. The view is incredible, especially at night. The stories as to why the Bastion was built vary, and probably don't really matter. It is a very unusual structure, with turrets and arches and little domes, but on a historic square so there is a lot to see close by. There are also a number of lovely restaurants, cafes, and shops within walking distance. A funicular can take you up/down (or both) the hill, also great for viewing and photos. St. Mathias Church is very beautiful, right behind the Bastion, and also well worth a visit. This is a traffic-restricted area so you need to arrive by bus, taxi, or funicular - unless you're staying at the Hilton or another hotel up on Hill which will allow car entry. A visit to this beautiful area is definitely a must-do if in Budapest!
Stunning views. As a structure it is unique and almost Disney-like, but the views are breath-taking. It is undoubtedly a highlight of the castle area.

Worth the effort. This is a really cool area that is quite beautiful and has amazing views. Would be a great place to bring some food to have a picnic. Great to visit day and night for the vistas.Easiest to take funiculaire by castle or take the 16 bus, especially if you have a hard time with stairs.
Unforgettable. The setting, attention to detail, service and the food make this a night I will never forget. Will definitely go back.
Lovely view. The view over the Danube is awsome. Thbbastion.e monument is Lovely and gives lots of opportunities to nice photos. Don't míss tne chucrch of St Mathyas just by the monument.

Imagine yourself as a protector of the castle. Lovely views and vistas from here. Nice to walk along the old walls, particularly at sunset and later to catch some beaut photo opportunities, then take your pick of many nearby restautants

Most Romantic Place in Budapest!. This place is simply stunning. One can easily spend 3-4 hours here. It is best to come here around early evening to get the day and night views. Both have their own charm and have different experience. Everything here can be enjoyed for free (without paying any entry fee) but those who love music must try and catch a concert at the Mathais Church. A walk down to the chain bridge from here is also lovely. We went here in the evening and stayed till about 9 pm to enjoy with evening and night view but it was very crowded. So on our last day we came here around 11 and it was lovely with few tourists around.
Beautiful. Such a lovely looking place very romantic and this was where my husband found his beloved penny press!!
Beautiful architecture and views of the city. The fisherman's bastion is a must see in Budapest for me. It's beautiful, with great views of the Pest side of the city.

Picture perfect. The Buda side of Budapest is full of monuments and of course St Mathias Cathedral. The Fishermans Bastion is the gateway to this area...importantly it also gives you an amazing view of the Pest side on the other side of the Danube, as well as the Chain Bridge which is the most famous of the bridges that connect these 2 cities..forming Budapest....

Reviews Forgot to Mention Views. Almost missed this site, but when you get here you know why it's one of the top sites.You can fill your camera from anywhere in this area. Even on a cloudy day it was fantastic. Good placed for taking a break for a snack or lunch.
Just gorgeous. The views over the river and the city are well worth the climb. Stunning views and if its a hot day you get a lovely cooling breeze.
Best view of Budapest . If you go to the last tower, you can climb up for free. It is a really lovely view of the city, even on a cloudy day! A must see!

Magnificent. This is a must for your Budapest visit. Explore the walls and turrets, marvel at the glorious views over the Danube with the Parliament Buildings and St. Margaret's Island. You can access this by walking up about 100 steps, some uneven, or ride the funicular for a small fee.

The view. Yes the view and the whole architecture of the place is good and they say that it is good even from the top but I chose not to go up and have the sight from the restaurant and I found it equally rewarding. The restaurant is a little pricey but with the view and the whole ambiance it was a worthy experience.
Amazing Views. Amazing Views and nice place to be. We didn't stay long but if you want to go around the whole place you need to spend some good time there.
a great piece of architecture. This is great to walk around and admire. There is also so much in that one area and you will be spoiled for choice. Just remember comfortable shoes and a camera <3

Walt Disney Castles Inspired by Fisherman's Bastion?. Far-fetched, but to me the turrets looked so very familiar from Disney cartoon. Great river view. It was very hot, crowded and best as a short, photo snapping stop on the overall citadel stop. Have change for the washroom attendant.

Great View. Fisherman's Bastion is nice to walk around and take pictures from ! There is a fee to go walk up the steps to the bridge area but if you walk the length of the bastion, you will find stairs that lead to a small bar area where you can purchase a drink but you absolutely do not have to buy anything. Everyone just walks through it to get to the terrace where the views are even higher up than the pay to go on bridge and they are FREE. There are many awesome areas to get a lovely picture of the Pest side across the Danube.

Great photo op. This is a really pretty area, with great views of the Pest side of the city, also located right near Matthias Church. There is an upper level that you can pay for to get some unobstructed views, but this upper level is free at night (not sure what time they stop charging) so you can get some great night pics, and it's much quieter up there.
The view. Go at night when it's lit up. Then it's very pretty. And looks like a fairy castle we did it on the hop on bus in the evening and walked around it in the daytime
Splendid. You can take marvelous pictures here. ;) The scenery and the building itself are all such beauties. If you visit Budapest, this has to be a part of the program.

stunningly beautiful!!. Like a fairy book scene, this place was amazing. You can stand and just stare, stunning! In front of the castle district easy walk up to there and to the church behind. They say it is "Disney-esque" but that is an insult to this scene! Disney can say it is fashioned after this Bastion, but not the other way around. It was beautiful!

Panoramic views and history. The buildings are very different to others in the city and with it being close to Matyas Church it is easy t combine the two. Whilst visiting improvement works to the pubic realm were being undertaken and looked very impressive so it will be a nice pedestrian area once complete. There are great photo opportunities across the city and also to take selfies!

Like a fairy tale. My fantastic hotel (Baltazar) was on the Buda side, so I was lucky to have Fisherman's Bastion, St. Matthias church & the Buda Castle right in my 'hood. Day and night visits are a must, it's so beautiful and there are many nice cafes and cool little stores nearby...expecially if you walk up or over a couple of blocks.
Amazing views. Quite simply a lovely, romantic experience, in amongst the towers, the clean air and the picture-perfect views. It's what selfie sticks were made for!

Amazing!. If this is the only thing you will see the first time you are in Budapest, it will be enough! Have a walk and enjoy the scenery, because the view is fantastic. You are usually never alone, but since the place is huge, it does not really bother. There is a great restaurant there, just before you reach the top - try their wine selection! Also, if you collect the memory coin (the one where an image is imprinted onto a 5 cent coin), there is a machine for that at the top behind the central building.

Glorious View of Buda and Pest. The Fishermans Bastion (pay the modest charge to go to the second level) provides a great place to overlook the Danube and the city while having a drink and a tasty, light meal if one wishes.

A MUST..... This is an area that MUST be seen to be appreciated.. It is vast and very crowded but worth the time.. so do not rush it.. The views, alone are worth the time spent.. SO.. have your camera along !!!! walk it all and take your time... the best area to view PEST...

Interesting architecture, beautiful city vistas. This is a must see. Unique architecturally. Lovely photo ops. See the panoramic view from a vantage point. Many other sights around and several coffee shops and restaurants where you can enjoy the Danube.
Nice view. Nice view, not necessary to buy a ticket for a similar view a short way away. Must visit to enjoy the view.
Great View. You'll have a great view of the city from here. Visit the cathedral and the palace too! Put aside at least a few hours to cover this whole area. Definitely a must go.

Fantastic view. This venue enables fantastic views as well as understanding the structure of Budapest.
Gets a little congested near to where coaches are allowed but after that wandering the streets is great. Architecturally Mattias church is superb.
Amazing. Amazing views of the city from above and it is definitely a MUST see! We had a little lunch and cooled off with some ice cream! Our kids enjoyed themselves!

Fisherman's Bastion. Beautiful views across the Danube to the Parliament. The bastion was built to honour the fishermen who defended the city.
Stairs to climb and I didn't see any disabled access. However well worth the short I
climb.
The history of this place is fantastic. The view from the top is just amazing for taking pictures. But you will have to walk a lot so do bring comfortable shoes.

Impressive. This structure looks like a toy from across the river, but it's more impressive when you come closer & climb the stairs. The best part about this place is a perfect view over Danube river & Pest, most notably the Parliament building.
A must place to visit in Budapest. The Bastion has nice views of the city and Danube river including the Parliament, Chain Bridge and center city area.
Great view. The views over the city from here are breathtaking. The bastion itself honours the fishermen who defended the city and is a fitting tribute. Don't forget your camera.
Beautiful views . This is a very unique building that overlooks the Danube River and parliament. I was surprised to find it to be the most crowded attraction in the city.
Amasing. An amasing cathedral! you can go there on foot or by bus. or by a cable railway. all ways are nice and gives you a perfect view on the river and the Parliament! a "must see"!!!
Great Views. If you visit Fisherman's Bastian, know there are two towers, one that requires a ticket, and a second, where the view is just as spectacular and is free.

Great view across Danube, but better things behind. This spot gets a lot of hype for its view, which is very good, but there are so many similar vantage points in the Budapest Castle Hill precinct.
But for us, the highlight of heading to the Bastion was to find the uniquesly decorated interior of St Matthias' Church

Fairy castle beauty. There is something almost magical about Fisherman's bastion with its beautiful turrets and stunning views. The nearby bars sell good local beers, and the live classical music and beautiful sunsets are included in the price. A must see.

Fantastic!. Looks like a fairy castle. It's a very beautiful place, I like it so much! For my opinion, the best place in Buda! We have a lot of fantastic photos of the castle and of the view from there to Pest. Recommend it for all tourists!
Fairytale-like. I initially thought this was the castle but apparently not. It certainly looks the part though! Beautiful architecture and a lovely place to walk around and take in the views.

Nice sunny afternoon on Fisherman`s Bastion. If you would like to see Budapest with great view, then you have to go up here! We walked there from Margarit Island and it is not so far and easy to find way through streets. From here you can go to Castle, Museum,... There are bars, restaurants and shops around. If the weather is nice and sunny there could be crowd even in the middle of week :) Overall: nice!

Wonderful!. An amazing place in Budapest! Great wiev day and night, specially at night when you can see all the lights from Pest and the bridges. Highly recomended for the wiev! Go there and take some photos...but not much else.

Great view, do not pay for ticket. The view from Fisherman's Bastion is certainly incredible. It overlooks the River Danubue and also offers a neat view of Matyas Templom. You can pay for a ticket (350 HUF for students) to go into certain parts of the Bastion, but honestly I would not have paid had I known what I would be able to view. The views from the free turrets are just as amazing as the ticketed one!
Budapest Bastion. Another historical & interesting place for visitors We were always shaking our heads in surprise at the beauty to be seen around each corner The view from here is beautiful

Beautiful views from above. Beautiful views from above overlooking the Parliament building and River Danube. We had our group photo taken in this site. There are a lot of souvenir shops and coffee shops around the area.

Nice view, but don't pay for it!. There's a bautiful Danube view waiting for you in The Fishermen's Bastion. The surrounding environment with music playing in the near-by bars/cafés makes it even more magical! However, don't feel tempted to buy the entrance to the first floor because it really doens't make a difference!

Amazing place!. One of amazing places in Budapest. All things there are very different in comparison with other part of older town Buda!
I sincerely recommend this place!

A Tourist Trap With Great Views. I don't understand this site being rated highly. It is more an artificial tourist trap with limited historical significance. Yes, the views are great. But that's about it...food, drink, etc are all quite overpriced by Budapest standards. Loved the town. But there are much better things to do in town. If you head here, make it for the views. Then wander to better places with real significance and real Hungarian flavor.

Beautiful part of Buda, not to be missed. Yrs, Budapest is much more than the Danube, beautiful lookouts, stunning buildings that have survived the horrors of the twentieth century. But treat yourself to a walk across the Chain Bridge to Fisherman's Bastion where you can see the city from afar before examining it's many layers.

Looks like a Disney Castle?. If you're in Budapest then this is well worth a visit. If you're into your Photography then it's a must...It's worth noting that it's quite a hike to get up here although if you are planning a visit then using one of the "hop on hop off" buses can get you pretty close to the top.

Wonderfull view. After a walking tour in the old Buda this is a nice place to just sitt down relax and enjoy the nice view over the river and Pest. The staf was friendly and nice. Price in the higher level but worth it because of the view and environment.

Unique buildings and an amazing view!. See this for the great views of Pest if nothing else! Really trippy, dreamlike setting behind St. Matthias Church. Entry fee is negligible; Very unique place; a must in Budapest.
Well preserved. Very well restaurated and taken care. All buildings are clean and beautiful. Clean streets. Calm and big.

great view - drink but don't eat on the terrace. this was such a disappointment - it was the only bad meal that we had in Budapest - we sat on the terrace and ordered the caesar salad - the chicken was warm so curdled the caesar salad sauce and the salad leaves were old and wilted -this was a shame because we had planed to return to visit their more expensive indoor restaurant, but were put off by the quality of their more simple lunch fare on the terrace.... it was really quite horrid. However, the view is just amazing - so a great place to go for drinks only - and the staff were delightful - they went to a lot of trouble to make us feel comfortable, even moving around umbrellas so that we didn't get over heated - such a shame that they were let down by the kitchen.

Stunnning view. A beautiful part of the Castle area of Budapest, Fisherman's Bastion is a place to see a panoramic view of the city and surroundings. The only downside is that over half of the walkway is taken up by a restaurant, and an other part of accessible by fee only. Still, enough is free, that it is worth it.

a nice place to visit. A lovely little area beside St Matthias Church, although one does need to pay to go on to the walls, however at the far end is a little café in one of the turrets and access views across the city can be seen from there

Great view and worth the walk. We visited the Bastion yesterday as part of an organised tour and the views are spectacular. A great view over the whole of Pest and miles of the Danube. Brilliant views of the Parliament building and also the Chain Bridge - one not to miss. There is also a very good restaurant up there too.

Waste of money. We paid to get into the Bastion but was very disappointed that it was basically just a walkway and nothing else, there is a better viewing tower next to this which is free of charge, don't waste your money on this.

Like a Disney movie set. Most of the bastion is accessible without payment, but the part one pays for is uncluttered visually.. no bars in the way. Otherwise it is worthwhile for photos of the city and the Danube

Gobsmacking view💛🍁💚. located up in the castel hill this place is a must visit & it will not disappoint . Spectacular view of Budapest ,Danube from above . The tourist buses ply on this route , so it is accessible ,a bit of a climb . It has a history attached to it ,better to read up & visit . It has 7 towers representing the seven Magyar tribes that settled in the carpathian basin in 896. There is a bronze statue of Stephen 1 on a horse ..

Breathtaking views. One of the must-dos in Budapest. The Buda Castle district is full of history and beautiful architecture - The Fisherman's Bastion, a highlight. During the summer you have to pay an entrance fee. You get a breathtaking view of the Parilament, Chain Bridge (Szechenyi or Lanc Hid) and the Danube. The walk along the bastion doesn't take long, but if you feel like lingering, you can take advantage of one of restaurants and enjoy a lovely meal.
Worth the walk. We walked over to the castle from the Marriott. It was gorgeous. We took a cab back, and it was only 8 Euros.
great view. You can pay for the second floor but it´s not necesary, the view from the ground is perfect. It´s better to visit in the evening with the sun getting down.

What a View sight.. A wonderful view sight which gives you a great, look at the River and the city.All the landmarks can be seen.
THE negative is that it gets very busy with all the visitors.

One of the best views of Pest.. Fisherman's Bastion provide a most spectacular view of the Pest side of the city! Located at the historical Castle district from there you can just wander..
Cobble stone streets, cafe's restaurants.
Great view!. Day and night; best place to view Budapest. The city and the river look amazing from the walls, specially at night when you can see the lights from all the bridges.

Just stroll and absord a very special place.... Views from Budapest overlooking Pest. The Danube, the Parliament....this is why you come to Budapest
The whole area is immaculate, safe, clean and hassle free. For a tourist destination it lacks the touristy feel.
There are few more impressive and beautiful cities than Budapest and this is the place to view it in all its majesty

A must in Budapest. We returned to Fisherman's Bastion after about 20 years and found that a lot of cleaning and renovation had occurred in that time. It has a lovely view and very interesting design.

Great views. We walked here from the centre of budapest, well worth the trip! It was particularly hot when we went which made the walk up the steps harder but when we came into the courtyard it was definately worth it. The tiles on the roof are beautiful and the views are amazing. We had a drink in the turret bar which was lovely apart from every tourist wanting a photograph right next to us. Definately recommend this!

Somewhere hard to leave. This was my last visiting station in Budapest. I was intending to stay at most half an hour. But when i saw, i couldn't leave for 2 hours. One of the best city view place. Especially parliament building. Drinking something on the top, or in the cafe is a experience must be lived.

Fantastic Views. You can see the sight free, don't pay to walk up round the top. You get the same views just underneath it. Views of the river and Parliament building right opposite it. Worth seeing for the architecture.

Best point to see Pest. In fact Budapest is not a single, but two cities, Buda & Pest. Buda is old town up on the hill, Fisherman's Bastion is best point see whole of Pest. Earlier this place used to be Fish market. Near by there is old church also, must visit point during your visit to Budapest.
Excellent views. The best things in life are free. While you can go up a level for a fee, the views are the same from the street level so enjoy and get photos without the charge.
Historical richness. Fisherman's Bastion is filled with wonderful historical richness, best visited with a tour guide to learn of it's past and important place in Hungary's history and current times.

A beautiful oasis out of the City. I had no idea at all about Hungarian history and had no clue as to what the Fisherman's Bastion was, or probably still is. All I know is that I thoroughly enjoyed the hour or so I spent around here. In fact the whole Castle district has a certain sense of calm and peace that you struggle to find in the rest of the City. Sure, there are still hundreds of tourists here, but it just doesn't have that claustrophobic feel that many popular tourist sites sometimes have. Aside from the Bastion, just the whole area is a splendid way to spend half a day, grab lunch, have a drink and get some of if not the best views of Budapest that it's possible to have, Just for the photo opportunities alone, you really would struggle to find a better vantage spot.
The Bastion. Interesting to see. Lovely views of the city. Went into the Church which was beautiful. It was a lovely day.

Ancient viewpoint. From this site you have a magnificent view of the Parliament buildings across the river and an expansive view of areas of Budapest. The structure of the Bastion itself is architecturally interesting.

A square housing two beauties. In Buda, on the castle hill there is a square called Szentháromság, (Trinity) tér. It is surrounded by the Fisherman’s bastion, opposite towering the Matthias church and in the middle of the bastion yard standing the equestrian sculpture of Saint Stephen The whole set up is beautifully planned by Frigyes Schulek. My belated congratulation to him. The neo-Gothic Fisherman’s Bastion with its seven towers – representing the conquering seven Hungarian tribes -is one of the most visited attractions of Budapest.From the tower and the terraces breathtaking view is waiting to the visitors. One stairs you can go up to the upper terrace free of charge, but the other terrace above the restaurants has a fee. Be prepared, that you have to pay it in Hungarian forints. No euro or other currencies are accepted.In front of that stairs leading up to the terrace, there is big sign,” WC”, with an arrow pointing to the right direction. Just in case, if you need another kind of visit as well.If you’re hungry, your choices aren’t too wide and not too promising. The Panorama coffee and bar is selling different kind of sandwiches, all of them are 4, 5 € and none of them are freshly made.There is another restaurant upstairs on the free of charge terrace, calling itself lunch bar, but food was only on the black board at the entrance, advertising, that “Menu of the day: Goulash soup, baked leg of chicken, + Soft drink, + Coffee 2990 HUF. (cca 10.- €) Not too bad, not too good, especially if you can order it. Two girls in front of me were asking for it, but the waiter told them, that there is no food, only drinks. When I asked him, what about this advertisement, he answered, that was for a big group, and all the food is gone. So, why is the sign is still here, misleading the tourists?-I asked. He said he didn’t have time to take it in. There were no guests in this bar.If you don’t want to enjoy this fantastic panoramic view dry, there is no problem at all. You name it, and you can drink it at several bars, restaurants, coffee shops sitting on the lower and the upper terraces as well.To make your entertainments complete, on the lower terrace they serve you with music as well with the view and with your drink.If you have enough of the sight, and already also have seen the Matthias church, let’s go for a stroll in between the castle district century’s old houses. There are plenty of restaurants, where you can have a decent and mostly expensive food.Despite my complains, this place is so charming, that I always feel the urge to visit it every year.
Best view of Budapest. This is where they make the photos for the postards too. Dont need to wonder why, just make few for your self too!

A must see in Budapest. Interesting architecture, great views towards Parliament an the Danube and access to some interesting streets and lanes to wander down. Can get crowded at the leak season but nothing like the crowds in Paris or London (the nice bit about a city not being that popular yet :-)

Wonderful views, stunning architecture and lovely glass of wine!. We sipped some ice cold sparkling rose at the top of one of the turrets, overlooking the Danube river. Wonderful views and a lovely walk around the old town of Budapest.

Fantastic vantage point. What a peaceful place We paid just 700HUF which is £1.40 each to access the private balcony which at 6pm was devoid of tourists as all the buses had left From her you can watch the river boats swim gently pastMarvel at the new roof on the cathedral Spy on Buda Palace Or just enjoy looking across the river at Pest and imagine what it might have been like before these two cities where one capital Very white Very clean Highly recommended

One of the best places to visit in Budapest. A place of fairy tale architecture with fantastic views of Parliament, the Danube and most of Pest. There is a small cafe in the highest tower which you could easily miss as there is so much to see and do in this part of the city.
Great views!. Wonderful experience with beautiful views including the Chain Bridge and Parliament. Do not miss this if you are in Budapest!

Fish you were here !. This is one of those places that defines a city, delights a visitor and casts a spell that makes you shout across to your dear ones on a post card,"wish you were here !".A stark contrast between the tiled magnificince of the ancient cathedral and the eternal stone simplicity of the conical domes that recall Hungarian tribal origins piques the imagination and then all thought is suspended as one steps across to the edge overlooking the Danube to see a magical city laid out below.A place that we visited twice in 4 days and if I had my way , would have come here to savour the view at differrent hours of the day !

Great view, nice drinks, poor food.. The view from here is wonderful, overlooking the Chain Bridge and Parliament Building. They has a string trio playing when we visited in the afternoon. The sandwiches were pre-made, pre-packed and tasteless. Coffee and beer were fine!
Fishermans Bastion. The view is spectacular overlooking the Danube , the Pest side and the beautiful Parlament building. This was one of the higlights of our trip, a must see!

Fisherman's Bastion: do not miss it!!!. This is one of the great sights in Budapest! Climb up as high as thy let you and check out the views. Especially look at the view of Parliament from there. It does not get any more beautiful!

Great Views. This place has great views across the city, especially if you want to see the Parliament building in all its glory. It gets quite busy but it's worth it- especially of you get a Hungarian chimney cake from the stand (I would really recommend the cinnamon sugar).

Great buildings and superb views. You're in Budapest so you can't miss out on a visit to the Fisherman's Bastion!! On the Buda side of the river close to the castle. Take the "train" up to the top and just walk around. The buildings are spectacular and offer a complete contrast between the old and new. The views over the Danube towards Pest are wonderful. If you plan to get a return trip on the train check the times of the last return trip. We went end May and the last return journey was a 6:00. Not a problem as the walk back down is very pleasant.Some good "tea & cake" shops and restaurants can be found around the area.

Prettiest sight in Budapest. After visiting Matthias's church,spend 1 hr at the Fishermens Bastion. Worth the fee to go up and see great views of Pest. It is very scenic . climb down to Vizivaros after exploring the bastion to see great churches lining the Danube on the Buda side up to Bettyny ter

Good for 5 minutes. Yes, the views are nice. I paid for the top floor but it really isn't needed. You can see the city very well but that's true for the entire area. Nice for a few but then move on to the church.

Awesome views. Just a short walk from Buda Castle there is this amazing place. from here we could see the beautiful views of Pest, Parliament and the bridges on the Danube.We were not charged any money to go to the top.Bring the camera with you as it is a wonderful place for very nice pictures

Wonderful historic place but don't buy souvenirs from the market there!!. Very beautiful place but unfortunately we went to buy souvenirs from the small market there but they were very rude and they looked at us in a funny way and did not treat us well that's the only problem but the place itself is wonderful of course

Excellent views and arctiecture. It is worth a visit just to see the views over the Danube and Pest. Can get very busy, so pick your time well. Great buildings, and fascinating roofs. On some of the areas you have to pay

Fairytale castle. This is a great area for photos and souvenir shopping. Lots of little stores and restaurants. The views are spectacular. It can be pretty crowded when there are a lot of tour busses in the area, but well worth the trip.
By night or by day awesome. Beautiful view of the parliament across the Danube . So many nooks and crannies offering amazing photographs.
Beautiful Views!. What a beautiful spot for pictures and sights of the bridges and Pest side! Even though it was raining the day we went it was so worth every footstep necessary to get there!

Beautiful Attraction. Beautiful structure overlooking the Danube from the Castle Hill District. This has been rebuilt and is set in a fairytale style square. Fishermen of the Danube were entrusted with being lookouts for impending attackers and acted as the first line of defence, hence the bastion being built.

Stunning beauty. Each day I was drawn there to soak in the beauty and see the amazing views. Several times I went and there was no one collecting fees to get up on the upper wall. Just once did I see a fee being collected. The walls are spotlessly clean and it appears ageless. Music is frequently in the background by a trio playing at the little cafe.

Must see place. One of the most intresting places in Budapest with fantastic view over the city!You can't really visit Budapest without visiting thie place. It's like visiting Paris but not visiting Eiffel Tower or visiting London but not visiting The Big Ben.

Very beautiful place. This is really a must see, no doubt! Place is fulled with tourists and everyone is trying to get a good photo of surroundings. I recommed that you bring water with you on the walk there, because in the summertime it is really hot..open area and a lot of people is a great match. On the top you find a great view to see the pest side and all the bridges..It could be so beautiful at the night time also. Because it´s so growded beware of thieves!
One of the most beautiful city landscape!. Central location just in the middle of the stunnig Castle Hill in Budapest. frequently visited by locals and tourists as well, on the top of the city.

wonderful view. The view from the Fisherman's Bastion was fantastic. Just like many other tourist attractions in the city, so many subjects to paint. You need to pay to go up, and queueing to buy tickets is a bit of a pain, but you can buy joint ticket for Bastion and the Church. You could see the same view free from the side balcony of a restaurant. If you are a pensioner, fee is half.
Simply beautiful with great views onto Pest. We walked around the Bastion whilst visiting Matthias Church. Its really beautiful and provides a great view across the river onto Pest.
AmaZing view of pest. . If you want to take pictures this is the place. Amazing view of the Danube river. I recommend you take a guided tour. All views are superb.
Nice View. Disliked being charged to walk up some steps walk around a parapet for 100 yards then down again. Nice view, but no different from the view 20 feet below, which was free.

Nice panoramic views. Not much to say about this place. I strolled around the area, went into the church which was quite interesting I suppose and passed some time. The best thing was the panoramic views over the Danube into Pest.
Very nice view. One of the most popular sightseeings in Budapest. Very nice view to Danube river. There is also a very good cafe-restaurant inside the monument. Try it!
Don't Miss. Beautiful - right outside our hotel window; great views of the city. They do close the area during late evenings or early mornings - check the timings. Don't miss this
Love visiting this beautiful historic place. Just love it, walking the grounds. The cafe in the grounds is a delight and very friendly. A must visit.

Fantastic to See and Great Views. the site is very impressive and some great photo opportunities. The Cathedral is paid admission and was ok , but it was part of our tour. Really, the buildings and history are what it is all about and you get some lovely photo shots going up to the top of the hill to the ?Bastion.The shops around the area are a bit quirky and limited in their offerings for souvenirs but it is the views you will enjoy. Very busy and again, beware of pickpockets as in any busy tourist attraction.
just beautiful. aa beautifully constructed monument dedicated to the seven magyar tribes protecting budapest. what a view especially the ST. STEPHENS BASILICA towering over all ....
Fantastic view of pest!. One of the nicest places in budapest, Try to arrive there at sunset and wait until you see the lights of Pest,it is really a fantastic view.

view to die for. The even have a squished coin machine. The marzipan museum is an exciting visit as well as all the little shops on the cobblestone streets. If you go to early in the morning the Hungarian Goulash won't be ready yet so plan for early to mid afternoon.

Day out. What a beautiful place and the sight across the city are wonderful please visit to sight see it is magnificent my daughter was playing rugby for England and I went to support and came ere for a day visit would highly recommend it

Best view!. If you like photography or panoramic views then this is the place for you! Quite simply it is beautiful! At first I wasn't keen on going because all I thought I'd get is just a few decent views after a long walk up. The views are absolutely stunning and you know what they sort of say.. When in buda :)

How much more beautiful can it get. While taking part in a dinner cruise on the Danube we past by this beautiful site at night and it is breath taking. Sitting on top of the hill and shining down on you. Need to find time to go inside soon.

Beautiful Monument . This monument is one of the most significant expressions of the glorious history of the city, along with the Buda Castle and the Parliament must be at the top of your priorities in Budapest. I would recommend to take the whole day to visit Buda, Take an early morning visit to the castle, then go to the Citadel at the top of the hill and finish it wit the Bastion, in the mean time, visit the local restaurants and souvenir shops in this area and enjoy the breathtaking views of the Danube and Pest from Buda.
Fantastic views.. Amazing views from this fairy tale setting. There was a wedding happening when we visited which made it even more magical.
Interesting. Interesting And nice locationGreat viewA lot of nice small streets around, small shops, quiet and beautiful

Beautiful view!. We took the sightseeing bus on to this hill, view was wonderful, and with the market selling some interesting gifts, and also can checked the sunset there! And what if you miss the last sightseeing bus? Don't worry, you can take "bus 16" back to the city center with 450ft.

Do Not Buy A Ticket!!!. We visited the Bastion today, and bought a ticket for 700 HUF each when arriving to the Bastion - it seemed like it was the only way in. Well, were we wrong! The ticket only covers less than 1/4 of the building, and today there was a photoshoot happening in this ticketed section, so we were ushered along quickly and didn't even get to enjoy the view! After walking back down we soon realised the rest of the Bastion was open to the public, via restaurants and walkways - so the point of the ticket? To scam tourists out of money before they realise that this isn't the only way in! The ticket is pointless, the rest of the Bastion is far nicer and I think its disgusting that they can even do this.

Beautiful view of Budapest. Wouldn't guess only century old.. Firstly it is an amazing piece of architecture, and a great viewing platform for basically all of Pest. Beautiful statue of St/King Stephen and you wouldn't think was only built in the 1900's simply as a viewing platform. No defensive purpose at all, but I'm sure if needed you could hold out there with as little as 10 men.

The Bastion. This is a must in Budapest. It can be walked too. We took the Budapest Castle Hill Funicular and walked from there. Great views and we even saw a wedding ceremony in one of the turrets. We decided to go back at night. Even better views and the walk back down across the chain bridge was worth every second. Great place.

More modern than at first seems but well worth seeing very characteristic. The fishermans Bastion has a history worth investigating while you are there. The buildings can be seen from across the river they are well set into the landscape though worth a visit.
Fisherman's Bastion. Liked the church, the castle, market and the area. You cannot walk up there though, it is a long walk from town, and is located on a hill.
View from above.. From there you have a great view of Budapest. The Bastion itself is beautiful and St. Mathias Church is a must see.
Great views. We saw this as part of our tour and then went back. Views are beautiful. Nice shops with local artists. Good place to sit for coffee.

Ice Cream and Marzipan. Attractive, fun even if the history is questionable. Numerous vendors of ice cream and near the cathedral. Lovely views of the city and river. Marzipan museum is here; inexpensive and fun to see what has been created. Area made a good rest stop.

Nice view. Very touristy. Lots of people. Parts of it are free. Parts of it are restaurants. A good view toward Pest. But not as good as if you walk up to Liberty Monument. Right next to Mathias Church. Easy walk from the red line subway stop. Nice area but very filled with loads of people. When we walked up to Liberyy there were a total of 3 people there.

What a view. Take the bus 16 or 16A all the way to the top, the funicular is there, but usually has long lines. The walk is almost flat once you get to the main street and there is so much to see is fantastic

Outstanding Dinner. Wanting to try a traditional Hungarian dinner, we asked the concierge at our hotel for a suggestion. He said go to Halaszbastya! We went to this beautiful restaurant overlooking the Danube (Donau) River,, Parliament, etc. Food was unusual, well prepared and very tasty. Service was impeccable and having a trio playing gypsy and Hungarian music was an added plus! Go there if you have the chance!

nice view over pest. Nice architecture of the building. Very easily accessible from Deak Ferenc by bus 16. One must visit here at twilight for best photos of parliament on pest side. There is entry fee to go up.

Great views!. We went here twice, once as part of an organized walking tour and again, on our own. The views are fantastic-great photo ops. No need to pay to experience awesome views-free views are just as photo worthy!!! Save your money!!!

For the views make sure it's a clear day. Great views of Budapest up here, make sure it is a clear day. You need to buy a ticket from the booth there to go round it. Sunset or sunrise would be a good time for photography. There is a W.C there which costs 200FL

Good Views. Good views of the Pest side. Various places for refreshments ranging from various types of cafe and, at the up-market end, the Fisherman's Bastion Restaurant (qv). Worth a visit especially via the Funicular.

Great view!!. Wow! The view is definately worth the climb or fenicular rate! We went up with the funicular and saw the full castle district of Buda, the best is to spend part of the day or the full day there, there is a lot to see.
The view of Pest is beautiful!

Great Views of Budapest. We were turned off by the fee charged to simply look over the Danube from this beautiful hill, but it was possible to walk through the area and view from several "free" locations along the wall. Worthwhile to walk through the small market that is typically open too.

Great view . We went up on a hot day but its not the hardest walk.Slightly overrated as it all looks a bit Disney but the views are worth it alone....don't pay to go up (10 foot higher) as you wont see any more than anyone else .Its a nice walk around the top of the fort .

Delightful. I adored this place. Excellent views across the city. A magical fairy tale feeling about the place. If you can, I recommend you visit in the daytime and also when it gets darker. Would love to visit again in the future.

Scenic views from above. A must see either by bus or walking - simply a site to see
that is beyond words. The structure is amazing, cute shops
around the area and easy to get to
Fisherman's Bastion. Fisherman's Bastion is castle and fortification located in Budim part of Budapest. Nice view over Budapest. One of Budapest main attraction.

Great place to visit.... wonderful view, interesting history...... We had the amazing experience of staying in an apartment near the Fisherman's Bastion recently..... we visited it 5-6 times during our visit during different weather conditions.... even in the rain it is a fabulous place to visit... either read up about the history or take a guided tour.... you will be glad you did....

What a wonderful place to visit!. The views were superb and the architecture magnificent.
We liked it so much, we visited several times. There's just so much to see and take in.
It'll be the first place we go when next we're in Budapest.
Plenty of good places to eat, quite a few good tourist shops, all staffed by friendly and helpful people.
Lovely scenery. The view was lovely from the fishermans bastion. We went in February and it was quiet but can imagine it being very busy in the summer.
excellent historical. location with views on Buda side with many other nearby attractions better to get the hop on hop off bus system

Great place with amazing views. Fisherman's restaurant has beautiful views from Buda overlooking Pest. It's a beautiful place and has a lot of activity going on. They have food outside and also a nice cafeteria upstairs with very good prices if you can find it. The one aspect of fishermen Bastiaan that I do not like is that they charge people the simply go upstairs to the highest level in order to have a look from there. It makes no sense because the rest of it is free and just as good. Other than that minor point, this is an excellent place to visit and I would recommend it to all visitors to Budapest.

Budapest is full of amazing attractions, this is one of the better ones.. One of the many 'must see' attractions in Budapest, with stunning views across the city. I would recommend that you wear comfortale walking shoes for this area, there is a lot of walking to be done.
Stunning views. Worth going for the views but very busy.Surprised no charge to climb the tower.If going to Old Buda then you must visit.The whole area is very attractive

You always want to be here. If I'm in Budapest and I have a chance I love to visit this place. It's out of many great place what you must visit when you're in Budapest, both of the City Park (Városliget) and the Heroes' Square. You can spend a nice afternoon there and if it's your first time when you visit, I'm sure you want to return. It's an amazing place, great for families with kids or couples. Highly, highly recommended to visit and not just once.
Beautiful view of Buda and Pest.. Beautiful view of the city of Budapest. Matthias church, which is nearby is also beautiful to visit. Definitely a place to visit.

Great View from an old landmark.. A nice place gives you a beautiful view of Buda & Pest, and it's located exactly next to the Hilton Hotel. And it'll be closed on the public holidays just like other shops. Also it's near to the Matthias Church, In May weather was rany but great.
Great Views. Very nice vantage point to get view of a very pretty city. There is a fee for the privelage. There are bathroom facilities adjacent to the attraction also for a fee.
Historic and a Great View. Quite a few stairs up to the site, but well worth it. The building itself is beautiful, as is the scenery which surrounds it. The views from the top are great as well.
an Icon place of Budapest. but of limited interest, just facing the Duna, and behind the Cathedral, on the hill of Pest. doesn't deserve a special trip on its own, but part of the visit.
Romantic place. This place is full of history and has so much romantic atmosphere, with the view over Danube and Pest. It is a must to see in Budapest.
Lovely historical area.. This area is historical and a lovely place to view the city. Lots of little shops and places for a rest while doing lost of walking. Local musical group was very talented.
What a view..... We had an absolutely beautiful day to see the Danube from Fisherman's Bastion. It was a great way to see the Danube from high up.

Best view of the Parliament building. Make sure you visit it at dusk, so you'll get the wonderful night view of the Parliament Building. After 8pm, there was no fee to go up the stairs. Even earlier, there are some free spots beyond Matthias Church that also have great views. Oh, the wind can be quite chilly.
Best free view of Danube and Pest side. It's a short walk past the paid viewpoint and main crowds in Budapest Castle to this feature, well worth the extra minute.

over restored, crowded even in May, good view but not unique. whole area is over restored, somewhat tacky, just walk about Castle Hill for view and ignore hawkers (literally), musicians, overpriced coffee shops and head for National Gallery

Must Visit. Plan to spend several hours at Fisherman's Bastion. Impressive when you see it from afar and more impressive as you actually walk through it. Picture taking galore while here. Look for the Falconer and see the old reflected in the very modern glass windows of the hotel.
One of the Best views. If you want to get a nice view of the Parlament, from an early 20th century creation in the middle of a medieval atmosphere, this is a must see in Budapest.

Glorious panoramic views!. Walked over from Pest and up to find another world! Glorious panoramic views over the Danube and back over Pest out to hills beyond. Walk along the walls but no need to pay to go up into turrets the views are fantastic without that. Surrounded by beautiful architecture too. Musicians play in the small restaurant in the walls - very atmospheric! Definitely worth a visit & helps to put Buda & Pest in perspective too!

Awesome view. The view from Fishermen's Bastion was amazing. To go to the main balcony you need to buy a ticket. But its worth it. Thought sometimes the line for ticket is big.Close to Budapest castle can be done together. A day can be good for the castle district. Which include but not limited to Buda Castle, Fisherman's Bastion, and citadella.

A Buda Highlight. Located on the Buda side of the city, experience the most amazing views of the Danube and Parliament while relaxing with a bite to eat and a glass of wine. Enjoy the strolling musicians and the fabulous city vistas.
Lovely place. Fisherman's is next to the Mattias church which is not to be missed when visiting Budapest. You can see the whole city from the Fisherman's bastion.
Beautiful place. beautiful place with nice restaurants and site seeing such churches and historical places. nice place for day and night.
Dramatic. Very impressive collection of buildings and wonderful views in every direction. Worth the climb up from the bus stop.
Incredible views. Fantastic views of the city, and so cool to walk along the walls. Too bad they charge for it, but hey, you're there probably once, so what the heck.

Spectacular views. Fishermans Bastion wraps around the edge of the Buda side of the Danube. It offers fantastic views of the city, just like a picture postcard. The turrets around the bastion make you feel like you are in a fairytale.

Awesome views - come at night. We first went to the FB in the evening during a lightning storm - what a view across the river! There was only a few people around and it was really magical. When we returned the next day at noon the place was teeming with tourists - magic gone.
Like a Fairy Tale. The castle is so pristine it looks like it has just been built. Really beautiful, Well worth visiting - a must!

Must stop for pics. Make sure you take 10-minutes out of your day to stop at Fisherman's Bastion to enjoy the views. A sunset or sunrise would be a great time to see the Parliament building's brilliance from afar. Also, a good place to open a bottle of wine and plant yourself on some stairs nearby (if it's allowed).
A must see. Such a lovely whimsical place both during the day and stunning in the evening. Definitely a must see for any visitor to Budapest.

Great View of Pest from Buda. Up on the hill on the Buda side sits Fisherman's Bastion and along with its history, it has a great view of the Pest side of the Danube. It has great shots for the photographer, especially on a clear day. Matthias Church is on the same property, which is another landmark to visit.
So pristine and the views awesome. This area is beautiful. The views are outstanding and the whole place is very clean. There are many tourists so try to plan a trip here after around 3.00pm.

Beautiful. Worth the visit. Great for photographers. Loved the stories/myths about this place. Unusual architecture. Cold day but that didn't stop us. Our restroom break included having to buy a coffee in order to receive a chit for the restroom down the street. Not a coffee drinker and soft drinks didn't receive a chit.
Amazing view. An amazing view, very romantic, perfect for pictures, the cathedral is right by it. Easy access by cable car,a place not to be miss in your visit to Budapest

Best view in the city!. The monument is worth a visit in its own right but most people go to see the view of the city which is spectacular both day and night. It gets pretty crowded during the day but I visited the first time about 6.30pm and there were only a few people around so this is a great time to visit.

Bus number 16. You can take the bus 16 without using the tourist bus to arrive . Very nice view . There is a little bakery which make very good pays don't remember the name but they have signs just across the street.

Great photo opportunities!. Our Budapest trip was just two nights. We had taken an apartment just 5 minutes walk away hence we visited the Bastion three times. Each visit a different time of day and all with different photo opportunities. (The light changes dramatically-amazing what a bit of bright azur sky can do for the lens)The actual bastion is an upper level comprising of 7 turrets. Just a few feet below is the main level which is free and the views equally as good.After dinner one night we also persuaded our young daughter to make the hike up the hill. This time a totally different experience with mesmerising views of the city. Also a nice atmosphere created by the accordions/singing of locals.
Best place. For me This is the Best place in Buda and maybe in Budapest! You have to visit this monument and if the weather help you you'll pass a beautiful and nice day!
great views!. Lovely lookout area on the Buda side of Budapest near the castle. Built in the late 1800's it's a great place to see the city. Gorgeous views!! Everything free but the turreted area.
Amazing views.. Didn't pay to go in we was on a tight schedule we nipped on the last day was amazing views of the city and parliament building. Well worth visiting. Beautiful buildings too.

Great Site to See, Arrive Early. My girlfriend, mother, sister and I visited this site on our first trip to Budapest. We arrived early, trying to cram a visit in before our bike tour, and it was amazing. It is a short walk from the subway stop with lots of hills. The views were amazing.
