We spent about an hour walking around the site, taking pictures of the Pest side and the structure itself. We did not go in the church or pay to walk around the top of the structure. We got there around 8:30/9:00 in the morning and around 10:00 the bus tours started to arrive, which made the area crowded and noisy, so I would try to get there early if at all possible. It's free and very cool and the views alone are worth the trip over there.

Do it for the view. The view from the fisherman's bastion (across to the Parlament building) is stunning and it's worth a walk up (or you could take the funiclar). The bastion itself is a modern pastiche of medieval battlements (and as such, is a little it 'Disney'). Together with the church it's worth an hour of your time (although I wouldn't recommend much longer- most of Buda is pretty unremarkable). Worth it for the view.

Best View of the Parliament building. The price of admittance is 700ft but the views are spectacular. Not much to see in itself just the views from this structure of the parliament building and the Pest side is worth the price of admittance. Loved it.

Breath-taking views. Lots of great views of the city from here, especially the Parliament and the boats cruising the Danube River. The Mattiyas Church rooftops are a site to behold too - so make sure to take pictures of this while at the Fisherman's Bastion.

Fabulous view. We were on a group tour of some of the highlights of Budapest, so this was obviously a natural stop. As has been stated by many, the views from here are fabulous - probably one of the best views you will get of the lovely Parliament Buildings, along with the Danube and the rest of Pest. The whole area was extremely interesting and it is worth spending an hour or two walking the area, just be prepared for lots and lots and lots of people. I understand there is a fee for climbing to the upper part of the Bastion but the free views from below are probably just as good. Certainly worth a visit

Stunning views, worth the hike. Located on the Buda side of the Danube, Halászbástya (Fisherman's Bastion) is a marvel in how an historic European city can build something so rich in its history yet so scaleable for the future that it connects this grand European city's past to its present. The views are breathtaking but turn around and enjoy everything this little community has to offer. Worth at least several hours to fully appreciate the sprawling grounds, my college-aged daughter and I enjoyed everything Halászbástya had to offer but we also noticed smiles on the faces of everyone from age 8 to 80. Enjoy the walk from the Danube to the top - it's quite manageable - or find a ride to the convenient turnaround at the base of the Bastion. Stunning, simply stunning!

Stunning. We got married here so I'm biased but the bastion and surrounding area are worth a few hours of anyone's time. Walking up towards the bastion from the sdiude of the Danube will give some excellent photo opportunities and once you're up onto the bastion there are fantastic views up and doiwn the Danube. I recommend visiting the restaurant as well, for lunch or dinner.

Stunning Views of Pest from Buda. The Fisherman's Bastion is a must when visiting the Buda side of Budapest. The entire area is very open with beautiful architecture and absolutely stunning views across the Danube River to Pest. A great place to wander. I would highly recommend getting a coffee or cold beer at the cafe so you can just relax and enjoy the views and the people watching. We were there at dusk, but as the city lights up after dark, the views must get even better!
Beautiful views. The story of the bastion is really interesting and the view is fantastic. Recommend going up there at night to see Budapest all lit up.

Great views of Pest from the Buda side. Very worthwhile to go to Buda - aside from the attractions there - to be able to look at Pest from this vantage point. On a clear day I can't think of a better way to spend it than wondering around Buda - with Fisherman's Bastion as a destination.

DISNEYLAND LOOKOUT. The Disneyland architecture is a relaxing place to roam on the Buda side to view the Danube and to look over the Pest side of the river, with an excellent view of the Parliament buildings. You cam also buy a snack while you are there.

Not worth the fee or the wait. We queued for some time to buy tickets for the Fishermans Bastion and the Church. When we finally got to the front a tour guide stepped in front of us, apologised and then bought 30 tickets. We didn't mind too much and there was a sign. Unfortunately when the second guide pushed in front of us our patience was wearing thin. When a third did the same we complained but to no avail. We gave up at that point and left in disgust. Instead we went in the restaurant underneath the bastion for a coffee which cost us less but we could enjoy the same view for about 20 minutes. The people above us crowded through in about 5.
WOW what views. Highly recommend taking a walk or ride to the Fisherman's Bastion. Extremely interesting and amazing views of the city. Great area to walk around and get lost. Would recommend.

Great views. great views of the city of Budapest and the wonderful parliament building across the river, also a short stroll to the Palace art museum which is a good take and right next to Matthias church, which also has very ornamental interior
Best place in Budapest. Great, excellent view. Don't come back home not to see here, it is fantastic you feel like in a fairytale when you are going up to the stairs of fisherman's bastion
Must see the views from here!. Again you are close by to St, Stephens and the old town, so this area overlooks the Danube below as well as the Pest city across the the river!

Great views. The Fisherman's bastion I worth the climb for the view of Budapest from the top. It was 30+ degrees when we visited, so we were hot & sweaty by the time we reached the summit, so to speak, but the effort was worthwhile.

Fishermans Bastion. Very beautiful and with walking distance of Buda Castle. You can walk up to the top or take the funicular. I chose to walk as it was good to see the different perspectives. The views are spectacular from these places. A must see....
Unexpected view. If in Budapest you should make the journey to St Matthais church and Fishermans Bastion . If nothing else the views over the Pest part of the city are glorious!
Lovely place. This is a place you don't want to miss. Sometimes there will even be concerts there. The view is breath taking and the architecture is phenominal.

Beautiful architecture.. We loved this area scenery and architecture was amazing. We did pay 4 euros each to walk on the wall but if you walk further along there are steps you can climb on the wall for free. Definitely a must see in Budapest.

Greta View. You get a great view of the city from Fisherman's Bastion. You can pay for this privilege however if you go up the cafe/restaurant steps the same view can be had for free -perhaps accompanied by an excellent beer!
View Point. From here there is a breathtaking view to the left bank of the Danube: Pest and to part of Buda. Close by excellent food and danish pastry.

don't miss it. Beautiful site during the day, with spectacular views. So romantic at night. This part of town is picture perfect in the evening and nightime without crowds. Also incredibly clean...the stone pavement looked as if just vaccumed/washed...zero litter.
Wonderful view. You can see amazing view of Budapest from this place and take wonderful photos of Danube river and parliament building in the opposite. There is beautiful church nearby too!

A beautiful structure. The views across the river are excellent from here. Would recommend to go there at night for beautiful views. Moreover the terraces are free in the evening. The views of the Chain Bridge and the Parliament are beautiful.

Fisherman's Bastion a cooling balm in the hot summer sun. Fisherman's Bastion has never been used by Fishermen nor is it a Bastion. It is a folly, but a stunning one, the cool marble floors, and white stone provide a picturesque setting for looking out onto Pest in all it's glory. The view shows the Hungarian Parliament in a beautiful angle with the Danube completing the picture. The Bastion holds a cafe and usually several events are held nearby ( a folk fair with hawks and owls etc). In the summer the Bastion is an excellent place for a drink and shade from the hot Hungarian sun. Especially if you have walked up to the Bastion. It is also close to the Castle and sits a top castle hill near the finicular. It is a very soothing tourist attraction and even contains a tour if needed.

Do people actually pay for this?. Not sure why one would pay to walk on a reconstructed rampart to view the city when one can step a few feet either way and do the same for free. The little ice cream restaurant, however, on their terrace is free and recommended over the sausage and beer restaurant overflowing with bussed-in tourists and bad wait staff 100 meters away.
a definate must. a bit hard to figure out how to get to the top. recunstruction was going on in the area. finally found a 16a bus to reach the top.

A link to the past glory of Budapest.. It was a beautiful experience - it was reminding us of how we looked down over San Freancisco or Haifa and a wonderful view of the city. A beautiful view of the Danube River.
must visit. it is a shame they ask for money - the time before everyone was able to walk around on this beautiful building/ enjoy the view
overrated. you get the ticket when you buy ticket to enter Matthias church. You would think, oh ye why not. Dont! not worth the extra entrance fee

Best view on the city, free at night and even nicer. On the top of the city, as a part of the Buda Castle, just next to the stunning Matthias Church - just finished the renovations after almost a decade - Fisherman's Bastion offers an exclusive view over the city, along the Danube. Almost the opposite side of Parliament, it's a perfect romantic night stroll with your loved one.

A nice view over Pest. If you're going to Budapest, this is a must see! The area itself is not large, but it has a lot to offer. Café's, chocolate and marzipan shops, and a lovely view! From the Bastion you can see to St. Stephen's Cathedral, the Parliament and more. Grab your camera and take memorable picture's it's worth it! But overall i'd say it's an average experience, it's beautiful..but I wish there was more to do there, than walking around..
wonderful views and great outdoor eating. Very good vines.. it is a long hike up on foot, take bus or tram. It is well worth the journey. The church is a MUST!!
Good History. This is a great place to visit. There is a marzipan museum in one of the restaurants by the Hilton, I loved it
Nice views. This place has nice views but there really isn't much more around there. The same views can be seen at the palace.

Distinctive architecture. Fisherman's Bastion required an entrance fee that seem steep for the amount of time spent on it. The view across the river to the Pest side is beautiful. It is also a good place to get interesting photos.
fantastic views. A lovely place to walk around and take in the fantastic views over to Pest the chain bridge and parliament building.

Photo ops aplenty. There are so many corners and angles for you to snap pictures and the journey up here is half the fun. To get there turn out from Szell Karman Ter , walk up the small hillslope and take minibus no.200 .
Fantastic. The view is just amazing! You can see the whole Budapest from one place, and it's just beautiful! I'm in love 😍

Beautiful, pitoresk place. With Matthias church this was a lovely, not too busy little place on the top of Buda hill. It is a big climb, so if you can take a bus up, you'll be able to enjoy the place without being out of breath

Love this area of Budapest!. What a beautiful area! The view from the top of Fisherman's Bastion is lovely. My recommendation is to go both in the daytime and at night for very picturesque views of the city.
Great view of Budapest from here. Located on the Buda side of Budapest, it is an amazing place which offers a great view of Budapest. It is easy to access with the buses but also by foot.

Great views. Beautiful views of Budapest from here great photo opportunities, lovely area with the beautiful St. Mathias church at its centre lovely restaurant also with a great selection of food and deserts would highly recommend a visit.

Great view, architecture is total kitsch. I suppose every visitor to Budapest goes up here. It's worth seeing the Castle district if you want a sense of what 19th-century Budapest might have looked like, but the Fisherman's Bastion looks like a bad wedding cake, and the Hilton behind it is also pretty horrific. (Actually the Mathias Church is kind of iffy, a finicky version of its more majestic counterpart, the Stefansdom in Vienna.)But the view is great -- all the same, I think the absolutely best view of Budapest comes from the top of Gellért Hill, a 15-20 minute walk to the south. Also, many fewer tourist junk shops and hawkers! More green! Nature! Go Gellért!

White castle with beautiful view, nice place to spend a few hours to walk around. - Though the castle is not large, it's a nice place for photo taking with beautiful view- Ticket is needed to be bought to go to the upper part so there will be less people, but the view has no big difference from lower part- Church next to the castle which entrance fee is required- Many shops and restaurants in that area which allow you to spend a few hours in a relaxing atmosphere

Might be a tourist spot, but well worth it!. There's no better place to sit and have lunch with a view. The place looks like Disneyland, except you are overlooking the Danube, all of Pest, the chain bridge, Parliament, St Stephen's cathedral. Sure, they were out of the two things we wanted originally, and the menu is small, but what we had was delicious (ever tried elderberry lemonade?). The free walking tour ends here about 1:30, so make plans to have lunch after. We had no wait.

Beautiful to See, View of Budapest is wonderful. This is a must see. Wonderful restaurants down the street. The castle looks like something out of Cinderella. Check out the photos I posted.Well worth the visit. If you have a camera this is a must place to take pictures of and pictures from. Absolutely loved it and went more that once. There is a small fee, for some things.
Once of a kind. The visit to Buda and the opportunity to walk around the Bastion was incredible. I do recommend to visit Budapest and visit the Fisherman's bastion and the Palace in Buda
Go in the evening. Avoid the crowds an go in the evening.Excellent views. Strange cpmbination of old fortress church and new hotel buildings.
Views. You have to go. Combine it with sitting in a restaurant or going to a gallery or such, but just enjoy the views.
Not worth the admission. Just walk a little further down along the wall and you basically get to see the Danube and Pest without an admission fee.

Good view of the city. Took the hop on bus to. The top the hill visited the Fisherman 's nest on a drizzly day however the views were still goodWalked down the hill afterwards and strolled along the embankment
A piece of history. Well worth a visit. A historical site, recently updated. Lovely views of the city and the river. Funicular takes the stress out of climbing up there!

Beautiful- get there early. I waited until afternoon on a sunny day and it was swarming with visitors. I suggest an early visit. Easy walk from the castle, easy to walk to a bus and get back to Szell-Kellman ter. Great for pictures.
View of budapest. Fisherman's bastion is a very touristy spot in budapest. Its located just outside of mattias church (not official name). You could see the whole of budapest from there!
Great view. Great view of Pest from the tower. Many places and buildings around, coffee shops and souvenir shops. Quite cheap entrance and free after 8 in the afternoon.
Worth visiting. Quaint streets, beautiful church and great view of city. Shops selling local goods. Go up furnicular and walk down

Most Beautiful View Available. This is the best place to see everything about Budapest. You can see the entire city, the entire river, everything. Once here, enjoy the sites and sounds, watch the river activities, and take a stole along the pathways of the upper city.
Beautiful. What a beautiful place looks like something out of a fairy tale with brilliant views of Budapest a must see place if you visit Budapest

Beautiful!. WOW! That's all I have to say. Perhaps the most beautiful place I've ever seen.
Matthias church is very near. Great view.
Beautiful! . Amazing view of Budapest! A must visit spot. (: If you and your group want to get a photo, this is the perfect setting!

Fake! Looks like Disneyland. We visited this when we're were up at the top of the hill in Buda, it was completely void of any charm and really reminded me of Disney. Walk around this place but do not pay for the view because all around it are the same views and I noticed that after the busy mid day period, they abandoned the lookouts and we were able to go up for free! I also noticed that there was a very private corner, close to the Hilton gate where nobody went and here was a fantastic view, quiet and people free with magnificant views, a wall to sit on, and views of an ancient church that Hilton incorporated into their oddly placed hotel.
Artificial Tourist trap. This is an artificial tourist trap that is worthy just for the view of Pest and the Danube . You can get the same view from other places for free
History everywhere take bus over. History everywhere take bus over walk around go into museum walk slowly down through the compound towards the river Don't go on a Monday Museum closed
Beautiful view. Great view of Budapest. Very clean and easy to get around. Loads of cafes for a drink or lunch. Great area to explore and a must do in Budapest.

A Must Visit. I'm not surprised this is Number 1. The views down over the Danube and the bridges to the Parliament Building on the other side are superb. Just make sure you keep your back turned on the hideous Hilton Hotel block built on top of an old monastery ruin. How this got through local planning laws is a mystery to me. Good bar on the top floor of the Bastion and the restaurant is expensive (by local standards) but well worth it. Book in advance and ask for a window table.
beautiful area. as part of the sight seeing tour we spent some time here and it is an amazing area with a beautiful overlook of Budapest.the sales of the tickets for the church were to slow.
Superb viewpoint. Definitely worth visiting this place just for the amazing views you get across the Danube and city. It also reminded me of a giant sand sculptured castles, very impressive.

Top quality dining and service. I'd booked the restaurant 2 months in advance for my girlfriends birthday as the trip advisor reviews had been positive both for the food and views from the restaurant. From the moment we arrived we felt it was being managed to be a special experience for us. The warm greeting as we arrived, the spacious table in our own alcove with views over the river and Pest were fabulous, the service was efficient yet unobtrusive, the quality of the food was of a high standard as was the the wine (choices aided by the Sommelier), music during the evening and the operatic rendition of happy birthday by almost the entire waiting staff was brilliant (and fitting), and the overall value was a pleasant surprise. I have no complaint and wouldn't want to change anything. In summary, there will clearly be other establishments that can compete in one or two aspects of their offering but I would certainly recommend this restaurant to anyone wishing to have a high quality balance of choice, quality of food and service all in a unique setting.

Wonderful view from the top!. The fisherman's bastion is at the top part of the buda area and once you're there, you would have a fantastic view of the danube river, the parliament, the chain bridge, etc.

A most delightful place. A Hungarian friend suggested this place, and I'm glad. What a delightful place - so old and so charming. It's a walk away - a decent walk, but heck we do more walking in Europe than at home - part of the charm, not to mention burning calories from all the goodies we consume. Walk around, enjoy a cafe/dessert, and take in the view.
Superb Views. Views of Parliament, the Danube, and all of Pest from Buda Castle Hill. An easy ride on bus 16 from Deak Ferenc Metro stop.

How can we not enjoy thebeautiful Fisherman's Bastion. I think it is a shame that the upper part is closed and we hav to pay for enjoy it. It is also a pity, that in the unter part the is a coffe house, so we have no oportunity to look out or onyl to enjoy this building
Nice food and belgian beers. Try to eat and drink in one of the five Belgian restaurants and don't forget the visit the very nice pub called Taproom

Great overlook of the Danube and Pest. We never tire of coming to this area of the Castle Hill. The combination of the Mathias Church and this site is too wonderful to miss. This site gives you a great view of the whole of downtown Pest and the Danube flowing past it. There is a paid part and a free part, it is worth paying to see the Church and go to the higher part of this site. The site continues to another even higher part which is worth going to as well.

A must do !. Just stroll and enjoy the views and the beauty of this area. Around noon we were very lucky to listen to a free music concert in the area. Keep your eyes and ears open. Very pleasant by good weather. We visited this area by bus and got good information from the hotel.

Magnificent views over the city. This is s superb spot for views over Budapest especially over the Danube to the Pest side. But allow plenty of time to explore the old part of Buda. There are lots of old streets and cafes to explore. Also include the magnificent Matyas church and a walk towards the Palace as part of the itinerary. Several hours in this area are magic

Great Views. Besides the several things to see there, one must not miss the views of Buda and the Danube River. The Bastion is on the same hill as Castle Hill on the Pest side. Walk a little (quarter mile tops)to the east and visit the castle. In between you may want to catch the changing of the Guard. Great experience!!
a must. impressing bulding up a hill of Budapest,specially at night viewing frim chain bridge when it is phantastic lighted,
Great views, worth a trip up!!!. Busted the castle and did not expect all the shops, & restaurants up there...Beautiful setting, great views, a real surprise...well worth a visit!
Like a fairytale!. Can't decide what is better : to look at it from a distance, or to wonder around inside.It's a must see in Budapest !

The view up there is worth the climb up. The view from the arcs of the fisherman's bastion was amazing. You can see the whole Budapest city from up there and the beautiful bridges. It is worth the walk up there when you go past the row of pink and green trees. You can see the bascilica up there as well.

Great Views and History. Provides excellent views of both the Buda and Pest sides of the city along the Danube. Saint Mathias church, restaurants, nearby shops. Nearby the Budapest Hilton. A must see!
Interesting History of Buda. Interesting history of the Bastion and the Church. Beautiful location and views for all ages. Excellent walk around the area.

Beautiful . This place is like a fairy tale castle with views that over look the Danube and Budapest. It is absolutely beautiful and worth a visit, great place to take some pictures! Some areas you need to pay to explore but you can see plenty and explore it for free too :)

Impressive.. This is one of the most amazing places I visited on my trip to Europe this year. The church, its surrounds, and the historical markers too numerous to mention sit on the hillside and offer wonderful views of Budapest. You will need a day to look at it all and take it all in.

on top of the world. we went to fisherman's cabin around 4p.m.
wonderful place, superb views of city and river, snacks and icecream available, bought lovely handmade blouses from lady on the road near bus stop.
very cheap. only 10 euros per blouse.
fairytale feel to the place.
radha aiyar.

Perfect Scenic View of Pest. The Fisherman's Bastion is a fantasy recreation of older defensive works on the Buda Heights. Looking from Pest or the Danube, it provides a great foreground to views of Mathias Church. Looking at Pest from the Buda side, it is THE BEST scenic view of the Parliament building. You can easily see down Andrassy Avenue almost to Hero's Square.You are going to be at the Bastion if you visit Mathias Church, so walk over and get your picture taken at the Bastion with the whole of Pest behind you.

Fisherman on hills. It is situated on the castle district so close with the beautiful saint Matthias church!it is a very particular architecture and by the bastion you can see a beautiful landscape of Budapest !!
Beautiful. Beautiful buidling, great view. If you wish, you can pay a fee to go up a small stair case to have a slightly better or other view and take a photo. In my opinion not necessary though.

Oh the views. A great are to visit for the views of the Danube and over Budapest. The arches make it very easy to get a professional looking holiday photo. Lovely little cafe to get a coffee. Try the latte with honey.
Great photo op.. Good place to stroll around on Castle Hiil, wonderful place to take photos. Other than that, not much to do, it's just a good view.
picture perfect. Great place to get a view over the rooftops of Budapest. A lovely place to chill and have a glass of wine on asunny day.

Absolutely Beautiful with Stunning Views of Parliament. Go here at sunset. It is lit and totally gorgeous. A lot of the tours end here or close to here, and it's pretty centrally located so I'm sure you'll go anyway. They say a picture is worth a thousand words so I'll post some.

What a view!. Disney Castle like, Fisherman's Bastion in historic Buda is a sight to behold. The views across the Danube over Pest are spectacular. This is a well worn tourist path which is definitely worth a visit by any tourist.
So worth it!. The view is worth it, I took a walking tour that ended at Fisherman's Bastion and it was the perfect spot to take in the whole city and also going inside Matthias Church is a must!!

Great views of the Parliament. From Halaszbastya you will probably get the best views of the Parliament if you are not sailing on the Danube. Besides that it is definately worth a visit, though there are a lot of tourists here. To get here I would suggest to take the cable car from the Chain Bridge and walk back down. The Hop-On Hop-Off busses also frequent the area.

Beautiful views and fairytale buildings. came here on a "free walking tour", this is where the tour ended so then had a good wander round.Do not queue up for a ticket ! it's a tiny bit of the actual veiwing area and you can get it for free just further on! it's not expensive for the other bit 700HuF but just so not worth the waste of time queuing! unless you want a ticket for the church as well .

Beautiful views from a beautiful location. Nicely elevated above the river and the Pest side. You are treated to breath taking views of the Danube with the chain bridge to the right and the Parliament buildings to the left. You won't want to miss these incredible views.
Beautiful place, beautiful views. We took a walk up here, lots of steps and quite a steep hill but we like a bit of a challenge. Its lovely when you get to the top, lovely views and architecture!!

very nice place to walk and certainly to visit. we visited this place taking the small train up to Pest. Once there it is a very nice walk along the streets; visit the church; have a rest and drink ...

Best Views Ever. A must see with a little history- photo opps galore and another beautiful cathedral. Great little town to walk throught, take pics, have a beer and enjoy the scenery. Take a cab or see it on a tour bus as private cars not allowed.

Great views of the Pest side of the city. We stopped here as part of the Budapest City Tour. The views of the city are wonderful. Don't bother paying the extra fee for a so-called "premium view" as the photos you can get from the public spaces are just a good.

Evening Dinner at Fisherman's Bastion. My wife and I with two friends booked an evening meal in advance over the internet. The first positive is that, without being asked, we were reserved not ony a table on the Terrace as we requested, but also a table inside in case of poor weather. In the event the evening was too cool to be outside and we were glad to have the inside option.The position of the restaurant is spectacular. Our table for four was in one of the several alcoves around the gallery with panoramic views of the Danube and Parliament opposite, plus good views of the main restaurant floor below, where some excellent traditional musicians played thoughout the evening - and even came up the spiral stairs to play at tables around our gallery at top of the tower with violin and double bass! The food was excellent but a slight negative is that service was somewhat slow and inattentive and, for our tastes at least, could have been a little more informal.

Great view but other places to see it. I was keen to see Fishermans Bastion partly because it's the no 1 sight on trip advisor for Budapest - a city so rich in wonderful sights. And there are great views across Budapest. But I don't understand the hype. As other reviewers have noted this site is very commercialised and extremely crowded. You have to buy a ticket to get to the top of the bastion and most of the viewing area is roped off for restaurants. There are equally great views from both Gellert Hill and Castle Hill which are more accessible and less crowded. It's definitely worth a visit - especially because it's right next to the magnificent Matthias Church. But not Budapest's top attraction.

Fantastic views. The bastion gives fabulous views over the Pest part of the city. Don't bother paying to go up the stairs to the first section, the views in the other parts of the bastion are equally good.
lovely area. area worth a day just to walk around........don't go to the first few tourist restaurants there are some lovely ones further into the area..........
Breathtaking. No visit to Budapest would be complete without a trip to Fisherman's Bastion. The views over the Danube are truly spectacular.

Viewing terrace for panoramic photos. The Bastion was built in Neo-Romanesque style in 1895-1902 by the talented architect Frigues Schulek, who restored Matthias Church at its best. It was created for the Millenium Anniversary celebrating 1000 years after 7 chieftains settled down in the Carpathian Basin in 896. That's how the Hungarian State was formed. The Bastion owes its name to the guild of fishermen who defended the city walls during the Middle Ages In war periods. They lived under the walls in what was called Fishtown or Watertown. There are 7 lookout towers for the first 7 tribes. During WWII it suffered a lot of damage but the son of Schulek, Jànos, managed to restore it according to his father's designs. By 1980 the Bastion had turned to grey colour due to heavy pollution. Now, after expensive restoration, it's a wonderful point for uninterrupted views over the Danube River and the Castle District as well. You may visit the lower parts free but if you want to go to the top of the turrets climbing a lot of steps, you pay a fee. The restaurant has outside sitting for good weather and the views are absolutely fantastic, wherever you manage to sit. The St.Michael Chapel may be visited for a small fee. It was revealed during excavations in the area.

The most picturesque place in Budapest. Fisherman's Bastion is just delightful and the views from the top over the city are fantastic. Easily accessible via the hop on hop off bus, local bus or funicular.

Spectacular view.. The view over Pest, Donau and the Chain Bridge is fantastic. We were lucky to be there on a sunny Day with a clear view. Not many tourists had bought a tickets when we were there either, so it was easy to get a perfect view. Definately recommendable

Lunch in the open air with a view to die for. This lunch was the highlight of my holiday. We arrived just after noon and managed to snag a table by the walls overlooking all of Budapest and the Danube.Loved the fried pork with potato and onion salad.
Great views. Right next to Matthias Church. Great views over Budapest. They had a food market on when we visited.

Nice view, but commercialised. The view is nice, but unfortuantely the upper part requires a ticket and most of the lower part is taken by restaurants. Would recommend taking the ferry for a more interesting view

3D Movie at Fisherman's. My all time best spot at Budapest. My instagram -tomboros- gets the best feedback what ever pic i take. Recency just found there is a short 12min. or so 3D movie about history of Hungary what i strongly recommend to everyone. It is near the ticket office where you can also can buy pass for like 1.5 euro or 700 forint. Plenty of language to choose from through headset. Don't miss it.

A must while in Budapest. Take Bus 16 from city center to this amazing place where there is a beautiful view of the city and the Danube...
Pay the small extra fee to enjoy the views and you will not regret it.
Unusual shape, looks great.. It's eye catching because it's different. Some great views of pest from the balcony. It's in a lovely area with nice bars and restaurants.

Breathtaking views!!. The Fisherman's Bastion is a terrace in neo-Gothic style and located on the banks of the Danube on Buda side on the Castle Hill. The views from the terrace is a treat— the breathtaking panoramic views of the Danube and the riverfront sights of the city (Pest side) are part of the UNESCO World Heritage site. In the evening, it looks like a dazzling fairyland..Most of the place has no entrance fees and the views from the free part of the terrace is as wonderful as the paid part.Take a stroll around and don’t miss the lovely Matthias Church beside Fisherman’s bastion.
Fantastic. What a view , brilliant restaurants, lots to see. Spend a couple of hours here and then relax in one of the many restaurants.

Beautiful Viewpoint. We went here on our Viewpoint Tour with I Like Ebike. The view from here is spectacular! There is a charge to go on the top level, but we could see everything we wanted to see without going up. Highly recommended if you want some beautiful shots.

Worth the admission!. It's worth the few florints it costs to go up to the upper level of the 'bastion' -- the view is impressive and you can get some great photo shots of both the Pest side of the river and the pretty Mathias church right next to it.

A must see tourist attraction. This area is very clean and excellent for walking, would recommend a guide book or walking tour as there is very little information arountd to tell you about the buildings

Beautiful View. The view from the Fisherman's Bastion of the city across the Danube is beautiful! The architecture of the Bastion is also beautiful. I especially liked the area at night. When it was all lit up it was beautiful and seeing the city lights and the Parliament building across the river all lit up was spectacular! I think you can pay a small fee to go up on the Bastion, but there is no need, if you walk around you can get great views and you don't have to pay a thing!There are also some places to get a snack or eat a meal built right into the Bastion, I can imagine it would be lovely to dine there.
Wonderful views. This is in the Castle area and has great views over the Danube river. The Castle region is a must to see on the Buda side.
picturesque. good walk up the stairs and greeted with great views. enjoyed the stroll. you can view the city from multiple angles. definitely a must go if you're in budapest.

Perfect romantic spot. We got engaged on Fishermans Bastion overlooking the lit up bridge and Parliament buildings. Was pretty spectacular. We then visited again in the day time. The views are breath taking. Really is a wonderful spot and a nice walk up and down.

Perfect spot for pictures. Located on the Buda side of town on castle hill, right in front of the Mathias Basilica. Picturesque at night or during the day, it's always a great spot for selfies or group pictures. Be careful in winter, as there was a lot of ice on the walls and walking became dangerous at night. It's always very busy so come early in the morning or once it's dark.
Amazing views of the city. Lovely bit of history, not to mention the views of the city from here are splendid. Looks even better when it's all lit up at night.

Enjoy the view from the walls. Its a great walk and a beautiful view from the top. Don't miss the church and stop for a coffee to enjoy the view. No need to pay for entry, the view looks exactly the same from the free parts

A place with superb personality . We visited the place in April-2015 and fell in love with the entire complex and, of course, with the views of the Pest landmarks. The only regret we have is not to be able to be there at night. We can see the many pictures available online, but the live experience must be something very special

Best View Ever. This is the best view I have ever seen! You can see the entire city and perfect for taking a panoramic. Story goes that this was the area where the fisherman would come and sell their fish but also protect the city if it were to go under attack. A must see for this city!

Not as historic as it looks, but tremendous views.. No need to pay for entry, just stroll in to the small cafe at either the lower level or the upper one, in the tower. Tip: do try the Hungarian Funnel Cake from the stall there. It's a giant cinnamon, chocolate, sugared hollow doughnut. One will do for two of you.

Nice but why is this #1. Go there on a sunny day and you might like it, good for a hang out and few clicks here and there. Walk down the stairs and its really easy. Most part of the place if free to see, special view point access requires to pay.Place may be crowded on Sunday mornings.

Must See. Really enjoyed fishermans Bastion, lots of lovely places to eat, very picturesque, we found a really fabulous restaurant along one of the side streets, had my birthday lunch, fantastic fish soup !!!

Cath the best view of Pest. The Fisherman bastion is an architectural jewel, located on the hills of Buda with a look out terrace offering a breath taking view of Danube River and the Pest country . Built in the 19th century in Neo Gothic and neo Romanesque style for the fishermen as a hangout place and to be vigilant of this stretch of the city wall. You can enjoy the spectacular view while sipping on your favorite drink in the cozy coffee shop at the high point. Be sure to visit the St. Mathis Church and the Trinity Square in the adjacent distance. Make sure to visit the infamous Ruszwurm family run bakery that was establish in 1827, only a short walk away. To get there, go toward the Trinity Square from the Fishermen Bastion, pass the square and continue going straight, the green color bakery is on your right.

Breathtaking views. Worth going up to the bar at the top for a local beer, a seat, less crowded and the views are stunning. So many places along the Danube that give you a great orientation to the city and a vision of all the places you must visit

best place to observe the city. I went here pass the buda castle. It was different style and form. I can lookover pest areas. And castle roof style is unique compare to other pattern of roofs in the city. But it is good! On the back side of the Fisherman’s Bastion has pinkmood for kind of cherryblossom trees. You can keepp your composure!

Outstanding!. Breathtakingly beautiful in it's own right, but the views take this already spectacular sight to a whole other level.It's located just a short walk from Buda Castle and is worth every step. The church and surrounding structures are just stunning and can be viewed for free (going inside the church was only 1400 forint each, which was worth the price of admission; note: extra 500 forint to take photos inside). There's a few cafes on the walls overlooking the city so if you're there around lunch I doubt you'll find a better location.Overall this is a must see I'm Budapest.

Like a giant beautiful sand castle!. This place was absolutely beautiful and provided for some great pictures. The statues and castle-like appearance makes some great picture locations and there was a vintage oven and wood stoves side walk sale, neat shops, great restaurants and even a couple elderly gentlemen playing musical instrument in the immediate area. Definitely a spot worth checking out and if you have the money there are some very upscale eating places in the immediate area. Special dining rooms and very expensive, but for a very special occasion or business trip it couple be a great venue.

Wonderfull views !. Its very attractive and imazing Place were You can get time running ! Weather is,when we visit there(may 2015)very warm;sun is shining and no Wind at all ! It is MUST visit-place when You travel to Budapest ! Wonderful views to Pest side !
A must while in Budapest. The place is smaller than i expected but very unique. Good for photo. There's fee to go up the balcony for the better view. Less people better photo.
Views Cannot Be Topped. Outstanding view of the city from the Buda side. I cannot stop loving this romantic city. 32 years os too long between visits!

This needs to be part of your first time visit!. If you are visiting Budapest for the first time. This will certainly need to be added to your plan! Why? 1. Its in the Buda part, and gives you a fabulous view on to the pest part. You will see the Danube bisecting Buda and Pest, the Parliament on the river bank, the chain bridge connecting Buda and pest. St.Stephan's Cathedral and all of the pest side. 2. The Fisherman's bastion itself has the Mattias church which is a beautiful Gothic church. Its got some interesting colorful tiles (which apparently are self cleaning) 3. The Bastion or fortress next to the church, on which you will climb to see the lovely view has never actually been used as a fortress. Its got a bit of a lord of the rings feel. White stone with cone shaped towers.

Nice view over the Danube!. It was 24 deg C on a warm April afternoon that my family and I went up to Fisherman's Bastion as part of our independent tour to Buda Castle Hill. As it was a very clear day, the view across the Danube of Pest was so amazing. If you're into history and museum, you may spend longer time at some exhibitions there but the Fisherman's Bastion in itself to us was more of a viewing platform on a clear day over Pest. There was a queue to climb up the steps to the viewing area though. Not sure if you'd have to pay to get in or perhaps it was reserved only for tour groups? Even if you do not step your foot into the viewing area, there are some spots just outside the viewing are where it's still worthy of quality panoramic photography. They are located just before flights of stairs downhill from the Fisherman's Bastion. The walk down the bastion was easy as the steps were gentle, not as steep as we had previously anticipated. You may catch a taxi or a bus as you get off those steps if you do not like the idea of walking back to Adam's Square where the funicular awaits unadventurous visitors. We had no choice but to walk up the Castle Hill that day as the funicular was out of service but we didn't regret it at all as it was an easy walk though we had a 7 and a 5 years old on tow. Glad that the kids actually enjoyed the climb. Taking up the funicular up and down would have cost us 5800 Forints for a family of 2 adults and 2 children which was about 20 Euros so instead we spent that money having some refreshing coffee & pastries a few steps away from the funicular station. For a mere 5 minutes descent to the top of the hill, we thought the funicular was a pricey tourist trap as it only took us about 15 minutes to walk up the not-so-steep hill to appreciate the view from the top although we had two small kids tailing behind us. It was a good day for a visit mainly because the weather was on our side. Can't say much in terms of attractions for kiddos though.

Fabulous view. This is a very lovely part of Castle Hill. You can wander around, have a coffee, climb the towers and just enjoy the fabulous view to the Pest side of Budapest. I suggest getting there early to enjoy since it does get quite crowded. St Mathias Church is nearby and I had the luck to be wandering around Fisherman's Bastion while the bells were tolling, this added such a nice touch to a lovely location.
A must see. Located on the Buda hill it's definitely one amongst the most beautiful a place you can visit in Budapest. Pop in at evening too to admire it properly.

You MUST go and enjoy it!. Go there just before dusk falls. Have a hot drink in terrace of the bar covered with a blanket while enjoying the take breathing view! Definitely the best attraction in Budapest and one of the best in Europe!Looking for a place where declaring your love? Keen on photography? Everyone will love this place! What else? It's for free! what are you waiting for?
Great viewpoint of the city. Great architecture that provides a fantastic view of Buda and the city. An open neo-Gothic terrace-like building that offers a great viewpoint - a must-see sight!

Excellent View and Beautiful Structures to Look At. I can only tell about the view and structures as we only enjoyed those and did not visit any restaurant or cafe. We tried to visit Rustwurm Cafe, but it was crowded, so we only went inside to check the interior and see what kind of a cafe it was.Fisherman's Bastion is definitely a place to visit on your trip to Budapest. View of the city is excellent, you get good photos and the structures and the architecture is nice to look at.

Beautiful architecture and the awesome view of Pest!. One of the first attractions we saw while visiting Budapest beside hitting the bars when we've first arrived in Budapest at 9 pm. It was raining that day but didn't stop us from going here. I actually slipped and fell with a huge bruise on my knee on the way there. It's a must-see attraction in Budapest. Beautiful architecture and great view for Pest side even in the gloomy weather. We even crossed one of bridges from Buda side and it was such a enjoyable experience especially how much love the old architecture in Europe. Not only I find the city beautiful, I also love the cheap drinks and lay back atmosphere at bars we've visited. The people were pretty friendly too.

Beautiful Views for Free. No need to pay any money at the restaurant or the Bastion itself to get the same spectacular views you can get for free by walking through one of the arches to a terrace in front of the restaurant. The views of the Bastion and of the Danube and Pest part of the city are spectacular.

Top attraction...and I can see why!. Our group of about 25 people headed straight for this spot when we arrived in Budapest. We knew it was a top attraction and we wanted to have time to see it all before the evening. We were not disappointed...not only was the architecture beautiful, the views of the city were outstanding! If you're visiting Budapest, absolutely do not miss this spot!

Like a princess' castle. A really pretty place with beautiful architecture and amazing panoramic views of the whole Pest side of the city from across the Danube. It was free to walk around and take some nice photos, so I'm not too sure how or where people paid to visit? Worth spending an hour or so exploring, it felt very much like something out of a fairytale. The walk up to it reminded me a little of the Royal Mile in Edinburgh, with cobbled streets and overpriced gift shops.

Beautiful view over the Pesta part of Budapest. Great view over the Pesta part of the city. The ice cream and coffee on a candy shop inside the walls of the building. Also have a beautiful panorama of the Danubian river & parliament palace.The square, Matthias Church, the statue of king Matthias, also worth the trip

The best view in Budapest. You just cannot visit this city without coming to the Bastion. It overlooks Pest from the Buda side of the city and there are beautiful views over the river and of the amazing architecture on the far side. The surroundings of the Bastion itself are equally impressive. This place gives a great view over the city and a great chance of a panoramic photo. This is one of those places you just have to visit, even if it's only a short fleeting visit before moving on to explore more of Buda.

Panoramic view of budapest. This is the right place to be if you wanted to see the panoramic view of budapest and a the same time enjoy a stroll along side the beautiful picturistic chapel like building
Worth visiting. Beautifull structures, well maintained and interesting history behind it. Great views of the city from there!

Great view, but.... the restaurant is overpriced and definitely not worth it. Should have listened to advice. What is worth it is walking to the bottom of the steps, turn around and take in the view of provided by FB and Matthias Church.
A fairytale. Beautiful architecture with a fantastic view of the city. We visited on Labour Day, going up on the funicular railway which was a great experience and well worth it.

Completely refurbished. the amazing restoration is now complete and a "must see" on the Buda side of the Danube. Its quite steep climb but in addition to the church which is facinating and steeped in history,there are excellent views of the river and Pest
Not to be missed. This is one attraction that should not be missed at any cost.Great to visit with kids and lots of things to see and enjoy in Buda
STUNNING VIEWS. Do not pay the fee to go up on to the fishing bastion terrace. instead walk around to the next tower where there is a café and spend your money on a coffee and get the same view :)
Brilliant Views. Gives great views over the pest side and allows for lovely photo opportunities. The architecture is very nice too....I think - not massively into that kind of thing!

Fairytale towers. This place looks like it should be in a fairytale. The view from the towers is amazing and when you are walking on the walls, you really feel like a king from the medieval times. THough it looks much older, the bastion was constructed around 1896 to commemorate 1000 years from the Magyars settling in this area. Each of the 7 towers symbolizes one of their tribal chieftains. The statue of St. Stephen, the king who converted the Magyars to christianity is located in the courtyard, next to St. Matthias church. Also the view of the bastion from the Pest side, from the Danube promenade is amazing. Sitting on one of the benches next to the Danube on a summer night and enjoying the view of the Buda castle and the Fisherman's bastion is an apsolute must do while in Budapest.

Beautiful and free! Must do!. Stunning place. Bring your camera and spend some time here. We felt no need to pay for a higher view point (only maybe 20 ft higher than free area) but to each their own. Either way, beautiful way to spend a few hours in Budapest!

Loved this place. One of my favourite spots in Budapest. Lovely view of the river and the Parliament. You could see the UNESCO touch to it, the buildings were very well preserved and the area was impeccably maintained. A must see.

Unforgettable evening. 50th birthday dinner could not have picked a better place; amazing views and excellent service with great food. We ate Halászbástya menu with sommeliers wine selection. The staff was great.
First thing to show. Number one place to show to foreign friends. The most beautiful view of Budapest, great atmosphere. Proud to show.

Quite a nice setting. I had read a number of raving reviews about the place so I had to see it for myself. While it was quite nice and the vista's over the Danube and the city were nice I wasn't completely blown away. It is one of the city's landmarks though so it is worth a visit.
A nice view point. Very busy, good view of the river. A long walk back to town but at least it w as was downhill. Too many artists selling their wares spoilt the area a little

A must to see. Fisherman's Bastion is a must see before leaving Budapest, when we was there the weather was fantastic and the view of the Parliament building from the Bastion very beautiful. Budapest is a great city to visit and we hopefully return soon.
What to see in Budapest. Very interesting place to walk through and take pictures. It is on the Buda side near the church and there are great views from here.

Pretty landmark. The area around the Mattyas church and the Fisherman's Bastion is nice, it looks very new (recently cleaned and restored) and the views over the Parliament from the Bastion are really worthwhile, more so at night. We were there a couple of times at night and it was pretty quiet (it was a bit cold at the time) - so we had all the time to enjoy the views, also from the top rampart that you had to pay for during the day.
Fantastic view. The view was fantastic and the place around full of restaurants and cafe...It is really worth to visit this place...enjoy
Beautiful view!. Fisherman Bastion is a nice place to enjoy a beautiful view of Budapest. At night can be a nice romantic stroll. Is a very nice place.
wonderful area. Loved wandering around this area. The Matyas church and the Bastion were stunning. Take number 16 bus up to the top. The walk isn't too arduous.
Best view of Budapest by far. This is a must do when in Budapest. We were fortunate enough to stay at the Hilton right next to the Bastion and the views are out of this world.

It's all about the view. If you are already in the Buda area, by all means include the Fisherman's Bastion as one of your stops. The view from here is magnificent and it is right beside the St. Matyas Church. The view at night is even more spectacular.

A View of the City. One enjoys a good view of the city from the Bastion. You can do so without paying the admission fee to walk along the Bastion's upper wall and can sit in the open air cafe to get a refreshing drink while doing so. I also recommend taking in the view at night when you can enjoy the city in its twinkling glory.
Beautiful Buda. Great photo opportunities and glorious cherry blossom!Don't miss the reflections in the building opposite.
such an amazing place and I wish I gave it my priority. The view was amazing, beauty and everything there is worth it, getting there gave us a great opportunity to walk around

Magical. Fantastic views of Pest, Parliment and the Chain Bridge. This takes on a totally different look at night. The Fisherman's Bastion looks like something out of a Disney movie, it looks magical. There are resturants & gelato places in the area.

Great Views from up here at Castle Hill. An architectural gem on this neo-romanesque complex named after the once defensive walls defended by the guild of fishermen. Quite a climb up to it better the funicular or bus if you need to. It is a must visit while in Budapest.
Beautiful!. amazing view from the bastion! dont pay to go up to the top, if you walk to the other side there is a cafe in the tower with a terrace at the same height - which you can go in for free!
Busy. Visited as part of a walking tour. Lovely history behind it all and amazing views of the City, just very very busy!

Something out of The Lord of Rings. It was like stepping back in time - to Middle Earth. The architecture was reminiscent of the fortresses of The Lord Rings. It also has spectacular views of Budapest and of the parliament building across the river. A must visit whilst in Budapest.

Buda area visit. We caught a train to the area. If you are over 65 and a EU citizen all public transport is free.And free entry in a lot of sites. We could not enter the basilica as there was a ceremony on .Check on the net before going there.We crossed the chain bridge by foot . The vows were worth it! Rode up the hill on the funicular rail, nice experience.
A must for visitors. Great view........stroll around, have a drink and enjoy the magic of BudapestThe area is also full of restaurants, so this is a great place to enjoy an apperatife!

My favorite place in Budapest. Go at night!. I like this place better than the Castle, St. Stephen's Basilica, Opera house, or the Parliament. You'll see the Budapest city from the top and it's beautiful. My favorite course when I'm taking a tourist there, is start at night and cross the chain bridge, go up the castle hill by walking up the stairs (there's "rope-way" too but it doesn't work at nights, and it's not a long way up anyway), then to the Matthias church and Fisherman's Bastion (next to each other), then go back down. It makes a perfect night stroll :)

Fantastic View. We stayed very close at the Buda Castle hotel and the short walk (literally about 90seconds) with a fantastic view of the Danube. There is also a nice little bar with glass walls inside the actually wall, which is well heated and it was great just watching the world go by!!!
Great views of Pest. Lovely and peaceful place to go for a walk. The funicular was not working. From the top you have a magnificent view of Pest, the Danube and the Houses of Parliament.

Great spot for drinks!. After a nice time in the national gallery in the royal palace, my wife and I were ready for beers with a view. Well, we found it. If it's sunny and warm, if you're ready for a break, do yourself a favor and sit up on the balcony for a few drinks. With the classical music group near our table, this experience was the top of our trip.
City view. Wonderful views. Great building. Pay to see church and viewpoint far better than the free viewing area

Views to die for !. Just down from St Matthias Church is the Fisherman's Bastion - a walk way of arches that offers the most spectacular views over the Danube towards Pest. Steps lead up to the Bastion - and then you just walk its length taking in the stunning views - and of course looking the other way, you are viewing the Square in which St Matthias Church is situated - and The Hilton Hotel! This actually has mirrored bronzed windows offering a reflection of the Bastion - as a photographer I found this very fascinating.

Step into real-life Disney. Imagine a fairy tale set come to life- that's what the Fisherman's Bastion looks like. Lots of tourists, (like in Disney World) but beautiful enough to endure that aspect. We were near the end of a 2-week trip, but were still very impressed by this site.

Charming walk in Fisherman's Bastion. The Fisherman's Bastion offered a clean, relaxed location for a walk and a quiet cafe for coffee and reflection. Its traditional streets offered tranquilly without modern day tourist hassles.

What a view !. Buy a bottle of Eiger Red Wine (Bulls Blood to the children of the 70's like me ) from the general store across the road ,ask them for a glass & for them to open the bottle (Alexandu was very helpful)- walk across the grass in front of you - find a bench - take a long slug of wine & take in the wonderful view of this beautiful city before you & chill !

Wonderful View Of Pest Across The River!. After walking across the chain bridge and riding up the funicular, it is a short way to the Fisherman's Bastion. Of course, there is plenty to see on the way, including some of the ruins left from WW II, and Matthias Church, which is beautiful. Fisherman's Bastion offers photographers an excellent opportunity to take pictures of Pest, and of parts of Buda located below the bastion and between the bastion and the Danube. Another attraction is the restaurant that is a part of the bastion. It serves good food and drink, and its staff is a great group! Ask for the young woman, who is a hostess, who lived several years in Pennsylvania. She's a delight, and helped us find a seat. Above all, do not be afraid to walk about and poke into the back alleys and streets. You'll be surprised at the interesting shops and nice people. Oh, and remember, some people in Buda have some English, but not as many as you'll find in Pest. Get your expressive gestures ready!

Gorgeous. We loved the view and the cleanliness of the Fisherman's Bastion area. The views of the Danube, Parliament, the Pest side were wonderful, but in daytime and evening.Only downer is - why do they have to charge to let people go to the higher level?
Great Views on A Clear Day. Nice place for sightseeing. Overlooks the city, Parliament house, the Danube. Great for picture taking on a clear day. Shopping at a local craft market down the street.
Great view. A must see in Budapest. A good tip is to go there pretty early since the place is very popular. Crowdy from 9.30 am already.
Didn't mind the steps. Now you have to go to the fisherman's Bastion for the panoramic views you get from the lookout towers.
A must see. Visited had a coffee and an ice cream and just enjoyed a great day out. We walked up to the top as the funicular was out of action for servicing. What a view. Enjoy

A MUST SEE. A must see landmark in Budapest. Easy public transport (Bus 16) on the Buda side of the Danube to get there that runs until midnight and will drop you off Fisherman Bastion with a stop at Buda castle right before as well. Great view of Budapest and the Danube from the walls on the Bastion or from the two cafes along the wall. At night the place become magical with lights and alot less tourists. Enjoy!
Incredible views. Awesome castle complex itself situated in the heart of lovely old town offers incredible views on Pest side. Absolutely charming!
Super. Brilliant day up at the fishermans bastian, hop on off bus get you up there if required, brilliant place plus the surrounding buildings gorgeous scenery as well worth a visit
One of the best views of the city!. This was one of the best views of the city! You have to take a few minutes to visit the church next to the bastion...truly unique.
Expected. A nice church, but pretty modest compaired to others temples in Budapest. The scenary was nice but don't expect really much. A place worth visiting for, but pretty expensive admission

Re: great view. We went to the Buda side with our private tour guide. She showed us the castle area. Just the surrounding area will give you a good view of the city. We didn't have to go in and we seemed to have a good vantage point.
Another Beautiful Building. Near to the castle - within waking distance. Due to lack of time we didn't actually go inside but looks spectacular

Beautiful. Budapest is a beautiful clean and well kept city but the fishermans bastion is the best.
There are lots of positive things said here and they are call true, but also visit at night the fenicular
Railway runs quiet late and the views are great.
Best view of Danube and Pest. Part of the Church complex. Panoramic views of the Danube and the City of Pest. Cobine with visit to the Church of St. Istvan.

Not To Be Missed!. We went into the Castle District on the Buda Side of Budapest and this was a definite highlight. The views from the Bastion were stunning and the entire location where the Bastion is was quite lovely. Do not miss going here. There are charges to actually go up on the Bastion but you can have access to the breathtaking views free of charge by staying at ground level.

Stunning views. Stopped by for refreshment after a hard morning sightseeing. No need to pay the entrance fee if you sit in the snackbar and order refreshment. Attentive service. Limited range of food on offer when we visited. Outstanding views across the Danube to the Parliament Building.

A Place Not to Miss. This was a highlight to our visit over onto the Castle District. Quite picturesque. The views from here overlooking the Chain Bridge and then over to the Parliament Buildings was stunning and worth the trip up the hill. Only downfall I would say is that during our whole trip on our Viking Cruise of the Danube, this is the only place where we were approached by people trying to sell their wares. (specifically Hungarian women) selling their tablecloths and sweaters. They were very pretty but it took me back for a minute as we did not experience that in any other country we were in. Overall worth seeing.
Great place for view and a snack. Excellent views of the Danube and Pest. You have to pay extra to visit the top, but get also great views via the openings below.
Not worth the price.. Was with a tour group that paid admission. Wouldn't have paid otherwise. The view isn't that different from down below. A tourist scam in my opinion.

My favorite place in Budapest. Like I said in the title, Fisherman's bastion is my favorite place in Budapest. It' has beautiful view to both, Budim and Pest. You can make a wonderful photos there. Also it's near some other attractions like Matthias church and Buda castle. If you want to go to the top of bastion, you have to pay entrance fee. Lower levels are free for visit.
Brilliant views!. A great place to explore with great views over the river! After exploring, have tea and cake at the nearby Cafe Ruszwurm, one of the oldest traditional cafes in Budapest.
Amazing place. This place is very big with amazing architecture and very beautiful.. So pity i dont have much time to walk around here because going with the tour. A must visit place in Budapest.

Worth a visit, only buy the entry ticket to the Cathedral. Definitely worth the visit. Suggest buying only the ticket to the Cathedral and not the combined ticket since going up the bastion is not worth it and same views are available from buildings on the side and these cost nothing.

Its location on top of a hill makes it a nr. 1 attraction in Budapest. Not so many bastions in the world has this location. A view to the river and to the beautiful building on the other side which is the Parliament. We had a guided tour in the old town around this area. Our guide said that the properties in this area are the most expensive in the city of Budapest. This bastion has its own restaurant which I believe caters to the tourists than the locals. The first time I went to Budapest 2 years ago, our tour guide booked a dinner in the restaurant here. And now, we ate in the restaurant again, presumably suggested by our tour guide in this trip. I can't blame them. It really has a beautiful evening more so in the evening.

Out of a fantasy book.. This place looks like something out of a fairy tale, it's spotlessly clean and perfectly conserved.I don't think that paying the ticket to go up the walls adds anything to the experience.

Photographers' Paradise!. This was my third visit here in ten years and I was still thrilled by the pristine white architecture and wonderful views across the Danube of the Parliament, magnificent bridges and other wonderful buildings. This was the first time I had seen Mathias Church without scaffolding and since its restoration it absolutely glows.
Beautiful place to visit. do not hesitate to walk to the top and take the time to visit the surrounding area . Have a seat and enjoy the panorama , when sunny it's really wonderful
Romantic setting and a beautiful view. Very romantic setting and a beautiful view - it lives up to the pictures, but it is a shame that there are souvenir shops and restaurants amongst the buildings.
Stunning!. This is a must visit! You will get one of the best views of the city as it is located at a height! Beautiful white architecture..stunning views!

What an awesome place!. We went to this place on our visit to first visit to Budapest. You need at least 3 hours to enjoy which probably give you enough time to visit the inside of Mathias Church which is in the same area. You can take beautiful pictures from city below and they have plenty of souvenirs shop for the trip memories. There are tours to take you there however we recommend spend a little more time for your own satisfaction. Go visit Ruszwurm bakery for a coup of coffee and pastries. Until my next review.
A must see. Breathtaking views of Pest. I absolutely think this is a must see. We went in April 21,2015 and the trees and flowers were blooming and you had great shots.
Fantastic area. Absolutely beautiful restoration from World War 2 damage. Wonderful views of the river Danube.Not to be missed when in Budapest.

Beautiful to look at; exciting to explore; fantastic view point over the city.. The Fisherman's Bastion has been expertly cleaned and restored and offers great views over the city, particularly over Pest. It sits on the edge of the rocky cliff in front of the too, too modern extension of the Hilton Hotel and next to the beautiful Matthias Church. Because of its position it affords great views of that church, its spires and multi-coloured tiled roof as well as the vistas over the Danube and beyond over Pest. Its multi-level walkways and staircases can be explored offering yet more incredible views. There are a number of cafes and restaurants and a small museum too. Then wander slowly down the hill to the river side.

I love Budapest.... This area of Budapest is very "upscale", touristy and absolutely beautiful. There are incredible views of the Danube, Parliament and historic bridges. Take a walk and visit the National Art Museum which has an excellent collection. There are many small boutiques which because of the location charge more than other areas so be careful shopping there. There has been a recent renovation of the streets near to the Buda Castle so it is even more attractive than before. Most people speak English and are very gracious towards tourists. Right now the dollar is in excellent shape so things are quite affordable.
"lovely". an lovely place ,but because of this there are a lot of tourist.Wonderful view to the danube river.
Beautiful with amazing views over the city. Beautiful!! Lovely to walk around with some spectacular views over the city. The roof of the church is gorgeous.
Stunning views of the city. After going to Matthias Church, a walk along the bastion is a must. The views of Budapest are amazing.

Well preserved. In general, this is a nicely preserved ruines of the old place, but it did not move us too much, you can see that the major attraction next to it is the church which is really beautiful and stunning! The church was once a Turkish chappel, so you can see some influence on it like the roof.

Great view. We were staying next door at the Hilton so we called this area home for three nights. Not sure how old these structures are, but I suspect they are rather modern but built to look old. Apart from that, visitors should visit the "Castle Area"To get a great view of Budapest. The view over the Danube toward The Parliament building surely is a sight to behold. The area is a bit Touristy but still well worth a visit. You could spend half a day here and perhaps enjoy lunch at one of the many eateries. If you get the chance to visit at night to see the buildings lit up you wouldn't be disappointed .

Stunning View of Pest and the Danube. Fisherman's Bastion is The Must See when visiting Budapest. The views are stunning and gorgeous. What a lovely city Budapest is! And the view from this location only confirms that opinion.
Fantastic views. Great views over Pest and had a lovely lunch at the restaurant there. Would recommend it if visiting the Buda side.
nice lookout. pretty lookout across the danube. I didn't bother to pay to go up higher since the view was great on the lower level.
The views. Fantastic views with abundant places a small museums to visit.If you are lucky you can experience the change of guards ...and its small musical march

Gorgeous views and beautiful spot. Came this morning and enjoyed just walking around and taking in the scenery. Excited to come back at nighttime to see everything lit up! The Castle Hill area is an absolute must see when in Budapest!

Romantic Viewpoint... On the top of the hill there's a view pony, and in order to go up to the top you have to pay a very small fee. In the beginning seemed a bit petty to pay extra for a few more meters at the top of the mountain - but then you go up and it's not crowded with pedestrians and organised tours, and the view is much better than downstairs. Totally worth it!
bastion is very interesting. bastion is very interesting, but don`t park here your car (5 euro/hour).the place is incredible, close whit Mattyas curch

Better than expected. We were able to walk up and back from near the Opera House.The funicular is closed for repairs this April at least.We enjoyed a fine lunch at one of the classier restaurants near the top.There is also a music museum up there.
Spectacular views. Amazing views from the terrace and also home of Halaszbastye restaurant. Others have commented that it looks like a huge sand castle - that was my impression too.

Stunning views.. Thoroughly recommend a visit because you will see some fabulous panoramic views of the city across the Danube to the Parliament Building. This place is steeped in history. We also visited the little bistro cafe near the tourist board after our visit which was very good.

Special place. A special place with a beautiful view...
A lot of tourists here
But the Streets around are nice ans cozy.
Perfect startpoint for a walk around.

Beautiful!!. Not only is Fishermans Bastion beautiful to view but also offers the most beautiful views of Budapest and its many attractions. The structure reminds me of intricate sand castles. I highly recommend you visit it. The only fee that I'm aware of is the charge of the funicular to get to the top. You can also take the stairs if you are fit.

Remarkable views. But why did we have to pay to enter the boring bit when the interesting bit was free?A lovely area with a chap dressed in medieval fashion with a raptor of some ilk posing for photos.Not as old as it all looks but then, not disguised fact either.

A Must See. This amazing attraction on Castle Hill was built on castle ruins in 1895 in Neo Gothic style looks like the Mid Evil castles we see in fairy tale books and movies. You get the best panoramic view of the Danube, Parlaiment House, Margaret Island and Pest from here. It is open 24/7, if you want to visit the upper towers they are open from 9-7 from 3/16 to 4/30 and 9-8 from 5/1 to 10/15. Many museums and attractions in Budapest are closed on Mondays so this is a good place to go if you are in the area on that day.There is a cafe where you can sit and enjoy the view, and a chapel.It is next to St Matthias Church and you could take in both of these historical landmarks in an afternoon. For a fun experience, I would recommend taking the Funicular to the top of Castle Hillto The Fishermans Bastion.

Don't bother paying. We paid 700 huf each to go up to the fishermans bastion. You can have exactly the same experience for free if on a budget. I must say that by paying we could enjoy the views and get some pictures without the hustle and bustle of the the crowds. So it it up to you to decide what sort of experience you want!
Great view. Great place to walk and see the amazing view of Pest. You can just sit and watch people enjoying the view. Very beautiful place with great atmosphere.

be sure to visit this castle viewpoint over the Danube. Beautiful view and magnificent castle are a photographer's dream. We came on a tour but enjoyed the visit enough to come back on our own the following day
Hungarian Waltz music by the band in the coffee.. The best place to get coffee break and listen to Hungarian Waltz music by the band in the coffee. with spectacular view to the river and the palace.
Superb views of the city. A great place to view Pest over the Danube. A little reluctant to pay the fee but was well worth the small cost.
Worth a visit, superb views. It is worth to walk up, very nice building. Good views, do not have to buy ticket if not going inside. Recommended.
Beautiful castle. We spend a week driving through Hungary, Austria and Germany visiting castles and palaces. Hungary's castle - including the Fisherman's Bastion - is perhaps the best.

Gorgeous views!. Breathtaking views of the entire city from the top. Soak up the history of the area and enjoy the nearby stores and restaurants. All were kind and welcoming to English-speaking tourists.

Best place to see the Parliament and Matthias Church. Best place to see the Parliament and Matthias Church.There are two restaurants with spectacuar view to the Danube in front and the church in the back.
Great views and not to busy. Visited on April on a Monday and it was not too busy. Good weather makes all the difference when here. The cog railway is getting repaired do a good club up the hill

Great City View Point. We stayed next to the Fisherman's Bastion at the Hilton and visited this place several times at different times of the day & the night. This place looks great at any time but especially at night when its all lit up & some of the crowds have gone home. We saw in the New Year of 2014 on the steps of the Bastion with a birds eye view of the city & its celebrations. There are a couple of bars in this area & the one inside the Bastion serves a good selection of beers & wines & also does some great food. As you can imagine it can & does get busy so get there early to get the best tables which by the way have a great city view also.....

Fairytale. Witches hat towers and a commanding view over Pest, one not to be missed. Adjacent to the Royal Palace (peer over at Buda) visit the church and, if you don't mind a possible criminal record, polish the testicles on the horse statue (it is supposed to bring examination success)!

Commanding views of the city. Still quiet in early April but busy on Easter Saturday. A lovely area to explore in the old Buda. The views across the city are spectacular.For a meal at reasonable price -the only 'Tourist Menu' we found in the area- try Saint George hotel (Szent György Hogadò) in a nearby street.

Favorite place in Budapest. This was definitely my favorite place in Budapest. Worth a visit during daytime as well as at night. Lovely view on the Parliament and the Danube. There is a little fee to go all the way up the Bastion, but you already have a lovely view on the ground floor.

Stunning. What can I say except this place is stunningly beautiful, like a fairy castle film set, with fantastic panoramic views of Budapest and the Danube. If in Budapest you must not miss a visit here.

Fantastic views. Liked the building and views, disliked that you had to pay to walk around the better parts of the structure.
Go to Castle Hill for the similar views for free :-)

Great View. Great View!
Need reservation first.
There are too many visitor!
I can't get a table for food.
I can just have a drink at top floor, but that is good enough to take great photo!

The Views.... On a nice day you can just sit up there look out over the whole of Budapest, the views are spectacular, there is a small fee for one section but its about 1-2 euro and another section is free.
