Fisherman's Bastion. Wow what a view of the Danube River & the surrounding.To get up there, you can either take the funicular which costs 1800 Huf with return or you can walk up the hill. It's not easy but I did it. There are also buses that take you up the hill. We had the one day ticket & could use all methods of transport. For those who don't feel like walking they can take bus number 16. You have to stop near Matthias church & it is very near.
Amazing views. Lovely building with a really amazing view of the city! We got the funicular up which is also a lovely view, well worth the cost and a lovely walk down afterwards down to the river.

Picture Ready. We saw this picturesque sight as part of a tour. It was pretty for pictures, but we didn't feel the need to pay and go inside to see more. There were a lot of other tourists with the same idea so it was a bit crowded for pictures, go early in the morning because there is a great view of the Chain Bridge and the Pest side of the city.

Fantastic views. Fantastic views of the Danube. Free if you don't want to walk along the top. Well worth the walk up the steep hill, there are other transport means to reach it, but the walk is good for the heart and you pass many viewpoints on the way.Worth the visit as there is a lot to see in Buda.

Fabulous Views!. Situated high on the hill in Bude near the old palace - this area offers magnificent views back across the Danube to the Hungarian Houses of Parliament etc beautiful old architecture and surprisingly colourful roof tiles . Take a bus unless you are very fit to endure the climb up the hill.
Beauty. Is a piece of beauty carved in stone, you see many nice places traveling somehow here with a view as a total you know it was worth bringing your feet all the way here.Must see!

Worth the hiking. This place and the whole Buda actually must be visited if you are a tourist in Budapes! We were lucky to have a guide who showed us everything worth seeing and told us the stories behind every single place. You have to hike the hills a little in order to get here but you won't regret it. The view over the Danube is great, also over the Parliament. 5/5 stars for this.

The best view of Budapest. Great photo opp and a pleasant area to stroll in. The gellert Hill, caste and fisherman bastion are a great way to spend the mornings. Although the best times are considered to be twilight with the city lights coming on. It is the best view of Budapest one can get.

Great View of the Danube. The Fisherman's Bastion is named after the fisherman that helped fight off invaders. Views of the Danube and the city are fantastic. While the Bastion is free you may pay a small fee to walk along the top giving the best views (well worth it). Take time to enjoy the area with its rich history, wonderful views, and quaint shops and cafes.

Great view on a sunny day. Well worth the trip on foot or on the Numbers 6 or 6A buses. The funicular up the hill wasn't working the day we were there, but if it is, it allows ascent up the hill to the castle and museum, then a walk along the flat for about 1/2 mile to the BastionThere is a charge for the Bastion itself, but the views without going up onto the walls are free The view over the Danube toward the parliament buildings in the foreground and to the outskirts behind, is superb. The whiteness of the church and bastion is lovely and the church roof very pretty.Avoid the terrace café south of the church, cant remember the name, but food and service poor.Combined with Matthias church, the castle and museum, in their elevated position in Buda, there's a good day's worth to see.

Nice when you are in the neighbourhood. It is a very nice buildig and you have a good view over the Danube.I would only visit it when you are in the neighbourhood. I would not only go visit this building.

Very pretty. My first impression of the area of the church and bastion was that it could be something from Disney land....so bright and clean too. Lovely views of the Danube and Pest. Lots of great photo opportunities.
a great view. it's worth the sweaty trip up the hills and stairs for the view you get at the top. its crowded, naturally, but bring a camera and a nice smile and you'll get some great holiday snaps

Feel like a Knight/a Princess on top of the towers overlooking "your" Kingdom... I suppose that by now you already know that in order to visit Buda Castle one of your choices is to take the #16 bus that crosses the chain bridge and stop, well... at the proper stop. DON'T! Go on one stop further and visit the Fisherman's bastion, situated right behind Matthia's church, a true gem as well. Get on top of the towers and enjoy a nice cup of tea or coffee in the little cafe that overlooks the city before walking back towards the Castle. You'll get the inevitable feeling of being a Knight/ a Princess set on these towers for the greater good! ;)
Cool place with a great view. This place with its surroundings is a great place for culture, history or a nice lunch with a splendid view of Danube and Pest.
Awesome place. It is a great place to walk around, there are some little shops around the castle as well. The view was priceless, and everything seemed very very picturesque.
Lovely views. Beautiful views from the turrets and walks. It's well worth visiting at night to get the best views of Budapest. No 16 bus was great to get there.
Great views. Beautiful church, turrets and a great view overlooking the Danube River and the Pest side of Budapest. Great photo op.
fairy tale. This place belongs to another era. Magical! I took a little time to visit this for a second time in my vacation.
good view that's all. The view over the Danube is excellent. But really there are too many tourists and it gets difficult to move around. The view from the nearby Royal Palace terrace is better

A must-stop for photographers looking to capture the Pest side of the Danube. Fisherman's Bastion offers incredible views of the Pest side of the Danube. For photographers, there are more opportunities for taking "art-shots" through the various archways. You can pay a small fee to go along the highest point of the bastion, or avoid all fees and just go to the numerous other lookouts on the left (north) side. Be prepared to wait for numerous tourists taking selfies to move out of the way, but the wait is worth it to get an awesome shot of Parliament or other views of Pest through the archways.

Impressive. It's fairytale lovely!! It could be Cinderella's Castle but it is a monument to the fisherman that protected the castle walls from invaders. The view of the city and the Danube at night is magnificent from this site.

A true fairytale experience. For a cheap entry fee of around 1-2 Euros, you get to go up this amazing bastion which offers some of the best views of Pest from the Buda side of Budapest. The Chain Bridge and the Parliament are in full magnificent view from here and also offers a good view of the Matyas Church.

2nd visit after 20 years. Still love the castle but the new Hilton hotel behind the castle looks so bad, destroy the feeling of the place!They should maintain the castle better way. There are many restaurant chairs & tables stored just on top of the castle make the place look like a mess! What a waste!
Beautiful. The whole city is amazing but Fisherman's Bastion is a must see.A city full of loads of little supruses

Magnificant Views from a Magnificant Structure. What an amazing structure and location! The views over Buda and Pest are simply breathtaking and the architecture of the structure itself is fabulous. it is very easy to get there by bus, hop on hop off busses or a funicular. There is a small charge to get access to the upper viewing platform but it is well worth it.
Beautiful!. You can't miss this if you're in Budapest, it's an architectural delight plus amazing views of the city.
Best. By far the best attraction to see in the city. You can visit all Buda and Pest by foot. No need for taxis.

Amazing location, setting and view. This is a beautiful restaurant where you can enjoy the view of Pest over a nice lunch. The prices are quite reasonable and the food is really good. The service is one of the best we've had in Budapest! You should definitely try it!
no reason to buy tickets. it affords great view over the Danube and Pest, but no reason to buy the tickets to get you 5' higher than ground level.

Very nice point for the panoramic views over Danube. One of the best places for taking pictures of Pest and Danube. Easily reached by Bus 16 followed by 2 mins walking up. Good strating point to proceed to Buda Castle. I think it is better to start visiting it in the morning, have some half hour for touring and taking pictures and then going to Buda Castle which is some 5-7 mins walking. Should be of interest for romantic couples.

Viewpoint. We wandered here unawares while visiting Castle Hill on a cloudy afternoon and then were brought back the next day as part of our city tour, when the entrance fee was paid for us so we ascended to the higher level for great sunlit views of the city and Matyas (Matthias) Church.

Beautiful. Nice place to visit too if wanting a few snaps of across the Danube. Although many people around it didnt feel busy. We didnt get to try out the restaurant there but it was busy so seems it was good
Architecturally Amazing. Must see while in Budapest! Offers fantastic views of the Pest side/Parliament Building across the Danube River. Check out the Labrynth while you're here as well...

Great photo opportunities. I was surprised to see that you have to buy a ticket to be able to walk through the entire wall. However, we decided it was worth it, especially as we are not expecting to come back to Budapest. The view is amazing and you can take brilliant pictures!
the perfect view of Budapest. You can't miss the panorama from this point of Buda hill. Just next to Mathias church. Best place to take pictures…...

Beautiful panorama. I love the panorama of the Fisherma"s Bastion, but i don't understand why we have to pay for the visitation of the upper level. Also don't understand why the citiy allows to maintaining a restaurant in the lower level. All together one of the most beautiful point of the city, but from another side it has a "money smell".

Beautiful especially at night. Love the free walk around this Fisherman's Bastion and you can see the Parliament Building. The view is very picturesque and spectacular. Photos just does not do this place justice.
Beautiful. Wonderful. We didn't use the elevator/cable car because of the long line and walked up - and arrived before those who were waiting for it. Also worth just walking in the streets around
Fantadtic!. Beatiful view. A glass Of wine, violin music and amazing atmosphere. A must for visit when in Budapest.
Great place. Nice view from bastion on the beautiful city.. Mattias church behind is also awsome.. You can see hole town from there..
Must see!. Beautiful architecture and views of the Danube River. Many cafes and shops in the area. Definately worth a visit.

Beautiful building in grounds of the Hilton Hotel. Looks like Sleeping Beauty's Castle this beautiful building gives you an even better view of Parliament and the danube and its bridges across the water
Built early in the 1900,s it looks much older
Watch the cafes underneath it is a real rip off and tourists trap

Just beautiful. An absolutely beautiful place to visit, and very romantic. We spent hours walking around and just sitting, watching the world go by. Had lunch in the cafe inside the Bastion area overlooking the Danube with gorgeous views of Pest. The garlic cream soup is to die for but don't expect anyone to come within 3 feet of you after eating it. The only downside is the Hilton hotel stuck in the middle. How permission was granted to build it in such a beautiful location is beyond me. I'm sure it's a wonderful hotel but it doesn't belong there.
Awesome views.... Great view off the city. Clean environment and very easy to get to. Lots of room for kids to run around and look at the city.
Beautiful. What a beautiful building lovely to wander around with great views of the city from the view points. Great place to photograph.

Pretty architecture, lovely views. My family and I walked to the Fisherman's Bastion from the other side of the Danube. It was a cold clear day. The architecture is fantastic and the views over Budapest and the Danube are lovely. We found it tricky to find our way back (but we're pretty hopeless at reading maps)!

Luxurious. Great place. Splendid scenery and extremely classy personnel. Great food, wine and tables. This is a perfect restaurant apart from one giant minus; Violin-player walking around playing for money.. He asked if it was ok, which we responded "no, thanks" to, which he respected. but still..

Beautiful! Especially at Sunset!. We visited Fisherman's Bastion during the daytime on a guided tour and decided straight away that it was one of the most beautiful parts of the city. A few days later, we returned in the late afternoon to explore in our own time. We would definitely recommend taking a seat on the steps overlooking the Danube/Parliament as the sun sets. We visited in March and it wasn't overcrowded by any means (as some of the other reviews are suggesting). We didn't pay to enter any of the restricted areas as it didn't seem worth it - the views are great from all areas!

Busy, but nice. Really nice view of Parliament and St Stephen's Basilika on the Pest side. Great for a photo op, but gets extremely crowded, and we weren't there too late. Would recommend for a quick look at the Pest side and some nice photos.

Good enough without paying for the ticket. You can see enough of the bastion without paying for the small parts that require a ticket. So i suggest only going there. Too bad that parts of the bastion are closed off though.
strange looking buildings. It afforded a great view of Budapest, it got a little crowded in the afternoon, best to go in the morning

Wonderful view. If you're visiting Budapest, the Fisherman's Bastion is one of the must see places. Beautiful view down to the town. Highly recommended to visit on nice and sunny, but maybe not too hot days
Nice scenery. Nice place to have a look aroun and excellent view over Budapest, especially the Parliament building.
This Is A Must See. This is the best view of Budapest and the absolute best place to get a picture that captures the beauty and vastness of the city as well as the Danube.
Excelente view. It was a rainny das when we were there but it really worths the walking. We did not pay to "enter" the towers because for us the place itself was enough!
Best scenic view of the city. The place is a little bit crowded, but it definitely worth to wait a couple of minutes. Also I recommend to take a worm cloth with you, because it is a bit windy place

Could spend the full day here. Lovely and sunny sunday - we spend almost full day there, just hanging around the area, and enjoygin the leisure picknic there. Must see and do not try to explore it with hurry. Please note the walking paths to the hill - good way to enter there insted of using the time in queue for the lift.

Lovely architecture, fabulous views. This is positioned very closely to the castle and Matthias church on the Buda side of the Danube. Fantastic views across the river towards Parliament. Attractive architecture

Great views, free on the lower level. This is a great place for panoramic views of Budapest. It's terrific architecture blends perfectly in with the surrounding area's architecture and enhances Castle Hill.
I did not appreciate having to pay to walk up the steps to stand on the top level. I would suggest they charge admission for the whole thing or not at all.

Amazing, loved this restaurant. The best restaurant I have been to, food was amazing, I had the venison goulash soup to start and Guinea fowl as a main, both were fantastic. Amazing views great sunny day, would be amazing at night too! I would highly recommend this, went to lots of other restaurants during our 5 day mini break, incl boronyza, cafe kor, bock bistro, this was the best. Thanks and well done.
Beautiful. The bastions are like an old castle with towers. The view of the danube and the parlament is fantastic.

Nice view of the city. The Fisherman's Bastion is on the Buda side of the city on the banks of the Buda river. It looks like a fairy tale castle and has some good, but expensive touristy restaurants built into the walls. The view of the city and the Danube river is fantastic. The Church next door is as beautiful and worth a visit. Only drawback is that this is not a historical building, but built to attract tourists.

great views!. had a walk from chin bridge up the castle hill to fisherman's bastion. although weather was not that good, the scenery was still great. nice view of the pest side of the city. a different perspective at each point along the way. i can imagine it will be beautiful if the weather's good:) recommend the walk up hill. was an easy 20-30min walk with great views. went back up again at night. great views as well. but the spot lights shining on the castle n structures made night photography kinda difficult unless you bring a tripod along. the spot lights were shining right at the camera lens if the camera were placed on the parapet. disappointing photos but still great views.

Beautiful views day and night. I visited here firstly in the day. I brought my ticket with my Matthias church ticket which made things very smooth. Visiting allows you to get higher than the other parts of this area and gives you fantastic views over the Danube. On the same evening we were able to go up again as there is no ticket requirement. I assume this is because the hoards of tourists have left buda and headed to pest where most of the hotels and restaurants are. The views at night are spectacular! Lots of the buildings are lit up and it really shows off the beauty of Budapest. This area is very busy in the day as it is top of the tourist itineraries but worth the hussle. At night it's much more relaxed, quiet and romantic.

Another great view. The Fisherman's Bastion is another great place for a great view of Parliament and the river. It is in a beautiful setting and the church is just as beautiful. I would imagine this place is even better in the evening as the sun is going down!

Stunning view of Budapest and Danube from this fortification.. The road leading to Fisherman's Bastion builds up the anticipation. This fortification lies on the Buda side of the city. Once you are in, you can enjoy the stunning view of the Danube river and the city with the largest building in Hungary, the Hungarian Parliament standing out amongst the rest.

Lovely place. Definitely one of my favorites. Sadly I was there in a very cold day, but still, was a nice visit. The view from there is amazing, takes you instantly back to the old times where you can check like a warrior the entire city.
Perfect setting for pictures!

Splendid. All the castle block is simply amazing, my suggestion is:
go there on night time (meaning when it's dark), you'll be delighted by a wonderful show of architecture and lights... Breathtaking!
Perfect View!. From this place you have one of the best views to the city! A place you need to visit when you are in Budapest!
A must.. Don't miss this beautiful area. Take the funicular railway to the castle and walk along. A real highlight

Not to be missed amazing views. The view from the Fisherman's Bastion is outstanding, a real photo opportunity. The area is rather crowded in places but it is more than worth a visit. There is a charge for walking on a section of the walls but this is not something I paid for, as I was more than content with what was accessible for free.

Closed at 4pm on Fridays. I didn't get the chance to go inside because they closed as we were walking up to the ticket booth. However I did walk the area and get to see the very beautiful views. The bar area was still open and had amazing views there as well. I would so recommend visiting this site. Even if its just for a walk around
Disneylike perfection!. A beautiful setting and wonderful views. An absolute must and the perfect place for photos of the Danube and Parliament over on Pest
The best view in Budapest. I went there around 2 o'clock, the view was really amazing, I completely recommend it to anyone it's an easy trip and the old walls are beautiful :)

Don't miss it in Budapest. Best time during March is in the evening, it gives a fantastic view of Budapest. Always will be crowded irrespective of the time. artistic way it's very beautiful, the landscape makes it perfect

Great views but a bit Disney. Walked around this structure was part of a visit to Castle Hill. Lovely views over the river towards Pest but it did remind me of something I might expect to see within a Disney theme park.
Romantic and beautiful. The Fishermen's Bastions are in between the most known attractions of Budapest in the Castle district. The view from the towers is an amazing and unforgettable experience.
fantastic views. amazing views, lots of other things near it, not the oldest in the city as only but a 100 years old but the architecture is fabuous

The hilly part of buda side . Nice breathtaking photo opp. Choose a clear day to come as fog might ruin the photo. Come early or late to catch sunrise and sunset. Sun bathing over pest side is really beautiful. Consider investing in a selfie stick to capture your friends and the the view tgt
Delightful. A very pleasant way to spend a lovely sunny afternoon with some very good views of the city and beyond.
Excellent view across the Danube to Pest. Excellent view across the Danube to Pest – but then you get an equally good view for free from the courtyard in front of the National Gallery

Beautiful. An amazing structure. Like many other old buildings in Budapest, this is almost Disneyesque; could be straight from a film set. Easy to imagine knights of old here. Free (for most of it) with outstanding views down over the city. Superb photo opportunities. Highly recommended.

Breathtaking views! Favorite spot in Budapest!. The views from and of and around the tower are beautiful! Great for photos all around the area! Definitely climb the small tower and climb all over it to get some great views of the city! There were some peddlers around, but the police showed up and as soon as they were noticed, all the people selling their wares grabbed their stuff and high-tailed it out of there. There is a small bar at the top, if you want to sit and relax. We went at sunset to get some great photos! I could have stayed there all day!

Fantastic views. We were staying at the Hilton which is part of the Bastion and the views over Budapest are great, Early morning, before 10am is the best time to visit as after this many coach parties arrive and it does get rather crowded but I think the best view is after dark when everything is illuminated especially the parliament buildings and the church
Fantastic Views. This is located in Buda, the high part of Budapest. Loved it, fantastic views out over Pest. A must during your visit.
beautiful and relaxing. a place to chill and people watch as the world goes by............................................................................................

Amazing. Beautiful place very fairytale castle like.
Can get a bit touristy with the groups of people but they move on pretty quick.
Bar on top of castle is a bit pricey but definitely worth sitting up with a drink for the view of the city.
Stunning views. Fantastic views across the river, don't bother paying though because most of it is free. Nice place to stand and take in the river Danube and good photo opportunities.

unbelievable views. We took the time out of our holiday to go up to the FISHERMANS BASTION, (HALASZBADTYA),to admire the stunning views of the Danube and the city.We took the casle bus up here from Moszkva ter,only a short journey. There are so many things to see ,the towers,the square, were you can get a nice refreshment drink in the cafe,the winding staircase's,do not leave your camra in your hotel as you will need it to take some unbelievable photos. This is a must go destination in this wonderful city,well worth a visit
Truly one of the great attractions of Budapest. Fantastic architecture, unsurpassed views of the city below, inviting small old town section with shops.

WHAT A WONDERFUL, SIMPLE ATTRACTION - FOR LITTLE KIDS AND BIG.. This half Fairy Tale Castle with its 7 spires, turrets, walk-ways, stairs, terraces, parapets and statues is great for kids to run around and fantasize. I don't know why other cities have not taken up this idea and made it their own - starting with my own home city!With its white stone-work and marvelous view over the river, Parliament House and the city it has been fully restored after it was damaged during the war.Included is an equestrian, bronze statue of Stephen the First - the first catholic king of Hungary.The only other feature required would be a nice Cafe -- and this is on the top terrace.Brian, from Perth. W. Australia.

Paranoma view of the City. The Fisherman's Bastion is located in Castle district on high hill, we got there on bus 16 from city center. The platform allow us to stand at vintage point overlooking the city. it's a must visit location!

Disney, eat your heart out!. When it comes to Fairytale-style edifices, I thought that Disney was king, but this place is awesome! The stonework is so ornate, and the city views from here are magnificent and far reaching.
Fisherman's Bastion. Lovely. Like a fairytale setting. Calm and enchanting. Well worth a visit. We were mesmerised by the peaceful quality and delightful architecture
Budapest.... A Very Nice place to be when un are in Budapest ...nice view ,and a lot of peaples,just be relaxing........

Take time to admire . My favorite part of this attraction is the view of the Parliament. You don't have just the view, you also have the surrounding parts to visit. The architecture of this place is stunning, it's like a palace in outdoor. I wouldn't thought that Budapest is so beautiful!!!
Very nice location. Really one of the best locations must see in Bupapest but dont forger your camera as its very nice views.
Stunning. Wonderful place. Well worth the walk. Beautiful architecture and stunning views. A real gem. Continue to the National Gallery. Great cafe on the square here.
Great views. We paid to go up to get the views but realised afterwards further along you can go along another part for free! Just be nice if that was clear !!

like a fairyland castle made from stone with great views. great views across the Danube to the Pest side. makes for stunning photo opportunities. Don't know why the Hilton was allowed to place a hotel there. I suspect it was all about money, it reflects poorly on the hotel group but I suppose they wont care.
Any case it doesn't spoil what is a fantastic place to visit

Best view in the city from a fascinating monument. Day and night this is a great attraction. The majority of the towers and walkways are open access. You can pay to access some towers but the view is similar. The view of the Danube, the many bridges and particularly the Parliament are great. Quite a walk up but a great stroll down.

Wonderful Views!. We used the hop on hop off bus to view the City, and stopped at the Castle District of Buda, and a short walkways to this fairy tale structure, with it's wonderful views over Pest and The Danube, flowing between the two parts of the City.

great views. a must in budapest! there is a part of it with entrance fee, we didn't take that part.
worth coming also at nigth, amazing views and photograf spot.
Most beautiful views. This is a MUST SEE in Budapest. We had the pleasure of taking a private tour that drove us up to see it. It was stunning and the views were amazing.

An exceptional landmark with stunning views!. The Fisherman’s Bastion (Halászbástya) is a castle like structure, built in 1905 in neo-gothic and Romanesque style for decorated purposed by Frigyes Schulek, the architecture that reconstructed Matthyas church. There is a fee in the morning but free later on in the evening.Climbing stairways and numerous turrets are spots for excellent photos. The 7 towers symbolize the 7 Magyar tribes.The name seems weir though but this was where the fish market was taking place during medieval times. It can be reached by the Castle bus (Varbusz) from Moszkva ter.

Very beautiful. Good place to just relax and take a walk among the white turrets. Great view from above on the Danube, the Parliament and all the bridges. I wish we had more time there.
When it's cold it's a good idea to enter the small cafe on the top turret and have a cup of mulled wine, as we did.
Views from Buda. Ideal location to view Pest especially the parliament and the Basilica. Try it at night when the sights are illuminated.

Best of landmarks. We had a lovely time here. It is so beautiful. The church is gorgeous, although a lot of it is under construction right now. There is a restaurant up there that has some awesome wine. Just around the corner, there is shopping, as well. Love it here.

You have to go!. The Fisherman's Bastion is spectacular. It sits grandly on a hill, overlooking the river, bridges, and the stunning parliament building. It actually looks like something out of a fairytale, with turrets and pillars and white stone, it was really stunning. It's also a fantastic place to get panaramic shots of Budapest, plus some filmy photos for your collection! It's truly enchanting, you have to go!
Fantastic views from here.. wonderful buildings with good photo opportunities of the city. This is next to St Matthias Church and you can buy tickets to both places.
Beautiful. Wonderful place, stunning view of the city, historic and wonderful. Budapest is enchanting in so many ways and one of the moments you'll think that, is when you go up there.
What a great place to see!!. We visited this place on a tour and I wish we would of had more time to see this wonderful site! This place was really beautiful and the shops nearby were fun too.

The best views and experience while visiting Budapest. Fisherman's Bastion is like something from a fairytale at the top of the hill overlooking the city, the wonderful Parliament building and sights from all angles. We visited on a very cold day in December and were happy to get inside for a warm hot chocolate but I would love to return in the Summer.

Dining in a castle. We did not plan on seeing the Halaszbastya. We spent little time on the Buda side of the waters. However, dining in the main restaurant was a highlight. The food was excellent, moderately priced ($75 for two including champagne), included live music, and has an outstanding view of the Parliament building. When recommending things to do in Budapest, this would be high on my list. It is the perfect place to have a romantic dinner.

Magical at night. If you can come here in the evening where the tourist crowds are gone, it's just absolutely magical to go walk around this area looking over at Pest with Matthias Church in the back.
Wonderful vista!. This is definitely worth a visit, especially at night, when the view is just stunning. The church immediately behind the Bastion is truly beautiful too.
Interesting architecture, worth a trip to see it. As part of a Pest tour, we went to this area. The views were great, lots of Danube river areas to see and photo.

Most beautiful view of budapest. Fisherman's Bastion is part of every tour at the Castle District. The view from the top is stunning and we couldn't get enough of it. You can see the Danube with the four bridges, the parliament and the entire Pest side.There are many nice restaurants in the area and of course Matthias Church. From there a short walk to the Castle.
Beautiful. Really stunning building - one of the most beautiful in Budapest. Beautiful architecture so if that's you're thing it's well worth a visit!
Stunning view!. This was the highlight of my trip of Buda. Stunning view of the city. Best time to visit is in the evening before sunset.

must see. very nice place, lovely views over Danube and Matyas church view, romanesque gothic cocktail in the structure is the secret of the beauty of this white bastion, it's free to enter and see all views

Fabulous Birthday Meal!. After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor and seeing the stunning pictures of the building and the restaurant, I knew this was the place to take my husband for his special 50th birthday meal, and it certainly did not let me down! We had been up to the area the previous day and had had a drink in the bar right next door overlooking the river so we knew the views where going to be spectacular but we couldn't wait to see them at night. We were given a table by the window overlooking the Parliament Buildings all lit up and to the right of it was one of the bridges - it was stunning. Out of all the restaurants we have been to this was definitely the one with the wow factor! Perfect lighting, beautiful interior with huge chandaliers, gypsy music, in fact they came to our table and played two beatles songs on our request. For the entire night we where treated like loyalty - the service is superb! The meal was very good and well presented and by the time you finish three courses and the bread you are satisfied because the food is very rich. Don't get me wrong, I have had better food but the overall experience of this restarant is not something you come across everyday, I mean how often do you get to dine in a fairytale castle with views like that! Thank you to the staff at Fisherman's Bastion for making my husbands night so special!
Stunning building. Impressive structure and great hot chocolate in the cafe within it's walls. Lovely views from the towers across the river.

Little gem. Visited Budapest in February. As we were limited to time we wanted to see as much as we could.came up here on our second day wat an amazing place. The layout,area its situated and the exterior decor (tiles on roof)are very eye catching. Some magnificent pictures to be taken up here. Loads of shops in the vacinity and also a cafe shop that has unreal desserts. Would definitely recommend a visit

Spectacular panoramic View. If you ar in Budapest, definitely you must to go.The Bastion is free, and it's near to Matthias Church. The views from Budapest and the Danube are amazing, I suggest visit it in the morning or evening and another in the night , because Budapest by night is simply amazing.

Great view whilst relaxing with a drink. A great place in the Castle to stop and have a drink with an incredible view over the Danube from the parliament building all the way to Margaret island. A real must if you are visiting Budapest.

Picturesque Vista!. You must pass by this vista just for the Castle like edifices located just by the St Mathias Church. It is rather a touristy area, with many tour groups at midday when I visited, but it is just begging to be photographed. As it turns out, it was built just for the 1896 centennial, but it has a great flavor and architecture. Numerous lookouts with panorama picture opportunities looking back over the Danube and Pest side. The arches frame the view nicely, and it is a nice place to sit on a short wall on a sunny day and plan your next stop

just fairy tale. beautiful although it was a bright sunny day and hardly anyone there is was beautiful. We roamed around the bastion and then went off to have some coffee and cake an a traditional coffee house which just set us up for the next leg of our sight seeing.
Overwhelming . Tremendous view especially during the night and you can see the whole pest side of the city! I definitely recommended visiting!

Great views, cocktail bar. The Bastion itself is clearly a "folly" built to look like an old castle turrits and all. However, after walking through the castle, I needed a sit down. The coffee was exquisite, and the views superb. Save some cash and have a drink / sit down here - while overlooking the city and the Danube below.
A must see. Amazing views, clean, easy to walk around, best area on the castle grounds for buildings and views. Ghoulash soup was good in the cafe overlooking the river.

Very nice area of old city Buda.. Cool area to walk around. Usually there are only a few street performers, maybe a guy with a large eagle, so the area is relatively nice to walk through and get some of the best pictures back at the Pest side. Spend a few hours and make sure you go into the church.
Best pics u can get!. We got the best pictures of our trip here at sunset! Absolutely stunning! Wish we would have taken more!

Fantastic view. Great view of the city. It's worth taking the Budvari Siklo (Buda Hill Funicular) cable car up the mountain and then take the 10 minute walk to Fishermans area. You feel like a princess in a castle!

Clean and interesting. Well worth a visit if only for the views and photo opportunities. I found myself being a camera expert taking groups of different nationalities who all seemed to be having a great time. Lovely clean place to wander around.

tough walk but stunning views of the city. There is a funcular railway which I thought was expensive. Many didnt by the size of the queues for it. Decided on walking the hill. Great way to get the heart going. Lovely walk at the top. Stunning views over Pest with the Danube at the foot of the hill. Definetly worth the walk. Lovely quaint buildings , coffee shops . Spent a lovely morning up ......................................................................................................................................................

Just for the stunning views. The town of Buda is very quaint and not all at what I expected. The church is equally stunning, but I felt that the Bastion was let down, by selling its sole to unnecessary restaurants built into the bastion, as well as that awful hotel.However the views across to Pest are stunning, as is the Danube below.Despite what I say, worth the visit.
A must see. The view,the towers and everything is super.You can see Pest from the towers.The castle area is very beautifull and picturesque.The bastion is THE landmark of Budapest.

Very positive and sunny place!. It is really very intersting to come there, apart of the fisherman's bastion there is a Marzipan museum close where sweet lovers like I am can purchase sweet marzipans all kind of tastes and shape. There some souvenirs stores close to the Bastion. It is a little bit hard to walk to it, as you shall step up the stairs, but it worths it, as from it you can see half of the Budapest and the view is magnificent. You will see the Danub river, the bridge and mane other things. Don't miss a chance to make beautifull photos for your memory album.

An architectural fantasy.. This entertaining architectural fantasy can be reached from the Pest side by walking across the famous Chain Bridge and then using the ancient funicular railway to reach the top of castle hill.The fishermans bastion is close by and from its parapets provides a superb vie of the city and in particular the Parliament building,and the dome of St Stephens Cathedral.The parapets are well populated with stalls selling lace and other craft articles with tourists in mind;consequently the prices are much inflated compared to the prices in ordinary shops in the city.nevertheless a trip to fishermans bastion is worth it for the matchless views of the city.

Magical. It looks like a Disney Castle, and we kept on calling it that throughout our stay. If you want to sweep your love interest off their feet then this is the place to go! There is a small cafe with sparkly lights and a magnificent view! There are quite a few private and romantic balconies or nooks and crannies where you can share a special moment with your loved one.At night a nightingale can be heard singing which just adds to the magic.

Tourist attraction. One of the most crowded tourist attractions.If you travel to Budapest with a guided group, chances are this will be among your destinations. If you are traveling alone, it' s also worth for the sightseeing.But make sure you come here after 7 PM, then you won't have to pay an entrance fee to the Bastion.The prices here are among the highest you can find in the city, but if you find the small CBA (a chain of food stores), you can have a good coffee and cookies upstairs.Also, you can chose among thousands of Hungarian wines here. All for regular prices.Also, it's best to wait until it gets dark, as the view over the Danube with all the bridges is astonishing.

Steep Climb, but worth every pace. Our group did a stopover here in the afternoon and what an amazing view of the city!It is quite a steep walk up, but worth the trek. Check out the restaurants nearby and cafes.
Best views from here. This area offers stunning views over Budapest, Danube and the parliament. Definitely worth the walk.
Fantastic views over the city. A lovely quaint area - with superb views over the city - a must visit! Lots of restaurants to choose from in the area and St Mattias Church well worth a visit

My favorite place in Budapest!. The Fisherman Bastion is my best spot in Budapeste! If you are lucky to see a sunset the place will turn even more magical! The sunlight illuminates the Parlament, the Danubio and the entire rest of Budapeste. It's just amazing! I could spend hours there going up e going down in the 7 turrets! A nice bar with fair prices is located under the castle and it offers an astonishing view with great food!

Stunning Views. I visited early in the morning, managing to fit between two large tour groups, which meant I enjoyed a few minutes in the site when it was almost deserted. Beautiful views of Budapest and interesting, fairy-tale architecture. A definite must see!

Lovely views. We visited here as one of the stops on the "hop on hop off" bus tour. It was a fine clear day and the views of the Parliament Buildings across the Danube and also the bridges was lovely, however, from reading reviews & recommendations we felt we would have seen more and as such, we were a little disappointed. It's not mobility friendly - there is quite a steep hill to walk up to where the coffee shop is, there are a couple of bench style seats, but as you can imagine they fill up very quickly. You can walk around here at your own leisure. It is worth a visit on a clear day.
A Magic place!. A really lovely spot to see views of the City from ,and the Towers look a bit like the Magic Kingdom at Disneyland! Go into the Church it is amazing!

pretty battlements. This was free to wander within but unless you go into the bars there is no where to sit. it is a must see however,i went twice as the second time I went with my husband. So I noticed that the top bar selling hot wine with a terrace view is closed on Sundays
Buda-ful. You are able to get a beautiful view from the Fisherman's Bastion. It is definitely worn going over and walking around that side.

Nice View. Fisherman's Bastion looks awesome...from the other side of the Danube. Once actually up there it just didn't do it for us. The views from Fisherman's Bastion was lovely across the Danube and overlooking Parliament, the Chain Bridge and the rest of the City. There is not much difference between the two levels in scenery or views. Worth a visit but don't plan on being there for too long.

Lunch. So this was on our list of "To Do's" however evening service gets booked quite a bit in advance due to its stunning setting and brilliant service and reputation. So we opted for lunch after visiting Matthius Church. It was a very impromptu decision so we actually weren't that hungry however once seated and having per used the delectable menu we shared starters and desert and each had a main course the food was amazing the surroundings sublime and the service out of this world I can not rate it high enough. We were sat by a window that looked out across the Danube absolutely stunning.

Great views. A charming walkway near Mathias Church, the Bastion offers panoramic views of the Danube, Parliament, the Chain Bridge and beyond. A great place for photos or for just taking in the scenery.

Free views over whole of Budapest.. What more could you want?. Beautiful architecture and stunning views. We stopped and had a mulled wine looking out across the bastion and beyond. Definitely not one to miss!
Beautiful! . The view of budapest is simply breathtaking! It was one of the best parts of our trip there and I'll be glad to visit again

nice high point to take in the view of the danube and the city. the church that's in or right next to fisherman's bastion has very colorful roof tiles. very unique. we enjoyed to just staring at it and watch crowds coming and going.this is also a good place to get a nice view of the danube down below, the bridges, and the whole city. good spot for taking pictures. a couple of bus routes take you straight up there from the pest side. very cheap and convenient. two thumbs up!
Go on a nice day.. Really pretty, good views . Interesting light and reflections good place for photos .go in the afternoon that is when the light is at its best.

Great views, but very crowded. This is an impressive location, but horribly crowded in the middle of the day. And unfortunately, on the day I visited there was heavy construction in the courtyard at the Bastion. By all means stop here when you visit Matthias Church, but wait until construction is cleaned up.
nice walk. Lovely area to walk around. Very interesting. Being there out of season was quieter. Lovely views across the Danube.
Worth Visiting. This place is so worth visiting for the spectacular view. Budapest is so beautiful day & night! Got a lot of breathtaking photo's...

Great photo opts. This is a wonderful photographic opportunity to take pictures of the Pest side and also appears to be in a tower. There was no cost when we were there. The seven towers represent the Magyar tribes. This is located in the Castle Hill area and across the street from the Matthias church.
A view of Pest. Fabulous weather gave a great view over the Pest side of the city and the Danube. You need to be relatively fit to climb up to the top.

Great views. The area here is a little touristy , but clean and beautiful. The views are fantastic across to the Parliament area and across the danube, you can sit and enjoy a drink at the top and half way up , very reasonable prices too,
Excellent hill-top view. Beautiful buildings with an excellent view of the plains of Budapest from the top. Excellent for photography.

Nice location. The view from the hill top is amazing . luckily the weather was good during our visit, it could be a bit windy at times. The architecture is amazing. The views of Danube in the evening with lights across the city makes it very picturesque.
Harry Potter like feel to it. Really interesting buildings with great views of the city. Worth going day or night. Take your camera!

so beautiful. The view from up here is absolutely amazing, it was perrishing cold when we visited, but with lovely blue skys. we stood as long as we could to enjoy the views from several points.
use the hop on hop off bus and get off at stop 11.
Beautiful. Worth a visit, so beautiful, beware the overpriced cafes though. Views are spectacular and are a one of a kind
Amazing views. Amazing views of the Pest side of the river. You can climb up parts of it to see from higher up, but not much difference in view really.

Beautiful views!. This spot is a must visit for fantastic views over Pest and the Danube and stood out to me and my family during our visit to Budapest. We picked a sunny day, which is advisable as the white stone looks great in sunlight and against blue skies. We didn't get the opportunity to visit in the evening which was a shame as I have heard the view of the city lights from the bastion are stunning.
This is a must see!. Fabulous views over the Danube and all of the city of Budapest from this building and all completely free to look around. Well worth a look!

Extravagant Indulgence!. My wife and I went here for my birthday; it was a truly extravagant experience. Note this place is expensive - but very good value. Let me explain. What you are paying for is exquisite Michelin standard fine dining, exceptional service that was formal without being stuffy, wonderful surroundings with amazing views over the Danube, very romantic atmosphere, v.g. Hungarian wine list with extremely knowledgeable sommelier - recommendations were perfect. Wish I'd taken a picture of the bottles! Tip: We knew we were going on a blow out, so during the day grabbed a 'lagos' [local snack] at the central market and a drink each - filling lunch for two for a tenner!
Must visit. A perfect venue to watch sunset and soak up the atmosphere. Great photo location. Which we were in Budapest longer, to try the restaruunt.

Great panoramic view of Pest. Along with the Mathias Church it is a must to do in Budapest, you could spend a long day in this area of Pest, including the National Gallery and the History Museum. Now the Fisherman
Great place to walk around. Feels like being in a magic location, with an incredible view of Budapest from high above. Keep an eye out for the eagles for a fun photo!!

Well worth a visit. A fantastic viewpoint right across the city and showing off the beautiful Danube river. The architecture is very grand although some modern buildings impinge on the overall impression. Walk up the main steps pausing to take in the vista, the views just get better and better.
Great views especially at night. The Bastion is a great place for photographers to capture Budapest at night with a great view of the Danube and many of the city's most famous buildings.
Great view. The view was marvelous. Each tower is different and if you go in February the visit is free. The architecture is spectacular. This is well worth the visit.
Beautiful. I didn't make it inside, which I was sad about but it looks amazing during the day and when lit up at night.

Best place for views. This was my favourite place in Budapest. It snowed the day we visted so was very picturesque but it did obscure the view a bit. We loved it so much we visited again but without the snow. Gorgeous views of the river and the parliament building

halaszbastya. Breathtaking do not miss - go at night when everywhere is lit up
too budy in the day with tourists but nighttime is great. Costs to get into the Cathedral.

make sure you dress warm. My family and I visited fisherman's bastion after seeing matthias church and even though this has the best view in all of budapest make sure you bundle up warm. The wind zips through there and will chill you to the bone. They have a little bar there as well equipped with heaters which was great the day I went. So you can sit there and have a cocktail while looking out over beautiful budapest

A must to visit when in Budapest!. This is really worth visiting.You can take great photos from here as it has the most amazing view of the city and the River Danube. There is a terrace daytime café which is reasonably priced, a more expensive evening restaurant or just a bar where you can sit inside or out and take in the view! One of my favourite spots on my brief visit to the city!
Beautiful. Great vantage point, would definitely recommend tourists and travelers to go here! Beautiful architecture.
Great Views!. There really isn't much here except great views of the city nd a fairy tale like backdrop for photographs.
Great View. It's a free venue to visit. The view is outstanding and it's a great photo spot to take pictures of the chain bridge and the Parliament.

Lovely view but no need to pay!. This lookout post is beautiful to looker in it's own right but also gives beautiful views over Budapest particularly the Parliament buildings. You do have to pay to go up the turret on the right, however you can buy a combined ticket for the church right beside it which has lovely architecture. What we discovered after though was that the turret on the left you could go up for free as there was a cafe up there, same view without the cost (except for a drink/snack). In the courtyard below there is a marzipan museum with a toilet, you do have to pay to use the toilet but it was very cheap and you can see some of the random marzipan figures!

great view. I've never quite seen a place like this it was excellent and i enjoyed it and climbing to the little bar at the top of the tower is worth it just for the view over the danube its breathtaking.

Tremendous Turrets.... My husband visited the bastion on our sightseeing trip, quite simply the most beautiful and fantastical piece of architecture, so unusual and looks like it's straight from a Disney movie, you're treated to perfect views over to the parliament from inside.
great views. Managed to find a lovely sunny winter's day and the views were not disappointing. Sat in the Margaret cafe for a mulled wine..well worth it for the view.

Vievs. This is an excellent lookout and taken out of a walt disney movie. The bastion leads you back in time. It is easy to envision both knights and princesses. It surprised me, however, that it was built in terms of turism.
Wonderful views of Budapest. You look out across the river over the city. Clear views of the parliament. Nearby cafes for drink. Get the 16 bus from the bottom of the hill. It will save your legs.

rapunzel tower. Just so beautifully built and located. Free entry, super views and a great photo opportunity too. Very close to a number of attractions and all but a part of the Budapest Hilton should you be staying there.
Disney history. It was a nice wlk up the hill but I didn't appreciate that we had to pay to visit a church and everything was a bit neat and pretty.
Fabulous views. Great views across the city in a magical setting. Not to be missed when visiting Budapest, incredibly scenic.

A must of Budapest. The " Fishermen's Bastion" is unmissable spot in the center of old Buda Hill, next to the Hilton Buda, the Matyas Curch and the other main touristic spots, especially, if one used the furnicular to get to the hill. More than a fortification complex, it is an architectural, artistic and panoramic splendor to admire and walk around .Every touristic book or brochure describe the place, better and nicer the I'll do. My only task is to tell you, that I have been ther a few times and enjoined it each time as well as it was the first....

Gorgeous area, stop in for some goulash. This whole area is not to be missed when visiting Budapest. The Fisherman's Bastion will make you feel like you are a princess...photo ops galore! There is a breathtaking view of the Pest side of the city. We stopped into the cafe "inside" which has seating right by the stone windows and heat lamps to keep you warm. Strangely enough, I think this was the best goulash we had in all of Budapest, and we tried it at no less than five places. They serve it with very hot peppers to your taste and warm fluffy bread.Don't miss this!

Great view, romantic and chill. The best part about it for me was that it has an open space to sit down with a bottle of wine (which is awesome in Hungary), and enjoy the view over the Parliament, Basilica, and the rest of the Pest side. Plus, it's right in the center. Don't be afraid to walk up there, and don't take public transportation - it's not that high up as it looks from the beginning.

One of the best meals of my life!. Enjoyed the degustation menu on 2/24/15....7 courses of deliciousness for 70 euros, plus another 30 euros for unique wine selections for each course. Amazing food, perfect service.... would have easily been 300 euros in Paris, and not nearly as delicious.
Great views.. Nice area. Great photo opportunity. Walked up from the River, quite steep! Should have visited the same day we dis the castle area as we had used the hop on hop off bus.

Stunning views. Beautiful architecture with the most amazing views across the Danube to Pest! It was quite busy but it is free to walk around. Plenty of great photo opportunities and only a short walk from Buda Castle

Sleeping Beauty. This is the view many tour operators use on advertising, my chikdren use to call it sleeping beauties castle. And this is just what it looks like. Once again the view is fantastic from here, you view the whole of the Pest side of the Danube from this area.There is now a small charge to go on the top walkway, but its got to be worth £1.You can go to this area on the funicular on the Buda side of the Chain Bridge (Adam Clarke Ter) buy a return ticket as it is cheaper. There is plenty to see in this area especially in the summer as they have food/wine markets.
Perfect place for pictures. - beautiful view!-not overcrowded-you can have there a cup of coffee with awesome desert-i recommend, to try there cakes with cream
Great views of Pest!. Worth a visit if you're up on the hill as you have a beta view over the river and out to Pest. There is an unusual marzipan cafe nearby that serves a mean cappuccino!

See it at night!. A lovely spot for an evening visit, fabulous views over the Danube and the floodlight Parliament building. The architecture is beautiful and it's right next to St. Matthias church, another stunner !

Great views across the Danube from this fascinating place. Great building with an unusual history. Great views across the Danube and the Budapest bridges, just next to St Mathias Church - also a lovely building.
Cool. Different time, great Architecture! Wonderful view! I felt like princess! The only thing i didn't like was the hotel, that doesn't belong in such enviroment!

Views to make you fall in love. If this is Europe I must be in love. Budapest is still one of my favourite big cities. It has a vast network of dependable subways and ground level public transit, hotsprings, reasonable priced eateries, and this location (The Fisherman's Bastion) is true eye-candy. This is Disney in real stone and steep in true history. Statues of glorious kings, Gypsy violins, and a wine bar/restaurant with a million-dollar panorama of the Danube and Hungarian Parliament buildings golden in the sunset. Ah!

Panorama!!!!. In Budapest there are a lot of attractions to visit!! This was the best of all with amazing view of Budapest and Danupe river!! I took a hundred of beautiful photos! There also restaurants and coffee/bars in the area as well!

Must see in Budapest. Nice to visit in the evening when there are less people. In the evening you can pass through the turnstile to visit the top level without a ticket. An excellent place to see the river and city, especially at night.

Panorama of Budapest. One of Budapest attractions. The Bastion with towers and turrets, little balconies to enter and walk around, Statue of Stephen I of Hungary... This complex looks like a fairy tale castle and from up there, you have an incredible view at Danube river, Parliament building and beautiful Budapest city.
A MUST.. You have to go visit this, and be sure to look around the backstreets, beautiful place with stunning views.
Fantastic views. pick a clear day to come up here to get wonderful views of the city. Is extremely pretty but can also get very busy with bus parties. Perfect photo stop

Trundle Up the Hill for a Kingly View of the City. When in Budapest it is a must to trundle up Buda Hill by footpath or funicular railway for a walk about the interesting community, a visit to the many interesting museums in the area-except perhaps for the National Gallery-see my review of that attraction-and not least for a view of the City and Danube from the fisherman's Bastion. This is a stonework and concrete construction on the precipice of Buda Hill just next to the Cathedral and the Hilton Hotel. It is self-explanatory. Simply go there and take in the sights. From there one can head to any of the fine, or indeed any of the more mundane, eateries on the hill, to any of the other attractions, or simply do a bit of a walkabout the hill. It is spot not to be missed when in budapest.
Nice Views. Neat place to take in views of Pest. It is nice even when raining to walk through the portico. You don't need to spend to much time here though.

Free (in low season only, apparently) spot for great views of Budapest. This is a great place to gaze over Budapest and the Danube River. We were fortunate that there was no admission fee (based on other reviews it appears that one is charged on occasion). When you consider all of the great sites on Buda Hill, Fisherman's Bastion is definitely not to be missed. It looks like a cross between a fairytale castle and a sandcastle. We happened to go on a cloudy day but both it and the views were no less beautiful. Worth a trip!
Fantastic city view!. Make sure you do,this on a sunny day, you will not regret it. To top of Buda is quaint and very charming.
Must visit. This is a must visit when in Budapest as its very picturesque and has some of the best views of the river and pest...

Stunning views from here. It was a very cold day when we visited the Bastion. However a hot mulled wine sitting out on the balcony area soon made us forget how cold it was. A fantastic place to take some photos with amazing views of Budapest.

Impressive. Very impressive with great views over Budapest and the Danube. Slightly more expensive for refreshments compared to nearby offerings but this needs to be tempered with the great views that are on offer.
Budapest. Whilst visiting the castle area you will find this lovely building overlooking the danue to the parliment building a fantastic photo opportunity

Beautiful, unless you turn round. One of the most beautiful parts of Buda City, almost fairy tail like. Fantastic views down across Pest. Sadly, if you turn round you will not be able to avoid seeing the truly awful Hilton Hotel. Whoever let that be built there should be locked up.
Great Views!!. Well worth the walk up the hill. Best views of Pest. Stunning scenery and a stunning bastion. A must for any trip to Budapest.

Awesome view, beautiful building.....great place to take lots of pictures:-). I really loved it:-) I took awesome pictures, we were so lucky with the weather. You can walk around and there is a wonderful view from different spots.To get into the Fisherman's Bastion you need to pay 1400HUF, around 6 Euros. It's worth every penny. They were restaurating inside, but you can still walk around. Beautiful!

Fantastic View. Located behind St. Matthias Cathedral, this is another of the don't-miss attractions in Budapest. For one thing, the scenery behind the Bastion is exceptional, and you'll undoubtedly take dozens of photographs of the city on both sides of the river. That's after you've photographed the sights of Fisherman's Bastion itself, of course.
Wonderful monument. Restoration is nearing completion at Fisherman's Bastion. What a wonderful site and best views of Pest. Visit in the early morning before the crowds arrive

Fantastic restaurant in Budapest. If you like fine dining or an absolutely fantastic romantic meal with outstanding views of the Danube & Pest this is the place for you . Although the restaurant is in the top set of eateries in Budapest the staff are unpretentious warm with a friendly & courteous manner which compliments the outstanding position of the restaurant within Buda castle. Having travelled extensively & eaten in some very rated restaurants in the UK & Europe the meal we enjoyed this February ranked as one of the top five to date - Quality , service & flavours all top notch as was the selection of wines . The price of the meal for two including wine , water & two glasses of Hungarian 40c proof brandy £140 which for the quality & setting in a capital city is very reasonable . A great place for a romantic meal , or to impress or just to enjoy a fine meal with good company . Taxi from central Pest to the restaurant approx. 3,000 HUFS. Thank you Halaszbastya for a great experience
great!. Wonderful walls allowing one of the most beautiful views of the city. It's windy up there, but it's a must... you have to see it

Fantastic view of Pest and Matthias cathedral. Great place to visit especially on a clear day! Lovely spot to take pictures of the view of Pest and Matthias cathdral. There's a small cafe in one of the citadels open in winter too! The site is free of charge definitely worth a visit!

Unparalleled view of Budapest. I loved it! The Bastion is simply beautiful and the view from the top breathtaking! We visited it during the day and came back to see Budapest from the top in all its glory at night as well. Must go!
Beautiful. Excellent! No photo's do this justice. Its gorgeous whether day or night and the views are incredible!

Don't miss a visit to Fisherman's Bastion. Fisherman's Bastion is on top of Castle Hill on the Buda side of Budapest, so you have a choice of how to get to it. There is a short funicular railway which starts just across from Chain Bridge, although there is often a queue for it. You can also get a bus up which stops near the top of Castle Hill. There is also a set of steps. We got the bus up and walked down which worked perfectly. I would recommend walking across Chain Bridge on the way there or back or both ways, as the views from the bridge are amazing. As are the views from Fisherman's Bastion. It really is a photographer's delight, both the actual bastion itself and the views over Budapest. Plus there are all sorts of other things to see and do once you get to Castle Hill. Probably worth spending at least half a day there.

Pretty views, nice neighbourhood nearby, look around. Our Big Bus tour stopped at the bottom of the hill so we enjoyed a walk up Castle Hill and to the Fisherman's Bastion at the top. I think there are also accessible bus routes that visit this location if you're of a local transport traveler, and a small train. However, I enjoyed looking around area - there are so cute shops and a lovely fountain on the hill up the Fisherman's Bastion. I suggest you allow a bit of time for visiting here. Take your time and go slow as it's likely to be filled to the brim with tourists and there is no point in rushing. Make sure that you take in the surroundings and admire other nearby buildings such as Matthias Church, which is a landmark in it's own right and possibly one of the prettiest, over the top churches I've ever seen. If you want to get in side I think the ticket office is on the other side of the street, not actually by the church - but anyway. Once you're at the Fisherman's Bastion be sure to take some obligatory tourist snaps, and get climbing! The top offers stunning views over Budapest, featuring some of the main landmarks. You can get stunning photos and it's the place to go for a view, for sure. There's also a small cafe, and various ice cream shops just across the road if you're there for a snack. Plenty of shade if you want to sit down and rest your legs, but there isn't much else to do. Also, it's not actually a castle - It makes for a stunning view when viewed close up, below, or from a distance. Looks like a real 'Disney' castle.
One of the best views. Visited here in Feb. Take the escalator if you want to save your legs! The views across the city are stunning!
The view. Standing there and looking over Budapest...really worth it!The atmosphere is historially and the landskape amazing. Must place to go.
Beautiful. a must see in Budapest. Lookout, architecture, carhedral, dining and shops. One of the highlights of all of Budapest.

Stunning!. I visited on a very snowy day. Although the views were slightly hindered by the fog it was still a fantastic viewing platform to see right across the city, especially the parliament buildings. Definitely worth a visit!

Amazing View. The bastion is located on top of the Buda Castle Hill, the panoramic view is totally breathtaking, no matter it is night or day. The bastion is open all day, and YAY, it is for free, at least almost all balconies, but doens't matter, you can take perfect photos from there. U can see the Parlament, the Danube River and the Pest side of Budapest. Enjoy and take some photos to register your time there.

Stunning views. This is well worth a visit. You can get a bus or train up to the top. The views of the Pest side of the city are really stunning. It is worth spending an hour or so taking in the scenery. It was a highlight of my trip.
Must see. A lot of tourists, of course, but definitely worth a visit. Great view across the river to the Pest-side (great view to the beautiful parliament building).

Peace and Life. In the heart of Buda is waiting a beautiful view to the Danube and to the Pest side, in every season. From the bastion you can see the St. Stephan Basilic, The Parliament, Margharet-island and other monuments. You must see this part of the capital if you are in Budapest. Located close to other important monuments also as The Royal Castle, Matthias Church, The Funicular and finally the beautiful, historic- and medieval town with his lovely winding, streets, with excellent resturants where you can taste the tradicional hungarian dishes.
Fifty yeara Birthday. Fantastic experience. marvelous staff. Restless views from the terrace, where we had a delicious meal throughout the evening until long after the sun went down
Great Views. Must be the best view of Budapest from here, nice place to visit one of the top tourist attractions, we had hot Mulled wine at one of the cafes & just relaxed.
Intresting place why this place is remembered. You will get nice photos and atmosphere up on this edge of the bastion. A panoramic view of the 2 cities and great history of the place.

great views. From panoramic views across the Danube to Pest to a short walk up to the Castle district of Buda this area can get a little overcrowded during the tourist season, but is well worth it. I enjoy the sights early in the morning with a gentle Danube mist or later in the evening with the lights on the Bridges, Parliament and other sites giving a somewhat drab Pest some atmosphere

My Favorite Spot in Budapest. We loved Fisherman's Bastion. Built for the millennial celebration of the Magyar arrival in the Hungarian basin, this place is marvelous. There is no real purpose for the buildings, in fact, never has been. They are just there to look pretty, and they do a good job of that. If you've got the energy, be sure to climb to the top at the north end. No need to pay to go to the top level (like you see at the south end). There is a little restaurant tucked into the bastions, but it was closed while we were there (late afternoon). Just as well. The view of the Parliament Buildings is excellent. It is humbling to think the amount of work that went into creating these stone structures back in 1896 before cranes and backhoes.It is definitely worth mentioning that the Fisherman's Bastion has the best bathrooms! And they are free. Go towards the north end (furthest away from Matthias Church) and look for a stairwell leading down. One floor down and you'll get to use the nicest, free public restrooms you've ever seen.
wonderful panorama. Very nice place on the side of Buda hill, with a wonderful view of the Danube and Pest. Just a bit overcrowded...

superb views. This place is beautiful to wander and is right next to Matthias church. The views are stunning. We stopped off at one of the turrets and had a cold (rather expensive) beer. Well worth the walk.

A good viewpoint. Having taken the funicular up castle hill to Buda Castle. We had a gentle strole to the Fishermans Bastion. Nearby is the statue of King Steven, the fishermans church with it's colourful roof and the Marzipan museum. You can pay to walk along the top of the bastion wall, from where you get a fantastic view over the river to Margret Island, the Parliament building, the chain bridge and over the city of Pest

Breathtaking. My friends and I were here in the early morning and night. It was so breathtaking. We are able to see the whole city from up here. Try to go early to get pictures without other tourists! The place starts to get really crowded after 10am.

Like a real life fairy tale castle. Stunning and wonderful. Even dressed in jeans and trainers I felt like Cinderella. Lots of other tourists but that does not spoil the beauty of this location. Stunning views and a stunning building in itself. Photographs can't do it justice.
Great Views. Great views across the river over to Pest. Be prepared for a lot of steps in general if you walk up to the area. Fabulous architecture.

you just have to. If you're at Budapest, this place is a must-go, the view of the city is marvelous from here. The bastion itself is a pretty place too, I loved running around inside as a kid. It's not free of charge, but as the view really is amazing, I think it's worth it. If you like that kind of sightseeing, I'd also recommend to walk down to the riverbank from here.
Best viiew in Budapest. On top of Buda hill (across the Danube), worth the travel/climbBeautiful scenery, beautiful view, highly recommended

High point of any visit to Budapest. The views of the Danube river, the Parliament Building, Margaret Island, and the bridges of Budapest are gorgeous. The site of the highest part of the old city's walls, Fisherman's Bastion, on Castle Hill, provides the best postcard view of the Blue Danube River flowing through Budapest. The bastion is large enough so that it requires care and maintenance (in the Middle Ages this area of the wall was defended by the Fisherman's guild). The architecture with seven Cinderella towers, one for each tribe in the Magyar Confederation of 830 AD that participated in the "land taking," is beautiful and majestic, like the grounds of a castle. The bastion is right next to the Mathias Church whose steeple can be seen from the Pest side. The view and the convenience of the bastion are well worth the entrance fee which includes maintenance of the building and regulation of the flow of people who are admiring the view at any one time. In more ways than one, Fisherman's Bastion is a high point of any visit to Budapest.

Beautiful view!. The Fisherman's Bastion offers a beautiful view of Pest, especially the Parliament building and the chain bridge. I highly recommend for anyone looking for a picturesque spot. The church nearby is beautiful as well!
Great photo vantage point. Definitely visit this site if you're looking for great photos of Budapest. My husband and I went near sunset and got some of the best photos from our entire trip.
Beautiful place !!!. The place is accessible by foot from the main hotelsAmazing panoramic view of the cityAnd the place itself is so beautifulWorth a visit

Hidden in Plains Sight. There is a tower at the top of the Fisherman's Bastion that you will see but you might not realize that there is a small café underneath the top turret. There is also a walkway around the river-side of the café which has great views of the river in both directions. We like to go up there at least once on a visit to Budapest to sit and sip either a glass of beer if the weather is warm or a hot mulled wine if not. When it's cold there are heaters turned on so it is usually comfortable to sit there. Even if you do not have something at the café it's worth going up and through it to the other side just for the views. Most of the people simply do this.

Nice building and nice view!. It is really beautiful located in the heart of the old city of Buda. Really lovely and a wonderful example of the Magyar architecture. Very nice view of the river Danube and Pest on the other side. You can easily find somewhere to eat and drink but the prices are higher than anywhere else in the city
Good view!. I like this place very much! Such beautiful view on the other part of city. Especially at night! Very nice!

In love with Budapest !. As the old and wise man stands above the right side of the river Danube, looking at the Chain Bridge and across on the other side of the river at the Parliament, great and romantic place with huge history. One of must see things !

Beautiful views. This is a magical spot to look out over Pest.Best to come just as the sun is setting to see the city in day light and then how magical it becomes as the night descends and the city lights come on.
Fisherman's Bastions. Nice panorama, good photographic possibilities. Restaurants expensive. While climbing up is a hard walk, the downhill walk will benefit you
Nice views over Pest. very touristy full of coach parties etc. it has nice views over Pest. It's a spectacular building but that's it. I did not get a sense of history or culture
beautiful point. great to see the city from above the Danube and the whole complex is very special. walk around and you'll find great local places to eat

Loved the Panoramic Views. We loved the panoramic views from here and got some great photos. This is one of the top attractions in Budapest for good reason. The Fisherman's Bastion has 7 turrets that represent the 7 tribes that founded Budapest. It was built from 1895 to 1902. Be sure to pick a clear day to visit so that you can enjoy it to the fullest.

mixed feelings. as a local: great "building",estonishing surrondings, best location for panoramic view of the city. but taking "entry" fee and allow there "below the level" sellers... we can't be so desperete or greedy.this is one of the key locations in this beautiful city, should have remained free for anyone for forever...

Views amazing. The building is lovely, very clean looking. The views from there are fantastic, you can see down the Danube at the different bridges and a great view of Parliament. Glad I visited whilst there.
Best view ever. You can't go to budapest without going there and take the best pictures you could get.honestly if you don't go it will be like you have never been in Budapest
Wow....... This is very much a must for anyone visiting this Incredible and Amazing vibrant city,The view of Budapest from this point is Awesome, a great spot for photo's and memories...

Well worth it.. We found the visit to the Fisherman's Bastion to definitely be well worth it. We first caught a view of it from our hotel, and wondered what it was because it looked so unique. The view from the bastion is wonderful, and affords a lot of photo opportunities. Definitely put this on your must visit list....you won't be disappointed.

Beautiful views. the fishermans bastion has great views of the city both at night and during the day. It is a must if visiting the city! I would suggest to go early in the day to avoid the busy times when there are lots of tourists trying to take pictures/get their picture taken.
Lovely Views. Near the castle, this old-world bastion gives fantastic views of the city below. Make sure to stop by and take some pictures or just take in the view from this hilltop location.

Great view over bud. Must do if in Budapest , great views of the river Danube and the city, make sure you have plenty of battery life on your mobile, mine ran out from all the photos I took, hint beware of the mulled wine we got from a stall on the square, I was half cut after a few sips,but was so nice had to finish it off. You can walk up the steep hill or you can take a lift on rails up for about £1.50.
Amazing Views. Buda was very pretty and worth a visit, but quite deserted and lacking atmosphere (probably because a lot of the buildings are empty, so not many people around)
