Need see. If in Budapest, make sure this is part of your trip. If you have 1 day in Budapest, this should be part of the day.

Views. Based on the Castle District. Well worth a trip up , lots of steps but also can use the hop on hop off bus. Excellent views overlooking the Danube etc. small cafe at the very top . Toilets available, take some change with you to pay. Castle District is a great place to visit.
Extremly nice!. Forgetable view! Wonderful church, enjoyable walking and cultural feeling! Herendi porcelan and Ruszvurt cake was fantastic!
Disneyland?. This looks a bit like Disneyland but commands wonderful views over the Duna and Pest side. Probably the best view of Parliament.

Romantic place with a beatiful view. I have visited Budapest in autumn and in winter. The bastion is just great for a walking tour, great pictures, also a good meal in the nearby restaurants. In winter with snow, during the holidays, was the best.
Amazing. Great area to visit in Budapest. It's amazing itself and has great views over the city, the river and parliament.
Panoramic view terrace. The beautiful Fisherman’s Bastion, with its panoramic terraces, is the perfect place to enjoy amazing views of Budapest. Among Budapest top attractions.

Like in a Disney fairytale and great spot for panoramic pictures. The romantic bastion from the "Belle Epoque" is one of my favorite sites in Budapest. You feel like in a Disney fairytale structure with white stairs and towers. A landmark of the city and a "must see". Every time I visit Hungary I have to stop here. Great photo opportunities with panoramic views of Budapest and the Danube. It is also great to visit it by night and admire the lights of the city.TIP: It is one of the best spots to look at the Parliament building, another well-known landmark of Budapest.Another good thing is that the Bastion in near another excellent historical objectives, like the statue of Saint Steven and the great Gothic Matthias Church.At the bastion you will also find an elegant restaurant with a terrace and sometimes live cosy music. The view from the tables is one of a kind, but it is a little pricey in comparison with other places in the city where you can get something to eat or drink.

The place to see a beautiful city. There are many aspects of Budapest that are breath-taking, but for me this was the best. Spread out below you lies the majestic Danube and the Parliament building, which has to be one of the most perfect pieces of architecture I have ever seen, plus the Basilica dome in the centre of the city. However, it is at dusk that the buildings come to life with subtle and compelling lighting reflected in the river. We chose to buy a 48 hour ticket in advance on the 'hop on, hop off' bus, which proved to be excellent value because it included a river tour and a night bus tour and although local public transport seemed excellent and apparently cheap, I found the currency with its very large numbers a little difficult to gets to grips with for a short stay.

A place where you can smell history.. This place is the hart of this historian city, in every corner you can see and feel the history.now there are some cafes and restaurants some of them facing the river Danube whith a wonderful seeing.

like a lot of sites to Visit it is must do. A great deal of history ,if you didn't visit you would never find out ,on the way up we were told of the poor church elder that displeased the locals so the rolled him down the hill in a barrel that had been punched full of nails barbaric but effective. That side of the river has great history & if you didn't visit you would never know. If you enjoy walking its a good hike up
Great view!. It's really worth going here and checking out the view over the city! As well as the palace of course!

Oustanding view!. What else to say except - AWESOME!Must see. This plays gives you an opportunity to see the whole Pest and part of Budim (Budapest = Budim + Pest for those who are not familiar).On the top of the hill, right next to Fisherman's Bastion you'll find beautiful Matthias Church.Highly recommend!

FANTASTIC PLACE TO EAT. Place is at the top of Buda overlooking Duna and all city. The place is so beautiful that you must visit once when you go to Budapest even if the food is not fantastic. I must say we could not find a fantastic food in any place in Budapest except a street hamburger with beer. Having a dinner in this place would be unforgettable with a fine wine.

The Fisherman's Bastion. The Fisherman's Bastion is situated on the Buda side of the city, above the Danube with a lovely view back towards Pest.It is a bit of a walk but worth it for the views themselves. In the warmer weather it attracts locals playing their instruments and busking which adds to the atmosphere. It is a nice leisurely place to enjoy the views and the vibe of the city.

Fabulous view of river, Parliament, etc.. This is one of the highest spots in the city so you get an excellent view of the Pest side. Many of the ads for Budapest are photographed from this bastion. Worth the long hike up from the river, or take the bus. (We took the bus up but walked down; a nice walk if not too hot.)It's right next to an incredible church, Saint Matthias which is well worth a visit. And it's walking distance to many other places worth touring. There are restaurants up here and they sell fast foo too so plenty to eat. The Pest side is fine but the Buda hill around the bastion is much nicer ... not a typical crowded city scene.

view from Castle Hill. did not go close to the Bastion since this was part of a tour and there was not a lot of time. Admired it from castle hill. recommend going closer and spending more time if you can.

The views are fantastic but there is so much more on the hill. In its own this is not all that great - the views of the city are spectacular but the best experience is tho start at the castle end and wander along to this attraction, taking in the Matthias Church and the many beautiful buildings and ruins in the area.There is a fee in summer at some times but free in winterIf you descend at this place you can follow your nose down the sets of stairs and will end up at a rail/tram stop where you can catch the metro red line across the river as your legs will be a bit tired after the hill.

The views are fantastic but there is so much more on the hill. In its own this is not all that great - the views of the city are spectacular but the best experience is tho start at the castle end and wander along to this attraction, taking in the Matthias Church and the many beautiful buildings and ruins in the area.There is a fee in summer at some times but free in winterIf you descend at this place you can follow your nose down the sets of stairs and will end up at a rail/tram stop where you can catch the metro red line across the river as your legs will be a bit tired after the hill.

Disney like. Highly Recommended for views across river. It can be a bit of a hike getting up to this part of Budapest - I recommend taking a tour so that you will have transportation and a guide to point out all of the major sites across the skyline.The Bastion itself is quite magical take a drink in the small cafe with views over the river and all the magnificent buildings on the other side of the river.

Just beautiful! . Lovely (but steep) walk up and just the most stunning views - it's beautiful! We walked up to the Fisherman's Bastion and then across to the National Gallery via a hot chocolate stand! Definitely recommended, it's so lovely!
Beautiful view... so good I proposed :). Enough said :) Great walk back down too, very picturesque indeed. There was some building work going on but it didn't detract.

Great Views. It is compared to a Disney creation in that it is all castellation and spires like the Disney logo (though I thought that was 'mad' King Ludwig's castle), and in reality it was all destroyed in WWII. However, the views are incredible
stunning views. Lovely restaurant with superb views of Danube and the city of pest. There is a coffee bar too which is lovely to sit and watch the world go by

Disney-like building with some view. Impressive architecture of the building, breathtaking view on the other side - fantastic to see the Parliament; we were lucky enough to be there on a sunny day and took a lot of great pictures. The only downside - it wasn't only our idea, was a bit crowded. But I would definitely add it to the must-see in Budapest.
Wonderful View of Budapest. Brilliant... If you visited Budapest, mark here as must be visit list! You may nearly see all landmarks from here.

Excellent view. Very nice atmosphere, we were lucky to have piano and that beautiful view of Budapest by night, the Danube and the Parliament on the other side :)One of the top "must see"s in Budapest!

Good food in atmospheric restaurant. Visited with a large group and enjoyed the food and service. The live music was entertaining but not too intrusive.Half of the group were seated at tables in alcoves with windows overlooking the lit up city. We missed out and 22 of were seated at a round table and missed out on the view and the possibility of talking to anyone other than immediate neighbours. All in all well worth the visit

Great views of Pest. From the Pest side, it appeared that the church and the Fisherman’s Bastion was the same structure; we were surprised when we walked around it how different it was than what we imagined. The views of Pest, including the Parliament, are wonderful. But just to set expectations, it is a walkway of fantastic views and a nice restaurant, not a visit inside a building.

Simply the Best Spot.. You cannot miss the "Halaszbastya" or Fisherman's Bastion.If you enjoy taking photographs like me, you will have endless possibilities to take amazing photos of the city, of the Danube and the surrounding buildings. You will see Budapest through the arches, you will be amazed at the Matyas Templom right beside it. You can see the close up view of the temple's roof top which is made of coloured tiles.You will walk up and down the stairs and be surprised at the beauty of the architecture of this place.When we were there, a lady was standing playing her violin on one of the small bridges. Her music filled our hearts, and made us feel welcomed.We witnessed an awesome sunset from there. Budapest and the whole sky looked as if it were made of gold.This place is a photographer's paradise.Also very romantic.
One of my favourite places in Budapest. One if my absolute favourite places in Budapest. Has that "disney castle" feel to it. Have a cuppa in the cafe looking out over the Danube towards Pest.
Enormous Attraction. Elegant, Graceful and unique. Give you a sense of tranquility with a wonderful panoramic view of the city

Beautiful spot!. We walked to the area, but were disappointed to see we needed to pay to walk along the elevated walk. So we walked away and were able to see a beautiful, comparable view without paying.

Beautiful view!. Going along the parapets and up into the fishermans bastion provides stunning views over the Danube to Pest. Gorgeous cafe/restaurant within the parapet(glass walls allowing for an amazing view while you eat or drink!!) is definately worth a visit....

Beautiful!. Beautiful scenery from the Fisherman's Bastion! Walking around you feel the history of the place or you feel like you've entered a Disney fairytale! It has some of the greatest views of the city!Next you can find Mattias church, another famous landmark!

Best view with coffee. - May 2013. We came here once for coffee on our last morning together before my girlfriend flew back home and I continued on to Romania. The views are extraordinary and we had a man playing the piano near us who paused when the church's bells began to ring. Get lost while walking around as that's the best way to really get to know a city.

Historic storybook castle with great vistas and accessible info. This beautiful white/grey stone storybook castle structure sits atop Buda Castle next to Matthias Church. Due to a family member being in a wheelchair we entered from the gated entry of Buda Castle as the Hungarian Royal Palace is located there. Only cars with permits can enter unless you have a physical disability. Your taxi or guide car will have to pay a fee. You can take public transportation (bus) to the lower entrance of Fisherman's Bastion (1895-1902) where there are many many steps to climb but you can also take the funicular which is wheelchair accessible but that will take you to the Royal Palace. There is also an entry fee for the lower part of the bastion where there is a chapel and cafe. The top of Fisherman's Bastion, the balcony area or upper area, which is street level is free and it is wheelchair accessible. There are cobblestones but they are manageable. The view is breathtaking of the Danube where you can watch the cruise ships and see the famous Chain Bridge. You can also see Pest (especially the Hungarian Parliament Building) and Gellert Hill. In the middle of the Bastion you can see the all seven lookout towers each representing a Hungarian tribe that settled the Carpathian Basin. This is great place for taking photos and to relax by sitting on the stoned arched walls and admire all the stone work (figures, walls, and towers). The Bastion is close to Matthias Church (which has a ramp on the side closest to the Bastion) with its great architectural design, impressive bell tower, and colorful diamond patterned roof tiles. Free for those in wheelchairs. Close to the church and in front of part of the Bastion is the large bronze statue of King Stephen I mounted on a horse (1906). We were also told we were almost directly across (closer to the Parliament Building) from the very moving "Shoes on the Danube" Holocaust memorial site (2005). From Fisherman's Bastion it was a short walk to the Hungarian Royal Palace....with more cobblestones. There are many shops on the main street (most are not wheelchair accessible) but some cafes had outdoor seating between the two attractions.The sidewalks were paved and easy to navigate. There is much to see in this 2-3 block area and well worth a visit.
Bastion. Beautiful creature and one od the must visit points of budapest.you get great views over the city as extra bonus for visit.give it a go.
The point to see the Pest. This place is located on Buda bank. From here, you can see panoramic view of Pest, include the parliament.
beautiful stonework. The knights carved in stone here are amazing. The views of the city below are worth the visit. It's a unique part of the city & not to be missed.
Wonderful view. This is one of the must-visit places of Budapest. I really loved the view from here + the architecture and pure white colour of the monuments.
Astonishing atchitecture. We´ve never seen somethign similar like that, a must see for Budapest! Beautiful view above Budapest.
Stunning views. The best place to get views of the city and Parliament. Use the no 16 bus to get there and back for a couple of pounds

on walking tour. Good view of the city, learnt about it on the bus walking tour, good value as it was free!
It can get crowded up there as it's popular

Great place to visit !!!!. Wonderful views of the city
Took the bus tour (Hop on hop off )
We spent approx one hour in this area
Brian (Lancashire England)

A must go. This terrace is a must visit. It is situated atop the Castle hill which is a very nice area. It is exactly adjacent to St. Matthias Church. From here you can see the beautiful Danube, the Parliament and the Chain bridge among others. Access to the bastion is free of charge and one can go 24 hours a day, seven days a week. However, one must pay to go up the turrets. There is also a nice cafe there as well.

A movie and a panoramic view. The Bastion, the Matyas Church and the courtyard are a must-see, and the long walk from the street below to the Bastion is a must-do (don't just ride). It is the best place to have one's picture taken with the beautiful Parliament and the serene Danube River in the background.The main statue in the middle of the square and the statues guarding the entrance stairs reminded me of the keeper of the sacred chalice in an Indiana Jones movie. There is a grocery store at the corner before the Matyas Church courtyard. The souvenir stall across it (overlooking the church) has cheaper prices than the stores.

Stunning architecture and view over the River. This is a fantastic place to visit and a must see for visitors to the city. We walked along the river to the Chain bridge, crossed over and then got the cable car type lift set in the cliff face which took us to the top to explore a wonderful area with so many vantage points and interesting buildings. The Fisherman's Bastion as another reviewer has mentioned gives a magical feel a bit like Rivendale from Lord of the Rings, where you could easily picture characters from the film congregating. It is has a romantic charm which looks down upon the parliament building and the stunning buildings along the river. We were fortunate enough to enjoy walking around the area just in the last remains of daylight and then had a great views as everywhere started to get lit up adding to the experience. Nice place to enjoy a hot coffee / hot wine and marvel at the city below

Amazing view. The view from the top is amazing and for the ones who are going to be visiting in winter, there is bar with heats on, where you can rest and take nice photos of the Parliament and the Chain Bridge
Worth a look. This is essentially a viewpoint, albeit a very pretty one, right next to Matyas church. As one of the things to see in the Castle area it's worth a detour.
Like a fairytale castle. One of my top five favourite places in Budapest. Beautiful views of the city in magical surroundings. A must visit =)
Feels like Tolkien. A place to get a wonderful view of Budapest; it truly feels magical. A must see on your tour of Buda.
beautiful!. Took the number 16 bus from Pest to the bastion. It's such a beautiful place especially at night.do not miss visiting here. It was so nice my by boyfriend proposed here!
Amazing view. Lovely view from here.definitely a sight to visit while in Budapest.church was closed when I was there so was bit disappointing.

The touristy thing to do.. It is very touristy. Still, I liked wandering around. Beautiful architecture...statues and views over the Danube and the parlement building.
Spent about a good two hours here.

Good view of the city for those happy snaps. Top of the hill in the Fortess near the church. Good view and part of the fortress which has a number of restaurants and shops. Easy to get to by public transport. Take the tram to the end of the line and either catch the little bus up the hill or walk (steepish in parts but not difficult). Walking up the hill lets you see a few little galleries that have set up along the route.Also close to the military museum and underground hospital. A good place for views across the city.Bastion itself will only be a short stop and look, but allow at least a couple of hours for walking around and seeing the church and craft shops and galleries. More time if you go to the Military Museum or Postal Museum which is also nearby in the fortress.Walk to the north wall of the fortress to see the rest of the city and the hills. The Underground Hospital is under the North Wall and open Mondays.

Not to be missed!. The picturesque Fisherman's Bastion should be on the top of everyone's must do list when in Budapest! The fort can be seen from the opposite side of the river and you can enjoy a nice walk across chain bridge up through the streets. The view from the fort is breathtaking. We stopped off for a mulled wine in one of the turrets of the fort, which had been converted into a little café. From here you could look down across the rest of the city. The cathedral within the Fisherman's Bastion was also worth a visit and unlike any other Cathedral I've been to in Europe, with its ornate painted stone walls.

Great view from Buda to Pest. We were a little confused by the location and thought this was a separate attraction. Mourns out its actually right next to Matthias Church - almost looks like part and parcel. Take a walk up the ramparts and turrets for an incredible view. Just beware of the crazy violin guy and the guy in medieval costume hassling you for photos and money.
Beautiful view from Buda to Peste!. Beautiful view from Buda to Peste but try to go when the weather is nice because I've visited in a raining day and the view was not so nice
Beautiful. This monument is beautiful, unfortunately I was there in one of the busiest moments of the year! a must for visitors in Budapest!

Fantastic views of the city. After a very long walk around the Pest side of the city we crossed over the stunning Liberty Bridge to the Buda side to visit the castle & Fishermans Bastion. Unfortunately the vernacular railway was not in operation so we climbed to the top and made our way, via the castle, to the Bastion. The views of the Danube and the other side of the river are breathtaking and well worth the visit. It was quite cold but we snuggled under blankets provided by a cafe in one of the turrets and sat drinking hot mulled wine looking out at the view. It was one of those moments in life that you know you will never forget :-)
Best view of the city. Sheltered from the sleat , wonderful views of the city and mulled wine available to warm the cockles

A castle in the sky!. taking photos especially at nights gives it more character. Its like a castle in the sky. i just dont like all the stairs to go up. Although once were on top we discovered theres a bus that stop outside St Matthias Church..ngiii!
tourist area. It was a lovely place but the small restaurants are a bit mediocre. An interesting place and a must see. Go up by the venicular railway, it is an experience

Fishermans Bastion. If you are in the Castle District, you cannot miss it. If you are taking photographs, don't miss the views over the City through the archways. Try the cafe above a supermarket about 50 yards away.

Not to be missed!. Gorgeous columns and history behind it. Stayed there from afternoon till the sun set and it got dark. Highly recommend anyone visiting the bastion does so- the views of Pest and the parliament from the hill are gorgeous in both day and nighttime when the lights on the bridge and the city come on- not to be missed!

Beautiful!. Amazing architecture. Great views over the river and the Pest on the other side. Lovely little cafés and restaurants nearby. And lots of history here to learn about. A must visit when you come to Budapest!

More to this than I thought. From the photos I'd seen of this prior to visiting, I was expecting a single tower. Boy was I wrong. This place is amazing! Much bigger than I thought, and despite the freezing rain was intriguing and beautiful, with stunning views out across the city. Definitely worth checking out. Will be returning when I'm next in Budapest.

Less than expect, but must see !. This Medieval design Bastion is close to ST. Matthias church with 7 towers represent the 9 Magyar tribes that settled in the Carpathian Basin in 896.But looks like a decoration more than something Original.Offers very nice Panorama to the Pest part and you can take very nice picture it you were lucky to have a Sunny day.So try it but not expect so much and just enjoy.

Beautiful. Like most of Buda this is a beautiful building and you get great views over the Danube and Pest. Theres a few characters here, I got to hold a Harris Hawk with a dandy chap wearing red velvet breeches!
better at night. its very nice and near matthias church the view is amazing and it better by night when its all lit up and there is a small market near by for antiques but be careful about the prices
wedding anniversary trip. it is well worth walking up the hill to visit the Bastion.The views are spectacular and worth having a drink outside.

Very unique . The bastion gives a great view of the city; especially of the parliament building. There is very much a Disney feel here: the spires look like something from a fairy tale. Definitely spend some time to soak up the view here. There is nothing quite like it.

Beautiful turrets and beautiful views. After a good walk (you can take the funicular) this beautiful "castellation" is interesting and beautiful and looks a bit like a fairytale castle section.It is right next to St Mattyas church which has amazing tiled roofs and if the weather allows there are endless photo opportunities. It's also free!

Less than expected. We were told this was amazing and very beautiful. Well it wasn't at all that spectacular. In fact, seeing it from the Pest riverside at night is much better. The view is very pretty. But that's all.
Beautiful views. This is right next to our hotel so we're quite lucky. Beautiful views at night and just like something out of a fairytale when it snows. Definitely my favourite of the trip.

Great view of the city. Fisherman's Bastion provides the best view of the Pest side of the city. You can get a great sunset view from here but there is a great view in the morning as well when there are much less people. It is very near many of the attractions on Castle Hill.

fantastic view of Pest. It was very cold so our stop was brief but the views were fantastic. We had hoped to return when the weather was a bit less frigid but we ran out of time. If we're ever in Budapest again this will be on the must-do list.
Amazing views. Situated on castle hill, wonderful architecture and fantastic views down to the city and river. An absolute must visit location.

Fantastic spot. This is a must visit for any visitor to Budapest!
Spectacular views over surrounding areas, perfect opportunity to get some great photos.

Lovely place to visit.... Lovely place to visit even when it is pouring down with rain. The ramparts are beautifully carved and the view over the city is amazing! The area around the bastion is very pretty.
Mesmerizing. I was overwhelmed by the beauties of Budapest, but the Fisherman's Bastion and the views from it - definitely nb. 1 spot in Budapest for me.

Historical interest and great views. This is well worth a visit - in fact a 'must see' if you are in Budapest. Looks out over the lower-lying 'Pest' part of the city and you can see everything from here. We visited twice in two days and will go back when we are there later this year.

Great to see. i went here on January 22nd and I walked around it for free. Some people have said they had to pay but I didn't... Don't know what that's about. Nevertheless, it has great views and nice, romantic opportunities... You will get good pics here too. This is also part of the the whole Castle Hill area. You can kill two birds with one stone here. I think the view of the Parlament building is probably the best from here too.

Don't miss it. The entire area has a number of places to see and visit and the hill is fun to poke around. Sit at The Fisherman's Bastion to relax and take in the wonderful view of the city it provides.
Great views. A truly wonderful building with exceptional views across the river of Pest. We visited at dusk so there was not that many people around.

Must visit on a clear day!. best views of teh city! Make sure you visit on a clear day as you can see far. Stunning views of the Parliament. There is a cafe in one of the towers and there is beautiful view. No entrance fee. There is usually some street musicians playing and it adds to the atmosphere.
nice to walk around. it is a very nice place to walk around ... nice view, nice church. combine it with a visit to the palace of Buda.

Not worth the price of admission. A good view of the river and the city but costly to do it. Better to do late at night when the crowds have left and usually there is no one taking tickets . You can usually walk right up if its really late.

Panoramic city views - would have looked better with blue skies!. Great to wander around some of the eight turrets (the ones you can get to), that provide numerous photo opportunities. It's a shame that some of the best spots are cordoned off for customers paying over the odds for mulled wine. The views over Budapest are spectacular, even on a very grey day. The church's tiled roof is magnificent. We didn't pay to go inside (this is not included in the Budapest City Card). Oh for some blue sky! Next time...

Picture perfect. Beautiful place. Stunning location and the views from here are amazing. We ended up visiting here every single day of our trip and were blown away by how wonderful it was each and every time

Lovely place. A bit crowded. One of my favorite places in Budapest. It is so unique. White walls and little towers make the silhouette unforgettable and immideately attracting attention from every angle you look at it. The bastion itself opens great view to Pest side of the Danube. St Mattias church nearby doubles the velue of the visit. The only downside, the bastion is usually pretty crowded, but that testifies how good this place is.
World Class Spectacle!. Gorgeous view on top of a walt-disney like castle overlooking the city of Budapest. Show up EARLY or LATE, or be prepared to utilize a selfie-stick to get a decent picture!

Stunning, especially in the off season!. The views from this fairy tale 'castle' built as part of the 1896 Hungarian Millennium celebrations are breath-taking. Built atop a hill in Buda, it offers commanding views of Pest, the Danube, and much of Buda. The many towers and ramparts provide quintessentially photographic opportunities. A must see for any visiting Budapest for any length of time-- especially when less crowded in the off season!
Beautiful . Also another great place, with stunning view, actually the entire city in a huge open air museum. Lovely, lovely.. Worth the sacrifice to go up :)

A great tourist view point with history. The bastion has great views across the river and provides a great backdrop for pictures. also the architecture and small eating establishments nearby are also very good.

great view. located next to buda castle, you may take the funicular and visit buda sactle first,then go to fisherman bastion, what a great view! there are ice cream store near the square, the ice cream was delicious!!
Beautiful. Veru central, historical area of the city! Lovely experince, good food (a bit overpriced, yet great) and amazing view of the city!

Spectacular Artitecture. Beautiful and spectacular attire tire with interesting history. The St. Stephens Cathedral is also a place well worth visiting. Within easy walk to the old palace. A very enjoyable walk around indeed with lots of good spots for photography lovers!
Beautiful Views. We got our best photos from this vantage point. Great shots of the Parliment on the Pest side. Well worth the walk and climb.
Impressive. Impressive monument, spectacular view! Definitely worth a visit! A great place to take photos of Budapest from!
my number place in Budapest!!!. This has to be my number one place in Budapest! i have seen pictures online before and was not disappointed at all about the view and the building! A must go place!
Great view of Budapest. In the highs of Buda you'll have a panoramic view of Pest and the Danube river. It's a breathtaking view and you can sip a coffee there while watching the tourists go by,

Beautiful. After climbing with funicular we take a little walk to St Mattias church and Fisherman,s Bastion. We do not expect nothing special but when you come near and look over the Danube at whole City and parlament it is really amazing. Try to choose sunny day to get there. we were at winter time but it was full sunny day and it was amazing.
Great views.. Good place to get a feel of the layout and scale of the city. Much colder here than lower down ( in winter) so wrap up well.

Unforgettable. This restaurant and the view are spectacular. The finest in the city, I'm certain. Our wonderful concierge, Laront at Le Meridien, said this would be the perfect (and it was!) to celebrate a birthday.The food is as haute cuisine as you'll find in Budapest, but still really delicious anyway (esp if you enjoy foie gras). I love the mushroom, liver, and duck dishes in Hungary, and every course I ate here was yummy yummy yummy. The kind waiters and wonderful musicians made the entire experience really unforgettable. They made it a special birthday to remember for our aunt. Pictures cannot do this place or the views justice. We took plenty, but the beauty of this place is something to behold. Unforgettable. Ps- try to purchase a cd from a gypsy band from a favorite restaurant because it's a great souvenir that you can actually use.

What a place to ring in the New Year!. Actually its the church (St Matthews) that does the ringing! Right behind you on the edge of Buda, high up above the river Danube.Here the world and his wife, (but mainly of the Hugarian kind its good to note) gather with glasses and bottles, children, grandparents, uncles and aunts and all, to see in the New Year in style.Perched on the edge of a great cliffe the ramparts and their arches provide the perfect spot to get a bird's eye view of what goes in in Pest, and for miles around, at midnight.The municipal authority unlike those in many European cities does not put on a firework display of its own, but lots of communities, town areas and individuals do. Here is the prime spot to adjust your direction of view and see them all. During quiet periods you have the additional advantage of being able to gaze at the flood-lit Parliament building in all its gothick splendour on the far side of the Danube. Peckish - then have a sausage or snack from the kiosk too.For the well-healed you could do all this in style from the interior of local Hilton that shares the view. But if you want an authentic Hungarian occasion then join the masses on the Bastion and the sweeping staircases below to celebrate yet another year. You might even learn some Hungarian, even if its only 'cheers'!
Best views of Budapest. It is imperative to visit the Fisherman bastion. The best views of Budapest!!You can take the 105 bus in Andrassy street.

Great View - Overpriced Drinks. After visiting Buda Castle, we walked up to the top of Fisherman's Bastion at sunset on our last day in Budapest. There is quite a lot a steps to get up there, however once up there you have an amazing view over the city with great views of the Parliament House. There are plenty of spots to admire the sunset and an equal number of photo opportunities as well. The best view is from Fisherman's Bastion Restaurant with a Terrace at the top of one of the Turrets, however not only was the young barman a bit incompetent but the drinks were massively overpriced costing 6800 HUF for 3 beers! Not to mention the weird red lighting..Worth a visit but wouldn't be heading back in a hurry!

Romantic buildings and view from Buda side. This building is next to Matthias Church.The architecture is quite unique and romantic.It reminds you to the castle story in the past.The view of river and other side of Pest is quite amazing as well from this place.Bring your camera to take pictures on this place.
Breathtaking Experience. It was such breathtaking looking at the view on the other side of the river. You have to be there to experience" the feel "for words cannot describe it.

Much better then expected. My buddy and I took the day trip from Vienna to Budapest and I wish we had two maybe three days to explore but had to do it in a day. The. It's is clean and people are very friendly and many speak English. Walked throughout the city and saw St Stevens, the opera house and much more. I'd like to give a quick plug for the app. tripos. It guided me flawlessly and worked without an I tenet connection. Crossed the chain bridge and took the trolly up to the museums and the Bastion. Great shopping and dining too. Saw the changing of the guard and stayed to see the city lights at night. It was beautful. I will have to go back with the wife.

Near to St.Stephen's statue. Interesting that this was originally used for the fresh fish caught in the nearby Danube and sold locally, now not a healthy option like all city rivers. A magnificent building with great views over the bridges and Pest side of the city.
Like a fairytale... A nice place to be, vivid and romantic as well, with great views over the city. It surely deserves a visit.
Great Views!. My favourite part my whole trip...the views are just great! wish i could be there also during sunset and see the parliament with all its glory and lights!

a breath-taking view. It seems like a medieval building, but it was built at the end of the 19th century, when Budapest commemorated its thousand year old life, the millennium.From here you can see all Pest and the Parliament. The view is speechless.
go at night. such a beautiful place. more spectacular than the castle. A must see in Budapest! fantastic view of the Parliament here.
Great place to visit. Did a walking tour around Buda and the Fishermans bastion is a great vantage point for photos of Pest and the bridges. It is also a great photo shoot in its own right.

View over the city. A great place to view the Pest side of the city over looking the Danube River and the House of Parliment.
Great venue also for lunch or Dinner

Best Restaurant in Budapest. This is a restaurant/dining/sightseeing experience you can't miss if you go to Budapest. The service, food and location are definitely five star. We paid about $320 for four of us, but well worth it.
View of whole Budapest.. It is in the on side of budapest. You go up and you see the whole view of Budapest. Increadibly view, colors and design from middle ages. I defenitely recomend you!
Great vantage point. EXCELLENT place to see the beauty of Budapest! The Mathias church is right behind you and you can see over the river Pest and all its beautiful buildings.

Great Viewpoint. A must-do when visiting Budapest. This area had the best views of the city. It can be a bit of a hike getting up to this part of Budapest - I recommend taking a tour so that you will have transportation and a guide to point out all of the major sites across the skyline!

Beautiful attraction in an amazing area !. The whole castle district is full of history. Everywhere you go, you can sightsee over the whole city and enjoy in the same time the unique atmosphere of the city. This attraction is not so impressive itself, but located here, it becomes very special. There is an entrance fee for climbing up the bastion, but I don't recommend paying for this as there is nothing more to see there.. A must-visit in Budapest !!!

a romantic folly in limestone and turretry. This outdoes Disney in its frosted fairy tale of crenellated battlements and stairs and turrets. Would be an excellent setting for the first scene of Hamlet.slightly kitsch but atmospheric.great place to take pics of the Danube and the parliament and the chain bridge.especially at night.

Amazing. An amazing view.A very beautiful place, one can spend hours and enjoy the view. Drink hot wine and feel that you are in a fairy tale. Very beautiful and very impressive. Recommend to anyone to visit there.

The whole area is great. The whole area around the bastion is really great. Beautiful architecture and a nice view of the city. Probably the most expencive part when it comes to food an souvenirs, though.
Wow views. While it's a little Disney, the location is amazing and the views afforded incredible. The smiles on the faces, young and old, were a sight to see.

Great view, if you don't mind a million tourists.. Fisherman's Bastion is swarmed with tourists at every point thought the year. It's easy to see why, the view from up there of the city is absolutely phenomenal and allows for amazing photo opps. We took the tram to the bottom of the hill and walked up to it through the palace grounds, in which you can also see the changing of the guards. TIP: Bus no16 and 16A goes to the Fisherman's Bastion and you can use your BKK travel tickets on that if you don't fancy the walk. TIP: Take a croissant or something nice from a Pekseg (bakery) in the town before you venture up here, there are plenty of eateries, but they all have incredibly over inflated prices for basic food. Do yourself a favour and get something lovely from an independent in the VII district before you get into the horror of tourist-ville.

Breath-taking views from this terrace on Budapest. The Fisherman’s Bastion is located on the Buda hill, just behind the Matthias Church.It has been built, according to neo-Gothic and neo-Romanesque styles, at the end of XIX century, following the design of Hungarian architect Frigyes Schulek, same designer of adjacent Matthias Church.The purpose of the Bastion is to constitute a viewing panoramic terrace on the town; it’s connecting seven turrets, representing the seven tribe’s chieftains who settled-down Hungary at the end of 1st century.It seems that its name origins from the fishermen who lived just under the old town medieval walls, in the so called Fishtown, between the Danube and Buda Castle. Such people were spending their life by fishing and selling their fish in the old town; in case of any potential attack, once climbed to the old town walls, they were acting as a first defense against muggers.The panoramas from the Fisherman’s Bastion are breath-taking, especially on a sunny day, when the view is extending by kilometers.A stair, departing from the Bastion, allows to climb-down to the Danube bank in just 10 min; simply follow the direction to the river through alleys and narrow stairs.

Beautiful view of Pest. Budapest if full of beautiful pieces of architecture. Fisherman's Bastion is a fantastic structure with beautiful views of the city. Even in winter (we visited on the 4/01/2015) its a beautiful place to visit.Easily accessible by the the Castle Hill funicular. There is a reasonably priced restaurant and bar serving Hungarian food. We hid here to get out of the snowy-rain and had an amazing Goulash Soup and hot chocolate to warm us up. It provides shelter from the weather while you admire the view of the river and the houses of Parliament. It is surrounded but cute little Hungarian cafes, shops and buildings. The view is also amazing at night as it is lit by lights casting shadows over the building.
nice place with beautifull view. It was very nice place to see, you can from here see all budapest and i can recommend it to everyone its so beautiful.

Great views. It's a little hike up to the Castle Hill but nothing too difficult and there's a funicular railway or bus for anyone who doesn't want to walk. Once your at the top of the hill, the Fisherman's Bastion is both beautiful to walk around but has commanding views over Budapest. If you're a keen photographer, you do not want to miss a trip up here especially towards sunset.

A fairy-tale castle with a view. Do not miss this, especially if you like taking pictures! Fisherman's Bastion is up in the castle complex, so there's a good chance you'll find your way up here on a visit to Budapest. The covered walkways are all beautiful, and there are numerous small balconies and columns and arches which would make a fantastic background for any family or couples photos.Not to mention the view of the city on the other side of the river!The main "castle" is on the other side of the church, so don't forget to walk the whole length of the Bastion (it is not very long). At the top of the castle is a tiny cafe, nothing special, but the views from the balcony there of the whole front of the Bastion are worth dealing with the crowds up there.

So many things to see!. The seven stone pointy towers symbolize the huts of the seven Magyar tribe leaders who conquered the country also offer a great view. There is also the Saint Matthias church with the parisian architecture influences and the horse back statue of King Stephen, the king who brought Christianity to the country. Walk around it to find more museums and traditional markets!
Great views. Great views and a fantastic piece of design. Great way to see the city and well worth a walk up to see. Would recommend a bit of self exploration as opposed to an organised tour
Amazing view. It's was very cold when I visited but it was still worth it. Very beautiful and breathtaking view. A must place to see

Beautiful views!. If you're in the Buda side of the city, Fisherman's Bastion is well worth a visit. It doesn't really rank as a must-see on its own merits; BUT when coupled with other sights in the area, it's a wonderful addition. Our visit included: a stroll across the Chain Bridge; a funicular ride up the incline; a walk past the Presidential Palace (and a sad Trabbant, leaning into a gutter); a few purchases at several of the local shoppes; a tour of the beautiful Matthias Church; and finally, a stop at Fisherman's Bastion to get a great view of Pest -- and the Parliament, in particular. If you go -- bring your camera, your wallet (for the shoppes!), and a sturdy pair of walking shoes! Recommended!

Magical. Without a doubt one of the most magical and beautiful things I have ever seen in my life. Went in December and on route there it started snowing, when we got there it was dusted with snow and looked like something from a fairytale, expect it was real! Make the trip to see this, especially if it is snowing, you defo wont be dissapointed :)

Fairy tale-like. This is exactly as the photos depict it to be - a fairy tale-like structure with great views of the Pest side of town (and the Parliament). I would definitely recommend going here. Lots of stairs - not handicap accessible.

Not to be missed. This area transports you to the medieval age. Great views from here. Nice to walk around the area. Visit the Mattias Church. There are nice restaurants to sip coffee and relish the local pastries.

Interesting architecture, well worth a visit. This is conveniently located near the Castle, so be sure to visit both when going up to the Castle Hills. Theres plenty of magnificient views to the Danube, and the Bastion itself is an architectural art piece. I recommend going here.

Breathtaking Fairytale setting, but need help!. Gorgeous setting, it will take your breath away, however something went terrlibly wrong the night we were there. The way to bright lights, to the barely warm medicore food, to the waiter with the big attitude, 3 1/2 hours and still waiting for dessert. We did have a great bottle of wine however and the snow falling was magical. The very generous manager did compensate. Thank you for trying to make it right. There is no reason why this place should not shine.

A real gem. The Fisherman's Bastion is a beautiful piece or architecture, providing views out over Budapest. There is a cable car that goes up the hill, but the walk up is easy and avoids the queue for the cable car.
Like a fairy castle.. Well worth a visit. Amazing views of the city from the battlements. Lots of great photo opportunities.
Just like a fairy castle. What a view from the pointy towers! Well worth a visit and the photo opportunities of Pest are endless. There's a little cafe at the furthest tower too.
Interesting Place, good architecture & breathtaking Views!. Everything was excellent.....there was even an open air restaurant overlooking the Danube River and Budapest Downtown!

My impression of this place and the reality were a little apart. The archiecture and location on Castle Hill is outstanding. I thought the Bastion was going to be a big complex of walkways/overlooks and halls that appeared on the hill. you to have to pay to go into it and it is not as dramatic as I thought it was going to be from a historical or architectural perspective. Our tour group picture is in front of the horse statuary.
Great views. This must be one of the best views in Budapest. We were lucky enough to have bright sunshine even though the temperature was minus 12! Worth seeing

Beautiful Building. One of the most spectacular buildings I have ever seen. Reminds me of The Little Mermaid. So gorgeous to look at. You can go inside and walk around. Not ideal for people with heights as even I struggled at times with fear of falling over the edge. One of my favourite things in Budapest. It is like something out of a fairytale.

Great views. Perfect spot for photos, the parliament building view at night was worth the climb up the steps to get there. There is a cafe we didn't visit but would be a nice spot for coffee had it been warmer outside.
Simply breathtaking!. This place is a perfect combination of amazing architechture with the view of Danube river and the city. Definitely worth a visit.
Incredible views and architecture. Take the funicular up to the top of Castle Hill and turn right to go down to Fisherman's Bastion. Great views of the city by day and night and well worth a visit.
Amazing view!!!!. Great time by day or by night! Really a so beautifull view to Budapest! Verry nice walk on the hill.

Magical at Night. We were lucky enough to be staying at the nearby Hilton so managed to spend quite a bit of time here in the evening around dinner time when most other tourists had left the area. It's simply magical - like something out of Middle Earth! They light it up beautifully, but all the swirling staircases, the views over the city and the Danube, the turrets. Magical. You have to visit and my advice would be to go after it gets dark for the best experience.

Nice view. A nice view to the city panorama! When the weather is clear, you can see far distances and check the buildings and the layout of the city. Also part of the Hungarian history. A must visit if you are on the Buda side.

Excellent views across Budapest. Crossed the Danube to visit Buda and found this on the hilltop. With a little cafe inside as well it was perfect for a glass of wine and a bowl of goulash soup while looking out over the city. There was also a restaurant if you are fancying something a bit more upmarket

Fantastic views of the Danube. Fantastic views from the Fisherman's Bastion, which is is the castle district, it looks out over the Danube and the city. There is a very small cafe which serves wonderful hot chocolate which is much needed if you visit during winter. Don't miss this little gem, but be warned it can get very busy.

Has to be the best view in Budapest. High up the hill, on the Buda side of the Danube, is this wonderful, almost fairytale monument.Arches with fabulous views of the Pest side give the photographer in us some inspiration. Little towers, steps and balustrades - all extremely interesting.The Matias church with its amazing mosaic tiles roof stands proudly here also.The only downside are the other 'pests' not the town but the street vendors who cling to the visitor's side to sell or beg. The walk up here through the old town is very quaint and there are numerous cafes.

What a view!. Beautiful view of the river and Pest, the bastion itself is unique and inspiring (despite the hideous Hilton behind it, why?).We were here on New Years Day and it was absurdly crowded, I think because many museums and attractions were closed for the holiday.Still, a must-do as a tourist in Budapest.
Amazing!!!!!. This should be everyone's first place to see in Budapest. The views are wonderful and the Fisherman's Bastion and Matias Church are beautiful!
Fantastic views. Lovely views, worth the walk. Be sure to try the Kürtőskalács cake sold at nearby stalls. Lots of tourists here, you may need to be brutal to get to the front!

Beautiful views. Beautiful building.. The Fishermans bastion first caught my eye when me and my partner were walking along the river at night. It was lit up like a fairy tale castle. Very beautiful. We walked up to it the following day and it was well worth it. Fantastic views of Pest across the river, the parliament building stood out in particular.

Awful Eastern block service by Dora. We booked this for NY.Amazing venue and stunning views.We emailed DORA to make the booking and we asked for a good view of the Danube. Upon arrival we were seated next to the lavatory door at the back of the corridor. Useless DORA.When we asked to be moved it was too difficult and they promised us a bottle of champagne. They gave us a small glass of champagne and no bottle as promised for their mistake.We were asked to pay 78,000 (£210) (2 months in advance) which we did in November.They also said we could order anything on the a la carte menu and wine list. We were shocked and re iterated the conversation 5 times! In fact it got awkwark! When we ordered the wine and food and went to pay after we had eaten they told us our quoted had been exceed and we had to pay an extra 30,000 HUF (£20). Lol. Chinese whispers! You have to be extremely careful and confirm everything very carefully!
Stunning view of Pest from Buda. we arrived to the Fisherman's Bastion after having wondered around Buda. The views of the Parliament were breathtaking! Well worth a visit and it is free!

Nice place, good views. The Fisherman's Bastion is a very touristic place, which is not surprising, for its nice towers and walls to walk but specially for its views. Nice pictures of Pest can be taken from there, in particular of the parliament. I went twice in a couple of days as I loved the spot!

Breathtaking .... Beautiful environment in which to experience and enjoy the panoramic scenery of the city. Used the Big Bus Company to get here, which had a conveniently placed bus stop. Also took the opportunity to visit ST Matthias's Church.

Great views. We visited Fishermen's Bastion as part of an excursion where we walked across Chain Bridge, took the Funnicular up the hill and wandered around the Castle District. This is a great lookout point and was free (although very cold on New Year's Day). The whole Castle District was really cool and quite different to the Pest side of the city.

Not that family friendly. View is amazing, and worth a visit. quite touristy, but lots of little cafes, bars and restaurants dotted around the wall.As with most good outdoor tourist attractions, the walk up involved a long trail or multiple stairs.We walked from the Funicular to the top, which was really lovely but difficult with a baby in a pram.Worth going but would recommend catching the bus if you've got mobility issues.

Good views but crowded. Excellent views on good weather but the church ticketing system had problems and we were told its a new system. Although the que were not long we waited 15 minutes in -8 degrees. Hope this part can be improved!

Absolutely gorgeous in the snow. Came here on our first evening, felt like walking through the pages of a fairy tale story. Stunning views of the Chain Bridge and Parliament. The snow made it even more spectacular. Not to be missed!!

I thought it was a castle. I thought it was a castle or building, not a lookout point. Still amazing views. No charge. My favorite is the view of Parliament. Takes about 30min to snap all the pics and take in the views

Stunning views & Old Buda. This is the place to visit for stunning views of Budapest (Pest side), the danube and the bridges and obviously the parliment building, I visited over Xmas which was great and free but I believe they charge to walk the walls during summer peak periods which would stiil be worth it.Old Buda, The church, and nearby streets are lovely to walk around and surprisingly cheap to eat and drink around this tourist trap (£8 for 4 1/2 pints).You can walk from the centre of pest over the chain bridge, weave up the hill, spend a few hours up here, walk down over the Margret bridge and past the parliment building...what a lovely day.(Lot of uphill and steps)
Must see. This is really nice place with great view of Pest. Maybe the best Parliament view. Must see place in Budapest.

Nice view of the city. get there early! or be with the crowds. Lovely view of the city. the Mathias church is more interesting. the area of castle hill around it is very touristy. walk down the steps into the flat area of Buda next to the river for a quieter taste of Buda
Views of Pest are superb. Interesting historic monument/walkway with views overlooking the Danube and toward Pest and several of the bridges that cross the river. Worth a visit.
My favorite part of our vacation. Fisherman's Bastion was beautiful and the views spectacular! St. Matthias church was the highpoint of my trip to Prague and Budapest....absolutely lovely...

Worth a visit. Not much new to say about one of the most well known and most popular point in Budapest. This attraction is a must see, from where the whole city is visible, always full with different attractions, happenings around.The only draw back is that you have to pay an ammount which for the locals is a bit high.

Breathtaking view. A marvelous construction. And there is breathtaking panorama sight at the flat part of the city. It is a must for every tourist. And don't miss St Matias Church that is located here. It is very beautiful.

Fantastic views of Budapest. This is included in the Viking River cruise city tour and offers a great view from a very high vantage point. Its worth a few minutes to gain this overview of the city to understand the layout and change in topography. It was hazy so our pictures didn't do it justices.
Breathtaking views. Very pretty place to visit, we used the cable car to visit? We also watched the changing of the guards. A very interesting watch!
Another spectacular view. There is just so much to see and do. This area once again had the most awesome views. The Buda side of the River was very interesting to tour.

If you like Lord of The Rings, Welcome to Gondore!. This fortification in The Castle Complex on the Pest side of the Danube river is spectacular. It really looks like something out of a fantasy novel. It is hard to imagine that Kings and Queens once actually lived in this place. I haven't seen anything like it before. Our stay was incredible.

Go at dusk for an amazing view. We went right at sunset to get some amazing views of parliament from here. It was a great decision the city was kit up and magical. There is a lot of history in the area so don't kiss out on the other sites.

Beautiful in the snow!. We went here on our free walking tour and walked up via the road. The view across the river was fantastic. The steps to the bastion were covered in snow but not slippery however the flat, beige stone was very slippery so beware! We didn't go inside but walked around the nearby streets. Great food at Cafe Miro down side street behind the bastion.
Halászbástya. One of Budapest's key tourist attractions,it's a must see.Amazing place with such a vivid historical background.
Like a fairy tale. All those white towers, arches and steps... just like being in some fairy tale. Of all places in Bp you cannot miss this

Photo Spot. You can easily walk to the fisherman's Bastion without taking th Funicular. Access is free and since we went on boxing day, the place was not too crowded to get decent photos of the view of the river and of the Church( another plus point). Be prepared to take lots of photos and photos for other tourist!Sovenior shops nearby are pricer compared to the other shops in the main square at the Pest side or parliment building .
Beautiful place. We visited Buda castle and from there we walked 15-20 minutes to Fisherman Bastion. Very beautiful historical place.
A day is not enough. Loved this place! The views are awesome. You can just walk around and enjoy the atmosphere. To avoid paying for the toilet, go inside Hotel Intercon.
Fantastic views. The walk up there can be a bit tiring, but it's manageable.... There's a funicular like option, but the line was too long... It's next to st Mathias church also
Amazing views.. The views were really nice looking across to Pest. Be wary at the small market place that is near there. Some of our party had their credit cards maxed out there.

A view over Busapest. This is a vantage point from the Budda side of the river to look over to Pest
Nice enough views
No charge and a good vantage point
Fantastic viewpoint. A nice part of the Castle Hill attractions, offering great views across the Danube of Pest. A bit of a tourist trap but worth a visit for the views it offers.

Surprisingly one of my favourite "tourist" parts of Budapest. I loved the castle district of Buda, but this was probably my favourite part, with the turrets that look like they've been plonked there straight from a fairytale. A fantastic place to get some pictures, not least of the view across the river. We visited when it was less busy, so it was also quite peaceful. There are tourist "traps", yes, but it doesn't detract from the place and we weren't approached by anyone unlike in some European cities. Perhaps in summer it is more oppressive. If you only have a day in Budapest, this is one of the must-do attractions.

Best Views of Budapest. Awesome views across the river; the best is during sun set when everything becomes tinted with shades of orange and blue. Everything looks clean and polished, one of the reasons why Budapest is one of the most beautiful cities in Europe!

What A View. Stayed at the Hilton Budapest beside St. Matthais Church and was treated to the Fisherman's Bastion. The view was simply outstanding, overlooking the Danube River and all of the Pest part of the city.
Fairytale Turrets. Such beautifully architected turrets and walkway that have a magical quality. A haven for photographers and offering fabulous views of the Danube and Pest.

Incredible Views. Great views of the city! Definitely a worthwhile stop--right at Castle Hill, which is also a great place to visit. We picked up some embroidery there--not the highest quality, but reasonably priced compared to what was charged elsewhere.
Symbol of resistance. The seven towers reminds the world how few Fishermen bravely defended their site against the Ottoman Turks.it is a nice site for photos taken for Best from the high Buda

Great views to Pest in the night time.. Thsi is a beatiful area and the Fisherman's Bastion gives you a great view to the PEST part Budapest. Particularly in the late evening/night the Parliament house is like a gem in all its light.

Tourist trap. Lots of students and tourists clambering all over the edifice, which has commanding views over the Danube towards the Pest side. Very unusual building, worth a visit, but get there early!

A must see!!. Had such an amazing day here, so much to see, such amazing views, a must!!!!
The cafe at the top was reasonably priced with good food, goulash soup was delicious! We had a window seat with views to die for, would thoroughly recommend. A very relaxing coffee/refuel break.

Panoramic view . The place is atop a hill and the view of pest is awesome with the lake.. Quite often standing here one can hear the church bells ringing across buda and pest .. The cafe inside is a great place to sit and the music is good .. Overall a must see in ur things to visit

Wow!. Amazing view!! Amazing place to spend 2-3 hour, you can get up there by taking the bus no 16 from kempinski hotel in pest. You need to come only if the sky is clear.
Very special place, feel like in fairy tale.
Beautiful architecture. The architecture is amazing, plus the great views across the city make this a must visit whilst in Budapest.
well priced - great views. you must eat and see this - an ideal place for day time and evening - bit pricy compared but well worth it
Fisherman's Bastion. This Bastion is something worth to visit. I didnt like hotel Hilton inside. It is not fit in there. But anyway worth to see it :)))

beautiful view!. amazing view and architecture!!!
feels like you're in another time...
worth the visit the time spent :)
Magical. Wonderful views across the city. It's a bit like a set from Lord of the Rings and it's next to the most amazing church.

Clean and well preserved. Plenty to walk around in a lovely area, try the Verticular ride to it from Pest. The small cafe with hot chocolate on site contains a lovely setting and view. Great views to take pictures including the danube, house of parliament and the city, good at night too.
Nice. Was just beside our B&B. Nice area. The view on Budapest parliament from up there is breathtaking. Worth the detour.

Great Views. Best views of the modern city from this viewpoint. Must be one of the most photographed attractions in the Castle District. There is a very good restaurant operating in part of the building.The daytime views are so good but at night it really is special

Nice view and a "must visit"!. Take The bus, taxi or The gondol up to this nice place. Outside you can see Szent István, The First king Of Hungary. Nice view and a lot Of coffe places and restaurants around. Also visit The castle just beside.
Fab views and place to chill out. Great spot this, nice architecture and superb views of the city. Some places to chill including a cafe and ship or just sit outside.
old world. Very old world flavor in the midst of very historical builings. Lots of opportunities for good photographs
The Bastion. Love the Bastion. Great nightime view. It is unlike any site I have seen before. The architecture is wonderful.

Great photo spot. Great views from this area, and just next to another two major attractions of Budapest: the Matthias Church and Buda Castle. Watch out for pickpockets - since this is a very popular site with tourists there may be a few lurking around (almost had someone from our tour group pick pocketed). If it is not drizzling/misty, you may want to go at night - the views are even more amazing than during the day.

Magnificant Views!. From this rampart there are beautiful panoramic views over the Danube to Pest. On a clear day, you can literally see for miles from this viewpoint. The Chain Bridge cuts Pest in half with the Parliament Building, embassies, banks, etc.on the left side and the commercial center of Pest to the right. The rampart itself is another result of the 1896 Hungary birthday celebrations and has no real historic significance. But don't miss this structure while you walk through Buda.
Tourstic but too many tourists. Although this place was very beautiful, it was obviously a touristy place and it seemed as though everybody in Budapest was there - a must see kind of place.
views fab. views, bulidings easy walking you can walk all way round and then walk down The Danube and views are fab
OH THE VIEW. It is so nice here, just to walk around and sit look at Danube river and all city like on your palm. Oh what the view, priceless.........
A superb view from here over the Danube. It was well worth the visit to the Palace area of Budapest with so much to see, especially the view from this Bastion.

Fab views!. We enjoyed our visit ! The views on the day we visited where great - the day was sunny and clear. The Bastion has steps up to tthe viewpioints, but the overall feel for the place can be enjoyed from the plaza
Worth a visit. Great things to see and great views from this area. A bit touristy but still a fantastic place to see and absorb everything Budapest.
exquisite views. lovely and then wander the town--you cannot believe the beauty and the quiet of this quarter of the city. Medieval homes and quaint squares

Nice old tower and a wall. You can get a nice view from here. And the tower is really nice. It says there is a price to pay, but we walked all around and couldn't find a ticket officer. There's also a bar on top, but it was a bit too pricy for us.

Great atmosphere. You get spectacular views from here of the Danube and Pest. Look around the Cathedral as well and don't miss the patterned tiles on the roof. Lovely little restaurants for lunch nearby.
Great Views. My husband loved this its very high so you can get really good photos from the Bastion and works along the ramparts.
Towering above the Danube. This area is fascinating and of course more excellent views of the Danube and Pest. what's more, it's free to climb up the ramparts and into the towers.
Great views. Stroll through Castle Hill to this series of towers connected by stairways and cobbled streets and you'll be rewarded with some of the best panoramic views of the city.
so good! . It's a panoramic place where you can enjoy both the old and the new city. Definitely worth a visit! good for kids, adults andcouples.
Nice view. a short trip for a lovely photo stop.very cold up there. dress accordingly :) Should see inside the mathias church.

History and natural beauty. Fisherman's Bastion is a must for everybody visiting Budapest. You can enjoy both breathing scenery and historical buildings. It's an ideal place to take bird-eye view of Budapest

Like a fairy tale. Perhaps I'm a little bias, but visiting here was the highlight of my trip to Budapest as this was the spot I asked my girlfriend to marry me!I couldn't have picked a more perfect spot though. We arrived around 8pm when it was all lit up and looking like something out of a Disney movie. There were still some people around though and we wandered around the ramparts taking in the breath taking views towards Pest. I would recommend anyone to visit here at night as the buildings over the river look amazing all lit up and you can see all the main sites from here.Then, in a quiet turret, facing the parliament building, when we were all alone, i went down on one knee and asked my girlfriend if she would marry me. I am pleased to say that she said yes, and even though i would like to think that she would have said yes no matter where we were, being surrounded by such beautiful scenery certainly helped!

Best short trip in Budapest. I visited Fisherman's Bastion 1st time in August 2012 with my colleague before dinner during my business trip. In the Brasserie inside of this place, professional band played hungarian music and the standards of Jazz such as Autumn leaves/Fly me to the moon in reply to my request. Excellent! As I had supplier meeting with my customer every year in Budapeste, I visited this place total 3 times. 1-2 hours are enough for short sight seeing.Please see the attached pictures.

Good views when mist lifts. So much to view. Enjoyed the falconry display. Went back for a meal at night and place was magical. Want to go in the spring/summer when longer daylight hours and not misty/foggy.

Breathtaking views of the city, beautiful architecture...blissful!. We visited Castle Hill as a part of a guided city tour and this beautiful district turned out to be the high point of our tour!Fisherman's bastion not only has beautiful architecture to enjoy, it also offers some of the best bird's eye panoramic views of the city, especially the Hungarian Parliament, which in my opinion is one of the world's most beautiful buildings. It was a cold, rainy and a windy day, but we found a cosy little spot, decided to give the camera a rest and simply enjoyed the setting... it was bliss!

fishermans bastion,. We passed the fishermans bastion on our way to the castle district, looks a bit like a fairytale castle with its towers, large church on site (fee payable) but the rest of the area is free of charge to walk around. Spectacular views across the city, spotlessly clean, a credit to whoever keeps it so tidy. toilets available on site.

Beautiful architecture and stunning views. A lovely stroll through Castle Hill in Buda will bring you to Fisherman's Bastion.
A series of fairy tale towers connected by stairs and walkways by Matthias' Church, that provide a platform to view Pest and the Danube.
A lovely spot to include in a visit to the Church.
Choose a clear sunny day if possible.
Good Views. Good views and a lovely cafe, a must see place! Travelled on the sight seeing bus, for easy access, would recommend!
Fantastic night time viewpoint. A must see part of the Castle Hill. Looks fantastic at night and a great photo opportunity for the parliament building and Pest.

beautiful spot at night. went over there randomly at night, there was almost nobody, we could access most of the sites. amazing view on the parliament and Pest in general. went back during an afternoon, it was packed, way too packed to be enjoyable.

In Castle Hill area. This is a beautiful, unusual structure. We were with a guide, and accessed it by crossing the Chain Bridge and riding the funicular up. You can climb some stairs and have fabulous views of the whole Pest side of the city. As with most of the sites, you can also get here by public transportation.Our only 'problem' was the amount of reconstruction going on.

Stunning views over the Danube - A Must!. Last week we walked across the Chain Bridge and wound our way up to the castle area in Buda. We stopped for coffee and cake in the small Ruszwurm coffee house (another absolute MUST!) then walked the short distance to Fisherman's Bastion where we took several photographs and a video of the stunning view of Budapest. We also simply stood for quite some time and let the view sink in - it really is quite something.To appreciate the castle are fully I would allow at least a morning/afternoon as there is so much more to see than you would think when looking up at the castle are from Pest on the other side of the Danube.

Incredible. Its seven towers represent the seven Magyar tribes that settled in the basin of the river, you can visit both day and night (winter sets at four p.m.) where the views over the city are even more spectacular than the rest of the day. To access do the stairs or up the road where buses, for the latter is much easier to climb.
Pretty at night. Unusual looking but nice to walk along for the views of parliament. I'm told the café is worth a visit but it was really busy when we were there.
Spectacular views. Well worth a visit as part of the Castle area in general. The construction is interesting and with the great views of the city makes a wonderful photo opportunity.

A Must See. If you miss this attraction you will miss one of the most beautiful attractions in Budapest. The architecture is unique and you will not be able to stop taking pictures. So if you make it up to Castle Hill be sure and walk over to Fisherman's Bastion.

Great view of Budapest from Fisherman's Bastion!. Fisherman's Bastion is located next to Matthias Church and offers a breath taking view of the City of Budapest. It forms part of the court yard next to Matthias Church and it's walled walkway and turrets are unique. The perfect place to take a picture of the Parliament building showing all of its majesty.

Great panorama of the city. It sits majestically overlooking the city. A marvel to behold. It is a steep climb helped by stairs most of the way. You can approach via the castle. The views are stupendous. The are cafes around the bastion for we deserved refreshments. Enjoy!

Magical place. Located in the burg on the top of Buda hill, the place offers an amazing view of the city. With its pinnacles it resembles a fairytale landscape. From the archs of the bastion you can get a suggestive vista of the Parliament on th other side of the river.On the top of the bastion you can sit and enjoy a coffee outside (just not during the winter season). Very romantic place in the rare moments of the day when it's not too crowded.
Wanderful place. A very special architecture, an amazing view on Pest partv of Budapest, the parliament, st. Ishtavn and the Danuba.

Fairy Tale. What a brilliant sight this was. We visited fisherman's bastion the very first day of our trip and luckily weather was supportive. If i was a director, i would choose this place to shoot a whole movie. mesmerizing sights.
View the Danube from on high. Done as a celebration and memorial this fine piece of work gives great panoramic views. Should you be into your photography spend awhile.

Breathtaking views. With far reaching views over Pest, this is well worth a visit. Great photo opportunities and right next to St Mattias Church too.My visit was all the more enjoyable thanks to the guy playing popular tunes on his violin on the front staircase.

Beautiful and Great Views of Parliament. We missed visiting the Castle District and Fisherman's Bastion on our first visit to Budapest, so when we went back this year it was one of the things we definitely wanted to see. We were not disappointed. It is beautiful and amazing views of the city and Parliament. I highly recommend checking this spot out.
a great view. great place to visit especially to walk around the walls overlooking the pest side a great place to stop and have a nice chat
Great place to visit. A lot of things and attractions are located in this area. Great place to walk and enjoy the sites. A good view of the Budapest.
Beautiful. A must see attraction when visiting Budapest! It offers a magnificent view of the City, overlooking the Parliament. It is easily accessed and a lovely place to spend a couple of hours
I liked it. I liked it, a nice dry place to watch down on the city taking in the views. Quite a few steps but easily managed and worth it for the view.
Top site. This is a must do and take the time to have a coffee of drink on the patio overlooking the river and parliament. If it is cool, go to the small cafe in the tower and set inside.

Fantastic views. The architecture of this structure is magnificient. As are the views and pictures you can take of the Parliament and structures across the Danube. A must see if you are in the castle area.

Looks like Disney!. This amazing creation looks as though it is out of a Disney film! Very magical. We were fortunate to be there on a sunny day in December, early in the morning before it was too busy - and had wonderful views across the river and the town. Well worth going up the hill just for this! But go early to avoid the crowds - even in December by late morning it was full of people taking photos.

Great views if the city. You can get great views of the city from here as well as it being a great place itself for photographs - looking like a fairy take castle.Set within the area of the castle on the buda side of the Danube the bastion is well worth a visit

Best part is it's free!!. A must see spot for anyone in Budapest. Great views accross the city and an interesting building. Walk up the hill to get there if your keen (& have good knees) otherwise there is a lift/tram thingy for around €5pp

Excellent architectural view. We visited Fisherman's Bastion in November this year. The place is just fantastic by architectural point of view. Ad of course the view of the city is gorgeous.We were hungry from walking couple of hours at the castle hill and we went to the Cafe at the downstairs which was surprisingly cheap at such an touristic place and a Goulash soup was very taste - so recommended.And remember to look inside a church which is nearby - there is a museum as well inside, but nothing special, the church by itself is very nice.

Close to shopping and our hotel. We recently visited Budapest as part of a Viking River Cruise. We stayed in Buda very near Fisherman's bastion. It has a breathtaking view of the city but also was next door to our hotel and also very close to shopping and several other attractions. Don't hesitate to walk up to the top of the Bastion for a birds eye view of the city.
Spectacular. The views from the top are wonderful. Don't forget your camera! This is on the Buda side with Saint Mathias Church behind.
