Ok. This area is an ok area and has good views, but not as neat as the castle or Gellert Hill. The location of the Hilton right in the area and its 1970s/1980s architecture is a little odd for the area.
Fantastic views. The Bastion is behind the St Mathias Church. The views from here are stunning. Free admission when we were there. Very enjoyable! Don't miss it!

Charming piece of castle. Approaching from above, you get a smashing view of he city. Climb up the steps from the bank of the river, you'll feel if you were nearing a princess' castle.
Pro tip: avoid the restaurant and nearby street vendors.

Breathtaking. This is truly a breathtaking masterpiece of some fine building. The views are just as wonderful! You see the Duna and the Hungarian Parlament Building and most of Pest. A total must see!

Breathtaking. It is a must! After getting up the hill you will find yourself in almost fairytale-like place with the most amazing view on all Budapest. Be sure to take your hat with you if you will visit in winter - it's very windy. For price of 205 HUF (2x100 HUF + 5 HUF) you will be able to "create" for yourself a souvenir "coin" - not the best quality but it's nice to have if you are a "souvenir keeper". All restaurants are quite expensive (of course), same souvenirs. If you count every penny it's better to wait and buy/eat elsewhere.I saw a bus stop there so maybe there is a chance to avoid going up by feet.
Visit this in Budapest. Beautiful place to visit. Nice shops and great views of the river and the Pest side of the city. We visited on a rainy cloudy day and it was still worth going.
Fantasic.. Fantastic views from this building which is surprisingly not as old as it appears. Almost fairytale-like.
Must see. Imposing structure. You get magnificent views of Danube and the parliament building. The structure itself is beautiful and unique. There is a cafe with excellent views of Budapest.
Lost for words. Magnificent and imposing buildings. Definitely a place to stop and enjoy the view either in the open turret or the closed café/restaurant.

be sure to visit it .... Be sure to visit the Bastion!
Beautiful panoramic view of the city of Pasta, Parliament, bridges, river...

Fishermen's Bastion. The site from this place of Budapest lying at your feet is fantastic. You have the entire city (mostly the Pest side of Budapest on the other side of the Danube) in front of you. You can almost touch the Parliament - a neogothic building from the end of the 19th century. The name of the Bastion originates from the fact that this part of the castle wall was protected at times of siege by the fishermen's guild.

Great view of Pest, but don't pay the as.... sholes at the top charging you just to take a look of the city. Explore a bit and you'll realize there are similar views available for free. If you must have the "perfect shot" then be prepared to pay few hundred Forints. I'm just ranting because it used to be free, but someone let a little power go their head and has started charging just for a nice view. Scumbags.
Awesome. One of the top cities in Europe. A must see. I lived there for almost 4 years and guarantee you'll wan to go back again.

Budapest Forever!!!!. Come and visit this historical, modern ex communist country. Vibrant, reasonable, interresting.Restaurants and museums, buildings and people.Boat restaurants on the river etc etc

Fairytale towers with a beautiful panoramic view. Beautiful place, with a great panoramic view of Budapest. The architecture of the towers is unreal- just like in a fairytale. And to complete the atmosphere- there are violin players and gypsy singers at some corners. I loved it during the day, but in the afternoon it's even more beautiful.
great place. Must come to visit old building and its architecture.Excellent view from the top where you can make great photos.

Postcard Photos. This is one of the best places in the city to get postcard photos of Budapest. If you can go off season and avoid the crowds, it can be magical and there are no fees for walking up on the upper parts of the structure. During the late spring and during the summer, there are crowds, vendors and fees charged to walk around some of the prime areas. It is still worth going too though and quite a different feeling.
Fisherman's Bastion Visit. We had a beautiful weather day and enjoyed the spectacular view from the top of Castle Hill looking down on the Parliament building and the Viking ship we were on.

Fantastic views. This is a must see, especially on a clear day because of how much of the Pest side of the city you can see. The turrets are pure fairy tale and there is a nice little restaurant up there with wonderful views day or night. It is also where you can enter St. Mattias church with it's multi-colored tile roof. There are additional restaurants and shops on the back side of the church (actually the front) and a currency exchange window with VERY beneficial rates.

Magical. Fisherman's Bastion and St. Mathias's Church was the final stop on our walking tour. We arrived at about six in the evening (November) so it was dark and there was a fog decending over the hill. The Church and Bastion were beautifully lit and there was a magical quality about the whole area. I loved it .... Do try and see it by night - great views over the Pest side of the city too.

Upscale, 5-star dining. Dining at this restaurant was an amazing experience. The service is 5-star and attentive. Every dish is served with a silver lid that gets ceromoniously removed after the plate is served. The views are looking at the Parliament buildings. There is some live classical music in the restaurant and a violinist will stop by your table to ask to play. We found it a little loud and difficult to have a quiet conversation, so you can easily just say "no thanks" and they will understand.
A Must See (but go at night it's much quieter) . Wonderful walkways and towers plus fantastic views of the Danube and Pest on the other side of the river. Looks great at night when all lit up
stunning. stunning views of Pest the buildings looks like the Disney castle it is not too long and provides a great overlook of the city

Beautiful turrets. This looks very much like a castle from a fairy tale. The buildings date back to the Middle Ages. There is a large statue of Stephen I of Hungary that was erected in 1906. If this looks familiar, it was one of the stops on the "Amazing Race" during season 6.

Great view of the Danube. This is a great place to take a break, with a terrific vantage point of the Danube River and Pest. We didn't spend as much time in Buda as we did in Pest but this is a must see.

Get your camera at the ready!. Beautiful architecture that stands out from the crowd! Breathtaking (for us anyway) at day and night time. Lovely to walk around and I often found myself looking up at it with my mouth open! Go have a look for yourself.

Lovely views. Arrived here just as the sun was setting, beautiful architecture with some stunning views. Definitely worth a visit! There is also a bar in one of the 'turrets' with heat lamps and throws, so we grabbed a drink in there before heading back out into the cold. Quite romantic at sunset.

Best views over the city. What a location for a restaurant. Right in the heart of the walled palace area in the castle district. Wonderful views and the food was great and reasonably priced considering the location. Great for a romantic occasion.
Fairytale buildings overlooking the Danube. The fairytale peaks of these beautiful buildings cry out to be photographed from every angle. It is just lovely to walk along and between each turret.

Lovely architecture, lovely view. This is a must-see when visiting Budapest, both day and night. Beautiful view of the danube, St. Matthias Church and the ruins of a medieval church tucked in a niche of the Hilton. Don't be afraid to explore - if it's not roped off, GO IN!The highest points are not always accessible, and in summer you may lose so access to terrace restaurants (which are expensive).But it's one of those places, as a local, I love going back once or twice a year, each time I'm carried away by the view and architecture.My 4 stars is not because you shouldn't COMPLETELY go, but because there are always ways for the city and restaurants to improve the experience.

Amazing, amazing views.. The Fisherman's Bastion was a highlight of our Budapest trip - the architecture itself was amazing, and so was the view of Pest from there. We are not sure if it has been recently renovated, because everything looked very well-kept. Also, do visit the Fisherman's Bastion during the day and the night time, both views are spectacular. One thing that makes Budapest amazing is that the city is very well-lit in the important places. Strong beams of lights are focused on the Fisherman's Bastion and other important landmarks at night, making them extra photo-worthy.The bastion used to charge for entry, but not anymore!

Beautiful area.... Beautiful place to go and view the city whether in the morning or in the evening. We were there at sunset and it didn't disappoint. It has a great view of the Parliament and also quite near the Mathias Church.

great panoramic view. very good place to take a few photos.the history of this place is also nice... you should read about it.its right next to Matiyas Church... so you can catch 2 birds in the same place.quite freezing and a little foggy in November though ;)Dor
Incredible . Stunning in the day, breathtaking at night. The views are just fantastic from here but at night the city comes a light. This is my favorite place in budapest

Lovely view.. While visiting Budapest on a Viking river cruise, we spent an few hours here. Great spot to get a good view of Pest and that magnificent Parliament House. It was very crowded , but it is a large area and there are many interesting cobbled streets and churches to explore, not just the view over the river.
Brilliant architecture. This is a lovely building and great views of st Mathias church in front.it was very busy though .lovely to see at night time as well all flood lit up.
Stunning at night. We visited in the evening when it was all lit up with stunning views over Budapest. Beautiful and well worth the climb

Top Attraction in Budapest. This was my favourite place in Budapest. I spent a few hours wandering around the back streets, but the views of the church with it's amazing roof and looking out over the Danube through the turreted towers are hard to beat.It was very busy when I visited in the middle of the afternoon. Perhaps early morning would be the best bet to get photos without huge crowds in the foreground.

great view over Pest. the bastion is very scenic and you can enjoy a f¡great view over the danube, the Parliament and overall the Pest shore. In wintertime the access is free of charge. Don´t forget to visit the marzipan shop next to the bastion

Fantastic pan Pest views. Went as part of a tour,
WOW stunning views, a sheer delight. Perfect for photos. You can see the level of EU investment. An incredible national treasure
Excellent spot for photos and great views. Stop by if you are in the castle area for wonderful views of the city and for a nice spot for photographs.
Nice view. While the bastion has excellent views, the structure itself is not very special. However the Mathias church beside it is definitely worth the trip up the hill.

Brilliant.. Absolutely breathtaking. Could of spent all day there at the mind blowing rooftop bar which has unbelievable views spanning nearly the whole city. One of the best parts of the holiday for sure.

Fairy tale land!. Surely a top attraction in Budapest! A complex of beautiful stone buildings built in the late 19th century. Corridors, mini castle like structures, turrets, walls, stairs.. and spectacular views across the river! Excellent coffee and food too, at reasonable prices.

Brilliant veiws of pest and theres a cafe at the top to grab a coffee very reasonable prices . Would put it in my top 3 things to do in budapest if your walking up there are a lot of steps to climb but well worth the bother

Fantastic view for free. Fantastic views over the city, beautifully maintained building. it looks like there used to be a charge, but there is none now. Well worth a visit. We had a ice mulled wine in the little bar at the top too - very atmospheric and not a rip-off price.

Disney with taste. Behind the Hilton, next to Matthias Church is this wedding cake fantasy looking across to the Pest side of the Danube - walkways, built in bars and restaurants. Great stop for a quick look and a break for a coffee or a beer.

Like being in a bigger-than-life chess game :). I had not realized this was Fisherman's Bastion! Enchanting :) However, my back and knees could no longer take more stairs. I would have wished to go all the way up the big tower. I got many great photos, both day and night, from this site.
Eyes opener to Magyar's culture. Eyes opener to Magyar's culture. The Fishermen Bastion is clean with so much idyllic beautiful scenery.

Well preserved attraction. One of the primary places on the bucket list of places to visit in Budapest. wheel chair access is via the road to the rear and up the hill. Otherwise visitors ascend the steps to the site.
night or day. beautiful & whimsical at night and fun exploring by day. great panorama views of the city. Bus it up or walk all those steps. Lots to visit & see with nearby attractions.

Top sight to rival Rome and Paris. This was one of the top sights in what is a great city. Like something straight out of disney film . Great architecture and views across the Danube and the city down to the parliament which is another top attraction. Great city for a weekend break
Amazing view and area. I would rate it as the number 1 place for a spectacular view of Budapest. It's a must see for every visitor!
Excellent Views. A lovely building with excellent views. Even thought a number of people were about, still enough room to take stunning photos and look around

Don't forget to Selfie with city scape bacground. Yes, this place is one of Budapest's icon and also in the same place with St.Matthias Church. The place is well preserved, and good for "photo group" if you go with group. The important also is the toilet, it is available in the Ice cream vendor in there, not free of course.For selfie photo ? go to the tower (see my photo) and pose there, like many other do, I think is great. The St Matthias church also open to visit of course.Oh yes, If you stay in Hilton Budapest, you are in Fisherman's Bastion.

Terrific view of Budapest. This spot is an easy walk from Buda, great spot for photos and panoramic view. The walk down takes you by lovely small shops specializing in Hungarian handcrafts, foods and the like. Lovely spot for a stroll. Matthias church right next door.

Great views.... This structure is beautiful to view and to view from. We stayed at the Hilton Hotel located steps from Fisherman's Bastion so we had a view of it from our room and from the ICON restaurant in the hotel.Also we visited the Bastion several times during the day to enjoys views of the city and of the Danube River. It's a great place to take pictures.

Lovely views. It was a lovely sunny day so we got some great photos not only of the stunning architecture but of the Pest side of the river. A really chilled day, with nice views for an afternoon drink and then some tasty food. There's not super lots to actively do here but it's good for relaxing with the lovely atmosphere and strolling around.
Beautiful architecture. You are able to see out over Budapest with wonderful views of the area. must see if in the country. You are able to see the Danube River for this area.
best part of castle hill for me. lovely and worth a visit not much to it really but its just pretty and has great views over the city

Beautiful architecture and stunning views. Incredible and very unique architecture. The terrace looks out over the city of Budapest, with stunning views of the parliament building and the Chain bridge. There are nice spots for a picnic or to relax in the sun. Not a far walk from Buda castle.
I would highly recommend visiting!

Superb architecture and views. The Fisherman's Bastion is a castle like structure with towers and viewpoints on Buda's castle hill. It is right next to the Matthias church and offers outstanding views over the Danube towards Parliament and Pest. It is free and a must for pictures. Even though built in the 19th century, it looks like a medieval castle.
Like a Disney castle..... Beautiful setting and stunning views, not to be missed! Ideal location for photography, the actual buildings and also for stunning views of the Danube too.

Unique place for great views. The views are fantastic day and night. It's also a great place to see Matyas and it's beautiful tiled roof. It is really a fairy tale atmosphere. Look for views of it from below and on the Danube too. Great photos.

Stunning archituecture and views!. We came here as part of a walking tour around the whole area. The architecture has a fairy tale quality. The views are spectacular. this is a good place to get your bearings, for some of the other tourist attractions in the city.
Very pretty with spectacular views. Beautiful towers and terraces which give breath taking views of the Danube & the City both in daytime & the evening.
Magical place. My favourite place in Budapest, beautiful architecture and excellent views over the Danube. A must go when in Budapest.
A must see. Probably the best location in Budapest. The view from the top is absolutely amazing as you can see almost the whole town.
Out of a fairytale. Very nice place with a beautifully view. Looks like Cinderella castel with a church that is also worth visiting.
great vieuw. you have to walk from the bridge up by foot, the vieuws are amazing, the whole area is beautiful, visit also the oldest coffeehouse of budapest, cakes delicieus
sightseeing. Great views and free entry to this pretty attraction, What more do you want? Worth a visit whilst there.

wast of time. artificial place. the building itself is ok but there are much better places to view the Danube.
if you are in the area than 10 min of site seeing in more than enough
Great view!. Everything was excellent,the view,bastion overall- but one thing is missing-english explanation of the things..

Must see view!. Feel like you are in the middle of a neo-gothic experience - and take in the views of Pest from this side of the Danube as well. Walk around - don't miss the Matthias Church, and enjoy coffee at one of the charming cafes. Some wonderful, but expensive shopping is nestled amongst the souvenir-y stuff.

Romantic place...stunning views and worth the climb!. The walk up to this area is not at all as taxing as it looks from below...and I write this as an OAP! When at the top, there is a café terrace with stunning views all around, and the coffee is reasonably priced. The soup also looked good and seemed a popular lunch time choice. The marzipan museum is located here , but I admit we never got further than its shop!You could easily spend a couple of hours here just wandering around and enjoying the views. Much better to walk up.....or at the very least, if you are on the hop-on/hop-0ff bus then alight and have a wander before catching the next!

Amazing place. Extremely beautiful and pleasant place for a walk along the Buda Castle. From there you have a great vision of the Danube and the bridge. Outstanding medieval atmosphere and also a lovely place for a romantic stroll. Definitely worth knowing.
must see. Lovely view of the parlemant and the Pest side. nice coffee shops and restaurants in the area. I enjoyed the walk up to the site.

beautiful. Absolutely gorgeous view of the city, well worth the climb to the top of the hill. Also try the hot wine at the place round the corner as well when its cold, little bit too sweet but really warms you up :)

Interesting building, amazing view. Really interesting building - looks a bit like it belongs in a Disney film, and the view of the city from the towers is amazing - took some really good panoramic pictures from up there.
Breathtaking. the architecture itself the surrounding area etc ... it is mesmerizing a must see and experience if you are in Budapest
Picturesque. Many Kodak picture points but many peddlers of embroidery, blouses, etc. that at times can be annoying. (Sorry but I understand some have to make a living.)

Nice vista location to see Parliament building.. The view of the Parliament building from here was very good. Lots of arches, very romantic location. Behind Matthias Church and free admission. To reach the top turret there were entrance fee.
Beautiful place with great wiew.. I was many times at the Fisheman's Bastion when I was younger. This is the perfect place for the first date;-) I can recommend it.
Amazing View. this is an amazing view of the city and river, there's nothing blocking the view so I think this might be the best place to take amazing pictures of the city.

The best view of the city!!!. You really have to go to this place when you visit Budapest. The view is awesome and you get to see for free the best district of the city, that is the Castle District. Fishermen's Bastion is really beautiful, especially if you bear in mind the story behind this monument. There are also some coffee shops in the area, where you can relax while being in the most beautiful - in my opinion - part of the city. Next to the Bastion lies St. Mathias church, while in a few minutes walk you can find half a dozen museums, the Tower of Magdalena and ofciurse gaze the Castle itself. A MUST for every visitor of Budapest...........

What a place!. If you love history, architecture, views or just taking pretty pictures... This is the place for you! We went on our last day and it was truly breath-taking. Watch out for the people charging for use of sub-standard toilets and service charges being added to your bill. Other than that I couldn't fault the place. A great way to spend a good 4-6 hours!
Beautiful!. My husband and I have really enjoyed the visit, the castle looks like the one from Disney cartoons :)Looks special in winter-all white, covered in snow!Well worth visiting!

My favourite building in the world! . What a beautiful piece of architecture! For me, I was really looking forward to visiting this on my trip to Budapest, and I wasn't disappointed. The views of Pest are great, although I think they're best from the Citadel. But this is a must do in Budapest.

Perfect. Our table was in an alcove with a fantastic view across river. It was daylight when we started eating and dark when we left so we saw the Parliament building lit up. Service and food were both excellent. It was the perfect place for a special meal.
Busy!. Affords great views over the Danube, but that's about it and you get just as good views from less crowded spots.
Gorgeous panoramas. Beautiful sights of Pest from this vantage point, along with the church and castle complex it's a most interesting area

Fisherman's Bastion. The Fisherman's Bastion is in the Castle District which is on the Buda side of the Danube River. It can be accessed by public transport and gives a wonderful view over the river towards the Pest side of Budapest. There are cafes and toilet facilities in the vicinity and this a very historic area.

Amazing view and lovely place to visit. Hello! In June 2011 I planned to visit Budapest and I'm very pleased for what I found in that amazing and romantic city. The Fisherman's Bastion is situated on the right side of Danube, in Buda. It was not very difficult to find it due to a well-planned map and nice people who gave me some tips. :) The Bastion has seven towers which are vey much-alike with those from the fairy tales, the architecture is stunning and the view of the Danube and the entire city was breathtaking. I strongly recommend to visit this place when in Budapest, not only for its special and romantic view, but also for the surroudings -near-by there is the Roman-Catholic church(Matthias Church) which is quite impressive also. So, yes, you shoul visit the Bastion and simply enjoy the view from there! Have fun!
Nice view of Pest. Also nice sculptures and a good square to hang around. We had lunch at the Hilton and had great view of the city from the restaurant.

My favorite tourist site. The architecture is amazing and makes you feel a little like Disneyland! I love to come here in the summer to have a picnic and watch the light above Budapest during sundown. You can take great photos of the Pest area and there's also a quite affordable bar to have some drinks or a coffee. It's fun for kids, since they can run around and explore the building. Take the Bus 16 from Deak ter and not from the first stop on the Buda side, because it's always jammed with people.

Stunning views. Stunning views of the Danube and looking back towards the Pest side of the city. The area is currently undergoing construction of a new large footpath and terrace around the church of Matthias but this cannot spoil the overall atmosphere. Definitely worth a visit.
Fantastic architecture and amazing views. This is place in my mind is very architecturally beautiful. It has great photo-ops. The views are magnificent as well.
At sunset a great atmosphere. Beautiful open vistas over Budapest and a really happy atmosphere make this a top ten sight on any long weekend
fairytale. Very beautiful, like all the buildings in Budapest. There's a lot to see around the area. Not far from here is the 'hospital in the rock'. Well worth seeing

Panoramic views over the Danube and Pest. The views from the Fisherman's Bastion are magnificent. From the terrace you look out over the Danube towards the magnificent Hungarian parliament building with the Pest side of Budapest all around. Well worth seeing!

Must See. this place is a must see, the view from the top is fantastic. It was 700 forint to walk on the top area but well worth it.
Restaurant at the top where you can listen to Gypsy music, very romantic, but very expensive compared to other nice restaurants in Budapest...but good for a special occasion
good views. nice views over to Buda cross the river there is a little bar at one end that had heaters in which were very welcome as it was a bit nippy!

Fishermans Bastion. As a part of the Castle District, it forms a portion of the surrounding wall structure. Magnificent architecture and historical facts make this an amazing structure looking down from the top or up from the bottom.

Enjoy the views. Budapest has 2 parts, Buda and Pest. The city has an extraordinary location. One of the most impressive panoramic places this is the best to see the Pester side above the Danube(Duna). You feel Yourself in this historical place that the people can dominate the land.2 minutes walk from the Fisherman's Bastion you will find the old-fashioned Ruszwurm Cafe where you must taste a fantastic ice-cream or a cake.
Amazing. We enjoyed a lot this place. It's like you are in a fairytale. We visited it by night and there were many tourists.The view over the city is great.
Good. There was too much people and tourists. But, architecture is great, also sight to the Budapest. Prefer to go from there on foot.
Nice view. A pretty structure, offering a perfect panorama of Pest. It's definately worth to climb up there!A bit busy though.
Beautiful views. Visit at night too, it's illuminated and has incredible views of parliament building across river. Close so Mathias church which is also worth going into.
Lovely views. I love this place for the views it offers over Pest. Have been plenty of times already. TIP: FREE to visit in winter!

Must!!. If you visit Budapest you must take yourself here!! Don't be a lazy... Walk it!! Take in the entire castle and the scenery. The split of the city. There are many shops and scrumptious places to eat. Either a large meal or your coffee and pastry. Also the bus does run so after a long day of walking you are able to relax and take public transit back to your place of stay. These pictures I took are my favorite pictures I've ever taken. I love Budapest and my favoetir European city!!
worth the walk. Well worth the walk up the hills the views from up top are spectacular plenty of places for a coffee or a bite to eat

Beautiful view from ... You can see this beauty from many part of Budapest, especially from the embankment of river Danube.On the other side from this you can enjoy the whole of the capital of Hungary, Budapest. The Bastion itself is a special place, especially a decoration of the millennium of foundation of Hungary and a memory of the place at the foothill, at Danube, where the fisherman lived.Nice to visit, all foreigners and Hungarians are doing it!
Very pretty, great view. This place has a great view down to the Parliament building. Felt like being in a fairytale - an absolute must see in Budapest! Located very close to a castle and church.

Incredible views of a truly beautiful city!. Th Fisherman's Bastion, right next to Saint Matyas Church, affords lovely views and photo opportunities of the Danube and the Parliament building. It is free to visit -although I would recommend enjoying a mulled wine at the cafe on the North end of the Bastion, particularly on a chilly Autumn day!
Short visit to Fisherman's Bastion. Immensely crowded. Felt like we had to shuffle and keep moving every second. View was very nice, but I'd check on a better time to visit.

It's wonderfull all year round. Take the lift on the back-side of Castle /Dózsa György tér/ and through the corridor of the National Bibliothek you will drop in the middle of the Buda King Palace- from here you can walk to the Danube side of the Castle - nice panorama- and follow your way to the Fisherman's Bastion among the old houses!

From fairy tales. From fairy tales to reality. The fishermen bastion is just a city ornament but such a beautiful one. the view from there to the pest side, where the Hungarian sumptuous parliament stands, is breathtaking and so romantic.It is absolutely a must-see site. It looks a little like a castle in Walt Disney's world. This is why it is so magic.

Fabulous view and interesting places to visit. My wife and myself stooped here twice during our recent visit (first time) to Budapest. The views of the Danube are spectacular, may be the best on the entire river. We were concerned it may be too touristy but not at all like that. Granted there were a lot of tourists but the views and interesting places to visit in the area make it a must see stop. There is a bar at the tower that serves drinks at reasonable prices and from which you can really enjoy the views of the Danube. I highly recommend planning on spending at leat a half a day in the area and I guarantee you will love the views.
Fantastic. Beautiful by day but even better by night.Take your camera you will need it for the views over the river to pPest and beyond

Beautiful and Interesting. It's been several years since we were in Budapest so I'll do my best to be accurate. Fisherman's Bastion had beautiful, unique architecture and an outstanding view of Pest from above. It was one of those places that actually looks better in person than in photographs (not always the case). The only complaint was the fact that it was very crowded and difficult to get all the pictures we wanted, but that is the nature of tourist spots. (We were there about a week before Christmas). We didn't pay to go up to the top and the free views were still outstanding!P.S. We visited in December 2011 but evidently TA doesn't let you select dates that far back.

Worth for the city panorama alone. Although I was only In Budapest briefly, as I had a flight leaving from Vienna the next day, I was still taken by the city in the brief time I was there. To get to the bastion it requires a little bit of walking up steep stairs, if you are in decent physical health it should be fine. The bastion itself is divided into two sections. The lower level, which is free, and the upper level that requires pay, and I did not go up it as I was low on forints (Hungarian currency) at the time. There is also a restaurant on the upper level as well. Regardless, the bastion is a must see just for the vantage point you get of the Danube with many of the cities most well known sights, such as the Parliament House, Chain Bridge, St. Stephen's Basilica. For me the views here were far more impressive than that of Vienna and I highly recommend a visit.
excellent view. excellent view on whole Budapest, especially at night. Also, nice bar at last tower with affordable prices.
Views outstanding. A must visit when in Budapest up and down dales but worth the pain. You can take the train up cost I think 2400 huf

Loved this!. I loved this place! It was so unique and interesting - and the views of the Pest side of the city are wonderful! YOu can pay to go up to the top and it's not very expensive, but you get the same views from the free second story! Don't miss this!
pure beauty. If you are in Budapest, you have to visit the Fisherman's Bastion. It's architecture is so beautiful and the view from it is spectacular. It's a fantastic memorial.
Beautiful Architecture. It is like a fairytale castle with attractive turrets around it. You should visit Matyas Church and the Marzipan Museum while you are up there
You can see everything from outside. Really touristic, don't pay in. There is like nothing to see here. Nice building but you can get same view for free.

Impressive view. Lovely views of Pest and across the Danube. Visited the Bastion as part of a walking tour so didn't get a huge amount of time to fully explore it. I did notice alot of construction work and as a result, everyone had to get to the Bastion via the one laneway so it was quite busy.

Worth visiting. From here you get brilliant views across the river and Pest. Nicely restored and they are currently working on the square. Parts of the bastion are sometimes closed off for the public.

Great place from which to view Budapest. We went here on a gloriously sunny day and it was the best place to see Budapest. It wasn't too busy and although there was work being done on the paved area outside St Matthias' church that didn't spoil the enjoyment. We used the red line hop on/hop off bus to get here which was quick and convenient.Don't miss this - but go on a good day!

Beautiful views across the Danube. A fantastic place to view a wonderful city. We walked along the Fisherman's Bastion taking photos of the spectacular view, in the nippy autumnal air and then found a cafe selling mulled wine. A beautiful place to sit and absorb your surroundings.

Try to go early or late to avoid crowds but go!. I was first here 19 years ago. On this return trip I was very impressed by how much has been and is being done to clean, restore and maintain the bastion. The views of Budapest are magnificent and the story of the bastion is interesting - short version is that every group was responsible for guarding some area of the hill and this is the part the fishermen had to guard. This was off season and in mid-afternoon it was very busy. Attempt to learn when the river cruises and other tourists are typically there and go before or after that for a more enjoyable experience.
Fabulous. Beautiful architecture. Supposedly the most romantic place in Budapest. Wonderful views across the Danube. The cafe serves amazing hot chocolate.

Fisherman's Bastion. This is a section of the old wall of Buda. It provides a beautiful view out over the Danube and the pest side of the river. It is beautifully restored and has the feel of a medieval hill town - which it was. Take a tour to get the historical background.
Great Place !!!. Great Place to chill around during late evenings.. Excellent view of the city ... the place well lit up at night making it more beautiful ...

Full of tourists and construction. Although the access was impaired because of construction, so tourists were crowded into a smaller area, it was definitely worth the walk to the stairs. The view was terrific.
Interesting design. This is quite a unique piece of architecture, stretching around the front of a beautiful cathedral. No real need to pay enter, better just to walk around the edge and admire.

Best view of the city. I was staying at the Hilton near this so was lucky to see it day and night. The view from up here really is excellent of the city. It’s a proper panorama with several of the bridges in view, the parliament and a lot of the city. Matthias church is here also. The architecture around there area is really what you expect in Budapest and is highly recommended. It’s a bit of a climb up from the river level but easily done. I did it several times!
Great View of the city. One of the best location to get a complete view of the city. Definitely visit at the night time. Just 5 minutes from the Buda Castle.
Oh the views. This is such a fantastic area. It is so historic. You really could spend the day here. Nice shopping and views by the bucket load

Great view overlooking the Danube and Pest. Entrance is free (except for particular towers). The Bastion, adjacent to the St. Matthias Church, is basically an elevated walkway with several towers that overlooks the Danube. Beautifully built and offers a beautiful view of the city's centre.

Great panaromic view. On a visit to Buda this area must not be missed. The views of the city are wonderful especially at night.
Great panoramic view of Budapest. Really loved the vibe and atmosphere of the place. Keep in my mind that you have to pay an admission to walk on the walls.The area around the church is facinating.
Beautiful Views. Although the crowds are thick at this monument, it is a worthwhile place to visit. Great views of Budapest and the architecture.
Incredible !. I had a really short time here but it was beautiful. Loved the view it offered and it was simply amazing. Definitely one of the top locations to see! (:

I wasn't going to review this.... ...but I felt the need to correct a couple of posters. The fee described in some reviews below is for the entry to St Matyas church - entry to the Fisherman's Bastion is free Whilst we were there some parts were closed off because of the construction works in the square but the views, as mentioned, are well worth climbing to the top - it's not far!

Visit at night. We visited the Fishermans Bastion at night as we went with an organised group and we had a drinks reception at the top.The views are spectacular at night with all the lights twinkling in the distance.I would recommend wearing comfortable shoes as its a good walk to the top with a lot of steps
Great view of the city. Were were up here as part of a tour. We did not spend a lot of time, but the view back to the city from here makes for some great pictures.

Excellent View of the City. You can have a complete view of the City. Remember to spend time in the Mathias Church. It is beautiful. The bronze statue of King St. Stephen was so nicely crafted that you can see the ornaments and patterns on his robe.

Fairytale scene. This is in the Buda Castle complex. The day we visited the location, it was a perfect sunny day. It made the place look surreal with the colourful roof. There is an entry fee to go to one level up, but the views from the non-fee section is great. It did not seem like going one level up would be any different. Hence, we did not go up.Also, there are multiple souvenir shops on the way from the hop-on hop-off stop to the Bastion. If you are looking to buy magnet souvenirs, we found that this section has the most reasonable priced ones. Even 1 euro / 300 ft ones available.There are also some restaurants along the way. We had a hearty meal overlooking the beautiful location. However, as all touristy locations, the price for food here is comparatively 20%-30% more than a restaurant in the city.

Good views of the city. Probably one of the most photogenic and photographed areas of the Castle Hill. Also great for watching the fireworks on August 2o, the national holiday of the founding of the nation.
Beautiful sights. It was beautiful all around, there are some great photo ops everywhere. You must check out the Ruzsworm Cafe, you wont be disappointed!

Fantastic views. The Fisherman's Bastion provides the best views of Budapest. It is well worth the night time visit especially, as the tourist crowds have gone and the lights of the city provide that world renowned spectacle.
See at night. At night, you have this amazing site all to yourself. You will feel like you are in another time. The views are breathtaking. Enjoy!

A great view from the Buda side of the Danube!. Fisherman’s Bastion is a great place to get a wonderful view of the Pest side of the Danube. There is a fee to go to the top of the monument, but it really isn’t necessary. The views from the free sections are just as nice. If you have the time, having a drink and/or a snack on the restaurant overlook is relaxing, too. The area is quite crowded with tourists from noon onward, so get there early or late in the day to avoid the crowds.
include on the hop on off route.. Well worth a visit for the surroundings and views. Include within the castle tour as it is just one of the many attractions.
Amazing View. Bastion itself looks like a fairy tale. It has white color and walt disney style castle look. There is also amazing danube and parliament building view from bastion.
Excellent View.. Excellent view. A bit of a walk around the castle district but all's good for a day to walkabout and enjoy the scenery.
Nice views. The walls are a great place to see the Pesht side of Buddapest. The walk up isnt going to kill You, and you get great glimpses of the City on the way up

inspiration of Disneyland Fantasyland Castle. Beautiful architecture and wonderful point of view over the city... a msut stop place in Budapest. You can see where the castle of Fantasyland comes from :)
Great view of the city. Wasn't sure what this had to do with Fishermen, nice small interesting building though. It's part of spending a day in that area, I wouldn't go just for this.

Magic. This is not an 'old' building compared with others but it has a charm of its own and affords great views of Budapest and its surrounding environs. At the main tower there is a great vantage point with a café serving refreshments and has nice seating looking over the city

Stunning views and well maintained. I was really looking forward to visiting the Fisherman's Bastion before my trip to Budapest, and it didn't disappoint! It's in a beautiful setting, looking over the wonderful parliament buildings, river and giving great panoramic views of the city. The Bastion itself is beautifully maintained and atmospheric, tourists taking pictures and having a good time. There are some nice shops around the area for souvenirs, food etc.

Surprisingly low prices. We were prepared to pay a lot for the coffee and pastries but to our huge surprise the prices were very low at the famous marcipan museum cafeteria. The view was amazing and the bastion itself a great piece of history. In the middle of day there stepped a newly married couple out of the church. Lovely.

Magnificent. Not the first place to appear in guide books but it is very very impressive. Tremendous building and views across the Danube. I struggle to understand why this does not greater prominence in guide books of Budapest
totally breathtaking. On a visit to Buda this area must not be missed. The views of the city are wonderful especially at night.

Fabulous views. Excellent vantage point for views across the Danube to the Parliament building. The buildings themselves at Fisherman's Bastion are pretty enough in their own right to be worth visiting, even without the views.

Quite Impressive Architecture. We wandered over here from the castle and it is quite a nice attraction for architectural reasons. More great views but nothing that wasn't seen from down by the castle. Impressively built nonetheless!!
Awesome place. Amazing view of the city, Awesome arhitecture, it looks like another city in Budapest.:) better to be visited at sunset when the bridges get the lights on

New world Cuisine in old world elegance. The views of downtown Pest and the Danube are phenomenal from this historical castle on a hilltop in Buda. Add to this the cuisine, service, and ambiance and you have a five star experience to enjoy.

Great views. We bought our ticket for Matthias church and Fisherman's Bastion together. As you leave the church you find yourself here and the views are excellent - don't forget your camera!
Also worth pointing out, if you are a student don't forget your ISIC card

Pleasant walk along the Danube. The area between the 2 main bridges is called Fisherman Bastion,
Its great for slowly walking along the Danube & visiting the bars & restaurants along the banks.
Handy for the hotels & Budapest centre.

Nice but not essential. The stone walls that make up the bastion are really breathtaking to look at - as is the view of Budapest from them. That being said, you have to buy a ticket to walk on the bastion and there's not a lot to do when you're up there, other than gaze out at the beautiful views and take pictures. If it's your first time in the area, I'd say pay the fee and check it out, but I don't think it warrants a 2nd visit.

Breathtaking. Nobody could fail to be amazed by the view from here! Easily walkable but local buses frequent as are hop on hop off excursion buses. Building work on site was a little unfortunate but has to be done sometime I suppose. A must see area of Buda

Stunning views. Located on the entrance of the Castle Hill on the side overlooking the Pest side, it stands wonderful and amazes with the architecture. The views of the Parliament, the Danube, the Chain Bridge, and the entire Pest side. A must see!!
it is part of the castle district.Beautiful architecture. There is nothing to dislike,It is restored and beautiful.Be sure to visit this whole areaSee my review of the castle district

Great site, yet another cost. This is an ideal site for getting quintessential pictures of Budapest. Unfortunately, in order to walk around part of the area's walls, you have to shell out some money to a guy sitting in front of the staircase with a turnstyle. We were a bit dismayed by this as it appeared to be an open area attraction. We found that if you walk to the left and go up to the cafe in the turret you can get just as good of pictures of the city across the river and the remaining Bastion without having to pay the toll. (It's not that I don't mind paying 1- euros here or there, this was just a bit odd and we were at the end of our trip and tired of shelling out money to use restrooms and other attractions.)There was a lot of construction going on around this site and the church, so beware if you are traveling this fall.
Amazing architecture. This place looks stunning from the river, but up close it's even more surprising. Just a short walk from Buda Castle.

Great panoramic views. The Fisherman's Bastion is located atop Castle Hill on the Buda side of Budapest. It's the former sight of the fish market and is now an outlook overlooking the Danube River and the Pest side of Budapest. The views are amazing even from the lower levels. I read that there is a charge to enter the upper towers, but we did not venture up there. I don't think it's necessary to go up the towers to get a wonderful view. The bastion itself with its pointed turrets looks like something out of a fairy tale. Well worth a visit.

Great Viewpoint to Appreciate the Danube. Lying adjacent to the Matias church in Buda, the Fisherman's Bastion is a great place to wander round and take in the greatr views of The Danube and the Parliament building opposite. Note that there are huge numbers of tourist parties wandering around here during the day so it is best to take in when they have all gone home in the evening (it is well illuminated).The tower like turrets are meant to represent the old tribal Magyar tents that they lived in.
Good views and vibes. Great panoramic view of Budapest. Really loved the vibe and atmosphere of the place. Keep in my mind that you have to pay an admission to walk on the walls.

My favorite place in Budapest. The fisherman's bastion is my favorite place in Budapest and among my favorite places in the world. It provides breathtaking views of Pest and the Danube and is incredible at both sunrise and sunset. There is a little outdoor cafe across from Matthias church that sells hot mulled wine; a delightful complement to the view from the bastion on a chilly night. The stairs from the bottom can be daunting but are worth the views. If you aren't up to the climb, enter from the alley by Matthias Church and just enjoy the view from the top.
Amazing views of the City. Free, easy to get to, well worth it for a kodak moment. You can freely walk around the turrets and get unbeatable panoramic views of Parliament and the whole city.
Under renovation. The entire area is under renovation. Recomend to postpone visit til next year. The area around the church is facinating.

Excellent views of Danube and Pest. On Castle Hill right next to church that offers excellent views of the Danube and the Pest side of Budapest. They do charge an admission to walk up on the walls for the view.
Great view. Fisherman's Bastion provides a great view over Budapest. If you drive a bit past the steps, you can walk to the Bastion via the Castle town which is quite pretty.
amazing. Amazing piece of architecture, fantastic inside, very interesting. Even though it was very busy it still felt tranquil. It has a great view of Budapest.

Special memories. We visited here in September, I paid for the trip as a surprise 30th birthday present for my partner. It was our 2nd day of our trip and the weather was starting to pick up. We were staying on the Pest side and took a walk over the bridge which was great. I got snap happy with the camera along the way. We paid to go up the towers and the views were stunning. Again, I was taking pictures frantically in the tower whilst we had it to ourselves, and then my partner of 5 years got down on one knee to propose!! I was completely surprised. The setting was perfect! I said yes! Afterwards we found a restaurant with a stunning view so we could celebrate with a glass of bubbly. I will always have special memories of Fisherman's Bastion.
Bastion. too busy very crowded with crocodiles of tourists & raining!Difficult to find a restaurant, good views if the weather had been better

Lovely view, great atmosphere.. Wow. The view from the Fishermen's Bastion is stunning. Don't worry about paying though, just wander through the lower levels and you'll see plenty without having to fork out.Yes it's a bit touristy, there was a random guy with birds of prey on his arm and one guy collecting for charity, but it's worth it all the same.Also, there's a stall near here selling chimney cake, which is made by layering raised dough batter on a spit over a fire making what looks like spiral tubes of cake and tastes like doughnuts.

Amazing View. I've chosen to stay near this area of Buda as the view is simply amazing. Although this place can be crowded at times with tourists, nevertheless, the beautiful view from here simply make up to it. I love spending my evening here and enjoy some drinks while sitting at the cafe overlook the Danube and the city of Budapest. Is a must visit place in Budapest! You may want to take a stroll/walk to this place from the city and it takes about 15 - 20 minutes and later take a bus back to the town.

Great view, worth a visit. Head up here (we got here easily by bus) for an awesome view of the city. A little frustrating that to get to the best best spot they charge you but overall still an enjoyable visit.
Must. Come here and gaze the panorama of Budapest, the view is breathtaking. -1 point because they charge just a bit too much for the upper terrace.

Spectacular View.. This is an attractive spot, that was once a Fishernen's market (Why they would climb all the way up here to sell fish I cannot imagine?). It has now been restored and sits in gleaming white stone on Castle Hill. It is a spectacular spot, but in reality is is now just a good spot to look down over Budapest. It is however not "Free" as you can only get to the lower levels for free, the really good views require a ticket. It is a great spot to take pictures of the city and since it is close to the Cathedral certainly worth a visit. Just be aware that there is not actually a lot here.

Good views but not a true classic. Fisherman's Bastion is something every Budapest visitor should put on their list, but don't expect something that's truly classic. It's only about a century old and is a neo-gothic structure that's never been part of the city's defenses. It was pretty crowded when we were there but the open terrace is free and offers good views over the river and looking towards the Pest side. We were told the food in the restaurant there is pretty good but the time of day wasn't right for dining so can't give a personal comment. It's more of a point of interest than something historic, but is right next to the beautiful Matthias church which is also well worth a visit.
Awesome . Buda and Pest are amazing cities, I was with my wife in summer. I recommend to use Big Bus Tour. The Fisher's Bastions is a majestic temple of the Hungarian ancestors.

Great Views. I agree with many of the other reviews provided. This place is very touristy and crowded, but it is worth visiting for the views. There is a stunning view of Parliament. I visited as part of a city tour, so I was spared the steep hikes up the hills of Buda. You will not need to spend much time at Fisherman's Bastion, and there are other sites worth seeing on Castle Hill.
Beautiful!. Great place ovelooking the river and Pest side of the city. Located several hundred meters after Buda castle, make sure you don't miss it!

Great views from the top -and free!. Earlier reviews commenting on poor value for money are (at least for the moment) unfounded, as the coin-operated barrier has been disabled and you can walk to the very top without paying. You are then treated to one of the world’s great city panoramas, overlooking Pest, with the Parliament Building and Chain Bridge being the highlights of this magnificent stretch of the Danube. As a bonus, the Bastion’s small arches and (rather dainty) ramparts provide an ideal background for those obligatory we-were-there photographs. Should the authorities ever reintroduce charges for the top level…..well, the views from the walkways below are just as good and always free.

Nice Views. The views from Fisherman's Bastion are very good. We were a little surprised at the cost of tickets just to go up onto it, but learned later from a young woman living in Budapest that it is free after a certain time at night (6 I think). The night views would be lovely too.

5 Nights in Budapest. What a great view point overlooking the city - we stayed quite a long time on the rooftop cafe which is part of the complex. It was a lovely sunny day so we were there an hour or more.

Church lovely, Bastion forget it! . The Mathius church was outstanding and we'll work the entry price of 1200 huf each. The Bastion however was a huge let down. There was loads of work going on and so we could only access a small section but they still charged full price. I really would no bother. There is also a charge to have a pee of 150 huf each. Church yes, Bastion a big no.

Very touristy. Well worth a visit but do not bother paying to go in; the views are better from outside to the Bastion at the Castle and the best view of the Bastion is from down the hill. But be sure to visit as it really is very impressive.
Best view of the town. The Fisherman's Bastion offers the very best view of the lower town of Buda and the whole of Pest. History abounds.

Dramatic views, if you can manage to get to one!. This historic bastion gives a remarkable view of the parliament buildings across the Danube. Be orepared for a bit of a walk uphill, past shops and restaurants to get to it. When we were there in Late September there was a fair bit of construction around the bastion near the church which made for uneven walking and signage was poor. The hoards of people, especially groups of young folk occupied the turrets taking selfies so it was almost impossible to get a view from there. Awesome place if you can stand the crowds.

crowded out. Perhaps if you arrived very early in the morning it would live up to the image you see of it from afar, but it is crowded with tour buses and ticket queues. The whole of the castle district is like that with too many souvenir shops.
Superb view !!. We managed to view the parlimen from the top of the place at both day and night !! This place is crowded with tourist but really worth the visit !!
Great views. There are great views of the Danube and of the Pest side of the river from here. It is very much like something Walt Disney might have created.

Amazing views. Some of the most amazing views of the Danube can be enjoyed from the fisherman's bastion. The architecture itself is quite nice and makes you remember Disneyland's fairy palace/castle. There are lots of nice places to eat and drink nearby as well which always helps.You should definitely visit it once during the day and once during the night - as the views are different at both the times.Totally recommended experience once in Budapest.

What a gorgeous site to visit!. The history behind the building, the old Church with its tiled roof, its spires, and the stories behind the structure - all worth the visit! The lane leading up to it is full of quaint souvenir shops, where one can buy the icons and knickknacks that Hungary is famed for. Great views of the city and buildings across the Danube!
Views. Interesting attraction with fantastic views across Budapest and the Danube River. Lots of towers and terraces and a huge statue of St Stephen of Hungary.

Fairy Tale Architecture & Great Views. What a fantastic place to take pictures. The views along the Danube are spectacular. Many places to eat & drink nearby, including some romantic and relaxing venues on-sites. Don't really need to pay the 700 HUF fee to enjoy it. Check it out at daytime and evening.

Amazing to see both day and night. This is a place you need to explore during the day then do a night tour up to it, or at least past it at night. The views from there in the day are fantastic and at night it looks like a palace out of a Disney movie!

great views. the structure looks a little like something from Disneyland but it's interesting and you get great views across the river Danube. I wouldn't bother to pay to go to the upper level as the view is only a few feet higher. We ate at the restaurant on the terrace, where you get the view for free, plus good food (see my separate review).

Fairyland on the Danube!. Charming architecture is an understatement. These uniquely beautiful structures transport your imagination and your open up your spirit. If you yearn for something new, something special, spend the afternoon strolling around Buda's gorgeous Castle District.
Buda. Do not miss this scenic stop. It's a must along with the Castle and St. Matthias. Lots of tourists by bus, but well worth it! Great photo op.
it's a must. Beautiful river with nice view to the town... We made a boat trip during the day and it was fantastic.
World class site. Not only very interesting to look at but also provides a wonderful vista looking from Buda onto Pest as well as a pleasant walk down towards the bridge.

A good visit.. Something good to do on a day in Budapest.Its seven Neo-Romanesque towers create a faily tale-like atmosphere. There's a walking path that connects all the towers and a lovely cafe. It's completely worth paying the admission price, but don't forget your camera!

Fantastic view and a beautiful city. We were in this city for a short stay as we were joining a cruise along the Danube River. On the first night we walked up to Fisherman's Bastion and I must say that it is beautifully lit up at night and the crowds are so much better than during the day. The view of the river and city is just lovely. We also went back during the day as an excursion with the cruise ship. It is certainly very popular with lots of tour groups around during the day. Though we did get to enter the building which was great. Definitely worth while a visit at either time of day.
Best place to visit. You should not miss this area. On the Buda side of the Danube . It is stunning both the views over the river and the buildings. Give yourself about half a day to see it all.

A must visit.. Lots of steps but an absolute 'must do'.
Lots of shops and bars and beautiful historic buildings, the area is gorgeous with great views to other side of river.

Great views even without entrance fee. This is well worth the trip to Buda hill and really does offer some of the best panoramic shots of the Danube and Pest on the other side. I wouldn't bother, however, paying for the entrance fee. The views aren't any different if you're on the "free" level and the Bastion itself is more interesting from the outside than in.

Lovely meal in a fantastic location. Beautiful restaurant with magical views across the Danube towards the Parliament building. The food is beautifully presented by attentive staff. Quite expensive so attracts the wealthier tourists. We were with a Hungarian friend who told us she was probably the only Hungarian in the place.

Beautiful. We visited the lookout point Fisherman's Bastion on a sunny day in September and loved it! We walked around Mathias church to the left and climbed the stairs up the bastion from there. We didn't have to pay a fee. Perhaps a fee only applies from some entry points. There are some lovely looking cafes and bars along this section of Castle Hill and on the Bastion itself which offered beautiful views, although we didn't sit down. The view from the Bastion is magnificent and well worth it! To get to the top of Castle Hill, you can take a Funicular but the climb is not far at all and has lovely views along the way. We recommend walking up if you are able to. A beautifully scenic place.
Panorama view. Really nice place on Buda hill. Perfect for taking pictures of Pest part (Danube, Parliament bulding, bridges etc.)

Absolutely the best view . Here you can shot the perfect pic of Budapest and the Parliament. It's wondeful and very good the church and the places around that. I pay the fee, but it's useless because the free part is way better.

cool. If you like beautiful architecture, this place is for you. You can see there fantastic views of the city and Danube. But it's better to vizit it not in weekend because it's overcrouded by huge number of tourists. And not to change euro in forints there because the rate is awful.

One of the best views. 7 towers for the 7 leaders that meet here and decided to found Bupapest, this is a landmark and a stunning place to see the city, especially at night.There is a fee to enter the top of the tower, but you can avoid that if you visit after 9 pm that none will be there to ask for a ticket... And in all honesty that is the best time to visit to see the city lit up. So essentially its free. Enjoy.
Beautifull City view. One of the best places whre you can tak a photo of Parliament! Also recommend to visit in the night. The Building itself is a nice piece of architecture
So well restored take time to see the area.. Wonderful views, a delightful area not to be missed. I disliked the rain but that did not deter us from exploring the area.

Fine attraction. Walked from Elisabeth bridge all the way up to the Fisherman's Bastion. Unique architectural design. Great look out point over the Danube. Another one of an endless array of landmarks visible from the shores of the great river. Enjoyed a beer in the cafe alongside the attraction. Breathtaking view of the Hungarian Parliament across the Danube. Classical music band playing added greatly to the experience.

view of the city. a fantastic building to look around but also a great vantage point for viewing over the Danube and the Pest part of the city. A nice little cafe there to sit and drink a coffee and look out at the view with a three piece playing violin drums and cello

Strange building overlooking the river Danube and Parliament. This gothic stone fantasy which sits by St Matthias Church - it has no link I can see to fishermen. It is a sort of outlook terrace and as such is useful. t's not worth queuing and paying; You can get decent photos without paying;. An impressive statue of King Stephen is behind it

mixed blessings. Viewed from the river the Fishermans Bastion stands out on the hillside of Buda, when you get to the top there is a small charge to make use of the bastion to take some excellent views over Pest, it is comprised of seven towers representing the seven Magyar tribes that formed Hungary.The site dates back to the middle ages when the rampart was defended by the guild of fishermen.It can get Very busy so be warned and keep your valuables close!!

An Architectural dream. What a beautiful part of Budapest, if you are interested in Architecture it is definitely for you.The buildings from the Road look like a modern take in a fortified castle, all very nicely laid out and maintained. When you go upstairs, it opens out in to a lovely square with a beautiful statue of a knight on a horse. There are a lot of building to explore, when you walk up the street there is a few beautiful and well preserved streets to walk around in, a lovely church too.You can easily walk down to the castle from here which has historical ruins. The day we visited there was a week long Wine Festival running (early September) the admission for which seemed reasonable £12 and you get your own glass. We did not stay for it so cannot say if you paid much for the Wine you were tasting.Their are guards on the building opposite from Buda Castle, if you are lucky you will catch the changing of the guards.
Lovely. Well worth a visit, and especially on a clear day. Interesting to see how they have incorporated a Restaurant on it.

Great View!. Although it was raining the day we were there, it was still worth the small admission to see. The view from here takes in both the Pest and Buda side of the Danube River. The Bastion is unique in it's construction and well worth seeing as well. If coming to the Castle, it is a nice side trip!

Overhyped. The other reviews are very accurate, and you need to decide whether it is worth queuing for the tickets to climb up on to the walls to get some stunning views over the Danube, or simply walk around the Cathedral by the Hilton and climb up the other section of the wall with more limited views.
Disney castle?. Wonderful views from top, but you need a lot of empathy with the architect trying to understand what he had in mind...
A great view. It's worth the small admission price to enjoy this lovely view of the city. However, if you are expecting more be warned that this is really just a glorified overlook.

Fabulous views. Fishermans Bastion is not only beautiful to look it, it's got some amazing views of Pest from Buda. A lot of people were paying to go up it, but if you went near the Hilton hotel, you could get up for free.

Amazing view. Half of the Bastion was closed due to construction, but it's a stunning view of the city in on the Budda side. The whole area is worth checking out with a stop at Fisherman's Bastion. A great place to stop for a snack and enjoy a view.

Nice but crowded. The view is nice, but very crowded, some dubious characters are collecting tickets for going to the upper level, there is work going on on the street, if You cross in front of the church and go down next to the hotel, there is a nice restaurant at the Fisherman's bastion and You can go up to the higher tower without paying

Fascinating view. Fisherman's Bastion is a nice structure on the Buda side of Budapest and looks like a castle. You get fascinating view from there of the Pest side of Budapest. A nice place to take pictures of the Parliament building with the Pest city on the background and the Danube river in the front. It was very crowded and ought to be for the great view. You don't need to spend much time there but must do.
Gorgeous Budapest. One of the most beautiful spots of Budapest. The buildings look awesome and you can tale fantastic pictures there.
Great views. It was very very busy when we were there but it is worth the visit for the views alone. Looking out over the Danube and Pest is amazing. Definitely worth the visit.
Views over the Danube towards Pest. Good as a look out point across to the Pest side of the City, but otherwise this is not so exciting imho.

Stunning night views of parliament. I have been here many times and return every year for the budapest wine festival, we begin our trek to the festival from Halasz Bastion and the beauty of the place and craftsmanship never ceases to amaze me.
Wonderful view. An interesting building with a wonderful view of the Pest side.I recall not accessible to people with disabilities.
Nice city view. We liked the view, we did not pay the extra for the short walk as previously mentioned. We visited the church was good to visit.
Great View of River and Pest Side. Fantastic view to the East and the river and Pest side of the city. At night with the illumination sight is fantastic.

Bit of a rip off!. Don't get me wrong - great view of the city and great for photographs but certainly not worth paying to go the upper level took about 20 seconds to walk the length, although there was some work going on so may be not all open - if this the case then there shouldn't have been a charge.

Beautiful architecture, stunning views. Together with St Mattias Church located just nearby, Fisherman's Bastion was the no. 1 sight during my stay in Budapest. The beautiful white arches of the Bastion with a view of the city create a romantic atmosphere. When I was there, there was no entrance fee.

A fantastic view over the City. From the Bastion there's a great view over the Danube and the City, although the weather wasn't brilliant at the time. Is it worth the HUF700 pp? that will be a judgement call - and must depend on the weather.
No Point to Pay. We paid the 700 HUF per person. No point, in retrospect. There is nothing to see one could not see from other vista points.

Nothing fishy here!. Well-known for the wonderful panoramic views it provides of the city of Budapest, the castle-like Fisherman's Bastion was built in 1905, mainly for decorative purposes. Its seven Neo-Romanesque towers create a faily tale-like atmosphere. There's a walking path that connects all the towers and a lovely cafe. It's completely worth paying the admission price, but don't forget your camera!

Great place to visit. Go to Fisherman's Bastion while in Budapest best way of getting there is the hop on hop off bus.
The building is amazing and the view across the city and river is fanastic

fantastic viewpoint. It becomes very crowded with tourists so pick your time carefully. The views across the Danube into Pest are amazing. Very easy toget to by bus, tram or even to walk andclose to other magnificent sites.
view, history. It's a worth seeing place because of the view and the history of its origins. With "the Budaest Card" for free.

What a view. A wonderful view overlooking the city of Budapest and the river Danube its a steep walk up to the viewing point probably difficult for older people with any walking problems so get a taxi up to it or see if there is a service bus.

Awesome View. This is an amazing venue in which to see the city beneath. Can you imagine what it was like beforet he buildings went up. Th ephots I got from here were amazing and this is probably why it is a main stop along the guides of the city. You really need to come to see this place.
Beautiful. This is a beautiful structure with an amazing view of Parliament. It is on the Buda side of the city and overlooks the Pest side. It does not take long to see.
Great site to visit. A very old site looking down on Pest from Buda... You see the Danube all of the bridges. Great spot for pictures.

You get a great view of the city from here. We visited Fisherman's Bastion tour group. You get a fantastic view of the city of Pest across the Danube including the Parliament Buildings.
There are stairs to climb but the picture taking is worth it.

Great view, entrance could be free. The Fisherman’s Bastion itself is very beautiful, the view is also great, a good location for taking pictures of the Parliament. There is an entrance fee to go up, but after around 6 pm all the staffs will be gone, you can’t buy tickets anymore but everyone can just go pass the gate to go up; wait after 6 pm is not a problem for us as we want to take pictures of the Parliament at night.

Great views but don't pay to go in!. Lovely views over to the Pest side of the city but not worth paying to go in. Only cost 700HUFs (approx £1.75) so I suppose it's not worth complaining about. But having paid to go in, you are only allowed up steps to the top and most of it was cordoned off as work was being done. Better to stay on ground level for free. Views almost as good. Plus was then charged 150 HUFs to use th toilet!!!

Informative excellet viewa of Pest. I enjoyed everything about this city and all it has to offer .such History.The baths is another thing I had one of the best massages of my life with a massage therapist who was also a chiropractor.
great for a stroll. What a brilliant spot for views of the river and surrounding cityscape! We enjoyed strolling around the streets of this area.

Free entry to Bastion. Great place to get the best photos of Budapest. Walk around the church to the left and entered the Bastion , which required no payment of entry fee. Climbed the stairs to the top and had a coffee, with the best views and service in Budapest. Well worth the visit it has a special charm that makes you smile.
A Photographer's delight. Its a good location to snap pictures of the Hungarian parliament building. There is a restaurant located at the end of fisherman's bastion from where you get a better view.

Great views. Stunning in its own right, this place is a great place for photos (especially looking over the Danube to the Parliament building). There is a cafe underneath with beers and soft drinks around 800 huf + service charge.

Nice part of the Castle District as a whole. Don't go just for the Bastion, include it as part of an overall tour of the Castle District. When we were there a few weeks ago, there was massive construction going on, and the noise, I felt, detracted from the overall experience, but the views are very nice from here. Great photo spot.

It's all about the views. For the paid part the views are great, and try to look for a less crowded hour to make it worth it, it's very cheap so you will enjoy it anyhow. For the free parts, some restoration work was taking place so access was limited, also the architecture has been adapted to become a restaurant with a view, so you're just allowed a few gaps within it to appreciate the nice views of the river.
What a view. Loved walking around the Bastion and had drinks on the balcony overlooking the Danube. Great place for photos overlooking the Danube and the Parliament building.

Architecture stunning, atmosphere sterile.. Probably, the one place in Budapest i wanted to be able to throw superlatives at but in the end it was 'is that all there is?' Don't get me wrong, the architecture is stunning but with the crowds and the pointless admission price onto the Bastion, I came away after 1/2 an hour disappointed.Best 'photos are taken looking upwards, directly below the Bastion, if you can get a shot without the crowds.

Breathtaking views. When in Budapest this is one of the must see sights and places to take "that shot". Great views of the Houses of Parliament from here and the architecture of the bastion is fascinating. Don't miss it.

Unfinished, but beautiful. Upon my visit two months ago building works were going on all over the Fisherman's Bastion and, as a result, parts of it were inaccessible. However, from what remained and the potential that I saw from the building I would thoroughly recommend it. The walls are among the most beautiful and exquisite walls I have ever seen on a castle, and from them you can see all the way across Pest to the horizon. I hope one day to return again and finish my exploration once the renovations have finished.The cafe/restaurant built into it did seem quite nice from the outside, but expensively priced - as did a lot of the area around castle hill in Buda. Save your money and stock up on drinks whilst in Pest before making the trip, would be my advice. Drinks one will certainly need if they attempt it, as I did, in the middle of the day. The hill isn't too large, but it is an exhausting climb with how hot it can get.

Overrated. It's OK to walk around the Bastion and the church nearby, but it's not worth paying good money to go up to the Bastion's ramparts. The view doesn't change appreciably. The entire surrounding area is what one might call a tourist trap. A glass of fresh fruit juice was a shocking 2000 Forint, and souvenirs were obscenely priced too. Suggestion: don't make the Bastion the only reason to visit this part of town. Combine it with a leisurely walk around the Castle District. Do it on your own, not as part of a group with a fixed itinerary. Soak in the history, the views. Just be careful with your wallet. I believe pickpockets are quite active here.

work in progress. When we visited in early September, New paving was in progress making it awkward to get to the northern half of the Bastion, we were glad we made the effort, as the Halasbastia bar had a very good two course lunch offer!

An incredible building!. I had never heard of Fisherman's Bastion before I went to Budapest. I would like to mention the architecture. It is just amazing, but so is the Budapest smothered with architectural gems. As I have understood it, the bastion is built up so we get the best view of the city. And with that thought in your head the Bastion is a huge edifice. It was built in the 19th century. I just add a link and it speaks for it self. http://www.fishermansbastion.com/
Must Go. Beautiful views of Pest and river and really something to see.But it is very crowded and a challenge to enjoy all that the area has to offer.
Beautiful. This place is gorgeous, and has great views over the city. Definitely worth visiting. It's quite a nice walk up from the bottom as well - not too steep or strenuous.

One of the "must see" highlights. Fisherman's Bastion is definitely one of the highlights of Budapest and a “must see”attraction for every tourist. Architecture of this place is so unusual and interesting, that you feel yourself like in a fairy tale. And, of cause, stunning views of Pest will enchant you.
Beautiful. Brief tour of this incredible place. It looks a bit like Disneyland from across the river, especial tat night with all the lighting. Well worth seeing
Fantastic view of Pest. Just wonderful, the views of Pest are great. But enjoy all what is around you on Castle Hill. Some of the greatest architecture I have ever encountered.
