View to die for.. Arguably the best view of Budapest. No tourist should mis it. Try to go early as it gets crowded after about 11 a m. On a different note. Watch the taxis. They should start with fare no 0 or 1, otherwise they will cheat you. If you ask for a bill, it will help.

All part of the Buda experience. This place is STUNNING and the views from the walls are incredible.No visit to Budapest would be complete without a visit to the Buda Hill.It can get very busy here and you may struggle to enjoy the view (you can pay a small amount to get on to the top tier of the wall) but my tip is to go round the back of the church by the side of the Hilton and go to the terrace of the Halaszbastya restaurant where they serve coffee and drinks ,take the weight off your feet and enjoy the wonderful views in relative peace and quiet.
LOVED IT!. very pretty, great veiw, must see doesn't have to go in, but it is nice to take a walk on the bastion :)
Stunning. Marvellous architecture. Like something out of Disney. Stunning and definitely a sight not to be missed!
Visit to Buda. Overrated as it seemed to be selling the view. No one could explain what else we would benefit from !

Not sure why you pay to go here.. We paid the fee to visit this attraction, we weren't entirely sure what to expect so were surprised to find we'd paid to walk along a couple of hundred yards section of the castle wall.
It's very nice, but the rest of it is free and just as nice, so don't bother is my advice.

History and Amazing view. I was stunned by this iconic buildings. I paid the entrance fee to see the view and look the fairy tale towers but if you just go to Halaszbasya restaurant same view and the same iconic buildings welcoming you pluss you can spend the entrance fee on food and drink

Beautiful view to the Pest and Danube. Very nice place to visit and enjoy the view of the river and the Pest. But a few years ago you could come and visit. Now you have to buy a ticket to enter! Unclear why. Also there is a new cafe under the bastion, where in the past you could stand and enjoy the view for free. Now there is just a small piece of balcony where you can stand and watch free.
Stunning View. The castle looks a story from a fairy tale. Stunning view of the Pest Side and gives you a glance of the Danube River and the iconic Hungarian Parliament.
Fee is silly. Lovely views from this site but teaming with your bus types and i was stunned to find a charge justTo walk along a wall!! Still worth a look though!

Great Views. Great views of the city and the cafe at the viewpoint is nice with live music and good cocktails. Don't bother paying to go up the steps though. Not worth it. You can get the same view from 10 feet lower.
Beautiful overlook.... From the top of Budapest you get the best view of Pest. The best picture spot on your walk on Castle Hill.
Wonderful view. You should see this place which is located across the Danube River. It has breath taking Budapest view.

Great views, but really, why charge a fee ?. The bastion is a great place to get good views over the Pest side of Budapest, and is a must during a tour of the castle... I remember visitng years ago, and I don't rememebr paying a fee to enter the top of the bastion, but now you need to pay approximately a couple of Euros each...It was really busy, but few people actually paid to climb to the top...so it was almost empty

Breath taking views. The view that you get of Budapest is breath taking. A very memorable place to visit. Only problem is no matter what time of day you go there, it's always packed and you have to be prepared for dealing with the crowds.
Wonderful views. Get up to Fisherman's Bastion, if only to see the views across the Danube. It's in the Castle District, so it's surrounded by other wonderful places to see.
Wonderful!. Very nice spot in itself (construction and area) , from there you can have also a great panoramic view of Pest!
What a view. Arriving up there and seeing that amazing view is worth the trip. Bring your camera, you'll want to take pictures from every angle, because the view is fantastic

Interesting walk tour. We had the chance to visit it for free, we did not have to pay anything maybe it was just luck, and it truly gives you a nice view across the Danube. It's very crowded indeed but if you are in the neighborhood i wouldn't miss it.

Nice view, visit when the guards are away. It offers a nice view but it's not worth paying for it, since you almost at the same height when you are at castle hill. Instead I would recommend, wait after 9p.m. then it is free and the night view is also very cool.

Nice, but doesn't make sense to pay extra for it. The payable part is nothing different from the rest so actually going a bit to the left handside, where also cafe/restaurant is you see the same. Otherwise very nice and of course if you are on the castle hill you can't miss it
Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful!. It is a must while in Budapest. Once you see it....you'll understand. There is no way I can put in writing an evening view of Fisherman's Bastion.

Nice to see, but not worth $. nice to see,even draw from across the way, but definitely not worth having to pay just to walk across. (Not that it was expensive)but The view you get from there is the exact same if you were to go to the (free) bench the next beat over...

Cool, but crowded and fake. The bastion was built for looks only, it was not originally done when they first built the buildings on the hill, nor used. It was simply built for decoration....which has amazing views. I did not pay as it was so crowded when I was there, but I still got good views
great view of the city. From here you have a great view of the city during the day and at night. Even though most of it is free, there is one part that you have to pay to visit.

you pay extra to have a wee bit better pictures. if you don't pay the extra ticket fee, you can hang out on the ground level view (also spectacular) with the crowds. however, the extra entrance fee (about 800 fts?) allows you to go up stairs and have a lot more peace and quiet, and some stunning views and architecture. if you brought an expensive camera or have someone who likes posing, pay the extra for the upstairs. otherwise, it's probably good enough to skip paying for the ticket and just taking pics in the gallery downstairs.

Great Photo Ops, Day or Night!. It's like a cross between a sand castle and a fishtank ornament, but with 7 towers and views of the Danube and Parliament that cannot be beat! Lots of stairs and twists and turns and things to explore. And don't miss the interior of the St. Matthias Church next door... spectacularly colorful inside! Also recommend having drinks on the terrace at Fisherman's Bastion, and/or having a lovely, unforgettable meal in the "castle turret" of the Bastion Restaurant right there. Amazing food! Get there at sunset and watch the Danube glow blue with the golden Parliament building sitting on the shore (amazing photo op).

Great views across the river.. This area has undergone renovation and the white stone gleams in the sunshine. There are excellent views across and up the Danube and it gives the Parliament building opposite a chance to dominate the opposite bank. You can't really appreciate this when you are close to it. It gets very crowded though.
Amazing. Like a fairytale castle. Beautiful and interesting . Enjoyed watching an artist paint the castle and bought two of his watercolours.

The view. It gives one of the most beautiful views of Budapest and the structure is dreamlike.However, I feel the fee they charge to enter the outer rim of the balcony is excessive and should be eliminated. There are other ways for the city to make extra revenue.

Classic view, beautiful.. Go up to have a beer at the cafe in the bastion. Its a classic photo site and the view of Pest is exceptional. As of Sept 2014, there is a lot of construction in the area, but go up and enjoy the view

Fisherman's Bastion. A must see is the Fisherman's Bastion.One can only be amazed at the beauty of Budapest. I have seen it in times when it needed great repair but slowly all the areas are being revived and beautified to original state.

Nothing fishy about this!. The artwork (carvings) on the walls are beautiful. The architecture of this outdoor 'gallery' deserves a second look. The view across the Danube to the Parliament building is excellent and the church by the entrance is certainly a piece of art. Note: there is a fee to go for the better views.But, that does not mean you cannot get good views by not paying the fee.
Provides beautiful views of the city. Awe inspiring architecture & views of the city. Absolutely stunning in winter with a fresh coat of snow.

Great lookout. One of the best spots to see the beauty of Budapest. The place itself is a nice replica of a bastion.
As always in touristic places like these, the grid plays a role, and you are requested to pay about a euro to get to the second floor. Don't bother. The view is the same as from the first.

Crowded but good view. It's certainly worthwhile doing, but can be quite crowded. It is worth putting up with the crowds for the excellent views, however. Or get there early in the day or late at night...

My birthday. I went to this restaurant for my birthday dinner with my boyfriend. I will never forget that night. Starting from the location with a wonderful view of Pest+Danube. Food and wine were amazing! The service is perfect: very professional but super friendly as well! And at the end I got a candle to blow out while 10 waiters were singing "happy birthday to you"!!! That was fun and unexpected!

Nice views but no need to buy tickets if on a budget. The views of the river and the pest side are very good. There is a 800 HUF charge to climb on the upper levels but this is not required for quality of views. You get to walk around the structure and see the same scene below from various angles but you could do the same from the road level too for free. The place gets crowded during the day as the tours come in but it is much less frenetic mornings and evenings. Local Ladies selling lace work and artists with sketches add colour.

best view, especially at night. While Fisherman's Bastion itself impresses with its amazing architecture, it's the view from up there that makes it so special. In the evening (we went at 9:30 PM), the view over Budapest is just majestic.
go on a sunny day. shame went on a rainy day but views would be amazing the whole area is worth a wander. Very clean quiet and beautiful.

stunning views. superb views, and fanciful Gothic architecture, but it's become a big tourist trap, with hordes of visitors all doing their obligatory Budapest stuff -- and having to pay to go onto the upper balconies, which is a bit tacky....
Nice view to the Pest Side. Just fiew stairs and you can see the Danube and the Pest with Parliament, Basilica ect. There is also a restaurant with the view and often with the live music.
Interesting place. A very interesting building with amazing views across the Danube over to Pest. Pity about all the tourists though! A definite must-see when in Buda
Incredible views of Budapest. Found this to be an amazing place. Visited on Christmas Day Morning and found it to be inspiring. The views of Budapest are incredible and well worth spending your time.

Best view in the city. I returned to Budapest after a twenty year absence and this spot was still just as lovely as I remembered it. But, this time around we were serenaded by a five-piece Hungarian Gypsy band.

Beautiful. It looks like a princess should be on the balcony.
This is located right next door to a beautiful church with a fantastic selection of stained glass windows.

Nice architecture and lovely view. The Fisherman's Bastion is close to the Buda Castle. Nice architecture and there is a lovely view overlooking the river.
Worth a short visit but expect crowds during summer.

great viewpoint for the whole city. Fisherman's Bastion is a great viewpoint for the city, and you can visit the small shops in the area or walk over to the Palace. Paying the small fee to go into St. Matius' Church is also very worthwhile, as it is quite stunning inside and you may take pictures.
Beautiful views from here.. This is a place you shouldn't miss whilst in Budapest. Well worth a visit. Can thoroughly recommend.

A good place from which to see a lot of the river. There is a lot of interesting buildings and countryside to see on the Buda side as unlike the Pest side it is quite hilly. The palace and the church are both here and if tou are there at the right time you will see the changing of the guard at the palace. Do get the bus thar stops not too far from the hotel.
Great views. Construction work been done there at the moment nevertheless well worth a visit for the views, coffee shops, church and souvenir shops,.
Wonderful views. Vey interesting place to visit with fantastic photo opportunities to capture the amazing panorama of Budapest and the Danube.
Good view. mandatory tourist spot great view of the margin of Pestesouvenir shops and good local food. It's expensive
Fishermans's Bastion in process of renovation. With unique views on the Danube, FB is worth visiting. Currently under heavy renovation. Probably finished by end of year.

The 2 stars are for the view, not the attraction. I'm just glad we had our student cards with us as I would have been really annoyed to pay full price. Most of the bastion is being renovated and therefore you can only walk on a very small section, not that anyone mentions that when you buy your ticket. Go instead to the Citadella on Gellert Hill (walk up or take the number 27 bus from Móricz Zsigmond körtér) for much better views of the city from higher up and best of all, they're free.
Romantic view to the Danube. Walk around the Bastion than go up to the Margaret terrace of the Fisherman's Bastion for a coffee and enjoy the beautifull panorama, that you won't have from anywhere.

History plus!. So the oldest building you ever see in Australia is 200 years old . . . Imagine our delight walking around the castle precinct learning about history that goes back thousands of years! Oh and the views up there!!!
Spectacular. Views are amazing - architecture and the churches are inspiring - so loved my time in this city - the lights and people were fantastic
One of the top attractions in Budapest. In the shadow of the Matthias church, it offers a splendid view on the Danube river and its wonderful bridges, the Parliament and the Pest downtown area.

One beautiful sight to Budapest. The Bastion takes its name from the guild of fishermen that was responsible for defending this stretch of the city walls in the Middle Ages. It is a viewing terrace, with many stairs and walking paths. Beautiful
A must!. Wonderful architecture, unfortunately I found the St Matthews Church always closed, wonderful part of the city, nice view to the Parlament. It is worth to walk trough the park up to the top

View of the town from above. The bastion and landscape is nice day and night too. There is a restaurant in it, so you can drink a cup of coffee or dinner here listening live music. (The upper part you have to pay.)

Tumbs up!. Very nice food! Had a three course meal and everything was delicious. We were placed in a small tower, causing the waiters to not notice all of our request from time to time, but that didn't downgrade the total experience. very nice view over to the Pest side in the evening, with all the light brightening up the riverline.

Breath Taking Views. Hey Everyone,One of the must place to visit while in Budapest. One can see the entire city from the top of this place and the Buda Castle, St. Mathihas Church is all in one area. Spend the entire day and yet there is still lot to see. Lovely view of Hungarian Parliament which is very beautiful with the back drop of the river when viewed from the top. There is a lovely restaurant in Fisherman Bastion with stunning view of the entire city, bridges, and the lovely river, with live music played and a perfect place for wine or coffee. Very romantic and a perfect place for all. Lots of restaurants, and souvenirs, paintings and much more. Its the place which lifts one mood, its very beautiful and lovely. A perfect place to spend your day.

It compliments the view. Architecturally interesting and a great spot to take some nice travel photographs from. The surrounding attractions make the trip worthwhile. Buy the hop on hop off bus passes they are absolutely the best way to travel around the sights of Budapest. A city worth more than one visit

Such a beautiful place!. Visited it during a free walking tour, thought it was lovely. Learning that the towers represent the original Magyar tribes was nice, but the whole neighbourhood in Buda overseeing the Danube is fantastic.

The view!. It's one of those classic "gotta take it" shots that is worth the effort. You can get there by Hop On Hop Off bus, cable car, or if you're very adventurous, you can walk up..Castle Hill has much to explore but Fisherman's Bastion has the best views. It's every bit as beautiful as those tourist brochure pictures. But do try to go on a day when the weather is clear.
One of the best places to get a good view. There are great viewing spots even at the street in front of it. Go ahead and explore. Also, nice places to eat can be found inside the castle area.
Best Photo Pics. Great way to get nice and high for a great pic of the city. You can take the hop on hop off bus, walk up or take the funicular.
A must see in Budapest. One of the attractions every tourist must see in Budapest. Don't miss it when visiting Buda and the castle hill.
fairytale castle, loved by all ages :). beautiful fairytale type castle, well worth a visit, plus lots of quaint little shops in the side streets around
All about the view don't expect much history. . Great views day or night. Walk up hill next to the tram is not that bad as it looks. If you able to walk take the walk:) have fun!

📷 💫The incredible view of Budapest 💫. Friends , you must not definitely miss the place.!This is definitely a cover image to your album,Restaurants and cafes are great, with exceptional atmosphere.You can spend half a day in a fun... Highly recommendedWith great pleasureEli
Magnificent Views. Really the absolute best place to get great views of Pest with the Parliment Building and Danube.Unfortunately it is usually crowded. Get there early if at all possible.

Nice view, not worth paying.. Went here with my mother. I had seen it on trip advisor and thought it would be a nice stop whilst in the castle grounds. Having already seen the views from other buildings, this place really was a let down. We paid to go up, not really aware that it was only a small tower and short platform and it really was not worth paying. You can get the same view from underneath the platform. Great view but don't pay.

Go For the Views - Day & Night. Located in Buda, this area is an overlook within Castle Hill of the Danube River and Pest. It's steps away from St Matthias Church and its seven towers represent the seven Magyar tribes. You look out towards Parliament, Margaret Island and Gellert Hill. If you don't get up the hill by vehicle or the funicular, there will be many steps to climb. This area is can be incredibly crowded - be mindful of pickpockets. Several restaurants are in the area.

Outstanding view. Fabulous view of the Danube, the city, the Parliament Building, and the bridges. It's quite crowded, but well worth the view. It is located across the street from St. Stephen's Church.
Nice view. It has a spectacular view, and the building is beautiful, but that is about it :) But you can find other interesting sights at the same place.
fantastic views. It is nice and peaceful. The view is absolutely beautiful. We went there on the national day and there was a tradional ceremony going on which we really enjoyed.
Great views. Excellent views of the city from this elevated location. Worth paying the entrance fee as there are few really good spots in the castle area.

Worth The Walk - Uphill. This location, with much history, provides great views of the Danube, the beautiful Parliament Building and the churches of Pest, from the Buda side of the river.The architecture of the buildings is great but, for me, it's all about the views.

Don't go in August. A terrific structure with a tremendous view. However the crowds were also tremendous and much of the structure was blocked off by restaurants or perhaps other paid tours - no information given. Our tour guide gave us limited information about the structure however, even though he was informative about other things.

Halaszbastya. This place is so beautiful! The tile work alone on the roofs is amazing. The turrets outside protecting the Bastion are no less awe inspiring. Inside is a place to worship and has a very calming effect to those inside.

Great views of Pest. What an amazing place to view the city with all the bridges and the Danube. Linger over a cup of coffee or a meal at the top - or just wander along the edges to see these beautiful vistas. The architecture is fantasy but beautifully done. I highly recommend adding this to your "must see" in Budapest.

5 out of 5 if you visit by night!. Listening to my wife and visiting this Bastion by night was an excellent idea! By night you will see the Budapest to ressurect and become a whole new experience. The view of the river and the Parliament will leave you speachless. and this historic monument, will give you many not only the feast ofr the eye Budapest, but also walking through its stairs and arches is a must for the tourist.(Even for the tourist of the 1 day only)

Fantastic views. This place is a must. The views of the Danube, bridges and the Parliament building are brilliant. It is one of the best places for taking photos. We had a coffee in the bistro overlooking the Danube.
Amazing views. The best view of Budapest is here; if you want to take that perfect shot that best depicts Budapest, here is the place.

great views. wonderful views from the Fisherman's Bastion. can also find artists-whether strumming a guitar or actual drawn pictures-in and around the area. many different areas looking out at Pest so finding an area will not be a problem.

Do not miss it.. One of the most significant landmarks of Budapest, on the hills of Buda. A building of particular architecture, worth visiting. The view of Pest, the Danube, the bridges and everything is wonderfull. If you like, you can enjoy the view having a cup of coffee or a meal in the bistro or in the restaurant. One of the best sites for taking photos. You can visit the most part of it for free; you have to buy a ticket only for the upper floor.

Amazing architecture & view. looks like a castle built by Walt Disney, fun to walk along and the most amazing view of Budapest. Lots of stairs and arches, turrets. Nearby also worth paying to visit inside the church
Beautiful Views. We went on Fisherman's Bastion and were treated to beautiful views of the Pest section of Budapest. This was included on our tour. There is a fee otherwise.

Don´t pay entrance!. It has two parts, the first one you meet, paid. The second part, free. Good views in both, excellent pictures of Pest, but you can have them in both parts, so no need to pay entrance.
Beautiful views . The Fisherman's Bastion offers amazing views of the Danube and the city. It's worth paying the 700 HUF fee to go up to the upper section.

Nice views. The Fisherman's Bastion is only about 100 years old; it was built at the end of the 19th century the 1000 year anniversary of Hungary. The church is beautiful, the views are wonderful.The best views of the place itself are at night, when it is lit up, and you are on the other side of the river, near the Parliament, or the chain bridge. Then you see it in all its glory.

Nice views. The Fisherman's Bastion is only about 100 years old; it was built at the end of the 19th century the 1000 year anniversary of Hungary. The church is beautiful, the views are wonderful.The best views of the place itself are at night, when it is lit up, and you are on the other side of the river, near the Parliament, or the chain bridge. Then you see it in all its glory.

The View is the Attraction. While the Castle Hill is historic ground, most of the area has been rebuilt or restored over the years due to extensive war damage and lack of care during The Soviet occupation. There are wonder full views both the of the Pest and Budapest side, plus the river bridges, Many, Many photo opportunities, All the WC are pay available either by a shop purchase or direct payment to an attendant. I recommended the WC to the right of the entrance to the Fisherman's Bastion. They are new, clean and current cost is $1 or 150 HUF or 70 Euro cents, plus shorter lines.
you must see. this is a fantastic place to see and you see all the city from there, the danube ,the parlament and the Bastion too is like a very nice castle

One of the must sees in Budapest.. The view of the city is spectacular. There are steps to climb but the pictures are worth it. Wandering around the castle district is nice, and the St. Matthias church is there too.
Nice view. Nice view over the city,a walking tour that is full of surprises small places to eat and drink and a lot of potential magnificent photo shoots

Romantic atmosphere. Fishermans Bastion is one if the grand sights of Budapest, & can't be missed, especially when illuminated at night. The characteristic style, reminiscent of the Ottoman Empire, dominates the skyline along this stretch of the river Danube, jus across from the a Houses of Parliament.. Don't miss it !!

Good Way to get a view of city. Take a picture from this point as it will remind you of commercials you see on TV. Very good view. Plenty of things to do while you are visiting here. Just watch your pockets
Site. Nice area nice view must see area belongs to Budapest castle complex you can go walking but there are stairs or by car more easily

Enchanting. Really pretty and it does resemble the fairytale sort of ambient. The view is great so it's well worth the visit. We didn't pay to go up, it just seemed like a waste (as a previous member stated) because you can see pretty much the same thing and you can go to other areas, see the church, grab a bite etc. so you won't be bored.

Fantastic views of the city. Was being renovated when I visited so some construction noise, but well worth seeing for the views over Budapest and the Danube. Also some nice cafes and restaurants close by.
Nice View. This historic overlook offers very nice views of the Danube and Pest as well as the nearby Chatedral. It was very hot on a warm cloudless day but there were some shaded areas.

Fabulous view. I'll start by saying, this is a great place to visit and view Budapest from. However, DO NOT pay the ticket to go up because it is just a waste of money. you can see for free the same thing you see from the Bastion, and it is just a five minute walk.This is TOTALLY a tourist trap, so enjoy the place, go into the church that is there, but there is no need what so ever to buy a ticket to the Bastion. the bottom part of it is free, and on the left side there is a structure you can go up into for free as well.

Much ado about nothing. It is over-priced and offers nothing that is not available to those who stand outside the site. The structure itself is charming but surely should not require an admission fee.

Amazing. We did not pay to go up the Bastion however it is an enormous structure that you can see and only imagine the wonderful views of the river as well as the Pest side. There are so many great views that this seems liked overkill to pay for a view!

Great view!. Beautiful view from Buda overlooking the Danube and Pest side of the city! Free to view from the bottom floor, but have to pay to enter the second floor or wait until after 9 at night when everything is open for free.

Nice wiew form it to it. Really a nice stone job even never was used for military purposes. The wiew to the city of Pest as well as the view from Pest to this poit of Buda are really splendid. It really make sense to visit it.

So romantic!. View from the Bastion is fascinating, especially at night when Budapest is glowing. It reminds me of the architecture from Disney cartoons. When I think about Bastion, I always imagine a romantic couple sitting at summer night in some dark corner of the building, cuddling, kissing and enjoying the breathtaking view. It's a must see!Bonus: cup of coffee in the cafe bar inside the bastion is also a must, magnificent view and musicians who play classical music in the bar.

Very nice view of the city. It is a spot on the Buda hill where you can have very nice view of the Pest side and the Danube river. It is a must visit in Budapest and recommended to take some nice photos from there.
Great view. Maybe the most famous view on Budapest is from the fisherman’s bastion. A must if you visit Budapest. Should be combined with a visit to close by St. Matthias Church.
Must go in Budapest. Beautiful building, beautiful view of the city... If you are in budapeste you have to go there to take wonderful pictures!

Budapest Heights. The views are best from the Fisherman's Bastion, part of the castle complex in Buda. There are plenty of interesting and charming buildings in the vicinity, together with shops, cafes and restaurants. The day we visited there was a local music group performing and a man in costume with a large bird of prey. There is a funicular railway from the river to the top.

Nice Views of Danube and Pest from here. We ended our free tour of Buda here and took lots of photographs using this as the background as well as the River. We just saw the free portion of the Bastion. Did not even know there was a free portion.

Wonderful views. You can see the whole city from here, the views are wonderful. As everyone says, however, don't pay for the extra bit! The views are exactly the same from the free part. Go on a clear day and you can see for miles!
Beautiful views. The Bastion is a great place to take photos of Pest. Go ahead and pay the minimal fee to walk around the top, you'll be happy you did.
Very nice place. If you are in Budapest, don't miss a walk in Buda and check this place, from where you can view the whole city and admire its beauty.
Beautifull place. When we visited the Fisherman's bastion, there was a lot of construction going on. This spoiled the fun a bit. Still i think it is among the prettiest sights on the castle hill

Perfect for Picture Taking. This elaborate neo-Gothic arcade was built on fortification walls and is a perfect spot for viewing, looking out over the Danube and / or taking pictures. The entire area was interesting, quite a fun outing.

Nice views. Dont pay to go up.. Beautiful building with nice architecture. The views from here are fantastic, but its very difficult to take photos of the view because its always a very crowded place. Do not pay the ticket just to go 4 meters higher and see the same view. The local pastry is very expensive here, always ask for the price before paying.

Very impressive buildings. The architecture of this is amazing. A very good place to get really good photos. You also get a very good view of the cathedral. This is quite a famous are in Buda, and quite crowded.

Awesome, but don't pay for it!. Whoops, I should have read these reviews before we went. Bottom line: it's an incredible view, but DON'T PAY. You can get the very same view from the free portion. After we went to the paid portion (which was awesome), we went over to the free portion...and I was thinking "why did I just pay for that?" Oh well, it was like $3. Awesome views though!

Like a Fairy tale building. A very picturesque place near the Mathias Church at the heart of the Castle district. The best way to explore it to walk up to it from the Danube bank between Bathyány tér and Clark Adam tér. Just go towards the hill and you will find small streets with stairs leading up. It is not a hard walk and you could see the city from different levels. The Fisherman1s Bastion and the Mathias church was built for the millenium of establishing Hungary in the end of 1800's. It has great wiev of the city. You can walk around in it but if you want to go up to the turrets you have to pay entrance fee, While you are there visit the church and take a walk in the castle district, which is rich with history and buildings from old times.
Stunning. Very pretty, great views and in a lovely setting. There was some building work being done around the area at the time we were there but didn't spoil it.
Amazing views. No need to pay for extras…just walking around gives you all the views you need! Beautiful, clean, organized place to see.
Great views. Great views of the city from up here and the bastion itself is quaint even if it is nowhere near as old as it looks. You only have to pay to walk on the towers.

Don't pay for the view. Great views and I'm glad we went. However, I feel we were ripped off by paying for 2 tickets to the bastion. There was a very small section we entered and then came to find out that 95% of the area, with equally impressive views, was accessible to the public for free so there was no reason to pay. This is a must see for tourists, just don't make the same mistake I did!
What a good view, and much to do here. The view was spectacular, but there's also a lot to do here. Wouldn't shop here though, as prices are high. Go in the early morning to avoid the crowds.
Lovely views. Cheap but at the same time shouldn't really be charged for this it's only short.beautiful all the same and worth seeing
Great views of the city.. There are some great views of the city from up here. The Bastion itself is great to explore and take photographs of. Views of the church are also impressive.

Glorious Views. Definitely must visit in Budapest. Right outside of the Matthias Church. Lovely views and perfect photograph opportunities. There is a section that you have to pay to go higher up nearer the beginning but further in there are sections even higher again (& the same height) that were free so I don't see why you would pay for the earlier part!
Great Views of the city. It was worth seeing but very touristy and it was packed. Great panoramic views of the Danube and the Parliament,

Excellent views. Fisherman's Bastion is a terrace in neo-Gothic and neo-Romanesque style situated on the Buda bank of the Danube, on the Castle hill in Budapest, around Matthias Church. It was designed and built between 1895 and 1902 on the plans of Frigyes Schulek. Between 1947–48, the son of Frigyes Schulek, János Schulek, conducted the other restoration project after its near destruction during World War II.From the towers and the terrace a panoramic view exists of Danube, Margaret Island, Pest to the east and the Gellért Hill.Its seven towers represent the seven Magyar tribes that settled in the Carpathian Basin in 896.The Bastion takes its name from the guild of fishermen that was responsible for defending this stretch of the city walls in the Middle Ages. It is a viewing terrace, with many stairs and walking paths.A bronze statue of Stephen I of Hungary mounted on a horse, erected in 1906, can be seen between the Bastion and the Matthias Church. Adjacent stands the very modern Hilton Hotel which really challenges building regulations!!

amazing view and great food. We ate at the Fishermans Bastion on a fantastic sunny evening, watching the city light up below and enjoying a very good meal. The food is expensive by the normal standard in Budapest, but I think it was worth it for the view and the fantastic atmosphere.

Bastion is ok. The Fisherman's bastion itself is better enjoyed when seen from the river or from the Pest side of the city. But if you go to the castle district and keep walking to where all the tourist are going, you'll find St Matthias church and the Bastion, for both of which you'll have to pay to enter. I'd say the Bastion is not worth to pay for. You get the same astonishing views from other sides of the Castle district. Plus at the end of the Bastion there's a small bar-café, to which you can climb for free.
Has the WOW factor. This is a must see location on the Buda side of the city. It is located high up and has a cafe where you can take in the wonderful views of the city.
Nice view, little of attraction itself. Perhaps we expected more. The view is indeed great. However the building itself and nearby construction is not breath-taking
Great views.. The views of Pesh from this attraction are beautiful. Take your time to walk around and absorb the atmosphere. Worth the bus ride and walk.

Highlight of trip. Unfortunately, we only saw this from the hop-on hop-off tour bus on the last day, otherwise would have spent a half day here. It's one of the most beautiful buildings I've ever seen and has some of the best views of Budapest.

With a large pinch of salt.... The view this place provides is truly beautiful. However, I'm somewhat disconcerted and (being Hungarian) ashamed of the way this lovely place is treated and moulded into just another tourist trap, with a café/bar occupying, I guess, more than half of the Bastion and in effect separating visitors into a privileged (paying) group versus a "plebeian" (non-paying) group who must crowd together in the small "free" space provided. This doesn't go down well with me. If it's free, it should be free; if there's a price to pay for the visit, I'd be willing to do so - but this particular mixture of "free" versus "kind-of-free-but-you-must-consume-something-which-will-likely-be-overpriced" doesn't apply to me. At all.

Great views. As everyone else has said, this is the best place for view of Pest and the Parliament building. Fabulous views and within easy walking distance of the Palace as well. Which also offers equally good views of the city as well.Can get very crowded, so you need to be patient to get some uncluttered pictures. Best to come later in the day if you can. In the morning you get the sun in the face, which makes it difficult to get clear photographs without a lot messing around with exposure settings. Late afternoon you tend to get richer results and the area tens to be a little quieter. Not sure the extra payment for a part of the upper section is really worth it, but it does help pay for the upkeep of the area and has helped pay for the restoration and clean up.Well worth a visit. Come up on the 16 bus. Better option than queuing for the lift up.
It was ok.... When you walk on the castle hill is probably the least interesting one as it cannot overrun the palace and liberty statue. However, it does worth a visit!

Nice place to spend the afternoon!. There is an affordable restaurant inside the bastion, with a great scenery. There is a part of the bastion free of charge to visit. Also, you can just sit on the stairs near the bastion to listen to various artists singing.

great view over the danube. you need to buy a ticket to enter the fisherman's bastion but if you walk a bit further you can get the same views from a restaurant/cafe for free. if you want to enter the church you will have to purchase tickets from a ticket office that is a bit disorganized with large crowds

Nice architecture. A short walk from the Buda Castle to the Fisherman's Bastion. Nice architecture seen at the Bastion and took some great photos there. From there, we caught another picturesque view of the Danube River, Parliament Building. Bought some ice cream there, as the weather was relatively hot in June.

Great View. From this high up landing you can view the Parliament and the
magnificent bridges that span the Danube. Located right next door to the Coronation chirch.

Unique. Both times I visited during my stay, there were weddings on the Bastion so I was never able to climb the main tower. However, I find both the design (7 towers for the 7 tribes and shaped liked the tents they used to live in) and the view provided amazing. The only real downside was the construction going on.

A better view of Pest. This is the best spot if you want to get a nice shot (or even panoramic) with Pest as the background. Great place to see sunset as well, as you can see the gold ambiance shifting on the city, giving beautiful silhouette on Parliament and Basilica. Come here in the afternoon, it's less crowded as well :)

Fisherman's Bastion & Matthias Church. How interesting! On this tour we saw by bus the National Opera House and Hero's Square, both located on the Pest side. After seeing these sites, we boarded our bus for a ride to the Buda side where we visited Fishermen's Bastion and Matthias Church (on the hill). The view of the city was grand! From there we could see the Chain Bridge and Elizabeth Bridge, two of many that connect the two halves of this bustling city. How we wished we could have spent more time in Budapest, it would have been interesting to wander through this antique city on the hill. If you find yourself visiting Budapest, Hungary, spend a few extra days; it is worth it!

One of the main attractions.. One of the main attractions in Budapest is the of course the historical Buda side of the city. Near the Mathyas Templom, (Mathyas Church) one can find the beautiful bastions that overlook the Pest city side and the Danube. The stone structures are filled with carved statues representing warriors of old and provide a very pleasant view over the lower part of the city.Even if it was hotter than an orcish hell, we decided we should walk the hill side that leads to the Castle and enjoy the historical part of the city.Since it was July, an on season month, the whole place was packed with tourists from all over the world but we managed to find a small table at a cozy (even though expensive cafe) inside the bastion so that we can have the perfect look through the tiny stone windows.From up there one can see the impressive Parliament building, the quiet and blue Danube and the whole side of Pest, the new part city that vibrates with life.If you are into history, you should check out the Buda side as it is impressive, with its medieval houses and streets.

I love this spot!. I love the architecture of Fisherman's Bastion! Everything about this place is special...It is right by Matyas Templom (St. Matthew's Church) which is incredible, and right across from the Hungarian Parliament. You have an amazing view of the Danube, and much of Budapest! It is a wonderful spot!
pest. Spectacular views of the Pest side of the city. Very good resturant overlooking the river. Very busy during the day but the evening is very quiet.
Excellent- do not leave Budapest without visiting. Well worth the effort to visit. It is breath taking views of the river and the city. It is close to the Royal palace and several other attractions

Nice city. Went in oct13, although cold the sun was out making walking round a joy , lots to from the fishermans wharf(excellent spot for panoramic photos)to the many thermal spa baths.wide avenue's similar to Paris with shopping to match.cafés and bars were very cheap with some pretty quirky late bar/clubs.if travelling independent buy a 72hr transport pass at the airport, bus takes you to a station ten minutes away, underground metro into town.the metro runs everywhere and is a good way to get around if weather is poor,simply hop on and off, all major sights are marked on tubes, its a big place as well so you can cover more ground this way .was about £12 very good value

Gorgeous plae to visit. Went on a guided trip via our cruise ship the Emerald Star. Loved it so much we went back during our 2 night stay over in Budapest. Lovely church, plenty of quaint shops and an abundance of lovely cafes. The views are stunning! Well worth a visit if you are in the vicinity.

View is to-be-seen, don't pay for the upper portion. As everyone else has stated, the view here is very scenic, very beautiful especially at night. That being said, there's no reason to pay for the upper portion. You can get the view nice enough from the lower level.

Romantic lovely view, paid portion unnecessary. A fantastic beautiful place with a great view of Budapest's Pest side. As previous reviewers said, don't pay to go to the second story- just go through the cafe and you get the same view. It's truly magical, don't miss it!

Excellent panoramic view of Pest. The fisherman's bastion is a very beautiful building in itself, but apart from that, it is from here that the best panoramic views can be seen atop one of the towers of this building.

Nice views. The Fisher's Bastion is on Castle hill and can be considered part of the attraction when you visit the castle (you don't have to pay) and offers excellent views on Pest (it is on the Buda side of the Donau river) .

Fake charm. In te ancient setting of the Buda castle, the Fisherman's Bastion blends in very well as an excellent viewpoint onto Pest frequented by romantic couples. Do not forget thought that it was built in the late 19th century during the "renovation" - which at the time meant to redesign buildings and environment to the romantic style popular then. So this is a new addition, but a very charming one. Nowadays you have to pay to go to the upper level.

Lovely view, skip the paid portion. Fisherman's Bastion provides lovely views of Pest including the stunning Parliament building. We paid the extra fee (tickets are available at the same office as for the Matthias Church), but the same view can be had for free by walking up the stairs through the café area. Sure, the free area is a bit more crowded, but not by much and the view is just as nice. This is a great way to see the opposite shore without getting on one of the terrible tour barges.
Excellent views and sights. Loved tHe great architecture, and the views of the Danube and Pest from this vantage point is STUNNING!

Beautiful way to view Pest and Parliament. This is a stunning structure in and of itself. But, it also allows you to have beautiful views of the Pest side and the Danube. When we went, it was incredibly crowded and difficult to take pictures at times. If you want a less crowded option, there is an upper portion of the Bastion that you can access for a fee. I chose not to but if you really want to capture some pictures unimpeded, that may be a better option.

Best view ever!. No words to describe how I felt over there.The view is breath taking.You have the whole Budapest lying at your feet.If you are in Budapest and don't visit fisherman's bastion,you haven't seen anything!

Spectacular view. You can see the whole city from above and take great photos. There is a cafe/ restaurant where you can sit and enjoy the view. Try the funicular to go up (1.700HUF return trip), otherwise it's quite a steep walk up. You can walk down either taking the road or the stairs and look at the other attractions at the same time.
Had to pay for a better view. By paying you could go up and get a better view and less people. I didn't know what to look for so I just nodded and said nice. Waited till everyone decided to move on.

Worth a Visit. OK - if your tour operator takes you up by bus as the funicular gets very busy. Otherwise it is quite a walk. Good views from the top though and possibly worth the effort (or the wait) to get there

View and Food. The view is the best of the city from here. We had dinner in the Bastion restaurant and it was fabulous. The service was great and it wasn't crowded at night - which it is during the day.

My favorite spot. What a fantastic spot to appreciate Budapest from. On top of that the Bastion itself is a magnificent spot. Matthias church as a backdrop, breakfast, lunch or just a drink on the wall over-looking the Danube and Pest. If there is a better look out I have yet to see it.
Fairy tale!. Just beautiful! Very crowded and hot during the summer.We were asked to pay for the entrance but no one really asks for tickets...
excellent view of the city. this was included on our city tour. Excellent photo op of the "Pest" side of the Danube.Part of the Castle District and near Matyas Church.
So pretty. A lovely place to see the whole of Budapest with a lovely cafe out front with a spectacular view and good cocktails!

Fairy Tale Fortification. Fishermans Bastion sits in front of Saint Matthias Church and can be seen from almost anywhere in Pest. The name derives from the Guild of Fisherman who provided the funding to build this section of fortified city wall. It’s a beautiful sight – there are covered walkways with arches allowing fabulous views over Pest, with great views of Saint Stephen’s Basilica and the Hungarian Parliament building – either from the archways or from climbing the highest tower. And those towers wouldn’t look out of place in a fairytale. Within the Bastion, and one of the towers there are various (for the area more expensive) places to eat and drink.While most of the Bastion can be accessed without buying a ticket, it really is worth paying the 200 – 300 HUF (less than £1) to walk the one small section of the wall which is ticket access only. It gives by far the best views of the spectacular and multi coloured tiled roof of Saint Matthias church, only a few yards away.It’s very easy to spend a couple of days on Buda Hill seeing this, and the many other sights in that part of the city.

Favorite place in Budapest. Do not under any circumstances skip this place!!!!Great place to take cools pictures .Better skip funicular on way up and take metro line to Moscow station or bus 6 .On way down take footpath near Budapest Castle.

Great view over the Danube. Place where you must visit when going Budapest. Its beautiful in daytime,but you have to go there in evening when sun is going down. You see all the beautiful lights all over the city, wonderful sight.
A must in Budapest. Take the lift to go up here and walk around. Visit the amazing, historical grounds, the church. Take many photos as the view is amazing
View from Fisherman's Bastion. A good view, but not the best in Budapest. Go to the Russian monument (the one that resembles a girl holding a fish) on top of the hill for a better view of the Danube.

Beautiful building with the best view in town. It is a little bit of a trek to the top (if your not into stairs) but once up there it is well worth it. The building is quite a site alone. It was not really that crowded, its a touristy site so there are going to be people there but it was not like you were pushing people out of the way like some reviews made it out to be. There is a restaurant on top of the walls that offer a great view of the city but it looked kind of pricey. The view was probably the best part of the visit. The site offered panoramic view of the city center.A must see site for if it is your first visit to Budapest, there are other sites to see at the top of the hill as well.
Views. For a lovely view over the magnificent Danube and the beautiful buildings of Pest this is the place to go.
a must do. no visit to Budapest should be undertaken without visiting this historical and beautiful part of the city.
Don't need tickets.. One does not need The 1100 HUF tickets to get on the bastion. It's free entry and better views on the left and higher side.

must see at night. This place was mobbed during the day, and was much quieter at night. The night scene of the Parliament and the Danube from this site is breathtaking. The lighted roofs of the St. Matthias Church nearly by was mesmerizing.
Fabulous view. This place had a fabulous view overlooking the Danube River and the city. We took lots of pictures as it was an ideal photo spot.

Beautiful Buda Structure & Views. Worth the visit, all though as the day goes on, it gets busy with loads of tourists. Gorgeous structure, impressive roof tiling, and great views across the Danube to the city side of Pest.

What a view.. This structure gives you an amazing view of the city. You can walk along the lower level for free or pay (700F or approx $3.50 cdn) to go to the upper level. The view is great from both but more open up top. We paid and felt it was worth it. A must see for photo bugs.

Pretty, but touristy. Panoramic views of the Danube River are great from the terrace of Fisherman's Bastion. It's very touristy and draws huge crowds, which means great photos of the bastion itself (without 1,001 other people in the background) is next to impossible. Such a shame. Night views of the illuminated bastion looked lovely, unfortunately I was on a group tour and did not have the opportunity to visit again at night.

Nice place for a good view of Budapest. It is interesting place on the top of the hill - long walk if you don't use buses.Be sure that weather is good - fora nice view of Budapest.It was foggy when we went there and it was a bit of disappointment.

Busy but worth it for the views. Bit of a climb up lots of stairs and steep streets but worth it of the views when you reach the bastion. There were lots of tourists around when we arrived at 11:30am so go earlier if you want it to be a bit quieter. We didn't pay the extra and felt we got great views from where we were allowed to go
Great views. The view is superb. Not worth paying to go on the top tier, the views from below are equally good. It's a beautiful quirky construction with interesting (quite recent!) history.

amazing. Awesome, indescribably huge fortress with beautiful views of the city.Also there is a restaurant, and live music and views of the city make it an extremely romantic. Men note, this place is ideal for proposals ;)

Pleasant view across the city. The pointed towers of the Fisherman's Bastion has the best views over the river across the city of Buda-Pest. Although walking up to the top is a great experience, the public transport is a major add on to visit the place. Bus 16 goes directly to the Bastion. Going to the place after dusk could be interesting as you can spot the lights of the city from a good height. Also, the view of the Hungarian Parliament house from Bastions pointed towers is simply superb!!
Interesting. Pretty and interesting with lovely views but not much to do once you are up there and very touristy. The queue for the toilet was pretty cruel.
walk up and enjoy the views. This is a great place - nice architecture - great views - proximity to landmarks - and great people watching (while enjoying a snack of chimney cake:)

Lovely in the evening. We got a bus ( 16) near the Big Wheel in Pest, got off once over the Chain Bridge, went up the funicular railways, walked around the castle area, visited the bastion in the early evening, had a meal, went back to the Bastion in the dark to admire the sights and got the number 16 bus always back to the main square again. It was very peaceful, beautifully illuminated, relatively quiet, and one of the highlights of Budapest. Going in the evening made it quiet, photographs interesting, and lovely to visit. Positives were the church roof tikes, negatives were overpriced tourist trap restaurants and truly hideous Hilton hotel

History in view. The approach to this site takes you along a street with many native structures mingled with some built during the Russian occupation (shame they had to be built because they don't fit). The architecture in Fisherman's Bastion has to be seen to be appreciated

Go For the Views. The Fisherman's Bastion is a 19th Century folly built into the walls of Castle Hill in Budapest. It's name comes from the fact that maintaining that section of the wall was once the responsiblity of the Fisherman's Guild. Now, it's just a fanciful structure that affords a great view of the Pest side of the Danube, including the parliament building. There is also a cafe if you want to sip a beer or coffee while you take in the view. Of course, all the other tourists in Budapest will be sharing the view with you. Be prepared for selfies and posers.

Don't be duped into paying, you can see it for free. My trip up to the Castle Hill was a great experience as a whole. There is a lift that goes up there which you can pay to go on but why not walk up the stairs? You can walk around at the top, look at the castle, church, bastion and museum that are all up there. No need to pay extra to go up to anything as the view is just fine from right next to the bastion.

When in Budapest you have to Visit Fisherman's Bastion. You cannot visit Budapest without making the journey unto Fisherman's Bastion and take in the great views of the city across the River. Magnificent.

Best View of the City, and free. Though slightly artificial, the bastion gives you a fantastic view of the city scape. To sneak in free, just keep to the bottom floor, or go in the evening, or best of all, just take the stairs on the far left, which are usually unattended. Not something to devote a lot of time to, but the best view of the city!
Beautiful Views. Fisherman's Bastion is beautiful, its a wonderful place to start discovering Budapest as you can see out over the whole city. Definitely worth going to, don't miss it.

Stunning views . It helps that the Fisherman's Bastion is beautifully located at the top of the hill and next to the Church, so that if seeing it you'll probably be coming off the back of having seen the castle, but in its own right the Bastion is a thing of beauty. You might think that, given all the views of Budapest you've soaked in from up high, that the Fisherman's Bastion is just more of the same but it offers something more and, without having anything really notable to do other than to enjoy the view, nonetheless remains a special place in Budapest.

Spectacular Views. We visited Fishermen's Bastion as part of a tour while on the Viking Romantic Danube river cruise. Took bus to top of hill. Very crowded and lots of construction but neither dampened the wonderful views from Fishermen's Bastion. According to legend, there was a stronghold here which was protected in medieval times by a guild of fishermen. Spectacular views of the red-roofed Parliament buildings and of the Danube. You should go!
Loved it!. Fantastic vantage point to view the city. Budapest is a very romantic and intriguing city. Don't miss it.

Brilliant views. I visited Budapest in feb 2012 and the bastion was fantastic then. On returning this summer with got long clear days the views from the bastion are breathtaking. You can see across the whole of Pest and part of Buda. It is worth taking the short walk if you don't cheat and take the funicular or bus
Beautiful with interesting history.. It is a very popular tourist attraction and there are tremendous number of people. Probably it is better to visit it in the morning before the crowd.
Historical buda. Combined with the church an interesting visit. Very crowded and unfortunately a lot of roadworks but wonderful views over the city

A Lot of History. Went to the top of the hill to look at the some of the historical monuments and the view of the city. No charge and worth the time to visit. You would be disappointed if you did not. No. 16 tram takes you close by. Views are amazing and it is handy to the center of the city.

Stunning architecture. Worth a visit if just to take in the stunning architecture of this building. There is a fee to walk along the actual wall of this building which provides a great view over the Danube and Budapest. The view can be captured free of charge from many other places on Castle Hill so avoid walking the wall - just walk along at ground level where you still get a great appreciation of this wonderful structure.
must do, bit touristy. Ammazing views, busy touristy but worth the trip shame about the building work but will great improve acces when completed
Don't bother with the ticket. You can see the views just fine from the main bastion at the restaurant so don't waste your money on the ticket they sell with the church.

A must see and spectacular at night when lit up. If you're on a tour bus after 9 a.m. visiting the location it's very busy and tough to take pictures of the bastion. Spring for the extra charge (inexpensive) to go on the wall and take pictures of the Pest side. There's a restaurant in the bastion itself that takes away from the atmosphere but know you can eat and drink there.

Magnificent views. Brilliant area all around here to see Budapest from a height. Quite a steep climb to the top but so worth the visit. Plenty of shops - all selling tourist attractions and possibly the prices slightly higher than down in the city centre especially at the market.

Worth visiting, great views of Pest side too.. While it's definitely not stroller friendly, we shared time on the upper levels while someone stayed with the stroller.
You can however get beautiful pictures from either place. Tip: the restaurant on the far left of the Bastion allows you free access to the top. So, you might as well enjoy a drink!!

Great view. A must visit site to see a great view over Pest and the river,there is a charge to go up one flight of stairs to the top level but it is not worth it as the view is just as good from the free level.There are quite a few stalls selling tourist tat but you can get the same stuff anywhere in Budapest,There is quite a lot of work going on in the square outside the church causing a little dust and noise but it does not spoil the view.

Fantastic View, Very Good Food, Not Cheap. Arguably one of the best views in Europe (if not the World). Sweeping 230-degree view on the Danube and an additional 130-degree view on the Castle Hill and Buda side. Oh yes, they have a restaurant, too ..... After sever rounds of improvement now they have an excellent chef and the food is really good. Portions could be larger (couldn't it be always?) but the quality is very good. Service is polite and attentive. (One thing: why would they want to save a pitcher of ice water? We couldn't get one only the pricey bottled water.) So overall it's good but not a good value for money. In other words: very expensive.
Do not miss this site.. Though the Fisherman's Bastion was adjacent to our hotel, it warranted a couple of hours of strolling around and offered a tremendous point for photos. Do not miss it.
nice monument. It was a pleasure to travel in budapestThe bastion is very nice, very clean, nice panorama to see Buda
Great view. Great view on the Pest, Danube. Many people at the season. The ascent to the hill were light also for child.

Free - and beautiful - after 10pm. If you're coming to Budapest, you can't miss the fisherman's bastion. It has one of the most beautiful vies of Pest, and is by itself a wonder. During the day you can enjoy the view from the first level, and pay to go up - but after 10pm it is free of charge. My friends and I often will bring up a bottle of wine and some snacks, and sit and enjoy the lovely evening and beautiful view together.DO NOT take up the funicular (the cable car) - it is overpriced, and definitely not worth it. There are stairs up from Batthyany Ter, or if you don't want to climb then take the 16, 16A, or 116 from Szell Kalman ter. It is NOT a hard climb - my mother was able to do it with a sprained knee in a brace when she visited me.

Nice drink with a beautiful view.... You can't miss The Fisherman's Bastion if you are in Budapest. This beautiful and interesting building offers you a spectacular view, there you can take the best photos of the city. You will also find a first-class restaurant with excellent food, music and the service is perfect. You can also sit down just for a drink as we did. If you visit the bastion you are close to the Mathias Church and to the Royal Castle.
Beautiful views of the city. Excellent views of the city and the Danube. Be sure to visit the church and the garden. There's a lot of walking so be sure to wear comfortable walking shoes.

A beautiful place to spend your day. There's no better place to visit in Budapest! Great view, many places to explore (Matthias church, the national gallery, other smaller museums), full of souvenir shops and you can easily find a place to eat or enjoy a drink.
Incredible Architecture and Good View . This should be on your list! Really interesting and unique architecture and just a cool place to walk around and explore.

Best view in Budapest. Beautiful part of Buda. Can get there by bus from Pest. Museum's and Art Gallery closed on Monday's.Lots of cafe's and a few touristy shops. Great photo opportunities.Can walk from the bottom of the hill or take the cable car.The Hilton Hotel is located right in the center so great location for exploring this side.Public drinking fountain near small park next to the Methias church.Lots of walking tracks around the front of the area and there are preserved areas of the remains of and early castle floor and some walls.This area is undergoing lots of restoration of the footpaths and roads at present.
Best place for photos. Excelent view of the city and also a very interesting building. No need to pay to go to second floor as the view from the first floor is perfectly beautiful.
Very good. You cannot be disappointed with the food service and spectacular view. The music makes any occasion special.
good but touristy. Worth the funicular ride just for this . There is however much to see and great views of the other side of the Danube

Fishermans Bastion. The Fisherman's Bastion is a must see, some fantastic views, though you earn them, a lot of steps to climb! I didn't like the little cafe near the tourist information center near the Fisherman's bastion, staff were ignorant, my frappe was the worst I have ever had! avoid like the plague!

Nice castle, great view.. Welled built castle. Some towers are occupied by restaurants but still free for visitors. You don't have to pay for the ticket to get good views, but if you want, paid towers do have a little better views.

Stunning view (day & night). Wort to visit in daylight and at night as well. Lights of Budapest, especially the Parliament is amazing ! Would suggest to visit late afternoon to avoid huge tourist groups and the hot sun in summer. Unfortunatelly not too much history shared, and avoid paying for ticket, they do not provide better view than the free spots. Walk up to the top, the cafe shop does not requires to buy anything. Is a must if you are in Budapest !

Awesome views. This is well worth the walk or tram up the hill. There several sights in the area(church, castle, bastion). The views back over the river to Pest are spectular. The area can get a little touristy, so you want to try to go off hours.

Great view, but don't pay for it!. The views are fantastic, but we paid for a ticket that gave us entrance to a small portion of it. We then found that the views were equally good (if not better) from the tower in the centre, which is free to enter (there is a cafe at the top, but they didn't seem to require you to buy a drink if you were just popping up to take a photo or two).
great views. great architecture and amazing views of the river and of pesti would recommend a guide for a better history

Wonderful views and unique perspective. Be aware if it is hot outdoors, it is VERY hot here.
The views are worth any discomfort you may experience from the stairs. Paid entry for one side, but you can access the farther tower for free, I think. We walked the entire wall, and got terrific views of the city.
Nice view. From the Fishermans Bastion you have a view over all Budapest, so on the terrace there,you can drink your coffee in the morning.. best place in town

great view. better to go there by car and leave the car on the parking before the entrance (for money), the area is closed for autos. There is a great view from Bastion, nice restaurants and icecream. Also the best baking store in Bupatest - very tasty cakes.

A great panorama. It's not an ancient place (builded in 19 century, as far as i remember). There is the best panoramic view of Budapest. We came here on afternoon and we sit here on midnight (and it was the experience, like night watching LA from the observatory). Beer wasn't as cheap as in the other places in B., but it was worth the price.Also it is a fairy place, something, that separates hungurian architecture from typycally european one.White towers near themumeMatthew'smumultycolortiles are great!

Beautiful View of the City. From the Fisherman's Bastion, you are able to see the sites of Pest. Climb to the top and walk the length for great picture taking opportunities. Allow 20 minutes for appreciation.
Looks pretty nice.. Worth seeing, but I didn't pay for entering the walls. You get get basically the same view without climbing upstairs.
Lovely. A beautiful part of Buda the views are wonderful and everywhere is clean this can be viewed from the the hilton hotel

Amazing View of Budapest and the Danube!. On our first day in Budapest we took the time to trek up to Castle Hill and visited many of the sights as well as purchased a few small packages of Paprika (at a great price and many varieties). One of our favorite spots was the Fisherman's Bastion. The views from the ramparts were stunning and the stonework and statuary were amazing. We encourage you to take the time to climb up to the top of the rampart (in the free access area to the coffee house) and take in the views of the Castle Hill area and of course Budapest and the Danube below.

What a stunning place to be. Ok it's a place to allow a whole day wandering the villages, shops and we'll a great little supermarket with spirits upstairs including the chance to buy vintage champagne! Excellent day.
Beautiful. Beautiful architecture and view from the Buda side of Budapest. It's right near the Matthias church too, which is absolutely beautiful with its tiled roof.

One of many views. Cant quite work out why Fishermans Bastion gets such a high ranking. Yes, the views are good, but they are also from a dozen other spots along the river. The architecture is cute, but so it is also around the church and other areas of Castle Hill. I saw people paying for entry to one part of the turrets-why do this when you can get to the same height and view from the other end without a cost. Yes, it is wortwhile seeing for the view and the history of the Bastion itself, but that is really where the story ends.
Beautiful view. Beautiful view of the city, highly recommended, lots of museums, restaurants, shops, easy to walk around

Stunning architecture. It's obviously one of the most beautiful landmarks you're gonna see in Budapest. Along with the nearby Matthias Church, they make up an example of stunning architecture you wouldn't expect in a European city. The views of the city are great as well.There are a couple of ways to get there but I recommend the (longer but way less steep) path leading to the Buda Castle which you're probably going to visit anyway and then the nice, flat, shady pathway to the church and the Bastion. I made the mistake of choosing one of the random narrow streets where I felt as if I were going against a 45-degree slope with tens of similarly steep steps waiting for me at the end. Surely a lot faster but not a good choice if you're not in good shape/like such challenges.

Great views and photo op. Because the original was destroyed, the building does not have the authentic feel but the view of the River Danube below and Pest beyond are unparalleled. On either end, you can enter to get a higher advantage but there is a fee to enter on the right side. Go up to the bar area (left tower) and get the same view for free.

Great views. is a terrace in neo-Gothic and neo-Romanesque style situated on the Buda bank of the Danube, on the Castle hill around Matthias Church. It was designed and built between 1895 and 1902 and has great views of the city.The one downside is the upper level of the ramparts only provide unobstructed views of across the danube and they charge an entry, which covers only one section of the rampart - the second section of the rampart has been converted into a restaurant and. So you do not need to buy the upper level rampart tickets as they do not provide additional views

A slightly 'Disneyland' piece of architecture. Beautiful, interesting and packed with tourists (my husband and I adding to the crowds). It is definitely worth coming to but sadly the church of St Matyas gets overlooked because of it.
Great views but crowded. All the city tours include this spot so it does get very crowded. The views across the river to Pest are excellent but you have to pay to go up onto the top level.

Nice view of city. The Fisherman's Bastion (Halaszbastya) is a nice place to visit in a nice weather day. The view of the city is very beautiful and you will take nice pictures, I can promise that. There is also a nice coffee shop at the top. If the weather is bad, i.e. the sky aren't clear you might be a little disappointed but it still worth a visit.

Whimsical architecture, fun to walk thru, with spectacular views - despite the crowds!. My wife & I visited the signature Fisherman's Bastion as part of a walking tour on Castle Hill the morning of Saturday 5/10. We loved the whimsical architecture, the many outside, elevated walkways among the parapets, & the spectacular views in all directions.We'd strongly recommend taking time to do this, despite the crowds of tourists. Visiting Matthias Church, the surrounding square, & the Bastion is delightful & engaging.

Stumbled across. We didn't even realise we had visited Fisherman's Bastion until we got back to the apartment afterwards and saw pictures in the brochure and realised we'd been there. So, it's not signposted clearly and is a little underwhelming. Also a lot smaller than I imagined. The view is exquisite, but it's not the only place with a view in Buda! There's also a fee to go up approximately 20 steps, which you can do without, to be truthful. It's a nice place, but only go there if you're in the area, it's more of a half an hour trip than a day one.

Beautiful architecture and view. The place is very beautiful like a fairytale. The views are extraordinary but is a very crowded place, half of is occupied with the restaurants and the upper part can be visited with a ticket. Is not worth the money, the vies are the same and the place is empty. It is just for tourists..
"Must do in Budapest". The best view from here.Just beautiful.The bastion has a fairy tale look and atmosphere.We can recommend a visit.The area around the Bastion including the church is beautiful.

Great photo opt. Loking for a wonder place to spend the morning, meander along on this path of beauty overlooking the hills of Budapest. Great scenery of the Danube and parliament building in this city from high.

Stunning views. Don't pay to go up - I'm not entirely sure the views are any better up there!The Bastion itself is a great architectural wonder, the white stone contrasting against the blue skies. The views are great if you can get around the tourists for a photo and the open spaces offer a lovely place for a rest.

Lovely Place and View. The place is indeed lovely. The fairytale architecture with wondeful view of the city reminds a little bit of the castles described in the fantasy books. It may be easily imagined, that a place like this could have been built by dwarfs or elfs.

Great food in a stunning location. Great food accompanied by a very good winelist. Attentive waiting staff and a good sommelier made everything very pleasant. But... please ditch the cheesy violin duo, please!
Amazing sight. Amazing sight!!! One of the best places from where to see Budapest in all her majesty!!! The ticket is even very cheap.

The nicest place in Budapest. People often ask me where to go for a nice view when they are in Budapest. Well we have two higher hills that offer nicer views, the Gellért hill and the Budai hill. Though Gellért hill is higher, the second one has lots of beautiful streets on it, the Matthias church is also impressive, but still the best thing is to hang out on the Halászbástya (Fisherman's Bastion), on where you can see whole Budapest. I suggest to go there for sunset, because then you also can check out the city lights, which is a total different experience as seeing the city in sunlight :) And also, after 20:00 you can go up for free.
Beautiful. The general area is beautiful and the Bastion is a wonderful building affording good views of the city.
Halaszbastya. It's amazingly beautiful architecture and view. But what makes it even better is that it is surrounded by other beautiful sights! If you are in Budapest, you must visit this place!

It's not the place, it's the view. Halaszbastya is a weird construction located close to the Mathias church in Budavár, the palace area of Buda. While it is interesting and has a bar and a restaurant, the thing is: it has a privileged view of the Danube, specially when looking east at the Parliament. You will be able to take great pictures there.

Ecclectic architecture, beautiful views of the Danube. The Fisherman's bastion is a gallery at the edge of Castle hill overlooking the Danube. You can take nice pictures of the bend in the river and the Chain bridge. There is a viewing platform on the roof of the gallery, but you have to pay to get up there.Under the viewing platform there is a halfopen cafe , with a live music band.The style of the architecture is ecclectic. The back of the Budapest Hilton faces the bastion.
Stunning!. Wow. What a gorgeous place! I was told before we went here that it was like the Disney logo with the castle and it really does resemble it. Well worth the trip.

Beautiful building. It is a very beautiful building but be warned that there is nothing to see inside. On the other hand, it is incredible to see, close or far and the view of the city from there are spectacular. It took us 15 minutes to see everything and take pictures. Worth seeing when you are in the castle area.
Historic and impressive. Of all the things we saw in Budapest, this was probably my favorite.Impressive views - but the structure of the bastion itself was really interesting.highly recommend
The most beatiful and romantic Budapest panorama. Perfect view to Parliament and Danube bridges. The spot is near all sightseeing-worthy attractions on Buda side; don't miss out!
Good for the view. It was part of a bus tour and the views were great. However the view was essentially it with little else to excite and stimulate

Beautiful views. Not only is the architecture beautiful, but the view is fantastic. The church is very interesting. A great place to walk around and discover. The only downside is the modern buildings along side the historical ones. Someone wasn't thinking.

A must visit landmark in Budapest. This is a beautiful landmark in Budapest and definitely worth visiting! With turrets which make it look like a castle and stunning views across the river, it's not only great to walk around but you can get some amazing photos of Budapest.I would definitely advise visiting at night as the views are fantastic.
Great View. For the best view, walk to the far side of the Bastion and up the stairs. This view is not one you have to pay for and gets you above the trees that can block Chain Bridge.

Best view !. This was just beautiful. We enjoyed mooching around and looking at the views. It's a really picturesque place. We climbed up the turret and had a cup of tea (typically British) and just enjoyed the sun setting. Absolutely gorgeous!!!!
