Be warned. Do not eat here.. every local knows how much of a scam this restaurant is. Low , low grade food . Enjoy the free view from one side of the bastion and for God sakes don't pay to go up on the other side - it's basically the same view !

Do it if you take photos. It's been said already. At 700ft to go up and down, you may feel done! But you get good shots looking down on the city. If 700ft ensures this monument remains open to the public, then a couple of quid is no hardship. With digital photography allowing you to go snap happy, you can afford to try some arty shots using natural framing, or using the height for effect. There's likely to be fewer people up there too, so they are less likely to walk into your shots. I took the 700ft hit, and got a few good shots.

fairy tale castles in the sky. The fisherman's bastion is an architectural folly that offers splendid views over the river. Don't bother paying to go up however as you can get the same views from the free section (although you will have to fight for space!)

Nice view and fairy-tale feeling. Fisherman's Bastion in the Castle District of Budapest has a great view of the city and a nice fairy-tale feel to it. It's not worth spending the money to go up, so just enjoy what is there for free. Quick tip - after 9 pm (maybe it was 10 pm, I don't remember 100%) it is free to go up, and then you also get to see the nice view at night.

Beautiful!. Absolutely stunning piece of architecture, amazing turrets and the views of Budapest are spectacular.You have to pay 700HUF to climb up on the right hand side, however there is a free section on the left. We paid to go up, not much difference in views but for less than £2 each we didn't mind too much.Just lovely!

Great views!. This entire area is really lovely. My kids loved climbing up the various stairways and through the little doorways of the Bastion. The view from the top is incredible. It is very near St. Matthias' church, the palace (be sure to catch the changing of the guard), and many cute little shops and restaurants.
Fairy-tale. Looked like a fairy-tale castle with stunning views across the city :) There is a bar and restaurant inside as well.
A view to die for. So close to our Hilton Hotel......a lovely place to relax ax with a coffee. Staff were so helpful and the serenade was so pleasant. The best start to our first morning in the city.
Beautiful. Great views of the city, very magical place with lots of archways and stairways. Lively place with the beautiful St. Matthias' church placed in the centre.
Exploring Fisherman's Bastion. Took a tram ride up and were there to see changing of the guards and explored all the other interesting things up there. Wonderful view up there and great for photos.
Best view of the city. Best view of the city, and you can also have a nice drink or meal on the terrace or in the restaurant there.

Don't Pay the Entrance Fee!. This is a lovely relatively modern structure, so named because the Guild of Fishermen defended this section of the old castle wall in medieval times. It has a stunning view across the river of the Pest side of the city.But don't pay the 700 forints they charge to go up the right side of the bastion. The left half, opposite the Hilton Hotel, is free!

Don't miss. This is an outstanding area area in the old town to spend at least an hour wandering - and longer if you go inside the buildings as well. Very close to the St. Matthias church and the Palace. A real feeling of history over many eras.

Perfect view. While exploring the old medival town of Buda when passing the magnificent Gothic church you'll reach these terraces and ramparts above the Danube river offering magnificent views all over the city.You have to buy a ticket if you want to walk on them, but a small section beside a restaurant is free.

Beatiful views. The bastion itself is a sight to admire. However, from the ramparts opens an astonishing view towards Pest side of the city. Almost in front of the bastion is the parliament building and Danubius river. There's a cozy bar/cafe on the top floor of one of the towers.

Great Viewpoint. This structure on top of the Castle area has great views over the Danube and the Pest side of the city. We visited on a rainy afternoon, during a visit to the Castle and it was still enjoyable.
The view of Pest. Beautiful panorama, especially at sunset! Apparently, this is relatively new addition from the late 19th or early 20th century

Fisherman's Bastion- A Must See!. Atop Budapest on Castle Hill is Fisherman's Bastion. Not only are the views overlooking the city spectacular but so are all the historical sights in the area including Matthias Church, Hospital in the Rock and, of course, the Labyrinths where Dracula was once imprisoned. This was a highlight of my visit. While you're up there, visit Ruszwurm - the Oldest Coffee House in BudapestAddress: Szentháromság utca 7., Castle DistrictOpen: 10.00-20.00, Closed on Wednesdays
View. Magnificent view over to Pest. This is a must for visitors. Beautiful . Take the funicular up the hill

Stunning jewel in Budapest's crown.. We arrived at the Halaszbastya following a stroll round the castle grounds by way of Funicular. I have to say as beautiful as the rest of the Castle was; Halaszbastya really struck me. It looks like something out of Grimm's fairy tales and mostly is free to view. You do have to pay to go right to the top walkway, however the free parts are just as stunning. A must for a group photograph. You can see a great panorama of the Pest side of Budapest, and you can spend hours just finding new details within the masonry. The Bastion offers a fabulous view of the Parliament building and all of the bridges. We walked back down the steps and found an amazing sculpture at the bottom of the steps. Worth the walk to see this, and I genuinely cannot remember anything comparable in other places I have visited.
Great place!. Is a very nice place to visit and must be in the "to visit" list. St Mathias Church(who is near) and Fisherman Bastion create a lovely space together.
Enjoyable place. We arrived at this place late evening on a snowy day and we enjoyed a really charming image of Bastion - covered with snow it looked like from a fairytale!

Best View of Budapest. We were fortunate that our hotel (The Hilton in Buda ) overlooked Fishermans Bastion and from there over the Danube was the spectacular Parliament Building. The view at night is stunning but during the day the whole area around the Bastion is throbbing with tourists. It is a "must see" if ever you go to Budapest.
Beautiful photo opportunity. Fantastic views from here and we took some lovely photos of the views and each other whilst there. There are plenty if little nooks and places to pose!!

Nice view and suroundings. The place looks like something from the Universal Studios in Hollywood. It is beige and white and clean. The only problem is the bevy of tourists. Nice view of Danube, Parliament and practically whole center of Budapest. Great opportunity for photography. In one the street we found a great café with excellent Hungarian pastries and good coffee. From there we know that if you wish to order a strong black coffee you say : "Fékété dupla, please." And if you want to make your server smile, say "Jónapot kivánok" meaning "have a good day." Recommended as a place you should not miss.

A romantic fantasyland. One of the best places to view Pest and the Danube. . The architecture of the structures of the Fisherman's Bastion gave us the impression that we were wisked away to a wonderful fairyland. It sits in an area that includes many other important sights which are close by and can be seen within a short walk. Great place to spend an afternoon, the sights overlooking the Bastion are simply amazing.

Wonderful views of Budapest. A short trip either through a little wood, up some steps or the car that takes you up the hill. This is a lovely area, so clean and the buildings are really beautiful. A great bar at the top where you can sit and enjoy a drink on the ramparts overlooking the city. A must have visit
amazing place. great castle with some good restaurants around and about fantastic views of budapest worth a visit if just for the view of the area . river danube looks amazing from here as well.
amazing view. Amazing view of the area, Lots of shops and great places to eat, Some of the damages from WW2 are being preserved as well

A place to visit everytime. We visit in Budapest every year, and of course we always look for new attractions. But we have never missed a repeated visit to this marvelous place. We can stand for hours and watch the Danube from between the arches of the Bastion. The only bad thing is that too many people share our opinion, and the place is crowded... :)

Well worth a visit. We took the tour bus to all the sights and in two days saw all the main ones. Fisherman's Bastion was over the river in a picturesque part of the city and knowing the history was very interesting to see. Along with this we would not have missed seeing the shoes modelled from bronze and left on the river bank to show another reminder of sad times in the city's history. Taking the tour bus is a must!
Nice view. Very nice view of the city from the top. Close to major attractions, and a lot of nice spots. the Pity is that you have to pay to see part of them. But also the free part Worth to be seen.
Great Views. Drive to get here was great as well as the views from the top! I think we took part in a Wedding that was taking place. Ended up have a nice lunch round the corner on the way back.

Nice view and that's it. There is really nothing but the view. Other attractions close by but they have their own review. For some part of the bastion you have to pay entrance. DO NOT BUY TICKETS there is nothing different and the entrance price is crazy.
B E A U T I F U L place. Great view, very touristy, amazing building, romantic atmosphere. Just take your time and savoir the moment. Whichever way you look is special. A photographer's dream.

Visiting History. We visited St. Matthias Church which is located next to Fisherman's Bastion - so beautiful by day or night. It was the main church of the Castle District - later became a mosque during the Turkish occupation. Later rebuilt in neo-Gothic style between 1874 and 1896. Very beautiful and interesting. A romantic walk through history.

The Best Views of Pest. The Fisherman's Bastion was right outside our Hilton Hotel and a beautiful site each morning. It provides the best views of Pest over the Danube. There are two levels with different cafes. On the lower level there are cafes on each side. The one on the right was less expensive and we enjoyed a drink on a hot day with a sandwich. Granted the sandwich was packaged but it was sizable and tasty. The view was worth it for the chance to sit and admire the Parliament building on the other side of the Danube. Overall cost was reasonable. It looked like there was an area to pay to go to the top of level of the bastion which we didn't do. This is the area on the right. We went up the stairs on the left side where there is a little bar but no one was at the tables and we took our unobstructed pictures over there. Go later in the afternoon if you are looking for it to be less crowded. The busloads of tourists looked to descend on the castle area first thing. Plan to spend some time up in the area and see the beautiful Matias Church and the Buda Castle.
Do not miss. We stayed at the Hilton and had a great view of Fisherman's Bastion. It is well worth the visit, not only to see the Bastion to to see all of Budapest.
Fisherman's Bastion. Well preserved structure with a great view of the River, St Stephen's Basilica and theParliment Building. Great walking tour.
Magical. A magical structure and lovely view of the cities. This lovely landmark is well worth a few hours of your time!

The best view of Budapest!!. This attraction gives you the most amazing view of Budapest! We were disappointed that they were charging an admission fee to tour the church so we skipped it but people seemed to like it.
Fisherman's Bastion. The history is interesting. The actual structure, not so much. The nearby statue of St. Stephen is impressive.

Lovely views. We visited the Fisherman's Bastion in May 2014 with a small group tour. While it is basically a glorified wall with turrets, the views were stunning and great location to get photos with "Pest" in the background. It was nice to stroll around the area and see some of the local artists and visit the church. I would definitely include it in my itinerary for Budapest.

Best visit at Night. The Fisherman's Bastion gives you a fantastic view of the Danube and the all the fantastic landmarks along it, such as the Parliament House on the opposite bank.I find it most fascinating at night. Bring a good camera and a stand so that you can take some great still shots.

Budapest long weekend. I would ecommend a walk across to the palace building and then a wander down through the castle area to the Fisherman's Bastion.The architechture is amazing with fabulous views across the Danube to the Parliament building. Have lunch overlooking the river and bask in the views.

Why Fisherman's bastion?. All became clear when it was explained that during a battle, this was the place to which the fishermen of the Danube grouped to fight invaders. This is a wonderful view back over Pest and the architecture around this area is excellent. Whilst here, we saw a Golden Eagle with it's handler. That was definitely a first.
Excellent photo opportunities. We visited during the day, but it is also beautiful at night as well. We climbed it by foot, however it is easily accessible by various the hop on hop off bus tours.

Great spot for sunset. We didn't pay to enter we just went there for sunset and a few drinks.. The photos came out amazing. I would recommend taking some drinks and sitting up there for at least half an hour before and an hour after sunset to enjoy the changing of the colours and they the coming on of the lights.
Beautiful at Night. This is amazing to walk around but it is simply stunning lit up at night and is one thing to see at night.
Don't miss it. We spent one hour with drinks at the restaurant. The best place to rest, take pictures, and cool off.

Great View for Pictures. We stopped by the Fisherman's Bastion and took some quick pictures of the river and the city. The place is very touristy and was quite crowded while we were there. This is not a necessary stop. You can find wonderful views for pictures all along this area.

Slightly Better. All Advisors have been correct that you can get mostly the same view from the coffee shops and restaurants. However, we bought the ticket, unaware as well. In the end we were glad we did. Less harried, longer walk, and a more complete visit. I would say that buying this ticket depends on your financial situation. Nice to have, but not a must. The restaurant on top at the farthest end (away where you enter with a ticket) and behind the church is fantastic for a long evening's dinner. Reservations can be made just below in the door to the left (recommended). Sorry, can't remember the name just now.

Definitely must visit..... The views are great! We loved hearing the 3 piece orchestras overlooking the danube in a couple of places here. There is a great little bar at the top of the steps as well - check it out. No food, just drinks but half way up there was a nice place to sit that has food - we didnt stop so I cant comment but not many people there, table clothes and live music so Im sure its outrageous.Walking around this whole area is fun. Right now it is all under contruction for new cobblestones so you have to be a bit careful. Wear comfortable shoes and BRING WATER!
Must visit. Offers the most beautiful view of pest side. Great view of the entire city. A must visit tourist attraction. Beautiful architecture would recommend to go there on a bike tour.

Don't buy a ticket for this, you can see it for free!. When we bought tickets to go in to the Matthias Church next to the Fisherman's Bastion, we had the option of buying the ticket for the Bastion as well, which we did. There is two areas on the wall, one where you can go to see the view with your ticket, but the other half is used by coffee shops and restaurants. You can go to that area for free even if you aren't going to eat or drink something, and the views are the same from the side where you have to pay for it.
Well worth the visit!. An amazing building, fantastic views - I love Budapest and the bastion is no exception. We had a good look around then hung around for a while enjoying the views and the sun!
Excellent views. A lovely place to have a wander and see the Pest side. Seems like late afternoon, the big buses are nowhere to be found - BONUS!
great place for pictures. worthwhile to spend half a day at this area, lovely Architecture, clean and interesting, recommended for all

Amazing architecture with a view to match. For views across the Danube over to Pest this place is superb and offers many opportunities to capture unique and creative images. I didn't pay the fee to go to the top turrets but just enjoyed the views from the free balconies.I loved the architecture that reminded me of a fairytale castle. I just enjoyed looking at this structure from many angles. It is beautiful..

Don't waste your money on tourist ticket!. A great place to visit with spectacular vistas over the Danube and Pest. However, we thought the ticketed part a complete waste of money since excellent views are readily available in the vicinity. Just take the very good Saint Mathias tour by itself.

A Hungarian folly, good views, very busy. Whilst this is architecturally very impressive, and has decent views over the Danube and the Hungarian national parliament, it is surprisingly devoid of history - built as a part of the 1900 Millenium celebrations, it has served no real use from what I can gather, other than as a tourist attraction.That said, it is remarkably impressive, with almost fairytale turrets and sweeping arches. It is spectacular at night when lit up and visible from the Pest side of the Danube. There are great views, although I would say they are better from the top of Gellert Hill.The major draw back is that it is very busy, and the whole area around here is expensive, much more so than the rest of the city.
Fantastic view. I've been Budapest in may and the panorama from this place amused me, the Parlament is monumental, but unfortunately it is used by politicians. Awsome view:-)

A picturesque battlement. This is the bit that you see whenever yo look up at St Matthias Church from anywhere in Budapest. Closeup it is beautifully designed and constructed but is almost too good to be true. It is a bit Disney-like (or did Disney get ideas from here?) It is a wonderful spot for views over the Danube and the Pest part of Budapest.
Beautiful by night. Absolutely stunning - so glad we did this! The views were amazing and the architecture was stunning - very romantic!

Much Visited Tourist Destination. Our room at the Hilton Budapest - Castle District was into the courtyard where the Fishman's Bastion is located. There is a well-respected, very busy restaurant right there with these breathtaking views.
Restaurant. Excellent service, excellent food, excellent view, excellent music, just no veg with the chateau briand and white wine not cold enough otherwise would be exceptional

Great view. I went early in the morning so it wasn't crowded. The view is stunning, go by foot and get lost in Buda. I don't think is the best view after visiting the liberty statue, but it was calm and beautiful.

Don't Miss!. If you're in Budapest, you have to go to Fisherman's Bastion, for the views, if nothing else. It is pretty touristy with large tour busses and groups so be prepared. Otherwise, it is a beautiful place with great views of the city!

Beautiful. A gorgeous, well maintained spot adjacent to Matthias Church which has equally gorgeous views of the Danube, Pest and the Parliament building. As other reviewers have noted, the ticketed areas offer no better views than the free areas offer. I encourage, if possible, to find yourself in the area during the day but also at evening and night for a variety of perspectives.

Go there on foot. I also recommend to visit Bastion for the view. A little bit touristy, though. It's a beautiful walk up there, if you go on foot:) - you can admire the beautiful buildings of Buda. And you can get from there to the castle and to the Hungarian National Gallery.

Not to be missed. Fisherman's Bastion is on top of Castle Hill and easily recognized by it's turrets overlooking the Danube. Explore the building and the photo opps available. There is a very expensive restaurant on the terrace. You may like to purchase a small book which explains the history of the area.

Only place to see the History and the affects of the War. A magnificent place to Buda and Pest. Best place to take a photo of the Hungarian Parliament. You can also see buildings where bullet holes still remain. The old cobblestone are being replaced allowing it to become a much easier way
Wonderful at night!. While the area around is a construction site at the moment,the views of the city are unrivalled especially at night . Paying the extra fee for the higher level isn't worth it.
Great view. Great views from up here. There is a good restaurant under the trees. We did not pay to go in but just had a look around the area. Worth the ride up.

Beautiful Structure and View. The Fisherman’s Bastion shares with the other attractions in Buda the great panoramic view of the Danube and Pest; and excels with its beautiful open design and architecture; every meter has its own charm and beauty; the statues, the colonnades, the stairs; it is a must visit to all photographers and scenery lovers.

Beautiful, good views - too many people.. The Fisherman’s Bastion was by far the most crowded spot on the castle hill with many herds of river cruise tourists with their guides in the area. The structure in itself is beautiful and the views good. At least for us the crowds did not benefit the spot and quitter spots along the castle walls were nicer for viewing the city.
A Disney like marshmallow place.. One of the best views of the city's Pest side. Wonderful to see the Parliament in all its glory. Do not pay for the overrated entrance fee to the 1st floor!

Best view to the lower lying Pest. The Fisherman's Bastion has the nicest view over the city and is in fact quite a romantic spot! There are often people who play traditional music which adds to the stunning atmosphere. This is one of my favorite spots in Budapest! Also not to miss is the funicular railway down to the city which was first built in 1870. It conveniently ends below the Castle hill next to famous Chain Bridge over the Danube.
Lovely evening stroll. Great views of Pest after nightfall. The city lights up. Musicians play throughout the stairwells and porticos of the Bastion, which stretches beyond King Matthias' church.
Nice place. Very nice view of the Pest side and the Danube. The Matyas Templom just aside is also interesting, as well that area of Buda with many souvenir shpos and restaurants.

Magnificent views of Budapest. This location at Matyas church has a small, worthwhile admission charge. The Bastion itself is quite photo worthy, but the views of the whole city and Danube from the Buda side are the best you can get
Terrific views of the bastion and city. A great place from which to view Budapest from the Buda side and photograph the whole city at your feet. Small admission charge is well worth it.
Superb View of Budapest. Good Service, super location to look over budapest. Pretty Long stair till you get there, take the bus if you are not so sprty

Worth buying a coffee to enjoy the view without the crowds. This are can be very crowded with tourists and their guides. To my surprise the cafe 'under the arches' along the front of the square was quiet, and a lovely place from which to enjoy the view of the river and the fine buildings across the way.

Fisherman's Bastion. Great to get there by bus, you have a good view on the city. Great panorama once up there. However, it was very touristy (and so is the restaurant up there), but that was to be expected

Tourist trap, but excelent view!. Go there with the Free Tour Guide from Vörösmarty tèr. Its the first thing you should do when coming to budapest. You get a bunch of good info and you finish the tour on the fish bastion

Views, views, views. Fishermen’s Bastion offers just superbs views from the city and the Danube. Its very crowded most of the times but still its offcourse a must visit spot in Budapest when visiting the city. there are also places were you can eat/lunch something.

Like a fairy tale building.. Nothing to dislike at all. Such a beautiful place, like something out of a fairytale. Great location for overlooking the Pest side of the city, especially The Hungarian parliment and The Basilica.
Stunning views. Beautiful place and best views over Budapest. There's also a nice gift shop in the hotel there at the square that had beautiful postcards and other quality items.
Beautiful but be careful. The place is beautiful. However do to the amount of tourists and 5* hotel next door, it might be vise to mind your pockets.

Great views - spend 20 minutes. Great for the views of Budapest - the Danube, parliament building etc. But you get good views from the castle/museum side too. Not sure if paying the money gets you much more as it just gets you to climb onto the structure so you are 50 feet higher - but you are already high enough.

Super views, but don't buy a ticket. This is an amazing architectural gem and well worth a visit. However, don't buy a ticket to get into it as this is only necessary for about 20 metres of the bastion and the views from other parts are just as spectacular. Do buy a ticket to visit the church beside it though!

Like something out of a fairytale!!. Beautiful architectural delight with breathtaking views of the Danube and all of the major monuments which line it...and its FREE!!! It is a must see when visiting Budapest!!

Neo - Romanesque Fantasy At It's Best!. So another example of budapest sprucing itself up, this structure is completely artificial...but how can you resist the views? You must stop here when in town and see the sights. Tis fanciful structure adorns Castle Hill like wedding cake flowers! While some suckers pay the 800 HUF extra to climb to the top( 10 feet higher? ) the views are just as good from the free levels below. If you explore the entire length of the rampart, you will find many openings for pictures are free and amazing. Tip: want to see something you have never seen before? Go to the far end of the bastion, at the back of a pastry shop in a modern glass building is the Szabo Marzipan museum. For a small price, you can view two little rooms packed with little sculptures made from this almond paste confection! One for the bucket list, I know...
Good view of river and Pest. We walked along the Buda side of the river up to the Fisherman's Bastion. It was an interesting feature on the hillside and worth the effort.
Hilton Budapest City. Beautiful views of the city - looks really old and castlelike but is a relatively new addition to the city. Brides everywhere you look on weekends

Lovely views!. Great place to visit and take in the view. Didn't see the need to buy the extra ticket to go up on the wall. Got plenty of great photos without it. Had a drink at the lovely cafe below it while watching the sun set, listening to live Hungarian music. Magical!

amazing view,unique architecture. I definitely think that it is a must visit if you happen to have an extra hour in Buda site...the location is very near to the castle...theres no need to take the hop on hop off as we managed even with a baby stroller
Do Not Miss. Take the incline railway up and enjoy the view. Check out the Marzipan sculptures, the Churches, the area. Magnificent. Enjoy street musicians! Just wonderful!

Lovely building, great views. Fisherman's Bastion is beautiful to visit, and most of it is free. To get the best views, purchase an entrance ticket for HUF 700 (equivalent to €2.33 or AUD 3.33) and you can enter the higher areas of the Bastion. This nominal amount helps maintain Fisherman's Bastion. The paid area is not large, so don't expect it to be, however you will enjoy the views and the different angles of seeing Fisherman's Bastion.

Great views. Fisherman's Bastion is situated on Castle HIll and offers great views over the Danube and the city. There is also a marvellous restaurant beneath the bastion with amazing chandeliers and very appetizing food.

best view.. peace.. listen to Buda.. It is a very interesting structure built along the edge of the cliff. you can see an amazing view of Buda. if you are tired you can sit somewhere against to beautiful view and listen to Buda's voice :)

Spectacular view. The Fisherman's Bastion, once on the banks of the Danube, provides spectacular vistas. But don't hesitate to walk around the Pest surroundings. The immediate area is full of shops and restaurants ranging from traditional tourist traps to establishments well patronized by locals. Spend a few hours exploring; You may find Dracula's dungeon!
Great for photo op. Part of the Castle Hill district and has great views of Buda. Go the other side and see Pest. Can go up the funicular or take the Hop on Hop off bus.
Beautiful edifice. Although there is a fee to enter, you can walk around the outside of the Fisherman's Bastion and get some great views of Budapest.

It's all about the view. There is simply no better place for a view of Pest across the Danube River. One can imagine the residents of the castle in days gone by enjoying that view. It seems that the longer one looks, the more detail can be picked out.

A great photo opportunity. Visited when visiting BUda on the Hop on hop off bus. Fantastic views over Pest,and the Danube from the Castle and the Bastion. You can pay to walk around the whole Bastion but we just looked from the free part. A couple of nice restaurants which have great views too- a perfect place to have a drink and/or a meal. The actual FishermansBastion is a fantastic piece of architecture.

Fantastic Structure, Beautiful View. There is not much that I can add that hasn't already been said. Simply put, the entire place is gorgwous. There is a wonderful view looking between stone arches. The stone work, statues, and spires make the place look like something from a fairy tale book. The statue of St. Istvan, and all the others as well, are picturesque and worth taking the time to admire. Being located right next to the majectic Matyas Templom is a plus and should not be missed.

Little bundle of advice...on Castle Hill. On the Buda side, Castle Hill has the Buda Castle on one side and Hilton hotel and Fisherman's Bastion on other side. It is a comfortable walk. For views, there are lots of opportunities from the restaurant by Hilton so after we walked back and paid to take the stairs up to here (no strollers allowed up the stairs, leave it with the ticket attendants), we had already seen the view from the restaurant that has the same stone structure as here. And, we had little help from the counter when we asked what the tickets are for, they sell tickets for this which is just for a flight of stairs over a section with views, and they sell tickets for the chapel. We didn't do the chapel. There were hardly any people at the Bastion, compared to the restaurant. But, still I could not justify the tickets price when views are all over and free.Don't be misled by my ratings. Ratings are for the view and the ambiance of the area, but if you soak it in at other vantage points, I couldn't see why this area was paid.

Great photo opportunity. I agree with many other reviewers who say that this place provides great photo opportunities and great views of Pest, the Danube , and the bridges. The was no entrance fee when we were there.
Beautiful to wander. Just a lovely place to view, we visited both day and night but the evening was far better. Definitely worth a visit

Best view in Budapest. This is the place to go to get a great view of Parliament, plus there's the best looking church right behind it. More sights just around every corner. The nicest area of Budapest, you have to go here if not for this,which is very nice, for the collection of awesomeness around it.

What a view!. This is a place to have your camera ready so you can take photos of Pest and the bridges over the Danube River. You can see these sights without having to pay an entrance fee if you go next to the building or in near the bar/terrace. LOTS of tourists from 10:00-4:00.
great views. Lovely views along the river. Gets very crowded. Like many of the buildings in Budapest it is not that old. It is a very interesting structure built along the edge of the cliff.
Disappointing. Good views over the river but not much more. Could have been presented with a bit of its history but had to use guidebook for information.
Wow!. Fantastic views over the Danube from this extraordinary series of fairy tale turrets on the hillside in Buda. Lots of steps but we'll worth it.

Do not spend your money on this. I bought ticket to this one also simultaneously with Matthias Church. Do not buy. There is nothing special to see and you can see all the same from the bar-restaurat free of charge next to this. Someone could claim that you can get better picture of the statue in front but actually you end up on the back side of it.
Best view of Budapest. What a great back story...Views are killer. Plenty of nearby historical points of interest (St. Mathias Church, Buda Castle, the Hilton - just kidding)

Beautiful area to see many different sites. This was the most crowded area we encountered but was still easy to navigate. Our guide expertly got us to the exact positions to enjoy the magnificent views. No need to pay extra to climb up stairs / this view couldn't have gotten any better. There are bathrooms, but be sure to have either Hungarian coins or euros. Nothing is free here.

Intriguing. This is a beautiful place to both explore side roads and take panoramic shots of the city. Although the restaurants along the rim are enchanting, don't be afraid to explore some of the smaller, less expensive locations moving towards Pest. The locals are very welcoming.

Great views. There are several free places to get beautiful view of Budapest from this area of the Castle district, as well as a paid cafe terrace. Lots of ice cream places nearby (it was warm when we were there), and a public WC (which costs about 12 euro).
Excellent View. The view of Budapest was magnificent!! The bastion itself is one of my favorit sights in Budapest!! It is not worth paying the entrance for the closed section of the bastion.

Best views of the city !. Certainly one of the "must sees" in the city tour of Budapest. Very much worth the short hike to the top for the best vistas of the entire city. Parking can be very much a problem, so best seen on a tour.

A beautiful building, and terrific vantage point. An absolutely beautiful building that absolutely glistens in the sunlight. Always interesting things going on in this area, with bird of prey handling when we were there.Offers a great vista of the river, and parliament building beyond.

Its best to wander there at Sunset..... Forget taking transpo, cars or getting there from the Castle corridor... nothing but tourists. To be truly enchanted start lower nearer the river on Fo Utca and walk up through the residential neighborhood. You'll find staircases that lead up side streets cars can't travel up, and when you clear the last staircase at the foot of the Bastion there is a lovely little grassy trail, leading into a brick and stone tunnel untouched by time. Stepping out of that tunnel to the site of the cathedral and Bastion is a much better reveal than stepping off of a bus or walking through the crowded touristy spots. If you can time it right, go at sunset, the light and shadow dancing around the curves and points of the building make for great photos and you can stop and have a drink at the top and watch the sun set over the Danube and all the lights start to twinkle on over on the Pest side. While the open spaces are crowded with tourists, the bar is usually empty!

Excellent view of Pest side. Take tram #16 at Deak Ferenc tér and in a few minutes you will be at the top of the hill where the Castle complex is situated. There is a bus stop just in front of Matthias Church and Fishermen's Bastian. The day was so beautiful that we decided to stay outside, and it's so white that seems to be recently cleaned and renewed. To go back take the same tram across the street.

Come for the views. Easily the best views of Pest can be found here since you get an unobstructed look.Do NOT pay for the 700 entrance "fee" to the bastion as it only gives you one area extra to view from which makes no sense since the public area gives you the same view.Views are stunning so definitely a must if in Budapest

Wonderful views all be it crowded. This is well worth a visit but it is very popular, expect lots of people, there are great views across the Pest side of the Danube, We went up on a bus but we're told that the Fenicular was over priced and you can't see anything once you are on the carriage, not sure about that but once up the hill enjoy the view.
Nice place!. Fisherman's Bastion is place on Buda side.. just on way to the castle...the place has historical importance
Great Panoramic Photo View. If you want to enjoy the beautiful view on the Pest side and take a nice photo this is one of the great spot.

On the Buda side. Fisherman's Bastion is in the Buda Castle. It was built on the site of the old city walls in neo-Romanesque style. The viewing terraces offer unparalleled views across Budapest. There is a lapidarium in St. Michael's Chapel under Fisherman's Bastion.

All about the views. Amazing views and photo opportunities. Beautiful architecture with the backdrop of the Danube. We ate up on the terrace which was really lovely to sit and enjoy lunch with that amazing view.

Nice panoramic view. After visiting all historic sites it is nice to sit and enjoy the nice panoramic view and enjoy and take a rest there.
If you are the fan of photography it is your place to take picture of all historic sites .I really recomend.
Fabulous architecture and great views. The whole castle district is wonderful, with lots of wonderful sights. The views from the Bastion are excellent.

Great Photo Opportunity. Whilst almost Disneyland in its structure, this area really has a buzz and offers fantastic views over the Danube and the city. It’s a ‘must-see’ area with great photo opportunities. You will only need about 30 minutes for this part, but there’s an interesting walk up to the bastion with quaint shops and it’s adjacent to Mathias Church.

Wonderfull. Worth seeing.
I went to Budapest last summer almost a year ago with a friend of mine. There are many places to visit but I most definitely recommend seeing Fisherman's Bastion. Not only will you feel transported into another century but you also get too see a beautiful view of the other side of the city (Pest).

What a view!!!. This is a must see when you're in Budapest. You have the most amazing view of the city. We paid the extra money to go up on the right hand side which is much quieter as not everyone pays to go to that part - makes for better photos!
Wow-what a view. We claimed up the hill to Buda on foot in searing heat (well hot for a Brit that is) and although we were puffed the view really does leave you breathless- really worth the climb.

Great views. It was raining the day I visited Fisherman's Bastion, but it didn't stop me from going to the top of the left turret (the right one you pay for but I have heard that the views aren't much better than the left one which you can access for free). My views of Pest were not as great as they would have been on a much clearer, sunnier day, but were still high and unobstructed.The Bastion itself is very interesting, and the architecture is lovely. A lot of people have described it as 'Disney-esque' and I would agree with this. Overall, a great place to visit for a while if you are in the Castle Hill district and want to get some great views.

Most beautiful view of the city. Must see! Beautiful castle, the best view of the Budapest (especially The Parliament), it is open all night sou you can go there and see beautiful Budapest and Danube under the city lights. Very romantic. It's not far from the M2 metro station Deli Palyaudvar, you can walk from there, or take the tram and go only one station, you can't get lost, it's really easy.

Nice views. We'll worth a visit to the Bastion, really nice views of Pest and nice to se the traditional Hungarian streets with small shops and restaurants. The only thing that doesn't fit in is the Hilton Hotel

Best place in Budapest. If you only have a day in Budapest make sure the Fisherman's Bastion is your top priority. Not only is is beautiful in itself, you have the most stunning views of the city, including the remarkable parliament building, and the chain bridge.

Great view from Buda. This is a wonderful view of Pest and some of Buda. It is an fortress like structure and there is a charming little village of shops nearby. We were on hill at 11:50am and watched the changing of the guards. We stopped at the museum and then took the Funnicular down the hill and walked across the Chain bridge.

A Brilliant Place. We visited the area on a sunny and warm day. If you visit Budapest you have to get there. Charming buildings and green parks with relaxing bird sounds, without gasoline smell and car noise. You can have a coffee or a beer at a resturant that has great views of the city and the National Assembly. Unforgettable experience for me.
Great views. Great views, a must visit in Budapest. There are bathrooms in the Hilton (lower section, near gelato stand) that you can use but will cost you 120.

Amazing!,. Stunning views and amazing architecture, a definite must see. Beautiful panoramic view of the city, parliament and the Danude river. You can get a bus to the bastion (16/16a) from Szell Kalman station outside the palace.

A picture taking must. Amazing views of the city and an interesting piece of the wall to photograph. You will mostly likely spend about 20 minutes taking pictures of the views then keep walking to the many shopping and restaurants nearby.

Views and Medieval Influence. The turrets are some very impressive and detailed structures. This place has great views of Pest and Parliament. It also is in front of St. Matthias Church, we did not go in however. It makes you think of the past and the events that have unfolded there, especially since there is a photo at an exhibit of Nazis standing in the same place. I would it add it to your list of things to see in Budapest.

Stunning. This is definitely worth climbing up all the stairs to see. I cannot believe that it was free. It felt like we were in a fairy princess castle and offered beautiful views of the City. The Bastion was built in the 19th Century for millenium celebrations. I would recommend going early as it gets busier towards the afternoon, and I feel that crowds would destroy the beauty of the place. My only regret is that I did not revisit in the evening as I think that the scenery would look even more beautiful.
Check it out. Right by Matthias Church so it's an easy must see. Great views from the top. A portion is free and there is a fee for another piece. There is also a restaurant below the main walkway.
The most beautiful spot of Budapest. Fishermen's bastion has an amazing view,you can see the whole city,and is really nice.It is a must-see!

Medieval place. My colleagues wanted to reserve a table at the Citadella but finally we went to Halászbástya restaurant. The restaurant was full we knew we were at the right place. Very elegant service, fancy dishes, high value and prices. The big plates were almost empty but a the end of the day we all enjoyed the evening. The Tokaj wine is the best in the world.

What we liked the most in Budapest!. Beautiful surrounding excellent opportunity to take pictures of Pest! Excellent place to see the sunset! It is mostly public, there is a part that can only be access by paying a small fee - I think it was the equivalent to 2 euros- my husband thinks is worth paying as the best views are on that side.
great location. great views from the top and very interesting but looks better at night with lights on as does the rest of budapest
SUBERB OUTLOOK. A most unusual construction with multiple views over the Danube and the city of Budapest. Teaming with visitors but well worth attending.

Go at night. Fishermans Bastion is very touristy. To walk round the ramparts you have to pay. Go at night when all the tourists have gone and it is quieter, you can walk round for free and the views over the river Danube are superb.
Best view. The restaurant has the best view in Budapest. I recommend the terrace if the weather allows.I tried venison as a main course and was highly satisfied.
Beautiful view of the Parliament. This place is a must visit in the evening. Its beautifully lit and gives an excellent view of the parliament and the 'pest' side of Budapest.
One of the most beautiful sites in Budapest. Definitely a 'must' when you visit Budapest, and makes for some great pictures. The view from Fisherman's Bastion is probably one of the best of Budapest.

Beautiful, amazing views. Fantastic views our the Danube and Pest. Quaint little site, very nice setting for photographs as is all the old town round there.
Only down size is it gets very busy due to it being so splendid.

Great viewpoint. Fisherman's Bastion is a great place for views of the Pest side of the river and is a very pretty looking place. The only thing that detracts away from it is that it has no real history to it. The church and the bits around it were all rebuilt around 100 years ago and it all feels a bit Disney.

Best view while in Budapest, Hungary. It was a very pleasant surprise to see such a fantastic view of the castle, St Mathias Church and the city and Danube river from this high place, the castle wall are we'll preserve and your camera just loves all it's picture perfect view. There are eateries, hotel and shopping areas there, this is a must see in your Budapest itinerary.
Excellent Views. Lovely area with great views across the Danube, particularly of the Parliament building. St Matthius Church was also beautiful.

Views, views!. Incredible view of Pest and the Danube...a must for anyone visiting this beautiful city! Right in the heart of the Castle District and near St Matthias Church. Very crowded with tour groups when we were there, it might be better to go early in the day.

Halaszbastya.... It is really beautiful.Amazing.We felt like we entered some fairytale.Fisherman's Bastion is so different and unique.Plus,you have terrific view on the Parliament and a part of the city.If you are in Budapest it's a "must see"...

Must see of the city. If you only have a day or two in the city, this is the absolute first place to go. A great view of the city, the Parliament, and its right next to the Magyar Church. Best time to go is on a sunny day especially at sunset as the light hits the castle like towers perfectly.

Don't pay, just go!. You can pay around 700fl to go upstairs of a section of it, but you can see the same view and even higher in an area where you don't have to pay.If you have extra money and want to take in the view with less people around (as they are smart enough not to throw their money away) then you can pay to go up to take in the view, but you'll get much better view from Buda Hill anyway.

pretty. we ended up here looking for the labryinth and found it very pretty,it was busy as it is near the castle and the little village within but we manage to get a coffee inside looking out over to pest and it was lovely, well worth a visit for the scenery but you will come across it anyway once you have come up the hill.
must see. this is a place every one should visit if they go to Budapest. It is something absolutely different and unique. Incredible!!!!

Fairy castle. We arrived there walking from the national gallery and Buda castle.The St Matyas churh is in front of it.The place is marvellous.It looks like you are in the fairy tail.I loved walking around bastion,and you have a wonderfull wiev to the parliament!!!For one part of the bastion you need to pay,(but not much),if you want to go up.But at the left you have more or less the same thing and its free of charge.I did both of them ,but it is not necessary because it is almost the same thing.Place to visit defenitly,one of my favorite in Budapest.

What a Surprise!. We were staying at the Buda Castle round the corner from this attraction and we did not know what it was. Disney like towers and parapets with hundreds of people milling about. It is a great vantage spot looking over the Danube to Pest You can pay to walk along the walls, but you get the same view from the promenade. The coach tours drop of there between 9.30 and about 4 o'clock so if you go later you miss the crowds( I mean 20 coach loads at a time). A must to see and if you time it right when its dark you can see the lights across the river.
Good view of the city. Just a good view over the Pest side of the city from Buda. Some interesting architecture but just a viewpoint more than anything.

A view of Budapest from the top.. A wonderful view of the old city of Budapest is seen from the hill across the Danube from the main city, where the old fortress, or Fishermen's Bastion, stands next to a beautiful church and residential and business buildings. The city is in the process of building a tourist center in the hilltop area to showcase it's Hungarian culture.
Crowded and touristy. A nice overlook but teeming with people. Make sure you don't pay for the view - there is a free spot to the left of the cafes.
A must see when in Budapest. The view is spectacular overlooking the Danube and and the beautiful Parlament building. This was one of the higlights of our trip!!

Amazing views. We were so impressed with the Fisherman's bastion. The Mathias Church was amazing and the roof stunning. It made our trip. Highly recommend you get there before 5pm so you can go in the church as it closes promptly.
Lovely place. Great place with amazing views over Budapest. Definitely worth seeing. Nice surroundings and makes a great sightseeing trip.
Perfect. Food great, staff friendly, views fantastic. 4 of us made different choices, but all agreed everything was first rate.

Best view of Pest from here!. Beautiful place to wonder around, right next to the Hilton Hotel. Great view of the Parlament building. No one should miss this! It is always the highlight of my visits to Budapest.
Stunning. Fisherman's Bastion is absolutely stunning. The views from down below are amazing and then when you get up the it the views across the river to Pest just blew us away.
Do not pay for this!. The views are amazing, but identical to the ones you get for free at the other parts of the wall. really not worth paying the extra for at all.

Don't miss. Visit this place in the morning and we have to go back at night, in the morning it was a bit crowded, you have to pay a fee to go see the view but in the evening its free and a totally different scene, the place is less crowded and you can take a lot of pictures, just remember to bring flash, since we forgot ours and we are group of 8 we decided to use the lights from our mobile and viola! we are able to capture a dramatic and beautiful scene. we love it there.Also they have a restaurant which says have a great view, just book in advance, we tried but it will be available in like 2 weeks.

Must see in Budapest. When you visit Budapest, your trip won't be complete without a trip to the top of Buda to see this. We took the Hop on Hop off bus up to the top of Buda (all the main attractions in the city are ridiculously easy to get to) and walked around Fisherman's Bastion, an unusual and beautiful structure that overlooks the city. The photo opportunities are endless (I lost hours taking different panoramic shots). It doesn't take long to see the whole thing and the best way to round it off is to have coffee and cake in the cafe/restaurant while taking in an unobstructed view of the river and skyline. We watched while a curtain of rain clouds crossed a clear blue sky, submerged the city then passed over. Breathtaking!
do not buy tickets!. Do not buy tickets for bastion, they are only valid for the half of the wall, and the other one with the restaurant is free of charge and has the same view.
Awesome view. If you want to go up there, you will need a ticket but to be honest, you don't need it to have a great view of Pest, the bridges and the Danube. Don't miss it.

Don't miss this. It is easy to find and since you will probably be checking out Castle Hill you will find yourself at Matthias Church. Fisherman's Bastion is right there. Many wonderful photo opportunities and panoramic views all over the place. There is a small supermarket on the street about 100metres towards the Castle, we bought some fresh baked goodies and sat in the park to eat our cheap lunch. You can buy food and beers at the top of the Bastion, but of course it is quite pricey and the tourists taking photos would be a pain to deal with if you were after a quiet drink.
Great Views. This is one of the best viewing points of the city. You have great views of the Danube and of the Pest side of the city. Also great for photo,s

Magical!. What a magical place! One of the most beautiful in the city. You can just walk around and enjoy gorgeous views of the city or you can have a bite (or a couple of drinks)) in one of the cafes located there. To enter the top terraces you will have to pay a fee, but I'm not sure if it is necessary, as the view from the lower part is great!
Brilliant views over Pest. Beautiful panoramic views over the Danube and back into Pest. A must do if in Budapest as it helps to put the cities bridges and monuments into perspective.

Certainly worth a look around. The Fisherman's Bastion provides excellent views of Pest, and is next to a few other landmarks which you may wish to visit. However, we didn't pay to go up the steps of the Bastion as it really didn't look worth it - the views you get will only be different by another 5 metres height!

Great view of the city. great view of the city and especially the famous Parlament.
don't bother with paying an entrance fee for the top floor as there are plenty of great picture locations on the free bottom floor :)

What a view from a Cinderella-like setting. This fairy tale series of walkways between embattled towers high above the city skyline is a must for tourists. In the day it is magnificent and at night the sight of the city lit up is worth the trek up to the old town, even in the rain. The violin playing in the restaurant is very touristy but splendid. There is a charge to walk along the parapet pathway but the views are better.
Amazing Sights. Stunning architecture and sights over the cityWell worth a visit Shame about the horrific Hilton hotel they've installed behind it

Views over the Danube. Excellent views, not too busy even though it was a sunny day. Purchased entry with Matthias church works out cheaper and they are right next to each other. Royal Palace and other attractions 5 mins walk from here.
Best views of Budapest. The viewing deck of what was the old fish market with its 7 towers today provides you with a chance to have a glass of vino and oversee the Danube across the twin cities.
<3. I believe this is my favourite spot in Budapest!I really loved it! Too bad I couldn't go at night. I'm sure the views are amazing with all the lights!Don't miss it!

An architectural masterpiece, plus a panoramic view to cherish. Small wonder that the Fisherman’s Bastion is such a magnet for tourists. It’s a true architectural masterpiece. I’ll always regret that we couldn’t budget enough time to do a proper tour. I also regret that I botched a camera shot that should have been a real keeper. It was a clear day, and the panoramic view of the city and the Danube waterfront from these heights made me glad that I brought my best camera. Unfortunately, while framing what should have been a masterful photo of the Hungarian Parliament Building, one of the most strikingly beautiful public buildings in all of Europe, I failed to notice a solar array in the near foreground. I could have avoided the problem by a small shift of position, but that’s just 20-20 hindsight. Watch out for that solar array!

Stunning architecture. As part of a tour, we headed here for a stop of. Glad we did. The architecture of the church was incredible,huge sweeping towers and standing over Budapest like a great big shadow.We didn't have the time to go in, but could see it was busy , not surprising. The surrounding village area was quaint if a little touristy but provided a small glimpse of a past history of Budapest.What sells this however is the fantastic views over the city, and the ability to get superb parliament building in the background was in particular great.A worthy visit when in Budapest.

What a wonderful place to spend the day. It is the most spectacular place I have visited stunning and fantastic views across too Pest sit on the battlements and watch the cruise boats go down through Budapest or watch the Bride and Grooms as they arrive too take their wedding photographs sit and have a coffee and cake or an ice cold beer you will be spoiled for choice an unforgettable place
Beautiful landmark. With fairy tale towers, the Fisherman's Bastion offers gorgeous views of the Danube, Pest, bridges, Parliament, and Margaret Island. A must see in Budapest.

Very beautiful with great views. We did not pay to go on part of the Bastion. Instead we went up the cafe part and took pictures from there. It is a very beautiful piece of architecture. I highly recommend visiting. The only downer is the hideous Hilton Hotel right next to it.
Worth a visit. Nice building with fantastic views of the city from the castle district. It has an architectural presence and picturesque.

Terrific Views!. Great place to visit for fabulous views of the Danube and Pest - I agree with other reviews regarding not really necessary to pay to enter the actual towers, I don't think it would greatly improve the viewsShould definitely be on your list of places to see in Budapest!

Love it!. This place is like a fairy tale land filled with castles. It is very very picturesque and offers an amazing panoramic view of Budapest. It offers a 'postcard view' of the Hungarian Parliament which is probably the most beautiful building I have ever seen.
A must see!. Romantic building offering fantastic views with a lovely cafe where they have traditonal live music.

Very nice view - Not much to do. Amazing views and free past 9 PM, which is actually a much better time to get to go there as you get to see the city lit up. It gets overly crowded in the daytime when tour groups visit the castle disctrict, so you just have to make sure to time your visit.
Crowded but dramatic. Beautiful views and a chance to relax/refresh in the cafe. The cathedral is fully refurbished and worth a stop.
harika. it has a perfect location, we had a wedding there. was like a dream. I offered to everybody if you go to budapest visit this place.

The best place to admire the beauty of Budapest :). Very nice place to take a walk, make some pictures, eat lunch and admire the beauty of Budapest, visible like on the postcard because it is on the other side of the river than Parliament. Definitely must go!

Great view for a parliament. It is a great place for visit in beautiful Budapest, it looks very old but it is not. There is a great view for Parliament building. Choose a great weather to see more, unfortunately i was there when was rainy.
Dont forget take your camera.

Walk around, but don't pay to go in. This is almost entirely rebuild and cool area to wander around while visiting castle grounds. The view from outside of it is nice. There is entrance fee to go inside of it, but there's really no reason to go in as what's visible outside is the best part. Instead, spend money on going to the Mathias church or hospital in the rock.
Two day in Buda and Pest. Beautiful place to visit. Spend a few hours here to walk around the cobbled streets and visit the church.
Great views from here. Far-reaching views if a little crowded during peak times. Worth a visit whilst in Budapest. Don't pay to walk along ramparts when other sections are free.

best sites in thecity. Amazing views...but you do get charged. Still worth it. If you a photography fan then you won't get better pictures anywhere else. Go as late as you can so that you get the sunset light - perfect :-)

Great views and top place for photos. Beautiful views across the Danube and of the Pest side if the city. No need to pay for a ticket (tourist trap), as you get just as good without. However, if you want to linger / take photos and there are lots of crowds, it can be well worth going into the cafe for a coffee.

Great view on the Danube. It's difficult to miss it because it is close to the castle, in the historical part of Buda. Seven towers symbolized seven hungarian tribes, they differ in size and shape. Probably the best place to take a photo of the city panorama, it is a bit crowded though.

Such a nice place. The construction of the surrounding defense walls and towers is amazing, and the Fisherman's Bastion is a work of art itself. If you ever go to Budapest you must go up and visit them. There is a small tax to pay to go up on the wall, but you can enjoy it from down as well.
Another great view of the river. A must see. This place is really looking nice. All parts are open to take in the river but also next to statues and Matyas Church. Always lots of tourists.

Nice view. Really nice view over the Pest-side. It's only a pity that the former communism leaders accepted an ugly Hilton-hotel placed in the middle of the Bastion.It only shows that even in the communism age: Money talks.

among the best views from here. on the "Buda" - Castle side of Budapest, overlooking the Danube and the "Pest" side incl. the famous Parliament building. Certainly one of the "must go and see" places of the city. Enjoy the view.

Back in time !!!. Great view from this old and charming place. You can see a part of Pest, the Danube river and the magnificent Parliament.
Around there are the Matyas church, the statues Holy Trinity and King Stefan riding.
Not far away it is the Buda Castle.
This old part of city, called Buda is wonderfull
Great place for photos of the parliament. Although this is a bit crowded it is worth coming for the views. We took the funicular railway up, but walked down after exploring the old town.

Great view when weather is fine. You can enjoy the Danube river views mostly when the weather is fine. Climb few stairs to get a better view, or make a small walk around visit the National Gallery with great exhibits as well as the gift shops around.
Beautiful view. A beautiful view of Pest, especially in the sunshine. It gives you a real flavour for the river. It's also worth taking the funicular up from the base - fun for a modest price.

Beautiful building with beautiful views. I bought an Eye Witness Travel book for Budapest before I came and Fisherman's Bastion was on one of the walks in the book around Castle Hill, we had already seen some amazing buildings, our necks hurting from looking up in amazement at all the wonderful architecture but when we stumbled across this beauty we couldn't believe it!Not only was the building beautiful but the views are amazing, you can more or less see everything in the city from the Parliament building across the river to the statue on Gellert Hill, it was a great place to take some pictures of buildings that are too big to get a shot of when you're next to them!Another thing I loved was that you could walk up the tower for free, not many buildings are free to walk around in Budapest but this one was so we could sit up on the tower and take in the views for as long as we wanted. Very relaxing and chilled out.The tunnel from the archway in Fisherman's Bastion led us back down to the village so we could get back on the tram and start our next adventure, anyone visiting Budapest should definately visit this!
Wonderful views across the city. A must visit spot in Budapest. Worth the trek up Castle Hill but get there by 10am to avoid the coaches and mass of tourists
Great for photos. Lovely views of parliament. Nice place to view the river from. Vist St Matthews church whilst there.

Very good restaurant. We ate at the Halászbástya Restaurant, situated at the far end of the Fisherman's Bastion, on our first night in Budapest on the recommendation of an article in a UK national newspaper. It was a good recommendation for this is an excellent restaurant. We reserved a table and were seated at a very fine one in an alcove overlooking the floodlit parliament building. The table was large for the four of us giving us plenty of room for cutlery, glasses etc. There was a very full menu but we chose to follow the chefs recommendations and followed the four course menu. Service throughout was impeccable and very friendly and we must single out the sommelier for particular attention. His recommendations for wines to accompany courses were faultless and, perhaps more importantly, he guided us to an excellent wine shop for later purchases. This was a thoroughly enjoyable evening and a great start to our break in Budapest.
Fab views. The views from here are stunning, especially on a clear day. Great photo op and there's loads to do in the surrounding area. A must visit.

Beautiful!. This spot is easy to access (right in front of St. Mattias church), offers great views of the Pest side of the city, and is beautiful in its own right. It is lighted at night, which adds to its beauty. Only part of the Bastion is open to the public for free during daytime hours. Access to the rooftop area has to be paid for; tickets can be purchased from the cashier's booth directly across from the church.
Great views and photo opportunities. Photo opportunities abound, views are great and on a sunny day, beautiful place to walk around. Don't miss Matthias Church. Great little architectural gems.
Nice view. Good view, good walk. Worth a look while you are wandering around the town, good location to the hospital in the rock and the Mathias Templom
interesting. Liked the buildings/architecture. Great views over the Danube towards Pest. Very clean. Traditional Hungarian food and drink available at reasonable prices.
Views Views Views. Interesting place, great views over the city. Great place to sit and have a coffee and watch the world go by in the warm sun. The coffee was a little on the expensive side.
Nice view, but don't pay for it!!!. Well, it has a great view, but the place besides has a better view and is free! Don't pay for it, buy the tickets only for the Mathias Church!It's a Tourist Trap!
On you Budapest list. A must see. The view is amazing, and you can pay to get on higher floor of the Bastion. Also the walk is great all around
Go!. Such a beautiful place, and a beautiful view - worth going! We took the ride up, and that was just not worth paying for - walk instead and enjoy the surroundings.
Wonderful. A must visit place if you travel to Budapest. Amazing architecture, from the Bastion, you can see an awesome panorama of Pest side.

Nice view-. Really nice view
Look out for the pot bellied guardian brothers who man the entrance to it.
As to the secret behind their bountiful figure , they replied " goulash "
What a View. A long walk up but well worth it for the view of the City. I must have taken dozens of photographs. A must for any visitor to Budapest.

Great Viewst!. You must visit Fisherman's Bastion while in Budapest. It gives great panoramic views of the the Danube river, Hungarian Parliament and of Pest. It is also very close to St. Matthias Church which is another big site to visit while in Budapest.

Pest from the Buda side. Great views of the Pest side of Budapest over the Danube.
Bit of a tourist spot but well worth it. Lots to do and see.

Tourist gathering space but worth the trip.. This place can get very crowded but it's a photographer's dream with chances for great shots of Parliament and the Pest side, the St. Stephen's statue and the street performers.

Best View of the Pest side. (+) Best View of the Pest side, nice spot to take photos of the Danube, Parliament and other nice places
(-) its not free

Great views, but save your HUF. Really enjoyed the views from the Fishermen's Bastion (go out the steps by the 3rd tower, and you don't have to pay to see them), and walking around the little park and surrounding areas. Bring a picnic if you can!The view over Pest is stunning, and it is well worth the walk across the Danube and up the hill. (There is a walkway with steps all the way up to the Palace from where it is only a 5-10min walk to the Bastion.)As with most of Budapest's "old" tourist sites though, the Bastion was never a Bastion, has nothing to do with fishermen, and was built to be pretty for visitors... (Mission accomplished!)The area is *very* crowded on a nice day, full of tourists taking pictures, but don't let that spoil it for you! Also, try to avoid the overly touristy (and ridiculously overpriced) restaurants immediately off the church square.
Architectural wonder. Loved the whole area and the views down to the Danube. The architecture really is worth looking at and to wandered slowly taking it all in is worth the time

Best panoramic view on budapest. You can't be in budapest without visiting the fisherman's bastion. Best view you'll get (except, maybe, the citadela).Don't tempt to pay for the panoramic view. On the other side of the bastion it's totally free.

This is a must for anyone visiting Budapest. You cannot leave Budapest without having seen Buda castle, Matthias Church and the Fisherman's Bastion.From here you can see some truly amazing views all over Pest. This is also a great view of the parliament building.

The place to see the city! Must go!. The Fisherman's bastion is the best view of the city of Budapest bar none. You can access it easily from Szel Kalmin ter metro stop and walk up the hill, or take a bus into the Buda castle. Spend the day, or afternoon checking out some of the great art galleries in the castle, catch a bit to eat in one of the restaurants and then at sunset or even later, walk to the bastion and take all the pictures you will ever want of this classic view.

Beautiful at night. Lovely to walk around at night (bring a camera and camera stand) and listen to the lone violinist that was playing and take pictures, a beautiful view of the parliament, the river and all the city lights. Not many people there at night.
wow. everything in the area is perfect, the view is more than wowyou can see all pest, it is a defiit must see area

Five Stars - Fantastic. We had the most wonder evening. The food was delicious. The setting was incredible. The music played for you at your table was unforgettable. We had fun with the friendly staff. High class but relaxed. It was honestly a perfect night.

Nice views. Great views from the bastion, lots of great photo opportunities if you manage to squeeze through lots of tourists. So go early, befoure tour buses arrive.The bastion is beautifully lit at night.

Pretty place. It is worth a visit here. It is very picturesque. Lots of tourists and def more expensive to eat and drink here. You do have to pay to go to certain areas but really there is no need as the views are stunning without paying for them.
Nice view. Yes, it is nice. Yes, you have to go there is you're is Budapest. ...but I do not like the hordes of tourists, with no, or very little respect for their surrounds.

Beautiful!. It was neat to see the site! All the stones are white, and it looks like a Disneyland castle. From the top, and even under, there are amazing views of the parliament building and the city. There are trails down the hill that are very nice to walk as well.
Beautiful views. Part of the Buda Castle area, the views over the river to Pest are amazing .Great opportunity for some memorable photos.
Great views. Fantastic place to visit in Buda. You dont need to pay, the left side is free of charge. Great views of Pest from here.

Choose a quiet day and you will enjoy it. The Mattias Church where emperor Franz Jozef and his wife Elisabeth were crowned to king and queen of hungary is in the neigbourhood of the fisherbastion. A beautiful area on the buda part of budapest with splendid views and sometimes too many persons enjoying the view. You have to pay for the entrance in the Church and for some of the views. Therefore choose a quiet day
Absolutely beautiful. We visited at dusk. The sight at nightfall was stunning. Felt like you could have been in a medieval castle. Highly recommend the visit.
Nice views. This location had fabulous views of the city and river. The towers themselves are lovely to look at. It is a great location for lunch.
Great Views. Didn't pay to go up to the top level on the main section as you can get the same view from below! Lovely building though and frames the city and bridges very well.
stunning. what a breath taking view of stunning architecture a great place to explore and great view of pest and danube do not miss this on your visit

My favorite in Budapest. As a photographer, I loved walking around Fisherman's Bastion and could easily spend an entire day here. Most people would probably find it sufficient to spend a day in the area spanning Fisherman's Bastion and Budapest Castle. Because, once you're up that hill, you might as well just explore it all! We enjoyed lunch on the patio of a nearby restaurant and were not disappointed. Musicians in the area were delightful, fellow tourists and locals were friendly.Based on previous reviews and assessing the situation on arrival, we didn't purchase tickets to the higher balconies.

Not to be missed. This is a truly wonderful restaurant,fabulous building,fairy tale setting overlooking the River Danube which is all lit up at night,quite magical.The food and drink were all perfect and served by very attentive staff.If you want a special meal this is definitely the place to go.If possible try to get a table at a window with the river view,but even if not well worth the visit.

Beautiful View. My partner and I walked up to Fisherman's Bastion it took around I think 15 minutes but you can take the cable car up also. Once you get to the top the view over Budapest is beautiful. We spent around an hour and a half walking around and taking photos of the view as well as fisherman's bastion as it is such a pretty building. It a must do during your time in Budapest.

My favorite part of Budapest. This is my favorite part of Budapest. If you travel to here, you should not miss visiting Fisherman's Bastion (in Buda Castle). This is a beautiful place, very pritty and romantic atmosphere with a fantastic view from Budapest.
The unique attraction of Budapest. This place is simply unique. I recommend to visit for all. The correct adress is: 1014 Budapest, Szentháromság tér 5. Enjoy!
Great view. Great vie,w, Hungarian sspecific food, merchendise in a nice atmosphere, especially in sunny weather.

Great Area to Visit. This is a lovely part of the city. There are so many places of interest up there. You can take beautifully photos of the city and the Danube framed by the arches.You can catch a 16 bus from the bus stop up the steps from Szell Kalman Square.Have some yummy Gulas Soup at one of the many restaurants up there.

No fish but a great,great view and visual experience.. The Fishermans Bastion is all part of the 'Castle experience..On the Buda side just accross from the iconic Chain Bridge built by an Englishman ,by the way ,one can take the fernicular railway or walk the winding hillside into the Castle District..A visit to Budapest cannot be called complete without this experience and the wonderful views and photo opportunities .Small coffee shops and restaurants and local crafts guarantees a great visual feast..
Lovely place. Very pretty with fantastic views over the city. Gorgeous views over the city at night when the lights all come on

Fisherman’s Bastion is the best plcae to get excelent view in Budapest. 'Fisherman’s Bastion in Budapest is one of the top Budapest attractions without a doubt. The present day lovely lookout towers / decorative fortification of Fisherman’s Bastion were built in the 19th century to serve as a lookout tower for the best panoramic views in Budapest, Hungary. Needless to say, there used to be real castle walls where now you can take fantastic photos from, but the present day structure has never served as an actual fortification in Buda.Quick Facts about the Fisherman’s Bastion BudapestBuilt from 1895 to 1902Looks like the logo of Walt Disney films, only nicer and olderOpen all year round, day and nightEntrance fee: free balconies combined with fee paying top turrets7 turrets to represent the 7 Hungarian tribes who founded the present day country in 895The views from the Fisherman’s Bastion well deserve their own special tower atop the Buda Castle Hill, as not only the Buda Castle but also the river views and the Danube riverfront sights are now part of the UNESCO World Heritage. '

Beautiful building. We, as all other tourists, went here not knowing what to find really. I just knew we "had" to go here, not even really looking at pictures or anything (since there were a number of sites together at the hill anyway) and it was nice. The building is quite beautiful and a nice view, although not the best in town. You could pay to get into the higher towers, but we didn't find it necessary.

Do it in winter time..... Nothing historical, a bit fake/walt Disney style, but nice feeling around (in winter time) and gorgeous view/panorama. One of the best place to see the national firework in Budapest. Do it in winter time or at least in the low tourist season, when it is free access, and avoid it during the tourist invasion when it is over-packed with tourists and spoiled by cafe-terrasses, VIP restaurants and ridicoulous attractions. As many other places in Budapest, too much concessions are given to tourists-milkers, and most of touristic must shoukld just be avoided as they loose their soul during the high season.
Great views!. You gotta go there, if anything, for the views at night. And in the vicinity is the church of St. Matthew, another must see!

Special meal. Lovely, tasty food if some strange combinations of ingredients! The setting is magical and just right for a special meal. Beautiful views across the Danube to the Parlament building. Service was very attentive and staff went out of their way to make you feel welcome.
