Arquitecture, beautiful view and good music. Fisherman's Bastion has a fascinating arquitecture and a spectacular view of the Danube. If you are lucky you get to hear music in the streets. Nice souvenier stores & Church next to it.
fascinating architecture, great views!. Fascinating architecture, great views! - Worth the trip to see Fisherman's Bastion itself and, of course, the fantastic views over the City.

Great View. Great view of the Danube and the pest side of Budapest. A bit disappointed that you need to pay to access some of the turrets. Nice little restaurant in the wall, with great views while you have something to eat or sip on a sundowner/coffee

The view from here and the classical music was the best.. I went out at night. It was so nice to be there, listening to a wondeful music. One man was playing the violin. The air was a kind of chilly but I felt so relaxed. You should go there.

Beautiful view!. Elevated buildings with view of the city from the Buda side! Structured turrets and steps of almost white stone. There was nothing to dislike about this site and the surrounding buildings and shops.
Ωραίο. Nice place to visit, Deserves most at night, really romantic if not much crowded, great view of chain bridge and parliament.

Best place to take photos of city. Fantastic views of the city. You do have to pay a small charge to get to best area but we found that meant we could get some lovely photos without lots of people getting in the way so we thought it was worth it.
Wonderfull structure. Well worth a visit, very picturesque with fantastic views over the Danube to the city. Assessable by hop on buses if you don't fancy the long walk up.

Best view and restarurant in Budapest. Set 600feet above the city over looking the Danube the Fishermans Bastion looks as though it has been ther for at least 300 years. In fact it was built in the late 19 century we ate there on Christmas Day and the food, service ,ambiance were superb. It made the Ritz and the Dorchester look like a poor relation. We ate there twice and if we go back to Budapest it is the first place we will go.
Beautiful spot to see the city. Well worth the trip up the hill side. The view is fantastic. Check out the coffee shop at the top of the tower, best view around.

marvellous view. First of all the Fishermans bastion is in Boeda, from where you have a marvellous view on Pest and the Danube with its bridges. If it is nice weather, there is on the "roof" of the bastion a very nice terrace (belonging to the Fishermans bastion restaurant) where it is really worth not only sitting for the view, but also for the food. (not really cheap for Budapest but very good)
Would be nicer if you did not have to pay.. a large overlook built like a castle wall with great views, but a ridiculous venue to have to pay to climb on, which you don't have to, to see the view.
Great view. Lovely scene. I do not pay to enter the 7 towers but dont think they are much different. Best place to take pictures :) .
Lovely. Beautiful bastion with gorgeous views. A must-see. Unfortunately the Hilton built just by the bastion is a horrible eye-sore though!

Beautiful Structure with Great Views. The structure itself is lovely, looking somewhat like a permanent sandcastle. It's fun to explore, and the views of Budapest and the Danube are wonderful! We went during the winter and it was free, but I believe that the guide mentioned that there was a (small) admission fee during the summer. There was a small bar with amazing views that I'm sure would be unbelievable during the warmer months. One of my favourite spots in Budapest, and right next to the Matthias Church, so more than worth a visit!
Lovely views from here. Beautiful place high on the Buds hill looking over the Danube towards Pest especially on a sunny day. Nice to wander around, or to sit and enjoy the view.

Lovely Attraction with Great Views. A definite must see when in Budapest. We travelled here via the hop on/hop off bus, as the hill is more than a little daunting, and were rewarded with spectacular views over the city. The architecture is wonderful, in fact it is quite enchanting. There are areas for which a fee is required but we found the free areas suited us just as well. This is an area not to be missed.

The Best View in Budapest.. 35 years after my first visit to Budapest this was the place that I most wanted to return to. From here you have wonderful views of The Danube and the Parliament building, as well as many other beautiful buildings in Pest. Today, you can also enjoy a cooling drink or a meal up on the Bastion walls. 35 years ago there was just the view. Beside Fishermen's Bastion is the very beautiful, Matyas Church which is well worth the entrance fee to see inside. There is hardly a centimetre of wall or ceiling that remains un-decorated. It's beautiful. Don't miss the copies of The Hungarian Crown Jewels on the upper level.

Beautiful. The walk up to fishermans bastion was definitely a good bit of exercise, however once you get to the top you will not be disappointed. The building itself is a thing of beauty, and the views are incredible. We enjoyed an overpriced sandwich at one of the small dining areas available, service was lovely and the waiter very attentive. It is a must do in Budapest!
Great view of Budapest. Definitely a stop while in Budapest. Great views across the Danube and a fun little area to walk around

The best view!. We were lucky, visiting this place during a sunny day, not only amazing view of thecity, the castle, the church, the small tunnels there are beautiful and very picturesque.This is a must place to be!
amazing. I took lots of photos it is so beautiful we stayed in the Hilton think its part of the Bastion but well worth the climb up the hill or could get a bus

Very Atmospheric. Go along here during the evening and use it as a viewpoint for looking out over the Danube, Chain Bridge and the Pest side. A beautiful setting and the Mattyas Church, too, is stunning when lit up at night.
Beautiful Views. Really enjoyed our visit here. It has some lovely views of Budapest and is a great spot for taking photos! It really is worth a visit.

Very nice view but not worth the entrance fee. The Bastion is beautiful and looks like a fairytail castle but purchasing the ticket only gives you the option to go up 10 stairs. The view provided from the Bastion is no different from the one you get from the Castke and other hills.
fairytale. Great place for coffee/lunch overlooking the Danube to the Houses of parliament.Take your camera here.

Stunning view. There's a free for everything there can be in this city but it's worth the price - the view from here is stunning and it's worth paying just to get away from the mass of people who crowd around the free spaces to enjoy the view properly.

Fairytale - for free!. Without knowing anything about a bastion, I was able to appreciate the beautiful architecture, and stunning views this place has. There are a few restaurant/bars throughout the bastion which you can stop at if you like, but otherwise everyone is free to wander around and enjoy this magnificent place. It was a stunner day when we were up there, musicians were playing, the views were unrivalled, and the atmosphere very relaxed. Whilst you're up Castle Hill, there's plenty to do. Look out for the men doing falconry - one of them has a massive bird, and only asks 1800 HUF to have a go (well worth the photos opportunities).
Wow. Excellent - really enjoyed the view and wonderful history attached to the area. Serenaded by voilins what else could you want and the sun shone.

Fisherman's Bastion - Very attractive terrace and fairy-tale towers on Castle Hill. Fisherman's Bastion is a decorative terrace and fortification which attractively sits upon Castle Hill, just past St. Matthias Church. The structure was built by Hungarian architect, Frigyes Schulek, between 1895 and 1902. Here you can see a beautiful series of neo-gothic and neo-Romaneque style lookout towers, which have a fairy-tale like quality about them. You almost expect this to be something from a Disney movie or story when you first see it. The terraces are in very good condition and make a nice place to visit, rest and to take beautiful panoramic photographs of the Danube River and the city below. There are walkways from below that lead up the Fisherman's Bastion. We much preferred approaching this attraction instead of from behind. This gives you a nice perspective of the attraction. Interestingly, the name, Fisherman's Bastion, seems to derive from the guild of fishermen that were believed to have been responsible for defending this stretch of the city walls during Medieval times. At this location you can also see the bronze equestrian statue of St. Stephen, the Holy Trinity Column before or after visiting the lovely St. Matthias Church.Overall, we very much enjoyed Fisherman's Bastion and found it one of the more memorable individual attractions in Budapest. It is perfectly situated upon Castle Hill next to an equally impressive St. Matthias Church. Both are very much worthy of visiting while in the city.

Beautiful View. We took a tour from Vienna to Budapest and spent a day here. The tour was not very expensive considering the fact that we were driven here, escorted around and driven back. The views of the Pest side of the city from here is truly amazing. We took many photographs and I can still see that image in my head vividly. The Matthias Church was packed with tourist and we did not have the time to get inside so we took pictures from outside. I would loved to have spent more time here and maybe next time I will.

Castle District. Although relatively new to the Castle District it fits in perfectly with all the other parts of the Castle, Palaces and historic buildings. The views from the Battlements across Budapest and the Blue Danube on a clear day are breath taking. You could spend a whole day exploring the area up on the hill and visiting the various museums, exhibitions and market. Make sure you get the car lift up the hill, I missed it until I got all the way to the bottom!. Although a relatively poor country, it is very rich in Heritage and well worth the trip.
A fairy tale place!. The place is beautiful, seems like taken out of a fantasy movie. The sights of the city from the top are breathtaking. This is a must visit in Budapest.
beautiful. it looks amazing from the outside, but i didn't go inside, it seemed like too fancy place :) the beautiful view of the Pest side of the city can be seen from the walls of this bastion.

Indispensable part of town. You can't go to Budapest and not to see this part of the town. Every tourist tour takes you there.It's worth a look because it provides a beautiful view of the entire Pesta side. This is one of the places where you will take a lots of pictures for the memory ;) During season don't forget to prepare coins because you have to the entry (1E)

Beautiful setting. How all this was rebuilt after the Second World War is amazing. It shocked me - I expected Budapest to retain a tatterdemalion Cold War-era ambience and instead it is rapidly on its way to truly living up to its "Paris on the Danube" moniker. Arriving at night on the river with everything bathed in gold was amazing (my husband, not one easily impressed, said it was a "fairy tale") but in the day from Fisherman's Bastion it was as impressive. We were on our honeymoon and this was probably the most romantic setting we were in all the way from Passau to Budapest, including Salzburg, Vienna and the surprisingly quaint Bratislava. People rhapsodize about Prague but Budapest never seems to get a lot of play - I want to go back and spend more time there.This area of Budapest, while touristy (hey, there's a reason things are touristy - people like them!)has the usual local talent with their little boxes awaiting coins - the violin players, the falconers, the dancers - interesting shops and sights (such as the bullet-pockmarked building from the war, left with only 2 floors, once had 6), and cafes. There is an open-air crafts fair where the crafts are more inexpensive (albeit I think of a slightly lower quality) than in the shops facing, but you'll need to pull cash from the ATM (there's one across the street) first.

Delightful architectural complex. As an admirer of Gothiс style, I couldn't but appreciate that impressive sample of neo-Gothic and neo-Romanesque style. This terrace is not gloomy at all, but it flies gracefully over the Danube bank.
Amazing views. Have a drink up there - just amazing sitting in the cafe and having a drink. It is more expensive than elsewhere, but definitely well worthwhile!
The best part of Budapest. The area around Fisherman's bastion and St. Matthias church is the best in Budapest. Terrific sights and an incredible view of Pest and the Parliament.

A Restaurant With a View. The restaurant and bar offer unrivalled views of the city, and a level of service that was amongst the very best we experienced whilst in Hungary.Whilst the food was of a good standard, it did struggle to match the location - we were able to find better and cheaper fodder elsewhere in the city. On balance, the Halaszbastya has to go down as a 'must visit' in Budapest - the food may not live long in the memory, but who cares when the setting is so spectacular!

Breath taking views. Went with my partner for a few days. We went for a walk and found this area, we walked and walked up many stairs and each time when we had thought the view was amazing we were shocked to find it just kept getting better! I would recommend to walk up the stairs rather then the lift as you can get more atmosphere and amazing views.

A must see. The Fisherman's Bastion has been recently restored and looks stunning, so much so that it almost feels like a fantasy set piece. It's a gorgeous place for a drink in nice weather, and it has the best views across the river to Pest. For us, the only real disappointment was the large and incongruous Hilton hotel building, standing right next to the Bastion.
Great views. Although only a hundred years old, this multi-turreted, Disney-esque 'bastion' is certainly worth a visit for the splendid views over the Danube.

An Outstanding View of the City. Fisherman's Bastion offers spectacular views of Pest -- Parliament, the Chain Bridge, down river -- from atop Castle Hill. The site itself is impressive and comfortable with restaurants and shops nearby. As others have noted, there are areas of the Bastion that provide terrific views without charge! I can't imagine that the "for charge" view are that much better. The Bastion is a "must do" when visiting Budapest.

Charming architecture, touristy but worth it, don't pay!. As you approach from ST Matthias church there are ticket offices which sell tickets to enter the church as to walk along the bastion. If you are watching your spend, walk behind the church and further along and you can walk up on the bastion for free! Lots of action here with old buskers playing traditional folk music and loads of tourist groups coming and going but lovely anyway. visit as part of your walk around this Buda side of the river.

Wonderful viewpoint. I highly recommend this as a great viewpoint in Budapest. Not only is the architecture very nice, but you can walk along the outer walls for a considerable distance to get different views of the city. Certainly worth a visit when coming to Budapest!

40th Wedding anniversary meal. We wanted a special restaurant to celebrate our 40th anniversary. Our hotel arranged a reservation for us at the Halaszbastya. What a wonderful choice. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left was a brilliant dining experience. We were given a window table overlooking the Danube and Parliament building. The waiters and sommelier were brilliant with their service and recommendations for matching the wine to our food. All the food was superb and served with a touch of theatre.Towards the end we were approached by the staff and musicians and serenaded with a Hungarian anniversary song. The hotel must have mentioned it was anniversary as we hadn't. It was a surprise but it made the night really special.
Great View of the City. A wonderful tourist attraction and great for taking photos of this wonderful city. Nice bar/restaurants close by where you can just sit outside and enjoy being there!
well worth the visit. The Bastion decoration would give most of the Churches in Italy a run for their money! The renovation works were excellent and the only criticism was the lack of information

Worth a visit. Fantastic views of pest can be admired from the Fisherman's Bastion, great photo opportunities however it is over run with bus loads of tourists come mid morning but still worth a visit. We got the metro 3 line then hoped on a bus to get to the top- Buda castle is within easy walking distance
a beautiful view. It's like a Disney's caste and very impressive place. From this place you can see a great view of Pest.
Beautiful. Stunning views...a must see! A fantastic place for taking some pictures, and the café allows for a nice break.

Great views / Over-rated tourist attraction. While this site boasts some spectacular views of the city, and is great for photographing........that's about all there is to it. Go see for free, for sure; but there is nothing there that's worth an entry fee. There are a few restaurants where it is nice to stop for a drink or a coffee, to enjoy the views, but the food is definitely tourist fare. You will do better to find some little restaurant gems on Trip Adivsor if you're looking for good meal

Worth the trip to the top of the higg. This produces some of the best sites of Pest. There is the ability to get great pics of the parliament building. This was part of our Viking River Cruise tour. Don't miss this part of the trip. Take not to the bullet holes in the building on the way to the Bastion. Left overs from WWII.
Beautiful. We went later in the day as the sun was setting; there aren't many words I can use to describe how gorgeous it is. Just make sure you take the time to see it!
amazing place!. white stone gallery very picturesque! magnificent view on the Danube and Pest! nice cafe in the gallery with heating (good for winter walk)
beautiful w great scenic view. a very good spot for an overview of Pest. might be crowded with teens on skateboards. a nice marzipan shop.go look at the ancient monastery INSIDE the hilton.

Great views. The Fishermans Bastion offers fantastic views and all for free.....unless you want to go up in which case there is a charge. Fantastic panoramic views of Pest including the stunning Parliament building. Definitely worth the walk up the hill or if you fancy taking it a little easier take the number 16 bus which stops right outside where you need to be.

Very beautiful. Visited after seeing Buda castle! It's a lovely setting and wonderful for taking pictures of Budapest. We sat down in a very nice cafe and had a coke while enjoying the wonderful views.
Amazing view to Pest. this is one of the attractions that every visitor to Budapest must see before they leave! Don't miss it!

Absolutely Stunning.. For me this was a must see. The views of the city were spectacular and the bastion itself was beautiful. Me and my husband visited the cafe at the top of the bastion and sat outside with our drinks wrapped in the complimentary blankets taking in the views. Very atmospheric.

Sit and enjoy. A wonderful place to look across the Danube to Pest,after you have enjoyed walking across the beautiful rampart,look at the reflection of it, and the church in the building behind it, quite stunning when sunny.
ASTONISHING !. Maybe the best place to visit in Budapest. The view of the Parliament and of the rest of the city from there was worth the travel.

Fishermans Bastion. A beautiful castle type building with stunning scenery when you get to the highest point. Not particularly big to walk around but within the walls there is a marzipan museum, along with a coffee shop. Everything you view is made of marzipan and there's plenty to buy of it before going into the museum. Fascinating. Also there is a lace shop with everything made of lace imaginable. Altogether a place worthwhile visiting.
Beautiful buildings and view amazing. The views from here are fantastic and the hot chocolate in the cafe is best I've ever tasted!! Really enjoyed strolling around this area of budapest

Beautifully Crafted. You can't help but be impressed by the craftsmanship of the Fisherman's Bastion.It's an impressive and imposing sight along the back of the Matayaz Church.Few cafe's within the wall which I didn't think we're expensive given their prime panoramic view point.

What a shame!!!. Sorry it's all a building site at moment such a shame!!!and the poor traders.I,m sure by the summer it will be o.k let's hope the traders can all hang on.Unfortuately a lot of Budapest under construction at moment all around Parliament and dock 10!!!Good luck.
Great views and location. The Bastion is on castle hill, next to the Hilton hotel, and well worth visting.The views are great - especially of Parliament.
Worth the hike!. Unbelievable view and changing of the guard thing! Beautiful as the sunset and the city lights came on. Perfect picture spot.
well worth a look.. Just loved this magical place. Everyone visiting Budapest most visit this fabulous building.The fisherman's bastion and the whole of the castle district is totally unbelievable

A jewel from Buda overlooking Pest. On a clear day this is magnificent. St Matthias Church, the Bastion and the views overlooking the Parliament buildings.Outstanding architecture and some lovely small coffee shops and restaurants nearby ... worth the walk up those steps!

It's all about the view. It really is just about the view. Across the river to the Parliament building and the rest of Pest, or over to the castle on Buda. But they are truly spectacular views. I'm not sure how they managed to squeeze so many cafes, but this does take the edge of the place slightly.
Visit. Area was very clean spectacular building well conserved. Musical entertainment cellist, clarinetist throughout the day. Food and drink very good very reasonably priced.
nice view!. you have a beautiful view at the city! beautiful figures - it is one of many things wich is a must-see in budapest!
Great Views. Great views, beautiful architecture and history. Small shops and cafe's dotted around. Well worth visiting

Great Views. Well worth visiting and checking out the stunning views of Parliament and Pest. Also, it's only a five minute walk to the Hospital In The Rock from there, so worth stopping off for a few minutes and taking some photos before heading onto the hospital.

Beautiful building and great view. This is one of my favorite places in Budapest! The fisherman's Bastion look delicate and elegant on top of the hill! If you need to get a nice view on the parliament, this is the place!You need to climb a lot of stairs;.. but this IS REALLY worth it! you should definitely go there to enjoy the view and look at the architecture around you! You'll feel special and love the church and the view (the area was renewed)Too bad they built the ugly Hilton hotel there
fairytale. sat and had a coffee overlooking the whole of Budapest being 'serenaded' by the little Hungarian band bliss.

Beautiful views over Budapest/Danube. We visited during the day. We had planned to take the funicular up to the castle area, but there was a long queue so we walked. Don't worry the path winds up the hill so it's a gradual climb rather than a slog. The views of the city and river from Fisherman's Bastion are stunning (similarly from the Halaszbastya cafe underneath).
The best from Budapest. I recomment this place. We visited Fisherman's Bastion by night and it was amazing view. Also it will be beautiful view within day. Everytime :-)

Amazing views!. A must for any avid photographers/travellers, the views over Budapest were amazing and we had lunch in one of the cafés up there looking out over the city! Be wary of the walk up though, even the fittest of us struggled!

Great place to watch the sunset. Great at night looking over Danube.
For day photos of Budapest is great, though at night the spotlights lighting Bastion up are too strong and in camera lenses to ake photos.

Impressive Architecture. Quite a trek up here if you use the stairs but the views are excellent! Panoramic views of the Danube and over to the Parliament building and Pest beyond. Don't forget your camera!!
amazing view of budapest. It s beautiful during the day, but definitely it s more admirable in the evening. You can see whole riverbank and pest side, definitely a must in Buda.
Never knew about this.. This landmark and the surrounding Castle District are just intriguing. In a very compact area, there are many notable sites, including a Semmelweis Museum.
Good views. The Fishermans Bastion is impressive in architecture but the views across the Danube towards the Parliament and the Pest side of the river are very good.

Amazing. This is a must do when visiting Budapest. It is an amazing building with amazing views over Budapest. Cant rate it high enough. We walked up from the river and it took approx 15-20mins. Nice walk up through beautiful streets. Lots of steps & steep, so not recommended for those with difficulities walking. Various transport options will take you up to the bastian.

Great Situation and Views. Lots to do close by.. There are a variety of ways to get here. Easiest is take a taxi. Best IMHO is to buy a tram ticket from your hotel or an appropriate shop. And from Pest take a 4 or 6 tram and get off at the second last stop, Szena Ter. From the stop, Immediately cross the tram tracks and road towards the hill and fork right up the slope towards the castle following the signs. About 300 yards up you will see barriers and a gate system under a medieval bridge leading to the enclosed Castle District area. Take either fork to the left and you will see the Matthias Church, which used to be the coronation church of Hungary, on your left. Go either side of it and the Bastion is round the back. The towers and wall are superb, built in the very late 19th century in neoclassical style.. Arrange to leave just around time of sunset if you can as the city is illuminated from behind you. The views are amazing.(Try to combine with a museum/castle visit and check opening times. The Castle is shut on the Mondays but the church and labyrinth are close by if you have no choice) Note the pock-marking of the buildings and the lion statues from WWII bullets and shrapnel. Food and drink are available nearby along with toilets for which there is a charge. There is Matthias church beside it which is not to be missed and the art gallery, Labytinth and Pharmacy nearby. A Funicular railway is available for those who wish but the walk down the Zigzag and over the chain bridge will work up a thirst and / or appetite!
Wonderful views of the city, go at night as the city is even more beautiful when lit up. Don't have a drink in the bar by the Hilton Hotel, the price for 2 beers was ridiculously expensive.

A wonderful fairy tale structure. The Fisherman's Bastion on Castle Hill, Buda is an incredible fairy tale like construction which includes a combination of neo-Gothic and neo-Romanesque architecture and consists of turrets, projections, parapets, and climbing stairways. You may think that you are on the set of a movie like "Sleeping Beauty" or the like. In the bastion there are seven towers that represent each of the Magyar tribes that settled Hungary in the ninth century, but of course it is all fake, that is it was built in the twentieth century at the place where in mediaeval times the guild of fishermen had built ramparts to help defend the original castle. Sited as it is at the top of the hill near to St. Matthias Church not only does it afford fantastic views of the Danube and Pest but is a great place to explore the old town and all the surrounding area. It has to be the number one place to get acquainted with Budapest from.

Great views. Its a beautiful spot with great views. Next door is a wonderful church. There are cafes all around and even one inside the bastion and a bar too. Its a strenuous walk to get so be prepared. We went twice, walked once and then took the funicular train the second time.

Excellent views of Pest from this high perch!. Take a few minutes to walk a long the wall and look out over the Danube toward Pest. The view is stunning. Grab a coffee or beer at one of the cafes up on the wall and enjoy the scenery.
Cool Buda site. This was created as part of the Millenium (1896) but still an interesting part of the landscape. Nestled in the St. Stephen's area, it's a must see when in Budapest.
Beautiful. Great place and magnificent views over the Danube. Beautiful monument at the old town in Buda. One of the musts when visiting Budapest.

Don't miss it!. This place is absolutely wonderful. you can easily get there from the Buda castle, and the whole area is very beautiful. The view from there on the river and the Parliament is one of the best in Budapest

A beautiful spot. Whatever you decide to do in Budapest make sure this is on the list ... probably somewhere near the top!This area alone is worth slogging your camera and tripod through security at the airport, the views are amazing. I walked here during the day and enjoyed the view and scenery so much that I walked back there that night to get some more photos.

great view of Pest. on a clear day there are great views over the Danube to Pest. Well worth a visit. The church next door is also well worth a visit as the internal decoration on every wall and ceiling are truly beautiful

Unbelievable. This was the nicest attraction I seen in Budapest. Walk to the Buda Castle over the bridge and find your way to here through the Streets. its not far and a lovely walk. Do not by pass here.Also there seems to be cafe's etc here so maybe dont have lunch before you arrive.! Unreal!
veiws. Amazing views over the city and looking over to the parliament building. This really is a. Beautiful city.
Wonderful views across Pest city. This is a must visit to get a 'birds eye' view down onto the Chain Bridge, Parliament buildings and the rest of Pest, Danube and its bridges.
stunning views. Beautiful and can look over Danube and city. 2 levels and gives good view of Mathias church. Easy to find get no. 16 bus from Szell kalman ter metro stop

Go here. Was one of my favourite places in Budapest. It's like walking around a Disney castle, with great views over the Pest side of the city. You can't miss it if you're in the Castle District, is right next to Matthias Church
wonderful in off-season. Halászbástya is a must-see. I recommend you come here in off-season, since it's less crowded and free of charge. We were told to watch out for pick pockets.

Stunning views lovely morning out. The views were great access to it via public transport was excellent. We barely needed to walk which was great when one of you party has mobility issues. The little town nearby was so sweet. The matiaus church was also stunning. Best for a dry clear day. We went in feb and there were no crowds really.
Nice view!. On the top of Buda facing Pest - there's a great view and it's perfect for taking some photos of the city!
Unique. one of the most interesting and unique buildings i have ever seen. just very different. and the view from the archways down to the danube are just breathtaking!
Lovely views. Worth a visit with lovely views over Budapest and the river. Loads of good photo shots from up here.

fantastic view. One of the top 10 places to visit in Budapest. the bastion as such is a beautiful construction but maybe the view is also a very good reason to go. Very close to other places to see such as the St Stefan's church and Royal Palace (museum).
Great Panorama Photo Spot. The Fisherman's Bastion is a great location to take panoramic photos of the river and both sides of the city.
Beautiful. Beautiful views, pleasant and relaxing. Great spot for taking photos of the Parliament building in Pest.
Scenic view. Great spot for photos, kisses, engagements. The panorama includes the Hungarian parliament, you can make really great photos from here.
Stunning views and romantic at night. Stunning views across to Parliament and wonderfully lit on a night, def worth a visit especially at night.
Amazing view of the city. It was sooo cold when me and my sister were there but the view is amazing and we were both happy we were able to go there on a clear day and see the sunset from the top.

Beautiful, don't miss!. This is well worth the trip up the hill! Unmissable views across the city framed perfectly by the gorgeous structure.
Get there and secure a table in the cafe for sunset over the Parliment buildings with a glass of wine. Perfect end to a day of sightseeing.
Worth the walk. Buda has steep hills and after 2 days of non stop walking this was the last thing i wanted to do BUT the view and the fairty tale like building make this a must see/visit.
Nice view.. OK, kind of generic but view over whole city is nice. But you will be in the area anyway.There is a bar on highest point.
Shame about the mist! . This was a lovely place, the only downside being a misty day we couldn't appreciate the amazing view across the city! It just means we'll have to return to experience it!!!

beautiful...if you don't want to walk up, you don't have to... in my week long stay in Budapest i went there twice, the first time it was really foggy, you get to see the bastion itself which is very beautiful, and the church next to it is an amazing building! but we couldn't see the city's view which was a bummer+ we went up walking which is quite exhausting but doable even without breaks, and there's many routes up and down from all directions. 2 days later i walk up and it was a clear day so i decided i had to see the view from up there but didn't want to waste my time walking from pest to buda and then up the bastion, so i asked and there's a bus n.16 that takes you right up to the bastion and the view...incredible :D
Spectacular views. Excellent views of the river and both sides of the city. Very interesting viewpoint. Well worth a visit via the funicular railway.
The view here is breathtaking. The view is absolutely brathtaking and not one to be missed. It is a little walk to get there but after walking through to see St. Mattias Church. This is a must.
Amazing view!. The site is gorgeous and the views over the river are absolutely beautiful! Take a bottle of water for the walk. Would definitely recommend!
Beautiful view. Wow, it's a great place in a wonderful city. I have seen the all beautiful city and the river. Great!
great view. really nice, if you go see the buda castle take a half hour to stroll to the close fisherman's bastion take some pictures and maybe sit for a cafe .
A very beautiful site with a great view. It's located in a high spot, with a fantastic view over the city. It's near Matthias church, which is another "must go", so it was very convenient.

Best view. This place has the best view of Budapest. From there you can see the Parliament, the river and most of the best bridges. Recommended on a sunny day especially on the sunset where you can see the mix of the colors on the sky and wait the Parliament colors on the night.

Great walk and sights over Budapest. Walk over the Chain bridge and head towards the castle. You need to be fairly fit but you can take a few rest breaks. Uphill all the way in Buda but the Bastion is well worth the effort. It has a good 30 minutes walk around the ramparts with views over the Duna. You can catch the Fernicular railway down but it is only 20 minutes through the park and you see more.
Like a fairytale. We went here during winter. Snow made it very Fairy-like.We had an astonishing view over the Danube.I can recommend it to anybody who really loves to have a nice view
Nice place to see the river side. Very good view to see the river sides of Budapest. Very beautiful!! Recommended to go and I am sure that you can take some nice photos there.

Not too old,but too beautiful. The building have not very long history ,but is very beautiful with an amazing view of the city.I think late afternoon should be the best time to visit because the white color marbles changes their color with sunset.

Just beautiful.. Historic, and amazing views of the city.parking is difficult, so don't be shy to use the BKV (Budapest transit). The views are breathtaking, so remember to take your camera. There are little restaurants and street vendors to try local cuisines, and even pick up some souvenirs.
Spectacular. The mulled wine in the tower was great. They provide blankets if you want to sit outside.Shame about the Hilton next door!

take a moment to walk through it. This was a very cool structure and a great view of the city along the river. Lucky for tourists it is also central to many other sites that might be on the itinerary.

Great view of the city. Probably one of the best places to see Budapest from. It overlooks Parliament, the Danube, and most all of the best sights in Budapest. It's right next to Matthias Church which is stunning. Go at night when there is literally no one there (at least during the winter) and it's amazing to overlook the beautiful city by yourself or with a friend.
Well worth a visit. Great vantage point to overview the Danube and the city in general. Breathtaking - Good restaurants/coffee shops contained within.

Amazing views. The views from here are great, the best photo opportunities in Budapest and you get a proper idea of the scale of the Danube. However the cafes and bars and shops are very expensive in this area, so we enjoyed the views and then headed down to a cheaper area for coffee!

A MUST see if visiting Budapest. This place is truly amazing and the views are STUNNING!! We took so many photos at this location, We were overlooking it from our hotel room and it truly looks like a fairy tale castle!
Excellent views, nice coffee. We stopped off here on a coach trip excursion, took some photo's and took in the view. had a coffee and loo break.Definitely worth a visit
you have to eat here. What a beautiful place, with great views and history. we also ate at a restaurant on the top of the wall, defo a must. amazing food with amazing views. bit pricey but worth it.

Must Do in Budapest. This is a wonderful area, even in January! Great architecture, little streets, cafes, touristy shops, market area with locals selling crafts etc, marzipan museum/shop and great views. In summer I am sure it is even better with more street sellers etc? One of the cafes set in the tower had blankets and heaters on which made it a very cosy place in the cold. Hilton Hotel also has coffees and cakes + TV's & bar. There is an interesting church to view inside (charge). Very nice location to stroll around and take pictures.

Just like the photos. The minute I set eyes on it, I knew I was looking at Fisherman's Bastion, from photos I'd seen. Wonderful views, but not dissimilar to the rest of Castle Hill. One of those seen, it done it kind of attractions!

U will be here. Hey, u're in budapest! No doubt u'll enter the bastion! Okay, u will cross 34981 other people there but it doesn't matter: the view, the building and the castle hill around it make it undoubtfully a place u have (and will) see on your trip. Enjoy it by evening,u'll see the sunset over pest!
Fantastic views. Such a stunning piece of archirecture, looks like a disney castle and the views are just magical. the history behind the 8 coned towers is very interesting.

A very touristy spot. The view from the Bastion is excellent. But the surrounding environment is entirely contrived for tourists and the Bastion itself is literally crawling with tourists from all over. Not very authentic piece of Budapest.

Interesting architecture, GREAT views. A good photo op in the Castle Hill area. The views are amazing, even on the foggy day we were there. If you approach from the back end near the church, be sure the walk down the front stairs to get a great view of the Bastion from the front.

Cafe and Views. The cafe up the top of the Bastion is small, if a little expensive (but then you're paying for the view, which is amazing. We spent a couple of hours here on our first day as it went dark and saw the sun set over the 'Pest' side of the city, saw the lights come on in the streets and on the bridges.

Good Views . When you go up to Buda Castle you will come across a lot of sites. We took the funicular up and down. That cost 1300 HUF which is about £4.50 each so not too bad as it is a UNIESCO world heritage site. Anyway the Fisherman's area is nice and you can get sole noce photos and enjoy the design as well!
view. Offering a great view of the city, its bridges, and the magnificent parliament building, this site has a lot of offer. It is located right beside the beautiful, historic Matyas Church.

Beautiful area with great views. This area is so nice and offers wonderful views of Parliament. At night, it is even more lovely. The surrounding area is also charming, with some cobblestone streets and various shops. I know this isn't an original area of Budapest, but it was a great addition!

A must in Budapest. The scenery here is outstanding, it overlooks the whole of Budapest and is even better in the dark when the lights come on. the area is a photographers paradise, every corner has a new breath-taking view. You should not visit Budapest without visiting the Bastion

Great sightseeing. Not worth paying for the tower, you can see plenty from the free part of the bastion. Great views over the river towards the parliament building. The wall itself is really impressive.

beautiful area for a stroll. you can see the fishermans bastion from the pest side but it looks so much more impressive when your standing within its walls. on the top of the buda hills you can see for miles around, the whole area on that side is well worth a walk, there are lots of lovely little cafés to stop in on your way around and the best way to get up there is by the funicular !

Best time to visit- late night. It's a nice peaceful quiet place to visit in the night. I recommend a night visit because the panaromic view of the city is simply amazing. U should reach there by 10 pm in case u like to have dinner in the restaurant, which is also best experience

Fantastic place, a must of you are in BudaPest. A-ma-zing.......just the most fab place, food great, ambiance and views make this a meal to remember. Staff are great and knowledgeable. Not the cheapest place to eat, but in my opinion the best. Only slightly more expensive that another restaurant close by called 21 which I would not visit again or advise anyone to eat there. So if you enjoy a treat, book now!!!!I do apologies I thought I was reviewing the amazing restaurant adjoining the. Bastion, this is a view you will not forget, it's fab by day but awesome at night. All lit up and the views across Pest side are great.

Amazing architecture and breathtaking views. On top of buda hills, this unesco protected view is just breathtaking. Having reached the bastion just after sundown, was also very romantic.Architecture of the church that it attaches too is just amazing, along with its own design.

Worth the walk. Okay to get to this go up the Ponty Utca by the side of the Art 'otel and it's a direct route. Lots of steps and a steep climb but worth it when you get there. There's two nice cafe spots at the top so you can refresh yourself with an incredible view when you get there.

Unique architecture. It is a wonderful place and looks as it came from fairytales. It's architecture is amazing. The style is absolutely another than in the rest of Budapest. We visited it for two times: in the morning and in the evening. It was amazing both times.
fairytale. Stunning buildings & amazing views! A must in Budapest and its free to wander round. Beautiful at night
Impressive. The architecture is great and views excellent, well worth the walk up to it. Alternatively get a bus or the funicular
Medieval setting with modern day charm. A great place for touring and dining. This provides for a great view of the Danube and is a must stop while in Budapest.

Wonderful. We were celebrating my wife's birthday and spent five days in Budapest. On the last day we visited the heights of Buda. From the Bastion we'd a magnificent view of the city and Danube river. Full of history. Worth a visit!

Photo opportunities. Even though the monument is just decorative, the views from it are breathtaking. There are plenty of photo opportunities to get pictures of Pest and the Danube, but there are also many tourists doing the same.

Beautiful but purely decorative. It is a beautiful addition to the Castle district, though of purely decorative nature. It however gives you the opporutnity for some good views of Budapest and complements nicely the amazing Matthias Church. I personally find the adjasent Hilton hotel a nuissance, because it really does not belong there. Worth the visit!

Budapest on your palm. Once you climb on the top of the hill where Fisherman's bastion is located, you'll be amazed by the scenic sight of the city of Budapest and the river Danube that spans for miles and miles. Even in early January this place was packed with tourists trying to catch as many photos as possible, and believe me, you'll have plenty of material. The castle itself, as they like to point it out, reminds of the Disneyland castle.

A beautiful and photogenic spot to view the city. Located up on the hill overlooking Budapest, the Fisherman's Bastion provides beautiful views of the city and is a great spot for touristic photos (as long as the weather is nice.

Amazing. Really beautiful place that everyone in Budapest must see. It takes centuries ago and you feel like you are in a fairytale. My advice is to go late in the afternoon, so there are not so many tourists. The view from the towers is breathtaking.

wonderful. i was there in the night, drinking a mulled wine in the bar at the top of the bastion (great experience). behind me was the Church of Saint Matthew, under me this wonderful bastion and in front of me the Parliament, everything lighted... it was breath-taking, for real.

Picturesque and scenic. Loved this place as it affords great views of the river and the parliament building across the way. This is mostly an outdoor venue, so your experience is very weather dependent. The bastion is interesting, but some of the wonder of it is taken off by the fact that it isn't as ancient as it first appears. Due to WWII, you have to be forgiving of this when you tour the city. It's a wonderful area to walk around. Buses are available and the public transportation is fairly easy to use (we had week passes which made entering a bus very simple).
Fantastic sites. This was part of the tour that was included for free when getting the 24 hour Budapest Card, definitely a must see
Nice place To visit without fog. Nice view of the city ,you can have some nice photographs of the river and the city It is very important not to be foggy

Best Photo Opportunity in Budapest. Best spot in Budapest for photo opportunity as the City and the Danube stretch before you as you walk the ramparts of the Bastion.Fishermans Bastion was also the venue for the wedding of a relative who travelled over from Ireland for the ceremony having fallen in love with the City some years ago. It made for a real fairytale with a spectacular backdrop as the sun set and some truly great memories and photographs.Can get crowded during the day but is also worth a visit in the evening and there is a restaurant within the walls of the Bastion which was recommended to us but alas we did not get the opportunity to visit.The Bastion lies next to the Hilton which is handy if you are staying there and is also one of the stops on the Hop On Hop Off bus tour to the castle area.

Charming. This is essentially a lookout at the top of the hill on which the old town of Buda sits. It runs behind St Matyais the Medieval Cathedral and is a stone walkway that looks like a long castle. There is a restaurant there as well although I did not try it. This site affords excellent views of the city.

"Disney World-like beauty". Spent an afternoon walking around this area. It reminds me of Disney World type buildings. Hard to believe they were constructed long ago. The buildings were just beautiful, clean and well maintained. Nice leisure walk around the surrounding village where we shopped, had coffee and a pastry. Unfortunately, we were there the day after an international wine festival and some of the temp vendor booths were in the process of being dismantled in the castle area so the photos I took were not what I had wanted. Otherwise, the area is beautiful with breathtaking views. Ride the funicular up and stroll through the village then walk or ride back down and stroll along the Danube to the subway station. Expect to spend most of the day in the area. A "must see" if in Budapest.
A must see. Easy to miss. Book one of the two day bus tours and it will save you a lot of walking. Inside the church is just fabulous.

Watch the sun set whilst sipping mulled wine.. This will be a fantastic location to sit and have a drink whilst looking at the view of Budapest any time of the year. Set on the river. If you visit in winter wraps are provided to keep warm and in summer the outside terrace will be sunny and comfortable.
Must visit. The architecture and location is phenomenal. It is also next to the Cathedral and a shoppers walk to the Royal Palace/Castle,

Lovely place with a great view. When in Budapest you must visit Fisherman's Bastion. Set up on a hill it has great views looking down over the Parliament building and the Pest side of the city, and of course the Danube river. When I visited it was as part of a city tour so I didn't spend as much time as I would have liked, but you could certainly relax here for a few hours.

Beautiful location. Great views and a beautiful building. Shame it's covered in tourists during the day. Take the walk up the hill early or late... It's well worth the effort and couple it with some other activities up the top.

Extraordinary view. It's a most in Budapest and it offers one of the most exciting views over the city. It's near Mathyas church and the marzipan museum. The monument himself it's not very complex, but it's very well preserved.Can't missed.

Amazing view!!!. We were lucky enough to get a spot there at New Year's Eve, about half an hour before the year 2013 changed. Viewing the Pest side celebrating with all the fireworks exploding from different places (Parliament, St. Stephen's church) was truly amazing! Definitely one of our best experiences in Budapest!

A must see. One of the most beautiful sights(if not the most) in Budapest. Offers a panoramic view of the Parliament & Pest city.Can easily take a book and spend half a day relaxing there and admiring the city
Really great. It looked like a Disney castle from a distance. Got some brill photos. Didn't have to pay to look inside.
view. Fantastic view over the Dina looking at parliament,and all of pest . Very clean and a good restaurant,on the wall
Open. It is an open air construction with beautiful view of the Danube and Pest side. It is very romantic at night. You find it next to Matthias church.
must see. the story about the fisherman was wauuu, speachless, do not miss that it is on pripr list for all visitoers

THE most photographed view ever. The day we visited Fisherman's Bastion (30th Dec 5pm or so) it was thronged with tourists - and for good reason! A spectacular spectacular view. Just don't get too carried away and miss the return trip you paid for on the funicular!
Beautiful buildings. Great view, can get the funicular train at low cost up the hill. When at the top of the hill by the castle, visit the lady selling wool boot slippers, they are great.

Another beautiful perspective!. Our trip to Budapest featured so many spectacular views of architecture. This is one vantage point that lends itself to views of the Danube and the stunning Parliament Building!
Beautiful views. The architecture and views across the Danube towards the parliament are beautiful. The square that connects the bastion and church are lovely. Great photo ops.
Beautiful to visit especially on a clear sunny day. Another free attraction in the pretty Buda area. This is a particuarly great place to visit on a clear sunny day, the views are lovely.

Beautifull. The place in Budapest that you must see and find out why is under Heritege of Unesco.
Beautifull arhitecture and the great place to take pictures of Budapest.
There is no fee for this atraction in winter time. Half a year is paid ticket and half year not.
Lovely views. This is a really wonderful place to take photos of the river. I think it would be best to have a guide - we learned so much on a tour that I would have missed visiting by myself.

Perfect place to seeand feel Budapests and Hungarys history. Perfect place to see and feel Budapests and Hungarys history.
Fantastic night scenery of Budapest. But souvenirs are little expensive.

Beautiful architecture and view from the city. On the top of castle hill, right in front of Matthias Church, this white neo-romanesque terrace is breathtaking. On the contrary to what many people think, it was built not long ago, in the beginning of the 20th century, as a monument to the fishermen who protected this part of the city . The view of the Pest side is dominated by the Parliament and the St. Stephen Basilica, and it's certainly the best place to take pictures of the city! There's a fee to go to the top level, but it's completely unnecessary, since the views are equally beautiful from the lower levels.

Go the Bastion to see why it is declared a Unesco World Heritage. Buda is the mountainous part of the Capital and gives you the best views of the city (Pest), the wonderful bridges over the river. Visit at dusk and hang out for a while to be able to catch the city in a good light and at night... That is if you can shove your way through to the best photo spots!
worth to see it. Placed at Buda side on hill. you have perfect view on Pest side from Fishermans bastion. if you are a tourist it is worth to go and see it.

How is this not number 1.. This place is amazing and has the best view of Pest and Parliament. I went here withy family and the colors and details is amazing not to mention the history. This should your top stop if in Budapest.

Premier view of the city. Budapest is one of the most stunning cities I have ever visited, especially at night. The buildings on both sides of the Danube are lit up at night and beautiful to behold. The view from the Fisherman's Bastion is probably the best you can find.
Worth seeing if you are in the area. The Bastion is a nice site if you are in the castle district. It is a small area that has a great view of the city.
Beautiful. Brilliant for taking pictures at night. Just light a fairytale castle. When we went there was a violinist there playing songs and it added to the atmosphere.

Great views from a fairytale setting. Fisherman's Bastion and St Matthias Church had recently been cleaned when we visited in December. The whole area was really pretty and very interesting. It was like something out of a Walt Disney animation like Sleeping Beauty or Cinderella. Lots of little fairytale castles which offer great views across the city and the river Danube. Great view of Parliament too. We went up the funicular and then walked back down. There are a few places to stop for a drink or a bite to eat and there are some shops around the area of the castle.

Totally amazing. Fisherman's Bastion is like a wonderland to walk round, so magical, with amazing views of the river, Buda and the Parliament Building in Pest, this was positively the highlight of our trip to Budapest.The photo's taken are fantastic, and if you manage to dodge the large parties of visiting tourists you can have the area to yourself.Unfortunately the restaurant was closed, which was a shame - definitely a must.
Fairytale. Fisherman's Bastion reminds me of Disneyland, very fairytale looking, castle like. A bit out of place standing next to St Matthias Church but still fascinating to look at.

Fantastic food in a beautiful setting. Fishermans Bastion is a beautiful restaurant located at the Bastion. The food was amazing, service truly exceptional and the ambiance really lovely. There is a circular table in the centre on the restaurant dominated by a large chanderlier hanging over it - this table is very special and really offer the WOW factor - it seats around 12-13 people.

Best place to view Budapest. Worth a visit to take in views of this beautiful city. At the highest point, you can see both the Buda and the Pest - on both sides of the River Danube. If time permits, take the. Boat cruise as well. For me, I felt this city to be even more beautiful than Prague.

Stunning views. This is worth going to at the point it is getting dark, so you can see the sights during the light and then the city all lit up. The view of Parliament is stunning, and the bridges are lit up.

historical place. Very nice place to walk around. We found very good guide there, he showed us all the historical part. There are many cafes around, so if the weather is cold u can drink hot vine there :)

great views. This building is very pretty but it is just a folly as it has no particular use. The views over the Danube and The Pest side are superb. It seems to attract hordes of tourists but presumably they also visit the wonderful and unforgettable Matthias church which is just beside it.
Photo op+++. Superb buildings, magnificent views and efficient transport - not sure if funicular is worth the wait. Very crowded after 10.
Amazing. The view of this place and the city from this place was really beautiful. You will have a fantastic panorama down the Danube with the Parliament building

Just returned from My second visit of Budapest. I visited the city about 7 years ago and have just returned (14 Dec 2014) and the place just gets better and better. The Bastion is a must see and free to visit also, the views over the city of Pest are simply amazing. My advice is to visit the bastion as the sun goes down for photographs as the city comes alive at night. You will get stunning pictures of the parliament building and bridges over the Danube. My previous visit I went up to the Bastion in the day which is also nice. Take the funicular railway up and walk back down is my advice and have a beer or coffee at the bottom in the square. The church at the top is also beautiful but I'm disappointed that Hilton have muscled thee way into building a hotel next to it since I visited 7 years ago this looks and is very out of place and ruins the ambiance. A Shame that huge corporations can wave there cash at a poorer nation for profit without a care for the impact it has on the city, people and environment.

Great place to stop. We found the Fisherman’s Bastion about half way through our extended walk around the castle district and it offered a place to not only stop and have a drink but also take in a fantastic view of the whole city.

Terrific view of the city of Budapest. Situated high on a hill on the "Buda" side, it offers a wonderful view of the city and it's fascinating architecture. Also has a nice little café in one of the towers to get a cup of coffee and a pastry. The Matthias church is right next to it, but the church was closed the day I was there.

Surprised. Didn't even realise we were at the Fisherman's Bastion. Thought it was part of the Mytas Church. Great views of Pest and lots of tourists looking around. Worth a visit but don't allow too long.

A must see when in Budapest. One of the first sites I would go to when arriving in town.The building with it's coquettish tops and it's beautiful location write in front of the pest side and the house of hungerian parlament.If not too colde it's recommended to walkup by foot and feel the hilly part of the city (buda)The funicular is fine but manly for elderly od for the fun for kids..Allow atleast one hour on site
Great spot!. Incredible views from the top! Best place on the Buda side to takepictures of the Danube and Pest side of the city and best place forthat souvenir picture you want to frame.

Beautiful views. On a sunny day you can get beautiful pictures from here. Lots of people. There is a restaurant that let's you use their toilets for a fee across from it. Shopping is poor and very overpriced. There is a grocery store about a block away on the msin street.
Worth to go there. The view of this place is really beautifull.Next the Bastion you can eat, drink or buy some stuff in shops.It's a must do if you go to Budapest !

Do not miss out!. This place is perfect for a great view of the city; you get a fantastic panorama down the Danube with the majestic Parliament building a focal feature. There is no fee, you can wander around at leisure, and Matthias Church next to the Bastion is very pretty. There is a Funicular up to the Fisherman’s Bastion area but there are also stairs and it is easy to navigate.
Exellent view. Very nice view to the Danube river and Parlament but windy, don't forget the winter clothes if you are going there)
Excellent view. it has an amazing view of the Pest side of Budapest. Also, st. Matthew's church is nearby, worth a visit.
Fantastic views. Really nice and relaxing place to go, brilliant views. There is also plenty of restaurants to go yo.

The view will take your breat away. The view from here across the Danube is amazing right across to pest and of course the parliament building . The bastion is a gothic build and the colours are beautiful

A must see. Loved this late XIX century construction with its stairways, walls, cloisters, arched windows and conic towers. There is no entrance fee and the views from up there over the city are just spectacular. Not to miss.

Pretty but underwhelming. Fisherman's Bastion was one of the things I was looking forward to see at Budapest and although it was very pretty and detailed with gorgeous views it was extremley crowded and it really let the overall experience down. I also found it too "touristy" with alot of stalls and souviner shops right beside it. Took away from the architecture and beauty of the place.

Great view but...... . It's true you do get a great view of the river but you don't get a great idea of any of the history from all this new work. We found the citadell way more moving and a great view

Fisherman's Bastion. Great spot to see great views of Budapest. The area around Fisherman's Bastion has many things to see within a reasonable walk. Mattias Church, Hospital in the wall, The Palace, Funicular cable car.

Great location in the castle district to enjoy the Danube from upon high .... Fantastic angles on the city of pest .... Clear views and so many levels to the attraction . A real gem worth the visit and the climb !!!
Gorgeous. One of the most beautiful views you will ever see, gorgeous architecture; went on a Sunday evening and wasn't crowded with tourist, so quaint.

Halaszbastya Restaurant. There is a restaurant directly on the Fisherman's Bastion, behind the Mathias Church to the left. It is a "fine dining" restaurant, phantastic view to the Danube and the city, excellent food, and very good gipsy music. I had a very good evening there.http://halaszbastya.eu
Been there many times. Great view of the city and the river. Excellent photo opportunities all through the wall and the structure as well as in the plaza.

mediavel ambient, and spectacular view. Halaszbastya is one of Budapest's most beautiful sceens. A must see.It has the mediavel ambient of kingdoms and very nice architecture solutions.walking on the edge, you can see the city's best part: both riversides.Checking around in its neighbourhood, gives you more opportunities for famous hungarian buildings to see, that are pretty close.

Amazing - from any angle. Not only the Bastion but the whole Palace area - amazing to see bullet holes still in some of the existing buildings! Ensure you also visit the Labyrinth while at the Bastion!
If possible, ensure you visit at night - all lit up and the view over Budapest is amazing!

the best views of Budapest. You don't actually have to pay for the ticket to go to the top level, but I always do. YOu could just hang out nearby, near the funicular tramway up from the base of the castle. The Fisherman's bastion is lovely to look at and lovely to look out from. Budapest's entire panorama unfolds below you.
Sightseeing.. What a great view from Buda to Peste! Don't miss this if you're visiting the city. Behind, you'll have the Mattias Church, another amazing building. :)

Fisherman's Bastion - Budapest. The architecture is beautiful it's and a lovely place to spend some time taking photos and enjoying the views. Stop for a glass of wine at the cafe and listen to some live music. I'm ready to go again!

Panoramic view.... Vist this Gothic terrace on the Castle Hill on the Buda side of Budapest. What a spectacular view of the surroundings, the Danube River, Pest, the magnificient city and the rolling hills where you can see some more Renassance parliment buildings. There are local entertainers musicians putting on shows for the visitors. The Fisherman's bastion has seven towers, walk up into one of the towers and absorb the spectular view.

What a place. Looks fantastic from outside and from below but once you ascend onto the ramparts fantastic the views over the Danube and from Pest towards Buda Unser past. Like walking through a medieval Castle. There are turn styles to pay to go onto the bastion but they were not working when I went and looked as though they have not worked for a while although it would not have been expensive and well worth the cost. When I went they were doing road works to the road leading to the Bastion so walking had to be done uphill but once the work is complete you will be able to get public transport directly to the Bastion then a 50 yard walk. GO IF YOU ARE IN BUDAPEST.
Gallary dinning. We dinned in the gallery area off this restaurant with magnificent views over the City. The food was fab, the tastes divine and the staff and the musicians were very friendly.

Mock medieval bastion with stunning view. The bastion forms the Danube-looking part of Buda Castle. Despite the name that honors the fishermen guild that manned that part of the city defenses, this is a mock XIXth. century remake. Anyway, the view of the park on the downward slopes, the Danube and the Parliament at the Pest side is quite stunning and worth the visit by itself. As suits a born-again-capitalist country, access to the best part is paid.

Stunning. It looks as thought it is out of a fairytale from across the river and once you get up the hill it does not disappoint. A beautiful place to visit with amazing views of the city. The only downside is the amount of tourists but this has to be expected in such a beautiful landmark.

construction out of a tale. Although a recent construction, walking on it give you a splendid view on the city. From the city site, you can make nice pictures of the Bastion next to the Stefan church.

Wonderful views of the Danube and the City. There are a few bars there too so you can find a spot to sit and relax with a drink and friends. Several spots for great picture taking. Right near Matthias Church and Hilton Hotel.

A beautiful setting. Fisherman's Bastion is like a fairytale setting in January in the snow. In one of the turrets there is a cafe with infra red heaters set overhead warming you up as you drink your hot chocolate or coffee. From there you can see over the city and take the most amazing photographs. Well worth a visit.

Very Touristy, but Beautiful Views. I highly suggest making the trip up to this sight. The architecture is beautiful, the view is spectacular, and it is free! I regret not going back after dark, but was able to visit on a beautiful, sunny day and thoroughly enjoyed it. It is a great way to see the city and the Danube!
Lovely to see views. Lovely area to walk in with lovely views of church, Parliament building and river. Great atmosphere.

Marvelous Views, Free in Winter. I was fortunate enough to visit the Fisherman's Bastion this November (2013) and was pleased to find admission free! My parents had gone in 2012 and had not been so lucky. The views from the top are stunning, looking down upon the sprawling city including the Danube, Parliament, and bridges. Worth admission? I'm not so sure, as the views Castle Hill afford are quite nice, but free, absolutely!

Amazing views of the city. This is truly one of the "must-sees" when you visit Budapest. In the Castle District of old Buda, the Fisherman's Bastion is one of the Architectural Wonders of Budapest. Be sure to visit after dark to view the Skyline of Budapest, the Danube, Parliament, and Chain Bridge all lit at night - Breathtaking!
I see no fish!. But the views over this fabulous city are fantastic. A visit to the cathedral here is a must. We were also lucky to see traditional street entertainment whilst visiting the bastion.
Great views and a nice place to meander. While you won't be the only one here there is a good reason it is a world heritage site and you need to experience it!

Fairy tale. This lovely area looks like something from a fairy tale. The views across the Danube to the Pest side of the river are amazingly beautiful. I can well see why this is a world heritage site.

It's about the view.... Best place to wander, maybe listen to a little music on the square, if you're lucky and to take some spectacular photos. You might take advantage of the Castle Area and do some real walking around the hills. Nice places nearby to have a bite to eat, as well... Take the funicular if you have doubts about the walk up the hilly roadways. Worth the effort...
The best view of Budapest. You have to visit this bastion because of it's great view of the pest side of the town. Great photos, to many people gathering, free of charge
Spectacular views!. Take a walk up to the Fisherman's Bastion and enjoy the views of Budapest. We went during the day but I can only imagine the beauty during the evening hours.

The nicest place in Budapest for me. Great view! Beutifuly lit at night. It is just a must see! Why would you go to Budapest and not have this on your to-visit list? If you are a photographer, for this place, bring a tripod and wait to dark.

Overrated attraction- an incidental attraction compared to the other attractions. This is a highly over-rated attraction as it is simply a promenade for which you can take paranoiac pictures of the Danube river and the Hungarian parliament building. There is a much nicer paranoid view of the pest side of the city which is near the statue prince Eugene of savoy which s next to the Tula bird statue after taking the cable car up to the presidential palace. Ths pace is more scenic, quieter and a lt less crowded. If you are not careful, they will charge you admission fees to see the same scenery as what you can see better at the other location i mentioned.
Great views of the Danube and the city. Don't miss this in the evening with the backdrop of the Danube and the lighting. Great views from everywhere.
Great views!. Great views and a lot of interesting objects in the neigbourhood. If you don't want to be surrounded by crowds of tourists you may visit the Bastion early in the morinng.

Day or night, the views are amazing.. Come up here either by the funichular, or by the steps to get a view over pest. There is a bar in one of the towers so you can sip a drink and look over the views (expensive drinks). Don't leave your camera behind!
Great views and worthwhile walk. Came here as part of a walking tour. Great views over the danube and pest. We walked from the chain bridge and was a steep climb but well worth it.
Breathtaking views. The best place to take in the views of Budapest, and Pest in specific! There are even some cafes and restaurants within the Bastion for having a relaxing moment.
Disney-esque. We were staying nearby, so it was just a quick walk. It seemed like all tourists are going there, very busy place!The view from it was just amazing!

Amazing views. I visited the Matthias Church and Fisherman Bastion both in the day and the night. I would recommend visiting it at night (alternatively, visit during the evening and get the best of both worlds) because the lights and the fine architecture of the Matthias Church made it look like the Disney Castle. The views of Pest from here is amazing as well - you can see the Chain Bridge and the Parliament House. Definitely a pit stop for a traveller to Budapest.

Early Morning Visit. Visited before 9am which I would recommend as the area was quiet. Great location. Like a fairy tale from a Disney castle. Had breakfast nearby at a café on the first floor above a supermarket.

Best View of Pest!. The free walking tour we took ended here and we got some amazing photos around mid day of Pest across the river and St. Mathias church as well as the Fisherman's towers. It was so gorgeous we returned at night to get more pictures of the city lights. Really really beautiful. The #16 bus stops very close so it is easy to get to and from.

Amazing view. One of the most elegant buildings that I have ever seen in Europe. The view over Pest is superb and the place itself is a trully remarkable proof of Habsburg architecture. Can't be missed when travelling to Budapest

Old World Elegance on the Danube. It was a beautiful sunny May day with a wedding taking place here!We found the views from the Fisherman's Bastion overlooking the Danube stunning. Sit and have lunch with a Danube view and a violinist playing Hungarian love songs!

Fisherman's Bastion and Matthias Church. Fisherman's Bastion is a good viewpoint and attractive to look at. There is normally a charge to climb up but they cease collecting by the end of October. Cafés are located conveniently around, plus a public WC - Euro 50 cents to use.The Matthias Church nearby however is stunning and a 'Must' if you are visiting Budapest.
Superb Views. Excellent views of Pest from here, looking out over the Danube. Super spot for photos and a great complimentary feel to Matthias' church behind. One of the highlights in Budapest

Great views of the City. A relatively new landmark (built in 1895) in this old city, but it perfectly complements St. Matthias' church and sets up a magnificent viewing station in the Castle Hill area. Worth going at night -- and a clear night would be ideal.
Buda caslte area. The fisherman bastion is a beautiful romatic place to have a first kiss. Do not miss to see the view from here.

Wonderful view over the Danbube and City. Great viewpoint at any time of the day to look down on the Danube, Parliament building the Pest side of the City. In the evenings it is free to enter the Bastion and to watch the sunset and the reddy orange sunset colours on parliament buildings. Just sitting on the walls watching the world go by was fantastic and there is often some live music coming from the little restaurant which all adds to the atmosphere.

Beautiful. Lovely view and amazing structure.
Do go into the the nearby St Mattius Cathedral - incredible - small fee
Best view in Budapest. This is a set of turrets and stone fences up in the Castle district, looking down on the Danube. Great panorama of the city. Good place to get oriented.
Great View. You literally feel as if you are on top of the world! Great ambiance and lovely weather makes looking out over the entire place spectacular.

Fairytale. Don't know why but I was expecting a fortified wall, what a wonderful place. Is this what Walt Disney fashioned his fairtytale castles on ? Just magical, go on a river trip at night and see it all lit up, wonderful

A must see. A very nice attraction and is a must when you're in Budapest. One of the reason I visited Budapest is because of this. Although they didn't really used this according to our local tour guide and it serves as a fortress for me it serves as one of the focal tourist attractions in Budapest. I just have one regret as I wasn't able to visit during the evening, but was able to see from afar (Pest side) and reminded me of a fairytale castle in disneyland or something.

A bit touristy, but excellent views. Great views over the city from the ramparts. You can get good views from the lower arches without paying to go to the top. At the end furthest away there is a circular stairway to a round tower which has a delightful bar/terrace with even better views. On the day I visited there was a trio playing light music. I did not stay for a drink, just took a few photos, but nobody tried to stop me!
A Fish Eye View!. Great views from here of Budapest at your feet. Don't pay to take photos from a special place, Just walk a bit to the left and the views will be the same for free.

Beautiful. My favorite scenic spot in Budapest, it's even more beautiful at night time. It's a hassle to hike up to the spot, and then things are a bit more pricey, but they view and the structure are amazing. A must see if you visit Budapest.
beautiful and excellent view of the city. make sure to include a trip up here if you visit Budapest. The view is stunning! Beaufully built and restored bastion high over the Danube.

Went for the church, got the steeple. We were actually seeking the beautiful Matthias Church and were pleased to come upon the Fisherman's Bastion which is right next to it. The Bastion is a lovely constructed walkway with turrets that offers a wonderful, albeit a bit crowded view of the whole city. From the towers and the terrace a panoramic view exists of Danube, Margaret Island, Pest to the east and the Gellért Hill. Nice walk up to it and worth the trip.

Nice view. The view from this place is really nice. But my advise - don't buy the ticket to the Fishermen's Bastion. The ticket gives you access only to three towers. There is a restaurant in the fourth tower and you can just walk in to get a wonderful view. The view from the fourth tower is the same as the first three. Don't be fooled into buying a ticket only for the fishermen's bastion.

The great view.. Will always be the vantage point for taking pictures of this city, including the river and parliament. Doubly worth the visit for being near the great Matyas church, and a Sunday market nearby.

avoid the tourists and enjoy the view. This is my fav place to see the city from. If you go, try to go mid-lower season. That way you get the very best of the bastion. The coronation church and lots of beautifully restored buildings in the surrounding streets make the bastion a great place to start a day of exploring from.
Spectacular building. What a rare type of building this is and well worth the visit to this area of Budapest, it was interesting to read about the history of this building

Impressing. I was really impressed because of the architecture of this neo-gothic place. It looks impressing from the outside, but inside you will see the view of the city and the Danube. I didn't payed any fee because I just visited the terrace of this place.
