Stunning. Lovely area, though crowded as is on all the tour routes. Beautiful photos from the walkways. As with all of Europe you have to pay for the loos so go before you head up there if you can. Few coffee shops in the back streets that don't cost quite as much as those on the front area.
A must visit!. Situated on top of the hill it has stunning views over Budapest, it's just an amazing place worth visiting!
Fishermans bastion. This is a must see while your in budapest. It's so pretty and you can walk about it and take your picks. It a 30 minute stop max but it really is oretty cool

N ice to see. Only gave it an average as there are so many buildings, monuments to see and only part of the "buda experience" but nice enough as part of a good day out. Would only do Buda in good weather

Beautiful with a stunning view!. Beautiful view of the Danube and Parliament building. They did charge a fee to ascend to the upper level, but you could see almost the same thing for free just below that.

Be early. The highlight of Budapest was our visit to Castle Hill, especially Fisherman's Bastion. Although not steeped in centuries of history the architecture and views make this a "must visit" when here. Suggest you go there early on a nice day as the tour groups get quite chaotic by mid afternoon making it very difficult to find a spot with a view. Make sure your camera is fully charged because it will get a workout.
Great Views of Budapest. Located on the top of the hill on the Buda side of Budapest, the Fisherman's Bastion is an interesting historical place with great views of the city.
Don't Miss This. Highlight of the walk on top of the Buda side. Great views and the ramparts themselves were lovely. We had a great time.
Beautiful. Beautiful view, architecture, so romantic. You can walk down from here and cross the bridge to the Pest side. Looking good at night too.
Beautiful landmark!. Beautiful place to visit especially on night time! Plenty of restaurants, bar and even a mini groceries store. Very safe during the day and night!Highly recommended!
Great Views. Great place - really lovely views. Went at noon. It was a bit crowded however we also had the advantage that there was a live band, a falcon show, puppet show as well as a horse parade.

Excellent views of Pest side of Danube. A rebuilt monument. Very touristy but the best place we went in Budapest. Lots to see in one area; lots of shops, alleyways, cafes, stalls. Near to Hospital on the Rock, castle etc.

Fantastic Views!. We stayed at B&B just below Fisherman's Bastion so we have a few opportunities to walk up the many, many steps to the top. One thing not to miss is to visit the Bastion at night. Compared to looking at the view in the daytime, the night view was just spectacular. It is worth the trip to visit in the evening and while there, there are quite a few restaurant within a short walk.

The view. This is a peculiar structure with little purpose except to enjoy the great view. It is cheap. Take the time to climb the turret with the bar, and enjoy the view over a glass of wine. Unless you order , you won't get those great seats!

Beautiful area. We liked the scenery and the views from the bastion. We liked the atmosphere of the area, very touristy. We didn't like that you had to pay an entrance fee to get to one of the bastions to see the views of the Pest side.

Wonderful views of the Budapest. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the Fisherman's Bastion. The views over the city are superb. There are many little shops selling local embroidered items and other souvenirs. Prices are similar to those in the main city market. The hop-on-hop-off tourist bus takes you there and I'm sure other local transport services that area too. Delightful way to spend a couple of hours.

A MUST SEE PLACE AND THE VIEW IS GREAT. This is a place that has great history. Many little places to visit in the small streets. The Church charges to go in and only in local money. There is a small buffett resturant about one block away just east of the chruch and Bastion. Many peopel like to photo around the area, and some local famous faces. Small resturant/ Bar greta place to have a snack or tea.
a ripoff. If you want amazing views of Budapest, you must go to Gellert Hill. It's free and you can get amazing pictures and views of the city. Not worth the money.

Nice views. When we got there it seemed that you had to pay to go up some of the turrets. However it is worth a look at if you are around in that area. You can look out of some of the gaps and there are some great views which is good for photo opportunities.
Lovely view over Budapest. To walk along the opposite side of the river from the Parliament building means superb views over the Pest side. The Bastion and Castle view points are brilliant

Absolutely smashing views and buildings. We were lucky to go on a sunny day, but being a midweek October day, it was not too crowded. I'm not sure I would want to go there in mid-summer! The buildings are very cute, the cobbled square interesting, with it's statues and views. The church right there is so different inside with the most wonderful coloured walls and ceilings. The ceramic tiled roof has recently been renovated and is amazing.

What a rip off. This must be a national treasure yet the best bits are locked off from the average visitor unless you are willing to pay. Don't pay just walk a little further and enjoy the veiw for free.
Charming with great view. The Bastion is on Castle Hill on the Buda side of the city, across the Danube from the main part of the city in Pest, and provides a wonderful view of the river and city.

Stunning view. I purposely stayed in Hilton to have this place in front of my eyes all three days in Budapest. Although it is full of visitors in morning hrs before 9 it is quiet. You get excellent city view. Really lovely spot.

This Panoramic View is not to be Missed. Great views of Pest, the Parliament building, and the Danube. Don't miss the ruins of a church at the end of the Bastion. They have done a beautiful job of giving you the size and scope of the building. You have to go through the gate to see it.
What a view!. Just a really lovely spot, with stunning views. It did get quite windy and chilly, but absolutely worth visiting.
Beautiful View. Great place to get pictures and just generally view Budapest. We lucked out and had a sunny day. Even though it was early October, though, the place was crowded.
Great views. No need to pay admission to enjoy the view. Nighttime is especially as crowds are less and you can enjoy the city lights
What a view. Best panoramic view for Budapest! we couldn't enter the church as there was a wedding event but the outside architecture is beautiful and the view of Pest is stunning!
Fantastic View!. This is a great place to go for a quiet walk at night. The view of the Parliament building in Pest and the Church behind the bastion are incredible!

Great views, great place to walk around. On the Buda side, this area has a terrific view from on high, located next to the castle and museums and Matthias church...a great place to walk around with lots to do.

A fabulous View of Pest and the Danube. We visited on a bright sunny day and could see a long way! Very nice venue to explore and have a beautiful view. Unfortunately (for us) Matthias Church was closed for a special mass and we were unable explore it as well as they are collocated.

Amazing Vista. We spent several hours high on the Buda side of the city. From there you have the most incredible panorama of both the Buda and Pest sides of the city as well as the Danube in between. The historic buildings and church at the summit are also worth seeing with small shops and eateries located along the winding cobblestone streets. This site is not to be missed if you enjoy travel photography.

No fishermen here!. This is a beautiful and unique ediface with an interesting history and an incomparable view. There is a lovely covered walkway dotted with cafes and tables where one can refresh onesself from the heat, have a drink and delight in the view.I think it would have much more appeal if there was no entry fee, which is really only a charge to have the view from the upper level.
the view. worth the walk up the hill, the views are amazing and the bastion looks like a castle from disney movies

Fab views. some part of Bastion is converted to cafe and also pay small fee to go up, but you don't need to spend money to see great view of the Pest.
Just sit down and relax...before move to next attraction!

Live like Royalty. If you only have one night in budapest make sure you visit the castle area and bastion in the late afternoon and wait for night. The bastion area is an amazibg place to sit and take in the sights of Pest at night. You feel like royalty sitting high amongst the columns. We walked across chain bridge, caught the furnicular up to castle wandered around there then walked across to Fishermans Bastion.

Lovely views. It's like a storybook castle. The walls didn't look real. It's well worth walk. Great photo opportunities. It's in an area with several other attractions and we thought that this was part if the church and carried on searching for the Bastion after our visit. It wasn't until we got back to our hotel and tried to figure out where we went wrong on the map that we realised that we were there all along.
Great photo op. Interesting history and beautiful towers. But the best is the views to the city, Pest side. Nice place to just relax and enjoyed the views.

Incredible views of the Danube!. This is a 'must see' if you go to Budapest. The views of both the Danube River and the Pest side of the city are incredible, particularly at night. I have two cautions. In October, when we were there, there were large crowds on morning tours to this area. Secondly, and more importantly, be very cautious when walking along the Bastion. The walls are quite low in height and it could be easy to lose your balance if you are tall, and it's about four stories down! This is a great spot for photos and there are a number of cafes and restaurants in the area.

Neat. Fisherman's Bastion is an extremely old fortress that the fishermen of long ago built to protect themselves and the city of Budapest. It's amazing how it's withstood the test of time. It is located on the Buda side of Budapest and you need to have strong legs to walk it, or take a tour to get up there. But the view of the city is great! You also need a guide or a guidebook to explain the significance, so you can have a better appreciation for its magnificence.I have marked that there is food avbl for purchase and restrooms, because both are nearby, although not necessarily AT the bastion itself.

Fabulous View. Take the funicular up to Castle Hill and this is where you will find this site. Great views looking across the river to Pest and from up high you could see the Parliament building and the lovely bridges that span the Danube - we had a glorious blue sky day, though it was very busy, it is worth a visit for the view alone.
Fabulous view. Our hotel was just down the street. We were able to enjoy the view both during the day and at night. I would recommend making the trip just to see the view.

Beautiful views and some lovely buildings.. The views across the river are lovely from here - it's a good spot for photos. Some beautiful buildings round the area but lots of work being carried out at the moment. Big tourist spot so try to be there out of the main tourist hours. Quite disneyesque in places!
Amazing views. Out of this world venue with service of the highest quality but food not quite of the same standard.

Stunning. Walked up to the Fishermans Bastion which is situated next to Matthias Church, both are absolutely stunning, the Bastion looked like something from a disney fairytale. Definately worth visiting.

Great View. Great view over the Danube and the city . Many beautiful buildings and lots of places to take photographs . While we were there the road works restricted public space but should be fine when work finishes .

The Best View of the Danube in Budapest. This is the area where most tourist arrive to take pictures of the Danube and enjoy a massive amount of historical joys with the St. Matthews Church (Mathias Church) and also the voluminous restaurants and coffee houses/bars. You will truly enjoy this feast of history and great sights to see and capture.

Do this at Night, without the Crowds!!. The views from the Bastion are unparalleled, but the crowds during the day do impact the overall feeling. There is a separate entry ticket required at the south end of the bastion, but it's worth the small cost in order to see the views of the Danube below and the city of Pest spread out in front of you, along with the Parliament building. Every tourist has this same picture, so you might as well have one, too!
Good views. Don't pay the fee to walk up the stairs unless you really have your heart set on it. There are amazing views of Pest on the main level, and they're free.

great view. Really nice views of Budapest from here making for great photo opportunities. I can imagine it would be magical at night. Interesting to see the row of money changers....we used them with no problems.
Fabulous views. The roads were being worked on creating a difficult time to get here but worth the hassle! Really great views and interesting area / people
Will be amazing very soon. After restoration is complete this area will be one of Europe's main attraction. Totally impressed with the history and the hungarian pride.

Disneyfied. I have viewed Halaszbastya many times, but never paid the money to ascend to it. The views must be quite fine, but my overall response is that it is a very early (end of the 19th century) rendition of Disney World. There are often musicians and slight-of-hand gamblers around the Bastion, fun to listen to and watch.

Amazing view, go at night. To go up on top of Fisherman's Bastion during the day they charge you but after 7pm it is open free to everyone. The view is even more amazing at night since the parliament is lit up and there are a lot of boats on the Danube. We took up a bottle of wine and enjoyed our last evening in Budapest here.

Fisherman's Bastion one of the best viewpoints of the Parlement on the other side of the Danube.. We went by taxi to Castle Hill where the Fisherman's Bastion is.There is also the castle and church to see.We went to the Faust winery inside the Hilton hotel for winetasting and enjoy it very much.After the tasting we looked at the beautifull view at night over the Danube.There after you can get a taxi infront of the Hilton hotel.I think 3 to 4 hours is enough time to view everything, but if you whant to go inside every attraction you can stay a day up there.We used the toilets inside the Hilton Hotel and their are some places to eat or shop for sueveniers.You can also used the cable car from Chainbridge or walk up the hill.If your time is limit the best way is by taxi.
Community Centre. There are a lot of activities, just in case, you are free to do it....stall-games, restaurants, mobile boat, bar and grill, feeding ducks...but I didn't have time.

excellent wine and a magnificent view. Wine tasting on a high level. Excellent Hungarian wines, knowledgeable somnolier, lovely Danube river down below, magnificent view of Budapest, and trusted company: 20- odd friends from year 1959 Leyden University, the Netherlands. Could nót be better.
Fascinating Buda. For one of the best overall views of Budapest you certainly cannot beat the amazing view from the Fisherman's Bastion...definitely a place not to be missed.
Fisherman's Bastion. A beautiful view of the city. The structure is newly renovated and looks a bit like Disney Land, but still is worth going up to see.
One of the great places in Budapest. Great place to visit . Wonderful view of all Budapest on a clear day. Take the time to go around on the narrow streets and enjoy the atmosphere.

My Favorite Budapest Site. This was my favorite site in Budapest because of both the Fisherman's Bastion and Matthias Church are right next to each other. There is a great view of the Danube and the Parliament building. If you can visit at night it is very beautiful and just an amazing view of the city.
Very nice. It's for sure worth seeing. One of the greatests attraction of Buda. Place like a Disneyland , beautiful photos of Budapest's panorama. I do recommend it...

Fisherman's Bastion. Great historical story to it. A site that one should visit as you go up to the Palace. In general Budapest is a nice city to visit, lots of tourist attactions, very good restaurants, 1 in particular, "Sir Lancelot", a cosy medivial setting to it. Most of the people speak English but be aware og the gypsies.

Great view of the city and Matyas church...especially from the cafe inside of it.. Definitely should be on the itinerary of anyone visiting Budapest for a few days. It is romantic place to be and offers terrific city views. it is part of the Buda Castle area, so if you're already there, take the short walk north to check it out. There is a bus line (16) that will take you up/down the hill if you don't feel like walking as much. It hits Deak Ferenc ter and Clark Adam ter, so you can pick up this bus from the Buda side of the chain bridge or via any of the metro lines that arrive at Deak ferenc ter on the Pest side.  The view is fantastic, especially if you buy the admission ticket that lets you go to the top part of the structure...or if you have a drink or snack at the cafe inside. You can easily not pay and just walk around the area, as there are still lookouts for those that don't cough up the 500 or so forint admission. There are also plenty of nice cafes around the area that don't charge quite as much (although they also don't have the gorgeous view either). The Gellert mountain's view is wider and more unobstructed, and also does not charge admission...so if you want the best views of the city and Danube, you will be all set if you go to both Fisherman's bastion AND Gellert mountain.
Nice architecture and sight.. Beautiful place, friendly peoples, amazing architecture. Perfect places for take a rest make beatiful photos.
A part of our Buda Castle. Fisherman's Bastion is somehow a part of our Castle quarter, it is very suitable for romantic walkings and you can have a wonderful panorama.

Very nice place with a fantastic view. One of the best places to see Budapest-a wonderful city. Matthias Church is very close by. Fantastic place with a great view. This is a cant miss for sure! Reccomend this to all family types! :)

Great Views. The arches make a great frame for photos. Line your loved one up with the parliament behind - perfect Budapest. Usually can hear gypsy music as you wander around enjoying the Danube view.

romatic. if you one to kiss your partner in Budapest, than the most romatic place can be this Fisherman's Bastion. Take 2 glasses and a bottle of wine with you and enjoy the view and your partner of course

Unparalleled views. Fisherman's Bastion is an essential visit for anyone wanting an iconic view of Budapest -- especially its Parliament and Chain Bridge over the Danube. There are two levels and we noticed there was a charge to go up to the top level. We didn't do that. Instead, we walked up the steps at the far end which led to a cafe on the second level. We didn't have coffee, but we got a great view without having to pay the extra fee. And the views from the lower level are just as good, so there really isn't a need to go up at all.
great views. Although it looks ancient this is actually a fairly modern structure Something like a fairy tale castle. You can imagine Rupunzle looking over the balcony
best of buda. the best of budapest!!the view is amazing from the bastion. great place to take pictures ..absolutely loved it!

Great view from here all over Buda and pest. the architecture is famous here and you will be happy with it .it looks like it should be in a Disney film I liked everything about it ,it is very high up x
Just like something out of a Fairy tale. It really is like something out of a fairy tale. Absolutely beautiful it is a must, great views of the Pest side & River Danube.

Good views across the river. We enjoyed our visit to the fisherman's bastion with its beautiful views across the river. We were pleased that we were not tempted to pay for tickets to go onto the higher level because, at the other end of the wall, you can go up the stairs to a restaurant and look out for nothing. The musicians and artists added to the atmosphere.
Unusual architecture. Such an eye-catching building with all the lovely turrets and walkways. Stunning views down to the Danube and up towards the castle. The whole area is picturesque and beautiful.

Most beautiful place in the world !!!!. We visited here as we were told it was very romantic. The Cathedral in the centre is beautiful and well lit at night, as we were there in february we wanted to see it in the light and dark so as the sun was going down we went into the shop up there that has a coffee shop upstairs and they do the best hot chocolate i have ever tasted!! Fisherman's Bastion looks even more beautiful in the night it is mind blowing i think it is one of the most romantic places in the world as me and my fiancé got engaged here that night, we will always love this place and definitely want to go back at some point.

Nice view, interesting location, commercialized?. I get that there are tourist traps, but this one was kind of disappointing. A city landmark taken over by a bar/restaurant? Do you think the "founding Fathers" of Fisherman's bastion had this in mind?

Oh so busy. This is a must visit when in Budapest, it is part of the tour to the castle area and well worth the effort. Even though we were out of season it was very busy, best go later in the day when all cruise ship visitors have gone.
Wonderful Views. A superb outlook over the River Danube and Houses of Parliament. Get to spot all those river bridges and special sites. The one that tugs at your heart if the Liberation Statue.

Beautiful view! Make sure not to get caught in the tourist trap though.. Fantastic view! absolutly glorious. My mother and I went to the church just before and didn't buy the ticket for the bastillion, which was great as when you go on the left hand side, you get the same view for free! Beautiful before and after sunset!
Great views and nice terrace cafe. Interesting building with great views over to Pest side and Danube. Nice place to while away some time in the sun.
fisherman's bastion. Loved the unusual design. Loved the turrets, the circular balcony, loved its location by the river. Did not dislike anything

Very best views. This is a highlight of a visit to Budapest. The views fro the bastion over the Danube and Parliament House are stunning. The nearby church has a very unique and beautiful roof. This is the place for spectacular photographs.
Great location - Vegan food on request. Super location and nice view, No vegan food on the menu, but they cooked a decent vegan pasta on my specific request

Lovely views at night. Walked up to the castle about 9.30pm and the views were certainly worth all those steps! It was so nice and quiet at that time too so you could take a nice stroll round and take pictures without the hussle of daytime. Only shame is that the bar/cafe had closed already.

Absolutely the best tourist stop in Budapest. Unusual and beautiful architecture, stunning view of the Danube and parliament building, a fun place to be and to take pictures of-and it is all for free! Go to the end and take the few steps up to the bar -- the highest spot with lovely balconies. You don't have to buy a drink there.

Unsurpassable views of the Danube. I wonder if there is any other place in entire Europe that gives you such wonderfully scenic views of the Danube - or of any river for that matter. The visage of the great buildings of Pest rising on the other side of the river has charm as well as grandeur. The Matthias church is wonderfully different as well, with a uniquely colourful roof.
Amazing views. Jump on the big bus tour which will take you up the hill to fisherman's bastion.Amazing views of the whole city, also some lovely little cafes & shops
A beautiful piece of history to protect a city. A stunning piece of Budapest history, which one would never think was built for protection. Very beautiful and the view over Budapest is fantastic
Fabulous place. Gorgeous building and great views over Pest and the parliment, old Buda is up here too and it was a fabulous day walking around the streets.

Spectacular views, castle in disrepair. Very steep walk from bus parking and very large crowds. Some repair work is being done on the footpaths and road. Roads are apparently not strong enough to cope with large numbers of tour buses which use this area. A large section of the castle is currently closed off, hopefully for repairs. What is there is impressive, the views from the castle walls spectacular, as is the bottom entrance. It is possible for those who find stirs difficult to get to the top and enjoy some of the views. There is a coffee shop there too which was great protection from the very cold winds on Friday 27 September when we visited. We were on a tour and am sad to say did not have enough time. Would love to have had time to discover the identify and story of the bearded bronze man lounging on the rustic wooden bench in the grounds next to the parapet looking over Pest.

Stunning Cinderella type architecture but sadly overrun with tour bus tourists. The views from here are wonderful. The architecture is pretty white stone and is quite stunning. Sadly it was jammed with a number of tour bus tourists following an umbrella which ruined it for me. Visit later in the day when they have all gone away!!

great view of the parliament building. this place is just magic. We happened to spend the day & night time here & enjoying the view especially the parliament building on the other side IOC the Danube river on Pest side... you'll get such a great photo from here & the church just right next beside the fisherman's bastion has such a unique & unbelievable roof... what a beauty to see it especially on the night time with all the lights....;)
Amazing views. Amazing views from the city and the river, don't pay at the begining, at the end of the bastion it's a view for free from a bar
Beautiful view of Pest. We didn't pay to climb the upper deck. The view is already good on the lower deck. It'll be good if the sky isn't so cloudy.

Great views but very crowded. Visited here twice & found it very crowded both days so that to enjoy the views of Pest on the opposite bank of the Danube, we had to wait our turn to find a spot. If you wanted a clear view, you could pay a fee to walk on the upper level, which I found rather odd. The terrace is lovely and the buildings are most interesting. They are well maintained and the views are worthwhile.

Beautiful place. Very beautiful and you have a nice view of the Parliament. Don't pay to go up, because on the other side you can climb it for free and you have the same view! This is a must when visiting Budapest!

Visiting the Fisherman's bastion. Sept. 16th,. What a gorgeous place. There were spectacular views of the city down below. There were so many people our tour bus had difficulty getting out, it was a traffic jam. It was well worth seeing.

Good view of the parliament. First, don't pay to enter the part there's been blocked off-it doesn't make sense, given you could climb the other side and get the same view for free...You can a very good view of the parliament and the Danube! Facing the parliament, if you look to your right side, you'll also get a nice view of the other half of the bastion! I think this is the most touristy area in Budapest, so be prepared...

Incredible views of Budapest. We were so happy we went on a tour of Capitol Hill and Fisherman's Bastion. You see a lovely panoramic view of the Pest side of Budapest from the Buda side and also see much of the Buda side as well. This is a highlight of visiting Budapest.

great place. if you visit it during the day you will marvel the site as well as the great views that you get of the Pest side. Its a part of the Buda castle complex. At night the dim illumination unfolds a mystical feel to the place. The feel is surreal if you are visiting the place in a small group or as couple.
Beautiful Views. A must visit place on your visit to Budapest, stunning panaromic Views. A feel good factor about the place.

Excellent place!. Halaszbastya offers absolutely stunning views on the Budapest and its river and bridges! Students pay just 350 HUF! Lovely architectural style! Probably my most favourite building in Budapest!
another old town-but with a view. I think Hungarians are safe from Communism when they charge for the view...good job! But give yourself time to browse and tour-which we didn't have.

Nice views; that's about it.. It's probably important to visit because the panoramic views are exceptional, but that's about it. One gets a better "feel" of the area and its importance as a fortress by wandering further afield.
only good views. the views of the Danube are stunning but its quite expensive for a walk on a wall, you even need to pay to use the loo!
Beautiful. It's a beautiful sight especially in the evening. Hightly recommend spending a couple of hours exploring the Bastion and the church.

Three attractions together. Mathias Church, Fisherman Bastion, and the best view of the Parliament Building are the three attractions you get to see here. A nice tourist spot where you can spend between 1-2 hour if you are not on a conducted tour in which case you get half hour to 45 minutes.Go to the ramparts of Fisherman's bastion to get the best view of the Parliament Building, the only other place where we got a similar or better sighting of this magnificent building was on the river cruise on the Danube.
A must-do. This site is a must for anyone visiting Budapest. A great height to see Pest on the opposite side of the Danube and beautiful.

Very photogenic and also great photos to take from there. Although it was built in the 19th century it looks very medieval and makes great photos. Also from its balcony you can see the Pest side: Danube, Parliament, etc. My favorite spot on the Var - Castle hill.
Gorgeous. Just don't purchase a ticket to walk along the top- it's only for a tiny little bit of it and you see everything from the next stretch which is open to the public.
Fairytale like. It is a fairy tale like place to walk through. The views of Parlament and the Danube are so worth the climb. Do the tour on a bike and you will enjoy it double

A truly impressive loaction to view Budapest. Located above the Buda part of the city you get a perfect view of the River Danube and the Pest part of the city on the opposite shore. The architecture of the area is truly magnificent and the streets nearby for a perfect escape from the busy life in the rest of the City. It is a short walk from the Royal Palce and National Museum.

Must see... when in Buda. The whole installations and specially the city view worth the visit.
Anyone who can, must visit Budapest!

Great views. It was no doubt a short climb up the Hill but not too much, the day was bright and hot and the white of the Fisherman's bastion reflected well, the ambiance was lively and being a St Stephen's day the streets were crowded with locals and was a good feeling. A sight not to be missed.

a place to visit. Nice spot for a romantic couple.
Very picturesque view. nice place to make some beautiful shots.
There is a museum of Marcipan nearby.
Always live music
Wonderful. We strolled here, and it was absolutely picturesque - the view of Pest with the architecture itself... A must see!

Panoramic View. Lovely lookout towers, it's the Hungarian version of Walt Disney, nicer and older. Inside you'll find a chapel and the famous 7 turrets - representing the 7 Hungarian tribes who founded the present day country in 895, see the Buda Castle and the beautiful views of Danube river.

Good view for good pictures. It is worth going up the hill. Better if you go after visiting the castle and St Mathias church. There are ticket booths to purchase tickets to enter St Mathias, they offer a package with tickets to enter the the bastion, only purchase tickets for St. Mathias, because you can walk for free and have good views in most of the bastion. The tickets allow you to enter to one of the sides, it is worth paying only if you see really large crowds and you are kind of a profesional photographer that needs time and space to take your pictures.

Great views. The views from the Bastion are what make this a great place to visit. It's a shame that parts of it have been given over to blatant capitalism with small restaurants taking the best spots.

Entry fees for Fisherman's Bastion. Though the Fisherman's Bastion is an excellent area of the castle area. The entry to the Fisherman's Bastion costs about 700 HUF per person. It's only a place to sit to take some photographs. You can as well do this from the area right behind the mattyas church. The entry fees for Fisherman's Bastion is a very poor value for money.

Budapest's Disneyland. We went up the cable car which was so cheap and then walked down. It is like a castle up on the hill with amazing views. Lovely to walk around and plenty of cute little shops and bars to look in. A must see
Attraction. Spesial history and interresting. Easy to find and also a special atmosphere. But crowded much people want to visit.

A place with a difference. A place with blend of Neo-Romanesque, Neo-Gothic and Ramantic style. The place of King St. Stephen`s statue. A nice view from top. The row of bastions illuminated at night offers a scenic view from Pest riverfront. A must to see.

Magical. We loved visiting the Fisherman's Bastion. We hired a private guide who took us to visit Bastion. We enjoyed it so much, we returned the next afternoon. My husband is a photographer, so we barely saw him. He was in his element. The view from the Bastion is fantastic. Our first visit was earlier in the day and the crowds made it difficult to photograph. Our next visit we returned later in the afternoon.

Gorgeous. This is worth a visit, will only take a little bit of time. Great views, well kept and the architecture is amazing. The only issue is that they charge a bit and the rates aren't what they advertise but well worth it!
The church is fabulous. The church is in Art Noveau style. Lots of Budapest history can be found. The ticket office is messy but still worth to visit.

Will come again for sure!. Oh, we went on the day where there was a welcome match for some important delegates from Brazil. Other than that, the view was excellent, breezy and great place to just sit and relax. Those who likes to take photos, again, because this is on a hilltop, best to go when the sun is not directly on your head - created quite a few difficult angles for me.

Gorgeous views, Magical architecture. The Fisherman's Bastion was one of my favorite attractions in Budapest. Amazing view of the Danube and the city, and unique architecture. A great place to explore, with a refreshing fountain in the middle.
Great bar/restaurant. Best nighttime view of Budapest, good live music. Prices are on the high side, but that is to be expected.

History with the best view!. We went up to the castle using the funicular rail, then walked along to the bastion. Nice sense of history and really nice architecture even though parts have been rebuilt in the original style. Well worth a visit and the view over city is to die for!

Beautiful architecture and a great view of the city. The castle like architecture, the fantastic views of Buda and Pest from the vantage point, the crowds of tourists, the open air restaurant on the peak, the live Eagle photo shoot opportunity and the overall ambience would make for a great visit to Fisherman's Bastion.If you take the hop on hop off bus route, you can get off here, spend an hour or two and then be on your way to the other wonders of this beautiful city.
Spectacular views. If you want an excellent view of the Danube, Houses of Parliament etc then this place fits all. Full of tourists though in high summer season!

Felt like a Princess. Fisherman's Bastion is a most see. The views from the top are the best in Budapest. You can take the most amazing photos of Parliament House. You can have a coffee or drink at the top and pretend your a Princess. Staff were very nice and helpful also.

Views to die for! (Or photograph...). First of all, it costs not a single florint to get the fabulous views of the Parliament and the Danube, and all of Pest, laid before you. If you REALLY want the highest point of the Fisherman's Bastion, it will cost (but less for students and seniors), but I really can't see the sense of throwing good money away when the difference between the free view is hardly different from the pay-per-view. Be aware of touts and pickpockets in this heavily touristed area but, above all, enjoy something that is truly unique in Mittel-Europa!

Sunset spectacular. Take a taxi to the Hilton Hotel in Buda and walk to Fisherman's Bastion, where there are a couple of places where you can have a drink and watch the most spectacular sunset, overlooking the Danube and the lighted buildings in Pest. There are several excellent restaurants within a short walk, including Pest Buda.

Amazing fairytale place. We had our wedding photo shoots here - it is one of the most amazing places in Budapest, definitely my favorite. The architecture, the history and the view are simply unique. All major Budapest sites are visible from here: the Danube, the Chain bridge, the Parliament, the Basilica, Margaret Island etc. A must-see for anyone in Budapest (local or tourist). Tip: check it around 18 o'clock in summer, and you will see lovely sunset colors if the weather is nice, great for photos.
what a view. one of the most beautiful views of lovely Budapest. Spend a whole day. lots of shops and cafes and many historical things to see and that view really is amazing :)

Picturesque, a must see.. Most photogenic spot in Budapest, it is the #1 must see when visiting. Walk the surrounding castle grounds and take some great photos of this site and of the Danube, chain bridge and parliament on the other side of the river.
A nice view of Budapest. The Bastion and the Mattias Church are sitting next to each other. From Bastion we get a nice view of whole Budapest

Beautiful View of Budapest. I really enjoyed the history told of the Fisherman's bastion related by our tour guide, and the beautiful panorama of Budapest. I would recommend this as one of the sites to visit when you are in Budapest, Hungary..
Loved the views!!!. Offers one of the best views of the Pest side...It's castle-like architecture had be swooning every time I passed by it!

Budapest. Castle district is the most beautiful part in Budapest. From the Chain Bridge take the funicular to Castle Hill. You'll get a breathtaking panorama of the Danube and the Pest side. Then you can visit the Royal Palace, Matthias Church and the must see attraction the Fishermen's Bastion.

very nice view. I walked to the Fisherman's Bastion by foot with the help of google maps.
view is perfect. climbing is easy.
beautiful place to see Budapest. visit also the old town around...with vary nice buildings and viweus to parliament and around the city of Budapest

Nice place. Very nice place, but I advise you not to buy tickets to the Bastion. The availability of the ticket allows you to go up and walk along the wall of the Bastion with a view of the opposite side of the city. But you can do it free of charge if you come up to the Bastion from the other side and go up to the balcony of the restaurant.

Quaint Hill Neighborhood. A nice walk over The Chain Bridge then through the scenic hilly narrow streets and steps up to Fisherman's Bastion and Castle Hill. Great views of Pest side and Parliament. A whole different atmosphere on Buda side-quaint, charming, and intimate.

Fantastic views. The bastion offers incredible views across the river at the Pest side of the city, particularly the Parliament building. You can walk along the walls and there are a few staircases to climb for better views as well. Lots of it is pay-to-enter or just reserved for cafes/restaurants, and it's all very crowded but definitely worth wandering along, especially if you are in the Var area anyway.

A pleasure to see. The bastion looks a bit like from a fairytale, there is a bit of Disneyland-kitsch in it, but altogether it's absolutely worth visiting. The view of the city and the parliament is excellent and the small towers are eye-catching.A warning: don't buy tickets. This is a complete rip-off, you have to wait in a queue to have your ticket checked, than you climb to a short passage upstairs, which is usually terribly crowded by people taking photos. After several steps the passage is over and you proceed to the exit. Actually, there is a higher tower a few meters further with more free place to stand and no tickets to pay - crowds somehow choose the paid part.

Beautiful views of the city. It was a real treat to head up there and take in the views of the city. I suggest stopping for some lunch and having a lazy day mooching about and taking in the hostory and views from here. Also for a public space the toilets are exceptionally clean. there were weddings going on so we couldnt visit the church.
Beautiful. This is such a beautiful place to go and is great for good views over the river and of the Parliament
Nice Architecture. I liked the architecture of this monument. You can pay a fee to enter to the second level but it does not make a big difference.

Nice view. There is a nice view to Pest and especially to the Parliament house. But dont pay for it cause you have access to good view without paying for it. For better view to Pest and Donau you should go to Citadella.

Good view of the city. Very interesting place, may be a bit crowded, but still worth going. It gives you a good panoramic view of the city, The place has some interesting history. We walked and sat down at a small restaurant in a side street and had some local pastries, quite nice.

Fairytale must see. One of the sites that I was desperate to see after reading so much about it and it did not fail to impress- absolutely stunning and magical and great views of Parliament and Danube
Fishersman Bastion. This is one of the most beautiful, idyllic places i've been. There are some nice terras/restaurants there. A beautiful sight over Budapest and the house of parliament
Best views. Fishermans Bastion is a must visit it gives the best views of the Parliament building and also has a good bar useful for toilet facilities as well.

Spectacular architecture and great view of Parliament. The architecture alone is well worth the visit. They do have an entrance fee to one of the lookout towers, but the balconies are free. Most people just take in the view from one of the many balconies. That's what we did. I don't know how anyone can be disappointed with the view from the balcony, nor with the beauty of the architecture. The view of Parliament and the Danube River is breathtaking. The architecture looks like it came straight out of a fairy tale. You can't take a bad picture here. It's impossible! In fact, some of our best pictures were taken here and at Matthias Church. I even took a great close-up picture of the church tiles from the balcony. Don't miss it!
Great Views of the city. Don't pay the entry fee to the top of the building.. not worth it. You get a great view from below anyway. Beautiful building and great views.

Can't miss when in Budapest. If you miss this, don't go to Budapest. Beautiful architecture from days past, awesome city views. Spend the day roaming around the old city. In and out of churches, cafes and museums. What more cold one ask for.
not worth it. Costly for nothing - a state tourist trap you can have the same view at no cost.. Skip it and see things more interesting.

Skip the enterance fee and just admire the building. The building was cool, but not worth the admission, You can see part for free on one side and see the view. You can take as many pictures you want with this for free without paying

Puts Disney to shame. This is attraction architecture at its whimsical best, a memorable place from which to look down over the Danube and a great place for pictures. We stayed at the nearby hotel and never tired of walking this way.
Don't bother paying. We paid 700 forints to go on the viewing area - was a bit of a rip off as there are good views all round. Better off spending your money visiting the wacky Marzipan museum.

One of the most photogenic sites ever. This thing is pretty much a wall with balconies and turrets- it is really really picturesque and offers great views of the Danube and Pest (side of Budapest). I didn't bother with the part you pay to go on, there is plenty you can access without that. I took loads of pictures because it is just so pretty. I loved the statues also and there is a spectacular church right next door. It gets really crowded with tourists from 11am to about 4pm in summer but you will still be able to find a spot to take good snaps. This sight is all about the sights. Eat, drink and relax elsewhere. Get there via furnicular for 1000HUF (about 4.80AUD/USD) one way.
Fairytale. No fishing or fishermen, but absolutely stunning and well worth the trek up the hill! Exceptional view of Parliament and the Danube. Highly recommended.
A view from the top. The views from the Bastion are amazing and well worth the effort, the Church adjacent to the Bastion has the most amazing coloured roof tiles.

Fascinating Place and Marvellous Views. On our first morning in Budapest we were taken to this spot, which I had thought might be a fishing village on the Danube. How wrong I was! This is a wonderful structure high on a hill with great views of the Danube and Budapest in general, but especially of the Parliament building across the water. We were fortunate to arrive there on Saturday 4 May, just as a procession started, with people wearing Hungarian costumes and riding horses and playing music: we couldn't believe our luck. It is also right beside the Mathias Church and the Bastion has wonderful views of the exterior of the church. Don't miss this place when you're in Budapest!

Beautiful structure and great views. The Fisherman's Bastion reminded me of Gaudi's buildings and Parc Guell in Barcelona - a fantastical terrace overlooking the city. We didn't have to pay anything but had lovely views over the city (similar to those from Gellert Hill). The restaurants/cafes up here are mediocre and overpriced - but you're paying for the spectacular location.

Excellent views of the city. This is a beautiful place to spend some time and view Budapest. Good views of the Parliament building, the Danube, Chain Bridge, the stunning roof of Matyas Church and many more.
Nice spot. Paying 700HUF is not recommmended as you will only pay to see the view which is better from Gellert Hill
Amazing structure. The view from up there is gorgeous. There is a small bar and restaurant area. Do not miss seeing this.

Avoid the bit you have to pay for. There is a bit you have to pay for, and another bit which is free (kind of inside a café but you can just go up the tower without any problems). I think the free bit is probably better, with better views.
Glorious views!. This Is a lovely place to linger and enjoy the views of Pest while enjoying a delicious coffee and cake.

Good views. Lovely view of city and old buda is cute to walk around It is near the gellert baths which are okay other baths are more intricate, but it has a lovely restaurant right there. Worth seeing.
View is Spectacular - must see. I love the exercise I got walking / climbing all over Budapest. We were lucky enough to get a table and enjoy the view at Halaszbastya.

Engagement. I took my girlfriend here to propose on the terrace as the sun set. It was an amazing experience, the view over the city was beautiful and the service and food was fantastic.A group played music as we ate, the service was very frindly and professional but not too pushy to make you feel uncomfortable. The food was very classy and tasted wonderful. As it was also my girlfiend's birthday the restaurant had made a surprise cake and sparkler for our dessert. I would definitely recommend this restaurent and will return myself.Also, the restauarant were very good at preventing any tourists from entereing to take a look at the view, so the experience was secluded and private.
GREAT VIEW OF BUDAPEST. You will enjoy a marvelous view of the city from here, especially of the huge Parliament building down on the Danube.This is a must-see for every visitor to Budapest.

Wonderful views. I expected huge crowds here, but because it was just before St. Stephen's Day, many roads were closed, so the only way up the hill was on foot. That meant we got to see the wonderful buildings and views without crowds. be sure to take water and wear comfortable shoes.

Breath taking view. If you want to see Danube, bridges and Pest, go to Fisherman's Bastion. Great view is especially in the afternoon, not to early, when the Parliament is sunlit. It's worth to pay for the entrance to be a little bit higher ;)

Go at sunset!. This is a great opportunity to take some photos of the view and enjoy the architecture. It can be busy with the amount of tourists but the further you walk down the less people there were! Don't bother paying the entrance fee to get up to the second level, there is a restaurant and bar on one of the spires opposite the Hilton Hotel- we just pretended we were interested in the menu and got up there for free!

Lovely historical building with magnificent views over Pest. From this lovely building one gets the best view over the Pest part of Budapest overlooking the iconic buildings of the Parliament and of the St. Stephen's Basilica, along with the Chain bridge, among many others.
Must see. Breath taking view, easy to get there, little shops around to get a coffee or eat, more sightseeings nearby...

Great views of the city.. The bastion is well worth the climb and I would suggest working your way up through all of the castle buildings for a real aense of achievement.
It does get VERY busy though, so if you are looking to take some good photos, pick your visiting time carefully.

You pay for the view. When you go to the Fisherman's Bastion you can either pay to go inside or just walk around. When I went there I decided to pay to go inside. It wasn't a complete waste of money because it was cheap and the view is really nice. But you can spend a good 1 hour just talking pictures and enjoying the view.

Great Views for a Brief Stop. There are great views from here of the rest of the city and some limited free cover from rain, (if you are unlucky on the weather front, like we were). Worth a stop for a few minutes to take a few pictures but not a main attraction. I noticed that there was a restaurant of sorts... I suspect quite expensive but the view would likely be nice.

7 dwarf's on the hill?. Really special place but very touristic. We enjoyed the view on the city and the Matthias church which is nearby. Don't pay to get on the bastiontowers; the view is just the same!

Nice spot, if can elbow your way through the melee.. It is awfully hypocritical for a tourist review to bemoan tourists, I have no defence. The building has a fairytale quality, the views are fantastic but the scrum of people aggressively pushing to take their snap takes the shine off. Go 1st thing in the morning, we were thereat about 6:30pm and it was mobbed. The irony that this monument to normal working men is largely closed off unless you are dining at a restaurant that normal fishermen probably couldn't have afforded to eat in was not lost on me.

Fisherman's Bastion (Fisherman's Castle) is worth of seeing. When you are going to check this site out, remember to reserve lots of water with you. You will beed it in the middle of June. Especially, if you are going there by foot, like I did. The climb is not the easiest, even there is a good road all the way. And it's more expensive on-site, than from the local grocery store in the city. You, who want it easy, can take a blue hop-on hop-off bus. But, by foot you will see much more. Same goes with the Mountain Gellert.

Beautiful Area. If in the area.....this is a must. The views are outstanding. The area holds wonderful historical attractions. You can even visit their post office that is really great. The EX Gustafo building is there also. It is in ruins now.

Views to die for. Although it has no history to speak of and was built only as a setting for the church, it is well worth a visit. There are loads of spectacular views over the city and towards Pest. certainly a must for any trip to Budapest.
Amazing view. Come here for amazing view of the city! The first time we came, it was very cloudy so we couldn't see much but the last time it was simply amazing!

fantastic views. I was lucky enough to have a river view room at the Hilton. My view was the Fisherman's Bastion. It looks great day and night. If you walk along the Bastion you will enjoy fabulous views of Pest and the river. Best place for photos of the Parliament. Not to be missed.
Fantastik. in the middle of the night I was there and it has very nice panaromic view of budapest. Best timing to go there after 10 :)

Visit at night!. This place offers some of the best views of the downtown Budapest area. The lights of the city are breathtaking at night, the best time to visit this spot! Definitely a must-see on your trip to Budapest!

Superb View; Lots of History. What I liked about the Halaszbastya was the view of Budapest it provided. Very unobstructed. That it is also near the huge church, the equestrian statue of Szent Istvan and many other sights didn't hurt. There are many vendors of "genuine homemade Hungarian" whatevers. The prices are a bit inflated and they are banking on the Florint being so different in value from the pound sterling, the euro and the dollar that they will be able to ask a price that has little or no relation to the actual value of the item. Not a dislike as I approve of free enterprise, but do keep your acquisitive spirit in check with a currency converter application on your phone.As you walk away from the Bastion to the left is the Coronation Church and the monument to the Holy Trinity. Make a left at the monument and you will walk toward the old Ministry of Defense Building. In between are some very interesting buildings still in commercial use.
Best view in the city. It has a spectacular architectural style, it offers the best view across the Danube over the city and you have the Matyas church right next to it. It really deserves a go!
Great Views. Located in the Castle area, make a visit to see great views of the Danube and the other side of the river. Be sure to visit the Matthias church which is in the same area.

Wow what a view!!. This is the MUST visit place in Budapest ! Breathtaking view to the city. If you want you can even sit down one of the coffee shops, restaurants to have a cup of coffee to enjoy the view and listen to the live music. Great atmosphere too!

Good views of Pest riverbank. After 8 pm take the no 16 bus upto the bastion for superior views over the town - at no charge Earlier in the day there is a nominal charge and the day time view isn't as attractive A tripod would be useful for night photos as you need to avoid the floodlights and I found keeping the camera steady to get the best photos an issue
An excellent view of Budapest. A wonderful view of the Danube and the Hungarian Parliament. Location worth visiting. One of the many beautiful places of the city.
Nice view. Beautiful view of the Parliament.Come there in the evening and the entrance is for free. It also has benches for resting.
Nice view. One of the most beautiful views from here to the City of Budapest. The architectural style is worth to see.

Best view of Budapest. We went there on a tour of Budapest. It has the best views of Budapest and Danube in the city. It is right next to St. Stephens church. Nearby there are a lot of shops and cafes. Be prepared for large crowds as it is one of the major tourist attractions in Budapest.

One of the most beautiful attraction in Budapest. The paid tour on the top of the wall is probably not worth;What is worth is to have a drink at the panoramic bar indeed. From there you can enjoy a typical Hungarian Lemonade with a breathtaking sight of the city. Must see.
Beautiful. Amazing to see. However once up there, not a great deal in terms of cafes and restaurants so we didn't spend too much time there

A Bastion Indeed. Beautiful white walled bastion with fantastic views over the Danube, of the Hungarian parliament buildings and the sights of Pest. Do pay the extra to walk around the top of the walls.

Great views from an architectural gem. Fisherman's Bastion offers superb views of the Danube and Budapest and is a must-see if you're in the Castle Hill area. Tends to be crowded at times. It offers great photo opportunities both from it, and also of it especially at night when it is beautifully lit and looks like a disney castle.

For the view. Well, not so historical place but for the view it is a must have!
Too commercial for us (you have to pay to reach the "2nd floor".
Beautiful Structure. Very nice to see. Very beautiful inside and out. If you are near Buda Castle make sure you stop and have a look

Another option for photo stop and more. The location is on the Buda side and once there you get to see Matthias Church, a fantastic view of the Parliament and the Danube. Walking to the site From the parking lot, we passed interesting old buildings, houses, coffee shops and souvenir shops.

Incredible views!. What an amazing place. A must see in Budapest. Do the free walk (find online) which is about 2 hours long.
Amazing views and history. A big variety of things to see.
DO NOT take the funicular (rip off) walk up the lovely paths (unless you are very old or unfit)

Wonderful Design. This was my highlight from Castle Hill. This has a wonderful design, with amazing views. Additionally, this had a café/restaurant inside, from which you can enjoy the view at a more relaxed pace and with a meal
One of the most beautiful places in Budapest!. The views are unbelievable. Area is often overrun by tour groups, so go early or late. Lots of things to see close by.
restaurants. I was surprised to see the top tier of the bastion required a fee to enter. Don't know how much: Don't care. Much of the rest is occupied by restaurants. The Hungarians don't get it.

Pretty but don't pay!. This is a very pretty monument up on Castle Hill, well worth a look and a walk around. However, don't bother paying the 700ft entry - all this gets you is the chance to climb a flight of stairs and get views from about ten feet higher than the views you get without paying.
Like a Disney-castle. Went so high that was possible without admission fee. It looked excatly like Disney-princess-castle. Views were great. All Budapest at same sight.

If you are into Lord of the Rings don't miss!. Serious. You'll feel like on the walls of one of the castles showed (or described) in Tolkien's masterpiece. I thought it is very well preserved. The view from the walls is absolutely amazing and the atmosphere is completely medieval (if were not for the large amounts of tourists almost everywhere). Although some of the observation points are not free, you can (not so easily) find some great places to take a picture or enjoy the nearby church, square, restaurants and the famous labyrinth. My 6 years daughter loved it!

Beautiful walk through a different era. The bastion looks like something from Game of Thrones or some other fantasy world. It also offers one of the best views of the Pest side of Budapest imaginable. Totally worth the hike up!

Like from a fairy tale. The Fisherman's Bastion offers great view on the city and Danube river. But it's not just that. The Bastion itself is beautiful -like from a fairy tale. The 7 towers represent the 7 Hungarian tribes that migrated to this area in the 9th century. We somehow managed to climb to the top of one of the towers without having to pay for anything or booking a table or anything similar. And later in the evening (I guess when everything is closed), you can explore it completely for free. With the night lights it's even more romantic. Just be careful not to step on a homeless person sleeping on the stairs! :OAnd, in my opinion, it's not necessary to take the funicular to climb the hill. It actually took us longer to cross the bridge than to climb the hill on foot.

Amazing.... The Fisherman's Bastion offers a spectacular view of the Danube River and the Parliament. The sight was panoramic and amazing. The beautiful architecture should not be missed and don't forget to visit the Matthias Church beside it.
One of the best views to Budapest. One of the most remarkable views from here to the City of Budapest and also the architectural style is worth to see

Fabulous View of the City. One of the landmarks of Budapest with a fabolous view of the city, mostly Pest side and the Danube underneath. Better to visit in the afternoon as the sun will be behind you and you can shoot photos of the city easily.
Must see. It is a must to visit the Vár and the Halászbástya. Excellent virew to the city. Recmend to walk around the Vár and you can take the Siklo (little cable car) as well.

Nie view - but not unique. the view is spectacular, but since you have to pay to get up there, you might as well go to the Palace a few hundred yards south of there where you have an even nicer view - for free
GREAT. Had a local guide take us on this tour, very interesting and great history. The views of the Danube were wonderful. Don't miss this

One of the city highlights. We walked the stairways up to the presidential palace and than followed the road to Fisherman's Bastion. Beautiful architecture and craftsman ship. Very accessible - you can walk and explore every corner of this part of the bastion. Beautiful view of the whole Pest side with the Danube and the parliament.
Love it. Great views of the city from here. Right near Matthias Church, another great attraction in the area. A must see attraction/area if you are visiting Budapest.

A great lookout point over Budapest. The Fisherman's Bastion is a walking area on Buda, one of the best spots for photography. To get there, you can take the funicular at the foot of the Chain Bridge to the Buda Castle and walk the short distance to the FB. There is also a very famous church, Lots of shops and restaurants nearby. The Hilton Hotel next door is built on the site of an old monastery, part of which is preserved. There are also ruins from the Roman era occupation. The area has many attractions for the photographer!

Great views. From here visitors can have a magnificant view of the Pest part of the city both day and night. It is recommended to go there in the afternoon as the buildings and skyline of Pest will stand out very clearly under the sun on the west side. Then take the dinner in one of the fine restaurants nearby, such as the Alabardos, a Michelin recommended restaurant. Then have a stroll around the area and enjoy the attractive night scene of Budapest. Access to there can be by bus No.16 which operates until midnight.
Beautiful sight to the city. This is a beautiful place you must see when you visit Budapest. You can make excellent photos of the city and yourself of course :)

beautiful view. Every bus with tourists stop here. if you travel alone you must visit here and to ols buda as well. The view of the Duna river with the bridges, the plarliament, the four seasons hote and all Pest side is breathtaking. you can take a bus no. 16 from erzebet ter.

Gorgeous panorama of the city and it's bridges. U need to book a table with a view to fully enjoy !The food it's elaborated , ask for suggestions !Worth for romantic dinner,after a visit to the castle.
One of the best photo shooting places in the city. This visit can be combined with the Buda castle and/or the Matthias Church. Can be very hot and crowded in the Summer months.

Last visit in FisherMan's Bastion. this is a very nice and historic place I would strongly recommend for tourist to visit. Adjacent to it you can visit Matthias Church - one of the oldest temple in Hungary....

Looks like Disney made it. It looks almost too perfect but you gotta see the views from here. It's something you have to do if you are in Budapest. Ride the cog tram up. That's fun and you won't wear yourself out before you even get there.
Fine views. Take the funicular railway as the climb is quite steep, fine views and many street cafes to have lunch and are reasonably priced.
Beautiful place but crowded. Fishermans bastion is a beautiful place offering a good view over Pest. On our visiting day it was crawling with other tourists, all os us eager to take pictures.
You need a camera. Fhe views are magnificent and although crowded be patient and work your way to the front mits lovely

Wonderful Views. We enjoyed walking around the Fishermen's Bastion. A very good reason for visiting this place is for the wonderful views of the Danube and the Pest side including the Hungarian Parliament buiding.One of the best spots in the amazingly beautiful city
Great views. Worth the visit, the northern part of it is accessible without ticket, the southern part can only be visited after buying a ticket. Views are the same

Wonderful!!. Just behind the San Mathias church, in the old part of Buda, you can enjoy an incredible view of all Budapest. A perfect place to admire the Parliament and the bridges that link Buda to Pest.
There's also a restaurant to enjoy the view eating something maybe some goulash!!

Fantastic view of Budapest. We enjoyed walking along Fisherman's Bastion very much. Many great photo opportunities! We went here after seeing Mathias Church. There is a lot to see around Fisherman's Bastion and many incredible views. It is well worth the visit!

The best viewpoint with kids. If you are doing a city sightseeing tour with kids, this is a must. We stopped here and even the kids said it was really good. The views across the danube are magnificent. Do not pay the entry fee for the first section, it is a ripp off. Go futher along and perhaps spend the money on a coffee og ice cream in the cafe that resides on the next outcrop of the bastion. The views are the same and money goes to coffee and relaxation instead:)
Lively with a view. There were live musicians playing in the restaurants in the Bastion. It was a fun atmosphere with a great view of Pest. The white architecture is pretty.

Great place to take romantic photo's. This is a great place to take some romantic photo's with the Danube and the old Hungarian buildings at the background. I did take some with my loving wife :-) But to get some good pictures, be patient as this is also a crowded touristic spot .......

Fishermans Bastion Views. Great to walk around, usually some musical entertainment. Dont forget to have a meal at the Halaszbastya Restaurant. It is well worth the visit and views. Regards. Gary Saunders
Nothing to See.. Do not waist a time ! Go to another location.Market is very clean and better!

Great Viewpoint. The Fisherman's Bastion is an exceptional place for taking in the Danube and the riverside architecture. Even if the view is your primary reason for visiting, you will not be disappointed. Worth the time to wander around the area and to take some magnificent photos.

Must See!. The best place (in my opinion!) to look out over the city and the Danube. Absolutely breathtaking!! We went a few times at different times of day and never failed to be impressed. Interesting point is that one of the parts of the Bastion charges for entry during the day but becomes free after 8pm.

Simply Breathtaking. What an amazing place to see the city and the Danube. Simply wow, I personally loved every centimeter in Budapest but this landmark is really unique. It is the most beautiful spot to see the beauty of Budapest. A must go in my humble opinion. Been there is Summer 2009

Wonderful sightseeing place. Useless to say that Halaszbastya is a MUST for its marvellous position and the Mathyas Church 2 steps from it.Worthy to visit (even if it's not necessary to pay to step up few feets) for a wonderful view of Budapet!

Wonderful view and great place to photograph. Really enjoyed this - did not pay to go in anywhere but walked around this fairy tale like place. Thought the Prague castle district was amazing until I saw this. Just lovely. Wear your walking shoes!

Extreme fortifications. The Fisherman's Bastion was built as a defensive fortification against invaders. It is historically a very important structure. It's in Buda and offers a picture postcard view of the Pest side of the Danube.

Great views, nice buildings. But avoid paying.. A beautiful fairy tale area with views across the Danube. But avoid paying the 700 forint entry fee. Part of the bastion wall is free there is no need to pay to enjoy the views.

Wonderful view. An impressive buliding which offers a stunning view of Pest. If all you want is to look at Pest from above, you don't really need to pay the enterance fee as one of the towes is a caf'e and can be accessed freely.
Great views. We did not do the pay portion, because we found the free portion to be very beautiful. Great view over Pest, especially the Parliament and St Stephens.

Why the entrance fee?. I find it a very bad trend that more and more "public" places get used for business, rented out to some commercial estabilishment, or getting an entrance fee. In Buda there are many great viewspots for free too, it was a shame to make it unavailable if you don't want to spend 2,5 euro to take two pictures.But luckily it's not 24/7 paying, in the evening you can enjoy it for free, I hope this won't change!
Great view of the city. Interesting site and really gives a sense of the former Communist regime. The views are outstanding.
Great views. Wander over after climbing to see the castle and enjoy the views from the Fisherman's Bastion. I think you do not have to pay after 5pm but I'm not sure.

What a view!. High on the hill overlooking Budapest and directly behind St Matthias Cathedral this is about the best it gets for the photographer.The arched colonnade frames the city for a thousand photos and there are pointed turrets incorporated in the construction here which hark back to central Asia where the Magyars had their origins.It must have been quite a haul for the fishermen to bring their catch here but that is what this area was used for in the history of the city.There are scores of tourists here and many souvenir sellers just around the corner. We were told pickpockets frequent the area so it pays to be vigilant.A great vantage point and a city highlight.

Absolutely breathtaking. Well worth the walk up the hill - Fisherman's Bastion provides a stunning panoramic view over the city, including the Chain Bridge and the gorgeous Parliament buildings. Take photos from the various viewing areas, or sit down in one of the cafes and enjoy something delicious while your eyes feast on the view, or just take in the majestic architecture of the monument itself.
Wonderful views of Pest. This area around Mathias Cathedral provide wonderful views on the Danube and the Pest side. Come early in the morning or early evening to avoid the crowds.
Food is good, view is even better. Next to Matthias' Church, on a bluff overlooking the Parliament House, the Chain Bridge, the Danube and Pest. Strolling Hungarian musicians. What more can be said?

Fisher's bastion sugarware. It looks a kind like sugar building, but it's real, busy in the summer.
But visiting the Matthew Church, you can't miss a walk over this. Great in picutres from the Danube.

Great View of Budapest. Definitely one of the best spots for a great view of Budapest, the river and the many bridges. Try not to hang around the area afterward though because of all the tourist traps (restaurants, shops, etc.) Be sure to check out Matthias Church while you are up there as well as Buda Castle.

Gorgeous Views of Pest from here. Crowded to be sure, but worth 20 minutes and the photo op! Very pretty and different. Make sure to walk down to the old Medieval church ruins turned courtyard tucked up behind the Hilton. We discovered it from the Bastion looking back.
The best view of Budapest. There are many attractions to be seen there, Mathias Church, Royal Castle, many shops with hungarian products. Get a tour bus to go there.

What a view. It is worth spending some time here. So much to see & take in. The panoramic view of the city, & bridges, spires & palaces. Again just amazing architecture & how these buidlings survived the war. I did feel quiet a lot of sadness here as the scars are to be seen on the buildings.

Beautiful architecture, incredible views. This was one of our first stops in Budapest. Amazing architectural details. Matthias Church was really neat - beautiful tilework outside. Best spot for terrific views of the city!

Best view from the top of Budapest. It's one of the must visit places on the 1st day in Budapest, don't forget your camera though! best time to be is around sunset, there's a small cafe by the walls of the bastion with acceptable prices, live music and wonderful view.

You SHOULD VISIT IT. one of the oldest castle in the world i believe , sadly i couldn't visit the palace because it was Beer festival and it was close , but the views from the castle incredible , i wish i visit it again in one day .

Don't pay to go to the top floor!. It was a few minutes walk from my apartment at Buda so it was our fist stop at the city! Couldn't be better: Loved it so much!!!The view is spectacular and worth to climb!But hey, don't spend your Euros going the top floor, it is just a few m. up and will not increase the already great experience!:)

Fisherman's Bastion. Many people told us this place was a must. The view is magnificent. It was filled with so much history and beauty. We took the funicular to get to the top. This is the way to get the best view of Budapest
Beautiful. Beautiful concept of towers around Matthias Church. I imagined it better but still. The view of the Parliament on the opposite side of the Danube is also amazing.

Fascinating; Great Views. You can see the old walls upon which the Hilton Hotel was built during the communist era. Wonderful views, outdoor cafes. The adjoining church is undergoing renovations so can't see everything. Music in the cafes.

Mattias Church and Fisherman's Bastion. Incredibly beautiful church is a wonderful reward at the end of the climb up the Buda Castle hill. Wonderful tiled roof and exquisite neo-gothic decoration. Fantastic views of the whole city and it's skyline from the Fisherman's Bastion next to the church. Truely brilliant.

Walk up for the best views. Fisherman's Bastion is part of the square and complex around Matyus Church. If you start at the bottom at Battyany ter, near the Calvinist Church and St Anne's Church, you'll run into little surprises as you mount the various stairwells up to the Bastion. It's not a difficult climb, and there's lots of nooks and crannies to explore.
Beautiful!. Perfect, lovely view to whole city, free acces (or you can pay for funicular but it is really close) and lots of things to see! on of the best places in Budapest!

One of a kind. Worth the trip. Stunning views, a beautiful building with lots of nooks and crannies to explore. My adult daughter really enjoyed her first visit here and this was my second visit. It was amazing.

Great Free Site. Considering you don't have to pay, its beautiful and offers amazing views it is hard to go past this site. There is a lot more in the area than you think and you can easily spend a few hours. Hot tip: one Bastion (the first) which costs and the others are free. There is no need to pay :)

Fantastic vista!. We were walking up at the castle area and a trip to the top of the Buda Hills is not complete until you've walked up into Fisherman's Bastion. What a fantastic view of the Danube and Pest below!There were some buskers playing guitar & violin. When we were there, they were playing "If I Were A Rich Man" from Fiddler on the Roof... not exactly typical Hungarian music!
Great view. It is a beautiful place, where you can look all over the city. Great view and surroundings.It is worth going there.

Great views from the Bastion. You get good views of the Danube and the Pest side of the River from this monument, but it's annoying to pay for a ticket and find that on the other side of the building you can walk up to the same height and get similar views "free, gratis and for nothing" as they say in my country. The reason is probably because there's a restaurant at the free end, and so anyone is able to walk up whether or not you partake of food or drink up there. It's not clear if they are just being amenable, or if they have the right to restrict access due to their lease of the premises, but before you buy a ticket for the ticket office end of the Bastion, see if you can get up the other side for nothing.

Peaceful place with gorgeous views. We visited Fisherman's Bastion in the evening time and loved the views from the top.The Matthia's church is gorgeous from outside, though it was closed so we couldn't go inside. The Castle is also walking distance away and it a must see!We took bus no. 16, which comes via the Chain bridge and goes all the way to the top of Fisherman's bastion.

Best place to visit in Budapest. After spending much of our short break walking around Budapest, we found this the best spot for panoramic views of Budapest. Just before sunset the colours over Pest are amazing. Recommend booking a table at the restaurant here too, the food was delicious
Unbelievable View of Pest. We really enjoyed our visit and the panoramic views of the Danube and the Pest side of the city. This is a must see!
Amazing views. A really clever idea and great views, lots of opportunity to take photos of the pest landscape. Definitely worth a visit!

There is no other place like this in Budapest.. Up here, you can breathe a sort of medieval atmosphere, this perfectly preserved castle is a symbol of the city.In the Buda side of the city called from here the panoramic view over the Danube River and the entire city (Pest), is something unforgettable.The bastions are beautiful and perfectly preserved, you can walk for almost the entire area around them up and down.Great experience and beautiful panoramic view.
Fisherman's Bastion lovely. Fisherman's Bastion lovely dont miss it at list take a pictures from the river, budapest enough in one day to visit all attractions

Beautiful View of Pest. The Fisherman's Bastion was quite beautiful and unique. It's a nice walk to the top and very rewarding. The views of the Pest bank are quite nice, and it is located right below a beautiful church. Hold on to your purse, though. As a major tourist attraction, it's bound to draw a lot of pickpockets.
