great view. you have a great view of the Danube river. I paid USD 3,50 to go up on tower but later on found out that the right tower is charged and the left is free and both have the same view. So there is no need to pay for the visit.
Make sure you go at night!. This really is a very beautiful and romantic location overlooking the Danube and Chain Bridge across to Pest. A must on any trip to Budapest.

For the best views of Pest. Don't be fooled into thinking you can only get the views by paying the fee at the Fisherman's Bastion or from the over-priced cafes and restaurants. Just keep walking and there are plenty of points from which you can snap the city and especially the Parliament building for nothing.The views are great but the Bastion itself looks a bit too 'Disney' for my liking and really doesn't seem to fit amongst its surroundings.
Great view. Loved the view from the top. You can take amazing pictures of the bridges and Pest. A must do when on the castle side

Best views in town. We stayed in the parliament district so took a cab to the Hilton. Make sure you ask for the Hilton in Budapest, not Pest. Great views from up here and a couple of bars in the towers to help lubricate things. Lots more to see once you are up in this area, Roman ruins, palaces and nice place to eat. We took the railway up on our second visit which was a little more fun.

Great site with great views. My 2 friends and I did the free walking tour (amazing!) that ended at the Fisherman's Bastion. It is a beautiful place and offers great views of the city. Would definitely recommend the trip up here.
Views of the Danube are great. High on the Buda side of the river. This site provides an excellent panorama of Budapest. The views are fantastic. A must do for your visit to Budapest.

always worth the visit to see the view of Pest. Paid the entrance fee for the quiet part of the Bastion before realising the other side was free. A small donation at least to keep the site looking as beautiful as it is.
Astonishing. It was a beautifull day and the sight is fantastic. Walking around the amazing white walls and towers is like walking a dream.

Take one complete day to visit the area.. Since Budapest city is divided in two sections I suggest to spend one complete day visiting Buda District where the Fisherman's Bastion is located, at the high part of the city. From here you can get the best view of the Parliament, St Stephens Basilica, the Parliament, the Academy of Sciences, Gresham Palace, and, in the distance, the Inner City Parish Church. You'll also catch a glimpse of the Margaret Bridge and the famous Chain Bridge.
Wonderful view. An excellent view of the Danube and buildings of Budapest. Attractive building on a point high over the river.
Fine. Its fine, but perhaps because there are so many beautiful attractions in Budapest, there doesn't seem to be anything too special.
Outstanding!. Great place with view on the new part of city, there is a pee but after short walk from gate i can get the same view for free:)

Beautiful place and amazing views. We had a pleasure to watch this everyday from our hotel room window(Hilton). Absolutely beautiful place, well restored and amazing views overlooking Danube and Pest side.Lots of restaurants near.
Looking for the princess to be rescued. What a pretty place, and I mean pretty as in princess tale. It frames the Gothic Mathias church in a great way. A must if you're visiting Budapest

Spectacular views. this is a great place to get a really good view of Budapest, and is probably one of the best sites to take pictures. it is very clean and t here are stands to buy tasty morsels. I had a wonderful blackberry strudel. Lots of souvenir shop also.
Crowded. Superb location if you could get in. We couldn't squeeze in but perhaps if you visit early you may be lucky.

Beautiful view and atmosphere. We reached the Fisherman's Bastion by taxi and got off the taxi down the stairs to the Bastion. It was at night around ten o'clock and a violinist was playing on his violin and the stairs and the Bastion was full with people. We walked up on the stairs and took beautiful photos about the Bastion. When we reached the top of the stairs at Hotel Hilton we turned right and climbed u on the next stairs at the Restaurant. The view is excellent to the lighted city.

Super location, great views and great trip overall. We visited on a hot, sunny day and although there were plenty of tourists, there was time and space to see everything. Great views and picture opportunities and the porcelain roof is stunning.

Fantastic. Views from the Bastion were stunning. The whole area was lovely with lots of interesting things happening. Take time to explore & enjoy the beautiful outlook. Have a coffee or snack here to absorb the atmosphere.

Take your camera. Best place for photos of Danube and Parlament building. Great ice cream. Marzipan museum. Has fountains. There was tow elderly gentlemen buskers playing beutifuly that realy made it magical. We met an american couple there who took our photo for us. They were realy lovely. We felt very safe up there. Was realy worth finding the wat. a bus and tram map would be realy helpful.

Fisherman's Bastion - Budapest. Good place located on Buda side. You can make nice photos of Parliament House from Fisherman's Bastion. Nice view to Pest at all. It wasn't impressively for us, just good.
Complete fairy tale. It was absolutely adorably, there was even a wedding happening when we walked through! Such a great view of the city and the restaurant on the top is so good!

Superb views. Our visit to the FIsherman's Bastion was amazing. I have seldom seen such incredible views anywhere. The area also has many interesting sights nearby. The view of the Parliament buildings from there was incredible. Although our weather was not too good, we still had a very clear view. On a sunny day, it would be an amazing place to be. One can sit and have a drink and admire the view from a restaurant/bar at the very top, and one can enjoy live music played by the musicians there. It must be one of the most spectacular viewsites in the world.

Spectacular at night. This area can be very busy during the day and early evening but a little later in the evening there are less crowds but the views are spectacular both on this side and across the river to the Parliament buildings.Have a sit down, listen to some music being played by local buskers and enjoy the atmosphere.A fee applies until mid/late evening

Got engaged here. Walked for nearly 3 hours to get here instead of getting a taxi and proposed on balcony above violin player. Absolute fairytale location. Nices place in the nicest city I've visited. Plan on having my wedding here.

Breathtaking. Loved the different feel of this attraction - away from hustle and bustle of city - fantastic views over city and Danube - lots of things to do - museums, bars, restaurants, church - loved this so much we went back twice - open top bus first time and stayed on into evening and had a meal - went back last day and took funicular up - saw changing of the guard and also a Hungarian wedding. Serenaded by musicians in bar overlooking the city

Fantastic views, and free after 8pm. The view over the Danube of the Pest side of the city and the parliament building from this site is unparalleled. As has been mentioned by other reviewers, you don't have to necessarily pay the fee to go to the upper level as the view is excellent from the lower parts as well. After 8pm it's free in any case, and that's the most magical time to be up there. Unfortunately the cafe on the lower level is closed at night, but the upper level bar remains open. One of the "must see" attractions of the city.

Beautiful. Beautiful to see and looking over the edge you see a beautiful view across the river. You can see it on your own or do a private tour of buda castle and fisherman's Bastion should be added it to the must see sights.

Great views, interesting fairy-tale architecture. I agree with those who say it's not necessary to spend the money to go up into the turrets. The view was just fine from the balcony on the ground level. Well worth seeing.

great view :-). Please note, we paid for the entrance but apparently on the left side of the bastion there's a big restaurant with a big balcony and a great point of view towards the Parliament , everybody went to that balcony and nobody cared in the restaurant .

The best of Budapest. The Fisherman's Bastian will take your breath away. The view of the Danube, Paliament, Chain Bridge, St. Stephen's - its one of the best lookouts I have ever been to. Do not miss - make this first on the list!

Don't pay! The Russians snuck in for free! . I feel like an idiot for buying a ticket and presenting it to the 2 attendants at the entrance.Not because I didn't enjoy the great views and photo opportunities. It's because I saw a group of 4 Russian teenagers quietly walk in where the unattended exit is. And then right next to the bastion are another 3 spots which are just as good and are open to the public for free.

Well worth the trip up the hundreds of steps.... A fairy tale type tower and wall....really great architecture, the church and statues are 2nd to none.....slightly spoilt by the new architecture of the Hotel...
Great vantage point for pix. Extension of a pretty area (Buda Castle) to over view Budapest. Impressive structure. Surrounded but tourist shops.

Awesome view of city. Fisherman's Bastion (Halaszbastya) is a must visit place of Budapest.Enjoy the breathtaking view of Parliament and Chain bridge in the evening or night.Its Awesome place to visit.
Stunning views. a very nice view of the city, but a pity you have to pay just to look out over the city, you can see the city with out paying.
A nice vista-- great place to take a photo. It is easy to find- and there is a good walk down the hill from there.Be sure to see the SPy Museum which is nearby!
Best place in Budapest. We came at 6 in Budapest this time and instead of going to hotel we went to castle first. This place is amazing. No crowd in the morning, place belongs to you.
Fairy tale. A really beautiful place with towers and archways. You can pay a fee to go up higher, but it offers really beautiful views in free sections. I loved walking around this area.

one of the most beautiful parts of Budapest. we visited Fisherman's Bastion on a hop-on hop-off bus tour and it became one of our favourite spots in Budapest. The views of the city are truly stunning.the only problem, for me, is that there is a large gaudy hotel in the middle of the square which takes a little from the sites beauty.Overall though, the Fisherman's bastion is one of the most beautiful parts of Budapest.

Beautiful views. Beautiful views of Budapest from the top and the live music create a lovely atmosphere. Walking down the Fisherman's Bastion you really appreciate the beauty of the building I recommend looking back up once you get to the bottom as you can appreciate the beauty all over again
Amazing!. The restaurant is gorgeous with views of the Parliament. Lovely live music, delicious food, and wonderful service. It was like a fairy tale meal. Don't miss this romantic restaurant rated
Fisherman. located in Buda side. Its next to castle hill..If you go there in the evenning you can see all budapest with beautiful lights...
Great history - better view!. The view from top is breathtaking - easily one of the best areas in Budapest to visit as part of the amazing Castle District.

Good views. The views from here are excellent to the houses of parliament and Chain Bridge. Whilst it is very old, it appears to have been rebuilt or restored very recently, and the actually structure looks like a brand new Disney copy of the original. There are often lots of tourists and getting the right spot for that perfect photograph can be difficult. Some pats are free to access whilst the upper levels require payment.
Best view in the city. This is the best place to photograph the Danube. Its' quite the experience to just sit an people watch and ship watch

Awesome. A must visit. The view from the bastion is to die for. You can spend hours standing there. Walk down to river and see inner streets and residential areas of Buda which you would otherwise not get to see.A must visit...

It's free. The view it's fantastic. It's free, if you do not want to enter the church that is there. You can take a walk along the wall and admire tha view. Take a sit near the fountain, and listen to the live band from the restaurant. It's beautiful. I was there for my bachelorette party (3 days :P) and I just fell in love with Budapest.
wow. The views from here and the setting next to Matthias Church is incredible. You definitely do not need to pay to climb up 1-2 floors, the views from the ground level are incredible.
Great view. Having a splendid overview of the Danube, the Parliament and Pest in general. Great memories of my numerous visits with my wife, family and friends.

Great view of the city. Don't pay the price for going up to the top., The view from the lower level is just as nice. Also a bistro on the lower section where you can get a drink and enjoy the view in comfort

Beautiful Fairy Castle atop a hill. This is wonderful. It looks like a fairy castle just out of Disney movie. We took hop-on hop-off bus and the stop number is 11. Then you just walk 200 meters and see this castle. We paid extra 7000 huf to visit the terrace and I do agree with other visitors that it was not worth paying that extra money for just 100 m walk. But the view of parliament building cand Danube river is fantastic a must visit for everyone to get a good look at the city from top.
One of the most special places to visit. The Bastion looks like a castle from fairy tales, very romantic and the view is quite breathtaking.Had a great time and wonderful pictures taken there.
Great views. Spectacular views across to Pest & lovely little bar with friendly staff & easonable prices Had nice traditional apple cake & Hungarian wine

Great view. A nice walk from the Pest side of the river. It offers a bueatiful view of the city. Entrance fee: free balconies combined with fee paying top turrets. I wouldn't recommend paying the additional fee as the walk is maybe 100 yards, when there are other sections were you get the same great view.
Fairytale attraction. It's exactly how you'd imagine a Disney princess castle to look. It gives beautiful views of the city. Anytime after the morning it is quite romantic.

Fantastic area. As part of a walking tour of Budapest we went up to this area. The wall of the Fisherman's Bastion is quite amazing, all curves and flurishes on it. Matthais Church is beautiful, the roof tiles are absolutely beautiful and so colourful. The detail on this Church is amazing, you have to see it. The stepple is fantastic as well, the whole area blows your mind, its so beautiful. The views to the Pest side are incredible as well, you can see everything. A must do while in Budapest. Lovely city, very friendly people.
Fantastic. One of the most beautiful places to visit in Prague. Views are amazing. There are nice restaurants built in, with live music.Must see.
Wonderful views. Beautifully restoredWonderful skyline views of the Pest side of the river. The walk up is steep so elderly and young children would benefit from the funicular.

A Great View. Located on the Buda side of the Danube this site provides an excellent view down on the city. As we arrived, there was a parade going on. All the participants were dressed in period costumes which looked to cover several centuries. Well worth a visit.
It's a must!. It's a must when you in Budapest. You can see and take picture with Parliament Building is background. And one complex with Matthias Church.
Lovely. Lovely and romantic place!! One of the tops of Budapest, especially in winter!! The snow makes the bastion so beautiful!!

You dodnt need to pay to get the views. The bastion itself is nothing really special, the views are great, but you can get these from slightly further along the bastion without having to pay to get in. A must when you go to Budapest, for the views.

Very beautiful. This is a lovely site and a great place for taking photos of the Pest side looking over the Danube. When you are at the monument, face the Danube and go left. You can go to the top at no charge.

Avoid weekend visit. I guess this is one of the most populous sight in Budapest. You do get an awesome view of the Pest side, Margaret island, Lady liberty etc. But avoid weekends or public holidays if you can. Or go there really early before truck loads of tourists turn up.
This is not only populous among foreign tourists, also liked by locals.

panoramic views over to pest. go downstairs, for good views without paying...or even between the steps for stunning panorama over too the parliment and belvaros V area...the very best photos are taken here,,,

very pictureste. A very nice place with a lot of tourist Close to the Hilton Hotel. However the night we arrived, a weddind took place in the restaurant on the Fishermans bastion and lasted until 4 am and kept my wife from sleepin

Built in the 1840's cute but..... This looks like it was built yesterday for Disney! But it was built in the 1840's as I remember and each turret represents??I forget! But the views are awesome and the statues plus the beautiful architecture of St Matthieus Church make it a must see! the tiles on the church are all different colours and the bronze statues have detailing which is just unbelievable! Do not pay the charge to go up,you can get the same photos for nothing from Buda castle.Toilets again you have to pay for! There was a man with a huge eagle in Medieval costume,again pay to have a photo with his bird! Awesome statue in the little square those stonemasons again just as on the church just fab!You can visit the church but entrance fee again.
Nice views of Budapest. There are some nice views of Budapest from Fisherman's Bastion, the place may get crowded thought during the day. I recommend getting there early.

Don't Pay to Visit!. It is just a short walkway along a wall to see the views over the Danube. If you keep walking past the back of the church there is another set of steps where you can see exactly the same view for free (see photos)!!!
Awesome views from atop. Matthias Church with the statue of St Stephen and a panaromic view of Budapest was just awesome.This lovely city has so much to offer to visitors.

Great View, in Front and Back. Sounds funny but the view of Pest across the river is terrific. The view of the Bastion reflected in the windows of the Hilton is pretty good, too. You can pay to climb one section but we didn't. We climbed the section next to the Hilton for free. Maybe on a busy day you can avoid the crowds for a fee but we couldn't see any advantage other than that. Don't miss the ruins tucked between the Hilton buildings, too.
Spectacular views. wonderful views and great buildings. Many restaurants on the hill as well as gift shops. the 16 bus will get you there and back.
A must while in Budapest. From the turrets you will get the best picturesque views of Pest. The Matyas church is close by and worth a visit too
Come early to avoid the crowd. We went there around 9 am and there were a few people but not so much as what you would get after 10am. Took some fantastic photos and just really enjoying the view.
Beautiful and Picturesque!. Simply amazing almost feels as though you are in a fairytale. An absolute must see if you visit Budapest!!
Great Views. Got of the tour bus here and it was well worth it .Great views and lovely just to take some time out and stroll around for a bit.

The Best Views. This is a great place to see Budapest. It gives you the best views of the bridges, Parliament, and the Danube. And on the one day it rained heavily, it was a great place to hide in the alcoves until the rain stopped. I was there during the day and can only imagine what the view across the river would look like at night.
Very picturesque. Great for views over the Danube and parliament building. The old town really is lovely. A nice café at the top which would be lovely in Summer.
Fishermans Bastion. Lovely views across the Danube. Probably should not have an entrance fee as there is not really much to do here. Superb structure. Fairly busy with people but worth the visit.

What a view of. This place was absolutely breathtaking! Unbelievable architecture and even better views. There are restaurants along here, with classical music playing. Even if you dont go in, worth listening to a piece...or two!

why charge for a ticket?. there is a 600 Florint ticket to go up on the ramparts, however there is nothng up there, except for the view (which is excellent, by the way). You get the same view from the last part of the Bastion, which is free for all.

Just views of the city.. After reading other people's reviews before visiting I had the impression that there was more to this area than there really is. It is definitely worth a visit, but just so you know it is simply a great place to see the city on the other side of the river. The views are fantastic and the structure is pretty, but there is nothing else to do here except for a restaurant. It is close to the St. Matthias church (which is amazing) so you can visit them both at the same time. Don't bother paying extra to walk to the top of the wall. The views are the same and you are not that much higher up. One night while we were walking by we noticed that the gate to go up to the top was not locked and people were just going on up there...

Great views of the city, and a beautiful cathedral. After a bus ride up the hill we walked thru the quaint village area with shops and restaurants to the main attraction, the cathedral and viewpoint. The cathedral's roof was the most beautiful we saw along the Danube, and the views of Budapest were great. Small vendors are grossly overpriced, and some were warned by local police after some complaints. Our guide steered us away from buying souvenirs or food around the cathedral. Save your money for other shops elsewhere
Make sure to visit while at Castle Hill. Great viewpoint to see the Danube and across the river to Pest. Pose for pictures and breathe in the atmosphere of this great city.
Tremendous views. The Bastion itself is very picturesque and the views it commands are stunning. The only downside is that it is generally heaving with people - so go early or late if you can.

Fantastic design. The towers and walls were really nice to visit, also offering great views of Parliament and the rest of the Pest side. It was nice to take the Siklo up to the area and walk over, and visiting Matthias Church nearby was fun too. Definitely one of the best parts of the trip exploring that area.
Well restored. The church is still under restoration (mainly in the old Muslim corner of the church) but has otherwise been beautifully restored, including a new roof. Well worth a visit.

A delightful collection of towers and walls along the Danube. It is also located in the most charming historic district of Buda. Wonderful area to walk around. We went there to see St Matthias Church--closed early and couldn't enter, but were delighted to see the neighborhood.
Very busy!. Try and go early in the morning because as soon as everyone is awake..... it's sooooo busy. Beautiful buildings and surroundings, though!
Great architecture.. The Fisherman's Bastion right next to the St-Matthias Church is a great place to visit. Nice atmosphere, great architecture.
don't pay for this. it is not necessary to pay to go up the stairs, the view is equally great and beautiful downstairs, you can safe 700 HUF

Terrific view across the Danube to Pest and the Parliament Buildings. It is worth the effort to get up to the Fishermans Bastion and take in St Matthias Church too. As far as photographs are concerned your own personal ones with a view from the bastion go to the left hand side as you look at it and you will get a great photograph of the river and Parliament Buildings. There are folks happy to take your photograph and you are currenly looking at about £6 for that privilegeIf you want a lunchtime treat in the Hilton Restaurant you have a surprisingly reasonably priced meal considering the vista over the Danube to Pest with it's wonderful architecture dominated by the Basilica and Parliament buildings...as no other building is allowed to be higher.
Best views from here. Best views from this point, well worth a visit, lovely area, lovingly restored, pay a little extra for the turret views.

Not worth paying for admission fee. The architecture is beautiful overlooking Pest. However, it is not worth spending money on admission as only a small section is restricted. The other section of the Bastion is allowed public access for free and the views are similar.

beautiful place, fantastic views. See this place at the Budapest castle for both it's own beauty but also for the view out over the river toward Pest and especially for a great view of the parliament.  One word of advice is do not pay the fee to go onto the upper level as you approach it with Matthias church on your left. If you just move down along Fishermans bastion to the left you can go up even higher for the view without paying any fee, so i fail to see why anyone would pay the fee. There is a cafe with the exact same view as everyone else has so i'd only grab something there to eat if you really want to eat and find the choices and prices appealing, we didn't.

Great View of the City. Great view, especially of the Pest side of Budapest. Worth it to come up to the Castle District for it. If you come later in the day, you can avoid some of the crowds and have whatever view point you'd like! Also provides for some great pictures at dusk/night of a lit up Budabest

Great view. It was loaded with tourists and the best spots were occupied by restaurants. But still you can find nice spots to enjoy the panoramic views of the city and take pictures if the Parliment building.
Excellent view point. You can take good photographs from here. Be aware that part of this is a bar/restaurant so don’t wonder in. Other than that there are plenty of viewpoints.
Touristy but beautiful. A wonderful view, an adjacent wine shop and tons of foreign tourists greeted us here. A stand selling beverages closeby wouldhave been welcome.

best views of the city. It's a bit different, but well worth the climb to the best viewpoint on the hill. Make sure you stop to visit the church right next to it once you have your panoramic photos of the parliament buildings and bridges.
Fantastic view. Lovely view of the Danube and parliament building. Nice architecture. You don't need to spend a long time here.

Wonderful parliament's view. Nice place to look at 'Pest' and especially at the Parliament.
Church was closed for Easter celebration.

Views. Another viewpoint to take more photos of the Pest side, we didn't pay to climb the tower as were able to get just as good photos from around the side. We visited at a weekend so was quite busy, there is a panoramic café/restaurant with live music which looks nice, little pricey.

Great view of Budapest. You can enjoy the great view of the Parliament and the beautiful Blue Danube. There are many spots that you can take pictures for free. (There is a fee to get to the top of the Bastion).

Beautiful - like a fairytale castle. We visited here in winter - it is high in the Buda Hills and freezing - so warp up warm. The views were amazing across the city and the bastion is lit up at night. Beautiful to look at - like Buda itself really, seems like you are in a Disney movie!

The scenery is beautiful beyond all description.. It is famous for its scenic beauty. From any spot you can take the best picture. You can enjoy the great view of the Budapest. This is on up the hill, so if you decide to walk then I recommend to wear comfortabe shoes.
Tip: bring your camera or smart phone to take a picture.
Fantastic place. Well worth visiting if staying in Budapest. Terrific views over the Danube to the Parliament on the Pest side and the Chain Bridge.
Great place with amazing view. Well worth the visit. The church is amazing and the view from the Bastion is terrific. If you go around sunset it is free - you can just walk through.

Picture perfect. This spot, up on the hill beside St. Mattias, is as picturesque as the post cards. It's a hike up and the funicular can be your friend here. If you go before 6pm, you may catch the ceremonial changing of the guards at the President's house which is nearby.
Lovely architectural feature on the castle Hill. Very prettystaircase and sculptured features, not just of the 7 towers but the staircases etc in white stone but the tourist volumes kill it, go early
nice place to visit. if you visit the castle, you just cant miss to visit this. Very nice view suggest that you go early to avoid the crowd otherwise lunch time is good when everyone is eating!

Beautiful place. We visited this place on the 4th of May and there was a kind of historic event taking place nearby. The knights riding horses and a procession of people in historic clothes. It was additional attraction. The bastion itself is very pictoresque and offers great views. During our visit this place was full of people, but there is enough space for everyone and it was a great experience.A must see in Budapest.
Fairytale appearance!. This looked like something out of Disney. You almost expected Snow White to appear. Fabulous views of Pest and just a lovely place.
Disneyland in Budapest. Disney land in Budapest, you have to pay to get a view of Pest you can see for free a from the castle Hill.
Pretty. You get a wonderful view of Budapest and the structure looks like a castle made out of cake. Very good place to take pictures.

Fabulous vantage point. This is a fantastic site to see. In late April 2013 the temperatures were above 30C, this was a great place to relax and appreciate the wonderful views over Budapest. The bastion is really quite an amazing architectural complex with features representing the various tribes that arrived in Hungary in the preceeding centuries. It looks great.
Nice. You have a good view on Pest. The terrace was closed when we were there. The building of the Hilton next to the church is awful.
Excellent views. Great city views and you could just wander around for free. We did go up to the Cafe Bar but didnt eat up there, plenty of people were though
Amazing views. Was amazing, the views, the Bastion, would recommend it definitely =] if you go during winter it does get very chilly, so wrap up warm. Would be a lovely place to visit in the Summer

Expensiv. It's a historical place of Budapest. You can find here also the Mathias Kirche. There is a beautiful wiew to the city from there. Inside is a restaurant. You can visit it during a sight-seeing tour.
Beautiful view, wonderful architecture. Nothing to dislike, except for the crowds. The lookout points from the Buda side to the Pest side of the river were exceptional.
Fabulous view. What a wonderful place to visit. It is like a fairy land. Plenty to see and do and the outlook over Budapest is fantastic
great views over budapest. Visited this as part of a free budapest tour and is really worth the trip up for the views and also the surrounding area is very cute.

A MUST IF YOU VISIT BUDAPEST FOR FIRST TIME. Fisherman's Bastion is the point from which you can have the most wonderfull view of Dunabe's and Budapest so beautifull buildings along the river , especially The Parliament.There is also The Trinity Square with Saint Mattias church and St. Stephen Quards momument.What i thing does not much with the whole architectual scene, is the very modern glass-made building of Hilton Hotel.The music of the violins made the atmosphere very exciting!Around you will find cafe and souvenir shops. I will suggest you to have your coffee and try the excellent sweets ,made in the oldest confectionery of the town, that is Ruszwarm.You can find it in the trinity square next to St. Mattias church.

Worth the climb!. Wonderful views of the city. The trolley was out of order the morning we went, but it's a relatively gentle climb if you take the long way around. A large part of the Bastion is now a cafe, but the rampart is still open and provides stunning views.

Magical views of the Danube & Pest. We were unsure when visiting if the Bastion was well maintained or not as old as represented, either way it fits in perfectly, you have to pay to walk along the ramparts, something we did not, as the views from everywhere else are just as good, plenty of artists selling average paintings, soak up the atmosphere, you can even pay to have an eagle sit on your shoulder.Be aware that if you need the loo, a charge of as much as 1 Euro and even in the bars you are asked for a donation.
Beautiful reconstruction. Damaged during WWII the reconstruction is marvelous and the views are breath taking from the left bank of the Danube.

Looks Old But It's Really Quite New. Hungary is a nation with a great history and during the countries history many battles have been fault and lost. The Fisherman's Bastion tells one of those famous stories. Why I liked my visit is based on the fact that Budapest's architecture suffered greatly during the bombings of World War two and the Fisherman's Bastion is a great example of how modern construction can be made to blend with classic design of the past. Take the opportunity to visit.

Magical castle bastion with outstanding views of Budapest. Beautiful, and an absolute must to visit when in Budapest. Whilst not huge, it is in great condition, with a magical atmosphere about it. Well maintained and provides outstanding views of the city and Danube river. The restaurant is expensive but you do not have to stay. Just climb up on to the ramparts and take in the views.
View the City. Don't miss this vantage point when visiting the 'old city' and for viewing the 'new city' and the river!

Atmospheric at night. We were staying very close to the Fisherman's Bastion, and were able to wander round late at night to admire the views of Pest illuminated across the Danube, and St Mattyas church behind us. There was even a violinist playing halfway down, to add to the atmosphere. It felt safe, even though there were shadowy corners, because there were other people wandering as well.

Beautiful view. Has a nice view of the river, parliament and whole of pest side. Spent few hrs just staring at the view and having an awesome drink at the Halaszbastya restaurant. there is WC just under the staris that lead to the terrace hotel. Downstaris afetr few steps not many know :) and very neat.
History Pure. This place is well worth a visite and is easily accesible with the public transport. The church is magnificient and the views over the city are really fantastic
Picturesque. Not to be missed for great photo shots of Budapest. The Bastian itself is a magnificent to say the least.

Spectacular views. The views from Fisherman's Bastion are incredible. Don't bother paying to go upstairs. The extra 2 meters of height it gives you are not worth it.There are a number of artists who sell their works there when the weather is nice. Make sure you know what you're getting though cause some of them are just photocopied reproductions.
good view. I wouldn't pay extra to go and see the view when you can see it from another area, I was expecting more

Take the Bait. Fisherman's Bastion was lovely and provided unique architecture and great views. There is church on the campus and that was being resotred but offered a limited and worthwhile glimpse of teh beauty of the decor.
Beautiful spot fo photo. This is a very nice spot to overview Pest side of Budapest. You can walk there and enjoy the scenery as well
Fantastic views of the Danube. You do not have to pay to get a good view, there is another turet to the left of the main view point which has a fabulous little bar and viewing deck at the top.

Beautiful!!. Easy to reach my metro & bus. The building is beautiful & free to visit. I took several photos here & could have taken several more at sunrise and sunset. And you can stand in Buda, looking across the river at Pest :)

Great view but avoid to pay any entry fee because .... This is a must to be for a while. You will have a great view over Budapest and the Danube. However, there is a small part where you can enter the bastion with a fee only. You don't need to because this is valid only for a small part of the bastion. The greater part is for free and much more attractive. Don't know why they do this.

magnificent views. I was lucky enough to be there on a beautiful, clear day to enjoy the great views! The #16 bus is very convenient to take from Deak Square and back. You are able to have either a free, mis-range or expensive visit, depending on your transport, refreshment, and shopping preferences-----something for everyone.

Wonderful views but that's about it. The views across to Pest with the sight of Parliament, the Chain Bridge and St Istvan's are spectacular, There isn't much to the Fisherman's Bastion itself but it is surrounded by so much history and so many buildings of genuine artistic merit and inherent interest. The area is a 'must-see' if you are in Budapest.
Spectacular views. What more can I say the views and architecture are breathtaking, St Matthius church well worth a visit

Whole area is amazing. Stepping out of St. Matthias and seeing the Fisherman's Bastion is like icing on a cake. St. Matthias is spectacular and then you get the view and additional spectacle of Fisherman's Bastion as a bonus
Wonderful. Amazing view, u feel like part of history :) Its very nice in the day but in the night its just perfect for a romantic walk
Very nice. Beautiful views of "Pest" and splendid architecture. Definitely worth a visit. Somehow reminiscent of Montmartre without the bustle.
Excellent. Lovely building up overlooking the city. A great view down over the Danube and Pest. Great location for taking some photographs.
Interesting. Visited on the walking tour, very interesting, amazing views.quieter side than pest, Buda is calmer, great place to take photographs.

Fisherman bastion.. Classic tourist trap. A bit over priced. Great view over the river towards pest. Well worth a visit for the view and history. English is well spoken all around the city. Great for the English speakers.
Wonderful Views. Probably the place in Budapest to take photoraphs from. Very interesting. Lots of tourists, but it is must stop.
Good view, don't pay extra. View over the city is nice from this place and bastion itself looks nice. I don't recommend paying admission on the top floor, 2 more meters of view is not worth it.

A fairy tale story building, get your camera ready. One of the sites that should be seen on the castle hill. it is so impressive. If you walk around you will see charming architecture, with fine fantastic details. the Hop On, Hop Off bus will take you there, so get off the bus, and spend some time looking around, and photographing the lovely views. have a lovely day.

Wonderful view. My most favourite place in Budapest. Near the Matthias church, 15 minutes from the down town with public transport. Bit annoying that the place is mostly occupied by some restaurants and it's hard to find a place to take photos from or you can pay to get to upstairs. Never mind, beautiful.
Great views. Enjoyed an expensive glass of hot wine at the highest tower but well worth the view. A nice place to walk around.

Stunning Place. We took in the view of the Fisherman's Bastion originally from the Blue Tour Bus on the Friday morning. A couple of our group decided to get off the bus at the Castle Hill stop, so that they could have a better look around. The rest of us, decided to go back on the bus on the Saturday, so that we could have a look for ourselves. The buildings are stunning and the view from up in the Arches was tremendous. A couple of us ventured in to the Marzipan Museum to buy some goods and have a Hot Chocolate to warm us up. This place is one of the nicest parts in Budapest to take some good photos. Make sure you pay it a visit!

Excellent views of Pest, unparalleled and free too!. What a fantastic view of Pest side of Budapest from this historic location situated on the Buda side. Don't bother paying to go upstairs as there's enough to take pictures from the ground level and instead try this: walk to the far left side of the bastion and walk up to one of the turrets for a great (and free) view. There's even a cafe at the very top in case you need to warm up (which we did during March at minus six that day). The views of the Danube river and the Orszagház or the Parliament Building are absolutely stunning. Take a video shot with your cell phone, your relatives and friends will thank you for this. Tip: for a great coffee and treat, head to the Hotel Hilton across the street. It's located on the original foundation of the castle from hundreds of years ago and it's most inviting (and modern) inside. Warm up there!

Pleasant views however do not pay.. While the views from this location are very pleasant, there are may locations along the Castle district where a fantastic view can be appreciated. What I would say is that the Fishermans bastion is essentially a small walkway directly on top of a walkway that is free of charge to walk along. Whereas the Bastion is a fee paying area. Having paid to walk along the 50 metres or less of walkway and then gone to the nearby cafe which is free about 20 metres away and with a higher vantage point I was a little mythed as to what on earth I had paid for.
Wonderful history and view. We explored this on our own in cold wet weather and still found the area interesting well done. The view over the city is sensational.

Fabulous Views of the City. Don't miss going here; spectacular architecture and views of the city. It does cost to go up to the steps to the very top, but this is not necessary to get good views. It will be very crowded, so keep in mind that getting a photo without a person in your shot will be almost impossible.

Lovely walk. There is so much to see. The buildings are really nice and the walk up there makes you feel you deserve it, once you get there. Great courtyards. there was guys playing trad. music and other guys with eagles. and great views over the city.

Perfect place for photos. The whole site is charming and romantic and you can take wonderful photos. I just advise you to go very early in the morning, let's say around nine , because later on it will be filled with tourists . In the evening the scenery is astonishing and you will always remember it

Very Interesting Architecture. I've always thought this building looked like a gigantic sandcastle on the beach. The architecture is so unique and fluid. There's a small entrance fee, which I opted not to pay. You can see the same views on the other side of the "bastion" for free, and they're the same. Also, keep your eye out for a falconer in the area!
What a view!. Best view of Budapest. Great picture taking place. Worth going back at night for a totally different perspective.

One of the most beautiful.... Fisherman's Bastion is one of the most beautiful landscape I ever seen. It is located in Budapest in the Castle district and if you visit Budapest it is a must have. It was renovated a few years ago, so it is more beautiful than before. If you would like to find a romantic place in Budapest, where you would like to take your girlfriend it can be the place, especially in the evening (it is a totally safe place), when you can see Budapest in evening lights.

Stunning. I had been wanting to see this for years and I wasn't disappointed.Even though the weather was overcast it still looked beautiful and had a real fairytale quality to it. It's also a great place to get panoramic views of both Buda and Pest.The 'hop on, hop off' city bus tour makes it easily accessible.

the BEST part of Buda. Take your camera! The Fisherman's Bastion runs along the backside of Matthias Church ( also not to be missed ) and is beautiful in and of itself with fairy tale turrets and sculptures- but the views over the Danube are breathtaking. Don't miss this one
Great at night. The church and bastion are lit up at night and look amazing, especially at sunset. However I think that the church may shut earlier so plan for this if you want to see the inside.
Nice to visit. Not really the main attraction of the area but you will happen across it as you visit the castle and the matyas church.An eye-catching area with a few photo opportunities.

Don't buy a ticket !. Check our other reviews. The views are great but the attraction is one big area where you are asked to buy a ticket for only one part. Don't bother - just walk 20 metres along and you see it all without paying. I not a cheapskate and will pay any church but this is not worth paying

It's all about the view!. If you want to have an astonishing view of the city from above then this is the place to go. Lovely location at the hills of Buda, very romantic and you can take amazing pictures. Also, the terrace is very wide therefore you will be able to enjoy the view from different angles. I highly recommend the visit during nighttime because you can enjoy the view and the beautiful lights of the city without the crowds. The Parliament looks amazing from up there! Very romantic indeed! Also, there is a restaurant called Halaszbastya which also has an amazing view (since it is located on the right-hand side of the terrace behind the Matthias Church and the Hilton hotel and it is overlooking the Parliament) and we combined our visit with a dinner at this restaurant after taking many, many, many pictures - In case you are interested, I also made a review for this restaurant.
Beautiful Blue Danube River at Sunny Day. Beautiful site to see the blue Danube River. Go at a sunny day! Relaxing, peaceful and unforgetable.

Well worth the effort. Well, what a fantastic and beautiful location. I was really surprised by how much I enjoyed myself here, the view is absolutely stunning. We had passed near the day before on board one of the cities hop on hop off tourist buses and had decided to come back and spend some time here. I thought an hour would have been sufficient but ended up spending two to three hours here. It was nice to just kick back and relax. The bus dropped us off at the top, but I decided that I would walk to the base of the bastion in order to capture some pictures. The view from the bastion looking over to the Pest side of the city was well worth the time and effort and would be worthy of a return trip one day. I just wish we could have found the time to come back at night.

a visual delight. when seeing images of budapest this was always a striking picture to visit however you then realise it actually has no history but is only a visual beauty. due to the location in the varhegy it is something you must see

Breathtaking and magical, late evening or early morning. My Hungarian friend told me to visit this place. She said the view was spectacular. I nodded and put it on my To Do list. A view of a river with buildings illuminated at night? Been there, done that or so I thought.I diligently read the reviews on TA and looked over the photos. Pretty, but I've seen lots of majestic, time-weathered, historical and cultural structures. Places where empires thrived and declined. In comparison, this could only be a bit of stone eye-candy. And crowds? No thanks.Nevertheless, I planned the visit to include a few nights in a hotel nearby, the luxurious Buda Castle Fashion Hotel. I figured that if we were going to see the Halászbástya, we should see it properly -- late at night and early in the morning. And I am so very glad that I figured right!The night we arrived, part of the structure was cordoned off. Film crew! The walls and towers were brightly illuminated by the spotlights. We climbed up to the cafe in the tower, chatted with the lone attendant and imagined how pleasant it must be to have a drink up there in the summer. Looking across to the glowing Parliament, I started to feel the enchantment.The next morning at 8 am, we rolled out of our comfy beds and went for an early morning stroll. The film crew was gone (good riddance!) and the Bastion was ours! What a view! With the place to ourselves, we wandered about for a good half hour. I admired the various lines, angles and curves of the structure as well as the statue of Szent István Király (Saint King Stephen).After a delicious breakfast at the hotel, we headed out again. The daytime crowds had descended on the plaza. Soon, the tacky souvenir vendors would arrive....See the Halaszbastya late at night or early in the morning.

Stunning views from elevated view point!. This view point on the Castle Hill is an absolute must when visiting Buda. When you arrive at St. Matthias Church you will have to buy a ticket to enter the church. There is the option to purchase a ticket for the Bastion as well, but it not worth buying as the views from the other part of the defences (to the left, looking towards the river) as just as good, if not better! The views up and down the river and across to Pest, are stunning! Well worth a visit. Do visit the Church as well, it is an absolute gem!
Must Visit. Is a must of Budapest. Best views from Pest (do it during daylight and night). Take the advantage to walk Buda and have a coffee

To touristy. Unfortunately a big part of the Bastion has been closed for a restaurant and you need to pay a high fee to climb the steps of the Bastion and take a look at the beautiful panorama of the Pest side and the Danube.Many years ago I got there my first kiss so this place is important in my life. That point of time it it was open for everyone, the entire Bastion.

Go for the view. The view over Pest from this large "terrace" is incredible. You can see down the river in both directions for miles, weather permitting. There is no charge for the lower level, but if you want to go upstairs onto the terrace there is a charge. It is spectacular by day and night and if you are up to see the Matthias Church, you are so close!

Castle Hill. Beautiful view. There is a tower to walk up that u pay for and one that you do not (where the cafe is). We had the same view from the free spot. You have to walk through the little cafe that is in the tower but they didn't care.
Breathtaking View. Magnificent view of Budapest, the area is always crowded with tourists. The nearby cafes and restaurant are reasonable.

Where I proposed:). This is a fantastic view of the city especially at night - really breathtaking. This is where I proposed to my lovely fiance. It was really a special moment and brilliant place to ask the big question!

Fantastic views and wonderful stone buildings. I preferred this to Castle Hill for the views - it is really stunning. You can do quite a lot of tourist things in a short space of time here as they are so near. It was really cold the day I visited - the day was clear and the views were amazing!
Nice place. Nice view on Budapest, wonderfully architectured church. Some street artist give a nice atmosphere. In the winter it's quite cold though, so dress for it!

Lovely.. The only real downside to this was that they did not clear off the snow very well. In some places it was left completely and in others it was extremely slippery. I saw one man nearly slip over the edge (which would have killed him) but he caught himself just in time and an old man fell heavily on the water-soaked stones. Budapest in general seemed to have a dedicated workforce of snow-clearers so why they ignored such a treacherous tourist spot I have no idea.The view is beautiful, a great location for pictures of the palace, chain bridge, Danube and parliament.I do disagree with the comments others have left about cost to see the best view, it was free for us. All you need to do is walk through the coffee shop and outside.

worth the visit nice place to take photo of pest side. We did not take the ticket but just visited the lower part of it ( Don't need ticket for that). The view of pest from here is incredible. And the architecture of Fisherman's Baston is amazing.

Somewhat average... This place is OK..There is so much to see in Budapest with beautiful views that this seemed quite an average in comparison..Plus you have to spend extra bucks if you want to see the view from the terrace..But while you are there near Mathias Church,you will not mind going there as well..

Don'tmiss Fisherman's Bastion. Such a beautiful part of Castle Hill! Fistherman's Bastion offers more photo opportunities than one could ask for! It is simply beautiful to see Pest from the Bastion. The Danube stretches across the city offering exceptional views of the bridges and Margritszigit (Margaret Island) as well as the statue atop the Citadel. The view of St. Stephen's Basilica is breathtaking from from the Bastion.Great for families - the kids can burn off energy and the parents can find a quiet corner to steal a kiss.
A pleasant find. Enjoyed an amazingly cheap mulled wine in the heated turrets while soaking up the views of the parliament buidling and the Danube

A Must See. This is a great place for pictures an for views of the Danube river and the wonderful skyline on the Pest side and views of the budaside. The area is quite quaint with vendors a small park and was really fun to walk around and explore.

Go and see. It is a very beautiful monument. The view is fantastic. You can combine this visit to many other important places on Budapest, so no brainer to plan to go. Inside the church is interesting ( see pics ) , so you can go there if you have time.
Great Viewpoint. Best place for Views over the Danube and Budapest with all the significant landmarks on view. Lunch in the Hilton was pleasant but expensive.
good views. The stone work has all been cleaned and looks too white a bit fairy tale like but the views over to the Pest side are excellent.

Perfect site for short trip!. Castle hill and the fisher and bastion was the way I chose to spend my single free day in Budapest and it was lovely! Great views, great walk, cute shopping area. Easy to get to and wonderful photo ops!
Lovely walk. Its a nice walk along to the bastion and you get great views of the Danube and the Parliament building Looks great at night with Chain Bridge all lit up and close by
Gorgeous. Very interesting, and another way to gain great views of the city. The construction is beautiful, although it was a little icy when we went.

Lovely views of Pest. Don't miss walking onto Fisherman's Bastion for the lovely view of Pest across the river. It's just behind the Hilton hotel, and on way back pop into the shop selling interesting varities of marzipan, which is also at the back of the Hilton!
Great area to stroll around. Have a hot chocolate with rm in the cafet next to Hilton Hotel and see the Marzipan Exhibition of just over £1 entry

Superb views. The beautiful Fishermans bastion is on the Buda side of the river. It looks magnificent (especially when lit at night) from the Pest bank, and the views of the Hungarian Houses of Parliament, St Stephens Basilica and the Chain bridge are awesome.
Beautiful in the snow. A lovely castle y type of area, up high, so you get a good view of Buda and Pest. Take the funicular train up and walk down.
Lovely environment. I didn´t know this place till I found it, It was a lovely experience, with the church at the back and recentrly restored, I think it is one of the best places to visit in Budapest

Not What it Seems. It's very decorative, a great place to sightsee and take photos, and its totally fake - it looks like a keep on a castle, my friends tell me it was built in the 1800's to give appearances. Quaint, but not all that historic.
Great Views. Wonderful views of the Pest side of the city from here, although the views probably aren't as good as those from the castle
Amazing. I love this place. Really nice architecture and stunning view over Budapest.One of the best places in Budapest .

Visit but don't pay for entrance! . Cool building with good view over the city just behind the Mathias church. However, we made the mistake to buy a combination ticket for the church and this. Then just to realize you can walk around in about most of the bastion without a ticket, it was unnecessary to have. The stairs was also very icy where we had to have the tickets.

majestic!. Well worth a walk around in any weather, but especially beautiful on a sunny day where you get great views of the river, Parliament building and city. Architecture is beautiful; reminded me a of a fairytale or the castle grounds from the Labyrinth movie!
BEAUTIFUL VIEWS OF BUDAPEST!. The Bastion is very pretty and located next to the Matthias Church. Lovely pictures to be taken from here. Romantic lovely place...

Good Views. Good Views of the Pest side for the Bastion. There may be some local vendors and/or artists performing nearby. Wait until you come down off the hill to buy Souvenirs or exchange money -much more expensive near the church and Bastion.
Fishermans bastion. Church of mattias nice but new renovations make it seem false in a way, good views across river, lots of walking and hills so come prepared
well worth a visit. superb architecture, lots to see and great coffee shop in a turret offering views across the river, well worth a visit.

Beautiful views. We bought a lunch of rolls and ham from one of the small shops near the Bastion and ate at one of the benches enjoying the wonderful views below and the lovely Bastion. A perfect picnic!The Bastion was very pretty and spotlessly clean and, in March, not very busy, it's right by the beautiful church and a lovely place to visit that feels a long way away from the hustle and bustle of the city below.
A must-see!. Beautiful building with magnificent views, a definite must-see! We went twice, once during the day and once at dusk, two very different views, equally wonderful.

Great vantage point. The best place for views of Pest and the Danube that we found. Weather always a key consideration but on a good clear day this is not to be missed. Other good sights are in the nearby vicinity and a few nice cafes dotted about too.

Good Views, that's about it.. This gives a good view of Pest, especially the Parliament. All it is a look out point. But you should still go because it is right by the Cathedral, and you are going to be up there anyways.
Fairy tale. Pretty architecture and wonderful views. The hilton is a great place to stay. Nice hungarian restaurants nearby.

Must be seen. Ascend the hill in a pleasant walk and avoid the overpriced cable car. Or use bus number 16. Next to it is the palace of the president and the castle with an excellent exibition of art.Youl will enjoy the view over the city
Must see in Budapest. this was one the main reasons I even went to Budapest, it's simply beautiful at night. it's more of a ornament than a functional building
very quiet. fantastic view across the danube, very quiet area magnificent architecture, very steep hills use the cable car lifts up the hill nice walk down
Breath taking views. Quite a hike to get up there but the views over Pest and Parliment in particular were breath taking Well worth the climb ! Would recommend a visit

Best views of Budapest.. You must go here. The Bastion itself is beautiful but the views across to Pest are stunning - particularly in the evening and Parliament is lit up and reflects into the Danube.

Amazing view of the Parliament Building and River Danube from here. I walked over from the Augustz Cafe after some wonderful cakes and tea! Very good viewing spot where you can see all the main buildings.

Beautiful. We were very lucky to have this right outside our hotel (The Hilton). When you get to the top the view of Budapest is breathtaking. The small cafe on the top is lovely for a coffee or glass of wine.
Great Views from great Bastion. It's almost turkish-like. The views from the Fisherman's Bastion over the city are great. The walk on the top is now paid, so do take a few coins with you.

A picture postcard location. Another "picture postcard" place to visit in Buda with stunning views of the Danube. When I visited I walked there from Batthany Ter metro station through the attractive back streets of Buda. I guess most people will get there on one of the many tourist busses as it is very popular. Personally I prefer to walk as there are many fine buildings and pretty streets on the way. It was brim full of Japanese tourists taking each other's pictures on my visit. They were largely ignoring the fine trio of musicians (Bass, violin and cymbalom) playing traditional Hungarian music in the cafe which has stunning views of Pest across the Danube. There is much interesting architecture to see here.
Gorgeous itself, plus great view. The architecture of Fisherman's Bastion was beautiful ,plus it provided a great view of Pest and its buildings!
Great view. Great view of the Danube and the parliment. Right next to Mathias Church. Took a taxi and got dropped. Parking was a premium during tourist season.

Perfect picture frames!. Any one of the many openings on the Fisherman's Bastion (Halaszbastya) makes for a perfect picture frame. Superb views of Pest and the Danube, with a wonderful aspect of Parliament.Worth the visit especially if you use the funicular railway to get up there

Great view - day and night. If staying on the Pest side, plan a day on castle hill, so you can enjoy the view both in daylight and nighttime. Stairs take you all the way from the Danube street level. Also, busses and a cable cart bring you, if you do not like stairs.

Fabulous views across the Danube. Fishermans Bastion is located on Castle Hill on the Buda side of the city and is the perfect location for great photos of the skyline. It's free and there is plenty of room so even at the busiest times you'll be able to get some great photos! There's even a small cafe in one of the towers so you can enjoy the views with a cup of tea.
It is a must!. There is nothing more to write. It is a must if you get the best view over Pest. Do it both during the daytime and late evening/night!

worth the hike!. We walked up the never ending steps on our final morning in Budapest carrying our one year old in his pushchair! Some hike only realised at the top that we could have pushed up the road for majority of the walk up lol!!!!! Weather was lovely and we got to take some great shots of the parliament building here. Would definitely suggest to others to go. The church at the top as well as the rest of the architecture is very impressive.
Fisherman's Bastion. Brilliant view of Pest side of Budapest, Parliament building, Chain Bridge et al .Short walk to Castle Hill(Varehegy) , St Mattyas Church and Hospital in the rock.
Great panorama. It offers a great panorama over the Pest part of the city. On top of that it's a beautiful building on itself, right next to a beautiful church. A true must see!
romantic. It transports you, almost felt like i was back in Grenada, Beautiful view of the Parliament, river, easy access, go to the basilica afterwards

Great views of the Danube/Parliament building. This is a great place to visit. Although we went in February and on a day when it was snowing we were not disappointed. The snow did spoil the views but inbetween showers you can see up the Danube towards Margaret Island, Chain Bridge and across the river to the Parliament Buildings as well as further down to Elizabeth Bridge. On the day we wen there was two men dressed in old Hungarian costumes with hawks, that you could have your photo taken with.What I like about Budapest/Hungary is that nothing is a rip off as in the UK. 1000 Huf to go inside the bastion area, 1200Huf for the nearby Palace.During our stay we used the 'Giraffe' Hop on/Hop off bus service, and on the red route this is stop No 11(for both the bastion and Palace). We would highly recommend this bus service for 5000Hufs each you got two days travel and also a river cruise thrown in. There are two or thre others but they didn not look as good and I think the bus headphones have about 15-29 languages.

Beautiful fairytale setting.. We visited when it was snowing heavily, it was like something out of a fairytale, quite beautiful.The views across to the Parliament were not so great because the weather has closed in but that added to the romantic atmosphere.Loved it.

Stunning views!. Well, what to say more ? Views from Fisherman's Bastion are just amazing. Normally, the entrance on the highest terace is only with tickets but it is sometimes free in the non-season. Anyway, even without climbing to the highest point of the bastion you will have the possibility to enjoy excellent panoramas! While you are there, take also a look behind you on the hotel Hilton, adjacent to the Cathedral - apparently, there's come controversy about his fit (or non-fit) with the surroundings - up to you to decide if it goes well with the historical buildings or not...:-)
Wonderful views. You could look down on the Danube from up here, just beautiful. Then wander back down onwards the river. Great photo opportunities.

Very interesting and beautiful sight. The Fisherman's Bastion is a fairytale like structure with history on the Buda side of the city. The views from the Bastion are very beautiful, as you look out towards the river, the Parliament building and the Pest side of the city. It's a great spot for some fantastic photography!

A must see on the Buda hill. Have your camera ready and select a clear day to visit the Fisherman's Bastion. The bastion itself and the views to the Pest are absolutely beautiful. Maybe there are some artists too to entertain the tourist so be sure not to skip this on your Buda-walking tour.

Great views.... Note that the complex is not a historic building, it was built as an homage to the original 7 Magyar tribes. The architecture of the place is pretty unique, and is a great viewing point to look at Pest. Also a nice starting point to visit the oldest part of Buda, it gives the city some serious cachet.

Great views. It is well worth crossing the Danube to visit Buda it's very different to Pest which is also lovely. Lots of quaint buildings and you must go to Fishermans BAstion to see the wonderful view
Great views. Lovely structure with great views for pics of Pest and the Danube. Not much else though unless you've got an animated tour guide to talk you through the history.

Free and Beautiful. We wandered around the Fisherman's Bastion in a clear, sunny day and were treated to spectacular views across the Danube to Pest. I didn't get tired of looking at the fairytale turrets and you can stop for a mulled wine in a heated room at the top. I suppose on a grey day you lose the allure of the views, but the best part is that it's free to wander through the alcoves.

Fantastic View and beautiful architecture. The Fisherman's Bastion gives a glorious view across the Danube and Pest, particularly on a nice sunny day. I recommend going to the top to the little cafe and snuggling up under a blanket with a hot chocolate. It's a little bit pricey but worth it.It's a very romantic setting and fairytale like.
worth the climb to see the view. Climbing the steps up to Old Town Buda and the Fisherman's Bastion is worth taking in the beautiful view of Pest and the Danube from it's ramparts

When you see it you know Walt Disney saw it too!!!. Gorgeous white parapets high up. Great view of the city too. Walt Disney must have been here to create his castles because you can see the resemblance.

Theme park style. As part of our circular walk once on the top of the Buda side we came to see this monument. It would have fitted into a Disney type theme park however the views on a sunny day are not to be missed and we happened to be on the ramparts at midday and the bells from many churches bring to peel... quite magical.

I fell in love with Budapest in that spot. A great spot to see the city!!! go in the afternoon, see the city with day light and then, go and have some nice pastry in the area, and return after dark, when all the lights are on, a beautiful site!

Great spot for taking photos. Fairytale architecture with magnificent views - not to be missed.Beware attendents in toilets nearby as they tried to cheat the woman in front of me out of 1,000 Forints when she needed change.
beautiful. Gorgeous and interesting. Took the venicular up and it was worth the the time and effort. Gorgeous views
What a view!. Stunning panoramic view over the Danube to Pest, by day or night. Local musicians add to the atmosphere.
A magnificent architectural feature. This is a splendid place to admire in the old part of Buda, wonderful architecture. I have some brilliant photographs in the snow.

Fairy tale spires. a lovely place to visit after the Castle We walked over from the Castle and saw an eagle and falcon as well as lots of very pretty bars etc. It was a delight to visit. the only downside is that you have to pay to go to any toilet. We found a lovely bar on the walk down the hill called Malenojck (I think) which had beer and gluwein which was very refreshing on a cold day.

The place where you can see the history of Budapest. For me Budapest is one of most beautiful cities that I have visited (for now) . Around the city you can see many beautiful buildings that show the rich history of the city, but the most special places are by the Danube. You can see as far as Margaret Island and you can clearly see landmark buildings such as St Stephen's Basilica, the Parliament, the Academy of Sciences, Gresham Palace, and, in the distance, the Inner City Parish Church. You'll also catch a glimpse of the Margaret Bridge and the famous Chain Bridge.

Excellent views. We had reached the Castle & Bastion area by the funicular (tip: Buy return tickets). The views over the Danube & Pest are excellent and present great photo opportunities. The cafe at the top of the Bastion provided welcome hot mulled wine for a cold February day. There is a small charge for the nearby WC facilities
Nice sight on top of the city. I spent a few hours in and around the castle and I think the best of all of it was spendint some time with a caffe on the Halaszbastya how the locals call it.
Looks like it is from a fairytale. This was a nice structure to walk around and take photos of. Not much information about it, but it has a great view over the river and Pest.

A must during any visit to Buda. One phrase - a must... if you want a great photo of your visit, the fishermans bastion is the place to take it, trust me. A couple of cafes nearby, gypsy musicians and a couple of guys with a Golden Eagle and a Hawk!
Fisherman`s Bastion Buda. Nice view,nice view and once more nice view,you feel as you are hundreds years ago,as a part of history
Fantastic Photo Spot. Although relatively new it has great charm and provides lovely views. Worth the walk or use the funicular railway if you feel lazy.

Good for photo background. The Bastion is not a real historical building. It was just built to look nice for the tourist (much like the castle in the Varosliget park). If you are planning to see the Royal Palace or Matthias church, go see the Fisherman's Bastion, too. It is a very lovely fairytale building and the view across the Danube to the Parliament is spectacular.
Magical. Lovely place to visit, we walked up the hill and enjoyed every second... a must.The building were out of this world and thought the Bastion was well worth the walk.
Definitely worth it!. A must. Beautiful, almost fairytale-esque. Stroll around, have a drink in the bar overlooking the city. Great views over the city. Don't forget your camera.

A must see. If you are staying on the Pest side take the 106 bus from Pest to Buda - it stops right by the Fishermans Bastion and don't tell anyone it's free.......(well at least it was for us and we saw no one paying nor using tickets - prob a local secret)
Fabulous Views. Get there early to avoid the crowds. The views from it are great of the Parliament building and the Danube and the city and it provides a great photo opportunity.
Wonderful. Worth all the effort - go up the funicular railway at the palace and walk along the top of the hill. Beautiful place, breathtaking views

very nice. Very nice to have a walk around this place. The buildings almost look like a disney castle. Slightly ruined by the ugly Hilton next to it, although I found that a general thing in Budapest, horrible 70s looking buildings then beautiful castle type buildings. Worth a visit
Good views. Nice views over the Danube, chain bridge and parliment. Quite busy with other tourists, and if you're in the area good to have a look
Wow. We enjoyed the view and people watching. Avoid the tourist trap cafes and try going down the road for a better meal.
Wonderful views. Best views of the parliment and part of a wonderful section of the city. A must as part of your time in buda if you are not lucky enough to stay up there.

Beautiful set of small towers offering nice viewpoint. The Halaszbastya is a rather small set of high walls with beautifull towers. They could easily be taken from some elvish city from a LOTR movie. They are offering a spectalular viewpoint accross the other bank of the river.
There is also a cafetaria in the highest tower, but we didn't visit that one.
What a view!. The Fishermans bastian offers a great view over to the Pest side of the city, the Danube and the bridges crossing it. Well worth a visit
Stunning views. Loved the views and architecture. Coffee in the terrace Cafe is a must. Lovely to rest your legs for a while and take in the views with Tea and a Cake.

Pretty tourist attraction. Nice view over Danube and to Parliament. Tourists are everywhere in the Bastion but it is still a must in Budapest. The art is beautiful and it is within a walking distance to Budas castle.
Prices in the cafe are a bit high but the view is worth a photo or two!

Fisherman's Bastion. I think, everybody who intend to visit Budapest, knows or learn about this piece of art: Bastion is not only beautiful on its own, but what more provide you is great sights of the city. - It's well worth to visit.

Unforgettable view. This is an unique place, from where you can enjoy the unforgettable view on Danube, Chain Bridge, and so on,
Amazing in the night: all the illuminated sites are so beautyful!!!

lovely area. We walked here from Varhegy and it is a lovely area to visit. There were eagles that you could be photographed with and a cafe in one of the turrets but the photo opportunities are the best

Do not miss this. Gorgeous views and architecture. We lived in Budapest for six months and took all of our visitors here. A truly special place! Go up at night in the summer after 7pm with some wine, magical!

One of. This place, called Fisherman's Bastion is one of the first places which you have to see if you visit Budapest. The reasons are very simple. Great view, nice cathedral and o lot of monuments and old houses around!
Picturesque. Loved this spot. The views from area are incredible. You can see Parliament, the Danue and other hot spots on the Pest side of town in the horizon. Almost looks like a Disney Castle.
Great views!. Amazing panoramic views across the Danube and Pest. Take your camera and switch it to panoramic mode!

Unbelievably gorgeous views and a wonderful experience. Fisherman's bastion was one of my favorite things that I saw in Budapest. It was wonderful to walk along and see the view of the city across the Danube, especially at night. The Parliament building and St. Stephen's were all lit up and looked awe-inspiring.
Stunning. Stay near here if you can and wake up every morning to the most beautiful view over the water. Absolutely blown away by Budapest and this place is one of the highlights.

Good views. We went there in december 2011. Its amazing the view from the bastions. One can see also the San Andreas church that its a must to visite. You cant go to Budapest and dont visite this bastion
Great views. We came across this place by accident and were really glad we did! The architecture was very interested and it had lovely views as you walked around it.

great!!. the view from the bastion is amazing!!
this building has this unique feeling you won't find anywhere in the world
Wonderful. The 20th century fairy tale-like construction really sets off the church of St Michael. And the views are absolutely spectacular. Whatever you do in Budapes, do this!
Gotta go there. Whether you bus, cable car or walk (stair climb) you must visit for wonderful views back across the city!
Enchanting experience at night. I would recommend going at night when the lights are glowing off the water from the Parliament building. Very lovely place to visit to get a breathtaking view

Tourist Hot Spot. This is certainly one of the tourist "hot spots" of Budapest. The area around here is well worth seeing and the views of the city and Danube are wonderful. Best advice, especially in Summer, is to visit at the end of the day unless you don't mind being just one of what seems thousands milling around and making you feel you're not in that wonderful city but have somehow been transported to Disneyland during School Vacations!!

Fisherman's Basstion. Need to visit this attraction when in, some great views over the city and well kept, is quite a walk from the Danube river with quite a few steps but worth it when you get to to the top

Another of the Must Do's While in Budapest - Amazing Views. The view from Fisherman's Bastion is just amazing! However, it's totally not worth the admission fee (small as it may be) to go on the upper wall.I agree with many of the previous reviews if you can do try to visit it early at sunrise and at dusk for the most amazing views and light of the Pest side.Again I know it is cliche' but this is a must do while in Budapest!!!

Go for the View in the Evening. I'd suggest heading up here in the evening to get a nice view of the Parliament and waterfront lit up. We were here both during the day and in the evening, and given the number of people there mid afternoon on a cold January Monday I could imagine it would be pretty mobbed in the summer months. We didn't do it, but it seemed like it'd probably be a great place to watch a sunrise (if you're able to get up that early!)
Fishermans Bastion.. Visit during the day and at night. the lighting is amazing. The number 16 bus from around Deak Ferenc Square goes right to the top of the hill.

Fairy tale towers with a fantastic view. Captivating, unusual area of Castle Hill. Looking like a cross between a Morrocan Souk & Disneyland, the Bastion offers stunning views toward the Pest side... Parliament, the Chain Bridge and the Basilica. Climb up the winding staircase to get a coffee or a cup of hot mulled wine in the heated cafe and admire the view. This is a fantastic photo opportunity!
superb food. great views and excellent food, only negative was the band came to the table for requests which, whilst polite, can be annoying if you just want to eat.
Beautiful restored area in Budapest. We enjoyed visiting this wonderfully restored area in Budapest. We felt the view of the Pest side and the Danube was spectacular.
