WOW. As part of Castle district The Fisherman's Bastion offers super views across the Danube (Visit at night for a panoramic light show) there are plenty of places to eat and drink

My favourite place. I had to review this attraction,firstly if you walk up its free!! And it is the most eye catching, beautiful, romantic treasure we have ever found.....so much so we went twice. The views of it and looking out from it are just out of this world.....it's like a fairy tale dream world that if your in Budapest you just can't miss.

Best view of the Danube and Pest. In January it was cold and windy and once the fog came down the view was reduced to nothing. However, it is very close to the Hilton and several good restaurants so easy to get a warming meal or drink.

Great thing to see. The Barbie bus outside was sick..!
Just a catchpenny for the americans to feel at home I guess.
The views from the fishermans bastion are stunning and the story is fantastic.

Architectural beauty. On the Buda side high up overlooking the Danube, a fascinating mixture of buildings with lots of towers, walkways, statues & Matthias Church. It was foggy, so didn't get the (apparently) great view over the Danube. As you'd expect in December, it was freezing, more so because it's all on a steep hill!

Fabulous views. This wonderful monument on the Buda side of the Danube was an unexpected highlight of our trip! The views of Pest over the river were fabulous .... a photographers dream. Also the church there and the history of that area was fascinating. If you're in Budapest, don't miss it!
Lovely views. This is a great place to view the Pest side from the Buda side. And it's a great building in and of itself. Especially in the snow, it looks like it's from a fairy tale.

Astonishing. Along with the funicular, this is the highlight of the holiday by far. At number one with venice in the list of most beautiful places I have ever seen. We didn't go go the church but we took in the breathtaking scenery up there and we were astonished!

Amazing at night from bridge. We went during the day when it was full of snow. We went up the funicular as it looked to slippy to walk up the paths. When we got to the bastion it was a fantastic view! You can see nearly all over the town. There are also a few stall up there to get souvenirs. At night it is all lit up and it's a great picture opportunity from the chain bridge as it is just in-front of it.

Wonderful place!)). I had a nice walking over Buda part of the city, but those 10 km!!! didn't prevent me from going up the hill and see this very-very nice place;)). Views from here really great...even in winter time;))

Totally amazing. Totally, loved the location, loved the architecture, quit simply stunning and well worth a closer look. It has great views out over the river and across to the other side of the city. The little bar at the top of the turret, while expensive, provides some outstanding views.

Great views. It is east to climb onto the walls of the Bastion with its warm coloured stone and impressive turrets. From there you can see all the bridges crossing the Danube and a super panorama of Pest waterfront especially the Parliament building. In one of the turrets there is a small bar/cafe with a few chairs on which to sit and watch the city go about its business together with the shipping on the river.

Lovely monument. Fisherman's Bastion is a lovely monument of the side of Buda. At first I thought it wouldn't be someting remarkable, but when I got there I changed my opinion. It is romantic, like a castle from fairytales, with nice view over Pest

nice place . has got the name fishermans bastion. nice place for photgraphy its next to the church.you would need to climb up and walk to it or take the short tram to the palace. there are hourly buses which go around.

Views of the Danube. Stunning views across the Danube to Pest! The church is being renovated and you can see the conservation work being done as it is till open to the public! Or have your photo taken with a regal hawk and traditional falconer

Nice fantasy world feeling to it. Visit it after sunset.
The lighting gives a nice charm to it.
The attraction itself is worth a wow for few minutes.
Then views of fully lit parliament and chain bridge from here breathtaking with full moon..
Just the sight of those hordes professional photographers with huge cameras is testament to it.

Up, Up and Away. The name confuses. This vista and vantage point has little to do with the Danube other than that it was the responsibility of the Fishermen Guild during the Middle Ages. Instead, this locale provides a stunning vista of the adjacent Buda hillside and Pest on the opposite side of the Danube.

Romantic corner with a view. I added this to my to do list but was pleasently surprised. All pictures I saw were taken during day time. We have visited at night and it was stunningly beautiful. Like in fairy tale. Definately keep it on your must-visit list.

A pretty view, but looks a little "Disney". The place is very beautiful, and the view (on a clear day) is spectacular. However, it does look a little bit like a Disney reproduction. I visited in December 2012 for the second time, and I was glad that I didn't have to pay a fee to climb the stairs and take photos. However, the stairs were very icy I was surprised that none of the hundreds of tourists slipped on it while I was there! The area is very interesting, and therefore I would recommend a quick visit. It is not worth an entire morning or afternoon, trust me!
Gorgeous views from here. If you are in Buda, it is definately worth walking along the Fisherman's Bastion. The views are amazing!

Great views. The views from the top of the bastion are breathtaking and well worth the walk up to the top.There is also a cafe in one of the turrets that serve hot chocolate under heated lamps so you can see out and over look the city.
beautiful. makes for amazing photos and you get incredible views. wrap up warm in winter though it gets very windy up there!
Very pretty place. A lovely place to visit and take photos from, great statues and viewpoints across the river and over Budapest. Very pretty!

Treasure. YOu can go to Chain Bridge and climb by stairs through beautiful streets. When you enter the gate, you are entering fairytale world. Bastion was built at the end of XIX and in the beginning of XX century. This place is special for its architecture. Whole complex consists of Bastion, Gentlemens Street, Matthias Church, Royal Palace. Try to explore avery part of this treasure, leave day or two for this beauty.
Wonderful view. A steep walk up there, but definitely worth it. Great view over the city, and especially the Hungarian Parliament.

Like a fairy castle. Pretty bastion on the buda side of Budapest. The courtyard was nice with little restaurants and cafes of very good value. The views were lovely.If I ever come back to Budapest then I would stay on this side near the bastion as it is is meant to be stunning at night.

Must go. It is one the top 5 places where a tourist should go while their stay in the city. Especially during a good day (with no rain or snow or too many clouds in the sky) the scenery must look spectacular.

Wish we could stay longer. You need at least a day or two for the Fisherman's Bastion and we wished that we could walk around longer. Very impressive with beautiful buildings, lovely little cafes and a stunning view of Budapest. Not to be missed!
Photographers fun house. Whimsical architecture with a fun photo from every angle. some very talented local musicians played in one of the alcoves. A must see.

Regardless of my review you'll been visiting this place,. All is true, it is clean and the views are spectacular. We were up there on a couple of occasions and our experience with the throngs of tourists was the same. Interesting craft shops but prices differ greatly between shops, If you have time to price check I would suggest doing so. Like most of our experience with the recommended places in Europe we found this to be a very touristy area but a must see,

Beauitful moment and views. Very beautiful spot in Buda. The views from atop the Bastion are lovely. We had hot cocoa in the very overpriced little restaurant at the top. Quite a rip off but the views were lovely.
Beautiful views of Budapest. An excellent place to view Budapest on a clear day but still a beautiful place to visit, especially when covered in snow!
Beautiful architecture and wonderful view. This sight combines two excellent properties; to be beautiful to look at, and to be beautiful to look from.

lovely well kept area of the city. Visited here whilst on a city tour and was very impressed with how clean and tidy the general area seemed to be considering the number of tourists. Lovely area with some nice coffee shops and craft stalls in the vacinity as well as a Gothic cathedral. Make sure to walk along the bastion for great views over the river/parliament and the East of Budapest in general. Well worth the walk up the hill (funicular/buses also available)

Beautiful and well maintained. A pleasure to visit this area. Great views across the river, wonderful architecture, quality crafts for sale, falcon trainers on display, terrific restaurants (some with authentic food, some with tourist food and spectacular views)

Brilliant place to chill out and enjoy the view. This is so close to St Matthias Church its really lovely to just walk along the top of the walkway and take in the views across the river, there is also a little cafe there which is nice to just stop and watch the world for a while.
Do not miss this place. . The fisherman's bastion is amazing not just for the brilliant view but also for the atmosphere surrounding the area. Another must see in Budapest.
Worth visiting. The fisherman's towers are very interesting and provide beautiful view to Danube and city. There is a Gothic cathedral nearby as well.

I do not understand the rave. To me, Fisherman's Bastion is plain and nothing much spectacular about it. Loads of tourists hogging the place which makes taking plain photos hard. Same vantage point you enjoy on the other side of the hill near funicular.
Best views of the city. Amazing views of the city fromacross the Danube. If you dont like a walk, take the funicular railway for next to nothing,which runs all day long.

A must when visiting Budapest. The view from the Fishermans´s Bastion was beautiful! It is definitely worth taking the trip up there when in Budapest. When it’s getting dark the lights on the Parliament looks fantastic.
the wow factor. A strange construction, but wonderful in its uniqueness.These white towers make you go thinking to a fairytale...The views are breathtaking!

awesome. Busy beautiful this truly has the wow factor. It has a great vibe and is the hub of buda with the Var stretching beyond and the views are breathtaking. Indeed we intend to return with our family as this deserves a second visit
Best view. Great view on a clear day. Bring your camera, it is A must see! A new cafe has opened up there. Wear your walking shoes.

must see view. This is a nice finish for a stroll in the Castle District... with Matyas Templom and the "libego" or just a nice coffee somewhere in the neighboring streets. there are binoculars that you can use for some change maybe 50-100HUF

Must see. A beautiful building with a fantastic view over the Danube. The mosaic roof tiles are a pure work of art. This has to be on your 'to see' list no matter which side of the Danube you are staying.
Another brilliant view.. Excellent place for photos through the arches. A bit touristy, but well worth the visit. Have repeated the stop in all four visits I made to this city.

The Spectacular View. Likes: Culture, history, character, and breathtaking. The sun was finally out and it make the view of the city even more spectacular.
Dislikes: None
Beautiful. I liked it very much. It's the view of the Danube and Pest that you love exactly. Very nice. Near the palace
Fantasy land. This backdrop for the St. Mathys church may not be that old, but it is very pretty and gives great views out on the city. Definitely worth visiting.

Looks foreign aside the other Castle Hill sights. Beautiful as it may be (and it is), this sight felt to me like it didn't "belong". Side by side along the other, old buildings and sights it just looked foreign. But beautiful views nonetheless.

Don't Miss This! A MUST in Budapest!!. We almost left Castle Hill without coming here and oh man are we glad we didn't miss it! It was such a highlight of our day. The views at night are absolutely breathtaking. It feels like you are in a fairy tale in this while entire area! The church, he town...amazing!!

Magnificent views. The views from Fisherman's Bastion are really good and worth the visit, but the towers themself also look like they are from a fairy tale.
We went both in the day and at night and both views were great.
beautiful place. its a very beautiful place to visit with fantastic views of the city. Its quite a climb up the stone stairs but well worth it
Fairytale magic. Visit this place in the winter and I promise you wonderful photos. The touets are reminisant of a fairytale castle. Visit the coffee shop for wonderful views and fab hot choc !
brilliant view from top. We went up here as part of the hop on hop off bus route it is an easy way to access it. The view was amazing. A must see.

Imposing buildings and perfect view over Pesta. Very nice renovated it's worth to be visited, take a walk on the small pads on the wall and look from above to Pesta, the Danube and bridges, the Parliament.

As romantic as it should be. We visited in the fog and it made it more beatuiful and fairytale like, must visit any time of year, along with the wonderful sights especially at night when it is lit up.

A sense of history. History comes alive as you are carried you back to the days when the fishermen were responsible for the first line of defence of the city. Magnificent panoramic views of the river and the monumental buildings on the Pest side of Budapest.
must visit. it was a rainy cold day but the views from the bastion are awesome.It must be marvelous either aon a beautiful day or at night.

Great view of the city and danube. Just sitting there and watching the beautiul sites below was lovely. As it was winter time, having hot chocolate while enjoying the gorgeous sites was simply marvelous

Fabulous photo opportunity. But do be careful if you visit when it's cold and icy as the steps are lethal and the snow turned to ice when we were there so very careful stepping was required. We managed to traverse the bastion safely though and spent quite a while hust looking at the views

Amazing. Visit this at twilight if you can. They light up the buildings with a soft glow and it becomes a fairyland. The view from the Bastion is beautiful and if you can watch the city below turn on its lights, you will be impressed. Great place for photos
Fantastic View. Wonderful view from the Bastion and it is extremely photogenic on its own. Great place to get a wonderful view of Budapest. It can get very cold in the winter.
Must see. The view from here is brilliant, you are looking at the Pest side of Budapest and you can see the Chain Bridge, the Parliament and many other sites.

Fairytale-like. My favorite photo from a recent visit to Budapest is the Fisherman's Bastion; looks a lot like how Disney would have done it. Fantastic view over the Danube looking over the Pest-side of Budapest.

Beautiful, not as old as expected. Fantastic piece of architecture, just not as old as you might expect. It was build at the end of the 19th- beginning 20th century, with neo-romanesque architecture in mind. It's placed near the Matthias church, which gives it the perfect entourage. There is a restaurant and a bar within the towers of the bastion and in the summer you can sit at the terrace of the bastion. Several stories are told about the name of the bastion...One of them is that in older times fishermen used to guard this part of the castle hill. The views are amazing and the building itself is best seen at night, descent from the stairs of the bastion and look up for some amazing pictures as well!
Great view. Excellent view of the river and the east side of the town. The whole trip in the old town was great. Also has great places nearby to eat
Spectacular views. Wonderful place to take pics of the city (I just hope it's not foggy as it was when we were there). Allow plenty of time to just look around.

Fantastic views. Excellent views over the Danube and the opposite Pest side of the river. The view of Parliament is unrivalled. Visit at night and first thing in the morning for that perfect atmospheric shot.

Worth going there! Looks like from a fairy tale!. Amazing place to visit, especially when there is a sunny day! Amazing viewson the Budapest, perfect for a long walk! There is a great cafeteria just next to it, so you can have a warm chocolate after walk, just like i did! A must in Budapest with all castle area.
Great Views. Absolutely fantastic views of Pest and the banks of the Danube. Take in the sites of the Parliament building, and St Stephens Bascillica.

Disneys castle. Who knew?. Disney castle. Who knew? wonderful amazing views over to pest. The whole castle area is a great place to spend a few hours wandering around, having a coffee of beer and just absorbing the atmoshere
Amazing!!. You see this in pictures, but the reality is so much more awesome. Definitely a sight to visit!! Get ready with that camera, also view across Danube worth a few clicks.

Straight out of a Disney Movie. My friends and I accidentally stumbled upon this beautiful place while exploring Castle Hill. We got some spiced wine and sat on the terrace, even though it was the middle of February. It was truly one of the best views i have ever experience in my entire life. Highly recommend.

Must See Attraction. One of my colleagues recommended visiting this site. It was part of my sightseeing bus tour and it is a must see. It is a beautiful structure with a gorgeous view of the Pest side of the city and the Parliament.
Bastion. This was like looking at a castle from the world of Disney. Very pretty and so much history. The views were spectacular although when we went, it was a misty day.

Strange Name. The fishermans bastion is hundreads of feet above the Danube! We never learnt why it had been so named or what purpose if any it served. However the views where truely spectacular of the Pest side of Budapest and along the Danube. I must see tourist attraction.
Fantasic architecture. We did a City hop on hop off tour bus, and just had to get off at this stop and explore. It is beautiful.

Tower View. The interesting thing about the fisherman's bastion is the view you get of the City from that angle. The Danube, parliament, and many other buildings can be seen from the bastion. Make your way into Matthias church when you're done taking in the spectacular view and taking pictures. Important advice, take your time and walk around as much as you can. You might think there's really no difference but trust me, there is. Take it all in before you go in. By the way, take a snack.
Excellent photo opportunities. Great views of the Parliament (Orszaghaz) building, Danube river and views over the city.Mathias Church is also in the same location and is a beautiful building.

fantastic view. The view from this piont is wonderful and although heaving with tourists there is still room to take some spectacular views of this large city of two halves. Buda and Pest.are both seen from this point.

Lovely Monument - Must Visit. Lovely monument worth visiting. The view of the Parliament from here is great. There are some good restaurants also in this area. Must visit place during your visit to Budapest.
Great views. If your wanting some great river and views over Budapest then this is the place to visit. Mathias Church is also in the same location and is a beautiful building.
Beautiful views of the Danube and Pest. Beautiful architecture, lovely photo opportunities, and magnificient views of the Danube by day and night from this spot on Castle Hill.

Stunning views of Budapest. Very unique building with amazing viewing platforms across budapest with the River Danube and chain bridge. Worth a visit for the stunning views and photo opportunities.Do not get tricked into the 3 cups and a ball scam - we saw a women playing and 5 minutes later she was following the con man shouting and swearing at him saying he had conned her out of her money!

Nice place to visit on the hill Buda. Its really close to the castle on the Buda side. Take a guided tour than you will find out all interesting stories behind why the "Fisherman´s Bestion" was build, one thing i can say, its not for the fisherman...

Interesting history, superb views. Worth the walk up, or you can "hop off" the tour bus! Lovely area, clean buildings, amazing views across the Danube to the Parliament Buildings and Peste. Nice bars and restaurants in the area.

amazing views of Danube and Pest side of Budapest. great views, very well maintained buildings - only downside was the overpriced coffee house at the top of the bastion, but you can still access its terrace for more photos of the beautiful city below.
funny building and nice view. it is quite nice to walk on the wall and wander around. The architecture is quite interesting and amusing. Also very nice view of the city to take pictures.

Breathtaking views of the Danube and City. Fantastic architecture surrounding you, views that are breathtaking of the City and the Parliament, and the Danube and the 2 main bridges, and of the island. Free entry, several towers, amazing photo shooting opportunities, fabulous.

Great at night. We walked along the wall and I was amazed at how Disney, fairy tale like it looked and doing it at night was even better with the lights on, plus you can get some great photo's of Pest from there to

Beautiful monument,amazing view. Built in the late 19th century in neo Gothic and neo Romanesque style sibolizes the fishermen fight in defence of Castle Hill. It has 7 turretts that represent the 7 Magyar tribes that have settlled in the area.The views of the Danube abd Pest are amazing,especially the bridges ,the Gresham Place ( the FourSeasons Hotel ) and of course the stunning ParliamentThere are a coffee shop and a restaurant to relax and enjoy the view.My opinion: THE BEST OF BUDAPEST

Great views. Great views over the city and had a nice cappuccino in the cafe within the tower. Good that it was free to go around as well. Was quite busy even on a grey Thursday morning so very popular on clearer days I imagine.
Make sure to visit in the late afternoon. The light behind you in the west is fabulous for pictures overlooking the Danube River, Parliament, and all Pest.
A must-see. So beautiful, walking round the bastion is truly magnificent, and the views are to die for, would recommend this highly.

Must must go spot. Its too beautiful there! Every conrner is recommended to shoot though a bit crowded dt day time, its worth to go again in the evening and at night. A golden like fairy tales construction at night with violine artist playing romance music sometimes. I really want to go there again and again. I love that place ; )
Disney in Hungary. It is true what the guide books say about this looking like a scene from a Disney setting. The architecture was incredible and the views over the city breathtaking.
Well worth a visit. Very interesting, well worth visiting, fabulous views over Pest, you can easiy walk between the Fishermans Bastion & Buda Palace.
A beautiful evening.. Elegant setting, brilliant view of the city, wonderful Hungarian food, charming waiters - and a gypsy violinist - who could ask for more? food

Breath taking!. When you first catch sight of it at night, it is incredible. They are realy good with the lighting on the buildings. Approach it from the river side and go directly to it using the stairs, magnificant view. I could not stop taking pictures. Then, when you finaly make it to the top, you find awesome vies of the city and Parliament house. Brilliant experience.
Fairytale sense!. Fisherman's bastion is like a fairytale tower! It offers an incredible view of Pest and is ideal to take some beautiful photos. I loved its architecture!

Fisherman'Rest. A splendid pice of architecture set against the hill side. There are panoramic views acroos the Danube. Easily seen are the bridges, the parliament building and the basilica.
The Bastion features domes and columns but it is also a lovely place to stroll and to enjoy the different views and perspectives.
Amazing!. What a fantastic View over the Danube towards the Parliment to the left, with the chain Bridge to the right. Cobble streets, churches and museums.

Lovely view of the city. There is nothing like this, anywhere. It is almost Gaudi-like in scope and execution, although much more symmetrical. Go early or late to avoid daytime crowds. There is a wine restaurant on the top -- somewhat pricey, but a great way to sit and enjoy the view of the city of Pest, the lovely bridges, and the Danube.
beautiful!. it was a long walk and a lot off stairs but sooo worth it! it was like a fairytale!The views were amazing from the top. it was my favourite thing of my trip!
Beautiful. Beautiful and quiet, recently renovated and looks like a fairy tale castle. Good for walking, lots of greenery. One of really beautiful places in Europe.

Beautiful architecture. The Fisherman's Bastion is close to San Mattias and features beautiful views and really neat architecture. We stopped at a small terrace bar for a delicious mulled wine and some of the most gorgeous views, and the sun came out! (on what was an otherwise pretty gray weekend) Definitely worth the trip to the top of the hill to see.

Spectacular View Of City. This was our second time up at Fisherman's Bastion but this time we did it night. We didnt have to pay a entrance fee either! This terrace has several walking paths and stairs. You can see everything from the east side of Pest over to Gellert Hill, not to mention the Danube river. The city lights are beautiful. There is also a magnificent bronze statue of St. Stephen I of Hungry. bring your camera!
Best views of the city. The best place to come and take in this beautiful city. Take the funicular railway up and stroll across to the bastian. Don't forget your camera!
Great view. Been there several times. It's a must see. You can take great photos of Pest from there. Like it allot.
Amazing views of the city. Highly recommend walking around the Castle Hill and stopping at the Fisherman's Bastion to see the amazing views of Pest.
wow incredible place especially at night. wowzers this place is stunning! so much history and such a lovely place, also the most photgraphed place next to trevi fountain!!
Beautiful view. The best view of the parliment building. Really pretty at night. The paths below are nice to stroll along.
Great place for photographers. Wonderful view, great place for taking pictures, amazing place you have to visit it! Near the Buda castle and Chain bridge.
Fabulous views. This is a cool place to hang out, appreciate stunning views, enjoy listening to some classic music and indulge in some tasty food and delicious wine.
photographers' dream. Fantastic views of the Danube, Parliament building, St. Stephen's Basilica, in fact a good overview of the Pest side of this beauriful city
A beautiful view of the city. We were there after 8 pm, and it was just wondeful! The view, the Bastation, it was amazing. I strongly recommend to go there just at night!

Interesting towers and beautiful views!. Located in Buda, the Fisherman’s Bastion is made up of seven towers - each one symbolizing one of the seven Magyar tribes that came to Hungary in 896.
We visited in September and there was an entrance fee for the site.
I loved the architecture and the amazing views over Danube and Pest.
Wonderful views.. The views were amazing. Great place to take photos. I would have liked to come back at night to see the city lit up.

Fun to walk on and around. This is a nice monument you can walk around and up on. It's rather large and have several towers and passages to discover (plus its free) and you get great views over the river to the Parliament and Chain Bridge. It has two restaurants/cafes that you can enjoy (we didn't eat here because they were overpriced).
Must to visit. Vey beautiful place, just take a cople of hot wine and enjoy of view to Budapest. No payment for entry to the site

Fantastic views. This Disney-esque architecture is a lovely addition to the Mattias Church area and offers lovely views of the Pest side of the city, particularly of the Danube and Parliament. The stark contrast between the white of the stone and the blue sky creates some lovely pictures and if you are lucky enough to capture the golden hour of sunset you have some pictures to be proud of. Definitely recommend - plus it is free, always a bonus!

For first dates, or any date!. Never underestimate the afrodisiac power of the illuminated Danube. Especially at sunset. You will have even some live music around with violins. You can't miss with this one. An ill-fated hopeless guy can score a girl in this place anytime!

First visit. The architecture is stunning and well worth a visit. History is that the fisherman defended this part of the wall when the turks invaded and there are lovely views across the city and the river

Fabulous Experience for a Great Meal. Wonderful service, roaming musicians, lovely meal and beautiful setting in the restaurant and the view! A must for Budapest and if you have a chance to enjoy the food all the better for a fantastic Hungarian experience!

Must view it from both sides. Go early to avoid the crowds. The mist lifting from the Danube is also a nice scene from the Bastion. Do not eat at any of the OVER Priced restaurants here. Not worth it. It is a great point to view the Pest side of the river.

great for taking picture. good panoramic view of The Peszt side... architecture is beautiful. On a nice weather you can jiust sunbathing there . Can just sit there and enjoy the lovely view and cool breeze

Mandatory to visit in Buda Side. I think is the place were you get the best view of Danube and Pest, and it's one of the best places to take very nice photos. You should go during the day and at night, to got 2 very different perspectives of the city.
Excellent views. We enjoyed fantastic views of the Pest and Buda. Great place to be on a sunny day. Not to be missed.

From the Fairy Tales. Like the topping on a wedding cake, the Bastion was breathtaking. In addition to the brilliant view of the city, the mosaic tiling and the spire astounded us. The place to visit and after sundown

lovely view. wonderful view from the fishermans bastion and wonderful architecture - what I didnt like about budapest was travelling one time on the metro totally unaware that you have to stamp your metro ticket before getting on train in an orange box (nowhere does it tell you) - travelling just 4 stops a ticket inspector asking to see tickets and being fined on the spot 8000HUF each me, husband and 12 year old son!! WHAT KIND OF PEOPLE FINE A 12 YEAR OLD - cost us approx £75 for a 2 minuite mistake - apart from that the fishemans bastion was lovely

Maybe I missed something?. We paid, went up the stairs and had a nice view of the river and city; but it's the same view you can get for free at the cafe next door. I'm not sure why this is even a place to visit!

Beautiful. Wonderful views from the top walkway. It is a great place for taking photos of the surrounding area and Matthias Church nearby. If you want to pay for a ticket take this rampart overlooking the Pest side of Budapest. If you don't want to pay, just walk a bit along the rampart and you will see the same views for free. Highly recommended a visit.

Beautiful. This has great views. We went at different times, and I would recommend (if you can) going when it's evening twilight when no tours or cruises are also there. It's just a stunning place and architecture and views all rolled into one.
glorious. Be sure to enjoy a kave on the terrace of this turkish treasure. Lots of great photos to be taken from this look out point.
beautiful. beautiful place with stunning views. Cafe on the rooftop worth a visit just for the views. Recommend mulled wine on a chilly day.

Great views over Budapest and the Danube. This is on the Buda side of the river. Go in the evening as dusk falls and you will see across the Danube to Pest as lights on Liberty Bridge, Chain Bridge and Parliament Building come on - best observed with a glass of mulled wine in hand which can be bought here!

Visit October 2012. A fairy tale part of the walled castle area of Buda, towers with pointed roofs and battlements providing an excellent view over Pest. Take the steps down to find the rather disturbing sculpture of Peter Mansfeld, executed in 1956
Beautiful Panaromaic View(s). The Fisherman's or Fishermen's Bastion is well worth the climb! Once on top of the wall you'll be witness to some of the most splendid views of all of Budapest.
The view is beautiful.. We went at night when it was quiet, not touristy, and the view truly beautiful. There was no charge at night. Mustbe the most romantic sight in Budapest.
Part of castle hill.. Not sure why this needs a separate review, cause you will go there if up at the castle site. Take the on-off bus and save lots of walkiing.

Incredible! What a place!. We stopped here during our CityRama tour and it was just beautiful! I wish it hadn't been so crowded. But it's just so pretty, everyone wants to be here. It was a cloudy drippy day when we were there and it was so white against the cloudy dull skies. There are incredible views from the heights above the city.
Wow. Beautiful, the whole area was wonderful. Great little shop opposite where you can buy the warm doughnuts from as well.
Fabulous. Really nice area to view the city. The whole area up around the castle is well worth a visit and has a nice atmosphere.

Everywhere you look - a scenic view!. Fisherman's Bastion is probably the most photogenic place in Budapest. On clear weather days, the white stone pops out of the perfect blue sky. At night, the towers look mysterious. There are beautiful views from the bastion across to the Parliament Building and the Danube. We heard live music a few times, coming from a little bar in one of the towers.

Top spot - lovers don´t miss this!. Beautiful view over the city, stunning at night! See the parliament, the biggest in Europe, the Szechenyi-Bridge and more. Coffehouse on premises open in spring, autumn and summer - relax and enjoy the view!

Spectacular views. We went to Fisherman's Bastion after we had visited the Castle. It is well worth a trip as the views of the Hungarian Parliament building are amazing. It is one of the most stunning buildings i've ever seen
Beautiful. Beautiful and super views..well worth a visit. The journey up is lovely and en route lots of little bars/cafes so you can have a lovely leisurely hour or two.

Great views and photo ops!. Some of the Bastion is restaurant so it was difficult to know what was public access and what was not. Fabulous view of the parliament building gleaming white across the Danube.
Beautiful. What a beautiful and great site to visit, awesome views from here of the river as well as parts of the city.

Beautiful Building. We went there by bike and parked in front of the Bastion. In combination with the Matthiaschurch it was a beautiful scene. A pity the Hilton Hotel ruined that.We drank a cup of coffee on the rof terrace and had to pay in euro's because a card was not excepted. Very expensive!

Amazing Views. Great view over the Danube with all the bridges and over to the Pest side of the city. Visit the marzipan centre under the Hilton Hotel next to the Bastion. Marzipan structures have to be seen to be believed.

Good look-out point. The Fishermen's Bastion is nothing special in itself but there are great views and some good photo opportunities. It's right by the Matthias Church, which itself is well worth a visit.

Great view of the city and the bridges of Budapest. Place is reachable in less than an hour, is located in Buda, near Buda Royal Palace. Tickets can be bought at kiosk opposite the Cathedral of St.. Mathias. According beautiful weather, you can photograph a beautiful city and the bridges over the Danube, enjoying their coffee at a restaurant in bsklopu Bastion, or simply enjoy the beauty of the views as you wind ruffling your hair from the Danube.

Visit at night time for spectacular views!. Not to be missed! It's a great place to take photos at night after a meal on the Buda side of the city. Take the bus number 16 from Pest side so you don't have to trek up the hill in the dark!

Great View. Fun to stroll along with views of Pest on the other bank. Especially pretty at night with the lights, no matter if you were on the Bastion looking over Pest or on the Pest side looking at the Bastion all lite up at night.
Stunning architecture. If viewed from the river you can appreciate the complexity of the building. Superb to wander around all the intricate areas and then view the Danube from its vantage point.
Breathtaking View. You find fisherman's bastion in the castle district. Despite of its own beauties the view from the is just spectacular. Perfect to take some memorable pictures from there

Excellent place to sit back and relax. it gives wonderful view of Danube river and all the historical places across the river. it was peaceful surrounding over there with a lady playing violin. you can sit back and relax yourself with the awesome views and relaxing wind.

The view is pretty common. I know everyone mentions that the view is amazing but when you look at what you paid to get access to, it is a little dissapointing. I may also be very biased because we went when the weather was horrible. It just seemed that you could get most of the same views from walking further down and entering the Bar/coffee place and taking pictures there. I will say that it did allow me a different angle on the Matthias church and another statue around there. I would obviously suggest visiting the area because it is quote pretty and even take pictures of the Fisherman's Bastion but at the end of the trip my dad and I agreed that this was probably the one place that wasn't really worth the cost of entry. I highly suggest going into the Matthias church however and that will be in another review.

we had dinner there!. me and my Fiance had dinner in there it was very romantic but just it's atmosphere! the view was absolutely great, they had good wine menue and a live violinist gave a magnificent atmosphere there. BUT the Garçon was not polite, didnt have enough decency to ask if he should take away the plates or not, my fiance as usual finished his meal before me and the waiter take his plate so it was like im eating alone, and when our main course arrived he didnt ask me if im done or not, he just take away my starter!!i was there again with my sister and our girlfriends but the waiters did the same, the staff are not friendly, not fluent in english and dont know how they have to service. other than an absolutely beautiful place, the food quality is so average to compare of the price. the staff are rude and i wouldnt suggest it to my parents or people who doesn't have patience for rudeness and bad service, if you wanna enjoy the atmosphere and a glass of wine, there is the place to go, but to have a quality dinner!! i don't recommend it at all!!

Watch out for crowds - go early. This is a gorgeous structure however is over run by tour bus people from about 10.30 am which makes getting a good photo difficult. Lovely views from behind the church back across the river.

Pleasant Surprise. When I read about this area in Rick Steves' guidebook, I did not look forward to visiting it. However, the views were spectacular, the Mathias church was inspiring and I was glad I went.

Top Choise. View, food, service, interior all excelent. Book in advance. If the wther allows sit outside at the bastion with the Danube far under and all of Budapest in view. A must for a visit to Budapest.

Like a Fairy. One of my favourite sightseeing!
It is like you are in a fairytail! All the towers and the colours are really really nice! Worth going there and spent some hours watching the danube!
Fantastic view. Early in the morning, but still a lot of tourists. The view is fantastic. A lot of small cafes and restaurants if you walk away from the church, not only the expensive ones
architecture!. Architecture is everything here. Take some time to wander around and wonder at this place. Contrast it with the big block Soviet Era building that are all utilitarian.

Fairy tale with a view. It reminds you of a Disney castle but with much better views..A visit is a must just for the views of the river and parliament. The bastion itself is lovely to look at, and the views just make it better.One of the must do items when visiting Budapest..
Stunning Views. This is one not to be missed. The views are fantastic and there is a great atmosphere about the place. There are also numerous dining opportunities.
Disney in Hungary. Sure, it's scenic. It's also crawling with tour groups admiring the view from this purely decorative structure with no historical significance.
Nice place to visit. Nice place to visit with a spectaculair view over Budapest. Nice old building and a nice area of Buda

The View!!. The trek up to this site is worth the view. The view during the day is fine, but I suggest going up after the sun has set. The city is washed in a golden light that makes the Danube glisten and shine.

Cultural interlude. Fabulous setting. Well preserved and maintained went up in the funicular and returned by bus. Great views. We liked the historic atmosphere. We Had lunch in one of the small restaurants of which there were many.

Go, but don't pay. Next to Matthias Church.. I don't see any point in paying extra to go up literally one level higher than everybody else. For the view of the city, one story makes little difference, and certainly not enough of a difference to justify 600HUF. You can see plenty or free from the ground. Not only that, you get a wider range of views from the ground. Going up the bastion is only about 50 meters from one end to the other. Save your money and just be patient to get your beautiful view.
Save money go at night. A virtual lover's lane with great night time views of the city. No cost after the ticket windows close. Used by the locals as a nice place for a date.

Great Scenic Views. Wonderful scenic views from the top walkway. We had an excellent tour guide who gave us many historical facts. Great place for taking photos of the surrounding area and Matthias Church nearby.

Tourist Trap. If you want to pay for a ticket - have at this rampart overlooking the Pest side of Budapest. If you don't want to pay, just walk a bit along the rampart and you will see the same views for free. The Fisherman's Bastion is not much at all but it is right behind Mattias Church and that's a reason to be near it.

Beautiful.. Up in the caste area, this Bastion is like something from Disney. It's beauitful, as is the church behind it. Unfortunately, some idiot allowed the Hilton hotel to build in the middle of this area and it is an ugly 70's, mirrored monstrosity which is such a shame. One of the Bastion turits has a lovely wee bar which has the most stunning views of Pest across the danube...a beautiful place for a drink.
great from any angle. this 19th century folly is superb from any angle and affords wonderful views of the city and river...must pay entrance!

One of the main attractions. The area around fishermans bastion is the most popular for tourists in Budapest. And it earns it . Beautiful few across the Danube to the Parliament and the whole historic City Center .We went there by Hop on Hop of tours - highly to be recomended (2 bus lines and a boatline as well for two days at a reasonable price) a lot of regretable touristic restaurants but we found a very small pub in Uri utca. The only serve debrecine sausage and beer but. Try it its special

Obscure history. The view from here was fantastic but due to the guide we could not get the full history of the Fisherman's Bastion. Also the crowd that day prevented us from having a really good look.

Great Spot for a Coffee. Lovely views, wonderful shade with a cooling breeze in the Summer and great coffee.
My wife and I enjoyed a break from the day's busy itinerary at Halászbástya Restaurant where we enjoyed both the coffee and the views.
Service is good and the tourist premium is not huge!

More than I expected. Whenever I have seen pictures in the past I invisioned just a couple of towers so I didn't expect much. When we got there I was amazed at how large and beautiful the complex is. The views from the Bastion down on the city and the river are just spectacular. We hit a perfect day - few tourists, delightful temperature, clear skies, and almost limitless visibility. Truly a must see!
Beautiful!. Straight out of a fairytale, you have to see this; it's a great place for walking around and admiring the views of the city.
Fine views of Pest and the Danube. It was shocking that you now have to pay ...for every sight on the Buda Hill...the Church, the Bastion.The crowds in September/ October are LARGE i
Historic Fisherman's Bastion. Loved the historic buildings & beautiful setting. Allow several hours to roam about & explore. An excellent place to take pictures of the Pest side of the city.

Great View. Great view from the castle on the Danube, the Parliament and also the Buda castle that is very close.located in buda side of the danube behind st Mattias church also a very nice place to see around.

Fairytale by night. It's a must see if you go to the Buda side of the river. We paid the entrance (the right part of the 'Halaszbastya') but actually it's almost the same view you get on the left side (the side with the cafeteria). It's an beautiful view on the Danube and by night it's like a little fairytale, because the architecture seems to be inspired by the Cinderella story. Taking a picture of the parliament from up there is just like the ones on the post cards.

Go in terming or at night not during the day. Too many tourists. I cannot recommend the Bastion enough. The views are spectacular and the architecture amazing but it has to be seen at the right time. I was in Budapest for 8 days so visited the Castle and the surrounding area first thing in the morning, midday and at night. In there morning there are very few tourists and the light at that time really compliments the building. At night it is all wonderfully lit and I saw perhaps 5 other people. But during the day it is just another tourist nightmare. Hundreds visiting which really takes something away from the place
Pleasant view of the city. You get a good view of Pest and the Danube. Amazing historical city at your feet. The river is so peaceful.

stunning. I know this isn't as old as I original thought, but it's so beautiful. The views are lovely across the river. The view of the Parliament is excellent. I didn't pay to go up the viewing platform as there's no need as the views were still brill from the other areas. Well worth a visit.
Great view. great view of the Danube banks. Polished site, very nice architecture.It is one of the most special "castle like" I've been to.

Nice place, great view. The Fisherman's Bastion is situated on a hill with great view over Budapest. Many people go there by bus or so, but we decided to walk up there. It was a nice walk, maybe 30 minutes or so from the city center. Lots of tourists there and you have to pay a small fee to go up in the Fisherman's Bastion where the best view is. But it is totally worth it. The view is great and you can see the rive Danube and Budapest very well.
So Hungarian. Take time to walk through the surrounding area, have a drink at one of the street level bars and look back over Budapest. Makre time to live the moment
Must-see!. Magnificent, fairy-tale-like views both during the day as well as at night. If there is one thing to see in Budapest it should be old town with the Bastion.
a special place. very nice environment, especially around sunset time. The view over the Danube and the parliament is superb.

Fairytale Castle! :). This reminded me of a Fairytale Castle. Located on Castle Hill in Buda it has great views over the city especially of the Pest side. If you're interested in architecture or just great views then you can't go wrong with this. It's so pretty and very close to Matthias Church, which is also stunning. Personally for me I enjoyed getting up the hill via the funicular... just for the novelty of it. I would definitely recommend a walk round this area in general.
Like stepping into a fantasy. Very Disney-like. I just couldn't get enough of it. Don't miss seeing it from below. It looks different from that angle and just as pretty.

Beautiful monument + view. The bastion is in great conditions, greatly restored. The view from the top is amazing. There is a small entrance fee for one of the sides, which will give you a "couple-of-meters-higher" view, but nothing more. Still, the contribution fee is great for restauration work :)

Great view . Located on the buda side of the river, this structure is a small hike up the hill just off the chain bridge. You can also take the funicular (kind of like a cable car) up the hill, but it is difficult to take pics fm the car and also too short a ride to do so. I would suggest walking up, because the ride is not worth the wait or the price. I think it costs like $4 or $5 USD for a 30 second ride.Once you get to the top, there are vendors selling Hungarian souvenirs before you get to fishermans bastion. From the top you get great views of the city. I took most of my budapest photos from this vantage point. There are also spots where you can sit and have a drink overlooking the city. I would suggest going on a weekday, because it was so crowded with tourist on the weekend, that it was difficult to jockey for a spot to take pics.I do agree with one other reviewer who mentioned walt Disney must have gotten his inspiration from this structure. I was expecting Mickey mouse to pop up somewhere!
Great view of the city. Take the special train up the hill then head right for an amazing view of the city. This is right next to Matthias Church so it's easy to find.

Welcome to Disney World Budapest!. Views are good but the construction would not go amiss in Disney World. It looked and felt like a "folly". If you are going to Castle Hill you will see this but as a stand alone attraction its average at best.

Better at night. If you've seen and liked this place during daytime, you should not miss it at night. You can see the spectacular view of the Parliament and the Chain bridge. Very enchanting. But it's a little bit hard to do a great shot. Then if you are staying on the Pest side, all you have to do is walk and enjoy the lights of the chain bridge.
Nice architecture . Nice architecture and lovely site. You have a nice view of the Matthias' church and Pest. Nice by day and night.
Don't miss this one.. The best view of the city. Simply amazing. You'll need a taxi to get there. Don't go for the shopping, but bring your camera!
Amazing view!. Amazing view of the city, it is worth to visit this place. Panoramic views of Pest, Margarita Island, Parliament.
Worth a quick look only. The site itself isn't very interesting or unique. The views of Pest are what's worth seeing. There is a small charge to climb the bastion walls.

Wonderful views. This beautifully restored monument is well worth the short walk from the tourist bus stop. It offers magnificent views of the city, the parliament buildings and of course the Danube river. Plenty of souvenir shops, bars and restaurants in the vacinity.

Fairy tale setting. Just loved this area, once agin views are stunning from the vantage points and the turrets? give the place such a fairy tale setting. A few restaurants surround the area and not far from other attractions on Castle Hill. Althoug hop on hop off bus goes by, it's not a difficult walk.

beautiful buildings and history. This was our second visit here, and the builings are breath taking, and the views across the city are amazing. The only down side is the eyesore which is the Hilton Hotel which has also been built at this location, how they got permission to build that there is beyond me.
Excellent view from here. We did a 4 hour walking tour organised by our cruise, which included the Fisherman's Bastion. Excellent views from here over the city and river
Fisherman's Bastion. nice setting and architecture spoilt by hilton hotel built without sympathy adjacent to this historical monument
Another great panoramic view spot. It's 10 min walk from Buda Castle and the walk is easy with many shops and stalls in between. This is another highlight of Budapest and a must see attraction site!
Great views and athmosphere. Very pleasant location to admire the view of the river and Pest. Quite busy with trigger happy tourists.
"A must see". Visited on a lovely warm sunny day, beautifull area to walk around at leisure, have lunch & a drink overlooking the danube.

The place to go to see the Danube and take in the sights. So much fun there! We love the guys with the falcons by the statue, and the violin players in the bastion, and all of the people milling about having a great time. A fun place to explore. The views are very picturesque, makes for great photos to upload to Facebook to make your friends jealous!

beautiful. this is a fantastic place to see we went in daytime and thought it beautiful but it was nothing to when we returned at night ,it was brilliant ,the views of budapest all lite up would take your breath away it is a must do when in budapest
Excellent views. we travelled up to the Bastion when it was light, and left when it was dark! Incredible views. Very romantic, and steeped in history
This place is amazing!. Magnificent stonework and the view from it over Pest are amazing.. Statues and fiew were beautiful...
Nice View. The view was very good, good location for sightseeing. You can see this with the Buda Castle and the church on the same day since there are located one by one.

Great view but don't waste your money buying the ticket. As others have said, the views over the Pest side of Budapest, including Parliament, are fantastic. However, when we bought our ticket for St Matyas/Matthias church we made the mistake of also buying their ticket for the Fisherman's Bastion. We then found out that there was absolutely no need for it to see and enjoy the view. This ticket only gives access to a very small part of the Bastion and the view from the remaining public part is fantastic.

It's a must. Visually pleasing and great views from here. You don't need to go to the top to get your photos - so save yourself the entrance fee.
There are 7 towers to photograph from so hopefully you can get some shots without hordes of people in the way.
Worth paying the small fee to go up. Nice to take in the view with quieter surroundings. Its only a small fee to go up, so it is worth it on the whole. Time to get a good few snaps.
Great view. Awesome spot to view the panorama of the city and snap a few photos. Nice area for walking about and seeing several great buildings in a short distance

Amazing. I love this area, it is so clean. It is so beautiful. It is a must on the sites in Budapest. They are the best views. There is a lovely restaurant on the walls. you can just have coffee or a wine.

Beautiful place. One of the must-sees in Budapest, located at the Buda Hill, next to the Matthias Church. It looks older than it acually is, but who cares?! It is beautiful, you may walk around taking picures and viewing Danube. If you buy the combined ticket you can also visit the church and then walk further through the old streets of Buda.
Loved the view!!. It is an amazing view to see the Buda hills and the Pest plains along the Danube.....Lovely photo spot too..
Amazing views across the river. A photo opportunity of both the bastion and across the river to Pest. It is crowded with tourists but worth your patience.

One of the musts when visiting Budapest. If you want to get the best photographs of parliament on the Pest side then go to the Fisherman's Bastion on the Buda side. The Bastion itself is wonderful and you should try and get a tour of Matyas's Church although these are only at certain times.

Fantastic Views of the City. Always very busy, yet offers beautiful views over the city. There's a restaurant beneath, where you can enjoy the view while having a meal.
Top tip: If you're in Budapest during the winter (e.g. for the Christmas markets), head up here, as it's free. During the summer it costs 500 forint (around 2 euro).
Beautiful view!. My husband and I shared a glass of wine from the top of the Fisherman's Bastion as we admired the view of the Danube and Budapest. In our book, it's a must see in Budapest!
fantastic views. Well worth seeing the bastion when you are up at castle hill. You. Dont need to pay extra to see the views
Don't miss hawk. Great views - on weekends there are a couple of men dressed as knights with beautiful hawks. They give you a leather arm cover and the hawk poses there for a photo opo
Simply Beautiful. We watched the restoration of this area over the past 15 years. It is magnificent. The views from here and photo oppertunites are great.
Nice view. A cute place defenitely worth spending a couple of hours walking around and having a glass of vine in the local restaurant with a nice view on the Parlament and Danube river

Magic; pure magic.. Both by day and also by night the bastion here - only built just over a century ago - is a superlative vantage point to view the City and the river. The chain bridge is below, and the Parliament is just across the river also, with the magnificent church of St Matthias adjacent (as was our hotel). Look out for certain times when you don't have to pay to go on the walls higher up. This must be a favourite for lovers to have their memories photographed. Completely lit up at night, there is definitely something magical in the air when you promenade with your loved one during the balmy evening............
Lovely Views when you find it!. A lovely open air restaurant, with a magnificent view of the city and the Danube! Very nice food, and the band came over to serenade us whilst eating..
NIce view of the city, Parliament and the Chain Bridge. Lots and lots of people crowing around, made site seeing a problem. Go late in day is best, Boat people are gone by then.
amazing archtecture. The view is most likely the best in Buda. It was crowded when we were there. Take your time to wonder around.
Breathtaking Views. You must come here for the beautiful views. We walked here from the Pest side and that took us a bit, especially up the hill. In the end, it was worth it!

Excellent view of Budapest. One of the most famous landmark in Budapest. From there, you can have an excellent view of Pest side, especially the Chain Bridge and St. Stephen's cathedral. Recommend to have a beer in one of the towers in the far end. The view of the city and river is spectacular

Don't pay!. There's a small part of the bastion you visit for 600HUF, but then you realise the rest of it you can visit free anyway! - save your pennies the bit by the restuarant/bar is better anyway.

Absolutely beautiful. We actually made the walk up to Fisherman's Bastion from the tram station on the Danube side (can't recall which one). It was a long, hard walk but we like walking so we thoroughly enjoyed it. Would likely recommend taking the bus up the hill for those who aren't as stubborn as us. Some of the best views of the city. Stop in at the cafe to listen to live music and sip a Hungarian wine.

Disneyesque architecture. Very unusual but on a sunny day the contrast of the white limestone buildings withe blue sky is awesome.. As for Castle hill use the No.6 Bus. We also eat up here but you tend to pay a premium for the view - which is well worth it on a fine day.

Gets busy here. Beautiful location and excellent photo opportunities if you click quickly and do not mind lots of other people being in it. No idea why the Hilton was allowed to build such an ugly building next to this. Can have coffee here overlooking pest.

No better view than for here!!!. Amazing, picturesque views and a must see when you go to the Castle Distict. My kids got to run around, I got some amazing photos, and it made for an awesome afternoon. Don't miss this site!
Great photos. You need to come here while in Budapest to get some really great photos! The view of both sides of Budapest is phenominal! There are a lot of tourist, but it is worth it!

Best view. You definitely need to go here and go to the top of the castle. It has the best view of the parliament, the river and all of Hungary. There is one side that you have to pay to go to the top (the right) but you do not have to pay if you go up on the left side. Both sides have awesome views.
Great Views. You get great views here of both Buda and Pest. Often busy with tourists but worth the trip for the photo opportunities. Amust to visit.
Budapest. Excellent place to view the city, the history behind this locatios is just awesome, and august is one of the best month to visit
Beautiful view. I love everything about this location. The view is fantastic, and the Matthias Church is also beautiful right next to it. definitely worthwile to go there. Bring your camera!
A great sight!. This place strucks the eye for its architecture and white colour! It oversees the Danube and it's pleasant to walk on it while observing the landscape. Lots of pictures to take here!
wonderful view of city. This is part of Castle Hill ; wander around it and see the city of Budapest below you. You can sit on the many walls that are part of this, and get fantastic photos.
Another great view!. Fisherman's Bastion is an architectural marvel, really worth seeing. But the best thing is the views over to the Pest side of the Danube. This is the best place for photos!

Amazing Views. If you are going to Budapest this is one place to have to visit. Although it is a bit of a climb to the Bastion, once you get there, the nearby church with the colorful roof and the views from the open windows of the Bastion make the pictures you take home worth the climb to the top. If you can not climb to the top there is a tram that carries you up to the Buda palace nearby.
Very pretty. Situated in the Castle District. The turrets are like a fairytale castle, worth the visit! The views across the Danube are also worth the climb.

Excellent spot. Entrance is not free, but not expensive. You have splendid views of the Danube, Chain Bridge and the best spor for the Parliament. It may be good idea to go at night. Bring your camera.

Cute disney like little caste. The Fisherman's Bastion is part of the Buda Castle in Budapest and it looks very much like the Disney Castle in the Disney Logo (or rather the Disney Castle looks like the Fisherman's Bastion). It's got great views of the Danube and the Pest side of town (Buda is behind you) and its an excellent spot for photos. Other than that don't expect too much. It's really small for a castle and its mostly the ramparts that you walk on. Still one of the "must see" places in Budapest, I dont regret going.

Stunning location and view!. Well there is not much to say here except that it is simply stunning. The buildings themselves are jaw dropping and then you get to the view over Budapest!!!!!! WOW. Well worth heading up the hills to this location.We paid to get onto the bastion, but there was no need, had we walked 20ft further we could have gone up for free like eveyone else. But as it wasnt very much money at all and the view was stunning and quieter in the paid section, it was worth it.

Deafened By The Click Of Cameras. Amazing views over the Danube to Pest on the opposite bank, including the Parliament building. Standing and looking is all that needs to be done here although there's a chance that someone will ask you take a photo of them with the view in the background. Buda castle area where the Fisherman's Bastian is located, is a short climb up from Adam Clark ter just across the Chain bridge.
Beautiful!. Gorgeous sightseeing in Budapest, this is a must see, especially at night. Wonderful photograph opportunities, bus tour stops here.

Great view. After walking up the hill from Pest into Buda, the views from up here were fantastic. Looking left you have great views of the Parliament Building on the Danube Banks and the Chain Bridge is below, for a great photo of it.

Don't miss it. We first saw Fisherman's Bastion from the Danube and it looked impressive, actually visiting it was even better. The views it gives over Budapest ( actually Pest ) are memorable. Dont bother paying for the additional height as you dont need it. There is a restaurant actually situated on the top of the walls and although we didn't eat there the menu was good and the prices reasonable.If you want to visit the Castle area in Buda but don't fancy using public transport then taxis are very cheap, I would recommend getting your hotel to book one for the trip out and then when your ready to return walking to the Hilton and asking the doorman to call one for you.

Wonderful views. The views from here are wonderful especially of the beautiful Parliament buildings. Taking advice from fellow travelers, we did not pay but instead went a little further on and had wonderful vantage points for our pictures.
Amazing View!!. The Bastion itself was beautiful but add in the view of the parliament building and Pest.. it was definately worth the visit.
Great views of the city. This is a great vantage point to get some stunning views of the Danube and the city. Great place for photos too.
Nice view. One of the must visit places in the castle district. There is a nice looking cafe inside the bastion. You get great views acros the river.

Great Place for Beautiful Views. Fisherman's Bastion is a great place for lovely views of Pest. It consists of numerous turrets you can climb up. Note that there are 2 sides: one side is free (and therefore very crowded), and the other side costs a nominal admission fee (but is virtually empty). I recommend just visiting the free side because it's closer to Parliament, and therefore, has better views than the non-free side. There's also a cafe in the free area where you can buy drinks (rather expensive) and enjoy the view from little tables. Don't miss this great place.
Stunning view...a must to visit. A lovely view from the Fisherman's Bastion and the area is great for a long walk. You can view the whole of Budapest and take lots of photos. Really worth the visit!
A memorable and fascinating place. A memorable visit to Fisherman's Bastion (Halaszbastya). It is a place you must not miss when you visit Budapest. A memorable and fascinating place also.

Panoramic views with a side of fabulous Roma music!!. A magical place to visit. Beautiful views of Pest, historical places and stories to experience. Don't miss the abbey inside the Hilton. Don't miss the labyrinths nearby. The Castle district is awash in history and charm!

Fisherman's Bastion. Incredible view! We also had drinks in the cafe and relaxed while enjoying the scenery. A 4 piece ensemble was playing music which was also very pleasant. They aren't allowed to take tips but offered for sale their CDs. A great area to walk. Close to the cathedral.
Great views, awesome culture. The views of the Parliament here are the best, as well as the river. I particularly loved seeing so many street musicians performing everywhere.

great photo opportunites from here. Lots of turrets and towers and great views of the city. It's one of the main tourist attractions so expect it to be busy. Don't forget the camera for great photo ops.

Beautiful. This place is stunning. What a beautiful building, just so clean and fresh-looking. There were enough tourists to make it busy but not so many you couldn't make your way to the top of the turrets to watch the boats on the Danube and view the stunning scenery.

Make this trek at night for maximum satisfaction. Fisherman's Bastion is beautiful at any time, but to really knock your socks off make the effort to go at night in order to take in the incredible beauty of this city in all its glowing glory. There are many nice restaurants nearby, so make it an evening. You will not be sorry!

Nice place to chillout and enjoy the view from Castle hill. Whether you've climbed castlehill on foot or took the siklo up, the fisherman's bastion is a nice stop to chillout and enjoy the view of budapest and the danube river. The architecture is quite nice, a neo-Gothic/neo-Romanesque style, and its just next to the beautiful Matthias Church. Unfortunately they have commercialized most of the terrace, except if you go on the extreme left hand side past the Matthias Church where you will be able to get an equally nice view of the city from the hill.
Lovely place!. This is perhaps the prettiest spot in Budapest. Love the towers and little corners of the structure, not to mention the great view! Packed with tourists, unfortunately..
Bird's eye view of the city attractions.. From the top level at the Bastion, lies a bar and restaurant.From here you can have a beautiful view of the Danube and the city of Budapest.
Don't pay!. You can see everything without paying a forint! We thought there must be something more to see, so we paid, but nothing different! Beautiful spot, but save your cash for the WC!
Good very odd structure. Impressed with the structure difficult to say what it was mixed of gothic and modern structure nice thing about can see the skyline. Pest

perfect place to take pics of Budapest. The views from the Fisherman's Bastion are amazing - no surprise this has always been an observation point.
There are a couple of bars up there, where you can have a drink, an ice cream and enjoy the views.
the real Disney?. Did Walt Disney cpme here before he came up with the disney castle? This is obviously so much older and so much nicer. Packed with people and a great atmosphere
Great view of the Old City of Pest. Be sure to take some photos from the Fisherman's Bastion. Very convenient to St. Matthias Church and a few decent quality souvenire shops.

Good, but why pay?. It was great to visit and the views of Pest are very good from here, but honestly you can photo the views as well from other vantage points close by - save your money! You can see the Bastion without paying and take your photos just 20m further on!

Perfect view. It is not an option to miss Fisherman's Bastion in Budapest. The reason is simple. It is located in the heart of the castle district right beside the amazing Matthias church. The view from the bastion is spectacular.

lovely views and architecture. loved the views and the stroll along. weirdly there were other parts of the building that you could reach and climb without paying!? it only cost 600ft though so perfectly reasonable. definitely go look at it at least, it's pretty :)

Great Views of Parliament. Main reason to stop by here is for the views of the Parliament across the river. It's very crowded from 10:00 AM until 6:00 or 7:00, so get there either very early or in the late afternoon/early evening to avoid the large crowds.

Must see!. This place entertains a wonderful view of pest, including a magnificent view of the parliament houses. Also, the place itself is beautiful!! The white towers and walls are just magnificent and offer wonrful photo ops.

Long fishing rod required!. Great views although you have to pay entry now.
Very crowded so would recommend visiting early in the morning
Good views. Good views and photo oppurtunities of the river Danube and the city beyond and St Matthias church behind you but in itself not a particularly interesting sight.
It is a perfect view point both towards the church and parliament!. We recommend you to visit here at night for two reasons. First, it is free at night. Second, night view is just amazing!

a must see site. it's a very beautiful site - must see when you are in budapest (you can walk by foot and get there but it means you have to climb very high - it;s a good sport :)) if you don't want to walk up do your self a favor and takd a cub .

What a view!. The bastion was a lookout. The history of the cities on this part of the Danube is one of attack and overthrow by different empires over the years. Now one can look out at the cruise ships that ply the river and the beautiful buildings that remain and all the people wandering around.
Very beautiful. Fairy-tale beautiful, we had a great time walking around on it, but didn't stop to eat or anything. Why do these reviews have to be 50 characters? That's about all I have to say.
Stunning view. Beautiful views over to Pest from the bastion! You have to pay to walk along it but don't think it is necessary

LOVE THIS PLACE!. This site is absolutely stunning! Our tour described it as Budapest's version of the Disney castle - and as soon as you arrive, you will see why. Its structure is made up of a series of towers all unique from one another, yet equally beautiful.There are a few flights of stairs to climb to get to the top, but take your time, take pictures on route at each level, and the climb doesn't seem so extensive. To get to the very top tier, their is a charge - I didn't take this, but to be honest its not really needed, as you get an excellent view of Budapest from the viewing platform just below (see my pics).HIGHLY RECOMMEND! :)
Well worth seeing. What a fabulous building this one is well worth a visit a fantastic spot for taking pictures, a good time to visit is early morning we visited in August in the baking heat

See it at sunrise!. On my first day in Budapest, I got up early and took a stroll up to Fisherman's Bastion to watch the sunrise over Pest...it was sensational...if you can get up that early, it's a wonderful, quiet and beautiful way to start your day in one of the of the world's great cities.
fairytale. Most people would think this fairytale wall with seven gleaming turrets is medieval, but it is not. But who cares, its fabulous and offers great views of Budapest!

Great views, but don't be tricked into paying. The view is a must see, but don't be fooled into paying for entry. There are two sections with basically the same breathtaking view. Skip the first section by the statue (which you must pay to enter) and about one minute past that one, there is another section that is free!
A most!!!!!!!!. Beautiful location, incredible views, architecture to die for and of course great history. Do not miss it!
fishermans bastion. good view worth a visit but a little artificial - only built 100 yrs ago and a bit of tourist hot spot

spectacular views. In addition to some very interesting architecture, there are spectacular views out over the Danube to Pest and the Hungarian Parliament building. the whole complex includes a huge church. there are lots of restaurants and souvenir shops nearby. easily reachable from the castle hill stops of the hop on hop off buses.

Killing time. Interesting history, awesome views, free to access, walk around all the streets to get a feel for the place, inc the church, this would be one of the best wedding locations I have seen, ever, period.
Formidable!. It took me by surprise as the bus started to go uphill!! So clean and vast! Matthias Church on the side enhances the view!
just a viewing tower. You have to pay when you can see the same view for free just below the tower or anywhere on the wall

big surprise... well worth the visit. My wife described this as a giant sand castle. Known for the fishermen's defense against Muslim invaders, it sits on a high point on the Buda side of the river, with spectacular views of Budapest. The tile roof on the church here is amazing.
Don't pay the extra!. Beautiful building, amazing views from Buda over the Pest side of the city. Well worth the trip up the hill.

Amazing views. This seemed like its own little village. If you pay extra you can climb up to the top tower and get great views across the Danube. There was a man at the center of the square with birds that you could hold and it was very cheap 400 forints. The church has an amazing history that is on the grounds and the Hilton Hotel has some relics in the hotel that they didn't disturb. You can walk to the left of the square and get on a horse and carriage ride, visit several souviner shops and to experience the bread that is wrapped around a rolling pin. They cook the bread over coals and the bread is rotated. You can put vanilla, cinnamon, cocoa, coconut or nuts on it. Our favorite was cinnamon. This was on of the first things we did on our trip and it was lovely.

Beautiful and great view!. We visited the fisherman's bastion twice. Once on or first night going up the hill around midnight. The view is also very nice at night and after 10 you don't have to pay anymore to go on the viewpoint! Also at night some young people hang out there and drink and chill.Second time we went op Buda Hill and went from Buda castle towards the fisherman's bastion. It's very nice to be able to see the bastion and Matthias Church next to it in daylight! We didn't go on the viewpoint, because it's not worth spending money on. You have great views on the entire hill and the viewpoint (Citadella) on Gellért Hill is free :) You can chose to climb the hill yourself, take a funicular or even take the bus.

Amazing Views (and a great wee cafe nearby). Definitely worth a visit (take the number 16 bus from Clark Adam Terrace at the Chain Bridge - saves a long walk or the pricey funicular railway).Amazing views over the river to the Pest side, and the Parliament. I think it is worth paying the moderate entrance fee (900 HUF for adults) to acces the top, where the best views are.If you fancy a snack, coffee or a beer, try the small outdoor cafe on the grassy area to the right of the Fisherman Bastion just behind the Tourist Info Point- some of the cheapest prices in Budapest, with friendly staff.

Excellent view over pest. This was not really an exciting piece of budapest, but the view over pest is really magnificent. The restaurant in this area are really some of the more expensive in Budapest
great place to walk. great place to walk in couple ;)Clean with places to seat. Nice city view. I recommend this place to sightsee
the view. Check it out at night, please! The view of the Parliament is amazing.Tip: have a drink at the bastion's outdoor cafe;)
Excellent view, overpriced.. There is no need to pay the admission fee! The view is also remarkable a few steps away! Try to skip the security check.

a "must go" place. I went there with my friend as out graduation trip. The Fisherman's Bastion is just located on the Buda hill, next to a beautiful church. We enjoyed the sunset with beautiful live music! It is definitely a wonderful place to hang out with friends, and also a brilliant place to go for couples!
