You can enjoy a stunning view of the city from there: the Chain Bridge and the Hungarian Parliament can both be included within one glance! The design of the architecture is definitely exceptional!

Breathtaking views in a fairytale settting. I agree entirely that the Fisherman's Bastion resembles something of a fairytale film set but it is charming and the views of the river and the Pest side of the river are breathtaking. I would recommend having a long lunch here to thoroughly soak up the atmosphere and panorama.
Fantastic position. Went to the Restaurant here on a tasting menu/wine tasting / funky jazz night. Had a great time and the food and wine were very good - though service was rather slow.
It's a must!. It's beautiful, and the view is awesome. This is something you cannot miss because it's in one of the most beautiful parts of Budapest.

Quite beauiful..... Built between 1899 and 1905, mostly rebuilt after WWII, by Frigyes Schulekin a Neo-Romanesque style. In years gone by it used to be free to climb up the stairs to the top of the Bastya. Now of course it is a money maker. It is however, not worth the money. You get basically the same views from the lower tiers. The toilet is also quite expensive 200Huf, (about $1) plus it is quite nasty.The Bastya on the other hand is quite amazing, and clean. Many street vendors trying to sell thier goods, don't buy there, up to 3X as much as at the Nagy Csarnok (Great Market Hall) Great photos can be taken of the Parliament from this vantage point.
Wonderful views. Spent accouple of hours around this area had lunch in pleasant surroundings very hot but worth a visit

Simply breath taking. A captivating structure in white, not clinical just pleasant white. We were there Saturday between 10 and 11 and it was very warm and crowded. It is a challenge to take pictures devoid of other tourists. However, there are some "hidden" spots where this could be achieved. I am not certain when the place is less crowded but I would love to spend some time there, just to enjoy the spectacular views and get lost in my thoughts. Prices of ice cream and drinks sold by outdoor vendors are sky high. But there's a kiosk just a few steps before approaching Matthias church/Fisherman's Bastion. After our visit to the bastion and the church, we had lunch at a self-service eatery just a few steps from the church (right side of the road). The food is inexpensive and surprisingly very good.

Fantastic. Pricey admittance but stunning views, fairytale-like castle and you'll get some amazing pictures to remember your trip by. Very busy though so you have to be strategic when planning your trip there.
Fishermans Bastion. Very cool remains from the 14th century in the Buda Hills overlooking the Danube. Part of the Castle District and well worth it
B-e-a-u-tiful!. Such a stunning part of Budapest, I'd highly recommend going up for the sun set, the colors on the buildings are so pretty - just don't forget your camera!

Best views of Pest. It can be extremely crowdy, maybe you better come in the evening and enjoy the sunset up there, spend some time on the terrace enjoying a drink and overlook the city of Pest on the eastern bank of the river Danube.
Beautiful Views. Interesting architecture and amazing views looking over Pest and the Danube. Very crowded so try to go as the sun goes down or in the morning.
Fantastic view and photo opportunity. Charge to visit top tier may not be value for money.popular tourist venue so busy.Also visit Matthias church (although currently being refurbished
Amazing views, lovely architecture.. It was a hot day and there were plenty of people, but we enjoyed the views, which were incredible from such a lovely setting.
Excellent views. Don't bother buying a ticket to get on the second floor. The views from ground level are superb. Get there on a 16 or 16A bus for €1.
Beautiful view. What a view of the pest side of the city.Many wonderful things to see in the same area of the city. Lots of people around.
Great views - delightful place to take a break and eat picnic lunch!. It looks out on the Danube with lots of different stairs and alcoves you can find a place to rest and enjoy the views!
Excellent views. Talk you walking shoes, head up to Fisherman's Bastion and enjoy a spectacular view of Pest, the parliament, and the Danube!
It's like a Film Set. Wonderful views, beautiful architecture - just the best. Restaurant at top of stairs very good value.

Fun place to hang for a minute. As my wife puts it, the Fisherman's Bastion is a "folly," a fairly young building/complex made to look like it is much older. And it is mostly a tourist trap, with its terrace restaurant selling overpriced soft drinks and string quartet playing "Eine kleine Nachtmusik" and Hungarian-style folk songs. But it also commands quite an incredible view of the Danube and the Pest side of the city. So if you are already on Castle Hill, it is worth stopping by for a minute to take some pictures of the view; however, I wouldn't make a special trip just to see it.

Great Views, Nice Architecture. We walked up from the metro system, a 10 minute walk.It was very clean, especially the washrooms. I was very surprised as I was expecting a dirty hole in the ground, like other places in Europe.The inside of the Matthias Church is very nice, even with the renovations.It is very touristic, so I would suggest going up before 10 am, but everything is available to go inside at 10 am.The buildings looked all restored, but they are still old and are very picture-worthy.I would recommend this to anyone. Walking around is very lovely.The views of the city are spectacular. You can see the Danube, the parliament and the Chain Bridge as well as the entire city.
Amazing. Looks like a building from fairy tale and there's a great view from here, but you can enjoy only the bottom floor for free, for the extra 3 meters of view hight you have to pay/
Great Views. We actually walked up the hill which seemed worse that it was! Save your 2 Euro to enter - you can enjoy the amazing views for free on other parts of the bastion
Great view. You had a great view over looking the Pest-side of the city. It was a bit crowded. The restaurants in the area were overpriced.

The greatest view to Pest side. Try to go there after 8 o'clock in the evening. You can climb to the top of the Bastion with no ticket (in daytime you need one), and you can sit and enjoy the most beautiful view of Parliament, Chain Bridge and Danube!
Stunning. We had seen the Bastion when we were arriving in Budapest and wondered what it was. A really beautiful building and well worth a visit

Fisherman's Bastion. When we visited on 1 August, the city was completing a new fountain and had replaced the original cobblestone area with new tiles. Very nice update to the area in front of the location.

Nice views. Attending this location you have the choice of paying a few euros / ft to go to the top of the monument or just looking from the middle or bottom. At the time we went there were plenty of tourists, however still enough room to enjoy some buskers as well. Unfortunately a restaurant and a reception centre dominates parts of bastion, as well as a cafe. But still worth a look.
a must in bdapest. simply put the best views of Budapest - in the castle area so make sure you go - get the 16 bus from either side of the chain bridge
Good view. this location offers the best view of Buda and specifically Parliament. Otherwise the site is a little crowded with a hotel sharing the top to the hill.
Fantastic!!!. The most outstanding site to vist in Budapest, it's truly beautiful and exactly like something out of a fairytale.

Amazing!. Quite possibly the most romantic place I've ever been. We were lucky to have Fisherman's Bastion practically at the doorstep of our hotel, wat a view! What an atmosphere! Just go, you won't regret it.
Nice views. Nice views and area to walk around in Buda. The other streets and shops in Buda are historic and interesting.

The Best Place To Be. This landmark is magnificent. This is one of the places that one must visit if you are in Budapest. It's amazing how intricate the designs in the Bastion are. It may seem ordinary from afar but when you take a look at it quite succinctly, you will appreciate and be left in awe how the designs are made and constructed. This is one of the best places if you are into photography and your subject is about landscape because you can have the best view from here. 4USD is pretty decent enough to be at the very top of the bastion.

Great view - can pay for the top portion. I would recommend paying the $4 (about) to go up to the top portion. It is less crowded and you can get better pictures without people in your way. It can get pretty crowded. You can also get a great view without paying. I recommend going before 10am if your up to it to beat the crowds.
Hilton Hotel. The Hilton Hotel overlooks the Fisherman's Bastion you are actually inside itSuprb postion for the hotel.Chosen by Mr Hilton and Zaza Gabor

One of the most romantic place in the world. This place is really a kind of magic, I've seen it under the rain, while a trio was playing classical music in the restaurant which is placed in the bastions with only a glass to divide it.I really think that this is one of the place where a woman can fall in love ;)

Extreemely beautiful and such a great view. Do not miss going there - despite that it is a long way away from the center - if you are with a tour - make sure it is included in the programme. Really beautiful and relatively well kept.

Magnificent building and view!. It is worth the trip up to the Bastion just to see the art work and construction of the entire building and surroundings. THe view from the Bastion can't be beat. However, I find it appaling that you would have to pay to see the view. Yes, they charge! Go down a little further along the structure and you will be able to see the same view without the cost. It is a long trek up there but so worth it. You can see all of the Pest side and up/down the Danube. Great place for photos.

Great view on Budapest. This was an amazing experience, absolutely lovely view on Danube and Pest, I could have spent hours here just looking. Crowded with tourists ofcourse. You should notice that it is free to enter, only the higher levels have entrance fee and you can see just as well from the lower platform. It also has a nice café with same great view (expensive though).
Highly Recommended. Spent an afternoon walking from the Castle to the Bastion. It was one of the highlights of the trip. Great views over Budapest
great views of the city. dont bother paying the 600HUF to walk up onto this thing. the views arent any better 12ft higher. you can get a great view of the city from the non-pay portions.
amazing spot. i like the idea of honouring the 7 tribes that formed Hungary... a best place to take photos of the Danube River.

Great views of Budapest!. Great area to visit. Take time to relax, unwind and enjoy the marvellous views of the Danube and the Parliament that you will get from this vantage point. Avoid the overpriced souvenir shops and restaurants etc and simply take advantage of the free vantage points and areas to sit. Well worth visiting and close to other historic attractions such as Buda Castle.
Amazing views.... This is a beautiful building with amazing views. If you can go at night go for it because the views are amazing.
Excellent!. The most beautiful sight to the city and the Danube river !!!! Go there and see the magnificient view to the parliament
Marvellous. Great location with views spanning the city. It was good value for money and well worth going onto the upper deck of the Bastion!
Beautiful. This was a wonderful structure and the view from it was amazing. I chose a nice clear day for it too.

Love this area!. It's so beautiful here, but watch out for overpriced food and souvenirs. Great views of the city, the perfect place to take pictures. The Budai Castle is within walking distance. Find a parking spot and take a few hours here.
Like a fairy tale.... İt looks like a Disney Castle. You can have a good lunch there. Very fantastic view, very good spot for photograhers.
Fisherman's Bastion A Lot of History. The building of this Fortress represents talented craftsmen. We always make it a place to visit. Look around for the old World War II bullet holes in the area.

dont buy. do not buy the ticket to look round, its just the same view if you do not buy the ticket!!
smashing view over budapest well worth the look especially at night
Beautiful. Beautiful but very busy! You'll not get a photograph without a million other tourists milling around in the background but again the views are lovely.

Great views of the city. We spent a couple of hours just wandering around Fishermans Bastion, the views of the Danube and the city are amazing. Lots to explore as well, well worth a visit. Beautiful old church that has recently been restored.
BOWLED OVER!. from here you will get the most amazing views of the Danube and Parliament
A great view. A busy spot but worthwhile seeing. Offers a beautiful view of Budapest. Try to go early or later on in the day to avoid the groups of tourists.

Very Impressive. Built just over a hundred years ago as a viewing platform for St Matthias church renovations, this is a very impressive structure offering superb views across and along the Danube. It's free to visit but you can pay to go on the very top level of the bastion, but we didn't as the views are excellent anyway. There is a cafe/restaurant during the day.Best to visit later in evening once all day tourists have gone, then have the place to yourself!

Stroll around the Bastien!. Fisherman's Bastien was the highlight on our Castle Hill visit. It is free to walk all around except the upstairs viewing level which really didn't seem worth the 500 forint (approx $2.50) per person. The view is the same from street level across to Pest. Be sure to go in each little cubby hole and corridor as you might miss a local Hungarian musician playing gypsy music. Take lots of pictures across to Pest from many different spots here as the view from here is breathtaking. There is a pay toliet to the right of the Bastien near the ticket window and it is marked "WC" (Water closet). Also, the square has a cool statute of St. Istvan.

Beautiful with good music. This structure of staircases and terraces reminds one of stories and fairytales...with the addition of fine gypsy music in the background let your mind wander and transport you to a truly magical place.

Absolutely stunning vistas. Views of the Danube and the surrounding city are absolutely beautiful. This view is probably one of the best in all of Europe. If you haven't seen it, put it on your "bucket list"

Stone spires are great.. It looks amazing, but is a little wierd when you find out that the spires were made only 100 years ago for decoration. They really look good though and are worth checking out. You have to pay to go up to the top and I wouldn't do it. You can see just as well from the free level. Half of the Bastion is taken up by the Hilton, so that is a little weird. If you stay in the Hilton, use the Bastion as much as you can. There is a restaurant there as well. Cool place and it encompasses my favorite bronze stature in Budapest

Great views- worth the hike!. This was my favorite site in Budapest. The church and the bastion are both very beautiful. There is a restaurant on the Bastion that was playing live music, which added to the experience. You can pay to go up the stairs for a better view of the river, but free views are also available.

Absolutely beautiful. After a fairly hardcore walk up the hill in stifling heat it was well worth it when we reached Fishermans Bastion. The views here are absolutely stunning as is the surrounding architecture.
beautiful. Looks like a Cinderlla-type castle, very majestic.
Excellent view and interesting facility. Everyone should visit the Fissherman's Bastion when they are in Budapest. It is unique. We were lucky it was right outside our window of our hotel room.

Lovely food in an amazing setting. We had a very good lunch there and I must say, if you check out the setting that seemed quite luxurious it was not expensive at all.
The service was excellent.

Nothing special. There is nothing special on this "historical" site. It has a good view, but you can have a nice view also from the other parts of Buda hill, which are not so crowdy and are not payed.
Fairy Tale. Beautiful place, with an interesting history. Worth climbing all the steps, for the rewarding view of the city when you reach the top. Magical during the day, even more so at night.

Visit is free at night!. Don't pay to get on the bastion. You can visit it for free at night if you really want to, but during the day, don't pay for it. The view is not better from the top than from the lower level. Better get a drink in the coffee in the bastion, than waste your money on the ticket!

The darknest the best. It is amazing to watch the sunset from Fisherman's Bastion in Budapest hilly Buda side and see the lights turning into the night of Pest. Really is romantic and worth a visit and if it is in summer pretty much better cos Budapest use to be a very hot city. Take a sandwich and some drinks and enjoy the sights and the music that is played there. If you are not alone will be much better but if you are, no problem lot of people also alone so you could meet your half orange there!
Nice landmarks. Best views and pictures of Budapest can be taken from here.
Great. Unique experience - a bit of a climb up to it if a person is somewhat disabled but worth it.
Must-see. One of the best things to see when in budapest. Great panoramic view of the city and danube. The castles make you feel like you're starring in a disney movie or something.

panoramic views. Loved climbing up and down through a myriad of lookout places and looking up and down the Danube and across to the Pest side. The area in front of the Bastion was also interesting with the Matyas Church and the shops.

Worth the view but not the price. The actual bastion itself is quite beautiful and slightly reminiscent of Lord of the Rings, at least I thought. Fortunately the hill is high enough that you can get a wonderful panorama of Budapest without having to pay to go up on the promenade.

Views, views, views. We had a dinner with a large group. The views were magnificent. The meal was very enjoyable and the roaming violinist an absolute pleasure. This must be very high on your list when visiting Budapest!

Nice walk with Budapest at your feet. This is a must-see in Budapest. There you can always experience not only a beautiful view of Budapest but have a closer look on the first Hungarian king, Saint Steven.Apart from culture and history this place is just lvely for a romantic walk with your loved One :)I took the pictures in winter but it is just as romantic any time of the year :)
Wasted Money. There was no point in spending money to attain this viewpoint - a few steps up from a free similar view over the city.
Gorgeous building with great views. Definitely wort thne walk from the castle. Gorgeous building with great views. Definitely worth the walk from the castle
great view. just view from ground level or go up top at night after everyone has left for the lights view
Don't miss this!. This was an interesting place to see. The tours all seem to come by the Bastion.

Fisherman's Bastion is Amazingly preserved. A short downhill walk from the Castle, this site is a fitting tribute. We particularly enjoyed having our picture taken with a medievally dressed man and his hawk.

A must do in Budapest!!. BIt of a walk to get there if you end up waling up the hill and to the Citadel and the onto the Castle etc, however well worth it!! The views on a clear day are sensational! TIP - Go into the Hilton Hotel nearby and 100% see the Fausto Wine Cellar!! A hidden gem in Budapest!!

Yes!. A must see in Budapest! I was impressed by the view. A very good place to take pictures of the whole city, the Danube and the Parliament. I visited it early in the morning when it wasn't packed with people, it's the best time to go there.
Lovely view. The view from Fisherman's Bastion is great, and the buildings around the area are also very nice. You can get great shots of the city from this location.

Superb views of the City and river. Easy walk up the steps of the hill to take in the views and ambience albeit most of this is reconstructed due to major damage in WWII. Very nice cafes that are reasonably priced too. Church is undergoing major renovations inside and the tour isn't disabled friendly.

Average man made structure. The Fisherman's bastion looks magical when looked from the Pest side especially at night. It looks like the disney castle building with chimneys etc. However, we were disapointed when we got there. The structure is a man made structure in recent times. It does not have the color or character of what one sees from the Pest side. Although you can get good views of the Danube and Pest from the Fisherman's bastion. There is a ticket to go up onto the wall, though one can get equally good views from the base too.
Beautiful Views. The building is spectacular but the views from Pest are breathtaking, especially at dusk
wow. the must beautyfull view of the city and very chic cafè on the top!! it was a rainy day but the place is fantastic

Taken over by commercialism. What was once a wide open viewing area, is not commercialized by a restaurant that is overpriced and obstructing much of the viewing area. However. to the left if still an open space where you can see across the Danube unimpeded. In the evening, it is well worth going to the upper level to see the views. It is interesting to see how such a short distance in elevation can make such a vast different is perspective.

Stunning Views and Interesting Architecture. The views over Budapest towards Parliament etc and the Danube are stunning! There are restaurants in the walls which offer a fantastic setting to enjoy the views. You have to pay to go up on the wall tops but it's not a must!
A must see. , Mattias Coronation church , views to die for, cafes, resturaunts,markets and the history absolutely enjoyable.

Feels like Disneyland. As charming as the architecture is at the Fisherman's Bastion, it feels a little too perfect and is not nearly as interesting as going into the old part of the castle and getting to climb around and view the ancient ruins down below. There is a charming little cafe (Szabo) in Fisherman's Bastion where you can get a bite to eat while touring the Var district, including a small but truly eccentric museum devoted to marzipan. But as long as you are touring the castle, do stop by this area. Just up the street is the Ruszwurm where you can get truly fabulous ice cream!

Beautiful Views. Our first night in Budapest, happened to wander here after dinner as the sun was setting. It was magical. Bring your camera.Then walk back over the bridge, after the sun sets and view everything lit up. Fabulous.

Totally over the top architecture and great views. The Fisherman's Bastion must be the best folly I have seen - turrets, pinnacles, colonnades & statues along the side of the cliff - great views and utterly beautiful at night - unmissable!

Nice view and architecture. Is a nice walk and sightseeing of the city. There is also a cafe where you can sit and see the city from there. The prices where more expensive than the rest of the city but when compared to euros, it ends up being the same price for a coffee anywhere else in a city in Europe, so it is worth it!
very high up from the bottom. we only took pictures this time they are outstanding next year we will do the Buda side as its very hilly
Must see!!. Amazing view...definitely a must see! Beautiful architecture!
Nice views. Well, the place itself its beautiful, but there isnt much to do, apart of the great views of the city. You can walk to the nearby national gallery.

Better in winter. This is a good place to view the Danube and the city, but in summer, it is a cafe and so it is not always possible to get to the balustrade. However, at the end, ther eis a perfectly good viewing spot uncluttered by tables and chairs.
See this for one of the great views of Europe. The view of Parliament on the Pest side of the city is fantastic from Fisherman's bastion. Do not miss it.
Unbelievable view.... Small price for a fabulous view of Budapest! You can see it all from here, especially good view of Parliament.
A Fairy Castle. I always think that Fisherman's Bastion looks like a "fairy castle" made of sugar. It sparkles in the sun. A wonderful place to visit for sure.
Extraordinarily beautiful - MUST SEE. This is a must see sight in Budapest, a sand castle from your dreams. And the view from there is amazing!
Best views of Pest. The best place to appreciate Pest, by day..but also a gt place to walk at night, if you stay in Castle area!

A must see, but busy!. It's like a Disney Fairytale castle. It's beautiful and affords superb sights across the Danube to Pest. It DOES get busy though, so be aware. I would avoid the pricey funicular railway and walk up, it's a lot quicker and easier than you'd at first think!

Visit at night as well. We visited the Fisherman's Bastion again in the evening, where everything was closed. There was no longer a crowd, and you could go on top of the wall without paying the entrance fee! The view was amazing as always.
Great. The view from the top area is great, it cost around 300 Forint but it is worthed
Views spectacular. Although worth the visit there is not a lot to see and certainly not worth paying the charge to walk a few metres higher.
Wonderful place but now they charge. Second time visiting, but although wonderful, they are now charging to walk in parts of it.
Very nice view of the city.. I think that it was the spot that had the nicest view on the city
fantastic views. its a must to go here.the views over the city are fantastic and if u are lucky there will b free musicians playing.
Unique Architecture. Interesting area to walk around with unique architecture and great views!

lovely setting very picturesque. we got the number 6 bus up to the castle district from blahia ter, although obviously a big tourist area i didnt feel ripped off at the prices and we did the horse and carriage ride which was cool toowe had a drink at the small cafe over looking the river and the violin guy played for usit was a lovely moment and it would have brought a tear to a glass eyerecommend it for a day

Evening light for the best photos!. We were on the bastion as the sun was getting low in the early evening. it was just beautiful. Shadows, towers, statues are real place to take photos and it must have been quieter than during the day with all the tourists.Wonderful views of Pest and the Danube.
Great Views. From up here on the walls you can see the whole of the Pest side and great views of the Parliament building.

Great view. The view from up there is outstanding. It, however, does not have historical relevance other than it's having been built at the end of the 19th century for some kind of exposition. I enjoyed looking out over the Danube and Pest; the live music from the bar on the terrace below made being up here even more pleasant.
A Must See!. Gorgeous panoramic views of the Danube and city beyond... beautiful church and surrounding architecture.... a photographer's dream!
Boring. This is the ultimate tourist trap!! The view is the same as from in front of the museum complex or going up the funicular. Don't bother!

A fascinating site!. This is a beautiful and fascinating site that gives you a panoramic view of Budapest! It includes the gorgeous St. Matthias Church with tons of affordable, unique gift (souvenir) shops!
Wonderful music. The bastion is part of the whole Castle experience. Once you have been here, you will recognise a picture. Unique with lovely views of the Pest side and music to enchant you.

Lovely View. The Fisherman's Bastion has an upper level that you can pay to enjoy the view. It doesn't cost a great deal, but not for those who are afraid of heights. Below, is a cafe where there was a beautiful quartet playing music. Very good value for drinks considering the view. The violin player offered a CD for me to purchase, which I did. It's very good. Highly recommended
Not quite sure why people pay?. You an get equally good - free - views from other parts of the city?

Great view to Pest Side. Our free walking tour ended here and it was a great location for pictures. Do not pay to go the top. We found another entrance up the stairs on the opposite side although small srea to tstand still offered good views.We enjoyed our time spent on Buda side of the Danube.This area has some quiet streets and local shopping stalls tucked away into side streets.

Good photo opportunity. There's not really a lot to do except look but this beautiful terrace provides an excellent spot for photos in the day and evening. To get on to the higher walkways you have to pay but we noticed that at about 7pm the people charging disappeared and there was free access. There are lots of cafes and gift shops in the area and nearby is Matthias church.
Beautiful Views. Well worth the walk up! You can get there with the Free Budapest Walking Tours.

Disney Brought To Life. The towers here must have inspired Walt Disney! They're pretty and they offer good views from Buda over the pest part of Budapest, particularly the Parliament building.
I don't think it is worth paying to go on the top level. If you're they're in the evening you can visit the top level free!

Fairytale castle. It might just be a folly but this really was like a fairytale castle, all spires and turrets and arched windows with spectacular views. You have to pay to walk around the top of the walls but we didn't feel it was worth it since you can still see plenty. We never got to the restaurant which is disappointing as I could imagine a lovely romantic dinner overlooking the city at night.
# 2. I was there last week, the wheather was perfect, 30o C. I recomend to have a sparkling wine and see the landscape.
Excellent views. The views from here were worth paying for one slightly over-priced beer in the cafe. The musicians added to the atmosphere.

Views are worth it. Cafe hours vary.. The views and pictures you get are worth the entrance fee. If you are planning the cafe here as a refreshment stop with a million dollar view, be aware that the hours vary. Today was a busy Saturday and they were not open at 11:00.
Fanciful castle. Definitely worth the visit. Great photos to be had. Don't pay to go to the upper part. Take bus 16 back to Deak Square.

Beautiful!. My family stayed at St. George Residence Suites which was walking distance from Fisherman's Bastion. We walked around the Buda Castle District. We enjoyed the view of Danube River and Parlament from Fisherman's Bastion. The beautiful Matthias Church was also nearby. We saw the changing of the guards at the nearby palace.Across the Fisherman's Bastion, there is a CBA grocery, Ruszwurm bakery cafe (selling delicious apple strudels), Pest-Buda cafe (reasonably priced, delicious food like Goulash soup).Also, there is a labyrinth in the Buda Castle district.
Not worth paying. Views from the paying part are the same as you can see from the free part.
A Must Visit. Great views across the city had a vodka and tonic here and really enjoyed it but had to pay £12 for the privilege! It was worth it
Great view. The best place for a view on the Pest side! pity you must pay to get up till the top
hospital in the rock was a bit difficult to find. very picturesque great place to take photos very interesting history and good places to eat
Good view, don't buy ticket. I agree with an earlier viewer who said great views but don't buy ticket. Ticket gives you access to only some of the towers and it takes 2 minutes to walk across them!
The whole area was spectacular. I went in the evening and then early Sunday morning. Both times were fantastic and well worth just walking around the cobblestoned streets.
Great view of the city, don't buy the ticket. Go for the view from the elevated lookout. There are some nice restaurants and shops up here. Skip the tickets though - not necessary to enjoy the scene.
Photo shoot. Must be one of the most photographed places in Budapest,both daytime and evening
Loaded with tourist but still good views over Pest and the Danube. Crowds and fees to go on the top of the Bastion, there are free areas that will allow you to look out over the river.

a muuussstttt on your to do list.!!!!!!. Yes again this is one of the very famous tourist haunts in the Buda castle district. Do buy the ticket which takes you along the castle walls for the best views looking down over the Danube looking over to get the fill of Pest on the other side. Leave room for a drink in the cafe under neath the walls . And then stroll around at your leisure . Theres soo much to see id spend the full day here again if it were me.xxxx Enjoy

Mixed bag. Bit of a "confection" but it offers great views of Pest, if you can get near it for all of the groups of school kids swarming all over it. Word of warning, they don't take prisoners so don't get in their way;-)
So beautiful. Whether you are up there or looking at it from the other side of the Danube, this place is spectacular!
Lovely vistas. Great views of Danube, church and statue of St. Stephen
Beautiful. Beautiful view! Good stop near of Buda's Castle. Take a lot of pictures there, one of the best points in Budapeste for that!

Fantastic views over the city. This is a must place to visit. The tourist bus drops you off in the main square. We enjoyed a glass of beer in the cafe overlooking the city and the Danube whilst listening to the 'house band'...
You can get some fantastic photo's from the Bastion

Great views, especially at night. I adore the views of Pest from here, the chain bridge, the parliament, the cruise ships. No need to pay, just walk along a little.
The restaurant offers excellent cuisine and also great views, but note that it's not cheap, but for a couple we found it excellent. For group events I'd advise caution, read my other review.
lovely panaorama on historic ramparts. Breathtaking views over Pest and the Danube in one direction and fantstic up close views of St.Mathias cathedral on the other

Best Views in Budapest. Great place to visit some of the best views in Budapest. It has all been restored but well done apart from the new Hilton Hotel being finished at the moment and to modern. The building is out of place and like a blot on the landscape of a beautiful area.

What is a restaurant doing here?. That´s what I thought when I saw 3 different restaurants on top of the Bastion. First I thought that was disrespectful. But then I realized that was exactly what it was meant to be after de WWII restoration. From here you can get the best views of the Parliament and Margaret Island, while having a nice lunch, with live music.

Romantic Setting. Despite not being as old as it appears the Fisherman's Bastion is worth a visit. Its not necessary to buy the ticket that gives you access to the upper level as the view is actually better from the floors that are free to visit

A place like in a fairy tale, with great view. The entrance to Fisherman's Bastion costs 500 Ft (about 2 Euros) and it get you the opportunity to visit this magnificent site with a great view to Pest and to the Danube Bridges. The Bastion is located next to Matthias Church, so it's very easy to find.
great views of the city. the recently-renovated bastion offers a beautiful panorama of Pest.
view at night is amazing. you should definitely have a walk in castle district after sunset.. stop by fishermans bastion and enjoy the view!!
fishermans bastion. Best views of Budapest . Very romanitic.worth the £3 for 2 people.
Fabulous. The view as we arrived was spectacular and then they got even better when you viewed the Danube and the Parliament buildings from the top.
Amazing site from above the river. Go to the Fishermans Bastion, admire the view, you have to do it if in Buda.

Twee and overdone - but unmissable.. Part of the Bastion is a pay facility (300HUF currently), but some parts are free and another a cafe with marvellous views and prices to match.
Though it's twee and over-restored, I found myself taking more pictures of the bastion than any other part of the city. The views of Parliament, over the river are great.
Great views over the city and Danube. The history is well preserved and worth the visit. There is not the emphasis on comercialism as in some places.

Art Deco masterpiece. dont pay for the view -there are plenty of free spots to take picts of Pest. and best to go in the evening so that you don't have the sun in your eyes as you try to take photos of the city.

One of the most underrated places in Europe. Everybody knows Big Ben, Colosseum, Eiffel Tower, Parthenon and so forth, but this place really derserves to be on that list! It's an amazingly beautiful complex with nice hangout spots and things to do. "A must experience" place in Budapest.
Great view - average food. Have never come across staff that also try the wine as well as the customer. Service was haphazard of a restaurant of this standard.
nice to see the history from up side. Fisherman's a great place to visit in the first morning :)

The view is lovely. You can either pay so that you have the most famous backdrops or go to the northern tower and check out Pest. Also, there are some cafes where you can enjoy a glass of wine or another drink and enjoy the great view. It is touristy so tourist prices apply.
The bastion and the view are great photo ops.

Ahh the views (but oh, the tourists!). The views, the views the views. Please have your camera and don't be afraid to jostle for space to get the picture perfect shots of the Danube and Budapest city from the elevated area of Fisherman's Bastion. The only better view in Budapest is at the Citadela.

Great view but very crowded. You get a great view of the Parliament and Pest from here - if you're lucking enough to be able to see anything. The place was mobbed when I was here. Interesting though and still worth checking out, despite the crowds.
A unique place.. Although overly "touristy" and pricey...the actual structure is beautiful, as are the views from it's heights.
great views. well worth the visit - superb views over the city and good for a wander about.

Good views but not really worthwhile. It only costs about £2 but you don't get much better views than elsewhere and only part of the bastion is actually walkable anyway - most of it is taken up with a restaurant.
Fisherman's Bastion. Beautiful buildings and beautiful view to Danube and the Pest side. Remember to visit the Mathias Church

Visiting the towers. You don`t need to pay for it. Paid area is very short and there is nothing interesting. You can climb the left tower (with the cafe) for free, this one is free and even bigger! Beautiful place anyway.
Strange structure but great views. This structure is elaborate, but serves little purpose other than to provide stunning views of the Danube and Pest!
Great views from a very special place. Medieval design and great atmosphere, there is even a Russian restaurant built into the walls
Best view. Probably the best view to pest side, beautiful towers
This place is great!!!. Wow, what views!!! This is an extra ticket from the church. The church is under rennovation so this place is well worth it. Take a lot of pictures!
Amazing Views. Has to be in my top 10 most favourite places. The views were just amazing and breath taking looking over the Danube and City

nice architecture, lovely in the sunset. was there last May-walked all the way from the pest end of the chain bridge(Szechenyi Lanchid) and skipped the tram going up to the mountain top to the castle district. Fisherman's bastion is also within walking distance from the castle.it's a group of 7 castle-like building, with a good view from the mountain. i loved the white color as it's very rare and it's simply wonderful in the sunset. you can pay a fee to get inside.

Go early in the morning to avoid paying. The Fisherman's bastion is a nice vantage point to the Pest side but they charge for it and it I would recommend not paying. There are plenty of other spots where you can get almost as good a view. Or get there at 7AM and go up for free, before the toll collectors show up.
Not blown away. I didn't love this site, but many in my group did. However does offer a great view of the city.
No reason to pay extra for the walkway.. The same view is available for free so there is no reason to pay extra to walk on the upper level.

Well worth a visit. This is a must, book a day trip and take in all the sites. Then stop at the lovely tea-shop oopposite the Fishermans Bastion for choc cake & tea, perfect.The views are breath taking from the top and the shop within the tea-shop sells the cutest marzipan figures.
Lovely views. If you come to Budapest do not miss this attraction. The views are amazing even on a slightly foggy day! Crowded but a good location for a walk to visit the old town.
Good view. Good view over the Parliament and Donau. Also nice with the Mattias-Church behind. Absolutely worth the entrance.

Worth going. Set in a busy area this is a most interesting building with great views over the city. It was not too busy while I visited so it was easy to move about. It is set high above the main thoroughfare ... best not to try and walk!
romantic. one of the best sights in budapest...if not the best :) a must do for everyone who visits this beautiful city

Most beautifull place in Budapest. This place is amazing, with a great landscape, with musicians playng violin and other instruments, some coffees well located to stay for some time enjoying the place. All people that goes to Budapest cannot miss this place!
an enchanting place, perfect view. A place as in the fairy tales. A beautiful view to the Parliament and the Danube river. Definitely recommend visiting!

A Medieval Bastion on the Hill. The Fisherman's Bastion in Budapest is a wall and tower complex built in the 1800's to recall the medieval architecture of the original walls of Buda. Using the medieval convention of naming the portion of the city wall after the guild who defended it, the Fisherman's Bastion takes its name from the Fisherman's Guild who were responsible for that portion of the city wall in Medieval Times. Located on Castle Hill, near the Matyas Templom, the Fisherman's Bastion is a perfect way to cap off a trip to the Castle District, with its fabulous views of Budapest and the Danube. There are several cafes and a WC nearby so it's also a great place to relax before continuing with sight seeing. There is a small cost for the ticket to climb the Bastion, but it's not expensive and is definitely with the expenditure.

Disney castle but eh view can't be beat. The Bastion itself looks like the castle at Disney World in Florida so that's a negative. But the view of Pest, especially at night, is one of the best around.

Great view of Pest and the parliament. The 7 euros to go on the first floor is a total waste... you get an equivalent view from the ground floor cafe and a coffee too for 5 euros.The parliament building from this spot is a great photo opportunity and a must see. The lit up parliament at night gives a stunning view.
Go see it. Lovely area and deinitely worth seeing if you like architecture at all you will love it and great views over Pest.

Pay the extra and have a drink overlooking the Danube. Wow, sounds touristy but we go there every trip. Not really that expensive to treat yourself to a drink on the terrace overlooking the Danube; with some great classical music in the background - a photo opportunity never to be missed also

The best view of Budapest. Halaszbastya gives you the best opportunity to see Budapest from the top. Bastion itself is very nice, too. Castle Hill is accessible by feet, or by cable car coming from the river bank.

Beautiful to look at and beautiful views from it. A place not to be missed in Budapest! Up on Castle Hill the Fisherman's Bastion is a beautiful neo-Gothic terrace with 7 towers that represent the 7 Magyar tribes that settled in that area in 896. It's named Fishermen's Bastion after the guild of fishermen that defended that stretch of the city walls in the Middle Ages. The views were magnificent and we took many photos of the views from all the viewing towers towards Pest. All very beautiful. No need to go up the towers that you have to pay for access as the views are just as spectacular from every other vantage point.
Nice view of the city. Good place to spend the time enjoying the marvelous view of Budapest.
Great Panorama. This is something you can not miss if you visit Budapest.

Don't pay. The best view is free. Walked from the funicular , saw the cash desks and dutifully paid, but then realised the best view is farther along, and it's free. ( go as far as you can along the bastion wall until you see a small tower. Climb this. There's a cafe right at the top, but no pressure to buy, though you could pat peanuts for a coffee and site with one of the best views in Budapest beneath you. Right on the curve of the danube
Amazing structure and great city views. Highly recommend visiting this site - one of my favorite places in Budapest! Bring your camera because you will be taking a lot of pictures :)
lookout. not a place too miss good views over the Danube interesting restoration work

Always nice. I have visited it several times. It offers great views of the Parliament, Danube and Pesta. In the last 2 years they have introduced an entrance fee - although it used to be free. The tax si rather silly, as it only applies to a portions of the wall - but you can see the rest of it for free! Same stuff! And at night there is nobody there, so you can go for free. Moreover, in the daytime, if you use the exit to go in - you do not have to pay the tax... Nobody is guarding the exit.

Great view!. Amazing views of Pest! Will always be a very special place for me as on Saturday this was the location of where I got engaged!! A tip - for those going in the evenings the top section is open and free. Well worth it as the views at night of the parliament and various bridges crossing the Duna River are spectacular!

You have to pay for the premium view. Great overlook spot but there's an enclosed cafe taking up the lower viewing area, and you have to pay to access the top part. Still you can see the river and Pest by peeking through the railings along the side.
Disneyland Bastion. Don't pay the extra to visit. It only gives you access to an extra terrace and the rest is free !

Great scenic spot. A great place for that perfect holiday photo. You can see the whole city from up there. We really like this place and church right next to it. Actually the whole area around the castle was amazing. You must visit here.

Very nice but you've to pay for the view. The place is very nice, nearby the mathias church and it's a bit like in a fairy tale. However, you've to pay to go upstairs for the view and it's a bit disappointing that they ask you to pay for everything in Hungary...
and now I'm continuing my comment because tripadvisor need 300 characters to post it. ;)

You don't need to dine at the restaurant to see it. You can simply hang around the fountain within a couple meters of the restaurant, snapping photographs of even higher quality as you will be able to fit the bastion as well as the panoramic views into your shot.
Nice. Nice place with a good view over Danube river and parliament.
Great view of the Danube. It had a great view of the Danube, food was great and the beer even better.

Nice and awfull. I've mixed feelings about this one. The view is fantastic. Really really nice. But then I don't like this make money on the tourist. Ok I know money is needed, it turns the world around. Yes but this... Blantant no shame to rip of as much as you can do... It gives Me an sour feeling and honestly a little bit sad. But take the nr 16 bus up there.
lovelyviews. must see very picturesqe take camera.night time view beautiful to see over danube all the beautiullights
Great view. Hate the admission fee. The views are breathtaking.

Fisherman's Bastion in Budapest. I always take foreign groups to the Fisherman`s bastion since from this point you can make the typical Budapest panorama photos. I recommend to visit. Wonderful you`ll see it.
Very posh. A nice restaurant with a beautiful view. The service was brilliant, the food was just good. It was a bit too posh for us.
Do yourself a favour and go!!!!!!!!!!. Pretty and view to die for also near castle, art galleries, and caves
Great view. Great view from the top to look down over Budapest.
Top views. After a long hot morning trekking through Budapest seeing the sights, this place is a fantastic stop-off point for a cold beer, with the best view in town. Highly recommended.
good view but not much else. The site gives a good view of the city but there's not much else going on (expensive food, souvenirs)

Spectacular views. The views from the Fisherman's Bastion were amazing! We had a drink in the cafe and were serenaded by a gipsy band on our first night in Budapest - it was very romantic. It was unfortunate that some building work was taking place in the area, but by the time we visit again (which we definately will) the work will be complete.

Nice veiw of the city. Next to the Hilton Budapest, in the castle area and the St. Matias Church. There is a small charge, but if you don't want to pay, you still have gorgeous view of Pest, the other side of the city.
Amazing view. Nice place for taking photos. From the top you can see the whole city. Very close to Buda castle.

Great views of the city. When visiting the castle area, be sure to climb Fisherman's Bastion for the best possible views of the river and city. There is a small admission charge, but it is also possible to access part of it at at the far end without paying.
good place. good place to visit, good landscape, close to the church
nice view to the Pest side. you get a nice view to the Pest side of the city, even if you're not willing to pay the fee to enter the bastion. St Matias church is right beside the bastion.

Pretty spot to see a great view.. From the Fishermen's Bastion (each group had to build, provision and guard part of the fortress wall; this was assigned to the Fishermen's Guild), there is a great view across the Danube to Pest, the other side of Budapest.
fantastic view. fantastic view especially at night, a lot of stairs

Wonderful views but not much else. A great spot to enjoy views back from the Buda side across the Danube to Pest, especially if the weather helps you out. Other than that not much to say, entry to upper level costs - not much, but then the view is only a bit better. As others have noted it can be very busy especially once the bus parties have arrived. Photographers will like this spot.
What a view!. It's the perfect picture taking venue for the Parliament and Pest. Try to find a bathroom before you get there.
Not to be missed. Very interesting with great views of the city. Get there early to avoid the crowds
Great views and interesting architecture. So what if it's a tourist attraction, it's great! these wonderful sights don't exist for local visits only.
Nice views... but that's it. This place is very strange, very crowded and charge to see the top level. The views are good but the actual building is not really worth the time.
Seems a Little Disney-ish. While Fisherman's Bastion can feel a bit like a Disney set, it does offer great views of Pest from the Buda hill's Castle District.

Worth a quick look. Great architecture and a wonderful view, however, it was incredibly crowded. We were there on a public holiday so I suspect similar to a weekend. They charge to walk along the top (not sure how much). If you're up in the castle area, it's easy to get to and to see but we left quickly as it was too busy.
priceless view. the view is amazing from this spot to the parliament and the eastern side of the river...
Beautiful!. It's just a beautiful building, especially the roof. And the view is great too. However, it is a huge tourist attraction...so very busy.
Nice view. but it's not restaurated, it's rebuilt. Poor for such a historical monument.

Great panorama. I went there with my partner, in the middle of the day and Fisherman's bastion was one of the last sights on the Buda side of Danube. The view is really amazing. Entrance is 600 huf, we paye only 300 huf, showing our international student cards. The only thing I didn't like is that there were too many people, but you can't do anything against it - it's a very beautiful sight, it was Saturday and between holidays. It would be beautiful to visit this sight at sunrise or sunset.

Panoramic view. The Fishermen's Bastion is one of the most popular spots of the Castle District ..it offers you a grand panorama of almost the entire city. Catch the opportunity and take some fantastic photos

Brilliant place. The historic structures of Buda, the castle, Fisherman's Bastion and St. Matthew's Cathedral all have fantastic views of the Danube and Pest beyond. The Fisherman's Bastion offers something of a covered walkway from which you can enjoy the view. There are also stalls selling handicrafts around the Bastion and church.
great view. great view. try to go at the sunset and you can see both day and the nigth ligths. Keep in mind that most of monuments clase early (around 17h)
Too touristy. Was built much later than surrounding buildings, felt like it was built for tourism alone.
Magnificent view. Fabulous up there, the view across the Danube is wonderful
Awesome view!. A great view of the Danube and the Parlament, totally worth visiting it.

FABULOUS VIEWS AND GREAT STRING QUARTET. Amazing views over the Danube and the Parliament building, have a hot chocolate in the cafe and be serenaded by the very entertaining and friendly string quartet.
Breathtaking views and climb!. The architecture is beautiful and the views from the top over the city are stunning even if you have a mild heart attack on the climb up!

Such a lovely sight!. Amazing view and the St. Matthias church is also located here. A really romantic place. While I was here, there were musicians playing in the nearby restaurant and it made the place the more beautiful. You have an awesome view on the Parliament building from this place. Take tons of pictures and if you have the time, you should visit the church!
Not worth of money. Yes, view is beautiful, but its not worth of extra cost. Gellert is free and same counts for view few meters beside Bastion :)

Great walk from the hotel Bohem Art. Fascinating building, loved the hawk and falcon on display. Hungarian quartet wonderful playing. Beautiful view of the Parliment bldg across the river. This was of course right next to the church.
amazing view of Budapest. cost a couple of buck and not much different from the free views around the bastion but for the price, was totally worth it.
Great Views. Beautiful architecture, but was disappointed with the cafe's. they did not allow access to the top.
Beaultiful views of the city. Nice place, excellent to take a rest for a few minutes looking the wonderful view of the city.
BEAUTIFUL!!!. One of the most beautiful places of the world! Great panorama to the House of Parlament!
Fisherman's walk. They were in the process of refurbishing them. You will get a great view of the Pest side but it is not old. A nice way to get a view, but full of tourists(as you would expect).
Fabulous building. Sited next to St Matthews church this building is beautiful with 7 towers which represent the Magyar states
Views. A little expensive for basic food (sandwich and beer), but made up for it by the stunning views across the Danube to the Parliament Building.

What is all the fuss about?. My first review was censored by TripAdvisor, so am trying again. You have to pay (OK, not very much, but it's the principle) to walk about 50 yards on this viewpoint. This after being charged to see the church, which is currently undergoing full restoration, so you are severely restricted in what you can see. I don't mind paying for things, but not being spectacularly overcharged. Stay on the outside of the church, and get your views elsewhere for nothing. Spend your money on the Opera House tour, which is excellent.
Beautiful view. Filled with tourists. Beautiful free view and short walk to and from.
like a fairytale castle. really felt like I was looking at a fairytale castle it was amazing, walk through it to the other side and you will get a great picture from across the road.
Spectacular views. Beautiful buildings, spectacular views. Coffee with a view and serenaded by musicians playing Hungarian folk and classical music. Superb!
A view to remember. We had the most romantic dinner here. Do not miss this place
Beautifull location but pricey. Amazing area but a bit pricer to walk on the wall to get a similar view than one level below. Worth a visit in Buda though...
Nice views, don't buy the ticket. We bought the entrance ticket thinking it was for the entire site, but there are many public/free parts that offer just as nice a view of the Pest side.

Excellent viewpoint. Very busy litter bar, but excellent viewpoint. The only downside is people walk through the bar and try and push past the tables for a better view. Easily cured by a polite comment.

Beautiful building!. It is one of the most beautiful building i have encountered in Europe. The picture does not do it justice. The architecture is simply amazing and it is free to look around! What makes it different is that it is not the usual church and castle architecture you see across Europe. The attraction is also in the centre of Budapest, and it is close to other attractions!
Wonderful views of Parliment!. Wonderful views across the Danube of Parliment and Pest. Don't miss it!
Beautiful Views. The Fisherma's Bastion is definitely worth visiting but it's not necessary to pay to enter it, you can get almost as good a view from the adjacent "free" terraces.

A visual delight. This area was one of the highlights of our visit to Budapest. It was a truly enchanting area, almost fairytale in design. The view overlooking the town was spectacular from this height. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Bastion as a 'must see' if you are in Budapest.

enigmatic viewpoint above the Danube. This is a nineteenth century gem designed to provide a feature near the Palace and castle. Has been beautifully restored with great views of the river Danube and areas to promenade and take in the atmosphere of a once grand European city.

Fabulous building. Worth making a visit, even if it's just for photographs.
Beautiful building and situated in a nice area to sit and have lunch etc.

Good spot for photos. As an "attraction" there really isn't much here. It is a great spot for taking photos and the grand staircase makes for a regal descent after visiting the near-by church. Not much to do, but very close to other good sights.
Plenty to see. Fantastic views over the Danube to Pest. Lots of side streets to wander round. good atmosphere.Lots of photo opportunities
Lovely view. Gilert and here, both are must sees to take in a city almost stuck back in time.

Watch out for the scammer!. You have to pay 600 forints to walk along the top. I am unsure why there is a cost, as you can get a similar view without the need to pay from underneath and to the sides of the bastion. Cost aside, the view is spectacular. It is very touristy. Unlike in most parts of Budapest where you can get away from the tour groups and crowds, this is not. The most interesting thing here was watching an old Hungarian man scam tourist after tourist. Using sleight of hand and a pea, it was enjoyable to watch as one tourist after another handed over tens and even hundreds of euros convinced they knew where the pea was. DON'T BE FOOLED. The guy has colleagues with radios looking out and others which he loses to, convincing the tourists that he can be beaten. Regardless, it was strangely enjoyable watching the crowd be taken in, and watching the faces of people who lost money. (I saw an American teenager loose 20,000 forints and look like he was going to cry).
Kind of a rip off.... Yes, the view is nice but I paid 3 euros to walk across less than 400 m, from tower to tower. The view is nice, but compared to Gellert Hill, this just isn't quite worth it.
Viewing area. Paid to go up on the steps on the right but need not have done as you can go just as high, for free, up the left hand steps. Lovely view, good photo opportunities.
Totally Disney esque and wonderful. Amazing building with amazing views. Just take your time and savour the moment. Whichever way you look is special. A photographer's dream.
Fantasy!. What a great place to see Pest and the Parliament building

Excellent for photos - and free. You can pay to go up a flight of stairs, but it isn't worth it. The views and photos you will capture from the public spaces are just as good. Literally if you pay you get to go 5 ft higher. However whatever option you choose, I recommend it. It is a stunning piece of fairy tale architecture.
Nice photo opp at sunset. nice place to relax, watch the sunset and take some memorable photos.
What a view. Quite a climb, but the view was well worth it. Our guide gave us an insight into how the building got its name etc
Beautiful architecture. A gorgeous building, definitely worth a visit and you have st Mattias Church next door. We did this as part of an afternoon at in the Castle District, the views are gorgeous.
Awesome. Fantastic surprise! Just charming! The view over the city is breath-taking. This was my third trip to Budapest, but my first time here... Well worth a visit.

The amazing view. When visiting the Bastion, you also have to enjoy the view over whole Budapest, mostly Pest! At night, you have a great atmosphere with all the lightened buildings along the side of the river.

FISHERMANS BASTION. Best view in Budapest!!!! The free walking tour of Budapest ended here and the views and phototaking was fantastic!!! There are restaurants here where you can sit and eat and drink while enjoying the view. Great place to visit.
Fisherman's Bastion. This place is amazing! Great architecture and not too difficult to get to :) A sight to see.
a must see. Great views of the city~it costs a very small fee to enter and it is worth it.
Unspoiled vie of the Pest side. You just see EVERYTHING!. There were nice bars and cafés in different places in the old structure. Something you often miss. Great!
fabulous view of the city. an absolute must visit for a great view of the city

Spectacular scenery and interesting architecture. Fishermans Bastian has beautiful architecture and the scenery from the top of Fishermans Bastian gives you a great glimpse of the Pest side of Budapest. You can walk up to Fisherman's Bastian or take a bus but it's well worth the travel as this place is a must see in Budapest.We went here in April and it rained a little so we had to purchase an umbrella from a nearby tourist shop. Try to bring one with you as there is not much cover around here. Also bring some snacks as the restaurants are a little more pricey as it's a touristy place.
Best view. I love the view from here. I travel often to Budapest and I try to stop here on all my trips. For the best pictures of Budapest I recommend everybody to come here.

Beautiful Site to visit, advisable mid/end afternoon. Beautiful Site to visit, advisable mid/end afternoon, so that you can pictures both by day, sunset and night.I did not see anywhere a fee being asked (as I read on some other review).I was there with little kids, and the walking (a bit hilly) was tiring for them.I had a car, but although one is allowed to drive a car there, the free time limit is 30 mins, which is way too little, as well it being totally not practical to drive around there.
Best View from it. Both day and night I went there and it was great view from it!

A must!. Having visited Budapest many times over the last 10 years or so, I always make a point of visiting the beautiful Castle Hill Quarter and Fisherman's Bastion. It holds the most wonderful views of this wonderful city so be sure to bring your camera! Beautifully constructed, it is a must see for all visitors to Budapest!

tourist trap but must see!. For some reason they were charging 600 HUF to walk up one section, which made us mad as the tower was free, and they were charging to go into the church, but only into one room, so be advised, don't fall for that :) just walk and explore on your own.
Family weekend in Budapest. Great views across the City and street atmosphere was amazing

Amazing architecture and wonderful view. The first time I visited Budapest, I never made it up to the Fisherman's Bastion -- the time was just too short to see everything. The last time I was there, I took my wife and daughter up to the area and we were really impressed. The architecture of the bastion is extremely beautiful, and the view from there over the Danube and into Pest is not to be missed. We took some extra time there to gaze across the river and take photos among the interesting architecture. Once you get up to Buda Hill, it's an easy walk to the Bastion and well worth it.
worth a visit. interesting architecture, but it rained and was pretty cold.. we could have spend more time around.
OVERALL VIEW OF TEH CITY ...PLEASANT. Good overall view of the city. Close to the Castle and the Hospital in the rock so one can take them all in together
Excellent view of the city. Dont bother paying for a ticket, there are areas where you can get the same view and they are free...
Beautiful place nice panoramic view. We've visited the place twice: in December and in April. in December it was freezing. Very nice place to shoot panoramic pictures.

Fisherman's Heights. I am a disabled person who walks with a stick, I found the funicular railway fantastic for getting up and down the hill. people were very friendly and helpful, both young and old. fantastic cafe's lovely cakes and main meals.

Great views. I didn't do the actual tour of the bastion but walked around the site a bit on two different occasions, one rainy day and one slightly sunnier day. It's a beautiful spot up on Castle Hill and it offers great views down over the Danube and across to the Pest side of things. Definitely a must see.

Beautiful. I wasn't entirely sure what to expect when I went to the Fisherman's Bastion, hadn't really read much about it, just that it was a must see. It certainly was a must see, it was like a fairytale walkway in the Castle district of Buda. AMAZING views of Budapest and beautifully built, I couldn't decide whether to take more photos of Budapest or the Bastion itself!

Fabulous views and a wonderful place to stroll around. Great spot to take panoramic photos of the city. Everywhere is spotlessly clean and maintained beautifully. Lots of litte dining places. We used the cable car to get there as the walk looked beyind us!!

Spend the day (and evening) at Halaszbastya.. Beautiful square with amazing views of Pest, Buda Hill and the Parliament. Includes a statue of St. Stephen, Hungary's first King and "father" of Christianity. St. Matthia's Cathedral is just next door. A pretty little park and children's playground is to the right. Perfect way to spend the day exploring Buda Hill.
Amazing Budapest panorama!. Definitely worth a visit in the evening when it is not so crowded and you can enjoy the beautiful and romantic panorama of Budapest!
a must. Worth spending half an hour to walk around to enjoy the view of the city and the old houses.
look out post not a real Basstion. Views from here are great you can see most of Pest from here, it is a shame they charge to go in here as you do get good views from the side of it.

Best views of Parliament/Danube sights/Pest side of the city. Great views of Pest and Parliament.
Note: Huge crowds make trying to capture a picture absent of fellow tourists very difficult and at times stressful

Beautiful and great view of the Danube, th Parliament and Pest. Its worth a visit for amazing views of the other side of the river. Yoi have to pay engrance to get there (i think 2euro), worth visiting it!
Fairytale. Like many of the buildings in BUD, girlie castles rather than fortresses. Lovely place to sit in the sun with a coffee or beer enjoying the view over the Danube to the Parliament

wonderful!!. i liked everything, the sight was amazing. the architecture was really good, there were a few towers very beatiful and of course many stairs to go on the towers , but even if it was tiring it was really a very good attraction. i hope to go back one day may be!

Lovely!. One of the loveliest spots in Buda!
Lovely view on Pest.
Amazing views. If you are in Budapest, you shouldn't miss this site. You will be amazed by the panoramic views.
Very impressive. I was extremely impressed at the grandeur and the architecture of the building. Worth a visit to admire it. Also a nice (bar somewhat steep) walk.
Brilliant!. Best views of Budapest from Castle Hill. A fabulous location full of charm and great architecture.

Very nice, but maybe too short for the money!. The building is very beautiful with some very nice views, however, you have to pay an entrance fee to get on the top floor. Again, this is all very nice, but it takes you only a few minutes and than you're back on the groundfloor, wondering why you'd just paid for? Conclusion: if your budget is low, visit only the ground floor. If you don't mind paying a fee & stand between dozen of tourists for that one special picture, than go for it!
Free Option to enter Fisherman's Bastion. I bought tickets to enter it but there was no real point as further on, you can enter a part of it further on for free, which is being used a bar.
Very very nice place... Like encharmed castle. Good option for taking many pictures. Perhaps one of the best places for it... Paraliament, river, bridges, boats...fullfill your eyes.

beautiful place BUT....the restaurant has bad business practice.. It was a nice place to take beautiful pictures BUT I was expecting it to be BIGGER. Another disappointment was the restaurant had an advertisement for free glass of wine with a purchase of the hop on hop off bus tours......guess what FALSE advertising....they will tell you it is not effective yet and to come back the following month...what a joke!I hope they do not mislead people....I would have been fine just seeing the bastion but decieving people only makes for bad business....we walked out instead of having a beautiful lunch which I know would have been expensive....sorry I refuse to spend my money at your restaurant because of the false advertising.

Brilliant views of the city. This area forms the cliff side boundary to the older disrict of Buda. This part of the city is very pretty and has alot of the old world charm you envisage when coming here. The bastion itself appears very modern but has a unique appearance
Take an Evening Walk. A Great place to walk in the evening light .... plenty of shadows and shapes along Fisherman's Bastion

Touristy but worthwhile. The views are very good and the atmosphere is tremendous people watching!Take the #16 bus up and down - well worth the price and saves a lot of wear on the body. Good eating spots to be found - both for snacks and for cafeteria style eating.

Fairy tale castle with a great view. We visited Halaszbastya in March before the tourist season so it was just a bit busy. We were able to walk around and on it at felt like we were in a fairy tale. It is just so beautiful !! You can have a great view to the whole city, you can also see the Parliament on the other side of the Danube. The Matthias Church is next to the Halaszbastya, make sure you will visit this too. We waited for the lights to come up in the evening and transformed the area a little bit and of course it was stunning. I think Halaszbastya is a must see sight if you are in Budapest.
OK. Paid for tickets for this but didn't really need too as you can do is walk on the walls. You can get the views from the tower where the cafe is situated.
Wonderful view. One of the most scenic views in Budapest, with a nice little restaurant tucked in.
What views !!. Climb to the top largest turret, past the restaurant on the terrace, for a tiny coffee shop with the most amazing views. We found it by chance. Didn't seem to be any signs for it.

true sense of elegance. For those seeking elegance and chic outlet, Fisherman's Bastion offers that. The setup and the ambience inspires luxury within privacy surroundings at the same time enjoy the authentic Hungarian music
a bit of a rip-off. It's nice to take a picture of Matthias Church from here, but the view of Pest is otherwise the same as from below. Not expensive, but can be skipped.
View is Awesome. You can't go to Budapest without going to this to see the beauty of the city
Breathtaking. Fairy tale place with amazing views. Beautifully maintained also.

Too commercial. The views from Fisherman's Bastion are great but unfortunately most of the viewing areas have been taken over by cafes, so unless you pay to sit down and have a coffee you have to compete with all the other visitors for the limited viewing areas available. I also wasn't keen on the way this whole area has been restored. No sense of history at all. It looks more like Disney's Magic Kingdom to me.

What a beautiful view. For me this is the second most beautiful view, just after the one from Gellert Hill. You can easily see Parliament. There is also a bar at the top of Bastion, where you can sit, drink a wine, and watch Budapest. I really recommend visit here.

Almost like a giant picture frame - but I loved it!. I went here in July and I didn't think it was that crowded or touristy? More so than some areas, but not enough to detract. So the whole structure is a little bit random - why is it here? But the same could be said about the Eiffel Tower. Personally, I thought the combination of fairy-tale architecture and the brilliant view
a "must see". nothing to dislike, really, don't miss it and enjoy the view of the Danube, of the Parliament, of the Academy, and of many else
Beautiful Location. Have to say that this has got to be one of the best views in Budapest. Despite the poorly placed Hilton Hotel, it is a beautiful and highly photogenic place.

Always lovely to be here!. This is one of those places where I always love to be! The amazing view all around is so beautiful! Never eat in the restaurant, as it is strongly touristic, and very sad they improved the payment system, but away from these unpleasant things, this place is amazing!
ARABELLA FIRST NIGHT. SUNG IN GERMAN with subtitles in hungarian didn,t matter we enjoyed the singing and the superb opera house

A beautiful spot.. This is a beautiful spot with magnificent views of Pest.
We reached the Fisherman's Bastion after touring Buda castle and Mátyás church.
Make sure you climb as high as you can as the view from the top is so very rewarding.
Excellent Views, beautiful place. Great place to walk around on a sunny day. Wonderful view. This was where the Free Budapest Tour ended.
Amazing. Thats a really amazing spot of Budapest, honestly I never seen such a beautiful place.
Some of the best views in Budapest. We visted a few times both during the day and at night. Really amazing views.

Best views of Duna. It's the best place to make photos! But there are always crowded so you should wait until other people move further. Also there are nice souvenirs shop nearby plus of course you can visit Museum of wine, Labyrinth and other attractions (there are lot of them nearby)

Brilliant views across the Danube. Take the hop-on, hop-off bus or the funicular railway (don't walk up Castle Hill!). Worth it just for the views from the walls across the Danube. Maybe spoilt somewhat with the modern building (a hotel?) in the background and a cheap souvenir shop at the bottom of the long steps as you exit, but that's tourism for you. We walked down back to our hotel on Buda side and were happy we had seen the Bastion close up.

Unique and unsual if not a bit touristy. The bastion was one of the main sites that we wanted to see whilst in Budapest, it can be seen a top castle hill from the Pest side. When we visited the bastion itself it was very busy with a lot of tour groups and it was a little confusing which areas of the bastion you could walk around for free and which you had to pay for but it was a great visit.
stunning. Beautiful views across the city...a must to anyone visiting this beautiful city.
very nice walkabout ,breathtaking view. beautiful old buildings around cobbled streets, georgeous old Cafe / Patisserie called RUSSWURM ,
Like a dream. Seemed like a tower from a fairytale, especially when the sun was going down!

On top of Budapest. Lovely area full of history to stroll around,sensational views over the city. Lots of interesting sights and great places to eat and enjoy a truly Grand old city,not overcrowded even at peak times.
Nice building. Very nice building with lovely views to Pest - the other side of the Danube. Be aware of conmen, there are pleny around.
Romantic and beautiful. Very romantic and beautiful view at the top of this place overlooking the city. Convenient to walk from my hotel.
A must see. A must see like a Fairytale Castle and great views over the Danube

Fantastic views... and that's it.. The site offers a beautiful view on the Pest side of Budapest, you can view the parliament building, the chain bridge etc. and get a good view on the layout of the city.It's only another touristic point, it doesn't serve any other purpose, so don't expect at any else than a great view, the sculptures & architecture and the beauty of the place.While there, visit the rest of the surroundings, and go to the museum and the president's work-house near the funicular.
Great views. Great views of the city from here but it gets very crowded and you need to keep a look out for the pick pockets.

Take a view from the Halaszbastya at night to see the ChainBridge. Amazing and very romantic:). Take a walk around the Buda castle district and have the view of the Danube and surronding from the Fischermancastle at night. The most romantic place to be:). I love it!!!
old. I went with my daughter in the winter and weclean and re amazed and how
Fantastic views. Free to wander about. Fantastiv views across the Danube to Pest.
Great view in the city!. A "must go" place! The view is extremely beautiful. With its castle-like towers and series of overlooks, u can non-stop take lots of photo

great views. We did a short city tour (cityrama) that brought us here for a 45 min stop. Nice for a walk around, great views, beautiful church...but very touristy. Don't plan to shop, just stop in for the views and pictures, then head back to town or whatever your next stop is.

Wear your Hiking Shoes!. We walked from central downtown, along the Danube River, and across the chain bridge. From there we took the inclines to the top and walked from there to the Fisherman's Bastion. This walk covered at least five attractions of Budapest.The walk and scenery was above average.
