The shops and cafes smelled of local dishes, such as goulash soup and fresh baked bread. We found a marzipan museum and marzipan shop at the top as well. Some of the best marzipan I ever ate. The ice cream vendors were selling sweets and goodies as well.Many photo opportunities and friendly people were abounding.This is a nice place to visit and get some much needed exercise. If you do not like steep hills, then take the incline rail to the top. It reminded me of the inclines in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania that I rode on as a kid in the fourth grade, whilst on a school field trip.If you're going to Budapest, you won't be disappointed.
Wonderful view. The views over the city from here were wonderful,But try to get here early as it gets packed with visitors.
Do not miss this!. Beautiful building and very much detail to it...fantastic views of pest side of the city from the Bastion...wonderful, nothing much more to say except visit!!!!!
Fairytale pretty.... Incredible views across Pest and the Danube with plenty of viewpoints.
interesting. take some sandwiches and battle of wine, step aside from the crowd and have a good break. Not sure if it's quite legal but very pleasant
Great view to the city of Pest. Fantastic location to overview the city of Pest, including the Parliament, the Danube river...
amazing view. free of charge and provides the visitor with an amazing view of budapest

Great view, good atmosphere, but touristy. We were lucky to visit in March as it is still a slow time for tourists. The entire area is charming with the architecture, hidden ruins, etc., but definitely on the edge of becoming a Disney site. There were 2 men in costume with birds of prey who would not move away from the fountain (they want you to pay for your picture with them and the birds). The shops are very touristy, and the usual artists, musicians, etc. are sprinkled around.If you explore a bit ruins of the original church can be found along with some quiet. We were not able to go into the church as it was closed for some sort of construction work for the week. Every tour stops here for a while, or it is easy enough to reach by bus (#16). Walking down to the chain bridge is relatively easy (you obviously could walk up also) over a set of stairs through a 'park'. It's one of the boxes on the Budapest list.
Looks like Disney. The view and stonework beautiful. Also beautiful at night with the lights playing on the water - romantic
nice spot. a guy was busking on his guitar the day we visited and he just added to the atmosphere! well worth a visit.

Great views around the old walls. We did a short city tour (cityrama) that brought us here for a 45 min stop. Nice for a walk around, great views, beautiful church...but very touristy. Don't plan to shop, just stop in for the views and pictures, then head back to town or whatever your next stop is.
Beautiful view. The scenery from the Fisherman's Bastion is definitely worth the walk up (although there are easier way to get there). It has a wonderful view of the Danube and the Parliament.

A sight to behold!. Even before getting down from the tour bus, we were wowed by the majestic size of the Castle hill. Coupled with some February snow, it makes the Bastion and the hill even more beautiful and mystical. It is designed with neo-Gothic and neo-Romanesque with round pointed roof and climbing stairways, which reminds me of Disney castle. This area is once known as the Fisherman's Town, hence the name Fisherman's Bastion. Everywhere in the Fisherman's Bastion is a photo stop. We took the stairs up and were greeted with the most beautiful panoramic view of the Budapest. Next to the Fisherman's Bastion is the Matthias Church which is picturesque, together with the wintery snow, it paints a wonderful and charming picture.

Sweeping overlook of the city. Take the funicular up from the chain bridge. From there you can walk around the castle, have lunch at several nice restaurants and do some shopping. A bit touristy but a premium location.
picture perfect vew. The castle district is a must see for anyone visiting which naturally will lead you to this interesting bit of history.

A fairytale setting with a breathtaking view. This looks recently refurbished as the stone was spotless. The spikey towers were very scenic and there were amazing views over the Danube to Pest. There was lots to see in daytime, and at nighttime with the illuminations it was world class.

The most romantic place in Budapest. although it is fairly recently built, the castle is built in Gothic style and is very beautiful... Is the place were I feel back in time... The Hilton is built inside the Castle

Amazing view. Set up on Castle Hill, Fisherman's Bastion is a lovely spot to wander around and get some great photos.
Take the funicular up to Buda Castle and spend time taking in the sights and if you're lucky you will see the changing of the Guards.
Beautiful. The view was great because it was a clear day. A part of the Bastion was closed at the time (don't know why) so we couldn't walk around.
Great views. Great views over the Danube and Pest. Take bus 16 from the Pest side to take you to the top of the hill.
The view is just wowing. The view is spectacular. The walk is fun specially going down. Enough said

Breathtaking!. I could go back again and again, I supect that in the summer months whilst the warm waether would make you want to linger longer that the crowds would prevent you from wanting to do so. The view of the Fisherman's Bastion from the Pest side is beautiful to photograph too.
Picturesque "fortress". A wonderful vantage point to see The Danube and The Parlament Building (Oh and the 5* hotels opposite!)
Wonderful. like a fairytale castle, wondrful situatied in Buda, lovely these small towers!

Beware of the Hustlers. Absolutely beautiful place and worth a visit but leave your money in the hotel safe. There are a group of middle aged, professional Hustlers and lookouts, that pretend to be tourists and locals. They dress accordingly and carry tourist guides, maps, local newspapers. They trick you into playing games ie Thimble game on a fold up table. The man with the table is middle aged, over weight, with dark curly hair. I watched in the distance whilst they played. the guy pretending to be a tourist kept losing. They saw me watching from a distance, they asked me for advice, which I gave. They asked me for 50p, I thought it was very little money and was happy to give it. I opened my wallet and the one pretending to be the tourist grabbed my money (£250) they gathered all their things table, chair and all ran off. I screamed but no-one helped. I went to the tourist information and asked for the police. I was told I had to get a taxi across the city and report it to the police station. I didn't I later saw the men again in the same place. I was scared so left them alone. I had no way of reporting it.

The first place where Foreign visitors goes. There is always alot of visitors around the Fisherman Bastion and alot of expensive souvenirs seeling around this place. Very easy to get there by bus. Walking around the bastion give you beautiful views overlooking the House of Parliment and it surrounding Mainly Pest. Alot of expensive cafe and restaurant around there. Everyone who visit Budapest always go there first, the coach would take people there. It a famous landmark

Gorgeous views - well worth a visit. The Bastion itself is very pretty and you get fantastic views across the city.We visited in February and it was still pretty busy so it was a little disappointing to see the bar/restaurant closed. There was a tiny place serving drinks, but we would have loved to have eaten there.

nice view. It's a really nice place to see during your stay. It's a nice building and it's a good place to take a photo from te amazing views. Sometimes it could be quite busy here, so the best time to come is in the morning/ evening.
Must see. Perfect view of the city. There is a wonderful restaurant with live music.
wow!. What an amazing sight, a definite must see if you are in Budapest. We actually got the hop on hop off tour bus and found this was the handiest way to check out all this gorgeous architecture.

What a view!. This place is beautiful, go up into the stone castle thing and you get the most marvelous of views!! the church in the bastion looks brand new and is decorated with a beautiful bright mosaic roof! put it on your list of things to see!!!
Unique Budapest panorama. Part of the UNESCO built heritage. View of the downtown along the Danube with the Parliament and Chain Bridge
Great view. This place gave a great view over Budapest. Just infront of Matayas church.
A fairytale castle!!!!. We visited the Castle Hill in heavy snow, and it felt like being in a fairytale, it was so beautiful. Well worth a visit and the views over the city are gorgeous.

Good views over the city, worth spending an hour or so there. A fairly interesting place in the castle area. Worth wondering up and down and experiencing the view over the city. Felt safe and friendly. It was packed with tourists though.
Great views. There isn't much to this but it does have the best views in Budapest. Take in as part of a walk around the old town.
Good place or a romantic diner. I had a salmon cotlette and was a quite tasty dish! The fish soup is also remarkable.
Amazing Architecture. Considering its age, amazing building a bit like a massive 'folly'
Fisherman's Bastion. Interesting architecture and great views, just wander around and take photos.
What a view. Great view of the parliament and bridges, get the vernacular railway from the bottom of the chain bridge then walk across great place with lots of nice places to eat

Wonderful. This is not only a fantastic way to see a panoramic of the city, but also beautiful in it's own right and 100% worth the time to see it! Plus Mathias church and the ruins of a monastery are right there in it's clutches in the castle district!
Romantic late night walk. In the snow the whole area was magical, but at any time the views across the Danube and Pest are awesome.

Panoramic point. Even Hungarian people like to go up to the Castle district (1. district) because of the fantastic panorama from the Fisherman's bastion. It is a half-an-hour program to walk under the archs of the Bastion and take many beautiful pictures of the Pest side and the river Danube. The Fisherman's Bastion is right besides the St Mathias Church and within a walking distance to other thourist attractions. Eating and drinking could be quite expensive there. Public transport from the Erzsébet tér (bus 16) and from the Széll Kálmán tér (previously Moszkva tér) can take you up there.
Well worth a visit. Beautiful place, even better as the city below was covered in snow.

Great Views of Budapest and the Danube. If you want the best views of the city and the Parliament, then head to the Fisherman's Bastion. Not only is the site beautiful, the photo ops are incredible !!
Free view... Great wee place to get a super view over the amazing parliament building and Budapest. Shame about the large Hilton Hotel nearly on top of it.
beautiful. I recommend this for summer and a clear sunny day. what a view.

Fairy tail place. Halaszbastya is a wonderful, romantic place with such an amazing view on Peste, that up there, in the sun, you can't not to feel like a part of a fairy tail. It also offers touristical attractions like street musicians and middle-age knights that you can take picture with. There is also a bar, where you can take a coffee and enjoy beautiful view. Must-see place.
Magnificent. One of the best views in the world. Dont miss it.

One of the most stunning monument in Buda.. Fisherman's Bastion is located on the top of Buda, in the same complex as Matias Corvino Templom (one of the most particular, unexpected church I visited in Europe).You can get there from the city centre of Pest, as well, by a city bus. The vista from Fisherman's Bastion is stunning. The whole complex is kept very well, and for italian people, you can even book an Italian-speaking guide, to do the tour of the Church and of the Bastion.
Wow!!. This was fantastic - we truly loved the Bastion. The views were incredible and the sellers and live music there were amazing!

One of the most beautiful places I've ever seen :D. Fisherman's Bastion is an amazing construction, diferent to whatever building I had seen; and from there you can have the most beautiful view of the city of Budapest. You can see all the bridges, the Parliament... I was really shocked by this place :)
Fabulour views over the danube. Yet more beautiful buildings from many eras and all individual. The views over the danube and the parliament building were fabulous.

Beautiful Views and Architecture. Any visit to Budapest cannot be completed until you visit Fisherman's Bastion. The architecture is one of a kind and I haven't seen anything like it in my extensive travels. The views of course are stunning looking onto the Parliament and Danube.
Beautiful views over Budapest. A must see - close to Buda Castle and it's fun to go up on the funicular railway to get to it!

Beautiful sight. The Fisherman's bastion should be on your must-see-list. It's so pretty itself, and the walk up to castle hill is so rewarding because it offers you a great view of the city.
I think this is the prettiest thing Budapest has to offer. Liked it better than the parliament!

Intereseting bastion. I love the architecture of this bastion, it takes you to a different time and place.
It also offers a view over the city and it is a good place for beautiful pictures.
Yad being there five times and it's always a stunning view and feelings.. If you forget about a wind everything at and around is great1
Great view to the city and a lovely walk. I have walked up there many times before and always enjoy it. Lovely architecture, part of history and fabulous view from the top. Lovely

Amazing view!!!!!!!!!!!!!. I visited the place during the summer and the winter as well. Of course it is way better to sit around during the summer to enjoy the view but if you have the chance to go at the winter, drink a hot cider and just breath the cold refreshing air while enjoying the view.

Magnificent view and high quality food. The stunning view deserves all!
The food is trying to be very innovative, but it is not in fact. It is better, than the average served in the Castle area, that is sure. But no any signs outside the restaurant to tell that there is a fine dining experience in the bastion...
Great view and pictures!. Not too much to see but a great place to take pictures

Don't miss this area. Gorgeous views abound from the 7 turrets (especially in the evening).
Another nearby "don't miss" is the nearby wonderful Cafe Raszwurm - for fantastic pastries and the ultimate real hot chocolate.
Amazing!. I loved this place, one of my favourite buildings! It so unique!

Fantastic Panoramic Views from a Fairytale Location. I had seen the Fisherman's Bastion with it fanciful architecture and St. Matthias Church with its frilly spire from the Pest side across the Danube and it looked so beautiful. I walked across the impressive Chain Bridge with its pair of huge lions at either end and then along a street on the Buda side to some stairs that took me straight up to Fisherman's Bastion. One can take the funicular ride for a fee if you do not want to climb the stairs or take the bus to Holy Trinity Square. If you have a day pass it will cover the bus ride.I loved the architecture of Fishermen’s’ Bastion with its 7 Pointy Domes representing the 7 Magyar tribes and pretty ramparts with arched lookouts, turrets, walkway on the second level above, and the wonderful UNESCO heritage views of Pest from the Bastion. The Danube with its boats, stunning Parliament Building, and other landmarks take your breath away and have you taking many pictures.I viewed the Plague Column on Holy Trinity Square beside Fisherman's Bastion - much smaller version of the one in Vienna.I also visited St. Matthias Church on Holy Trinity Square - ancient and beautiful church.

it's a wonderful place to see the city ,. it's a wonderful place to see the city , wonderfuly shaped.... . I loved the architecture . There is a short funicular ride that you can pay for to get to the top of Buda or you can just walk up or take it one way and walk down. You can pay to get to the top or walk up the stairs to a part that is for a cafe/restaurant for free.
beautiful view. .we liked this sight very much and also the church next to it

Beautiful!. Was very neat and aesthetically pleasing. Right near the water, this monument and almost mini-castle to our poisson friends was so cool, and just added to the incredible history of Budapest. Saw this in January 2008.
Beautiful view. Magnificent view of Pest from above. Beautiful architecture. Be aware of pickpockets here as busy tourist times can sometimes be a little crowded.
Great food and view!. The food and view were wonderful. It was quite crowded and the method for who got the next table was nonexistant.

Wonderful place to visit. I finally visited this place after admiring it from across the river near where I worked. I loved the architecture though it was swamped with tourists. There is a short funicular ride that you can pay for to get to the top of Buda or you can just walk up or take it one way and walk down. You can pay to get to the top or walk up the stairs to a part that is for a cafe/restaurant for free.

best part of budapest. we did the fishermans bastion on the last day of our trip, and we were glad we did, beautiful buildings and panaramic views from the top of the river danube and parliment building.
Like Budapest's Disney Castle. I enjoyed the castle feel of the Bastion, climbing up to the walkways and the photos I could take from there. It was a great place to visit!
Lovely views of city. I loved it here, but I am biast it's where my boyfriend proposed to me!! but it has a beautiful view of the city.

Fab views day and night. DO NOT miss this place! The views are unique and you can fully appreciate the beauty and splendour of Budapest stretched out before you along the Danube, either day or (quite spectacular given the city's wonderful illuminatio of its buildings) night.And adjacent there is a superb restaurant - Halsbatya Etterem.
Woaou!!. The view from Fisherman's Bastion is breathtaking!!!
Picturesque, but busy.. Understandably there were hundreds of people there. It does give wonderful views of the city.
Romantic place. Typical Budapest sightseeing place, it is on the Castle hill and looks very romantic. There is a cafe/restaurant inside - very expensive as you pay for the romance ;).
Amazing structure. This attraction was just in front of our hotel, The Hilton. We were able to walk easily around the area and take in the wonderful view from there.
Fairy atmosphere. The site is wonderful,with direct view to the Parliament.Worth visiting also after sunset for the view.The architecture is very interesting,it may be crowded with other tourists
Another breathtaking view. Fantastic building that resembles a sand castle provides a great view of Pest from its hillside on the Buda side.
Beautiful place1. Go there after climbing up the hill and enjoy the views! Go through all of them, they are really pretty
Great place for the views of Budapest and the river.. We enjoyed the live music and the little bar at the top of the tower.

The best part of Castle Hill. I know Fisherman's Bastion was never actually a real bastion (it was built in the early 1900s as a viewing terrace), but it looks awesome! Lovely views, lovely turrets, and lovely castle-feel. Way better than Buda Castle. :)
Sightseeing at its best. The views, Matias church - go inside it is worth the entry fee!

Wonderful view from up the hill. I walked across the Chain Bridge and up the hill to Fisherman's Bastion on a cloudless sunny day. One of the few places you must visit while in Budapest. The view of Parliament from here is very nice.
Very Nice. Very Nice as well as the Mathias Church!! You Shouldn't miss it!!
Great views - even in winter. Superb views and very close to Matthias church which is also well worth a visit

Awesome!. Another place that we visited and just love the place. The view was so nice and it was a perfect place for taking beautiful pictures. I have nothing bad to say about this place. Recommend to everyone
wonderful place. Very interesting place. The view on Pesta is beautiful.
What a View. One of the best city views in the world to be experienced from here!
Fisherman's Bastion. Statues and fiew were beautiful - the stairs might be a problem for people with difficulties.
Another must see in Budapest. The history, the location and the architecture is stunning, a must see when in the Castle District of Budapest.
The View at night - MUST SEE. Excellent view over the Danube, Parliament and city.
Crowded. Very crowded look over Pest on a fancy build especially for tourist structure.

Fairy Tale Edifice. Okay, the Fisherman's Bastion is not a medieval castle, in fact it is barely 100 years old, but it is fun. Go there for the terrific views of the city, the unparalleled photo opportunities, or just pass through to visit the castle district. Even in winter, tours will fill the main courtyard during the midday hours.I did not expect it to be entertaining, but our B&B was practically on the steps, so we explored it and loved it.

A view for Cinderella. The view over Pest and the Parliament is the main point here. The bastion itself is a construction from around the 1890-ies. Feels mostly as taken out of a fairy tale. More interesting is the Matyas church which has been the crowning church of many kings and emperors (during the Habsburg period of the double monarchy). Although rebuilt many times it has its origins in the 13th century. It's surprisingly small, but has a very nice genuine feeling. The surroundings are equally nice, with the exception of the horrendous Hilton hotel 10 meters from the sanctuary.
Cool site (see it with Castle Hill). Saw it with Free Walking Tours. YAY! go with them or by yourself. It's amazing! Not a sight on it's own. But gorgeous!

best view of the city in the sunset and at night. It has all been said before - a fairy-tale architecture, not to be missed in a visit to the Buda hill & fortress. We were lucky to be there by the sunset time, and could see Pest covered in a warm golden light, Parliament building looking gold polished. It offers the most spectacular settings for pictures with a view. Budapest by night is also spectacular, so stay up until the evening lights fire on. You won't regret it!
Go for Best View of City & Parliament building. This is the best possible view you can get of the Hungarian Parliament building and the best part is that it is FREE. This is #1 place to visit.
nice. great place to take some pictures or to enjoy the view... very nice
Very good place for a nice panorama. You can make nice pictures of the Pesta side of town including House of Parliament. It is indeed a nice view from there
Fantastic views. Great views and people watching throughout this area
Nice view to Pest. Although it is very famous, the best thing that it's worthy about it is the view to Pest side.

Amazing view. A bit of a walk. satisfaction guaranteed when you get there...This view makes Budapest a place to remember and revisited. the city with the Danube river in between with the bridges over the river, the colors of the buildings- all with a bit of luck when the sun comes out...

Other-worldly if a bit overrun. The Fisherman's Bastion is a popular tourist spot on the Buda Hill and its unique architecture certainly is reason enough for the hordes to descend upon it. Photographers looking for a wholly unique subject will be delighted by the Fisherman's Bastion with its whimsical and mismatching columns and fairytale-like towers. As an added bonus, the St. Mattias Church stands adjacent to the Bastion and the views of the Danube River and Pest districts, including the Parliament building, are unparalleled from the Bastion. The only negative aspect of the Fisherman's Bastion are the hordes of tourists and the accompanying tourist guidebook hawkers. I would suggest a very late night or early morning visit to the Bastion to beat the crowds and to catch Budapest illuminated in all its glory.

Don't miss this restuarant. Incredible food and superb service with a view of Budapest you will not forget. Great wine list and treat yourself to Hungarian wine as they are among the best in the world and not easily found outside the country. I went in the evening which added to the magic. You will need to get a taxi to and from so make sure to tell the restaurant when you depart.
Disney come to life. In the states, the only thing we have to compare to this is disneyland. How amazing to see this Bastion. It is truly beautiful. It is almost whimsical.
Nice view on Pest. This monument is nicely restored and provides and excellent view on the Pest part of Budapest. It can be quite crowdy since this is a tourist hotspot.
Looks like a Disney castle. But it is not! Close to the Royal Palace and the National Galery. Excellent view over Pest.
Nice place, excellent view over Danube and Budapest. The view from Fisherman's Bastion is breathtaking.
Best view of parliament. Great views of parliament across the Danube make this a must visit site.
Nice with beautiful views of the Danube. Nice piece of architecture overlooking the Danube with nice views of the parlianent house. Take the funicular to go there!

Disney Land in Budapest???. I found it a bit funny to see similar structures...but i am keen to find out who copied who :).... the views from this place are greeat..specially the Parlamnet... i was there on a foggy day so could not capture most views but got a glimpse..
Great food, but an even better view. The view from this place is truly magnificent. The food is a bit of a mix of French cuisine and the more traditional Hungarian kitchen.
wonderful view. You can have coffee and watch the view. There was also a group playing Jazz music while we had coffee.

Neat building with a cool castle-like feel and views of the city and river.. Great place to take some photos, have a picnic snack or lunch and take in views of the city. Also, may find a few artisans selling photos and paintings here.
Very touristy. This is a good attraction with good city and river views but some of it is restricted and it does get very busy.
Great views. Great views from the top of the river and pest - great for night time photography!
Great. If you are a movie fan or watch documentries you will recognise the buildings
good photos. nice place to take photos. It a photo that says 'I've been to Hungary'
The view is unrivaled!. This is a fabulous viewpoint of Budapest day or night.

fabulous architechture with breathtaking views. We visited the Fisherman's Bastion when we took a day to visit the Castle Area. It's very beautiful and you can climb around the ramparts (not for those with vertigo though) and get great views out across the river. The Hilton has built a restaurant into part of it and the prices are not as high as you might imagine if you consider the unique location.

Heart of Hungary. This place is where the Hungarian history, soul lies. The csigan musicians here play songs for centuries. This is a sacred place, you feel it. Try not to see the big hotel though, it does not fit in the picture at all. Has the most magnificient view of Budapest, and a cosy cafe too ! Within the Buda castle, adjacent to church, the national museum, on route of every kind of tours, you will not miss it. And better not miss it.

fantastic views on budapest. i was surprised to know it's not as ancient as the castle. makes it fairytale style. the views are great from up there. avoid the cafe there, it's basically a tourist trap, however was nice to sip on a cuppa looking allover the city!
amazing views back across the river. and we were lucky enough to see a rainbow! Definitely worth the climb up a few steps.

Oh what a view!. This was one of our favorite places from which to enjoy the view of Budapest. The Parliament is straight accross the river and the whole scene, specially around sunset is just magnificent.
Beautifully. Beautifully restored and kept. Breathtaking views of Pest and the Danube

2nd best view of Budapest. Probably the 2nd best place to see Budapest from, (Behind Gellert Hill), in my opinion. If you are in the castle district they are hard to miss. A beautiful structure. During certain months you can get a great cup of coffee to stop and enjoy the view here.

Great views of Pest. Our B&B was close by so my husband went up several evenings to take some nighttime photos from here to across the river. There are some areas that you have to pay for to access, but the free sections also have great views. The photos turned out great.

Very Beautiful. Looks like a sand castle and the view to the other side ( pest ) is beautiful.
It's worth visiting yhe cathedral
Great view over the Danube. The best view over Budapest. One can see all the city. A must see

Disappointing.. This is a good place to view sites and stroll but also many tourists block the way making any photos difficult. However, like many other local places it has been well maintained and renovated.

The ultimate fairytale castle, with the best view of the Danube. This amazing castle of glistening white stone will bring you back to the fairy tales of your childhood. Its round turrets, crenellated parapets, and spiral columns will make you imagine a palace of marble and ice; you'll keep expecting a princess to emerge with a flourish of trumpets. It extends along part of the eastern wall of Buda Castle, thereby giving tourists the best view of the Danube and Pest.It was built at the end of the 19th century on the portion of the castle's walls that, during times of emergency, was protected by the fishermen's guild during the Middle Ages. Its celestial beauty is all the more incongruous when you imagine the rough medieval fishermen for whom it is named. There is no fee to enter the bastion from November through February; the rest of the year, there is a modest entry fee. There is never a fee to enter Buda Castle and get a good view of the bastion from many angles; it's a fantastic photo opportunity, by day and at night.Some portions of the bastion are reachable only by stairs and therefore aren't wheelchair-accessible. Beware of the grifters who frequent its upper walkway, playing variations of three-card monte and the shell game, using stakes of counterfeit currency.

A Must Visit in Budapest. Take the Funicular to the top and walk to the Fisherman's Bastion to get some unbelievable views of Budapest. Many little cafe's and small restaurants in area as well as souvenir shops and St. Mathias Church which does charge to go in for viewing and pictures.
Pretty, fairytale like!. Looks like something from a Disney movie. Worth the visit for the wonderful view of Budapest and just wondering around.

Fantastic Views & interesting history. Perched high on the hill overlooking Budapest & the Danube, Fisherman's Bastion is a location you must visit. The history & architecture of the site is a feature of a visit to Budapest you will not forget. Particularly when you review great photographs on you return home.Nereby is a beautiful church

Stunning. This is one of the most beautiful places I have visited, the architecture and the views from the turrets was unbelievable even though the weather was grey it didn't detract from its beauty, and looking through the arches over the danube up to Margaret Island, especially after dark when the chain bridge was lit up and the Houses of Parliament and also St. Matias Church was in my opinion mind blowing.
Beautiful example of architecture. this was close to disneyland fairytale type of architecture with rich history
tourist location. the most touristic area of budapest and great place for photos
Must see. Beautifully located on Castle Hill. Offers a spectacular view over the city. Interesting architecture and fabulous restaurant inside!
Fisherman's bastion. This was just above our Hotel. magnificent stonework and the view from it over Budapest are amazing..
extremly expensive. you can spend a load of money, for great panoramic view, but nothing else. Service is good, but you might want to stop by a Mc Donalds afterwards.
Great view. Wörth going up The hill - amazing view? Close by a Marzipan Shop (entre into Museum is a Little extensive compared what you get).
a must. looked so nice with panorama at the danube and the parlement house
photo time. Take lots of pictures here..it is absolutely dreamy! We paid to go into the Mattias Church but I don't think that is necessary....

From Bude to Pest. Good to see both sides of the city, you are high up and can fully appreciate Pest from this viewpoint. Great building but watch out for the local scam artists who try to relieve you of your money. Had a great brunch above a local wine/mini mart shop on left just before castle.

Magical. I felt like I was standing in a giant white sandcastle when I went up inside here. I guess during the summer there's an entrance fee, but it was free in October. It didn't take very long to walk around, so I don't know if I would have been as happy with it if I had had to pay for it. If you have a few days, you might want to go up on Castle Hill on a sunny day, to take full advantage of the views. My pictures aren't as great as they could have been, since it was foggy the day we went. Still worth the walk, though!
Imposing. beautiful structure and great view of the city. Nice photo-ops

Def yields the right view for pictures!!. One traveler wrote "magical" and I couldn't agree more!! ..If you happen to be lucky like me and get a particular spot alone for a while to just take in the sights...its just..beautiful! Bring your camera!!
Unusual and interesting, great views. Again on Buda side with great views over the Danube, to Parliament etc.

One of the best in Budapest. For me one of the best. For the beautiful architecture. For spectacular view from there. And for the incredible climate of the place. I was so lucky that my hotel- Burg hotel was located just in front of St Mathias church so I could admire this place even from the hotel window. The view of Budapest with Parliament from there is awasome during a day and night as well. You must go and see this. You can take a bus nr 16 from Deak Ter or the other stop near the Danube river and bridge if you want.

What a structure. We had read that you need to pay to go to the upper level of the Fisherman's Bastion. Although we were prepared to pay as we didn't want to miss out on the sights, we were pleasantly surprised to find that the entry to the upper level was left open and was unmanned. And everyone was hurrying in. So why wouldn't we? Got fantastic views for free!

The moment is magical. All of what you heard is true ... there's something very magical about the surroundings and views. BUT most importantly, walk up the stairs and have a cup of coffee in the nice cafe. You're on the top of the helm with breathtaking views of the Danube and city of Pest. Probably the most unforgettable cup of coffee of your life!
Loved this tourist spot. This is the BEST vista for pictures!!! Make time for this spot for your photos and simple reflection of a beautiful city.
Another must go. The view is great and the area is wonderful. The women still peddle their tablecloths and embroidery as they did back in the communist era. That hasn't changed.

Fisherman's Bastion is a Fairy Tale Monument. This fanciful structure inspired one at Disneyland. On Buda's Castle Hill, this part of the hill was defended by fisherman during times of siege centuries ago. This structure overlooks the Danube and gives a great view of Pest. Don't even consider paying the fee to go up to the top. It is a rip-off. The view from the low tier is just as good and free.
Nice outlook over the city. Worth seeing, it's like taking a step back in time. Great view over the city. We simply loved it.
Magical!. I felt like I was in Disney World! At night everything lights up and it is even better!
It feels like Disneyland, but it is real. What a special structure is this. It feels like a fairytale, but the building is very old. You have a nice view to the Danube and the Parliament.

Every time better. this is not the first time i visit it but i happy that this time there were no reconstruction works happening! it is an amazing place to be at, you feel overwhelmed an in a different dimension historically speaking! i would recommend it with all my hearth! It's worth seeing, it' s well kept, with an amazing view, with good places to eat or enjoy a coffee and feed of the incredible view!
Nice view. At Fisherman's Bastion you have a terrific view over Pest, so do take pictures! Fisherman's Bastion has an impressive architecture to see and admire.

A monument with a view. Forget the historical aspect about it. You could just watch the city below you, the sun fighting to appear through the clouds and the Danube winding its way down. Warning: You could just sit and admire the view and forget all about the rest of your schedules!
Spectacular View. What a wonderful respite from the contemporary Buda side! Great view of Buda and the Danube River. Very crowded even though it was not high season. Beware of pick-pockets.
Enchanting. Visually stunning and also provides beautiful views of the City and the Danube.
Stunning. A must on the sightseeing tour. Make sure to see this
like Rapunzel's castle!. On the Buda side, this can be seen from Pest, but a walk around it is a must. Fantastic views and a beautiful place.
Great Viewpoint. Wonderful views over Pest. Great nighttime views back up to the bastion.
Perfect. Best location in the Castle district. Dont miss this .. worthy to go inside and watch it. full panoramic view of the City
Don't buy a ticket!!!. It has a wonderful view of the city. Don't miss it! And don't pay to go in, the ticket only allows you to get to the top, which makes no difference at all...
Lovely. Lovely place with stunning views over the city.Vist St mathias church at same time.
Ignore the tourists, enjoy the view!. lower level - free, top level 900 HUFs - view is the same!
Beautiful. Look like something from a fairy tale! Apparently used in a number of films and tv productions

gipsy music and nice view. Fisherman`s bastion located very close to my hotel, Gold Hotel Buda, so I decided to check this place one night. The view is very nice from here and I was astonished by the wonderful buildings and spirit of the Buda Castle area. There were a restaurant in the Fisherman`s bastion, where I could listen to gipsy music.
Stunning views. Great place to get great views of the Parliament and Pest.

Amazing attraction. A great place to take pictures. The Fisherman's Bastion is one of my favorite places in Budapest. The best time to go there is when it's twilight. Just before night. I was there at the end of december, it was snowing, and it was absolutely beautiful. You simply must visit this. :)
Beautiful view of Pest. A must see!. The history, the ambiance and the breathtaking view of Pest and the Danube
Another great photo location. As with other sites in Budapest, this one offers another great location for photos and a breath taking view of the Danube.....
nice but too busy. the fisherman's bastion looks like in a fary tail - but on this October Sunday it was definitively too crowded!

Consider a guided tour. We were on a hop on hop off bus and decided to spend at least an hour to see St Matthias Church and the Fisherman's Bastion. The tour bus stop was at least 5 blocks from the attractions but that allowed us some time to explore the shops along the way.The Fisherman's Bastion has seven towers for the seven tribes that settled Hungary and the views of Buda, Pest and the Danube are breathtaking. St. Matthias Church is the site of royal weddings and coronations.After touring we had the feeling that we should have had a tour guide. Although we enjoyed our stop, we felt that we had missed a lot by not taking a tour.

you don't need to pay!. This was very confusing - if you enter near the Matyas Church, you have to buy a ticket and queue up. But after you've enjoyed the stunning views from there, and you come out the other end, you realise that you could have seen 90% of the same view from a little bit further along, without paying a penny! Still, it was a bit quieter there, but I wished I'd had the choice and not felt conned!

Beautiful views of Budapest & architecture. There are so many beautiful photo opportunitys of the city of Budapest. There are lots of ledges, stairs, window openings, fountains, churches etc to take photos. Great for keepsake or group photos. T

great picture taking opportunities. It's impressive enough ... turrets, projections, parapets, stairways, neo-Gothic, neo-Romanesuqe, it's all here. Great views of the city from here, and equally good for people watching. It's certainly worth a visit, and St. Matthias is also there .Still, thoughts of Disneyland with turrets kept popping in to my mind .. I personally enjoyed the old town much more..

Castle Hill Complex - a must see. Fisherman's Bastion is a series of battlements that provide some of the best views of the River Danube and views across Budapest. It attracts the tourists as it provides excellent photo opportunities.Fisherman's Bastion is just a very small part of the Castle Hill complex which is like a small village and has so many sites to see, we spent two day's there.

Fabulous site with great outlook. The Fisherman's Bastion is located on the hills of the Buda side, next to St. Matthias Church and Buda Castle. It has a grand view of the panorama of the whole city, especially the Parliament on the Pest side and the Iron Bridge. Its outlook remind me of the wars in the old days. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED, especially if you only have one day in Budapest.

Wonderful place but don't get confused. Having visited the Castle Hill district for around an hour and a half I looked on my PC for other nearby attractions and found the Fisherman's Bastion - all the current reviews said that it was well worth a visit. So I used Tom Tom to direct me to a street which seemed to provide access (an Utca and by the way the c is soft, I always thought the c in Utca was hard until I heard it mentioned in a book!!) We walked up several flights of steps through an interesting park and arrived back where we had been two hours previously!! Yes the Fisherman's Bastion is on Castle Hill and we had already seen it. Fantastic architecture but do check the photos before you visit just in case! :-)

Fascinating architecture and a gorgeous view from the Castle District. Just a portion of the castle district, Fisherman's Bastion resembles a huge sand castle. You can walk in and around (and in some cases up) the turrets and view the Pest side of the city from the walls. There is a cafe - isn't there always - which would provide a wonderful break but we weren't ready to pause while we were there. With St. Matyas right there as well, plan on an hour or more and take your time. There is a shaded garden with benches as well if the weather is hot as it was for us. We walked then to the other end of the District, and found the only way down was via the funicular which cost a couple of euros but brings you down to street level quickly.

A nice place to visit. The place is perfect for taking pictures, because of its view. It is located in Buda side, far from the center, but you can go there by taking a tourist bus. The ticket is not expansive and you can use it 24h. This is the easiest way to see all the attractions.

Nice views of the Danube, pretty battlements. The fishermans bastion has just had something of a facelift and the stonework is all clean and shiney - in fact it almost looks like something Disney produced ! The bastion would appear to encompass a seriese of battlements and towers. From the battlements one can gain fantastic views of the Danube and the parlaiment buildings.It's all slightly confusing as most of the battlements have tables for serving coffee etc... and its really not obvious where one can go and where one can't. That said we just wandered onto various battlements without any trouble. Its very picturesque and a must see, costs nothing and does give some excellent views down to the river.

unique and fun. I loved the unique architecture of this lookout, as well as the great views, and really loved that there weren't too many other tourists. There were some great street musicians playing (presumably) local music, and they don't seem to mind if you give them Euros.

Sparkling spires. You can see this from the Danube and it's a lovely photo opportunity. Get's busy. Take a walk around the much quietier streets of old town area while you are there and go to the Castle. An easy couple of hours sightseeing. (Not many reasonably priced places to eat nearby.)
great views on the river. Situated high on Castle Hill, this fanciful, multilevel structure gives great views across the Danube to Parliament and Chain Bridge.

Fantastic views and photo opportunities (day and night). We came here twice (once during the day and once at night), as it was centrally located near two of our favorite activities: the “Free Budapest Walking Tour” (http://www.triptobudapest.hu/) and a fabulous wine tasting experience at the Faust Wine Cellar (http://www.budapest-tourist-guide.com/wine-tasting-in-budapest.html). As other reviewer commented, there were other tourists around, but it did not negatively impact our experience.

Really Pretty Views over Danube and the city. The fishermans Bastion is to be found on the Buda side of the river up on the hill in the castle area; It is next to the Mathias Church and has magnificant views over the city below. Well worth a visit. There is a restaurant and ice cream place and the Hilton hotels restaurant all in the area for a nice lunch/meal or drink. Some of the area is being repaired and so is off limits but it does not spoil anything and the whole area is very photographable. The area is a little cobbly, so for wheelchair users - like myself, it can get a little uncomfy, and for some of the time it is better to be pushed on just back 2 wheels rather than on all 4; the road slopes a little downwards towards the walls of the bastion, so it is a little harder pushing up than down.Whilest there each day we saw a man with a hawk and a large eagle who were there to be posed for photos - approx 8 / 10 euros for 2 or 3 poses taken on your own camera, worth doing if you like that kind of thing. The birds looked well cared for but very fierce. I was afraid and dont really like birds so we didnt partake but saw a few people do so.Also, whilst there we went to mathias church, the ticket office is at the office at the right of the church as you look at it face on, with the bastion behind. For disabled people, enterance was free and access was by entering through the exit door. There was 1 kerb and the 2 small steps to negotiate but was quite easy. The normal entrance leads to approx 8 steep stairs.We had a lovely time in this area despite the cobbles.

Amazing. DO NOT MISS!. This restaurant was recommended to us by the concierge at our hotel. He recommended it as having stunning views over the Danube and Budapest at night, as well as being a first class restaurant.He did not tell us any lies. The views were amazing but the food was the real treat. Coupled with first class service, the experience was simply flawless. An excellent sommelier and waiting staff made the experience unforgettable.Do not miss when in Budapest!

Worth visiting for lovely views, museums and stop for coffee/cakes. We went up on the furnicular - which is a short ride, quite expensive (and they only take Forints) but quite fun. But we had a gentle walk down and then over the Chain Bridge back to Pest. The views are lovely here - both over the river to Pest and at the rear looking out to Buda. There are 2 museums here, and the History Museum is well worth a visit. Cafe Ruszwurm (reviewed separately) is a good coffee stop - if you can get a table. We visited in November, I guess it would be heavy with tourists earlier in the season.

simple the best restaurant, best service in Hungary. Food is amazing, service is outstanding. Very very high class. Waiter is introduced himself as Peter. Gave us the best dining experience what we ever had. We had starter as goose liver, beautiful. Main as Follow Deer, compliment to the chef. Wine list also outstanding. I cannot wait to come back again.

Beautiful view point, entrance to castle hill. I'm still not sure why it's called the fisherman's bastion, but this one the second most beautiful view (after Gellert Hill) of our trip. Beautiful architecture and statues all around. We didn't even pay to go up the extra level and it was still beautiful. Access to Mathias Church and the rest of the Castle Grounds from here.

great views of the city, cool architecture. The architecture is very cool and there are great views of the city. We climbed up, took some pictures, had some icecream and then walked over to Buda Castle.

nice, but don't pay. unfortunately the main part of the bastion (the one from all the photos) is closed for construction.yet they still charge admission for it, to walk up to the first level of the walkway leading to the bastion.don't waste the money cuz you get the same awesome view from the lower level that is free.nice to see, great views....but don't pay. and pray that whatever construction they're doing here ends soon.
Walt Disney has been here..?. No militarty role, only a look-out terrace with wonderful views of the Danube andthe great buildings at Pest side. Worth the uphill walk.

Must see. This place looks like a giant sand castle. It is a must see while in town. It is a bit touristy with a million people around but it is fun to check out the different fortification walls and the views from different perspectives. We made it up here a couple of times to further explore the area since it was right across the street from our hotel (plus the walk up the hill).

Beautiful up close and from the Danube. I took the funicular railway to Castle Hill and teh Fisherman's Bastion. It's got a great view of the Danube and Pest. I wasn't impressed with teh church behind it, but the area is nice to walk around and site see.

gorgeous view. Definitely worth a stop. We didn't realize there was a section that you needed to pay to visit so we just stayed along the bottom. The view is fantastic - you can get great pictures of Pest and Parliament. There are a lot of tourists around as you would expect but still a nice visit.

Beautiful views - very touristy. It looks like something out of a fairy tail and offers great views of the city. There were a lot of tourists there but you can pay 400 HUF to go up onto the wall for even better (and more importantly uncrouded) views. Time it carefully though as some large tour groups did come up, but not until we had spent a peaceful 10 minutes by ourselves taking photos and enjoying the quiet views. Priceless!One thing that did dissappoint me was the man there with a very large bird of prey charging tourists to have their photo taken with it. Very unnecessary. Please please do not exploit the poor bird just so you can add a novelty photo to your album!!
